review_body: We arrived prior to check in had begun but the hotel were able to accommodate us and give us a room early so that we could freshen up and head out to watch the Super Bowl. We stayed for 5 nights and the rooms were quiet apart from a bit of external noise, housekeeping was done daily and we had no issues from that. The amenities fee was included as part of our stay and we made use of the happy hour or detox hour as they called it to have a few beers. The shop inside was useful if you fancied a snack. The hotel was a 5-10 min walk to a few different subway stops. We went to a few NBA games while we were here but didn’t feel unsafe walking back to the hotel.Check in and check out were quick and easy with no issues and we were able to store our luggage after check out as we had a later flight home. Already looking at a stay again for next year.

As soon as you enter this hotel, you are blessed with a beautiful aroma of blissfulness! The entire staff (Unfortunately I just remember Danny & Isabella’s name but everyone I encountered are included) were just fantastic!!!! Great customer service. I’m a candy lover so I was thrilled when I saw a mini Dylan’s candy bar to the left as soon as you enter. The hotel room was perfect for our stay... super cozy and perfect. Now my favorite part was the “summer of love” decor in the courtyard! It was a big flower power party that gave you major hippie vibes! It put a big smile on my face! My husband and I can’t wait to go back!

Arlo Soho is the only hotel I stay at when I visit NYC. My visits are often (prior to Covid) as my daughter and son in law live there. The staff is friendly, the decor is trendy and inviting. Harolds, the restaurant serves great food (all meals) Rates are reasonable. Love , love, love the place and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Highly recommended!

My boyfriend and I recently stayed here for 2 nights and it was great. We had a king bed city view room I was in love with how they made such a small area that useful. I only gave 4 stars because of the space it is small but great for a single person or couples
user_name:
DeraBri
New York City, New York

review_body: We visited in May 2019 and I think this may be the closest you can get to authentic New York City living. Shoebox sized room (city king) for a steep price when the conversion rate is factored in. Also not a fan of triple sheeting. Lots of fancy amenities in the room but sadly no kettle or tea/coffee. Luckily for the Bodega and (possibly the highlight of our stay) the lovely gentleman who had a good laugh when I returned the bottle of milk I accidentally stole after a big day of walking. Overall the stay wasn't terrible but it wasn't great. I can't say Arlo gave me any reason to want to rebook next time I visit.

Fun, trendy hotel. Great vibe, lobby area and location. The room was super clean - loved the bunk beds! I would love to stay there again! Also staff was super helpful and the little market was super cute to grab a coffee.
user_name:
shrtyR8
New York City, New York

review_body: Excellent location if you like being downtown as everything we wanted was within walking distance. If not, then the subway is minutes away. This hotel has a fantastic vibe.... although tourists are staying here it doesn’t feel touristy at all... it’s like staying at a trendy private club. The communal areas are beautifully styled ..mid century modern feel. Bedrooms are bijou but brilliantly designed. I stayed here with my daughter for her 21st and she adored this hotel and we both would stay here again. Staff... how could I forget.... they were all super friendly and helpful. 5 stars!

friendly staff considering the current covid environment. Great price, quiet, comfortable bed. Room was made up meticulously. My only complaint is the poor quality amenities. The towels were a bit threadbare.
user_name:
Mlleron
New York City, New York

review_body: Thank you Arlo team for making my stay as smooth & safe as possible. The hotel team are friendly, Rooms are Sanitized & very clean. Easy access to downtown Manhattan. For sure i will be coming back

The GM, Bassim, who’s solely the only one at the desk making sure everything runs smoothly during this virus shows what being professional looks like. Not only him but the staff running this hotel is just amazing at what they do and it shows they’re trying their hardest!

During the days of the virus I was in the process of moving and I was staying for weeks at the Arlo Soho.The Hotel is immaculate, the entire staff was beyond professional, the delivery of the fresh and delicious food from their restaurant was first rate and all of this was during a pandemic!Everything happens under the watchful eyes of Bassim Ouachani, the General Manager.Lastly, the hotel is located in one of the most vibrant hip and interesting neighborhoods in NYC - Soho.Thank you Rey, Amaris and Chad and to the entire staff!Bruce Lee Roistacher

By far the most talented hospitality professionals in the business. Chad and Basim have made my stay exceptional. I feel like I'm home here at the Arlo not just because the rooms are pristine and beautiful -- its the character and charisma of the people behind the front desk and throughout the building that have put a smile on my face every day. The rooms are pristine and bright and the attitude and positive energy from the people making things happen is all wonderful. Also want to say thank you to Marshal and Amaris and Ray. I will definitely be back and hope to see the same faces.
user_name:
jeffnorthrop
New York City, New York

review_body: This small hip hotel is well situated with easy access to the West Village, Tribeca and Soho. Great breakfast buffet with the best overnight oats ever! Rooms are very small but adequate. Staff is friendly and responsive.

The hotel staff was very friendly. Check in and out was fast and flawless. The room was a little small but very cozy/comfortable for two people. The front desk answers the phone very quickly and service is very smooth. The hotel is very photogenic as well.
user_name:
da1002020
New York City, New York

review_body: I had an awesome times staying at Arlo Soho!! I stayed from April 1-4. It was an awesome experiences!! The room was very pretty and clean, it has a very nice shower and beautiful view!!! Also it come with a 40 inch TV with Chromecast. Best idea ever!!! I get to watch the movies I like on Netflix and Disney + on TV!!! And the Lobby are very cozy and has a good atmosphere!!! And last but not least. Staff at Arlo Soho are very friendly!! Specially Armansss!!! She’s super sweet,super fun and very helpful!!!Overall,Arlo Soho is an awesome hotel!! I had so much fun!!! I will be back soon!!!
user_name:
Jaydenkim118
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I had a great time staying at the Arlo SoHo hotel during February 2020. We spent six nights in a Queen Room and although a little small, found it more than adequate enough for our requirements... we didn't travel to New York to spend our days in a hotel room.The location was fine for us as we are always happy to walk and explore as we go, so while it was a bit of a trek to some of the sights, there was always so much to see and do on the way.Staff at the Arlo SoHo were always friendly and accommodating and we found our room to be clean and supplied with all that we required during our time there.We would gladly return to the Hotel and would recommend to anyone that asked.

I am a New Yorker now living in NH. I love the city and have stayed in many hotels throughout the city. This time I wanted to visit the Tenement Museum and found this hotel was within walking distance. From the moment my friend and I walked in, we felt welcome. Staff was super friendly and helpful. I especially appreciated the tip for pizza at Joes. We love our pizza and they knew where to send me.The hotel,is a gem with lounge areas and outside space. The bars were fun and restaurant is great as well.

The majority of the staff display energy you cannot imitate. As a hardworking, dedicated and focused enterpriser from East New York, hospitality usually arrives short or with awkwardness at first. I was immediately able to enjoy the environment and my work. Period. Seriously, I love this place. Also! They wipe down often and I highly recommended to stay here if you're concerned about COVID-19

First time driving "into" the city - pulled right in front and was met immediately with a valet who unloaded our bags and took care of my car. Location - Soho area, VERY "in" place for restaurants, shopping, etc. 1 minute walk to the subway and 20 minute ride to times square, Broadway, etc.Staff - OVER and beyond my expectation! LOVE Amaris at the front desk! FREE wine nightly from 5-7, rooftop bar/patio, DELICIOUS restaurant in the hotel and you get FREE sampler mini-ice-cream-cones with your meal. Food is AWESOME!Room - we stayed in the bunk bed room - OMG so much fun for my friend and I! Extremely clean, and staff is ready to help with any need.Price - VERY reasonable for such a nice place! Did not expect everything including extras - one of the BEST places to stay. This was our 9th trip to NYC and we always try new hotels, but we will ALWAYS come back to Arlo Soho! Can't find anything better for the convenience (esp if you drive) and the extras.
user_name:
Nancy N
Morgantown, West Virginia, United States

review_body: Great location, reliably good every time. This time they had some pretty cool mini Chalets set up outside with heat that you could order food and drinks from. The bar was nice (both of them) but expensive. The place smells fantastic and the service is really good.

I've only ever had amazing experiences at Arlo SoHo. The staff makes you feel so welcomed the minute you walk in the door, and the entire hotel has such an amazing atmosphere. The rooms are comfortable and well designed, and the public spaces are great for taking work calls / plugging in for a bit. Harold's has an AMAZING hot chicken sandwich, and you can never go wrong with the rooftop bar!
user_name:
hannahrH3925VH
New York City, New York

review_body: I happened upon the Arlo on Hotel Tonight last year and have not stayed anywhere else in New York City since then. Clean, bright, great food, two great bars and perfect rooms for my short stay needs. Couple minute walk to two subways. Staff is great, friendly and helpful. And the cost isn't over-the-top Manhattan rates. It is totally affordable.

The hotel is very cool and comfortable. It is in a great location too. The staff is super friendly and nice (A special thanks to Chad for ensuring everything went super smooth for me and without any issue whatsoever!). All of the team made me feel very welcome after a long journey to get there and nothing was too much trouble. I would definitely recommend this place.

I have stayed at the Arlo Soho more times than I can count, so this review is long overdue. The property is incomparable to any place in lower manhattan. My boyfriend and I have had the best days without ever leaving the hotel. A wonderful restaurant, three bars, a gorgeous outdoor rooftop bar in the summer, endless space to do work on a computer or just relax outside of your room, and an adorable courtyard thats always changing into something better. The location is truly ideal; in the heart of soho, yet somehow on a quiet street. The beds are BY FAR the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in. This place is the best bang for your buck and you wont get a better experience anywhere else. All of that being said, the main reason we constantly return is because of the staff. David N., Joe, Amaris and Dan at the front desk, Albi, Nate and Yana at Harolds, ALL of the bellman... they constantly go above and beyond to give us the most out of our stay and make sure we are comfortable. They truly make this place feel like our home away from home. I can't recommend this place enough.
user_name:
morgansN1459IU
New York City, New York

review_body: It's has a young and hip vibe, which actually means music is loud in the Lobby and restaurant. Too loud. Reception staff is also super relaxed, and they even forgot us to explain some essentials. But staff is anyway super friendly. Super small rooms, but big enough to relax. Great shower. The size of the bed could be too small for Dutch people. Nice and simple breakfast. We specifically like the location, just West of Soho, near the subway. The big square in front isn't too beautiful because its one big congestion of cars going into the tunnel.

We just had an amazing visit to the Arlo SoHo. David at the front desk was extremely helpful, professional and wonderful. He made our stay most comfortable and I had one of the best trips to NYC. We were there for the art shows this weekend, Armory, Art On Paper, etc., which was also wonderful. The room was clean and cozy and the view was beautiful and the bed was comfortable. David even left us some wonderful surprises in the room which was so thoughtful. The bars were cool and the buffet was delicious in the morning. Also, the sitting area on the main floor was extremely cozy and so are the outdoor little cabins. If you get a chance to rent a city bike down by the water it is very enjoyable. We rode along the west side of Manhattan on the bike path which was busy and fun. Thanks for an excellent visit and I recommend the Arlo Soho for a great place to stay.

I had an amazing stay, room was super clean, beds were so comfy I didn't want to get up. The breakfast was delightful and the staff was superb!!!!!!! I loved the Dylans candy sop and the 24 hour bodega to get snacks and coffee.

This was one of the cleanest hotels I have stayed in. Everyone was extremely helpful especially David at the front desk! He was awesome. We were also able to park right out front overnight for free! Will definitely be back

Easygoing and helpful staff, cool neighborhood near two key subway lines, small but comfy, well-appointed rooms...Arlo is hip, happening, and habitable. Cool downstairs bar, plus salons for sitting/contemplating/plugging in or spacing out.

I can't remember the last time I was meant to feel so at home in New York. The staff are so friendly and helpful and the hotel is in a perfect spot. The partnerships with Gyms and all the programming mean its great for an extended stay too!

This hotel had a very hip but comfortable vibe. My room was compact, clean, comfy, and modern with a great view of the city. Cool perks: I was able to leave my luggage at the hotel before check in AND leave it for the day after check out, preventing me from having to drag it with me while shopping and sightseeing. Although it was too early in the season to use one of the hotel's complimentary bikes, the hotel is very close to the Hudson River Park which has a long bike path, so I welcome the opportunity to come back in the warmer months and rent a bike.

I've stayed here twice in recent weeks for business trips to our NYC office. While the rooms are small - they are very comfortable, clean, modern and well equipped. Comfy beds and nice showers. What I love about this hotel though are the common areas. Clearly they have chosen to invest in the lobby experience as well as the many areas to work, eat, drink or just hang out. The courtyard area in particular is very cool - and as a Canadian I just love the charm of the wood cabins (which are also great spots to work from or to just enjoy the vibe and escape from the busy Manhattan vibe). I'd highly recommend to anyone looking for an efficient place to stay (as long as you don't require a huge room).

This hotel has everything you need for a stay in NYC. Location great. Rooms great. Yes they are on the small side but it’s all laid out so well. We had no problems as a couple with space. Incredibly comfortable bed - isn’t that what you are really looking for in a short break. We did not spend a lot of time in the hotel but when we were there the team were friendly and helpful. Well done team SoHo. If we were in NYC again I would re book.

The Arlo is a great place to stay for trips to NYC: close to major subway lines, great location, and amazing amenities. The rooms are on the small side but very efficient, clean, and well outfitted. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

The hotel has a modern atmosphere but maintain a cosy environment. The room is comfortable, there are plenty of spaces to hang out or work in the ground floor and the restaurant is excellent. The staff was always helpful and friendly.

Our stay at Arlo was great. All of the amenities and our room was awesome. David at the front desk was super accomodating, helpful and kind. We appreciated the flexibility and great service -- will definitely be back!

Love this spot! First time staying in the area (for work) and the staff at the front desk were so welcoming and informative. The vibe is very city-sleek, boutique - great bar service! The room (king-size) was perfect for being there 1 night. Definitely will be visiting this spot again when I go back!

I couldn’t believe how small the room was, but to be honest, it didn’t matter to me, as I just needed a place to sleep. It would have been challenging for a couple! Functionally it was fine, and convenient to where I needed to be. I didn’t get a chance to experience the rest of the hotel.

My husband surprised me at Christmas with a weeks vacation in New York for my 50th birthday! He picked a great hotel in a great location with great amenities and great service!We arrived Saturday February 22nd - our room was on the 5th floor overlooking the pretty courtyard and proved to be a nice quiet spot away from the main roads.My husband had emailed ahead to let the hotel know it was my 50th birthday on the 25th in the hope they may do something special, unfortunately he never received a reply. However, this did not alter the fact we had a thoroughly enjoyable stay.The room itself is cosy and perfect for just two, it maybe small but who needs more when you're out sightseeing all day! Each day we returned to a nice clean room, which was most welcoming after a day pounding the streets of NYC!Harold's bar has happy hour between 5:30-7:00pm and it was lovely to enjoy a free beer or glass of wine before dinner. This is covered under the resort fee you pay but a nice thing to do.Another compliment is the hotel smells great!!!! As soon as you walk in the lobby you are enjoying some nice smells Popcorn was on offer Friday evening, just help yourself! A great location, Subway not far and overall a really nice comfortable hotel with lovely staff.We will not hesitate in staying here again next time we visit New York.

First off - walked into this hotel and I couldn't get over how good it smelled! The front desk was super helpful (especially David) and I ended up buying the scent. BACK TO THE HOTEL - love the aesthetic, super attentive to details. I live in NYC and it was great to get away and enjoy a little "staycation". The drinks on the rooftop were great, can only imagine how nice it is in the summertime.

I had an interview in downtown Manhattan. I booked the hotel for the price and found so many hidden amenities! I forgot my charger, they had that covered. I forgot my tooth brush, they had that covered. Needed a beer after work, they had complimentary happy hour! I didn't want to travel for my meals, they had a 24/7 bodega, a library to work in, and 3 bars!! I cannot state how much I was surprised by all the amenities this hotel offered at the great price. I will be sure to stay here again next time I'm in town.

This is the best hotel we’ve ever stayed at! We love how intentional they were with everything! We told them it was our anniversary and they had rose petals and heart towels on the bed, as well as champagne waiting for us when we got to our room. We loved all of the activities, movie nights, the amazing bed with tv hookup to our phones... everything was amazing. We will be returning to this hotel every time we come back to NYC! Thank you Arlo! (Only request I have is to maybe clean the windows)

The room was meticulously clean and perfect for our stay. We enjoyed streaming options from our phone to the tv in addition to regular channels. The front desk staff were welcoming, informative, and authentically kind. We southerners were thoroughly impressed and loved every minute of our stay. We will return and stay again!

Great small rooms if you’re looking for something affordable. Best for one, business type trips. Very clean, comfortable. Only issue is a small desk if you need to work from the hotel a lot but otherwise great.

Booked through British airways holidays and found the arlo soho a wonderful and comfy place to get to after our long trip from Yorkshire. Stayed here for 4 nights with my teenage daughter who has been badgering me to come to New York for a while. Really nervous about travelling so far and being disappointed by our accommodation but I need not have worried. I had read on here that the rooms can be a tad 'compact' , but we were really lucky to get an end of corridor corner room that was a bit bigger and included a couple of chairs and a little table by the huge window. Looked out onto the rear courtyard but didn't mind because we didn't hear any street noise at night. The bed was really comfy and the room nice and warm. Some really nice features and touches in the room- good quality body wash, shampoo and conditioner in the shower, toothbrush/paste provided, mini fridge, USB charging points, free good quality wifi and a welcome half bottle of wine for a tired mum! .Good sized TV. Did lack space for hanging/putting clothes so we pretty much lived out of our cases but for 4 nights we didn't mind. Really missed having a kettle but we did take a travel one and got some milk/coffee/biscuits from a shop. The shower and toilet are not in a separate room but in a sort of cubicle with frosted glass. It does lack a bit of privacy especially for a teenage girl in a room with her mum. Felt the frosting wasn't quite enough and maybe a curtain dividing that end of the room would at least help. However, we coped. Didn't use the restaurant or bar because we like to explore a bit so we went out to eat. The area around the hotel has a few nice places to eat, Whitman's burgers and an Italian over the road. Felt really safe in the neighbourhood even after dark. A great base for exploring, within walking distance are the world trade centre and 9/11 memorial, statten island ferry, museum of the American indian, FDNY museum and Brooklyn bridge. A short walk along canal street is the subway station that links to all the rest the city has to offer. The hotel staff were very friendly and dealt with our broken remote control very quickly. Room was cleaned daily and water in fridge restocked. Elevators were fast and never busy. Whole place clean. No noise from other guests. Really trendy, modern and boutique style. Would definitely recommend and would stay again if we ever come to New York again.

Me and my partner came to explore the city and this place gave us a wonderful time, with it's presentation and clean stylish rooms. The staff were just as wonderful and friendly. I would absolutely recommend this place for any traveller wanting to stay in Manhattan.

Stayed a few nights whilst visiting friends. Easy location to experience Soho and convenient for travelling around manhattan. Lobby has a great little coffee shop with a lolly shop, which is a nice touch. Rooms are small but cosy with everything you need to unwind at the end of a long day.Harold’s is a good spot for brunch of lunch as well.Really friendly and attentive service throughout our stay. Would be back.

I came to check out Arlo which was referred to me by a friend of mine who had drinks at the rooftop. My experience was unlike any other. I felt that I was not inside of a hotel lobby, mainly because of the Dylan’s Candy Bar and music playing. All of the staff and employees were extremely helpful. A gentleman named David N. was highly professional and devoted to showing me around. He made a brief pit-stop thorough and memorable. Love the vibes and good energy he brought to the table. Highly recommend, awesome place!

It's one of the most fav places in SoHo. They say you always remember a place by it's vibe and smell - I can assure you Arlo smells amazing. It's a very distinct smell that leaves you wanting more. It's also a great place to hang out and work, meditate in the lounge, and in general - have professional meeting. It's close to CANAL subway station as well and that's incredibly convenient. David at the front desk - is a certified ROCKSTAR !I am a fan - !

I have stayed in many hotels in Manhattan and I had a very positive experience here. I stayed here for a special mom/son weekend with my 13 year old. He wanted to stay downtown and in cool área. When we arrived we were greeted by David at front desk. Personable and super nice. After finding out we were there for special occasion, he upgraded us to a better room with a terrace and gave us a complimentary breakfast voucher. When we arrived back later on my pillow David wrote us a very nice welcome note and left a bag of candy from Dylan’s candy bar. He went above and beyond throughout the whole stay. The whole staff did and it really made a difference. As far as the hotel goes, if is a boutique and cool and fun vibe. The lobby has Dylan’s candy and a great lobby, outside area, rooftop bar and restaurant. Every night happy hour with free wine, beer and snacks. The restaurant was great ( I am a food snob). The Breakfast buffet was amazing for $24 and included tons of options. The Cobb salad and pizza great too. The room itself is simple and small, not a lot of storage space, but clean, modern and a lot of light. The location of the hotel is easy to access bc right near holland tunnel. Great location bc within a few short blocks is soho, TriBeCa, the river and easy access to the subway lines. I would definitely recommend and go back. Again, David at the front desk (and his boss Amira I think was her name) were exceptional at customer service which really goes a long way.

This is a gem of a boutique hotel in soho! The smell of the entrance is so Amazing and was the draw for me on deciding to enter this lovely hotel ! It's cool, contemporary but with the sweetest friendly efficient and very accommodating staff! David No the concierge was extremely and genuinely hospitable! I highly recommend staying here for the outstanding hospitality alone right here in Good old Tough as Nails New York City!!

Stayed here for three nights and had the most wonderful stay thanks to Chrissy and Elvis! They made us feel so welcomed and for first timers traveling from Miami, made us feel at home here. Felt super relaxed and so glad we stayed here. Can’t wait to come back!

We flew into JFK for a 6 day holiday in NYC. The hotel is pretty well situated. It is only a 5-10m walk to the nearest Metro Station ( Canal Street). The SoHo, Little Italy and China Town are all within 10-15m walk. The Metro runs straight into uptown New York. We saw everything ( well not EVERYTHING, but all the ‘must see’ tourist stuff without having to swap Metro lines, so it made everything very easy. Our room had an amazing view from it’s full-length Windows. The hotel is twinned with a restaurant, so getting breakfast and evening meals is very easy if you are too tired to go anywhere else. There is also a small Coffee shop in the Foyer, so if you are an early riser. You can sneak downstairs for a coffee before breakfast. The Reception staff are great, very friendly, knowledgeable and leave you alone unless you need their assistance. ( Same for the Restaurant too.) A big Thank You to DAVID NICHOLSON, who on our last day helped us out with a small room stay extension, which made all the difference to our last few hours at the hotel. These are the things that really do make a difference when you are traveling.We had a great stay here in the ARLO SoHo hotel, and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone coming to stay in NYC...

My father and his friend stayed here at this amazing hotel. At this hotel it included so many things. We especially enjoyed the court area where they had tiny houses where you could eat dinner, and included an nice couch with blankets. Also they had a nice movie theater with a movie playing once my family got there. This hotel was truly amazing and would come back here any time!
user_name:
penelope_meyer
New York City, New York

review_body: My daughter, friend, and I stayed here. We enjoyed the hotel’s vibe and style. We especially enjoyed the courtyard area where we listened to music and had a few drinks. The rooms are well designed and fun!
user_name:
gregmV3777SS
New York City, New York

review_body: I visited Arlo recently. I had the opportunity to check out the property. I really loved ART- the rooftop bar upstairs. The service upstairs was exceptional. Second to none. I even had the chance to have a walk around downstairs and loved the courtyard as well. The winter cabins were a unique and wonderful feature that I've never seen before in a hotel. Additionally, and more importantly, Mr. Nicholson, from the front desk, provided excellent and gracious service. He even gave me some pointers about the hotel and recommendations on what to do in NYC. Highly suggest to anyone if they're in NYC, to stop by and check out Arlo!

We enjoyed our stay at Arlo Soho! Beautiful and very cosy hotel. Room (queen streetview) was perfect. Good size (according to New York standards). Room was very clean. Good bed! Friendly staff. Excellent location... we just loved the neighbourhood.. lots of lovely restaurants near to the hotel! We also enjoyed the breakfast! We hope to come back some time!

While this might have been rated great by some visitors, the staff and behavior is not acceptable. The room we booked 3 weeks in advance was very loud with a hissing and unbearable sound coming from the water conduit. Upon complaint, they claimed that only one room was left (!) and that room was facing a wall. The staff told us they accommodated with a first room (noisy) and we should be happy to get another room. Regardless of how our situation might sound, the staff made our day a miserable one. The $35 daily that gets added in addition to rooms (for wifi and two bottle of water and supposedly wine and beer from 5:30-7) is not worth it. And there is no way of not accepting it. The whole place is little precious and you feel like you are in a store with some rooms with shelves of products and food to buy.We would definitely suggest to look for other hotels and avoid this property.

I love the boutique feel of the Arlo. Most of all I like the location. Away from the crowds and close to soho shopping. This is the 2nd visit to the Arlo and I would stay there again. The rooms are efficient and just enough space while staying in NYC

You have to walk a bit to get anywhere bit otherwise i is a good hotel with great prices. and who doesn't want to walk in NYC. you are close to Tribeca, Soho Chinatown and if you need to get to NJ or Newark airport you are very close to the Holland tunnel.
user_name:
D2605BTjohng
New York City, New York

review_body: My family came to visit from Dubi and we stayed in Arlo, we had a great service that exceeded our expectation, the hotel is very clean and elegant, very friendly staff and great sense of hospitality, I would highly recommend this hotel to all my friend’s and family, thank you and we will be back soon!!
user_name:
mmrezk2
New York City, New York

review_body: My boyfriend and i arrived with a warm welcome from the front desk. The uniforms of the staff is very unique and hip. We went to the rooftop and it was so pretty! The location was perfect. If you plan to stay in downtown New York this is the perfect place to stay! I will be back!! Thank you!!

Great customer service at the front desk, very friendly and helpful people. The room was very clean and the location is amazing. It was an awesome stay, I’m so amazed I’ve been recommending it to everyone. I’d recommend for anyone!!!

Everyone was great starting with the welcoming front desk staff. Couldn't of had a better stay. We really recommend it to anyone traveling with family. Thank you, Arlo staff we will be back sooner than later

I loved Arlo! It's located right in the heart of SOHO and it is the perfect place to decompress and feel inspired artistically. After such a long and exhausting day I was greeted so warmly by David at the front desk who continued to make sure I was taken care of throughout my stay. I highly recommend staying here!

Great hotel with a buzzing vibe. Rooms great by NYC standards and the staff from front of house through to the restaurant and bar are wonderful. I’ll be back soon and will certainly be staying in this great little haven.

Location was an A+. Valet service was super convenient.Rooms A+ and sparkling clean.Great food to go!Fantastic Bars and lounge areas!The value was not to be beat in NYC.Wish they had more hotels around the country!

Recently stayed at the Arlo in SoHo and I was very impressed! Every employee we interacted with was kind and professional. The hotel was spotless and the food and drinks were wonderful. Hotel layout is very nice and the location is great. I would highly recommend staying here.

I stay here every time I'm in Manhattan. If you don't mind having a small room, it's the perfect stay with the most welcoming staff! The downstairs lounge area is nice to relax in and the food at the restaurant in the back is SO GOOD. I will also say that the bartenders make GREAT drinks! Seriously, some of the best cocktails I've had in the city. DANNY is probably my favorite. Short walk to Duane Reed if you need any toiletries, and they're also building a CVS nearby coming soon. Great restaurants in the area. The only thing I will say, is the elevators are old, so it can take a minute or two to get in/out.

Arlo SoHo is a really beautiful property in the middle of a great neighbourhood in New York. The restaurant is phenomenal with great service. They run awesome events too and have lots of space to work. Definitely an awesome and beautiful place!

The hotel has a fantastic location, and given how central and close to loud things it is, it is remarkably quiet to stay here. Rooms are small but well-designed and comfortable, and the common areas are really well thought out. The evening complimentary happy hour is a really nice touch. Most of all, we had a small issue that the hotel resolved immediately and made a nice gesture with our bill upon check out to make sure we were happy with the outcome. I want to recognize the manager Elvis for being so professional and comprehending of the issue.
user_name:
estranger
New York City, New York

review_body: second year in a row staying here for work. the room is perfect for 1 person. I had a room overlooking the garden on the 5th floor and it was SO quiet. Last year I had a room overlooking the holland tunnel exit and it was also very quiet inside the room. Beds are very comfortable and the room layout uses space wisely

1. Warm welcome and the staff at hotel were so helpful and ready to orientate or respond to questions.2. Clean and tidy spaces.3. Great ambiance and easy access. The only downside for me was my room was a little small.

We arrived for a wedding on a red eye from Lax...tired and having arranged for an early check in the room was ready but not on an upper level. David Nicholson provides the detailed and engaged customer service that distinguishes the wonderful to the extraordinary. He was on point, followed up to make sure the upper room was taken care of, walked us to that room and then provided a small but wonderful amenity.Highly recommend
user_name:
cdwest22
New York City, New York

review_body: Wow what can I say. The second I walked into this establishment, I was blown away. The ambiance is breathtaking and the staff is unmatched. I had a girls trip this past weekend and we loved every minute. I would highly recommend Arlo Soho for such an amazing experience. Can't wait to be back soon! Kisses to Arlo xoxo
user_name:
vmars84
New York City, New York

review_body: I had the most pleasant stay with my husband last weekend. Check in was a breeze as the front desk was so friendly and diligent. I must say the room was spotless. All of the staff in the hotel was so helpful. I had a billing inquiry about our stay and it was resolved immediately. The department I spoke to was very professional and pleasant over the phone. We will definitely be returning! If you haven’t stayed at this hotel it’s a must.

My son and I had a weekend trip to the city planned. I found Arlo Soho and it seemed to fit our needs. Well, they completely blew away our expectations. The hotel smelled wonderful as soon as we walked in. It was cute and charming. The front desk staff was phenomenal. They were friendly, knowledgeable, helpful and sincere. They made great recommendations for places to dine, pastries, etc, too. The lobby, hotel bar, and lounge areas were super cute. Stylish and fun. The courtyard ski chalet was just adorable. The room was perfect for what we needed. A place to crash after a long day. We got bunk beds so we each had our own space. And tv. The room was the perfect size for what we needed. The bathroom was small but perfectly sized. We were able to move around and not bump into anything so that's a plus! Overall it was perfect. I would highly recommend.

Lovely people working at the desk. Fun, hip space with a courtyard, lounge and rooftop bar. Nice bodega inside with tasty treats. Rooms are micro-rooms, which is a trend in NYC right now, but they are clear on the website about the sizes of the rooms and I found them to be fine for two people. Modern and clean! Comfy beds. Great location. I have booked another stay!

Great place in a great location. It was very simple and utilitarian. Great place to stay in NYC for a work trip or city break. The staff were brilliant, and made me and my team feel at home. It was a fantastic place to stay in.

I arrived on the 31st and was greeted by wonderful and helpful staff. Everything and everyone was extremely well organized. I was very impressed. There was a small bodega offering healthy and delicious food options, a coffee bar, and candy store right in the lobby! My room was already sorted and everything in order. The lovely Elvis then helped me find somewhere I could take my phone to be repaired. I was extremely ill and bedridden for most of my stay, which is where the lack of room service was a bit of a down point. But when I was a tad better, kind Richard heard about my being ill and gave me dinner on the house at Harolds. When I needed to change rooms or had any issues, Joe was extremely helpful, courteous and kind. AMAZING STAFF!!!! The rooms are quite small and not very spacious, but you are provided with every kind of amenity you need.The hotel interior itself is beautifully designed and absolutely stunning. From wall art, to eclectic furniture designs, and gorgeous spaces. The location, of course, was also great. Thank you to the kind and generous staff.

Amazing decor. Food was excellent. Very spacious room with a great view of the ocean. But the highlight for me was the pool and backyard area. The staff was very friendly and attentive. I felt welcomed and everyone wanted to make sure my stay was perfect. Well done!!!

The hotel was chic and cool, had such a good vibe, and the amenities were outstanding. Small but extremely comfy and efficient rooms. Great internet (and you can cast from your own streaming services, so smart). Amazing shower. Cozy bed. Great happy hour at Harold's. Loved it all!

We booked a Queen room and on arrival to book in we were informed that we had been upgraded to a king court yard which was a nice start to the trip. After 10 minutes we were informed that this was now being changed to a twin room (which we didn't mind as its for one night) for one night and the remaining two nights we would be upgraded to the best they could get on the 10th floor... after another 5-10 minutes in reception we were asked if we wouldn't mind going for a drink in the bar as they needed to sort somethings outs, we finally got our keys to the room after about an hour of walking through the doors. We were on the 10th floor so figured they must have got something sorted, we could not believe it when we walked in and found out they had put us in a accessible bunk room which left us speechless and disappointed. The last time I slept on a bunk bed was on when I was on operations in Afghanistan in 06 and then it was only until we moved down to our main FOB. My wife how ever has never slept on one so was even more upset and disappointed than myself. The next morning we were advised to go to reception and confirm that we wished to change so I was at reception at 7.00am to say that we most certainly wished to change and that we would get the key after we returned later that day, when we returned it was the same guy who signed us in the previous night and we got the sense that he knew that something was a miss and he tried to change the room while we were stood there before we had actually seen it but was unable to so we got the the room on the 7th floor and it turned out to be a queen room which we should have had in the first place.So the question is are there first come first served on rooms even if you have paid for themI think the the saving grace for this hotel is that it really is a nice hotel and the guy on reception Richard was fantastic and really was trying to help us so many thanks to him.

Cozy Room. Cool Atmosphere. Staff Super Nice. Complimentary drinks during early noon in the Bar was a good surprise :). City views from our room were less amazing than expected but at the end, it is always good to see some NYC lights. Harold's Restaurant and Lobby Bar highly suggested to take some rest during the cold winter.

Stayed at the Arlo on a recent business trip and can not fault it! The rooms are perfect for one person (may be a little cozy for 2 but would be fine I’m sure), are super comfortable and clean. Service was great, good spots to work when needed and happy hour from 5-7 is a nice bonus. Location is perfect, 5 mins walk to Canal Station and easy to walk into soho / Chelsea / Greenwich village etc. Highly recommend.

Really nothing to fault this hotel. If you have looked into it you will already know the rooms are SMALL. So be it. The lobby has multiple areas to cuddle up and read or work from your laptop. The restaurant does not provide room service, however the food there is great. Wish they had an a la carte breakfast menu prior to 10:30. Not a fan of buffet spreads. But if you can wait until 10:30 you will be well rewarded with avocado toast. The staff is lovely.Location is great. Rooms are quiet.

I found this hotel through Expedia while booking a trip to NYC for New Year's Eve. I'm so glad I booked it. Hotel was nice and clean, friendly staff. It's on much quieter area. I found a lot good places to eat/, also bars around this area. It's closer to Canal Street where Chinatown and Little Italy. Also closer to metro. Definitely recommend this Hotel and definitely be staying here again.

Cool place. Cool staff. Cool bar. Pick and mix in reception. Close to subway. Rooms are tiny (even by NY standards) but perfectly formed. No wardrobe is a pain when two girls are sharing room having packed for partying in the City. The worst thing though was the proximity of the toilet to my friends bed. I didn’t even want to wee in there so anything else was a no. A Hell no. Lots of urgent running around the hotel in pjs looking for bathrooms. With the theme tune to Benny Hill in my head.......

An amazing place to stay, soak up all the local area and more has to offer. The entire team was on point and the vibe is amazing. Nothing to much trouble and they all know their stuff! Love this place!

We stayed in a king city room for three nights. An excellent short-stay staycation hotel: The room is small but didn’t feel tiny as the bed is huge with a full wall glass window right next to it. The room offers all necessary amenities; the built-in tv has chromcast support; the Library (co-working space) is cozy for morning coffee or evening hangout. The cafe serves Intelligentia coffee, healthy light foods and dylan’s candy bar. Harold’s has great pizza and veggie burgers. 10-15 min walk to Soho shopping districts; easily reachable to tourist spots like 911 memorial and brooklyn bridge within 20-25 min subway ride. A cab booking service is provided upon request for those heading to airports.

Excellent hotel with very friendly staff, the digital detox a particular highlight. The amenities within the hotel are excellent and of a modern decor with everything looking fresh and well maintained Only downside was the rooms are a little small with a lack of storage.

I stayed here with my girlfriend for a short holiday. The hotel is comfortably located very close to the Hudson River, in the SoHo area. I am a runner and I could easily and quickly arrive to the walkways close to the river, and enjoy my safe morning run looking at the skyscrapers. The breakfast served in the restaurant was OK, and the only 'negative' thing about the hotel was the room dimension: VERY small for two people! We did not get very concerned, though, since we spent almost all day visiting the city and getting back quite late. I would find the dimension of the room more challenging if I had to spend daytime in it!

This is one of the best hotels i’ve stayed at! It’s more for couples as i stayed with my boyfriend the rooms are small and cute and the staff was wonderful always helpful! At first they didn’t have the room we reserved but they were extremely nice about it and ended up even upgrading our room! Very close to subway station and felt very safe in the neighborhood. Not only that but the arlo “signature scent” is awesome! Highly reccomend. very hip/trendy hotel. Would recommend for younger crowd

We went to the New Year's Party 2020 at Arlo Roof Top bar and were very disappointed regarding the local organization. It took 20 minutes to get an elevator into the 11th floor and then 30 minutes to finalise the check-in. Around 250 guests were in the bar. The DJ played some music but there wasn't any space to dance. Only two barkeepers were in charge of the drinks! It took more than half an hour to get any kind of drink and the atmosphere was very bad, People went aggressive and let the location. For 500$ entry fees for 4 persons you could expect a better professional service. I cannot recommend this location/ bar in the 11th floor!

Just a few blocks from Holland Tunnel , our commute from the airport was short. Subway is just a short walk and all of New York is Accessible.The Hotel is very clean , bars are great, and first floor lounging areas are nice and not crowded.Rooms are efficiënt , small , but you know that upfront. We rented 3 rooms for 6 of my family four 4 nights and loved the stay,All the staff are smiling and helpful. Chad was helpful and a pleasure to be around. Great stay.

This hotel has all the amenities you need during a visit to NYC. Each room has a steamer and hair dryer. The coffee / candy shop / bodega in the lobby has everything you need to get you going in the AM or for PM / late night snacks. The staff was very helpful, especially Chad Nathan! The rooftop bar had great drink for reasonable prices. I would definitely recommend it to others! Just a few blocks from the subway and awesome SoHo shopping!

I stayed at the Arlo back in September 2019 on a business trip and I’ll start off by saying it was one of the best hotel experiences I’ve ever had. The hotel itself is very cute, the location is convenient, and the rooms are nice. One thing that stood out to me the most was the exceptional customer service provided by the hotel staff, but in particular there was a young man named Daniel working the front desk that went above and beyond in making sure my stay was as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. Overall I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone planning on a trip to the city!

Stayed over New Years in the Arlo Soho. The rooms are a bit small especially with two suitcases. However, the bed is very comfortable and and the room is quiet. The hotel has different open spaces where you can meet other travelers or get some work done. Overall a very lovely hotel that offers great value for money

We had a great experience at this very cool hotel. Staff was super friendly and helpful. The whole atmosphere was totally charming. If you are looking for something that is not your typical, boring, cookie-cutter hotel, this is your place.

When we arrived, we were really happy with our choice. The hotel looked swanky and the staff was managing even with new years traffic. But we had issues that the hotel did not address.1) Room smelled2) After taking shower, the carpet behind the bathroom wall was wet. Water leaking problem3) Hotel had no medication supplies.I really wished they would have addressed the issues we reported.

I visited my Wife during her business trip to NY. Upon arrival to the hotel, I immediately fell in love with the sultry/woodsy scent of the space. I met my wife at the onsite resturant. The decor, staff, food and drinks were wonderful! When I finally made it to the room, I was surprised at the size. #tinyhomevibes for sure! I loved it! It was everything you needed in a super cozy space. The window next to the bed was everything! The hotel is super walkable to shopping and exploring the city. I loved the little convenient store in the lobby. It was nice to have a place to grab a quick snack/drink without leaving the hotel. During checkout, I asked about the hotel scent. I was surprised to learn that it was a signature scent that they SELL! I almost fainted. Lol You know I purchased a bottle to take home. Now I get to spray it in my home for a lovely scent and reminder our lovely stay with Arlo! Until next time Arlo! (P.s Please bring a location to Baltimore! ♥️)

Efficient room, wonderful stay. Friendly staff. Tv and internet system was kinda cool. Location is great near spring street and where all the cute shops and restaurants are. Beautiful property. Would recommend.

I had a great stay at the Arlo Soho. My room was very small, but still super functional. Loved the blackout curtains. The lobby was a great place to work and relax. Lovely outdoor space, too. Each night, there was a complimentary wine & beer happy hour with some small bites. Such a nice touch! I also ate at their on-site restaurant, Harold's and had a great experience. Food was nice and the kitchen sent out complimentary biscuits!Would absolutely stay here again. Near to a lot of great restaurants.

I booked 3 nights at the Arlo Soho through Priceline and it was an amazing stay. The interior is beautiful and the staff are welcoming. Although there was a mix up in the type of room that I had booked, they resolved it very quickly and professionally. They even offered a complimentary breakfast and candy on the house for the trouble. Thank you to David and the Night Manager that helped us with everything and made sure we had an enjoyable stay!

I love this hotel. Very great experience to stay one night in New York. The room is clean and well designed. The bed is really big for one person to live in. People in Arlo Soho are very nice. They really concern about your trip there.

I loved this hotel!! The rooms are small, but very clean and has an European charm. The staff was very friendly, as were the guests who stayed there. We’ll definitely stay again when visiting downtown NYC.

We loved our three nights in this contemporary hotel. The room was small as most NYC hotel rooms are but it was designed intelligently and comfortably. Everything worked beautifully, especially the shower! The lobby behind the reception desk is also spacious and inviting, a great place to hang out if the room is too small. The staff is professional and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Can't beat the prices on this hip, stylish hotel! The staff is top notch and they make a great espresso in the lobby. The place has a casual vibe, always feels inviting, and is exactly what I need when visiting NYC.

Rooms are small but very cozy and clean, lots of entertainment in the hotel, very modern and staff was very helpful. Walking distance from the subwway. Would definitely go back next time I’m in the city

This establishment was absolutely amazing! The kindness of the staff was overwhelming! The rooms were very clean and smelled great. My mother and I have never been to NYC and I can say with certainty when we go back this is where we will be staying.

I discovered this absolute gem, which has greatly exceeded my expectations, through Hotwire. I couldn't be been happier with the hotel they placed me at. The staff made such an amazing first impression, and several more after that. (Thank you Danny, Chris-Ann, Moises and Z and the friendly housekeepers and staff at Harold's!) I have never experienced hospitality this universally amazing and also so authentic in New York City. The numerous areas to enjoy downstairs are so festive and beautifully decorated for the holidays. Many of the rooms are very small but there are so many great spots downstairs to work or relax and the beds are very comfortable. (You can also book a larger room and some even have terraces.) They have come up with so many creative ways to get guests to mingle, including their complimentary weekday digital detox hour. So good!! You can reserve an outdoor cabin. I stopped by to see one that friends I met at the hotel reserved. I felt like I was tucked away on a ski mountain, not in an NYC courtyard. So magical! The beds are comfortable and the soundproofing is amazing, which is such a gift in city hotels! I did not hear any noise at all in either of my courtyard rooms. (I switched rooms when I had a window draft issue in my first one on an extremely cold night...they found a solution that made me want to shout from the rooftops about how amazing this place is.) Speaking of rooftops...the view is spectacular and I will have to return to experience it during the summertime. I'm sure I will have more great things to say tomorrow. Can't wait for breakfast!

Stayed here for 3 nights. Our “pod” room was small, but very well designed and very comfortable. All the staff were really helpful and Happy Hour in Harold’s was great fun. The hotel is very well located on the edge of the nice restaurants, bars and cafes of Greenwich Village. You can walk down to the 9/11 memorial, or a bit further uptown to the Empire State. If you prefer not to walk, the subway is just a few minutes away. Perfect hotel for a visit to New York.

We visited the hotel for a three night stay stay in New York to soak up the Christmas atmosphere. The hotel was ideally placed for our needs. 5 minute walk to the subway, great little café close by.The staff could not have been more helpful. From dropping our bags off early to calling us a car to take us back to JFK. Nothing was too much trouble. All fairly standard stuff but it was done well. All smiles and general good nature made us feel very welcome. The hotel lobby leads onto a lovely lounge and bar area with restaurant at the back. We didn't eat here so can't comment further but the cocktails were excellent and reasonably priced. The snacks that were available in the lobby (24 hours) are extortionately priced though. 21 dollars for three packets of crisps and a coke! I guess that's what happens when you have a captive audience. Rooms were great for our purposes. They're small but have everything you need and the shower is great. Not the sort of room you would lounge around in, but why would you when you've got New York to explore. Comfortable beds and amazingly quiet considering the location. Contact throughout our stay was superb as well. Emails were sent if the do not disturb sign was up and the room therefore not serviced, just to make sure it wasn't a mistake. If it was then contacting the front desk soon rectified the matter. Highly recommend and would love to return.

This was my third visit (and I admit rating this hotel five stars previously) so what went wrong this time? Friday, I was given a key to a room that stank of BO, presumably, because of previous guests using that room. Upon complaining, I was told that there were no spare rooms and that I should find another hotel (at my own expense). After an hour of complaining, the front desk confiscated the vouchers I was handed when I first arrived but eventually I was given another cleaner room. At time of check-out, there was some confusion over whether the hotel had already taken payment yet were asking for payment again but quickly over-taken by the hotel manager offering me a rebate for the poor treatment I had suffered. I didn't receive the rebate I was offered but (despite not charging a single item to my room), and just to add insult to injury, the hotel did take a further payment from my account. Next time, I'll take their advice and find another hotel.
user_name:
Steve D
New York City, New York

review_body: I was only in town for a short overnight say but look forward to coming back in the future. Hotel and room design was nice. Most important, the staff, especially John S., was welcoming and helped a short stay feel memorable.

Loved this stay. It’s a great looking location near soho, village and the 1 or a quick Uber up West Side Highway. The staff is very kind and helpful. The rooms - though small are clean, comfortable and well thought out- especially for one person. Public spaces are fantastic to unwind or plan next steps. And Harold’s is the best!

From the hospitality of the staff to the cleanliness and efficiency of our room, this stay is one we won’t soon forget. The location is convenient to the subway and within walking distance to the beauty of SoHo and Greenwich Village. Would definitely recommend Arlo SoHo to anyone - and you can’t beat Christmas in New York.

I can highly recommend this beautiful Hotel! I am a regular guest ( 3 times per year at least!) nice rooms, friendly staff and bikes for free :) Additionally, I love the roof top bar in summer! Gret location- all you need is a walking distance away.

great place! my husband and I enjoyed it very much! very helpful and friendly staff. Great perks and events the entire weekend we were there! Very nicely decorated for Christmas! 24 hour coffee bar, perfect for my coffee loving husband. They let us check in a little earlier, which was perfect because we flew early in the morning, and we wanted to be able to freshen up before exploring the city. They had no reason to do it, but they accommodated us!

I've stayed here a couple times now and have grown to like it more and more. Nice location and space and attention to making sure all your senses are taken care of. Aromatic open spaces, soft lighting, nice rich sound systems, comfy beds and pillows, power showers and full smart TV entertaining. Yes, rooms can be a bit tight...it's lower Manhattan...that's what you get and it isn't compromising...just cozy. love it.

This stay started bad and just went down from there. There were two days without hot water. While I understand that things happen with boilers (not ideal but things happen) the complete lack of communication to guests was unacceptable. Anything from an email acknowledging the issue/making customers aware of it to a call or even a note of apology would have gone a long way but instead it took me calling or stopping but the desk to find out that it was a hotel-wide issue. On top of that, housekeeping seems to be operating on autopilot and not paying attention at all. I used the glasses in the room the first night and left the dirty glasses in the sink. They were still there when I returned Monday evening so I set them in the hall assuming that housekeeping would replace. They never did until I spoke to the front desk on Wednesday. Additionally, the phone in the room was malfunctioning causing the screen to rapidly flicker making sleeping with it on the cradle next to impossible. It was something that was VERY obvious but housekeeping never called maintenance or replaced it. I had to ask the front desk to replace it on Wednesday. Lastly, I woke Tuesday to a tear in the bottom sheet that, again, was very obvious. I returned to the room Tuesday night and the same torn sheet was still on the bed! I don't know budget hotels that have such bad service. Again, I had to ask the front desk to replace it on Wednesday. All in all, the majority of the front desk and lobby team were exceptional. Very polite and very prompt. A good friend who works for a hotel group in NY noted about the woman with curly hair in the lobby that she'd hire her in an instant because of how great she was with guests. She is also the person who fixed the issues with my room and comped me coffee from the lobby. However, when I was departing on Sunday afternoon I asked one of the front desk guys if I could reclaim my luggage and he passed my ticket off to someone else and went about his business. All in all, it took me close to 45-min to get my bags back causing me to miss a flight by 3 minutes and have to stay overnight at JFK.

This was my first stay at Arlo. The atmosphere was fun and quirky, loved the small footprint of the room, but definitely room for only one person. Great for my business trip. Room wasn't ready at check in time of 3 pm, but provided drink voucher, however service in the restaurant was either understaffed or under trained. No one interested in checking on us for more drinks or food.

These rooms are incredibly tiny (even for NYC standards), which is fine, except they are super awkwardly designed. The bed is in a little cube, but the mattress (in the king size room) doesn't line up with the frame, so they put two wedge pillows next to the mattress to make the pillows even with the bed. Seems unsanitary (since who knows when those pillows get cleaned?). The bathroom is terribly designed, with a shower curtain you have to pin to the wall to use, and just a thin sliding glass door between the bathroom and the rest of the room (so no privacy).

Underwhelming for the price you pay. Unsatisfactory level of service. In the bar, you pay $40 for 2 glasses of wine and the glasses are super dirty and sticky. When you complain, the bartender says its because she is wearing gloves that are sticky due to syrps she used in other drinks. She protects her hands, but doesnt mind giving you dirty glasses. At the end of our stay, the hotel charges a resort fee thats difficult to comprehend, as the place is not a resort. Overall disappointing, would not stay again.

My husband and I just stayed the weekend in NYC. I had some work on Friday, but then we wanted to enjoy the city. This was our first stay at the ARLO and it was perfect. It is just around the corner from the #1 metro line which makes it possible to get to Times Square in minutes. But at night you are away from the craziness and noise in a romantic space that envelopes you. The rooms are clean, and efficient. They make good use of space so it works. Our room had a large hot shower and King size bed. While it was cold outside, the room temp was perfect and quiet. No fan or annoying hum of an air-conditioner. A large window brought in natural light, but two powered screens (one transparent, one thick made the room private and restful. And there are lots of interesting spaces on the ground floor and terrace for chatting or working on the computer. For the holidays, Santa stopped by with spiced cider and treats and there were craft activities for the children. Happy hour goodies helped transition from day to night. The restaurant is amazing-- such interesting flavors- who knew carrots could taste so good. Also try the octopus ceviche. Everything was perfect for us- the rooftop terrace gives you a view that is hard to top and it feels like it belongs to you. If you want to get away from conventional hotels then the ARLO will give you a quaint and charming hideaway as you explore the excitement of Manhattan.

Almost major hotels provide same experience. This hotel is quite different. They provide me not only environment but also experience. If you want to find any other experience in NYC, let's try to stay!

This hotel was recommended to us by a friend, and we are so happy we trusted their judgement! Modern and clean decor (they had just finished the Christmas decs as we arrived) made the whole hotel feel really welcoming. They provide a digital detox in the restaurant from 5:30 - 7 every evening, free wine / beer for guests. A really great touch. The hotel is about a minute walk from the subway which can easily take you into the city, and about a 20min walk to the World Trade Centre. Staff are really friendly, overall a really great place to stay. We shall be back!

Very nice hotel, lovely interior, and good amenities. Rooms are tiny, just about fit two carry on suitcases without depriving walk space. Digital Detox is a wonderful amenity for hotel guests. Staff was extremely friendly and the outside courtyard with cabins is gorgeous during the winter time. I had some hiccups such as phone not working in the room, tv not working, and shower taking 10 minutes to get warm but overall would stay again due to amenities offered at the price point and decent location. Paid a premium because of the weekend i visited therefore value rating below is 3/5.

I had a nice stay. The hotel is very well located next to 2 main subway lines. It's clean, convenient, central and has a large working area, making it ideal to hold work meetings. The bar on the groundfloor is a good place to invite friends of business partners. The cafe at the entrance serves wonderful gourmet coffee, definitely a plus!

The hotel staff was gracious and kind. The food was excellent. The location to the meetings and Penn Station was perfect. Perhaps the rooms were small, but they were clean and efficient fit a shorter stay. Over all, great experience.

The Arlo Soho is a small unique hotel with beds in the windows, this means you get a beautiful view every morning and evening and is worth the stay just for this. The hotel is based in Soho, NY which is part an arty area of New York. There is a roof top bar, plus Harold's bar/restaurant which includes outdoor seating. Between 5.30 and 7pm there is happy hour, so free wine and beer! You can't argue with that as New York is pricey to drink! We loved it here, we came for our honeymoon and we were treated wonderfully. It is close by to the main attractions and everything is easily accessible via the subway which is around a 2 min walk too from the hotel. I was so impressed with this hotel, from the staff to the rooms. Everyone was friendly and the whole hotel was clean and cosy.I reccomend having breakfast in Harold's, it's all you can eat buffet and the food is tasty! Good way to start the day. The hotel also offers movie nights and other lovely entertainment throughout the week and the outdoor area of Harold's is always themed for the season. I highly reccomend staying here if coming to New York as staying in Times Square is just too hectic! Stay at the Arlo and have a relaxing stay outside the hustle and bustle. We can't wait to come back!

After having a terrible experience at a another hotel. We arrived at the Arlo upset, frustrated and exhausted. The staff was more than kind and provide us a nice room on the 10th floor. Along with this we received a complimentary drink coupon to relax our minds from the terrible experience we just had. Every encounter with every staff was always done with smile and a kind heart. Our flight was canceled and we were forced to stay an additional night, although our second room was not as great as the first the staff again made it so easy to choose this hotel again for tonight. I would recommend Arlo to anyone planning a stay in Soho NYC. This has become my home away from home! Thank you Arlo!

For our first trip to NYC I’m so glad we stopped at the Arlo Soho. From start to finish the staff were extremely friendly and accommodating to our needs. We ate at Harolds twice for breakfast and had an amazing Hanger steak for dinner.The rooms are nice, the king size bed was great to get in after a long day stomping the streets.The hotel stocks your fridge with 2 bottles of water a day, free WiFi and a free umbrella to use during your stay which came in handy on 2 of our days.If and when we come back to New York we would definitely stay here againThankyou to the staff at Arlo Soho for contributing to our amazing trip. See you soon

We had tickets to the Opera for Saturday night and decided on staying in the city. We arrived earlier then check in, and to our surprise our room was available. This typically does not happen in NYC. Most hotels will tell you, you can leave your bags, but you have to wait until 4PM. This was great because it gave us a chance to check in early and go out and walk around before our event at 8pm. The hotel is a boutique Hotel, and not a stuffy old fashion place. The staff is friendly and very attentive to your needs. They gave us complimentary drinks, since my girlfriend said it was for my birthday. They also gave us complimentary breakfast for the next day. The rooms are small, but like I always say, it’s only for sleeping. The hotel has two bars, one just off the lobby and another on the roof top. It was cold the night we were there, but still took advantage of the roof top. The view is decent; you have a clear shot at the World Trade center building and a nice view of NJ. The bed and lines where nice comfortable. The shower was great and our view was of the street below, but with large window floor to ceiling. Nice size TV, simply a nice place to stay

Hi! I stayed at the Arlo on a whim with my boyfriend; we were out late in the city, and didn’t want to take the train home to LI. We found the arlo listed earlier that evening on Hotel Tonight for 110$ and when we arrived to the hotel, 2 hours later, the price rose to 130 due to increase demand. John, the front desk clerk, not only upgraded our room but he also honored the price based on the app from what was listed EARLIER. Not only that, we missed the happy hour by 5 minutes, and instead of saying “sorry, you’re late!” He gave us 2 free drink cards. He was awesome.Additionally, the hotel was clean, trendy, beautiful, in a great location, comfortable beyond, fun, shabby and awesome. Would definitely stay again!

It was the perfect stay. Excellent staff, clean room, beautiful place, great food. We will be back. The courtyard had an amazing little cabin area that was just perfect for the season. The roof top deck was gorgeous. The cafe great, and the restaurant was spectacular. We will definitely be coming back.

Return trip was as good as the first at Arlosoho. Great staff, super cute mini room, hip vibe, and a perfect location. Happy hour is always a plus, dining at Harolds was great. Casual, friendly guests hanging in the lobby, people coming and going at all hours, lively spot that's fun to be at for a change of pace and a change of place. We'll be back.

The staff are friendly and make sure that your room is clean on a daily basis but however the rooms are very small for the price and very cold with the heating taking forever to warm the place up. Also, defo not suitable for family as the showers are mainly clear so whenever someone needed to use it the other would leave the room which wasnt ideal at all. It lacked privacy. The drinks downstairs are pretty overpriced too, like coffee.

Stayed there last week, Staff/Place excellent. would recommend to anybody. Rooms Good Size, Restaurant good/food. Staff couldn't do enough for you. Advice from them Perfect. Knew place to eat around there.

I’ll start with the positives: reception staff super friendly and the rooftop bar was nice. Negatives: the bathroom and location. There are no walls providing you with privacy in the bathroom. All the room provides is frosted glass dividing the bathroom from the bed. So, you can see and hear whomever you may be sharing a room with take care of business. It felt like a prison cell as I had to ask my partner to give me a courtesy flush. I get this is NYC and I’ve experienced this will lesser priced hotels. The problem I had is that there is NO mention of this issue in the room descriptions. For the exact same type of room w no-privacy bathroom, you could stay at the Yhotel and save $100 a night. Also, I was no a fan of the location. The hotel is situated very close to the busy intersection heading into the tunnel towards NJ. Given this, it’s loud, congested and made navigated in and around the area difficult. The bathroom and location are enough to keep me from ever returning to the Arlo Soho.

Great stay at the Arlo Soho. Perfect location for any reason to be in that part of NYC. The rooms are very clean and nice, but small. Great rooftop bar and view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again!

Overall a very nice hotel with luxury amenities. However, these rooms are microscopic in size. My boyfriend and I had minimal luggage and were literally walking over each other. The size wouldn't be such an issue if there were more efficient storage options.

Great vibe w lots of good common areas as well as a cool outdooe patio. Rooftop bar. Rooms are small, smartly efficient and appointed. Great service. Near Holland Tunnel. Would definitely recommend trying.

The public spaces for guests on the ground and second level were well conceived, comfortable and trendy. Great for relaxing after city hikes. We had good cocktails in the bar. Happy hour at Harold’s was a plus with complementary beer/wine for hotel guests. In general, Arlo Soho had a good vibe. We stayed in a “Queen Alcove” room. The room was pretty good, but windows needed sound proofing and weather proofing. Street noise was real, the bass from the gym across the street was notable, but they closed down before bedtime and it wasn’t too much of a problem. The room is small, as expected and anticipated for an NYC micro-hotel type place. The bed and bedding were very comfortable. We slept well. The bathroom had a nifty lay out, incorporated into the room with a frosted sliding door. Though it had a trendy look, some items were also a bit worn - hooks over the sink were starting to pull from the wall, the shower curtain was in need of replacing. We didn’t love the location of the hotel. It was a decent jumping off point for adventures in Chelsea, Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown, but wasn’t in the middle of anything either and the surrounding area is fairly nondescript. The price was responsible for NYC and fit the hotel. After accounting for all the various taxes, fees and the like the cost for a mid-November weekend was $288 a night. Overall, we’d recommend this hotel, but didn’t leave gushing about the experience either.

I could hear hammering from like 6 am from a construction sight below. Cars driving by, the people next door. We are on the 9th floor I took several videos lying in bed because it was so awful. I was exhausted and found no rest or comfort here. I’ll pat videos to my yelp review. Paper thin walls. Windows that don’t block ANY sound.

Used this hotel for a four night stay, great location in Soho with easy access to sub-ways and if you like a pleasant walk. The guys on reception were so helpful and courteous, big shout out to Joe and Richard. Yes rooms are quite small but how much time do you actual spend in them when a tourist? They were clean with good showers. The Harold's restaurant and bar is lovely and great happy hour/deto, and nice roof terrace. Would def recommend

Great public spaces, helpful staff and convenient location. Rooms are small, but we didn't spend much time in the room in NYC. Seems to be one of the few moderately priced hotels in the area. Prices fluctuate greatly based on time of year. Have stayed here twice and will do so again!

One of the best and hippest hotels I have stayed in anywhere in the world. Great staff (big shout to the helpfully Richard and Danny for travel tips etc). Very beautiful people here and such warmth from guests and staff. Amazing roof garden and amazing happy hour!! LOVE IT.wanto come back soon from Somerst, UK. Great food, especially the wings and such a great hip location.

Nice place friendly staff. Great location in Soho. Rooms are comfy but on the small side. We stayed on a Saturday night and parking is free on street. They sent up a complementary bottle of wine and some cookies, I thought was a nice touch.

I stayed at the Arlo Soho for a couple of nights in October. Front desk staff was super friendly and very helpful. Rooms are not huge but well designed. Location is great - a few minutes to the water and great to explore downtown by foot.

The room was nice and trendy. As advertised, the rooms were also very small. It was fine for me and my husband but if you're a new couple, beware that the bathroom isn't really closed in...there's some open space at the top and bottom of the door. Very little privacy! Location is fair to good. There's a bar and restaurant onsite but nothing around the corner. We walked about 10-15 minutes to better options.

Room was okay, amenities basic [no tea/coffee]. Unresponsive staff in resolving complaint about room [door was broken and wasn't fixed during our stay]. High price for basics, wouldn't stay again. Complimentary 'happy hour' also v basic: house red, white or Heineken. No staff happy to offer, bring round or suggest. Really have to wait and go out of your way to get any of those drinks. Won't visit again, wouldn't recommend you stay - go elsewhere. The Hoxton in Williamsburg [appreciate, vastly different location] offered a much, much better experience for less!

Loved the small but pretty room, super comfy bed, wine hour downstairs, fabulous location, candy bar, and above all the unusually kind and helpful people working there who went above and beyond to make our stay pleasant!

Arlo SoHo is a great hotel to stay whether you're on business, couples trip or family vacation. The hotel itself is set up in such a way to entertain and cater to everyone. We were lucky enough to go when they were having happy hour from 5:30-7 p.m. - free beer/wine and hors d'oeuvres. I understand they have different "perks" at different times. The staff is happy and friendly and the rooms are spotless.

We went to the other Arlo in NYC on another trip and decided to stay at the Soho. Wonderful hotel. Rooms are small, but that is plus for me...with nice appointments like a steamer and hairdryer. Friendly and kind people working there. Fun galore from the comfy rooftop bar, to the nooks to camp out in with your computer, to the astroturf courtyard with little sheds for groups of people....Great coffee bar in the lobby along with nice pre-made salads if you dont want fancy. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant and we all were thrilled with our food. Plus, the location was great for us as we had to bounce over to Brooklyn--which was easy being downtown and near the bridges and tunnels.

This hotel was truly an amazing and beautiful in every way.Room and bathroom was very clean Great ambiance at the hotelAwesome customer service Great helpful and welcoming staff!Very highly recommend for business or pleasure stay in NY!
