If you get the chance; stay here! The staff are great, the hotel itself is fab, & the overall experience; you just can't beat it! City views all the way, yummy menu, awesome lounge areas & fab staff!Our hotel room was clean and comfortable, loved the bed. The views were brilliant and we were fascinated by the city views the hotel has to offer. Staff will jump at the chance to go above and beyond your expectations and seem to know what you want before you even do, they are the best!The fact that you can leave your bags in the hotel safe and sound before and after room check ins is a god send. You can go off and explore without worrying about carting your bags around behind you all day. Whilst you stay at Arlo Soho, you must must MUST take the opportunity to visit each of the lounge areas as you will be amazed, so much thought goes into the courtyard, but all areas make you feel so relaxed and at home. We have loved our stay and are so pleased we followed on social media first to see what to expect. Although, the hotel is even better than the instagram photos, super hotel! Seriously can't wait to return!

We were at two night stay at the Arlo SoHo, and had great experience. The staff at this place was as helpful as any I have ever had. David at the front desk was awesome every time we came down out of our room with a question, he had an answer or suggestion, never annoyed with all our inquiries. The Arlo has great common areas to sit, get on your device, or just slow down. They have a complimentary beer and wine thing going on every afternoon. Close to subway, and walking distance to lots of eating options. One drawback is the size of the room we had. Not just small, but tiny. Had to put our luggage in bathroom to move around, no chair to speak of. It is the smallest room I have ever stayed in, including Europe.

After making a reservation at this hotel on a third party app called OneNight, I was advised at check in that I would be staying in a bunk bed. After clarifying with the hotel manager that this was an error as the reservation confirmation stated that the room would fit two people, I was advised that I would need to pay close to double what I already provided them to get a room with a queen bed. The fact that they wouldn’t assist without engaging in price gouging was extremely concerning and violating. I told the manager that I felt abused by her request and she told me that she would be calling the police on me if I continued to complain. I strongly advise that you avoid this hotel as they engaged in blatant fraud and threats against me for no reason.

We stayed for 2 nights and from entering the hotel to leaving the staff were super friendly. The hotel is really cool with lots of sitting areas, lovely bars and Harold’s Restaurant is great for a quick snack or a nice meal. The rooms are compacted but have everything you need - and more! The toiletries are also great and smell amazing!The hotel is ideally situated for the World Observatory and some lovely restaurants and bars are nearby.

We stayed for 2 nights and our stay was great from start to finish. The staff are very pleasant, efficient and helpful.The room was compact but exactly as it looked from the photos. Lots packed into a little space and there wasn't anything we needed which wasn't there. Clean and tidy and the shower products are excellent!Harold's Restaurant was perfect for a quick bite to eat - very tasty food and reasonably priced.Happy Hour was a lovely surprise - don't get free drinks in many places these days!

Always a great stay! The staff is very friendly and welcoming. The rooms are microunit size but feel very cozy even with a king size bed. The buffet is a bit pricey. Maybe the hotel guests could get a discount?Overall, I’d recommend staying!

I travel every other week back and forth from AZ to NY. As most business people know the routine can get old and you start missing some sense of home after awhile. My team told me about Arlo Soho and I jumped on it as it was right next to my office and it's a wonderful hotel. However, I keep coming back because of a individual named Clu. Tucked around the corner from the front doors is a small bodega with incredible food and one of the KINDEST people I have ever met. His name is Clu..always armed with a smile and he always remembers the people he helps. I would be remiss if I did not share an encounter with Clu that will stay with me for years to come. After a 16 hour day, exhaustion, and coupled with rough news I dragged myself to the bodega around 1130PM for some tea before I headed to my room. A little teary I stood quiet waiting for my turn and I hear Clu asked "everything ok?"...I smiled and simply said rough day. He smiled and handed me my tea and wished me a better day. It was the second night that I made my usual run for tea that I hear "was today better?" ..it was Clu and not only did he remember me and my bad day but my tea was waiting. We chatted for 15 minutes learning about eachother... where we came from..why I was in NY..and most of all it was the sense of friendship that made my week. In a fast paced city like NY we pass by one another never giving a second thought to how someone might be doing. But Clu slowed that pace down and humanized a moment I will be forever grateful for. For me Arlo Soho is not just a hotel..its a second home for the next several months and I have to be honest..I come back to see my friend Clu because it makes this travel a little less tough being away from my daughter knowing there is always a friendly face each day. Thank you Clu for taking a moment to ask me how I was and for your unwavering ability to bring a smile to so many faces everyday!

Very good hotel, friendly staff, great food at restaurant. Tiny room but with comfort and new furniture/mattress/pillows. Within walking distance to major Soho attractions. Try not to get room facing traffic to tunnel, it can be a bit noisy, but not too much.

It was my first time staying at the Arlo but I’ve stayed many times in Soho. Thought it would be another too cool hotel but ended up having amazing customer service, great amenities and was really good food and drinks.

Coming across Arlo SoHo in advance of a recent business trip, I’ve since stayed a couple of times and will again when next in NYC.Rooms are compact (to be expected in the centre of NYC) but provide everything you need, the ambience of the hotel is hard to match (particularly in the public work spaces) and the bar offers a great selection of drinks crafted by a very friendly and knowledgable team.

This is a lovely hotel with friendly staff,good bar and comfortable beds. BUT* the rooms are really tiny so if you have any luggage you'll have a problem putting stuff anywhere.* The bathroom area is frosted glass and you can hear EVERYTHING. The sink is in the bedroom.* My biggest issue was the noise of the air con. It switches on and off every 15 minutes during the night with a massive click and a woosh noise and then is so loud it ruins your sleep. You can also hear all the traffic noise outside. I could hear an alarm clock in another room going off in the morning. I was able to turn the air con off because it was October so after the first night I could sleep ok but it would have been impossible in the summer. For that reason I wouldn't stay here again.

Best hotel experience I have had in awhile! Absolutely no complaints about my stay. I just wish I could get the spotify playlist that the rooftop bar was playing while I was there - great music, great vibes, and amazing staff. Thanks Arlo Soho!!

Had a great stay at Arlo Soho and will definitely be back again. The building was clean, my room was great especially my view, the staff was always nice and helpful, and between the diner and bars my needs were met. It was raining during my stay so I didn't venture far but didn't need to.

I was really happy staying here - great location, great hotel, friendly staff, excellent coffee, gorgeous bar and really good food. I was happy and will definitely be back the next time i swing by the city. Thank you.

The moden lobby, where you meet the nice and friendly team, welcomes you with a pleasant, light scent, its exclusive scent! Small rooms, with minimalistic design, introduce you to what is quite a standart size of a NYC room. It was very clean.Furthermore the hotel offers a rooftop with a nice view on the neighborhood! Very enjoyable. Visit it! We loved our stay! Next time we are in NYC, we will definitely chose Arlo Soho again!Fabulous!

Great staff, atmosphere & location. Perfect small rooms with everything you need provided. Within walking distance of great restaurants & shops. Great small bakery just around the corner. will stay here again on next trip to NYC.

Anyone who complains about small rooms here is not paying attention. The rooms are small. If you want a large room stay elsewhere. Rooms are small but efficient. Good for a 2/3 day stay max. Rest of amenities are first class and location is ideal. Walking distance to almost anywhere you want to go. Attentive staff. Roof top bar is beautiful. Will be back

Let’s be honest. You don’t go to New York to stay in your hotel room. These rooms (we had a bunk and a King room without balconies) are small, period. You don’t really want to hang out in them. But that’s not a bad thing because they are also clean, the beds comfortable, quiet, stylish, clever, and priced appropriately. This lively little place encourages getting out and about within the hotel itself and the city! Isn’t that the point of visiting New York? Breakfast buffet at Harold’s was great. John (“Brooklyn Boy”) was super welcoming at the Front Desk at check-in) We walked to everything and appreciated that the hotel location was out of the typical tourist areas. The only reason I didn’t give 5 stars was a room issue at check-in that was appropriately taken care of. We would happily return.

Was very pleasantly surprised at how the level of service totally matched the coolness factor during my stay. Key for me are a comfortable bed, access to a proper gym, nutrition and a good spot for a drink. With multiple bars, an onsite coffee shop and a variety of work spaces I ended up spending far more time in the hotel than I'd even planned. I also loved that the mini care was open 24/7. Whether I got in an 2am and wanted some eggs, fresh overnight oats at 11pm or good coffee it was all there. as well, really liked their partnership with a gym with very complete workout facilities.

I had a great time in this hotel. My room was very clean and comfortable (it’s perfect especially if you travel alone like I did). The staff was helpful, and very welcoming. There is a cute rooftop, and the location of the hotel is great. I will definitely stay there again in my next visits.

Nope. Just nope. Reached out 3 times and no answer, just keeps sending me spam telling me to tell them how good they are but wont respond to my concerns, how crazy is that? These automated communications, yeah I dont know. It makes them look even more ignorant. Nope. Nope. nope. nope.nope. nope nope.nope. nope

Stay at the Arlo if clean and comfortable rooms in a convenient location is what you want.Seriously - the location was perfect (3 min walk from either the red or blue subway lines) and close to shopping (soho) and great restaurants (tribeca). Will stay at the Arlo Soho again when I return to NYC.

Cute room, wonderful staff, great property, HUGE balcony off the room with outdoor shower. Loved it. The lobby and common space had plenty of room to hang out and have a nook to work or chat. We loved breakfast at Harold's. The candy bar in the bodega made the hotel an instant win for our kids.

Nice vi-bee feeling hotel with friendly staff.Unfortunately we were disappointed with the room which had a glass toilet/shower room the size of a cupboard, which offered no privacy in an already well below average size NYC hotel room - All noises and smells were shared fully with your bunk mate, this for me would certainly have an effect on the romantic mood for anyone looking to set the scene... We weren't offered any kind of special treatment for my partners 40th birthday, which was disappointing, as the staff seemed pretty nice i think this must be hotel policy rather than a grumpy desk op which is a bit sad.We are not moaners generally, but feel i must mention the Air conditioning in the room, which was ridiculously noisy and stopped us from sleeping on both nights. We actually considered trying to get a different hotel after the first night but realised the cost and inconvenience was not worth baring, so we lumped it with red tired eyes.We were told by the maintenance team that all rooms were the same and that was how it was supposed to be so, please bear this in mind if you are a light sleeper as it will effect your stay.

I stayed two nights at the Arlo Soho last week and was very impressed. Rooms are small but incredibly well laid out. Hotel was very welcoming and the rooms were impeccably clean. Hotel staff was pleasant and helpful. Rooftop bar is fantastic for enjoying a drink while looking out over the Hudson River.

Joe S. and David were super helpful and made our stay smooth! Thank you so much! Not only is the space beautiful and well-located, the customer service is amazing! The rooms are thoughtfully put together and the Digital Detox (a happy hour for patrons) is a great touch. Also, I wish I could have taken the bed on the plane with me...SO comfortable.

Stayed 5 nights. Enjoyed every minute. All works perfect in this hotel. The atmosphere, the service, the design, the rooftop, the bar, the view, the bed, the shower, the aircon, the breakfast, the location. All amazing.we enjoyed every moment here.thanks Arlosoho, for a great stay

Very happy with stay at Arlo for business travel. Petite room but nice amenities. Good brand toiletries, nice bedding, good AC climate control, quiet, clean. Staff is lovely and very fun, cool vibe. We enjoyed the rooftop bar as well ✌

Really Cool Vibe here! Place is clean and staff is friendly. your smack in the middle of Tribeca here. You never know who you will run into celebrity wise. I bumped into Jennifer Lawrence. Lots of common space to work. network or just meetup. Roof Top has very good feel indoor and out. DJ spins certain nights. Rooms are small, but bed is comfortable.

Friendly staff and comfortabel (small) rooms.Walking distance to plenty of shipping and dining opportunities. Get a higher floor room to get some views. Bike rental for green sunset to sundown and great lobby area to do some work.
user_name:
Dbernauer
New York City, New York

review_body: I'm a luxury real estate agent in New York City. Most of my clients are foreign. This mean, a week spent looking at property requires a place to stay that is not just modern, clean and beautiful but efficient. Cozy room means the clients are out enjoying their new home city. The main lobby schedules free movie nights, jazz and art based entertainment. A Dylan's Candy Wall and great grab and go food makes this a "work late" gem.Recently, I had a client who gave me 24 hours to find a place to host a birthday party for over two hundred people. Enter my personal super hero, Jen Roman, Event manager. In no time flat I had a tour of the location, a price quoted and approvals for the rooftop and even a menu of what could be served to the guests. Arlo anywhere has my business. Knowing I and my clients are in good and responsive hands, is all the peace of mind I need.Need to get work done while traveling? The lobby has been transformed into a comfy living room with plenty of outlets to kick back and get work done. Sit indoors or out, even in Winter! Glamping tents erected each season to make the backyard an adventure. Co-workers from every industry meet and collaborate on the first and second floor spaces. Come for a vacation, leave with a start-up. :)
user_name:
callmestef
New York City, New York

review_body: I came here for an overnight stay and loved it! The hotel rooms are on the smaller side but it’s just what you need, bed is comfy, shower is great, the room has an overall cozy vibe. There are great restaurants and amenities on site. Within walking distance to a lot of great places. 24/7 bodega with everything you would need, and the staff were all incredibly friendly!! I would definitely recommend and hope I get the opportunity to stay here again in the future.

Arlo Soho hotel is modern and up to date . Con: very!! Small room, never had such a small room include bathroom. High price - 400 $ +Pro: happy atmosphere, the staff is very friendly and helpful. Public spaces are very nice and comfortable. Very good location. I enjoyed a lot. Thank you

Arlo SoHo is a feast for the eyes, a comfortable stay, and in a great location with easy access to multiple subway lines, great food, and scenic walks. The staff was extremely friendly from the beginning to the end of my trip.

Great, clean room (king - courtyard) in a fantastic spot in the city. Helpful and very nice staff, in addition to a great rooftop bar (didn't try Harolds). Perfect for NYC as it was efficient but not claustrophobic.

Couldn't fault this place. From the friendly helpful staff to the lovely clean room and the amazing breakfast. A great rooftop bar was fantastic for the late summer sun. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

I have been staying at Arlo NoMad since 3 years. For the first time I have stayed at Arlo SoHo and should say it is my new 'home' in New York. The area is quiet, you dont have the noise of the crowded mid-town. With metro (different stations/lines at walking distance) you dont have to spend lots of time to move. The Hotel is 'brand new'. Very clean, very practical. The Restaurant and the roof top... perfect. You dont have noisy crowd and you can easily feel your self comfortable eventhough you are alone. The rooms are well furnished and clean. (No AC sound outside and inside the room-this is very important). The staff is very good, friendly and helpful. I had a very small problem but the Hotel made their best to recover it and they did. They were able to turn it around and helped me end my trip with a pleasant note/moment. Thank you so much. As the title suggests: 'Arlo SoHo... new home in New York'.

I enjoyed my stay at Arlo Soho. The room was clean and the bed was comfortable. I was glad I had not invited a friend to stay with me because the bed literally goes from wall to wall, and with no way to walk around the bed, you would have to crawl over. Breakfast was a delight in the hotel with a large buffet.

Thank you Arlo team for a nice weekend at your house. Friendly staff & fun atmosphere. The rooms were very clean & staff were very responsive to my requests. Also I was very comfortable with my kids playing in the lobby. Great time!

A conveniently located NYC hotel in SoHo, close to business, restaurants, shopping and the Holland Tunnel. Staff is super friendly, food is good, and great roof top bar/restaurant. Rooms are stereotypical NYC small, however, well appointed with a comfortable bed...and excellent water pressure!

My family and I stayed at the arlo hotel for the first time. The service was great and staff were friendly. The harold restaurant offers a variety of choices for breakfast. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Lovely, hip, modern style hotel with great staff and service. Just be prepared for tiny rooms with lots of noise. Internally, the AC unit going on and off if the loudest I've ever heard in hotel rooms. Externally, be prepared for very many and very loud car honking from the thousands of cars trying to get into the entrance of the Holland Tunnel. This hotel should be five stars....but the noise is a big problem.

Arlo is relaxing, comfortable and fun. Everyone is professional and kind. I would definitely recommend Arlo to my single friends. Definitely tiny rooms. Roof top was energetic but pricy . I say don’t look further but Arlo is the place . Location location location.

Wow! What an incredible experience. I had a staycation with girlfriends at Arlo Soho this past weekend and it was great! From the moment I walked in the front desk staff greeted me with a warm smile a catered to my every need They were so accommodating and went above and beyond. I would recommend this hotel to everyone and I will be back soon.
user_name:
vmars84
New York City, New York

review_body: The arlo was in such an awesome spot near the subway and could walk to so many landmarks. The hotel had such a cool vibe as well as the coolest rooftop bar to watch the sunset. The room was small (along with pretty much every hotel room in NY) but it was so comfy and suited us fine!

Couple of weeks ago I stayed at the Arlo Soho and it was the best Hotel I have stayed in so far in the big apple. Everything was amazing, the service, the cleanness of the rooms, the food at the restaurant, the location and the lobby scent, oh my God it's beautiful. This is my Hotel from now on. :)

I went to visit my friends and ended up stay for the night. Everyone was friendly, attentive, and helpful! The rooftop was a lot of fun however the drinks were a little pricey, but what do you expect, it’s SoHo!

Great hotel for short stays with amazing restaurant, multiple bars, friendly service and a candy bar. Fantastic places to meet and gather and Louis is perfectly located for great night life and eating out.

Overall, good impression for a first visit to Arlo Soho. I liked the location and cool, casual atmosphere, and loved our huge outdoor terrace with a view, and even a shower. I appreciated the friendly young staff, smiling and energetic. The bed and linens are comfortable and all areas are clean and bright. I was less enthusiastic about no coffee in the AM, in the room or lobby, unless you buy it at in convenient in-lobby bodega or you included breakfast (pricey) on your room reservation. I would like to see the Arlo be more consistent in their environmental message by offering a towel rack by the sink so we can reuse our facecloths and handtowels. I dislike the madness of the Times Square area, and was relieved to hear a lower intensity of car horns at night, although the rooftop lounge creates its own noise level. You can easily walk to Soho shopping areas and little Italy scrumptious food offerings from here, or use an Arlo bike. I will probably choose the Arlo Soho again.

What a cozy fun hotel to be in! I spent my last weekend there. Very friendly front desk agents The room was small yet functional. Love the coaster idea, they truly embrace being a green hotel. My room was immaculately clean. I met the director of Housekeeping Evona! What a young vibrant lady! Thank you for making my stay comfortable. She also recommended I try Harold’s and she was not wrong. Thank you for the recommendation. The lobby is the place to be. Loved the outside mini garden they have. It was full was not able to find a place to have my morning coffee. I will definitely come back to Arlo Soho on my next visit. Thank you Arlo Soho Team!
user_name:
BlueScooterGirl
New York City, New York

review_body: Arlo Soho is fantastic. Writing this review based on multiple experiences, as a guest and as a local patron. Rooms are clean, comfortable, and warm (in spirit - temperature is up to your discretion.) Perfect location for a downtown NYC experience. Great communal spaces. David at the front desk went above and beyond the call of duty extending service well past my check out, huge shout out to David! (and to the operations manager as well.. sorry I've forgotten your name.)All in two thumbs up. Book for your next NYC stay.

This is a cleverly designed and fun (but cool) hotel in a super-convenient location. First of all, let me mention the staff. They are universally friendly, helpful, well trained and efficient throughout the hotel. The public spaces at the Arlo are both vibrant and comfortable. Breakfast offers a good selection and decent value and the bar and lounges on the ground floor are good and work well across a few different spaces. The rooftop bar is a fabulous asset - we started every evening there and had a great time every time (and our NY friends were really happy to come and meet us there because it's such a good spot). Be warned, though - service can be slow when it's busy (although that's understandable). Accommodation? OK, let's be honest the rooms here are small and with two people in them it's tight with luggage, but the design optimises the space and the hotel doesn't hide any of this in its room descriptions or photography. Plus the showers, amenities etc are good quality. I'd recommend paying the extra for the rooms with outside space if you can afford it. In summary, this is a really cool, welcoming place to stay at a reasonable price in NYC so I have no hesitation in enthusiastically recommending it.

Just came back a few days ago from this hotel and it was amazing! The service was impeccable, the staff was very welcoming, the rooms were clean and the breakfast buffet was sooo good! I highly recommend this place

Great hotel in a good location. Very inviting and comfortable. The staff is friendly and they have a terrific breakfast buffet, modern rooms nicely done. Also a great rooftop bar. I‘d stay here again.

This boutique hotel delivers! With locale, service, atmosphere, cleanliness! Close to two subway lines to get you to where you need to go. Right by Holland Tunnel for easy access. And Uber accessible. Local restaurants within walking distance. Nice rooftop bar, restaurant and mini store with Dylan’s Candy Store in lobby. The vibe is very hip and urban. Clean lines and functional. The rooms are small but they have everything you need, comfortable beds, great rainfall shower head, mini fridge, TV,Internet, hair dryer and steamer. I will definitely come back to the Arlo SoHo on my next trip to NYC.

I have stayed at this hotel on several occasions. The rooms are small, but are unique. However, my stay this time has been an extreme disappointment in that my room is immediately over the tunnel. There is light shining into my room through the sun blocking window covering and loud car traffic all night. I went to bed and heard noise through the headphones. The hotel is generally nice, but make sure your room is well located. I have to say I won't take this risk again.

I was happily surprise on my first stay at this hotel. I was looking for hotels in the area, saw some photos on Instagram and it looked good. The experience in the hotel is great, staff is very professional and helpful. Details are taken care of, rooms are well designed. Not big, but surely a great deal for the price and location. The rooftop and lobby bar are great spaces for socializing, and winding down. I would definitely return for business or pleasure trips.

Recently stayed at the Arlo Soho after proposing to my girlfriend. The hotel staff really made us feel welcome and even decorated the room for us! Couldn’t have imagined staying anywhere else for the night!

The Arlo Soho a favorite place for me as home base in NY. The front desk, the shop, and in fact all of the people interact with are helpful, go the extra mile. Very caring and genuine. The Arlo has everything i need to feel centered and productive...and just overall fun.... great location as well.thanks!!!

Landed super early and obviously room wasn't ready upon arrival; luckily, I was staying at the SoHo location, I spent hours wandering in the neighborhood. Basically I did all my SoHo shopping that morning. Room was tiny but equipped. I was staying facing the street, so it was a bit noisy at times. The only thing I wasn't happy was the shower because the water kept "leeking" so the floor was wet all the time. People told me the rooftop was awesome so i went up but it was wayyyy too crowded.

David at the front desk was so kind, helpful and awesome! Would definitely stay here again. The rooms were nice and they upgraded us to a room w a patio and gave us free drinks! So much fun/ so nice and clean/ love it

I had my wedding ceremony at The Arlo sohos beautiful “All You Need Is Love” garden. The staff including the amazing Jennifer Roman planned such a beautiful ceremony and catered to all of our needs. They made our day special and on top of that we stayed in one of their rooms and I have not one complaint. The room was super clean and comfortable for a couple. The Arlo will hold special place in our hearts forever.

The courtyard view rooms are SO nice and quiet. While the rooms aren't large, they are cozy and well planned out. I slept great every night without hearing sirens, construction or other common noises to NYC when staying at other nearby properties. I will be back for sure!

I had an absolute blast celebrating my bridal shower with my family and friends. We held it at the Arlo soho courtyard no need for decorations because they had an amazing Woodstock them all set up. Food and drinks were amazing, best of all was the service. I can’t remember my waitress name cause the drink were flowing. She’s a sweet brunette with glasses. Would definitely host something there again. Thank you

The hotel was super cute, clean, was entertaining (had lots going on, lots of social opportunities, shopping, yoga, movie night, drinks, etc.), extremely helpful kind staff all throughout (front desk, house keeping, restaurant) just the rooms are TEEEEEEENY! I know NYC accommodations have tiny rooms but his was next level tiny! Wouldn’t stay here again for this reason.

From the clean, refreshed room, to the delicious salmon within the cafe, it was an amazing experience. The two free water bottles hit a desperate thirst after eight to nine hours of driving. The staff seemed friendly or at least accommodating. In addition, I enjoyed the laid back nature of everyone that worked there.

Service was great; room had a nice terrace with outdoor shower. Location is perfect for SoHo area; short walk to restaurants and shops. Nice rooftop bar and Harold’s was great for breakfast and happy hour. They had a nice pop up shop for fashion week and a cool Woodstock themed setup in the garden area. Highly recommend!

First impression was already quite dissapointing when stepping into the lobby and trying to do the check in it wasn't possible to maintain a conversation with the receptionists as we couldn't even hear ourselves due to how noisy the lobby area was (music and just guests practically screaming, without being told off by anyone from the hotel staff). During the check in "conversation" we were told 35$ additional would be charged PER NIGHT, which was absolutely not mentioned at all in the reservation confirmation or rates diplayed on the 3rd party site. Upon finalising the check in, we arrived to a room that wasn't in proper conditions (the bed was undone and the whole bedframe was misplaced in the middle of the room). We were told this room was previously used to "store" other guests baggage and thus the bed had been moved to make some space. This would have been fine, but the least they could have done is to put things back in place and tidy the space up before handing over the room. On top of that the rooms (we were given a new room upon complaining about the initially assigned one) are extremely small for the price, and if you add the 35$ extra they charge aside from the prices displayed on booking.com, it definitely made it even a worse value-for-money experience. Lastly, check out coudn't have been more absurd. There were multiple charges made to the card without prior notice and for various concepts and amounts, however each "concept" was broken down into multiple sub-charges which made it extremely difficult to estimate total amounts paid per concept and amounts we could expect to be returned. Example: concept A charge was 50$, instead of having 1 unique 50$ charge, there were 5 charges on the card, of 5$, 10$, 23$, 8$ & 4$. It absolutely made no sense at all. Overall, really bad experience, literally the only good thing was the location, and there were plenty of other hotels around of the same category and price range.

This is a great hotel. Rooms are small which isn't unusual in Manhattan so you need to be well organised and tidy! There is little storage space and only hangers ,no wardrobes but it has been designed in an imaginative way. Beds are very comfy and rooms are spotless. All staff are delightful and make every effort to make you feel special. We had a couple of problems during our stay, not the hotels fault but some troublesome neighbours . However they offered us complimentary breakfast and drinks. The restaurant seemed nice although we only had breakfast which was great. The communal areas are quirky and comfortable. Happy hour is 5 till 7. In fact it's very happy as red and white wine and beer is free. Take advantage of this as wine is astronomical in bars and restaurants!! The roof bar is lively and very popular in the evening. Enjoy.

Chic, brand new, great location!!!It has been a fantastic expereince. Lots of collaboratiing spaces, amazing wifi.But I would like to highlight SERVICE, absolutely incredible!! All the staff have made our stay so comfortable! Thanks to all of you! We'll be back for sure!

We can't thank Arlo Soho for taking care of us so well during my birthday stay (Sept. 3-5). Upon arrival, the energy in the lobby was amazing & the staff was so upbeat & welcoming, specifically David & John. Once they realized we were repeat guests, they were quick to offer us a room upgrade along 2 drink coupons. That was so unexpected & incredibly sweet of them. You can tell how they (along with the rest of the staff) are so committed to their work & really enjoy what they do. They were one of the real reasons our stay was so amazing. We absolutely love how cozy & comfortable the rooms are. They thought of absolutely everything you need with so many special touches & so creative with a smaller space. We love how the window takes up the entire wall, creating such a bright, warm space. They have a steamer, dryer, toiletries, lots of nooks & crannies for storage & even an umbrella in case it rains (thank goodness because we needed it one day).The lobby/bar area is full of energy with many areas to sit, relax, enjoy a drink or do computer work. There was even a pop-up shop & private event that was happening that was cool to see. We also got to enjoy the rooftop lounge since the last time we visited it was cold. It was packed & no seating, but still enjoyed a great drink, the atmosphere & views. The only weird thing was we had to go to the inside bar to get our drinks even though there was a bartender making drinks at the outside bar, but that didn’t damper our enjoyment. It just seemed a bit disorganized between bartender, wait staff & manager, but they were friendly.The coolest space & what makes this hotel so unique is the courtyard & the pop-up installations they do. This time was a nod to Woodstock 50 Years & Summer of Love. It was so vibrant, fun, imaginative & whimsical! I can’t wait to come back tosee the next installation!This is the ONLY hotel we will stay when we come to NYC because they always have something unique going on & you just never know what to expect…. well, you will DEFINITELY expect fantastic staff, a great room & great vibe!

So we were three friends, staying at Arlo 2 nights. We came early, around 10am, so check in was not possible as it was too early. Which is fine and which we knew, so we just dropped our luggage. We came back two hours after check in time, but still, one of the rooms were not ready. They mentioned they gave it to another person who checked in at 3pm - although we were there at 10am. They should have taken a note.My room was still full of trash when I entered, half full paperclip with could coffee, empty bottles and a note for the former guest... So I went down again and got a new room. My friend who's room was not ready dropped her luggage into my room as she needed to change before dinner. After I cam back from dinner at around 10pm I tried to get her luggage transferred from my room to her room - the receptionist said "I'll be up I 5 minutes and do that". No one showed up, after 30 min. I called reception, I explained to the lady on the phone and she promised to send someone immediately - no one came. So after an hour I went down to reception, but no one was there. So I went to bed as it was already late. My friend didn't get her luggage until the next morning. There were a few more things which I don't go into detail here. Overall they should not say they do something when they don't. At check out my invoice was not ready so right now I am waiting to get it via email - also here they promised "you'll get in within 30 minutes via email". I still son'z have it 2 hours later. So I am not only disappointed, but almost angry about the situation. For a room that cost 300 USD per night I expect a different service level. The location though was great!

I adore this hotel and would definitely stay again and again. The staff are excellent as are the rooms and amenities. The rooms are small but very efficient and no detail was ignored which is so New York. Highly recommend!

Friendly, helpful staff. They went above and beyond to make me comfortable. The restaurant's menu was diverse and delicious. The hotel has multiple spots to lunge, read or enjoy a glass of wine. The setting was absolutely gorgeous. As a woman traveling alone, I felt safe at the Arlo. I shall most certainly return in the future.

Thank you for having me. This trip was amazing. We enjoyed every bit of Arlo !! The team was very service oriented and provided us with all info needed. I will share with friends and family. We will be back.

The hotel exceeded our expectations in every way.Arlo is a contemporary upscale venue. Without exception, every member of the team we came into contact with was friendly, professional and genuinely committed to ensuring we had a great stay.We had dinner one evening and the buffet breakfast on the day we checked out - the choice and standard of the food is excellent.The choice of spaces to relax and socialise in is varied; rooftop bar, courtyard garden, bars and breakout spaces.We really appreciated the digital de-tox happy hour.The room is a little tight on space, but we only slept there.Excellent!

Very cool hotel in the middle of Soho with great common areas and activities for a hipster crowd. The rooms are very clean and the beds comfortable. The common areas are great for socializing and for spending time with other guests and friends.

We loved our stay at the Arlo Hotel in Soho. The room is compact but very nicely detailed. We had a lovely view and the bed and linens we most comfortable. We enjoyed the happy hour and roof deck. The buffet breakfast was better than average. We will go back again.

My husband and I have stayed at the Arlo SoHo 5 times, since they opened in 2016. Our son lives in New York, and the Arlo is definitely our home away from home! We look forward to a visit to the Arlo Nautilus, Miami, next year.

Beautiful, eclectic space that is unlike many of the other hotels I have stayed at in NYC. The space is pretty small but they make it up for it with an interesting layout and great design aesthetic. There is also plenty of common space downstairs to work, etc if needed.

Although I am a senior I was comfortable with the crew at the ARLO Soho hotel. Perfect for my one night eat and run visit. The rooftop bar was full of kids my kids, or grandkids, age but it served me well. I especially like the shower with a serious stream of water! Next time for sure.

From walking into a fresh signature scent throughout the hotel, to free bike rentals to an higher quality breakfast buffet. The experience of our stay from beginning to end was thoroughly valued. I would recommend staying at Arlo to anyone looking for more than your typical stay at a hotel.

Everything about this experience was great. Friendly, accommodating staff, comfortable atmosphere. Walkable to shopping, Chelsea Market, and High Line. The rooms are small, cozy, and well done. I would gladly stay again.

This place is the perfect home base if you want to escape some of the bustle of the city- but still be close enough to adventure all over Manhattan! It’s amazingly accommodating employees (Danny and David you guys are ROCKSTARS and absolutely made our stay everything and more!!) awesome location (Canal St subway), great rooftop, delicious restaurant and breakfast buffet, and of course the signature scent (oh the most amazing scent!!) Trendy and stylish hotel with comfortable bedding and wonderful views and bath products- we absolutely LOVED our stay and will definitely be back!

Great hotel! Quite Small rooms but Amazing concept done in a ***** way , really comfortable beds. Love the communal and breakfast area. Really stylish. Great for single traveller for business. Friendly staff and easy area to get around.I really enjoyed my work stay at this hotel.

The Arlo Soho is a great hotel. A little on the smaller side, but if you are planning on going by yourself, or one other person, then it's not so bad, especially if you are exploring NY for most of your time. It was clean and the staff at the front desk and hotel restaurant were very friendly. The bed was comfortable and the shampoo, conditioner, and soap in the bathroom were so nice and refreshing. The views were great as well.

Cool hotel - good quality and not wildly expensive - great buzz about the place - and nice touch to have a coffee shop and takeaway food out front - we had very early starts both mornings we stayed and so could easily grab and go....plenty of working areas in the hotel too.

I could not be more thrilled with this hotel especially for my first overnight stay in New York. From our arrival to our departure everything was wonderful. The staff was very friendly and helpful from the time you book your stay to the time you check out. I'm a very picky person when it comes to hotels and I can honestly say I would stay here again in a heart beat. Our room was very, very clean and although small it had everything you needed to enjoy a nice relaxing time. I must say they bed and pillows had to be the most comfortable I have slept in. I had the best two nights sleep I've had in a long time! The subway entrance was just a few short blocks away to get to all the locations to site see. The hotel even offered bikes to get around if you wanted! If your looking for a nice, clean hotel with friendly staff then Arlo Soho is your place!

Great location in SoHo. The hotel is very close to restaurants and boutiques. Great customer service with people like David and Karam. Superb rooftop for cocktails! Ended our trip using the bikes from the hotel and toured alongside the Hudson. Great afternoon!

If you're looking for a fun casual feel while in NYC, this place is a great choice!The modern efficient rooms are great for what you need while in the room. Eco-efficient and tidy with all you need in the relatively small space; an example of great design in interior architecture. Amenities available to the guest are very inclusive and the entire staff was so friendly, and helpful. Great place, great value for the heart of Soho.

First of all, I will never be able to put into words how much of an amazing, smart, quick & cool team Arlo SoHo has. I am in the hospitality industry, where we are all held to very high standards. I can tell you that in particular, Chad went above and beyond to make me feel not only comfortable, but I actually can now call this property my home away from home. Chad, thank you for everything and klnowing exactly what I needed before I even thought I did. I really cannot say enough about the entire team - Joe, Josh, the entire front desk team are the nicest people in NYC, period. Rooms are emaculate, and comfortable. The King City View room with the bed (literally in a window) is cozy and perfect. Already planning my next arrival :) Thank you so much everyone!

Fantastic stay at the Arlo Soho. Lovely clean and fresh rooms - bed and bedding super comfy!, great friendly staff that always have a recommendation to hand of where to get food and coffee, lovely coffee bar in reception, daily happy hour in the bar and a rooftop terrace to drink in the views

After a gruelling flight in from the West Coast for a 2 week work trip, it was so refreshing to be check in so promptly and caringly by the staff at the Arlo. Isabella really took the time to make sure we had everything we needed for a long and comfortable stay. She was also very helpful when it came time to print some important company docs and really came through when I needed a parcel that arrived at the hotel delivered to another location. Overall she went above and beyond for us and really solidified our love for the Arlo, which is why we don't stay anywhere else.Rooms are compact but provide everything you need and the location is perfect- close to a Trader Joe's and several great restaurants.Highlight of the trip was the excellent service we received from Dree at the rooftop bar. He was on point every night and super personable, creating a relaxed environment for us to chill and enjoy the view of the city. He was also very attentive and hilarious, making sure we always had a drink in hand!Overall it was a solid trip and can't wait to be back staying at the Arlo in NY.

As usual, we selected this property based on positive TripAdvisor reviews - and the reviews were spot on ! From check-in to check-out, this was a first class experience in every way. Where to begin? The front desk staff were excellent throughout our stay. Very friendly and efficient and clearly intent on providing the best possible service. I only got one name - Isabella - but everyone at the desk was on point. We loved the common areas on the ground floor and the rooftop terrace was spectacular. Service in the bars and restaurants was very good and the food in Harold's was delicious. The "Digital Detox" in Harold's, with unlimited complimentary wine and beer was a big hit and the quality of the wine offered was surprisingly good. I've seen lots of comments on the size of the guestrooms but the room size is fine (and bigger than other NY hotel rooms we have experienced). The room overlooked Hudson Square and it was bright and well appointed. Overall the hotel had a really positive vibe and everyone was so upbeat. We were left with the overall impression that the Arlo SoHo leadership team has a perfect handle on what the hotel guest experience should look like and their team buys into this and executes it flawlessly. Kudos to all involved and we will be back.

Fantastic hotel and staff. Great location to visit this wonderful city. Enjoyed every minute of our 7 day stay. Would highly recommend this hotel. will require a chilling beach holiday to recover and a foot spa. Thanks New York for all the fantastic memories my wife and I have enjoyed. Graham&mandy Dobson uk

Great experience from when we checked in to when we checked out. We took advantage of the lobby bar, rooftop bar, and activities including surfset yoga on the rooftop and the bikes. We also ate at Harold's which has high quality and tasty food. The service is excellent at the Arlo - competes with some of the top branded hotels.The rooms may be viewed as small by some guests but my husband and I found it to be perfect as we spent most of our time outside the room.Great location to the subway and within walking distance to fantastic restaurants and bars. We will be staying at the Arlo SoHo again!

So we arrive late in after escaping the JFK airport, you arrive in not a conventional Hotel Lobby ( and your soon get addicted to the Arlo scent/smell) candy bar loads of tempting things to start spending your dollar on.Young White Converse wearing staff greet you in a friendly manner and your already to go up in the lift to your room Okay now let me be clear if your a basketball player or blessed with long legs unless you study the Art of Yoga and can bend your legs this might not be the Hotel for you it’s sleek compact and yes small ( as is many of NYC hotels.But if your after a place that has a vibe a great rooftop garden and just a great feel then stay stay stayThere’s bikes being from little New Zealand and because they drive on the other side of the road we didn’t risk but hey young free and ready to experience the incredible NYC grab one and peddle away looks fun.They have this philosophy about making it a place where the community can come in sit down plug in the laptops work, even attend FREE ( you don’t hear that word much in NYC and NO TAXES!!) Movie nights.The concept with this group as they expand there Hotel seems to me a mix of Japan meets Scandinavia - it’s a great formula Okay let’s get down to the bits that some people what to hear the rooms YES compact, clean and everything you need nice toiletries good Air Con ( a must in summer ) you can hear a little noise ( it’s NYC after all) so chose your room carefully and while on the rooms you can choose from slightly larger rooms I would suggest this. We had exceptional service after a wee mishap but sorted in a kind and thoughtful way ( shout out to Kate ) So it’s NYC this is near subways we walked ( and spent far too much in Soho ) easy to get tooAnd the last bit which I feel sums up any stay ANYWHERE is that we are coming back through in Winter and will stay here again for sure ( just hope they have some great winter rates PLEASE)Thanks Arlo WE LOVE YOU x

It was my first time in NYC and this hotel was definitely the right choice! I was blown away by Arlo! It was the cutest, cleanest hotel with the BEST staff! It was close enough to explore fun things around town and I enjoyed the candy shop, colorful courtyard, Harold’s restaurant, and the rooftop bar with a stunning view! The hotel’s vibe was right up my alley and the accommodating staff made it even better! I will definitely be back!

A very clean, and modern hotel option. Great food and snack options, with excellent service from the hotel staff. Rooms are small but extremely well organized with great views of the city or the hotel courtyard. Walking distance from numerous shopping and food options.

Stayed here for 50th Birthday, for 5 nights. Bit disappointed that hotel didn't acknowledge that in any way, despite me emailing them up front. Nevertheless the staff were all very nice and friendly at all times, from the housekeeping to front of house. Our room was a little larger than the std shoebox format, having a small coffee table and chairs. It actually wasn't any smaller than many European hotel rooms that we have stayed in.Location was for me the best point. Arlo sits on the edge of Soho/Tribeca/Greenwich. It's 10 mins walk to all 3, and a couple more and you are on the riverside which is stunning in itself. I highly recommend staying in this part of town if your want a quieter, more laid back experience. I love this area! From the hotel we walked easily to and across the Brooklyn Bridge, 911 memorial, Staten Island Ferry etc. Canal Street subway stations (5mins walk) link you to the city with ease.oh...Lobby smells amazing ! Recommend - Sirloin at Wolfgang's Steakhouse in Tribeca, Aperol spritz at City Vineyard, Pier 26, and chicken and strawberry panini at The Dubliner, Stone street.Loved New York City - Arlo was a great base from which to explore and a joy to come back to.

It was as advertised. Small but clean and efficient rooms and a very nice balcony. What was most impressive was the front desk staff. We had three special requests to three different staff members and they each were quite creatively accommodated. We will return.

Arlo Soho is the perfect place to stay in NYC. A welcoming front desk, some of the best restaurant and bars I have been too, and an overall amazing staff. I loved the location. I will be back soon for cocktails and a good nights rest!

Spent 2 nights at Arlo. Veerry efficient use of the 150 sq ft. room. I guess that’s how it works in the big city. Very clean. Very efficient. Great rooftop bar. A ‘free’ happy hour in downstairs bar. Bottom shelf red and white and draft Heineken. Only issue, is the combo shower toilet is IN the room. Which is fine for a single. But not so much on a date. Also, there is no fan in the bathroom area. Yaaaa. They held our luggage after checking out so we could explore a while longer. Thank you. Expect a while to get your car back from valet. Maybe that’s normal. We’re new in the big city. I would stay again and recommend.

We regularly stay at Arlo SoHo because the rooms are immaculate, the location is great and the front desk staff will go out of their way to make your stay memorable. Amaris, the Assistant Front Office Manager has been particularly helpful. We highly recommend Arlo for your next visit to NYC!!

Arlo SoHo is the spot! This hotel is in an excellent location close to many different areas. The staff was super friendly and went above and beyond to make sure we had the best stay. Every question we had they helped us and even went out of their way to accommodate our needs to help us find our way around town. The rooms were super clean and the hotel has THE cutest areas to sit, chill, check your email, hang out, drink coffee, grab a drink or some candy, and have a fun time. The rooftop bar is the spot and the view at sunset is gorgeous. I felt super safe and would stay here again and again!

The hotel is just great! Nice room (small but nice), great restaurant, nice reception, great staff, bikes available.I just found the location a bit odd - right beside the Holland tunnel entrance, with an insane traffic!There are not a lot of restaurants and markets in the surrounds.I would consider staying again if they have good price.

First time at Arlo Soho. Super friendly staff was more than accommodating and responsive. Convenience to the subway was great, less than 2 blocks away. I traveled with a friend and we stayed in a bunk room. It was tight so we traveled light. It was great to have the TV's attached to each bunk. The sink is in the room with a separate area for shower and toilet. The hotel was clean and fun. If the room leaves you feeling claustrophobic, there are so many spots to hangout in the building. A short walk to the West Village and everything cool about SOHO. The biggest drawback is not hotel related but be forewarned the hotel is near the entrance of the Holland Tunnel which creates traffic we only see in Boston when there is a car accident. It is gridlocked and I am not sure how people do that everyday. Keep this in mind if you decide to UBER or Taxi. Not worth it! Use the subway or walk.

Arlo SoHo is centrally located in NYC with and amazing lower level lobby and sitting area. Close to the shopping district. The staff super friendly and helpful. The roof top bar and restaurant was a great place to chill and have a drink. My room was very small thank god i was alone because 2 people in the room would have been insane claustrophobic. But that’s NYC. ALL IN ALL the Arlo a hip cool and great hotel to stay in. Definitely pleased.

great place if you just need a basic hotel room. The draw is Super cool bar and lobby area with the garden including a vollwagon and sunrooms! Harold’s the hotel restaurant has the best devil eggs on have every had - i will need to add then to my list of the must haves when in NYC.
user_name:
Decade4LivingLife
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: This has more than everything we're looking for in a hotel! The location is very convenient, the staff was very helpful and friendly, and the amenities were fantastic. It was so comfortable that there were times that I did not want to leave the hotel and explore the city.

For starters, when paying extra to book a king room with city views, one doesn’t expect to be placed in a room on the 5th floor, with views of the street/construction. It’s a little misleading, because there’s nowhere on the website that accommodates specific wants. Other than that, the room looked pretty much like what we expected. However, they could do a better job at keeping the rooms clean, considering the size. We found a thick layer of dust in multiple locations around the room. Also, my partner and I have stayed at micro hotel rooms in the city before, and we both felt that the lack of toilet privacy at Arlo was slightly embarrassing at times. On Saturday we left the room at around 11am, and arrived back at the hotel roughly around 6pm. By the time we got back, the room service still had not cleaned the room. Which wasn’t a huge deal, but when we tried to call room service for more towels and toilet paper, even the phone didn’t work. So we had to go down to guest service to ask. One more thing that was disappointing was the rooftop bar. We were really excited to spend some time up there, but the hotel allowsso many people who are not guests to go up, and there is barely enough room to mingle, yet alone find a seat. I understand that it’s also a business for outsiders, but we felt that hotel guests should have more priority there. The hotel might want to consider only allowing a certain capacity of outside guests separately from the people with room cards if it is that busy. We did enjoy certain things about Arlo Soho. But overall, I don’t know that those would be enough to recommend or come here for another stay.

Stayed at Arlo SoHo while on business in New York. Really liked the small well-designed modern room I had and overall, I had an enjoyable stay there.The Arlo SoHo is on the west side, close to the Hudson tunnel. It is a new modern hotel that has gone for a style and vibe that attracts the younger crowd. The room I had was very compact but nicely designed. The bed was large and comfortable, right up by the window and built into the room itself. That meant drapes had to be powered, but they still worked very well. The shower and toilet area was fine. The desk was very small but worked okay. Also, there was no cupboard for clothes, so they hung in the open and it would not have been easy to store a large suitcase. Nonetheless, overall, I had a very comfortable stay in the room.The hotel staff were overall friendly and helpful. Got an early check-in, which is much appreciated. The happy hour and breakfast were quite good, even if rather busy.The location is convenient for business in the south of Manhattan and is very convenient for access to and from Newark airport.The atmosphere is hip and cool, leading to most of the guests being of the younger generations.Had a very comfortable stay and would be happy finding myself staying there again.

Arlo Soho made my stay in NYC one of the most pleasant. Not only is the hotel’s atmosphere and interior relaxed and cosy, everything is done to make you feel at home. Rare enough for a hotel to be mentioned. The team is extremely friendly and caring with all customers. Last but not least, the hotel restaurant Harold’s serves excellent, fresh and home made cuisine. There is something special about this place.... I recommend it 200%.

I was in NYC with my girlfriend for a business trip.The staff was exceptionally friendly, the hotel is beautifully designed and decorated. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The layout of the rooms is a bit cramped, with the washbasin inside the room, not in the bathroom. There weren't any cupboards or enough space for the suitcases of two people, making it a bit difficult to navigate the room. The AC was exceptionally loud and would turn off and on randomly and the room we had was high up but street facing, and in a city like NYC, loud enough to wake you up if you leave the window open cos of the AC issues. The common areas are quite well designed but blocked for private events too often, making it harder to enjoy them.The breakfast included was of a very high quality. They had bikes which are in great condition and we used them to explore the city and go to meetings.All in all, I would recommend staying here. Would be more comfortable for 1 person, but manageable for two.

We reserved several rooms for a Friday night wedding in nearby TriBecca. Great location for just a short walk across Canal st to the venue. Front desk took several minutes to get our rooms ready on late Friday afternoon. Parking very difficult if you have a larger vehicle. Rooms very small but clean and comfortable. Roof top bar very busy but quite expensive for just drinks. Nice little coffee bar in the lobby entrance as we left the next morning.

We loved our weekend at Arlo Soho On Hudsen!The staff was welcoming and helpful, especially Isabella!, and the interiors matched the chic vibe I was hoping for. The common spaces on the main floor were easy to hang out in, our room was small but well designed, essential, and they even had a GOT viewing party. Highly recommend. Five Stars.

We've stayed 3x at Arlo Soho. Everything about it and the staff that work there provide an amazing vibe and experience. Love the free bikes, and use them to really access and experience NYC! The staff go out of their way to make everything about our stay just work. Pretty much any time we go to NYC we will stay here.

The location is ideal to get around NYC, just few minutes walk to Subway, the staff are very helpful and happy to assist, some rooms may be a bit small, but as we only spent late evenings is was not a issue, the rooftop bar is buzzing and good view of city.

We couldn't have asked for a better first experience in NYC. Arlo SoHo was close to transit, had the friendliest staff, was clean and relatively affordable. Not to mention, an INCREDIBLE smelling lobby and FREE happy hour from 5:30-7pm. Wouldn't have changed a thing.

I was impressed from the moment I walked in. The staff is courteous and extremely attentive and helpful. The lobby bar, the library, the courtyard, and various common areas are all beautifully designed with a sleek modern look that's also welcoming and comforting. The food at Harold's is amazing as well as the service, the ladies work very hard with a smile.
user_name:
Womanofpurpse
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I stayed 6 days and the experience was fantastic. On the day of my checkout, my outgoing flight was cancelled. I returned at a late hour to try to find a place to sleep and I was turned away to the street, as if I never existed as a guest. I would not recommend this establishment. Others are available to accommodate.

Thanks to Isabella Bue I was able to check in early and attend to business without being burdened by suitcases or having to check in at a later time. She also sent me up with a free hotel bike I used to take some incredible pics from the Brooklyn Promenade. The rest of the staff was also excellent. Highly recommend this hotel!

It had been 20 years since I'd been to NYC. I don't know why I waited so long. What an amazing city, and Arlo Soho was the perfect place to stay -- clean, friendly, hip. There are so many decisions to make while in NYC -- no need to wonder which hotel you should book. This is what you're looking for.

Beautiful hotel - does anyone know where I can the lovely scent that was in the lobby??? I would love to purchase it. The hotel was very accommodating and we loved the roof. Great location in soho NYC

I was given a room with bunk beds, which was odd, but apparently the least expensive type of room. It didn't bother me, I enjoyed watching TV in my bottom bunk. The view was nice and I thoroughly enjoyed the daily digital detox. Super friendly staff.

I knew to expect a much smaller room than I ususally experience when staying in a hotel. Rooom was small, yet well appointed-no wasted space. Lobby, restaurant and rooftop bar all great-friendly staff.

This was my third stay at the Arlo and it is becoming my go-to in lower Manhattan. Stylish, friendly, with a comfortable restaurant in house. The rooms are small but beautifully designed. If you have lots of luggage or want to do interpretive dance in your room this is not the place for you, but otherwise recommended.

The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and the decor is so hip. The rooftop deck has a cool atmosphere although it could have had a bit more cover for shade. The rooms may be a bit small for some people. It was fine for us, and it was clean and comfortable. We were there to have fun and experience the city so the room size was a non-issue. Great location and close to the subway.We would definitely stay here again!

My wife and I had a great weekend stay at the Arlo. Only criticism was it was tough getting through on Canal street during rush hour, however the stay at the hotel itself was excellent. Check in was a breeze. We got the special Rose room rate with a bottle of wine included. The room itself is as advertised, small but clean and quiet. Shower stall was great with great water pressure. We initially had a problem with TV reception which was quickly addressed by maintenance. Though the room may be cozy, there is plenty of room to lounge on the ground floor, a bar, a seating area, a courtyard with a couple of greenhouse covered picnic tables around a vintage VW bug and a large indoor table to do work and to watch TV. The bar on the first floor served great apps and drinks and the happy hour with free wine and beer was much appreciated. WiFi worked well. The roof top bar is also as advertised- great view of the Hudson and NJ. It fills up quickly so if you have a larger party would call as early as you can to get reservations. We borrowed the complimentary bicycles one day and took a ride up the Hudson river park and really had a great excursion. SOHO, Little Italy and the Village are only a few blocks away with their attendant restaurants and boutiques. Overall a fantastic stay at the Arlo and we will definitely stay again when we're in the City again.

I’ve literally just left the Arlo and am sad to leave my home from home. The staff are absolutely charming and do everything they can to help you in any situation. Recommending great places to eat and handy shortcuts around New York. Location wise I found I was with walking distance of pretty much everything I wanted. If you don’t want to walk the subway is minutes away. The bed was incredibly comfy and the room spotless. They have multiple accessible rooms, which even though I don’t need is great to see.The lobby is a hive of activity with people remote working. Welcome drinks on the rooftop are not to be missed. The sunset from there is beautiful.

I LOVED my stay here. From the minute I walked in the door, I was made to feel comfortable and welcome. The staff are quite simply amazing, and the atmosphere of the place is professional, yet relaxed. Nothing is too much trouble, and there’s is a lot on offer.. I will definitely be back! Very highly recommended.

The Arlo was a superb hotel, but moreover the experience the hotel and management provided ushered in a PERFECT NYC weekend. The hotel: The beds were SO fluffy and the pillows were clouds. The rooms are very small, but all that you need for a weekend out&about in the city. We enjoyed streaming our laptops on the TV too. The staff-- SO kind and attentive. They hooked it up with bikes and citibike passes. We enjoyed their coffee and rooftop bar. The location is right next to the water so we biked all along the Hudson. It was PERFECT.

Really loved the hotel - great public space and vibe. Upon learning it was our wedding anniversary, front desk employee offered us breakfast following day. Happy hour was an unexpected plus. Bikes available but we didn't take advantage.

I really enjoyed my stay! Chris-Ann was so kind and well informed.The hotel rooms are small but immaculate. The aesthetics of the hotel itself are fun and comfy and pleasing to the eye. Go to rooftop!

Cool Hotel - best suited if you were born after 1995.The rooms were unique - one side is a picture window outside. No problem for my wife and I but for those who dont deal with small places or are less mobile - forget it.The location is a little empty in the evening - traffic busy though as it is at the entrace to the Holland Tunnel. Some cabs couldn't find it. That said it is a cool place -

Was pleasantly surprise at how wonderful this hotel was compared to several others, in the same area, for the same price. I will definitely recommend it to all my friends visiting NYC and of course stay there again when I return!!! Highly recommend!!!!

Bed was great, rooms are NYC shoe box but very efficient and did not need more. Staff was friendly. Location was great and hotel is beautiful. A little pricey but it is NYC after all. I recommend it highly!

It’s a nice hotel. Well priced for New York’s standard. Clean and modern with good customer service. The only let down was that our room 307 had a very loud AC which turns on and off all the time. Had a terrible first night sleep using my noise cancelling earphones to drown out the noise. After requesting to change rooms the next day, everything was back to normal but given that it was our first night stay in New York after a long 19hrs flight. It could be much better.

After a long ride to NYC in friday traffic - we arrived to checkin for our 6 rooms (big family wedding). We had a large van which we asked to valet park. I was rudely told that they could not accommodate the van but needed to see all IDs and credit cards for the rooms. I asked about another parking option but the front desk clerk (who rudely pushed the nice trainee out of the way) insisted upon seeing IDs. Husband still stuck in the van trying to cope with the traffic jam while we walked ahead. Staff just didn't seem to care about our issue. Other staff member checked other 3 family members in without seeing all IDs. 2 towels in the room - for 2 people really ? (oh and a full size bed not queen as advertised) After a night with inoperative AC (in July) and some inoperative AC outlets I checked out and informed the staff. No one seemed to really care but would I like to put my $53 bar tab (for 3 drinks) from the rooftop bar on my credit card. Really? Perhaps a complimentary coffee or something...... Nope.

We arrived after some travel complications! John at the front desk was so helpful and understanding! He helped us relax and get back to enjoying our trip! He single handily saved our trip! Cannot say enough good things!

My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights to celebrate her birthday. Every part of experience at the hotel was top notch. The staff were always so professional but warm and friendly. I really felt they went out of their way to be helpful in every way. The bikes were great! Went to DUMBO for a morning ride which was easy and fun. Breakfast sandwiches at the coffee bar were delicious and an easy breakfast to grab before a busy day each morning. Loved the happy hour at the end of the day too! Can’t say enough about our stay.

Very modern and stylish hotel without the pretentiousness.Very friendly and helpful staff.Large and very comfortable beds.Lovely rooftop bar with good vibes and great views.Great downtown location especially for TriBeCa and Soho.

ARLO SOHO is a micro room hotel. If you are used to space and luxury extras you will be disappointed. The room is small but efficient. Like living on a boat. On the plus side, it is close to subway stops and the wonderful Hudson River Park. Walking distance to a lot of eateries and different neighborhoods besides SOHO. Great king sized bed, LG TV, Free WIFI, nice rain shower.

We stayed in room #826 from Saturday through Monday on the first week of July. The hotel is BEAUTIFUL and fun and chic and full of amenities. The front staff is amazing, very friendly, always available and proactive. The room is small but nothing deceiving from the pictures, bed was comfy and you there's everything you could need from a mini fridge to shampoo to steam iron. The window was super wide and we had a nice view of the courtyard and a bit of the city, even when the window is closed you can hear a tad noice from outside, at first I was scared cause i'm a very sensitive sleeper, but slept like a baby! The rooftop lounge was INCREDIBLE, we had out happy hour there on both nights, the view is great. The area is very walkable but the hotel is more like union square than soho. You are 2 blocks from the "real" soho but it was all great! Maybe next time we will try their NoMad location, but going back to this hotel for sure. Price was very reasonable and we felt in a true quality and throughout hotel.

We just returned from a quick weekend getaway in NYC.We decided to stay at the arlo soho and at the end of an amazing weekend we were delighted by our decision. The staff were friendly helpful always quick with a smile and a recommendation. Everyone was young and what to be of service. From front desk to bartenders and servers in the roof top patio. We took advantage of the amazing rooftop patio for drinks after a long day spent exploring the city. And a quick night cap at the end of our evening. Happy hour was a pleasant surprise!! The hotel bikes were an added bonus. The location can not be beat. The rooms are on the small side but tastefully decorated very efficient and spotless clean. We would be happy to stay at the arlo soho again and thrilled to recommend.

I absolutely loved the location on a not so crazy street for pick up and drop off. The rooms are just enough space and the bed was so comfortable. Loved all of the options in the lobby for food and beverage as well as space to sit and socialize or get work done.

Great big bed, room big enough. Few things in room like large TV, fridge, hairdryer and iron. Could do with kettle though. Friendly staff on reception. Good rooftop bar. But 1st floor bar thought barman only wanted to talk to fellow Americans and felt ignored.

To come to NYC for an event where the city is sure to busy customer service can sometimes suffer. This was not the case at Arlo Soho. The staff was the best at any hotel hands down. I travel frequently and have been everywhere in this country. My trip was made that much more enjoyable from the service and welcome I received. It was like I was visiting my family.

We stayed in the Arlo for 9 nights.After a shakey start with difficulty in finding our reservation we made through Booking.com into their own system, the staff managed to find our details, collected our luggage for storage as we were early to check in, and gave us good tips to walk round the area. Later on, when we returned to complete check in, we experienced the same issues as earlier with our reservation, though we were explained that there was a system problem, and finally the manager on duty managed checked us in (I cannot recall her name, very professional and helpful). We were also offered offered complimentary cocktails (6 vouchers) on the rooftop as a form of apology.This hotel is really charming however rooms are on the small size, especially to store luggage as rooms have generally no closet. On day two we asked to be changed to a different room and that worked for us as it had slightly better storage space under the bed (drawers-enclosed shelving). Perhaps for a long stay like us this was not ideal, however, we had so many plus to this stay, that eventually it did not matter: our rate included breakfast, which was really good, and we had it every morning and quality and consistency was always met. The hotel staff were all very friendly and accommodating to any request we had. On the plus side, the hotel also run a free Happy Hour between 5.30-7.00 which was a very nice way of starting your evening before going out for dinner, and the rooftop had a very nice bar, and cocktails we consumed were very nice.Special mentions to the Housekeeping team, as room was always nicely cleaned - all the restaurant/bar staff as very attentive and courteous.As for front of house team, the manager on duty aforementioned at checkin time, Chad (not too much trouble for him to change our room on day 2 - and he made our stay!), Isabella and Moises with their recommendations on were to go but most importantly being able to show a genuine interest in our stay and experience of the hotel and NYC - they were all in their own way and times we interacted with them really providing top service.Last but not least, the hotel is in SoHo, and we found the area really charming and with character, well connected to nice streets for food and walking, close to the river, good links to other parts of NYC.

I knew I wanted to stay in the SoHo area. I randomly chose this hotel not knowing what to expect. It truly exceeded our expectations! The hotel location is money! The hotel is adorable. Rooftop bar is so pretty and popping. Looooved Arlo SoHo! Whenever I do return to NYC, I will be staying here again for SURE! Service and employee's are super kind and nice. Loved every minute here! Thank You Arlo! We shall meet again. And the best part, my sister was so happy. Her 1st time in NYC, Arlo made it super special for her Birthday! xoxo!

In general, we loved Arlo Soho. From the minute you walk in, the ‘hotel signature scent’ welcomes you in. The vibe is cool, buzzy and you just want to be part of it.We struggled with an incorrect booking meaning a bunk bed for the first night and none of the TVs / phones worked in any of our rooms (tut tut)The rooms are small so as long as you know that before you book, it’s fine and the bed is really comfy. Breakfast was fab, evening meals and having out in the lounge areas was brilliant. The coworking space is a great place to catch up on emails and the roof top bar, was cool and easy to pop upstairs and hang out. Fix some of the room stuff guys and we’ll deffo be back!!

From the moment we got to Arlo Soo, Xena was incredible and very accommodating! She held out bags in the lobby while we went to explore the whole city with the free bikes they provide! Every time we needed something someone would immediately help us out! The rooftop bar upstairs was one of the highlights of the hotel. It has an amazing view and we literally made friends every time we hang out up there, usually 6 to 8pm to watch the subset!We we were leaving Chris- Ann was super nice and the check out process was seamless. Great staff in general and i definitely will be staying here again when I come back to NYC !!!:)

Our visit was lovely. It started with a warm welcoming smile from Chriss-Ann. She was super sweet and accommodating. We had lunch at Harold's where Ed the manager, server Kar and Maria took excellent care of us. Yana and Nabel behind the bar are amazing mixologists. Highly recommend spending some time in their care. Lastly the rooftop bar is a must. Kelly and Katie are fantastic. They provided excellent and memorable service. Would highly recommend Arlo Soho. Great location and vibes.Last but not least Big shout out to Gary congrats on your well runned and oiled machine.

Arrived at the hotel to a lovely team of check in staff and the most amazing smell! We booked a twin room and were told that we had been given a free upgrade to a room that had a terrace with some sun loungers (shame we never got to use them because of the rain). I would recommend making use of the free wine hour in the bar every afternoon - such a nice touch!

With my niece, I stayed 6 days in the Arlo Soho Hotel and enjoyed it so much (once we got used to the small room (however it is made extremely well use of the space).
