We stayed in bunk beds, which I consider very well for non-couples, as each one has bit of privacy. Some space to store our clothes would be been great, but everything else was fine. The atmosphere in the Hotel, the Lounge area, garden, rooftop and the restaurant is just great and is is wonderful to spend some time to relax in between sightseeing. Also the bicycles are a real treat! And the location, close to Hudson river, to 2 Metro stations and bus stations is perfect. I can only recommend the Hotel.

Close to a couple of subway stations, this very modern hotel was a fun change. Rooms are very small, but the common areas make up for it. This would be a great place for any business trip. I would need a larger place to stay if I brought family to NY.

They think of everything - no small detail is overlooked to make your stay truly exceptional. The rooms are clean, simple and comfortable. The restaurant selections delicious and the overall property ambiance modern, chic and accessible to all things that NYC offers.

... but design, comfort and functionality does. And the staff matters a lot, too. In our one night experience, the design, comfort and functionality of our stay was not good, but the staff were all fantastic.We booked a one-night stay through Tablet, which provided us an upgrade from a Queen room to a King room, plus late check-out. We called ahead to tell them we'd be arriving late and got there probably around 10:30 p.m. We knew our room would be small and in fact have stayed at a number of NYC hotels where the rooms were tiny but were still comfortable, so size didn't concern us. Unfortunately, there were so many things wrong with our room that it was not a comfortable stay. Some of the issues were design-related and some were maintenance-related. Here is a list:-- When we opened the door an immediate musty smell hit us. It wasn't exactly a moldy or mildewy odor (or we would have walked right out) but it was just sort of humid and not fresh smelling. We turned up the a/c and the a/c fan and hoped it would get better while we unpacked. The toilet and shower is glass-enclosed and part of the actual room space, so we also figured that might have something to do with the musty odor, plus it was almost 11 p.m. and we were tired and didn't want to go back downstairs. We tried opening a window but the traffic noise from the Holland Tunnel made it impossible to keep the window open.-- The king bed was up on a wooden platform with a drawer and a shelf underneath and kind of "built into" the space so that the end of the bed was touching the wooden "wall" where the TV was mounted and one side of the bed was up against the windows. When I say "up against" I mean that there literally was no space between the side of the bed and the window so that my hubby sleeping on that side literally had to crawl over me to get down to go to the bathroom. -- The huge TV mounted on the wooden wall of the "cabinet" we were to sleep in did not work. It just showed channel listings for each channel and a black screen, no matter what channel we chose. I called to report this/get it fixed and the phone reception to the staff member answering was such that you could hear only every other word. The staff member acknowledged this and apologized as she had the problem too. She promised to send someone up to fix the TV. We waited for about a half hour and then just decided to forget it as we wanted to go to sleep, so my hubby called down and canceled the service call.-- There was another unusual and not happy aspect to the bed. It seems that the mattress was about six inches too short for the wooden platform/cabinet it lives in, so there were two long triangular wedges placed in the six-inch space between the head of the mattress and the wooden wall of the cabinet, underneath our bed pillows. The wedges were covered in a tweedy fabric you might find on upholstery. Not only did this put the pillows at an uncomfortable angle for me but frankly I found this unsanitary as I only wondered whether they change the tweedy fabric covering the wedges for every guest? So I made sure not to turn my bed pillows over when sleeping. I have never seen this anywhere, period. There has to be a better way to deal with this, at the very least put the wedges at the foot of the mattress maybe, but it was an icky detail for me. -- In the morning the musty smell was finally gone. I went to take a shower in the glassed-in enclosure and tried to put the shower curtain up -- it is a nylon sheet with buttonholes that are supposed to go over metal pegs to hold it up, but the buttonhole that was supposed to go over the peg in order to keep the curtain up was too big and I was unable to attach it -- it kept just falling off. So that meant my little shower resulted in water all over the floor of the toilet area, even onto the floor near the front door. Also, the drain in the shower was slow and the ledge to keep water in wasn't that high, so that could have also contributed to me mopping up water all over the floor after my shower. Thank goodness hubby showered at the club after his spin class!So there were a lot of problems. I do have to say that the room looked very clean (in spite of the musty smell), thankfully. I would have given this experience one or two stars if it wasn't for the fact that the staff members were all just wonderful! Everyone, from the front desk person to the guy who sold us our beverages at their "bodega" to the woman who answered my phone call about the TV were all really engaged, friendly, and service-oriented. While I went to a handbag sale to meet up with a friend, my hubby ended up talking to the operations manager about our experience and he found that manager very responsive and listened well with concern, reflecting back what he had heard my hubby tell him (there must be some great service training here). The operations manager gave us a refund for 50% of our stay and hotel charges, which was very much appreciated given our experience.We stay at a lot of NYC hotels for little "staycations" here and there, and I'm not sure if I would want to give this place another try. If their rooms were as great as their staff I wouldn't hesitate to return.

I love this hotel. Everyone is so friendly and smiling from front desk staff all way to hotel maintenance staff. This the first hotel in New York whereI experience the maintenance staff was always smiling and greeting all the guest. The rooftop was amazing. Definitely will be back soon.

A DelightWe checked in at around 6pm after a nightmare, delayed flight. The check-in was efficient, and the receptionist was nothing but super friendly and accommodating she made us forget about the transportation bad experience. The front desk staff were excellent, helping us out at every turn. The room was well appointed and exceptionally comfortable. I compliment Arlo hotel and all the staff we had the pleasure to interact with including the management team.Thank you for making our stay so memorable

The hotel has great vibes. We just came back from a stay in New York. The staff was very helpful, They took the time to assist us all the time. We never felt rushed to leave the front desk. They took their time to explain to us how to get around and where to go. We also enjoyed the plants at flower jungle. Make sure to check out the activities they have for the season. It's a very interactive place. Highly recommended.
user_name:
Alisonkinsamy
New York City, New York

review_body: I have visit Arlo Hotel several times great hotel clean great personal I would visit again rooms are clean everyone is accommodating love the place court yard very nice with many spring flower room clean love special events people friend

The hotel is new, clean, offers good amenities in the room. The room is small, but comfortable. The bikes availabe for guests is a good and very welcomed Idea. Nice location, close to subway stations and at a walking distance from some of the most interesting attractions, such as One World Observatory. On the obter hand, I think the prices should be adjusted, they are a little higher than what I expect for an hotel like this.

We had a wonderful time at the Arlo Soho! The staff was super fantastic and the location was fabulous. Be ready for a small space but very well appointed. The entire property smells delicious. All dining options are wonderful. Just a great stay!

I had a wonderful stay at the Arlo Soho. From the moment I entered the lobby, I felt at home. This is a very modern hotel, and the rooms are quaint with excellent views of the city. The staff is very welcoming and hospitable, and are always willing to lend a helping hand. Can’t wait to go back!!!

The friendliest and most helpful staff. Was expecting to be hoity-toity and hipster but instead found the nicest, coolest hotel in Soho. Clean small rooms, prompt service, awesome amenities and fun location separated from too much craziness in the city

The hotel is beautifully designed. The staff is amazing and super-friendly. The food at Harold's is excellent. The location is prime — close to the Hudson River, not from from Whitney Museum of American Art, well-situated for any jaunts you might want to take from Battery Park, and steps away from many subway stations that give you access to the rest of the city. The rooftop bar is lots of fun. If you prefer something more low key, there are plenty of common spaces throughout the first and second floor. I’ve stayed here about a half-dozen times and it has never disappointed me. I look forward to my next stay!The hotel is located near the access to the Holland Tunnel so, periodically, there can be a lot of honking. If you don't mind hearing the city as you sleep — something you can get used to it — it’s quiet enough, but I have friends who found it noisy.

I had just moved to NYC and was staying in the Arlo before I moved into an airbnb. The whole staff was amazing in accommodating me and working with me, especially Joe. He made sure that I had to deal with as little stress as possible and allowed me to keep extending my room on short notice. He was extremely nice and made moving here way less stressful than it could have been. Had it not been for him, I would had to keep moving around. The Arlo is amazing and a very relaxing place to go after a long day of work or travel. I highly recommend this place! It has a special place in my heart now!

It was my first time in New York City. The staff at the hotel was extremely helpful with any information I needed for my stay in NYC. The room was quaint and upscale. Loved that they provided 2 bottles of water upon check in and the daily happy hour was a nice touch. Great area to explore on foot and subway station was very close. Thank you to the waitress at the rooftop bar for all of your recommendations for NYC, very helpful.

The staff is very welcoming and helping. The hotel is very well located so you can easyly get to SoHo, meatpacking, chelsea.The hotel offer the possibility to borrow bikes for free.It was a real pleasure to stay at Arlo SoHo.

We stayer for one week in the Arlo Soho Hotel in Nee York and the hotel was even better than we thought. Nice and clean room and bathroom. Very kind and helpfull personel in the restaurants and at the lobby. A hotel you must visit even you want to stay in Downtown Manhattan

I am thrilled with both hotel, staff, and location. Right in the heart of SoHo where everything is within walking distance. The room is small-ish, but well designed, comfortable, and spotless and clean. I slept like a baby! Super comfy and pretty lounge to hang out in. The best part? The awesome staff that are helpful and friendly, and will go above and beyond to help you and make your stay even better. My man Moses totally saved my last day in New York by fixing stuff and helping me out. You could tell he does it out of a desire to help, not just because he is paid to help. He’s the real deal. Thank you, Moses! Also thank you to Isabella for helpful and friendly service. I highly recommend Arlo SoHo.

Being back again at the Arlo hotel feels like home away from home. Starting with their house perfume which you already smell outside. Perfect location in Summer when it’s a short walk or bicycle ride to the Hudson River with the Grand Banks as one of my favorites.

Everything was fantastic at this property and credit to the Arlo hotel management. The staff is amazing, super friendly & personable especially Gabriel. The rooms are a bit small but the cleanliness and design make up for the size. The hotel offers complementary beer & wine to hotel guests daily from 5:30-7:00 pm. The restaurant Harold’s is fantastic & Dylans candy shop is very cool especially for the late night munchies. The rooftop is perfect with views of the city and fresh breeze off the river while enjoying tasty bites and great drinks. (Try the Arlo Margarita)The location is superb and super close to all the main attractions and conveniently located near the Holland tunnel.

If you are looking for a comfortable air-conditioned hotel, this is NOT the place for you. The air conditioning was automatically programmed to switch to fan mode after about 20 min, and will not turn back on to cooling mode unless you manually shut of the system, wait, and turn it on again. We called the front desk to complain after we woke up the next morning in a sweat because our room was over 80 degrees. A kind bldg. engineer came up to "fix" it, but after it only worked temporarily again, we asked the front desk if it was programmed to turn off after a while and he confirmed. He said something to the effect of "since there are so many rooms in the building it's not possible to have the air conditioning running all the time." As a licensed architect with 12 years experience, I can confidently say that the system capability is only limited by the hotel management who is making money off the literal sweat of its guests in the name of being environmentally friendly. For the amount of money we paid to stay at a "luxury" hotel which clearly states that the rooms are air conditioned, we felt like we had been scammed. Instead of looking forward to coming back to a comfortable room, we dreaded having to endure the steaming hot room in the middle of the NYC summer.

I live in Crown Heights Brooklyn. I’m an artist and needed new headshots. So I booked my photographer and booked a room at the arlo. I knew the location has beautiful lighting and backgrounds. Perfect location for the several looks I wanted to portray. I got a fantastic nights sleep so I was well rested and fresh for the shoot and I got a delicious healthy breakfast at Harold’s to fuel my session. Staff was welcoming and helpful. Room was super clean quiet and comfy. Bed was like sleeping on a cloud!!! I absolutely love the Arlo Soho. It’s my favourite staycaytion location in NYC

I was gobsmacked by the love and energy felt upon arrival. it starts with the check-i and this team is stellar. every detail of my stay was impeccable. Carlo staff are in it to win it!rami, joe to say a few have the special touch and completely work at an ease not usually felt in big cities. will only stay ay this hotel for the coming future trips.Heidi

We really enjoyed the four nights we stayed at Arlo Soho. The hotel is great, clean modern rooms with everything you need (deposit, big window with good blinds, quiet, comfortable bed). Stayed in room 316.Location is perfect in beautiful SoHo, walking distance to Prince/Sprint street with great food and atmosphere. Close to the metro on Canal street. Free bikes to rent. On the first floor they have managed to create an inviting and modern atmosphere with several rooms attached to each other. We really enjoyed the happy hour from 5:30-7 every day when free beer and wine was served. A great way to gather a lot of guests and make the hotel come alive. One night we tried the rooftop bar and enjoyed it. It was very busy but the drinks were great We used the hotel to book a shuttle to Newark which worked great, 98 USD.

Utterly spectacular holiday spent at Arlo Soho, the amenities were fabulous, the room was great. I was in a king room and the gym next door was super noisy from 6am so requested a move as was getting in late myself most nights. The staff including Katya couldn’t have been more helpful in moving me. The ambience, the cocktails and buzz of the place made this a trip to remember. Highly recommend!

We loved our stay at Arlo Soho! Clean room with a pretty view. Loved the digital detox happy hour (free drinks). Cute restaurant attached. Amazing service! An overall great experience, we’ll definitely be back!

We couldn't be happier with the quality, value, and efficiency of the Arlo Soho in NYC. We booked the reservation on their easy to use website and the rest was as easy as it gets for us. While the room size was typical of most in the city, the city view from our room was fantastic and everything was very efficiently designed to maximize space. The common spaces are excellent, including the cosy 'Arlo Blooms' outside 'green space', which was a perfect place to enjoy a cocktail and relax for our Summer stay. Service was courteous, efficient, and the entire experience was setup very nicely for the modern traveler (including the hotel's app which added a nice compliment for tech savvy travelers). Front desk was very accommodating to us regarding a few special requests during our stay, as well. Great location with easy access to taxis, Uber, and any public transport. Highly recommended and we will certainly be utilizing the Arlo Soho during our next stay in the city.

The Arlo Soho is one of those new, tiny room, hip hotels popping up in Manhattan. First the pros: The staff was friendly and helpful, the common spaces were roomy and inviting, the rooftop gave a nice view of lower Manhattan. They pride themselves on good wifi and plenty of space to connect and enjoy. The room itself was small of course (see pic), but well laid out, spotless, comfy bed, well lit, small fridge, good temp control. Cons: The bathroom consists of a toilet and shower in a frosted shower enclosure, sink is in main room. If you are traveling with friends, be comfortable with them being able to see your shadow and hear what's happening inside (see photo of garbage can on toilet). Beware the daily $30 "urban fee", which means those two small bottles of water and rooftop yoga came at a steep price. Make sure to ask what free activities are offered as they are not well advertised. Breakfast is only the pricey buffet. Opposite one side of the hotel is a workout business called The Dogpound, which has pounding bass both in the evenings and early morning. Request a room elsewhere. Nevertheless, the hotel is a good choice for lower Manhattan and a decent value for the price. Lastly, call the hotel, as I got a lower price directly than from the search engines.

I hate to give this great review for I fear I won’t be able to get a room next time or the price will skyrocket, but this place is great. Everyone was so cheerful and helpful (except the bartender during happy hour inside Harold’s who was dismissive and ick) We loved the vibe. The bed was very comfy. The room was teeny as expected but go with someone you love and it’s not a problem. ⭐️ ❤️

I checked out Friday, June 14, there were two ladies and one gentleman. The male was rude and very unprofessional. He rudely ignored me and directed his attention to a lady instead that was in front of a lady on the phone as I stood in front of him. I was never acknowledged. He should never be in the lobby or concierge desk. He was a blond male that was there Friday June 14th at around 10:30/11am. The woman was wonderful and helpful, a true professional at her job. If I do not return it would be due to that individual at the concierge desk. When someone is in front of you, it’s rude to direct your attention elsewhere. Sad, the stay was great until that point, would have been an easy five stars if this individual didn’t ruin it.
user_name:
Sunshine57281623673
New York City, New York

review_body: Room with incredible view, Design hotel perfect for young and fashion addicted... every corner is perfectly curated in design and sound... the inner garden is a real surprise, and ....what about the Roof Top? Amazing. Dont want to leave it!!

Perfect location for exploring the shops, bars and restaurants in SoHo, TriBeCa and West Village. Very trendy hotel, nice lobby area with outdoor garden and lively rooftop bar on the weekends. Great breakfast on offer as well as excellent customer service!Will definitely be back!

The room was definitely smaller than we anticipated, but it is a micro hotel so that is to expected. That being said, the room was very clean and had loads of thoughtful storage. My wife was there for a fashion thing so we normally wouldn’t have travelled with so much luggage so the room would have normally been perfect. Staff was friendly and the food at all the restaurants and bars was amazing! Close to the Canal street subway. We will definitely consider this hotel for future travel!

Superb hotel - super chic, super fun, well located, staff was friendly and informative, check in and check out was very efficient... rooms are small but it’s NY and you get what you pay for so no complaint there... great experience

there were mosquitos in my room because it was so warm and steamy- could not sleep because of the rediculous motion sensor which turned off the air when I went to sleep. The towels were frayed, and the noise from the loud capacitor in the fan coil woke me up. The shampoo dispensor was broken, and it was a rough 3 days.

I stay at this hotel every time I come to the city - never disappoints. Great location...just steps from Soho, with every shop and restaurant you could want. Friendly staff always willing to help or assist in anyway possible. Rooms are compact, yet offer all modern amenities you might need. Amazing rooftop bar with views that can’t be beat. Highly recommend!

Our stay at Arlo Soho could not have been better.The location was just perfect for us since it was a very short walk to the East Village or Greenwich where we spent most of our time. The service was excellent from check in to check out and the concierge staff were very helpful when we had questions about transit or dining options.The room was small but very clean and modern with a great shower.I will definitely stay at Arlo Soho on our next visit to NY.

Incredible service, and made my night super special. To top off a fun night, I was surprised by this set up a gorgerous and comfortable room with rose petals. There was also chocolate and a note to make it more personal!! Amazing. Thank you, Iwona!!!

Even if the room is very small, it is super confortable. The equipment is great but nothing fancy. The pressure of the shower is amazing. It’s very clean. The big disappointment is that is there’s no cupboard so the room was a big mess. We were living out of our suitcases.The rooms are super quiet, so no noise from outside or from the neighbours.However the service is great, the breakfast amazing but a little bit pricey.Very very happy with our 5-days stay.

The Hotel is in a great location, close to subway and nice restaurants. But that is it.If you plan to stay in NY for more than two days this is not the hotel for you.The rooms a very small, if there are two of you and you have a suitcase each you will struggle. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. However room service was very poor. I found that only the females at the front desk were friendly and helpful.

I got aquatinted with Arlo hotel for the first time and found the hotel young, refreshing with great rooms, very comfortable bed, great food and welcoming staff. The hotel has a vibe and a unique atmosphere.All I needed for my two days break in New York.

I travel to New York frequently and booked the ARLO this month to try a new hotel. While the rooms are Arlo are clean and modern, they bring new meaning to the definition of small. Even by NYC standards, these rooms are tiny. I booked a King Courtyard room and was surprised to discover the bed is wedged into a corner and could only be entered from 1 side. There wasn't even space for a laptop, I had to take video calls while sitting in bed. In any case, I was here for business and wasn't spending much time at the hotel apart from sleeping. For that reason, I was surprised to discover a $31 / night "Urban Fee" on my credit card at checkout. I complained to the hotel about this and was met with this response: "The urban fee is our mandatory facility fee. It covers all of amenities in the hotel." The reality is that this fee represents no real value to the guest and is just a poorly veiled strategy to increase ADR. If the fee is mandatory and charged to all guests, then why isn't it a part of your nightly rate? These sneaky tactics alone is enough to keep me from staying here again on future NYC trips. In addition, long lines for the elevators and front desk made it clear that ARLO packs in guests like sardines. I expect more at a place charging $350 + night PLUS fees.

This place is great for everything you’d want, and more in a hotel! Friendly staff and managers, and the location is great. Plenty of space to do work. The rooftop bar is great for drinks and dinner and then party!!! Great crowd

Beds are super comfy and loved the products provided in the bathroom! Staff are super friendly and thanks for all the recommendations!The rooftop has an amazing views. I would definitely come back to arlo when in New York :)

This hotel is fantastic. One of the swaggiest and most unique hotels I have stayed in. Excellent for a weekend get away or short trip! Arlo is also a brand with a shop in the reception area that sells sweets and other products. The roof top bar is also incredibly popular and would recommend going up to it. The staff are also incredibly helpful and nice and a shout out to Gabriel on reception who was super and helped us out a lot during our stay!

The place was very modern, mixed with some lovely greenery. Every view was eye catching and aesthetically pleasing.The staff was outstanding. Smiles everywhere, helpful, attentive, and really going the extra mile to make our stay perfect.The restaurant, Harold’s, had an amazing breakfast buffet. You’d be a fool to not go.Arlo SoHo made it very difficult for me to want to explore the city. I just wanted to explore and hang out at Arlo!

Love this cleverly designed quirky hotel with bright rooms, incredibly friendly and truly helpful staff. Great location for downtown, great in house coffee shop and I must shout out to Moises who was so nice and generous

I have stayed in the past in Arlo Nomad and it was amazing BUT Arlo SoHO was just spectacular. Isabela gave me an early check-in she went out of her way to get me in early, she’s kind and super funny too. The room was small BUT cozy me and my husband looooove it. I had an issue with my bill a rooftop charge when I don’t drink alcohol, but she fix it right away at check-out in less than 2 seconds.Moses store my luggage and was amazing every time I saw him. Would seriously come back not just for their cozy rooms but their staff WOW!!!!!

My assistant booked me here on a day that was between two business trips when I was "at liberty." He had stayed here before. The Arlo was perfect for my limited needs: compact, affordable, well-located to the subway, boasted plenty of open space for work and relaxation, and staffed with super-friendly and helpful people. The cool decor and overall vibe and the bodega are icing on the cake. I missed the cocktail hour, but I noted it favorably. I plan to return on a future trip.

Overall a great stay at Arlo SoHo. The hotel itself is super modern, very cleverly designed and so convenient! Rooms are very small, but comfortable and quite considered with their planning for storage. Shower is a bit annoying with only a curtain to stop water going everywhere and this was probably the biggest nuisance in terms of having to clip it up and the only thing that seemed pretty backwards in terms of functionality.Harolds is great if you don't have the time to venture out, I would skip breakfast (overpriced) but dinners are great for an easy feed in a nice setting. Late night snacks for the jet lagged are handy at the 24/7 candy bar downstairs at reception, great idea! Location is amazing you can walk so quickly to the Hudson river which is amazing, and so many great eateries and shopping spots all within walking distance. I wanted to check out Central Park so borrowed a bike and rode down myself to save on getting a cab! Overall would highly recommend. If its for a couple, prepare for little space between the two of you!

The hotel, location, staff, amenities, room: all great! Although rooms are small (as usual in NYC) they are very cosy and well organized. You feel very comfortable in entire hotel! For sure a must-stay in NYC!

Perfect location near the Holland Tunnel and SOHO.Super clean and efficient rooms-fully remodeled. (small but perfect)Friendly and helpful staff.HAPPY HOUR- need I say more?Reasonable pricesRestaurant on premises and a small items store.Walking distance to everything.

Great spot in soho! Good location, nice small clean rooms. The service is outstanding. The common areas are really nice and fun. Restaurant is good although I like breakfast off the menu, not a buffet.All around a winner. GO!!!

All I can say is, I had a wonderful stay at The Arlo! The staff were fantastic..Moises and David were super friendly and helpful and gave superb service!! The next time I fly to New York, The Arlo would be my first choice :)). Thanks again! Maria

The common areas are fantastic - the hotel is close to the subway;the neighborhood is really cute. This is the perfect hotel for students-rooms are small even by NYC standards. The room feels a lot like a small cruise ship room- no closet, no barrier between the shower and toilet. Staff was super nice but definitely overwhelmed. The check in area as you come through the door is too small to accommodate more than 2 travelers with luggage. (If the registration desk was behind the stairs-in the work table area, it would probably be a better layout.) If you are on a budget, it is definitely your best option. Would stay again if traveling alone

Perfect location for subways, walking through Greenwich Village, LES, Little Italy, Chinatown, SoHo, Cast Iron district, TriBeCa, FiDi, more... The Hotel has a great modern energy, with lots of public spaces to chill, chat, or people watch. The rooms are small, but have everything you need. This is my third trip to ARLO SoHo and it is my favorite hotel in NYC.

I come back here again and again. The Arlo Soho is the perfect NYC hotel. The location is great, the staff is AMAZING and the public rooms and private bedrooms have been designed to think of everything. Our room had a terrace and outdoor shower. Don't miss Movie night, yoga, live music and the rooftop bar. I'll keep coming back

It’s the second time we come in this hotel and we are again very very satisfied : the rooms ( clean and tidy,) the roof top, the restaurant ( sooooo yummy ) , the team ( young and dynamic ) , the bikes that you can borrow.. lots of good reasons to choose this fantastic hotel in Soho !!You will enjoy your time !! Promise

It was a all in all pleasant stay. Location, service, room, restaurant, bar - from check-in to farewell - all worked out perfect. I stayed in various hotels in New York before - this one comes on my FAVORITE list.

Arlo hotel is modern perfection. It was everything we wanted. The shower took a while to heat but once on great pressure and lovely set up. the garment steamer was perfect for this wrinkled traveler. Loved the comp use umbrella. beds were so comfy.

We had a wonderful stay at the Arlo. Lots of welcoming amenities such "digital detox" - a complimentary glass of wine or beer, bikes and complimentary breakfast. Although the room is small it is efficient in its layout, minimal (in a good way!) and very comfortable. The staff was great, and we will definitely return.

Others have written about it previously: The rooms are TINY. In fact, that's okay with me and I knew that before I booked. BUT: My room was literally ON Canal St, the bed was in the window and it feels like traffic goes through the room. Since you're in NYC, there are other places where this may be the case. But I paid $ 400 per night. Plus tax. This is ridiculous. Premium hotels in premium locations during peak days/ weeks can have better cost-benefit-ratios. In a nutshell: Save your money and go elsewhere. Maybe then shower and toilet are more than 2 feet away from your bed and your suitcase doesn't have to go under the the bed to avoid falling over it. My favorite thing about the hotel was the check-in "experience" though: The "gentleman" behind the counter had an alcoholic beverage at hand and greeted me at 11.30pm with the words "you're checking out? how as your stay with us?"No more explanations needed.
user_name:
EzPablo
New York City, New York

review_body: Room was tiny. Shower Curtain didn’t stay up. No privacy anywhere else in the bathroom either. Prioritized Rooftop Bar customers over Hotel Guests. Air turned on and off every 5 minutes with a loud bang and room phone was broken. Staff fixed neither despite requests.

We stayed here 9 days, the hotel is very classy and trendy, the location perfect next to soho and the Hudson River . The beds are VERY confortable and the shower great !!The lobby with the different lounges is perfect for meeting friends to have a drink and the happy hour is appreciated !!We enjoyed the bikes it was a big plus !!The team is very nice especially Antony from the restaurant and Moises !!!Make sure to try the restaurant they have a ribeye to die for and the asparagus is also a delight !!!You can feel the Team is well managed !!!Bravo !!

I stayed here for work in NYC. Didn’t realize the hotel was next to the Holland tunnel. During rush hour it’s nearly impossible to get a taxi or Uber the traffic is insane.This hotel has two popular bars. Expect lots of people and waits for the elevators at night.The rooms are clean and modern but one of the smallest hotel rooms I’ve ever been in. For over $300 per night I won’t return.

OMG. The rooms are freaking tiny. I mean seriously itty bitty. Less than 100 square feet is my guess. The gym across the street blasted rap music starting at 8am. I would not ever choose to return voluntarily. It could be made into a jail with little expense.

nice hotel in a convenient location of soho.... Staff is very friendly and accomodating, especially Moises, who goes out of his way to help you...super guy. Roof top bar is awesome, and very reasonably priced. Great NYC views.

I had recently found out that I had an older sister that was given up for adoption that lives in NYC. I chose the Arlo Soho as a hotel I could stay at for the weekend and meet my sister for the first time. Amazing hotel! The staff was amazing and friendly, the room was so nice. Tiny and clean and although I did not have a skyline view I had a view of the beautiful courtyard. Loved the rooftop patio as well. All and all an amazing experience and I will most definitely be back. Thanks for the hospitality!!

I felt compelled to post a review only after having checked in at the Arlo Soho! My check in process with Chad was excellent and would warrant its own review but what took it to the next level is that my friends accidentally booked at the Nomad property and when I inquired with Chad if we could move their reservation to Soho.. he made it happen! This hotel knows how to create a loyalists with their excellent service, thoughtful and engaging behavior and a culture that makes Arlo Soho feel like a breezy respite from what can be a crazed NYC environment. So thank you Arlo Soho! And also the space is great, rooms and food are terrific and fairly priced. I will stay here every time!

Stayed here for 2 nights on a business trip. The room sort of feels like a cruise ship cabin. Small but well organized. In NYC it’s all you really need because you’re not spending much time in the room. But it has quality where it counts when you are in the room. Comfortable bed, sheets and pillows. Blackout blinds. I couldn’t hear any city noise from the windows or inside the hotel. I love the mid century modern design. The 24 hour food snack bar in the lobby saved me when I was starving at midnight and 5am. They have the most delicious gluten free overnight oats and chia pudding. The courtyard was charming and vibrant decorated with faux flowers and little greenhouses with tables inside. Didn’t get to check out the rooftop because it was raining and I was too busy. The downstairs has plenty of communal hangout space with tables and couches that feels inviting. There’s a water bottle re-fill station in the lobby as well. The service from the staff was great. If you like candy they have a full candy store and lots of cool swag and things to buy. Definitely would stay again.

Arlo impressed me since its website that reflected exactly how the hotel is. It's very clean and beautiful inside. My room had this amazing view of the city and was very cozy. It's very well located and I would certainly come back for another stay!

Excellent hotel with friendly staff and located in a good neighborhood that contains a lot of good restaurants. The hotel staff recommended two restaurants and we went to both, they were excellent! Room was small but practical and pleasant.

You get, what you pay for: Choosing an excellent room with balcony the stay in the hotel will be a pleasure, breakfast is excellent with a lot of fresh fruit, chia, vegetarian like-milk and a good coffee. The restaurant an the lobby have a mice atmosphere and don't miss to spend some in the roof-top-restaurant

I loved everything about Arlo. The aesthetic, staff, activities, restaurant… I will def be back next time I’m in NY. It’s in such a convenient location on canal, right by soho and tribeca. Recommending this place to everyone!

Last month, I stayed at Arlo Soho during a business trip. I was immediately struck by how stylish, cozy and well designed the rooms and common spaces were. In particular, the Arlo Bloom courtyard, rooftop, and workspaces were so warm and inviting. I loved how it easy it was to grab a bit and transition between work and leisure over the course of the weekend. My room was smaller in size but thoughtfully laid out with everything I could need. I woke up feeling like I'd slept in the clouds with the comfy bed and high-up viewpoint! All of the staff members were so welcoming and helpful. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat!

Came to NYC for a graduation. Had my adult son with me. Lots of coordination. Flowers being delivered. Package from Rent the Runway. The staff was terrific - genuinely nice and super helpful. We were in an our for four days straight, eating at odd times and staying up late. Harold's was great. The lobby bar one of the best meals we had all week and it was only snacks. And the Bodega came in handy literally every day. Rooms were great - stylish and great showers. Loved this entire property!

I would give this a hotel a 10 if I could. Everything about it was amazing, the atmosphere, the restaurant, the rooftop bar, the gardens and the staff. We opted for the bunk bed room and while small, it was very comfortable and more than met our needs. Isabella was amazing, wonderful personality, gave us great advice and helped arrange our transportation to the airport. I’ve already recommended this hotel to a few friends that travel to New York often, this hotel is a hidden gem.

The rooms here are not huge but they have everything you need in a very efficient use of space--and most importantly the bed is comfortable. The price is great for the location, just a couple blocks from the heart of SoHo. The staff here is very professional and friendly, and the selection of fruit at the breakfast buffet is great.

This hotel was nice, well located, and we experienced great service. Staff were nice and courteous. Food was delicious and prices aren’t that expensive. With urban fee you get to have many perks including wind hour which was pretty generous. Shout out to the bellman by the name of “Z” if I remember. Such good energy and good service. We will be back! Thank you Arlo Soho.

Arlo SoHo is not only the perfect location to stay in downtown Manhattan, but it’s also a perfect place to stay for business or leisure travels. Perfectly clean they offer a lot of extra services and on top of that all the people working there are super friendly always ready to help you.It was a great experience, I’ll definitely come back to Arlo SoHo on my next trip to NY.

I really enjoyed my stay at arlo soho. The location is great, it’s good value for money and the hotel has great in house facilities (roof top bar, restaurant, garden, candy store and a nice lobby. The rooms where comfortable and cosy some might say a bit on the small side. But as a solo traveler they where perfect. Ask for a room on the western side of the building if you like a quieter room. I would stay here again and at there other locations around the world.

Really enjoyed this hotel. Beautiful modern room. Quiet and relaxing. I stayed while traveling on business so a good nights sleep was welcome. Loved the happy hour and ate dinner at the bar. Wonderful visit.

This hotel looks so nice, from the lobby to the rooftop.The food of the restaurant and the cocktails are nice! We loved riding bikes as well.The only problem is that the room are a bit small with no closet

Great location, great staff, great breakfast. Nice and clean rooms, variety of places to hang out - hang out outdoors on the three different terraces enjoying drinks, or indoor on different floors with perfect options for having work done. It's expensive - but isn't everything in NY? And it's worth the money.

I actually stayed here last summer, but just ran across a note where I had jotted down the names of people who made my stay special: Milaan, Mandi, and Joe! I had SO many positive experiences here. I arrived late on a Friday night with no plans. I wanted to enjoy this part of NYC before my business trip started on Sunday in Brooklyn. I was suddenly transported to an amazing rooftop party! I decided around midnight that I needed dinner, and the staff helped recommend a deli in walking distance. There was a steady downpour.. thankfully there was an umbrella in the hotel room! The hotel room was quaint, but everything was sparkling clean and I had everything I needed. I had a nice view of the interior courtyard. I actually had to laugh at the functionality of the bathroom and shower.. it was so European! I appreciated the updated technology and didn't mind the functional (if sparse) closet space. The next morning, it was raining, so I cancelled my morning plans. I noted that there was a restaurant downstairs if I chose to have breakfast. I really enjoyed all of the communal spaces.. I felt like I was solo, but not alone. I wandered down to the Hudson River and the 9/11 museum.. It was a nice walk but I took an Uber back. I enjoyed the tents, ice cream, and so many other cute features that come with this space! I was so happy with how they came in under compared to other hotels I'd initially considered, but didn't skimp on quality. The vibe of the clientele, whether staying or coming in to party on the rooftop, was very chill. I found all of the staff beyond helpful.I'm so glad I stayed here, and would wholeheartedly recommend it to anyone who is okay with a small room for sleeping and wants to maximize experiences.

Super helpful desk staff. Really easy to get to from outside the city. New facility. Amazingly small rooms (a real shock at first, but not a concern in the end). Close to where I was attending a wedding (a short 2 block WALK!) Great views...

We spent me and my husband 4 wonderful days at Arlo Soho, the staff is amazing , very helpful . And the hotel very edgy and cool, and the location very convenient. It's worth every penny!!!Can't wait to come back.

The Arlo Soho is a terrific boutique style hotel along Hudson Street in Soho. The hotel oozes charm, with a wonderful garden patio, rooftop bar and an inviting common area for work and socializing. The restaurant is also quite good, especially for a hotel. My room was well appointed and the bed comfortable. However, the room was quite small. It was okay for one person, barely, but I think it would be cramped for two.

Regardless of the very chill vibe, great staff, small room but great terrace, the noise level is the problem here. Non -stop traffic noise from vehicles jockeying for position to get into nearby Holland Tunnel till mid-night.A great roof top bar, but not if your room is 2 floors under it & the music noise level goes up as the evening goes on.As guests we are here to sleep believe it or not. Your bed was very comfortable, but it could not be enjoyed due to the noise.

Great hotel in TriBeCa for business travel. Check in was easy. There's a 24 hour bodega in the lobby with snacks and drinks (and a mini Dylan's Candy Bar)! The rooms are well appointed with Blind Barber toiletries, a handy garment steamer, and small desk for working. Free WiFi is a plus. A restaurant downstairs, work and lounging space downstairs and a rooftop bar (and hotel guest happy hour) make this a great hub for business in the area. If my travels take me back to TriBeCa, I'd absolutely stay there again.

Upon arrival, the Arlo has a very cool vibe. Location in Soho is an easy walk downtown and a lot of cool spots in Manhattan. I loved the common spaces in the hotel, such as the roof bar, Harold's, working areas etc. The guest happy hour with free beer/wine is a nice touch as well. However, I can't give this place above a 3 star because of the room. I've stayed in a lot of hotels in NYC, so I know they are going to be on the smaller side. I just wasn't expecting the toilet to basically be in the shower and to be unable to walk around my bed without nailing my shins in the process. Not having a true closet or drawers to unpack for a longer stay was just not comfortable. I also had issues with the temperature in my room. I would return after a long day of meetings and it would be 78 degrees, which is an inferno in a room this tiny. Plus, like others mentioned, I'm not sure I would even be comfortable staying with my spouse; there is zero privacy. I think this hotel is best suited for single leisure travelers who don't plan to be in their room at lot or for a 1 or 2 nights stay tops. It seems to suit many based on the reviews, but just not for me.

Arlo SoHo is a perfect spot for a stay in NYC. Great location, great amenities, and friendly staff. It's hard to find a hotel in NYC that provides all of these things, at a somewhat reasonable rate, and Arlo SoHo does it all. The rooms, while small, are very thoughtfully designed and provided plenty of space. I will definitely be back!

The Arlo Soho has great guest areas such as the lobby/library, the reception area, Harold's Restaurant & the rooftop bar. All of this helps add up to a fun and enjoyable stay in a great location. Harold's restaurant was a great spot to eat and loved the interior courtyard and floral decorations. They change the theme seasonally, and was great to spend part of my afternoon out there having a great lunch.Short walk to Soho and Greenwich Village and easy walk to downtown, Battery Park and Brooklyn. Even the Highline and Hudson Yards were a nice walk or bike ride away on the hotel provided bikes. 1 Train to Times Square / midtown is also convenient.The rooms are small, but a clever use of space. Two people may find the room a bit crowded, but the guest areas really help out with that and generally, I'm not spending that much time in my room while visiting NYC.Great staff and overall design of the hotel too.

Really nice hotel, but being Scandinavian style, you can't be modest and stay in a room with someone you're NOT in a relationship with. It is right on the 1 train, I mean around the corner. $78 Uber's to JFK? Just spend $2.75 and take the MTA.....if you can.The bathroom and toilet are RIGHT next to the front door, without a wall, just an opaque sliding doors, which is very weird. I'm a shy pee-er,so this is a no-no. The showerhead is really cool. And the room I had looks out to other rooms, it was like living in a college dorm again! Just better quality rooms. Its great they have a dedicated Chromecast, helped me watch GoT!I didn't hear the Holland Tunnel at all, but I didn't face it. There's a really nice rooftop and bar up on 11. The room wasn't small at all. It reminded me of an open cruise cabin. What more do you NEED other than a desk, chaif, bed, toilet and shower? I think some people are just born miserable to complain about this place. They have a free daily 90min happy hour every evening, even on the weekends! Each room comes with an umbrella,too or you can get one from the front desk if they have it. Its a really nice hotel and the Alice In Wonderland type secret garden on the ground level is nice.The staff were friendly, but BEWARE of the random $70 "incidental" resort fee they tag on to your room on TOP of your final price. That's more than Vegas! It is not mentioned on booking sites and it SHOULD be.You can't have everywhere like America, so while I give this hotel a 4/5, its nice to feel like I'm in Europe.....from SoHo.

The hotel is easily accessible to Brooklyn and all parts of Manhattan. Lobby is welcoming with a Sweet Shop meeting you at the front door. Cool merchandising that's unlike anything you've probably seen in a hotel. Lobby bar has a cool, "lounge-y" feel without being pretentious. Comfortable chairs, lots of power outlets and good Wi-Fi. Seems to be popular with the co-working crowd, which adds to the appeal. Immaculate courtyard garden with beautiful flowers. Food was delicious in the restaurant (Deviled Eggs and Wings are a must have). Staff is very attentive and genuine, but not overbearing.I did a check in on my mobile phone and used the Arlo app mobile key to open the door. Very easy and no need to stop at the front desk! I went straight to my room with no problem. Rooms are small, but SUPER clean, very well appointed and the space is well used throughout. Super comfortable bed, amazing shower, high-quality amenities. Drop down desk and comfortable stool were very useful for morning conference calls. The front desk staff is friendly and energetic. Their commitment to service is real and not manufactured. Overall, Arlo SoHo is a gem where even the smallest details are obviously very important to them. I look forward to staying there again (and again)!
user_name:
DCalloway
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Stay would have been excellent If the hotel had not applied a city amenities fee (not advertistes in the Booking.com site) that ended adding 30% to the final price. Had I known this, I would have chorem to stay elsewhere.

The two twin room was the smallest hotel room I have experienced on my travels, but I was impressed by the thought that went into the placement of everything down to a drawer under each bed, as well as a pegboard to hang items. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful in assisting us decide where to go for a great meal. As a visitor who had a full itinerary to soak in NYC, the 24 hour lobby cafe/candy shop was very convenient for a quick coffee and healthy snack as well delicious-looking prepackaged meals. The first floor has a very spacious area with nooks and modern furnishings to sit and relax or catch up on work if necessary.The hotel is only a few minutes walk to the metro which will get you anywhere in the city quickly. We enjoyed walking to many of the areas in the city during most of our trip and found the location perfect for that as well. I will definitely consider returning on a future trip to NYC.

The hotel lobby has a nice vibe - staff is super friendly and Bodega is great with healthy selections plus there is a Dylan's Candy Bar BUT the rooms are TINY even by NYC standards. I would only stay here again if I were traveling by myself.

Most of the reviews are right that the rooms are small, but hey it's New York. We stayed here with our 6 year old daughter. It is in a convenient location since we are tourists. The public spaces are very communal but nicely designed. It is a hotel built with Millennials in mind.

I mostly liked this hotel, although the upgraded room was 8 feet wide-literally, The desk was not deep enough for my small laptop, so the only place to work was the downstairs lobby with the obligatory shared desk. I went for a late lunch in the restaurant, and they charged me for iced tea refills--really?Bed was comfortable, good location, food was good in the restaurant, not outrageously expensive.

The room was nice, but small. But then again who goes to NY to sit in their room. The bed was comfortable, view was decent, and the roof top was great (but pricey drinks). Also, with the room being small it is made up for by all the great lounge space in the lobby/downstairs area.

Absolutely loved our stay at Arlo Soho. Funky boutique hotel with bright and stylish public spaces from the lounging area , to the bar, to the rooftop bar , to the coffee shop , to the sweet shop , to the garden area everything was amazing and especially the staff who were friendly and an absolute joy So why after all this only 4 out of 5 , the rooms are tiny ! Although not a huge issue as why stay in your room when you are in NYC but still would have expected larger Would I recommend, absolutely but be prepared for a small bedroom

Stayed here recently during the Tribeca film festival. Room was well decorated but had a lot of problems with it. TV didn't work upon arrival. In-room telephone was broken. And was interrupted twice by service people wanting to measure the glass for the shower. WTF? The hotel was clean and well situated location-wise in the city but a lot left to be desired. The service was pretty bad. I felt like the staff were both overwhelmed and also just didn't care about servicing guests. Biggest complaint was that I'd specifically requested the highest floor available and farthest from the elevator. Instead they literally put me on the 3rd floor directly next to the elevator. I heard the other guests coming and going every night. Will not stay there again.

Location and staff were excellent. This place is a great value that balances hip boutique with function and luxury. The house bikes are fun, the Hudson is only a couple blocks away and the subway station is a 2 minute walk.

Clean, comfortable,and great for spaces to meet people including the rooftop. It’s like a WeWork hotel. Loved the hipster vibe and the celebrity spotting. Can’t wait to come back! It was an affordable price for the location. Close to some great eateries, shopping and metros. I even got to take a yoga class at the aloyoga studio compliments of Arlo.

„Hidden“ urban fee was not at our last stayShould include bottled water in the room - water was never restockedShould include Wifi - wifi was slow and broke down oftenRooms not very clean and run down, bedding had holesWas my 3rd stay-very disappointing at all! Will not come back.

Nice place, all the amenities we needed, drinks were over priced but service was really good. Would recommend to others who want to be in that area. Very easy access to good shopping and 911 memorial and Hudson River fun things

I was in town for mostly work while staying at Arlo Soho and couldn’t be happier with the accommodation. Great rooftop bar/lounge, great restaurant on site, great work space, great lobby bar, super comfy bed, attentive staff and they even provide you a nice sturdy umbrella during your stay. I will stay here again!

Haven't been to NYC in 10yrs and Hotel near by made us feel very uncomfortable by saying that we had to pay "Double" the Payment for the room and they are emptying the wet bar in the room :(. I felt it was Discrimination. I had all the right Cards and Money to pay but my wife said "lets go" we can find somewhere better. We googled hotels near by and ARLO was our 1st choice. We called and they said come on over we definitely have a room for u. From the Desk to Room was Pleasant and the stay was AMAZING! The Garden Experience and Live Band was MAGICAL! My Wife has an AMAZING Bday Weekend. I'm so happy with ARLO that I'm staying again when I come back bc they make EVERYONE feel welcomed at ARLO HOTELS. Thanks ARLO! 100 STARS! #BeTheChangeYouWishToSeeInTheWorld #ChooseARLO #EveryoneIsWelcomedHere

Enjoyed my stay. Thank You Caroline for Your warm welcome, and breakfast vouchers, and all the recommendations.The rooms are well designed and the restaurant and rooftop bar are quality entertainment and dining. The location is perfect. Easy walk to the Hudson boardwalk where you can jog/and or bike and get a glimpse of Jersey city. Definitely will be returning soon.
user_name:
jonathanflores0701
New York City, New York

review_body: We got this on hotel tonight and we were very pleased at the value for what was a lovely experience. I think that staying in this particular neighborhood such a pleasure even though there is the Holland tunnel traffic to navigate. The staff so helpful

Great hotel if you are staying in Soho. Nice, comfortable rooms, really good staff. Comfortable and functional lobby. Some great, quick breakfast choices at the bodega if you have less time in the morning.

I enjoyed my stay at the Arlo Soho. It was immaculate, centrally located, nice smelling toiletries, comfortable bed. There’s a small shop in the lobby to pick up a quick bite with healthier options and a coffee bar. The only two small issues were it was somewhat difficult to get around the bed as the foot of the bed is very close to the wall and at night it’s a bit loud because the Holland Tunnel is at the corner. With that being said I would still consider staying here again.

Had a very nice stay at Arlo. Staff very efficient and courteous. Breakfast sandwich was excellent. Coffee nice and hot. Nice functional room. Public space set up very nicely for quiet alone time or for a groups of people to meet. Plenty of outlets to charge devices. Very nice stay.
user_name:
MrSolo28970
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: It's a beautiful hotel and the staff is fantastic. We made a change in our room preference and John at the front desk was very helpful. The rooms are beautiful and the beds are very comfortable!!!!!!!

Arlo is full of trendy young things, and in a great location for SoHo shopping and dining.So much for the positives.Sadly, the designers and management of this hotel rather forgot abou the basics.Rooms are tiny. - So small, you can’t get two people into the (comfy) bed without one climbing over the other. - There are no wardrobes to store clothes, simply a tiny hanging rail. - There are no bedside tables to put drinks on, glasses, phones, etc. - There is no chair to sit on, anywhere in the room!- The blackout blind is ineffective and does not prevent light entering the room at night.- There is no coffee or tea in the room.- Luggage can only be stored under the bed. This makes accessing anything from your case clumsy and slow (especially at night!) Remember there are no drawers to put clothes either so don’t even imagine you can ‘unpack’.All of the above is described by Arlo as “a micro concept”. Well, it’s a failed concept, it does not do the bare minimum that any hotel should achieve, let alone one with this price tag.Add to all of this the $35 daily charge for “free” WiFi, happy hour, bicycles etc. and you realise that this concept is designed with profit, not guests in mind.As I sat listening to the steady drip of water on the room ceiling, keeping me awake at night, I determined to write a review, to advise future guests of what they should expect.So now you have been warned. And I have learned a lot. About where not to stay again, and why.

This was our second time at this hotel. Trendy lobby with Dylan’s Candy store to the left. We picked up candy from Dylan’s candy to the room. The front desk staff greeted us with warm professionalism. The rooms are clean, cozy and functional. Customer service was top notch, we requested a few things that were accommodated right away. Spoke to management about a surprise that I was planning and they executed it flawlessly. Kudos to the management! We rode the bikes in the early morning that are available for guests, had lunch in the restaurant, drinks on the rooftop…lovely weekend. The hotel offers a great affordable value for my budget and always exceeds my expectations.

Arlo Soho is an exceptional boutique hotel with great amenities! The lobby (a mini Dylan's candy bar) is inviting as well as a hospitable front desk staff. Harolds the restaurant has the best breakfast buffet in town and has a delicious lunch menu too! Rooms are small (hence the boutique hotel concept) but offers all modern conveniences. It is my go to hotel when I visit my daughter who lives in the West Village. I have been a guest at The Arlo Soho 6 x!!

I stay here for business trips but would stay here for leisure as well any day! Great location in SOHO, outstanding service and the perfect little bodega for small needs. The bar is also lively with great beers

Already on the website the Arlo SoHo made a great impression on me, which was clearly exceeded when we arrived at the hotel. The room was cozy with a stunning view, clean, friendly stuff, great restaurant and amazing roof top, bikes for free (we used them every day) ... what more do you want :-) The location in SoHo next to Hudson river and World Trade Center is awesome! Some reviews said that there is no privacy because the shower is integrated with the room - we loved it, that was much fun! Thank you to the team of Arlo SoHo for an unforgettable stay at Big Apple.

Had so much fun staying at the Sarko SoHo this past Christmas. Amazing staff, service and atmosphere. Everything was beyond our expectations. We loved how warm and comfortable everyone made us feel. We’re certainly looking forward to visit again.

I thoroughly enjoyed my recent stay at the Arlo Soho. Yes, the rooms are small [which is not a secret] but a friend and I stayed in a cityview king and it really wasn't bad at all. The hotel itself is gorgeous and they have done a beautiful job of creating lots of interesting, visually appealing and functional communal spaces and curating great events as well. The courtyard was stunning- it was transformed into a spring garden full of blooms. The location of the hotel itself couldn't be beat- extremely walkable to Soho, Tribeca, and the West Village and very near the subway so it wasn't hard to get to other parts of the city at all. Overall, it was a wonderful experience and I would absolutely stay again.

You will get suckered by the funky website.I did. But it’s not what it seems.The shower curtain is insanely stupid. It’s an easy fix but yet nothing is done. Beyond irritating and I stayed for over week wanting to punch a wall every shower...Rooms are very small. Tokyo small.It’s not close to subways, bars or restaurants. Close as in NY close. Several blocks before you get into it. And UBK sadly closed today and that was the best food around.Noisy as hell.If you’re on a lower floor you get a bad 90’s techno beat all night from their restaurant (inside which,literally no one, is listening to the music).Starts up again early morning.They slap you with additional tax on departure ... supposedly for amenities like bikes no one rides and the water they give you.... on your first night but never again. The “movie night” that’s pointless because no one can hear it over the crap music.There is a happy hour if you want bad Chardonnay or some terrible red accompanied by a platter of food so small only a few people get near it. Including nil cutlery or napkins. The second night I went was even worse than the first. Included about 8 or 10 hotel guest mulling about trying to get near the food which included a dip with nothing to dip into it. I went 3 times and it was rubbish. I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt.You are better off staying a few blocks toward the centre of Soho in a proper room. And spend that tax smash on a decent glass of Pinot somewhere else!!!

Very cool hotel in great area. Just be aware that the rooms are very small. Not New York small, more like Europe or Japan small. It;s kind of cool but I think it would be too tight for 2 people, they would have to crawl over each other to get out of bed and go to the bathroom. Besides that it's a great place. Lots of energy like you would want in NYC. First time stating in SOHO and will go backk.

My room was about 8 feet wide by 16 - 20 feet long. Small, modern, clean, well appointed, but... No closet or drawers so if you like to unpack and settle in, it feels a little cluttered. Great location in Soho, walking distance to restaurants, shopping and subway. Facilities are contemporary, international influence is great. Would return...

We stayed at Arlo SoHo over spring break. It is a great location to explore the SoHo area of NYC. The hotel was easy to get to and close to many great spots like Jim's pizza and Molly's Cupcakes. We will stay at Arlo again.

We had our family meet in New York at Arlo Soho and never left the neighborhood - jazz, comedy, great restaurants and bars.The Arlo front desk took amazing care of us and they have a great restaurant for brunch.Special call out for Isabelle of management - amazing!Jeff

My boyfriend picked this hotel for our trip to NYC and he couldn’t have done a better job. Location is amazing with good bars and restaurants a plenty on your doorstep, the rooms are clean and tidy with amazing views of NYC or the hotels funky courtyard. The best thing about the whole hotel is the happy hour – free wine and beer for residents for 1.5 hours every evening. Really good atmosphere in the whole hotel, would absolutely recommend.

Planning a trip to the big apple and uncertain as to where to stay? It happens to the best of us! Here are my two cents on why you should stay at Arlo SoHo.Location: Once you've decided you want to stay in Manhattan ('cause Brooklyn is also a great choice), you may want to stay in the Lower side - away from the over crowded and Midtown tourist traps. Trendy SoHo is a great option & Arlo SoHo is close to many great restaurants and shopping venues. There's also a couple subway stations within a quick 6min walk. Staff: Super friendly, all smiles and attentive. Complimentary drinks: I probably should've started with this one, huh!? They serve a daily almost 2hrs long open bar including wine, beer & gin cocktails AND hors d'oeuvres.Rooms: Modern, clean & functional. But small. I know, it's NY and almost all accommodations tend to be on the smaller size, but having some additional in room space would've swayed me to a 5/5 rating. There's plenty of other common areas you can stretch, read a book or even work if it makes you feel better. There's also other onsite amenities to enhance your stay such as a restaurant and rooftop bar.

Relaxed atmosphere in my favorite area. Like Arlo Nomad, clean and comfortable with courteous staff and fellow guests. If you arrive early they’ll gather up and secure your luggage until you’re ready to check in later in the day. Fellow guests mostly young professionals, quite a few I spoke with were from SF or LA. Don’t overlook the complimentary happy hour - very friendly and relaxing.

My wife and I stayed at Arlo SoHo for our anniversary and couldn’t have picked a better hotel in Manhattan. The place is beautiful for starters, the room had an awesome view of the courtyard with perfect mid-century vibes. The place smells like a dream, constant candles lit, just a perfect vibe. To top it all off, I requested some special help from the front desk to set up our room with flowers, rose peddles on the bed, some champagne and choc strawberries while my wife and I were out on our anniversary. With our even a blink, Isabella at the front desk helped me with ordering everything and she fully set up the room better than I’d ever imagined. My wife was completely surprised and I scored some big points with her thanks to all of Isabella’s efforts! Thank you!! We 100% recommend this hotel and will definitely be back ASAP!!!

My niece and I stayed here for two nights and enjoyed our time here. The staff were all fantastic. So welcoming and friendly. The hotel itself has great public areas, modern lounges, rooftop bar and a restaurant on site. The hotel is also well situated for visiting many parts of lower Manhattan and is a comfortable walk to the Brooklyn bridge or up to the High Line. There is also a subway station nearby. The rooms are very small but super clean and the beds are comfortable. There isn't a lot of privacy, given size of the rooms and layout with the bathroom so I would stay here again with my husband, but perhaps not with girlfriends, where a little more space would be welcome.

this is a very cool property and was a refreshing change to the typical NYC stay. The rooms are small but i suppose it's par for the course for the area. I would definitely stay here again and looking forward to checking out the other Arlo properties especially the new South Beach Property.

Firstly, booked this hotel, didn’t realize it was a micro hotel, well what a shock. My husband had to crawl over me to get out of bed as it’s so small you can’t walk around the bed, it’s wall to wall bed. It’s so small, no bed side tables, not enough space on the flip down office table, nowhere to hang your clothes apart from 4 hangers, your clothes wee always in suitcase under the bed as there was no where else to put it. The toilet and shower wasn’t private, my husband left me alone and vice versus to go bathroom. The air conditioning was so loud kept me awake. Don’t do it, don’t. If you a lone traveler it is probably ok. Plus side. Staff was friendly pillows and bed comfy. But that is all. It’s ok if you are a mouse.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Arlo Soho. The staff is so welcoming and accommodating. Also, the hotel has such great activities and amenities for its guests. They have happy hour every day and activities like yoga/Pilates. Not to mention that the lobby, outdoor space and rooftop bar are amazing places to wind down at the end of the day. The rooms are a bit small (even for NY), but the space is so efficiently utilized. Every inch of my room served a purpose, so I didn’t feel crowded or squished.

My friend and I stayed at this cool Hotel from 3/28 thru 4/1 and it was an amazing stay. The place is chic and has a very nice urban vibe. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel. The location is ideal as it is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest subway, 10-12 minute walk to Freedom tower (WTC), and 15-20 minute walk to Chinatown. Not to mention an easy walk to Greenwich and instant access to Soho. The hotel itself is very clean, smells good, and the staff were all amazing. The restaurant on site is has good food and drinks (but they are pretty pricey). The bar in Harold’s (the restaurant bar) was our hangout of choice and we met some really great people there. They have happy hour between 5:30pm – 7pm where they serve free wine (white and red) as well as free draft beer. The room was a little tight as far but I went in expecting this so it wasn’t a hassle. The only concern is the bathtub and toilet area should be a little more enclosed and tightly sealed, I feel it is very easy to get the room carpet a little wet from the close proximity to the shower and toilet area. This was really my only concern in regards to the room.All in all, I cannot complain about my stay there and the service we received – I can only brag.

Great hotel with amazing location and amenities. Amazing deal for the money with a beautiful rooftop, quirky courtyard, great restaurant and bar, and extremely friendly staff. Would definitely stay again!

On the plus side this is a very cool hotel with fab lobby, bars and aesthetic. It even smells great. Also the daily happy hour in the bar with complimentary drinks and snacks is a great way to start an evening and makes you feel welcome (even if you are paying for it in the “urban fee”).Downsides: the ridiculous “urban fee” - fees and taxes are a bit ott. Also the design of the rooms. I knew it would be small but no bedside table and just a couple of hangers....? Also I think the design of having the bathroom basically in the room but with a glass partition was impractical. The sliding door doesn’t actually shut off the bathroom so there’s not much privacy if there’s two of you in a room. Also the lack of ventilation means the room starts to get musty once you’ve showered. There is AC but it was v loud for such a small room - like a helicopter taking off. Had to turn it off at night. Location wise, nothing much in a one block vicinity but well located for TriBeCa, Soho etc and Canal Street.

We spent 3 nights at the Arlo Soho with our teenagers. Great location for exploring the city. Fun atmosphere for all our age groups. The adjoining rooms were are good set up for our family. We very much enjoyed the common areas in the hotel for hanging out.

Came to NYC for a friend’s birthday and booked one night last minute at the Arlo. What a great place! My room was cozy (translation: small, but normal by NYC standards), but very functional. The feel is like a cabin on a boat. A very nice cabin! The staff was wonderful and welcoming. I worked from the hotel for the day and never felt like I was overstaying my welcome. The best part was turning one of the lovely Shackleton themed greenhouses into my office for a few hours. Was on a webinar and took conference calls petting my own personal polar bear rocking horse! The vibe overall was cool and chill, not pretentious, and overall very comfortable. Great bar, including the rooftop, and food at Harold’s. I highly recommend this hotel! Even if you just stop by and want to get some work done in one of many areas chock full of outlets. The only thing to keep in mind is that they include an “urban fee” which covers a class and happy hour and other daily events. Great if you plan to use those things, not so much if you don’t. Will definitely stay here again!

Good location, small rooms but organised efficiently. Wi-fi and Showers were great. The reception staff could be more welcoming/friendly/helpful. On arrival no offer of help with bags or being shown to the lifts. Also a friend booked 2 rooms and they separated us on the 3rd and 5th floor, which was a pity.
user_name:
cathyk0
Royal Tunbridge Wells, United Kingdom

review_body: Thank you all at Arlo for always being so kind and sweet. -Julian / bartender / Garry/ Albi/ The service is always great, and I feel always welcomed. And the drinks are always really good. Regards Emmelie Bjornsdotter Pagani

The Arlo Soho is fresh and well maintained, overall putting you in a good mood for the day ahead. Convenient to the Spring Street subway and the West Side Greenway, so next time I'll bring my running shoes!

I'm at the Arlo at least once a month for business travel and very much enjoy my stay - friendly staff, great bar, very comfortable rooms, high quality wifi, nice working space and very convenient to much of the city. Highly recommend.
user_name:
Culture11648724371
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing hotel! great staff, great food, super clean rooms. very cool atmosphere, great great location. I really recommend everyone to come to this hotel, I visited this hotel during March for business trip and it was great
user_name:
V3706DNdanaa
New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel far exceeded our expectations, The location, the property, the room, and most of all the staff were all incredible. From the generous happy hour to the restaurant, and the common areas each and every staff person that we met was super friendly, super knowledgable, and of course way hip. This place is as good as advertised.

Arlo SOHO was awesome. From the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out the Arlo was probably the best hotel experience Ive had in NYC and 100 percent of that was the service. From check in where they helped me with an upgrade to an amazing room, to beverage vouchers for being a tablet plus member. When I got said beverages and I tried to leave a tip with the bartender he declined, said I have a voucher and the hotel takes care of him. Eating and checking out was a breeze, everyone seemed to want to go out of their way to help me. The rooms as well are nice, location seems central enough if you are in the SOHO area, and lounge/drink/eat areas are stylish and clean. Highly recommend!

very welcoming staff. We made a mistake in our reservation (dates) and they were so accommodating. I recommend highly. Great atmosphere hotel. Clean rooms. Great location. Restaurants nearby in SoHo. Cool staff.

Just stayed one night at the end of a business trip. The lobby & common areas are beautiful and functional (lots of laptop work happening here) and the rooftop bar is comfortable with excellent service. Check-in/out was rapid and helpful. My only disappointment was the happy-hour: the snack was odd, a single selection, and no non-alcoholic option (not even a soda) which made my companion feel excluded.

Atmosphere at the Arlo hotel is outstanding. Service is fast, efficient, and friendly. Rooms, lounges and amenities are well designed, comfortable and trendy. The Bodega is a great additional to the hotel for fast snacks and convenience items. Would highly recommend the hotel and location.

The Arlo SoHo hotel was amazing!! The staff was very accommodating and professional, one in particular that really made my stay in SoHo astounding was Ameris, from the moment I checked in she was very helpful and polite. Her level of professionalism and courtesy really intrigued me, she’s definitely an asset at Arlo SoHo and should quite frankly own/operate them all!!!

Efficient, appealing, quiet, great location, in-house restaurants (which many newer hotels lack). EXTREMELY comfortable bed! Well appointed room with impressive design for ample storage and shower/bathroom experience despite small footprint. Not a room to host multiple people for visit/conversation. Super ideal for a single traveler. Lots of food and snack options, and several bars to choose from. Tons of common areas for working, visiting, talking, using phone, plugging in, or unplugging :)

I've stayed at the midtown location. This property is just as good if not better. Great layout. Rooms are fresh and well designed, beds very comfortble. Staff was superb. They nailed every request. I will def stay there again.

This was my first stay at Arlo Soho. My first impression was excellent, easy to find from the Subway (Canal and Spring) and reflected a cool NY vibe. The beds were comfy and housekeeping every day was a great bonus. Would definitely stay again.

My second time staying at Arlo Soho and the hotel is as welcoming and comfortable as the last time. Such a cool atmosphere and I love the cosy feel of the stylish rooms. Everything you need in a hotel. Will definitely be back!
user_name:
Matt B
Greater London, United Kingdom

review_body: My 4 girl friends and I just stayed at the Arlo in SoHo this past weekend.
