This hotel is conveniently located just steps away from the huzzle and buzzle of SoHo shopping and dining thus the rooms are nice and quiet at night. I was very much positively surprised about the cleanness and the room had all the mod cons needed. Everything was perfect for our girls trip! We will be back for sure!!!!

We love Arlo Soho - best of all is the fantastic support and warmth of the hard working staff. Isabella took excellent care of us and made sure we were comfortable in our room and at home in the chic communal areas of this stylish hotel. Thank you! We will be back!

I arrived at 4.00 a.m after 7 hours trip and without any prior communication Arlo decided to relocate me in a different hotel 20 minutes distance to Arlo. No explanation, no alternatives, that was my welcome to Soho Arlo. So, yes it is pretty and very well located hotel but be aware that client comfort is not always their priority.

Arlo Soho is an amazing hotel. The staff can’t do enough for you, the hotel is clean and has all the mod cons required and the location is perfect. I can not recommend this hotel highly enough and we will stay here again when in Manhattan

We had a lovely stay at Arlo Soho. Rooms were clean, small but efficient ( and not the smallest in N.Y). Winter "huts" were a nice touch. Decor and atmosphere were fun. Service was great. Easy check in and check out. We were allowed to check in early and they held our luggage after we checked out.Cocktail hour nice was a nice treat.Valet parking was a plus.There is a small version of Dylan's candy bar in lobby as well as snacks and coffee to purchase. Rooftop deck was nice.

This is my 2nd stay. We really enjoy this place has laid back and peaceful. It is a good place to hang out and work whether in library, lounge or outdoor tent/igloo areas.Special mention to Chi who is always friendly and goes out of his way to help no matter how busy he is. Yana at the bar is wonderful and super friendly as well. She had her Bloody Mary mix ready for me when she would see me outside.

Great hotel and really attentive staff. Ideally located for us as it was at a quieter end of town, but with great links to get to everywhere we wanted. Rooms are a bit lacking in storage space, but otherwise perfect for us. Coffee shop on site was great, and everything was clean and well maintained. Would stay again if in NY.
user_name:
davthechav
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: Wonderful, affordable place to stay in an ideal location for us. Public spaces are amazing & fun with a mixture of cozy, intimate & shared options. Service was nearly flawless with the exception of not having our room cleaned in a timely manner. That mistake was quickly & graciously rectified. As noted in other reviews the rooms are truly very small. The only reason we did not give a 5-star review is because of the housekeeping error & being placed in a wheelchair accessible room without our being told that and/or giving us other options at the time of our booking or check-in.

The hotel was suggested by friends so we had to assume we just had to go with it... and no regrets! The staff is friendly, great restaurants and bars (rooftop for the nicer weather) Super located to the public transport and all of Soho in walking distance.My only suggestions would be for the management concerning the room. We had the room with the bunk bed. Room was specious enough for what we expected and each bed has its own tv, there is Bluetooth to play your music. Bed are comfortable and clean.I would suggest to add some hooks in or near the bathroom for your towels. The shower curtain kept on coming down as the curtain was to short to teach the hook on the glass wall. (#608) Also an extra hook for your coat in the hallway would be great! Just these small additions would make the room so much more enjoyable :)...Other than that... a total gem in Soho for a city trip

We absolutely loved our stay. The rooms are small but designed well so you really do have everything you need. It's like living on a bat. We loved how cleverly it was all planned out. The large window actually helped expand the space too, so it didn't feel that tiny. The common spaces are well thought-out, attractive and actually in use. And Harold's is delicious. We can't wait to stay here again!

I've wanted to stay at Arlo Soho before but always ended up booking elsewhere. Decided to take a last-minute staycation yesterday and was looking for a decent hotel for under $200. Arlo was one of the top-rated in that price range, so I finally gave it a whirl. What you get for your money isn't a ton of space (so this hotel is not a great option if you have more than a couple bags) but the space you get is used efficiently. The bed is the focal point of the room (King City View)...and I loved it. The lobby area of the hotel is super inviting, with plenty of places to lounge and socialize or just read a book with a cup of coffee. I'd definitely stay again if I was looking to stay somewhere understated...and was going to spend most of my time in bed.

I cannot recommend the Arlo Soho enough. Although there was a housekeeping glitch during my stay, the management team went above and beyond in order to make things right. Good customer service can sometimes be hard to come by-- but the management at the Arlo is exemplary. Every step of the way, you will get personalized service, which makes the hotel feel like home. The building itself is also very comfy-cozy, the rooms are quaint, there are stylish communal areas in the lobby and on the roof, a great restaurant, and a 24 hour pantry for late-nite bites. You will not be disappointed with your stay at Arlo Soho.

The rooms may be small but really well set out, clean and functional, but that is the only “small” thing, big personalities, big bars, fantastic restaurant. Just came from an upper east side hotel and this place is sssoooo much better. Service, food, vibe I just love it, they do everything so well, music, buffet.......well done Arlo! I’ll be back.

A New York hotel is all about great location and a 'base' for whatever you're in town for. Not only is this a great location with close accessibility to the Subway, but its calm, cute and quirky, so ideal to chill out at the hotel to recharge, have a few chilled out drinks downstairs or get the party started in the roof bar.Whilst this is all great, what's really special about this place is the service. From the moment you walk through the doors, the service and genuine customer care from the front desk and management team is exemplary. This transcends throughout the whole Arlo team, whether it's reception offering advice on where to eat - Bubby's Breakfast is pretty life-changing - the bar staff holding a genuine conversation about your travels and life back home, or the friendly greeting each day from the housekeeping team.The place makes a great stay, the people make it a memorable experience. Great job guys!
user_name:
mykitco
New York City, New York

review_body: I was in NY to see a concert at the City Winery, which is very close to the Arlo. I was thrilled by how clean was the hotel room. The pricey, but convenient snack bar in the lobby was perfect for grabbing a quick breakfast before hitting the pavement.

Chose the Arlo due to its location near City Winery for a show we were going to. Very modern, clean, eco-friendly hotel with a friendly & professional staff. Rooms had a Scandinavian feel to it. Bed was really comfortable too! Definitely a younger crowd/vibe at this hotel, felt as if we were the oldest guests there being in our mid 50’s. But don’t let that deter you - it’s a nice spot to stay in Soho. Our only complaint was the lighting in the elevator was poor for our aging eyes! Found it hard to see the buttons to select our floor.

Super hotel, super service and great location. not to small and not to big hotel, close nice areas. fantastic breakfast and bar.modern and clean, good servise, easy check in and out. looking forward to next time.

Had a great time at the Arlo Soho ( during NYC fashion week) lots going on in the lobby. As usual the staff were so friendly and the coffee was pretty good too! My room overlooked the courtyard and the snow made it really pretty

I had a wonderful stay at Arlo Soho for a wedding weekend. The location was perfect - I was able to walk everywhere or took a short uber ride when needed. Harold's was delicious, and all of the staff was very accommodating. I would happily stay here again!

I stayed in a small room but bed size was great and amenities excellent. The staff are very friendly and helpful. There is a small cafe inside and a restaurant. Very hipster and cool and close to bars and restaurants.

Just returned from a short break staying at Arlo SoHo. Great hotel excellent location. Staff helpful and friendly. Room, although warned small, was not as small as expected and was very clean. Rooftop bar really nice though drinks were pricey however this was compensated for by free drinks everyday in Harold’s bar happy hour from 5.30 til 7pm. This was a great idea as everyone gathered there and atmosphere was great. New York was amazing everything expected and more.

I've stayed at this hotel a number of times in the last couple of years. The Soho location is perfect. There's nothing I don't like about this hotel. The front desk staff is very friendly & very helpful. Happy hour drinks & snacks in the lounge (or rooftop) are delicious and reasonably priced. Delicious coffee in the lobby & a mini Dylan's Candy Bar for sugary snack cravings. Rooms are comfortable. It's an affordable option and my primary choice when staying in the city.

Great place. Short walk to shops and restaurants. Staff friendly and very helpful. The hotel goes out of its way to provide activities and "events" for guests. Also, lobby area and "library" room on second floor are great for lounging, reading, etc. Our 4th stay and there will be more visits.

Visiting my son in NYC who is a student at NYU. I have found my home base! Cozy, comfy rooms, great food and exceptional staff. In three short days I ate at Harold's five times. (The bowl with spinach, salmon, egg and avocado, is so good.) Now that's a true recommendation. Such easy access to the subway. Thanks Joe S. for all your help. I will be baaccckkk!

Had a great stay with my girlfriend at the Arlo hotel in SOHO. Staff was amazing and the location was perfect to get around the city. Close to the subway, shopping and attractions. Very cool hotel. Rooms are small but have everything you need and super comfy beds. Highly recommend.

This was the first time to NYC during New Years & we couldn’t have picked a more perfect place to stay! The Arlo, its staff and the management more than exceeded my expectations! From a hand written letter, and care package welcoming us to the Arlo!! Accommodations were spacious with amazing city views off the private balcony!! The restaurant offered an amazing menu and the breakfast was phenomenal!!! Im looking forward to my next trip to NYC and the Arlo is most definitely the hotel of choice!!!

We visited the Arlo after a recommendation from a friend and were not disappointed. From our very first encounter with the front desk it was all positive, the greeting was warm a friendly and above all genuine!We loved the casual contemporary atmosphere and quirky decor. Yes the rooms are a little on the small side but this is New York, our bed was incredibly comfortable so much so that we prefer the same pillows for home. The staff and vibe more than made up for the room size and the location is great if you want to explore Soho and the surrounding areas. :)

I felt like a queen during my stay at the Arlo! All staff were so friendly and went out of their way to accoodate anything I needed. The lobby, rooms, dining spaces, and rooftop were all impeccably decorated and maintained, allowing me to stay focused. Every possible element in the room was well thought out. And the view was spectacular! I cannot properly put into words what a joy my visit has been. The Arlo truly is a gem.

I have been traveling between San Francisco and New York in January and February of 2019. The Arlo Soho is within 5 minutes walking distance to my work and conveniently in a really fun area of Manhattan. Between workout classes, dinners or sight-seeing, this is a great area to be in. As a lone traveler, the boutique hotel with micro-guest rooms is all that I need (and is super comfortable). The hotel itself is connected to a restaurant, has great spaces to hang out in the lobby and/or bar area. The hotel hosts little events (e.g. movie nights) here and there which is also a plus. I'm still traveling back and forth, and of course I'll be back.

We enjoyed our stay, had no problem with the room size because there were plenty of areas to relax in this hotel. Happy hour was great. We would have appreciated a kettle as well as the fridge in the room. However, we had to ask for our room to be made up three times during our week’s stay here - the first time we believe the entire corridor had been missed and after that the room hadn’t been made up when we returned at 4 after a day out - the poorest service we have ever encountered and pointing this out with reception staff did not improve their attention to this.

Loved the lounge area, coffee shop, bar, restaurant & igloos. Very efficient micro rooms didn't feel as small as I thought they would and with so many great spaces to 'hang out', the whole hotel felt like a home away from home. Great vibes and value. Would recommend and stay again.

Being a Brit, I would have liked a kettle and the buffet breakfast at the weekend meant I couldn’t get a piece of toast unless I had the buffet. However, room was really well designed and worked well. Lovely staff - I was on my own so that mattered. Good restaurant (Harold’s). Great billing process so very quick check-out. Would love to experience it in warmer weather.

a few hiccups, but the stay was great none the less...got locked out of our original room couple hours after checking in (luggage and all was in there) they could not get it open .... put us in another room for the night .. compensated with some hotel gift cards .... while using a drink card....BAR STOOL BREAKS (foot rest) AND I FALL IN THE LOBBY BAR LoL....what a nightmare (it was a full moon go figure?!)...the hotel staff was great ... the restaurant is really good! and there is lots of space to hang out! I would recommend only sharing the room with a spouse or family member as the rooms are tiny and there isn't much bathroom privacy!

The rooms are a bit small, but overall modern and very clean. When you go to NYC your not going to hang in your room. Its got a great bed, linens and a big tv. what else do you need. Location was great, many things to do near by and easy to access the subway to anywhere. Recommend.

Hi Tripadvisor crowd, if you are reading this you are probably as much in love with traveling as I am. And you would know that anything can happen during the travels. When we booked this hotel two weeks ago, me and my boyfriend had to make last minute changes in our itinerary. Like really last minute. Arlo staff was extremely helpful and understanding and did everything to accommodate our request. We communicated with few people at the front desk and with two managers - everyone on top of customer service. Separate thanks to Chad who finalized our request and found compromise suitable to both sides.Apart from our situation, hotel was really cool and designed with unusual solutions - both in the rooms and in common areas where everyone comes to work. They encourage people to spend less time in the room and hang out in shared space instead. In the evening there's a happy hour where guests are encouraged to leave their phones aside for an hour or two and actually meet people and have verbal communication - such a rare these days when people just talk via the phone applications!Definitely recommend this hotel for those who enjoys creative spaces, great location, fun crowd - and all of it for very moderate price!Great travels everyone!

I enjoyed my stay at the Arlo Soho and will definitely return there when I'm in New York. First, let me clue you in to why it is so affordable: the rooms are tiny. But they are well-designed and have pretty much everything you need (mini fridge, hair dryer, etc). Also, their public spaces on the first floor are excellent. I stayed in a city view king bed room, and quite enjoyed it. Their restaurant is good, the staff quite helpful. The location is ideal, just on the northern cusp of Tribeca and southern tip of Soho is great, particularly if you're going to be on the west side a lot. It's a block from the 1 train subway stop for Canal St. And you're not paying criminal prices, which NYC is known for.

Xena and Josh.. Either give them a raise or I’m hiring them myself :-) I am not one to leave feedback or reviews… This is literally the first I’ve ever done (I downloaded this app for this express purpose)… The hotel was exceptional, maybe the best I’ve ever stayed at, and certainly the best experience I’ve ever had at one. Coolest and most unique hotel in the city, with absolutely incredible, down to earth employees, I will be back here, absolutely exceptional.

I stayed here in late January for a work related event. The hotel is non-traditional in the fact that the room is much smaller than your usual hotel room and does not provide much in the way of storage ( no drawer/closet space). What is doesn't offer in space, it makes up for in other ways- the super-friendly staff, the happy hour offerings, the creative use of public spaces and the overall ambiance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in SoHo.

Periphery of Soho with subway stop near, easy walking to shops and restaurants.Friendly staff with ‘can do’ attitude. Public spaces comfortable. Fast elevators,rooms well lit, beds super comfortable. Lots of use packed in small room. Only issue for me was inability to get room a comfortable temperature; either sauna like or too cool a breeze across bed when air came on.Breakfast great.

Clean, stylish hotel. Room was small but functional. What really made the Arlo stand out was the staff. Everyone took great care of me when I was in a pinch - the front desk staff, the bartender, even housekeeping.

Just back from a week in Delaware, I spent a night in this hotel located in the Soho neighbourhood. Very nice architecture, great places to relax, innovative furniture that make you feel more like in Scandinavia than US. So uch different from the US hotel standards. Impeccable staff. And top notch, they do not just organize some happy hours at the bar but just Free Hours . Very good food. Standard rooms are small but very well designed and equipped. Very nice bar on the Rooftop. Just perfect !

I spent 5 nights at the Arlo Soho in mid-January. The location was perfect; away from the hustle and bustle of midtown but close to my favourite parts of NYC - Soho and Greenwich. The hotel was great - clean, comfortable and the staff was super welcoming and helpful. I also appreciated the complimentary drinks and appetizers during happy hour. It was fun to hang out with folks from all over the world. Next time I'm in NYC, I'll be staying at the Arlo Soho.

Location is great - right down the street from the 1 train. Check in and check out was very quick. There were no surprises or hidden fees, even though I booked through booking.com, which I appreciated. The staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was very clean, our room was superb. The candy shop in the lobby made us a really great latte and the baked goods were really fresh. The rooftop bar was also great, they had an outdoor section which would have been really cute if the weather was better during my stay (indoor section has a nice vibe as well). The bartender was really friendly and made us great drinks. Overall, it was a great stay. My only regret is I couldn't stay longer, there are a ton of great food spots near this hotel. Will definitely book with them in the future.

The Arlo is my new fav place to stay in Soho. The hotel staff and common spaces are amazing. The room is small but who is in the room while in NYC!?? The service, food, drinks, toiletries, snacks and candy are top notch. The courtyard with the winter pods are so cool and can only imagine how lovely the courtyard is during warm weather. Rooftop as well good indoor space and service. Outside again cannot wait till summer. I am already booked again for my next trip to NYC and staying at Arlo. Thank you for such a great little gem!

Great place with a great location. Was perfect for the show I was attending down the street. Crew is super helpful and could not have been better to work with. If you want to be in this part of NYC I highly recommend Arlo SoHo,

Can’t say enough great things. Location, lobby, staff, rooftop bar. This hotel has all the amenities and more! I go to nyc almost every weekend for work and have stayed in tons of different hotels and this was by far the best bang for your buck. I loved it so much I stayed the very next weekend!
user_name:
Ashleyschuh
New York City, New York

review_body: It’s not everyday that you encounter a business that seems to really just have a great checklist. Referred as micro rooms, they are super efficient and thought out. All the necessary amenities, clean, and quiet. Friendly staff from start to finish. “Could we please check out 20 min’s late”, no problem, we will make a note. Complimentary happy hour, lots of common spaces, including small greenhouse like abodes in their courtyard. Great location, easy walking or cabs to so many places. The value was also a great deal.Less footprint on the earth as well. I’m applauding your efforts and we will be back.

New York hotels are generally known for their small rooms and big prices but this little gem in Lower Manhattan has really small rooms and even smaller prices. The philosophy seems to be to make the room so small that you would rather hang out in the public places than stay squeezed in your room. It works.With three bars, including a roof top late night hang out, and a communal Campus like chill out area you certainly don’t want to spend time in your room.Mine could have been designed by a Yacht designer but the most stunning feature was the bed set sideways across the room and bang up against the window looking down onto the street just outside. It almost felt like you were sleeping on the street. Top marks for originality, style and atmosphere.

First time staying at the Arlo and it won't be the last! Their team provides the exceptional service and down to earth approach. The lounge area has a great working space as well. Lindsey is my go-to person; say hi at her when you're checking in.

We stayed at the Arlo Soho hotel for the second time. Last time in September .. We had no preference then and got so stunned. The hotel is quite perfect situated without the crazy commerce outside but still close to subway, Hudson River, grouchystore, shops and restaurants. Last time we stayed in one of the Terrance-room which was amazing during the heat and this time with great city-view. Lucky us the still had there overnight-oats and a complete bodega for breakfast, awesome morning coffee and bar - both indoor and rooftop - with great drinks. What’s most amazing though is the helpful staff, always ready and interested to guide you. For us our stay been complete and recommend the Arlo 10 out if 10 times :)

Hotel was very nice and very clean. Staff was friendly and well knowledged. Harold's, which is the resturaunt attached, had great food and very reasonable price, for New York City standards. We are already planning our next trip back. 10/10 on all conditions.

Would definitely come back here - the atmosphere was awesome - welcoming / trendy/ stylish - staff are all really helpful and knowledgeable. Has such a great vibe and was great value. The rooms needed perfect for what we needed them for - we were hardly there so wasn’t important to have huge rooms - they were compact but well laid out and super comfy bed and great shower! We had two massive suitcases and it was easy enough to store them under the bed out the way. I was surprised how quiet the hotel was at night - was never woken up by banging doors and didn’t hear anyone else - usually I do! All in a 10/10 from me

The decor and atmosphere has a unique, boutique feel. The outside courtyard had eclectic, heated igloos with cute furniture. The bar has delicious cocktails (although a little pricier than expected at around $14-19 each - not unusual for this neighborhood though depending on where you go). The room was clean, modern, and included all the amenities we could have wanted. My friend and I had an expected travel issue and booked this last minute when we got stuck in NYC. Sharing a 1- bed unit was a bit tight with moving around but not uncomfortable. We've both lived in studios and agreed this would be a fabulous apartment in a city like NYC. The staff was fabulous! Very friendly and helpful. I would definitely start here again and highly recommend it!

The hotel is in a great location with attentive staff. Food and drinks at Harold's were great and we enjoyed the happy hour too. The front desk staff was very friendly and offered great neighborhood suggestions. The only thing missing from the room was a coffee maker!

Great hotel - staff were amazing so attentive ! Made myself and my mothers stay unreal always helpful always lovely :) we were given a slightly bigger room on arrival :)The food in Harold’s was incredible loved it ! The vibe was cool. Clean bathrooms, good Wifi - everything you need will stay again ! :)

Went here after looking at hotels located around my business training . Loved the looks from the website and took advantage of the cyber Monday special. I had my sister stay with me to go out to dinner etc after my training courses . Little did we know that we wanted to spend more time in the hotel than to explore NYC. This hotel has so many perks - from complimentary happy hour to movie night & access to NY sports club . Also loved the rooftop and lobby bars. Arlo definitely pays attention to details and it does not go unnoticed . Yes the rooms are small (but that’s NYC) but the room was so efficient , clean and quiet. I even loved there beauty products which never happens. The staff was also very friendly and accommodating. I could honestly say that not until staying at Arlo that I had ever had a flawless stay at a hotel where everything was above and beyond . I will definitely be back!

Excellent stay with my mum for 3 nights! Loved the happy hour every day, the bar and chill out areas were so comfy after long days of exploring. Staff were super friendly and helpful! The best location if you like to eat and explore soho, lower Manhattan and the Meatpacking district. Will be back definitely! Loved every minute

Cool hotel, perfectly located for exploring downtown. I was visiting NY on business and was travelling to Midtown each day on the subway; the local stations are close by and really convenient. Would highly recommend.

Well designed and stylish place.I landed early and looked for a place where I will be able to spend a few hours until check-in incase the weather is bad for walking. The place has a very nice an inviting lobby and nice bar.They eventually allowed me to check-in early which was super nice.Im sensitive to noise and room was quiet enough (facing side street).Room is small but just enough.Well recommended

Ever looked for the perfect hotel in New York? If you have, you know it is nearly impossible. However I seem to have found the place, Arlo Soho. Not only is the venue in it self really fresh, modern, clean and above all have the best rooms. The location is also perfect for me. Just at the entrance of the Holland Tunnel, a block from the Hudson makes it perfect for taking an Uber ride to the airport without the hassle of down-town traffic. Also if you fancy an early morning run, the High line is just around the corner (almost, a short warm up run away...). Fancy tennis, basketball or soccer? The piers just north of the Arlo have it all. If you are ever looking for a great place in New York, Arlo is it!

The room was very small and the bathroom is basically in the room, divided only by panels, so you can hear everything from the bed, which is hardly romantic. Likewise, every time the heating turned on it was so loud it woke me up. The finishings are very nice, but the price is a bit too high for a room that small. Location was good, but it is a bit of trek from the Canal st station if you're taking the A line or E line. It's a good location for staying in Manhattan as you can walk to Chinatown or OneWorld. Also the prices of the little shop at the bottom are ridiculous.

My sister and I both stayed at Arlo Soho for two nights. We absolutely loved everything about this hotel! The staff was the friendliest I have ever experienced in a hotel and the design of the hotel was perfect, down to each comfy, funky and unique detail. The hotel located just a quick walk into Soho, Little Italy and China town. Plenty to do close by. The hotel itself has some really cool bars (and in the winter outdoor heated igloos), lounge/public spaces and a restaurant attached where hotel guests are treated to a complimentary happy hour (wine, beer, snacks). Views from the hotel out over the city are pretty awesome too. Definitely a great place to stay while visiting NYC!

My boyfriend and I stayed here and had the best time!! The staff was so nice and the room was clean and comfortable! The happy hour was amazing and the rooftop bar was so much fun! We will definitely be coming back to the arlo hotel!!

The place is great, the restaurant is delicious and the staff are friendly! Always a pleasure staying here. This is my second or third time here and it's definitely my preference when visiting New York!

hotel is at one of manhattans cooles locations, with all the great shops and restaurants nearby, standard room is small (but enough) and cheap for manhattan. very attentive staff, very clean and 24/7 service (no room service).

We had a nice 2 night stay at the Arlo. Our room was very small but extremely clean and very efficient- everything we needed was provided. The staff was polite and very helpful. The public areas of this hotel are lovely- contemporary in design, cozy and perfect for warming and relaxing after a busy day in the brisk winter air. The location is great and within walking distance of shops and restaurants. The price is excellent, especially considering the neighborhood in which the hotel is located. We would definitely stay here again.

Nice atmosphere, great staff and happy hour! Small rooms (as expected for NYC), but efficient use of space and unique design! Location in less busy area but within walking distance to bars & shops. We definitely would come back!

Loved this hotel... But I'd didn't initially, however it really grew on me, a lot.First impressions were the the staff were polite and efficient and the hotel looked slick and modern. However I then was taken to our room, which I was a little taken aback by the size of the room. It's small, there is no way around this. However once settled in, you realise the room is packed with everything you'll need. I understand why people would complain about the shower and toilet being within the room (no seperate bathroom, just devided by smoked glass screen.)However these rooms aren't designed to spend a lot of time in them, after all your in NYC!But it's the rest of the hotel is where it shines. The communal areas are packed with desks, tables with sockets / USB ports, powerful Wi-Fi, bars, 24/7 shop, a roof top bar.The city tax covers use of a nearby gym and a hour and half of free drinks and nibbles in the restaurant, where the atmosphere is fantastic. This is a new generation hotel, but even this 40 something old codger grew to love it!

I really enjoyed my stay at Arlo Soho. It was a gorgeous hotel, they had fantastic bars, and the staff was exceptional. I slept like a baby in a wonderful king size bed and the view was awesome. I will be staying again!

We travelled from New Zealand and were meeting friends in New York from elsewhere in the USA and my travel agent suggested Arlo Soho. We were not disappointed. A modern hotel with plenty of nice comfortable spaces to gather and catch up with our friends over a drink. The rooms were quite small but were very modern, clean and had everything you needed. Friendly staff and delicious cocktails. Excellent location, easy walking from the hotel. Will definitely stay here again whenever we are back in New York.

I stumbled upon this hotel because of its great prices online, not expecting much because I was just visiting New York for two days. I had planned on maybe going out the night of my stay but ended up not even leaving the hotel. The moment we checked in they told us happy hour was happening for a couple of hours! So we took advantage of that and had a couple glasses of beer and wine complimentary of the hotel. We went to out room which had an amazing view of the city right from out bed looking out a giant window! i got ready and had an amazing dinner at there restaurant Harolds, and went up to the rooftop bar. the rooftop bar had an amazing bartender and seriously amazing drinks. I am a mixologist in CT and there drinks where above and beyond and well as the service. The view from the rooftop bar is picture worthy, I unfortunately visited during the winter so couldn't enjoy it as much as i would have liked but I will definitely be visiting in the summer! Then to top it off, we were surprised with these igloo type pods that you can eat and drink in that are super cozy! I Ended up coming back 2 weeks later for a photo shoot, and will be a returning visitor!

Great hotel with very helpful, happy and kind staff. Great location, easy to get to main neighbourhoods - Soho, Tribeca,Nolita, etc.In house service fabulous - bar, restaurant, bodega!Will definitely be back.
user_name:
Cassi200
New York City, New York

review_body: Have stayed at the hotel several times, have always have a great experience and highly recommend it! All of the staff from the moment you walk in are incredibly friendly, helpful and professional! Love the Arlo Soho and will definitely be back!

Arlo Hotel SoHo for New Year's Eve was unforgettable! Great rate, very cool room design & 2 super-comfortable common areas.They have 3 temporary "Igloo" domes outside where you can hang out for food & drinks.Looking forward to visiting the Arlo NoMad location on my next visit to NYC!

So this little Gem was great! This boutique hotel is hip and refreshing...although the room was small, it was creatively designed and had everything we needed. From the second we entered the reception area, we were greeted by a very friendly front desk staff. The decor is “ Danish or Scandinavian “ inspired and so clean and comfortable, with great common areas for socializing and computing. This hotel smells great too, the scent of “Deep Wood” also greets you as you enter the hotel. We arrived early and was able to check in right away. I really wanted to give Arlo 5stars, but felt the overnight parking was expensive, we were told on the phone it would be $45, but in fact it was $55. The bed (super comfortable) was pretty much against the window that faced the street, I found it cold and drafty on that side of the bed, even with the thermostat set to 73, and at times noisey...and lastly the breakfast buffet at Harold’s was overpriced at $24 per person.We will definitely choose Arlo again for future stays!

So my boyfriend and I have stayed here over and over since 2016. We absolutely love the modern decor of the place, the friendly and professional staff, and being able stay in the best location possible at a great price. Note again: rooms are very small. Not suitable if your staying with kids; just enough for couples. Arlo has a lot of activities always going on, so you won't be bored. Food at Harold's is yummy and now there is a candy bar in the lobby. Also, great perk is access to the gym: New York Sports Club! Although its about a 10 minute walk, it's worth going to! As always, Arlo has received us with so much kindness and never fails to leave detailed notes and candy and chocolate upon our arrival. Thanks Arlo!

Amazing hotel with the type of amenities that make your stay a true NYC experience. Great staff where nothing is too much trouble. Don’t expect big rooms or cupboard space.. then again get out of your room and enjoy all that soho and nyc has to offer.

Amazing! Comfy bed, great service, awesome location. The breakfast and lounge area is really relaxing and makes you feel right at home. The customer service was brilliant and exceptionally friendly. I’ll be back!

This hotel is outstanding. Restaurant and bars are great. So many open spaces and so fun! Rooms are small but have everything you need. We loved our stay! Will definitely visit again! Outdoor areas are so interesting and vibe is positive. Staff very friendly.

I stayed there for 2 nights on a Business Trip, thoroughly enjoyed my stay, the rooms are small but very comfortable and perfect for couples and individuals. Amazing location, great staff and unlimited drinks and appetizers happy hour from 6-7pm. 10/10 would recommend

This hotel is very reasonably priced and situated conveniently near to the Brooklyn bridge. Only a short walk and subway ride to all the attractions. The room was small but it had everything you need for a sightseeing holiday. The staff were extremely polite and couldn’t do enough to help. We felt very welcome and would definitely book here again when we next visit new york

My stay at the Arlo is Soho was amazing! I chose to stay there over new years and my 30th for 6 nights. The location was second to none, the rooms and amenities were maintained so beautifully and the staff were always willing to help. I regret not staying longer!! The restaurant had happy hour from 5:30pm to 7pm with free wine and beer, which was awesome! They have bikes for your use, a rooftop bar and awesome outdoor igloos which were fun on those cold winter nights with friends. Highly recommended.

Very convenient locstion, i had been to arlo nomad and loved it so we tried this one to be closer to the soho area. Overall it was a great hotel. Service from the front desk wasnt wow but we werre almost out all day anyway.

I can’t say enough better things about this place. It was clean, convenient, sheek and the location was amazing. The service was awesome and the people who worked here were so nice and attentive. I loved Arlo Soho and will definitely be back!!

We've enjoyed our stay at the Soho Arlo hotel. Staff was very friendly, room was super clean. Bed was amazing. Location couldn't be better. Rooftop bar was nice. Staff in hotel restaurant was friendly, helpfull and nice. We've really enjoyed our stay and would recomment thi hotel to everybody who's planning a trip to New York.

Thank you so much to the staff for how they extended themselves, especially Lindsey, in every way they could, during my 1 night stay at Arlo Soho. They were so accommodating for every request of mine and I greatly appreciated it! I look forward to coming back and staying at Arlo Soho

It was a bit hard to find at first if you are not familiar with the city but the hotel is very clean, organized and the staff was extremely helpful. When we come back to the city, we will definitely be staying here again.

We visited Arlo Soho for five nights over New Years Eve. There were 8 of us in all and we could not have found a hotel with nicer, more helpful staff. We had a little hiccup on arrival when our airport transfer booked with the hotel did not show up, and Dan/Lindsey could not have been more apologetic or hardworking to rectify it (I also spoke to a staff member on the phone and can’t remember his name! Despite me losing my temper a little he was still super friendly and understood my frustrations!) The hotel is deceptively big on the inside with a wonderful selection of food and drink in the lobby. The happy hour is super and the restaurant/bar area is lovely with quick service. We were expecting little rooms with a view of the courtyard (enclosed in and with rooms opposite) but it’s not as claustrophobic as it seems on the description/photos. The room is more than big enough for two, the bed was comfortable and the shower was nice and powerful. We could see in to other people’s rooms but we weren’t in the room a lot and closing the blind solves the problem! The courtyard is nice to look over and it’s also very quiet.Overall we all enjoyed our stay and would love to come back!

Booked a last minute stay to celebrate a birthday. I was upgraded to a king bed and sent up some treats which was a great touch. Check in was smooth Joe was super sweet ! The room was airy and had some great under bed storage that came in handy cause we all know NYC rooms are on the small side. Overall the location is fun the design is dope. We will def be back!
user_name:
justineasierra
New York City, New York

review_body: Pros: Gracious and helpful staff; comfortable beds, warm and enjoyable public spaces; convenient subways; good restaurants nearby; quiet neighborhoodCons: design might have been placed over utility and comfort is a few areas; lack of bathroom privacy

We booked this hotel for 6 nights over Christmas, first impression, hotel modern and clean and hip - check in was quick told about happy hour in harolds and the water in the fridge which we could drink, then we were given a room on the 8th floor, was a little nervous given the reviews on how small the rooms are and was cornered we would literally have no room to move, was surprised to find the room wasn't as small as I thought. we had been given an adapted room, you walk in and the sink is on the left side, straight ahead was the bedroom, to which you have a desk/stool and a cupboard which the safe and fridge were located. Right in front of the bed was the toilet and next to that the shower. only thing separating the toilet and bed was a sliding door which you can see though, much as a love my husband don't want to see him emptying his bowels! The shower curtain is pointless the entire floor ended up wet when you take a shower. The bed is comfy, pillows are little too soft, the bedding (if that's what you call it) was just a quilt placed between 2 flat sheets nothing to keep it in place. The room was either too hot or too cold, if you had it the air con on, it would turn itself on and off all night, even switched off you got a draft from the window - possibly not sealed correctly which resulted in condensation on the windows majority of the time.Doesnt offer tea & coffee which is pretty much standard these days - the on site bodega charges $5 for a cup of tea - ridiculous even starbucks is cheaper! I didnt find the staff to be particular warm and friendly, every time you entered the hotel they rarely looked up from the computer screens. More like entering Hollister than a hotel! We booked the Arlo based on the reviews and the fact at the time of booking they didnt have an additional fee like most hotels, to which they have since introduced, given we didn't pay this fee we weren't given any of the benefits which is disappointing given they do include a small discount in the overpriced restaurant and bodega! All cliental should be given these benefits as it isn't our fault you decided to induced after booking, also some of the things included in the fee such as bike hire was already free before the fee was introduced, so really isn't an added benefit! The fee I believe is around $32 per day....you don't actually get much for it just another way to make more money which depending on the length of your stay can add up!! We wouldn't stay at this hotel again, personally I would say it is ideal for the 'young' crowd, people who spend most of the time behind a computer, not for people who like a little human interaction. Upon check out we weren't even asked about our stay, just I'll email the bill. Also don't book hotel transfer via the hotel - overpriced get the train or book elsewhere - save a fortune. I usually don't like to stay in the same hotels, however we stayed at the Innside in Chelsea last year - much better than here!

Arlo was a conveniently located well equipped hotel with a welcoming and friendly atmosphere with staff who could never do enough for you. My daughter and I loved it! Harold’s (the restaurant) had a great selection of foods and beverages. Delicious and again great quality. Thank you.

The Arlo Soho is a great place to stay in a great location of NYC. The rooms were clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would recommend to anyone wishing to stay in the Soho area of NYC.

Stayed here ,to wath Canelo v Rock Fielding fight at Madison square garden, this is a lovely hotel ,handy for the subway ,5 minutes walk ,which will get you anywhere in no time.The hotel is lovely and modern ,spotless,and lovely friendly staff,rooms a bit on small side ,but other hotels in NY york are similar. You can walk to Brooklyn Bridge and World Trade Centre inside 15 minutes, and Chinatown, Little Italy ,in the same time, Greenwich Village is just up the road.We would definitely stay at the Arlo Soho again on our next vision to New York.

Scent in lobby / business area was strong. It was clean but had a strong fragrance too it. Difficult for us to sit in area for any length of time.We enjoy a first of morning cup of coffee- in order to do this I had to get dressed to go to lobby and pay for coffee. At other hotels I have visited I could walk in PJ’s/robe to a lobby area and fix coffee w/ no charge.

A fun afternoon, went on a Sunday funday. There are 3 huts but not overly crowded so we tried all 3. Free, first come first serve to occupy the huts. Unfortunately we didn’t get any snow, too warm. But they do have heaters inside. But I would still recommend dressing warm.Super cute and cuddlely great for dates in the winter.

I stayed for one night. I was working in the area and my shift ended at 11 and my next shift began at 5am, so I just needed a place to crash. I really wish I was able to stay longer! Every single person I came into contact with, from the front desk to housekeeping to maintenance greeted me with a smile and said good morning or hello. There were a lot of things to do from the living room style common areas to the rooftop bar to the restaurant to the free bikes. I want to come back here for a few nights just to hang out! The room was small, which is no secret, but it was thoughtfully designed. The bed was extremely comfortable and the amenities in the room were top notch. I loved that I could chrome cast to the tv to watch Netflix while I was getting ready to head to work in the morning. My only complaint was the draft from the windows. The bed was very close to the window (which is neat and part of the design) but even with the shades drawn there was still a bit of a draft coming up off Canal Street (which my room faced.) It wasn’t enough to make a big deal about but I could see how it might be an issue for somebody who gets cold easily. I’m thoroughly impressed with Arlo and hope to be back again soon. (For a bit longer this time!)

I'm Starting off with the lobby hosts who were friendly and helpful to the last person!No problem was too big or small to handle. I got up to my room which Is a lil' small butI got used to it and really started to enjoy! The bed and the pillows are very comfortable - you can just sit there, in your warm bed and look out over the city. I LOVE the bathroom and waterfall shower. I do wish there was more storage room for clothes but all I can say is, Pack Light, lol! In my room there was a small space to hang clothes behind my bed and a space under the bed for shoes and boots.Harold's restaurant has wonderful omelettes and I tried the Quail - Delightful!The bartender does not 'stint' on alcoholic bevs and every single meal I had was delicious. Waitstaff all charming, attractive and professional. A final shoutout to Lindsey H, who manages the Airport driving team - she 'rolled with' every schedule change and did it calmly and courteously. Thank You, Arlo Soho! I'll be back.

We have stayed at many hotels in NYC and The Arlo is now our favorite. Three things stand out. First, they have, by far, the friendliest, most welcoming staff we have experienced at any hotel. Not in your face or over the top, just genuinely nice. Second, the common areas (lobby bar, courtyard, rooftop) are the best we’ve stayed at in the city. Third, they have rooms with two twin beds- great for families with older kids. And the location is great!!! We love this place!

The hotel is very good. The shower and the bed are very comfortable. The rooms are so clean. Also, the staff are very nice people. Check in and check out were very fast. I recomend this hotel in New York City.

Hip hotel with great lobby and bar. Good ambiance and comfortable location near the underground and walking distance to shops, restaurant and even 9/11 memorial site.Rooms are small as you'd expect in Manhattan but comfy and clean. We also liked the happy hour free drinks at the restaurant.

Arlo Soho Team was so accommodating, friendly and helpful. Thank you for ensuring that my stay was amazing.Not only is the front desk team on the ball but the hotel is super cool and the room had such a cozy vibe. If you go to soho and don’t stay here, you’re missing out!!!

For starters—-yes the rooms are tiny. But you’re staying in NYC to enjoy the city not hang out in your hotel room.Atmosphere of the hotel was warm and welcoming as soon as we entered the lobby including polite staff who were able to accommodate an early check-in time. Hotel room was a courtyard queen which was gorgeous with the bed tucked into an alcove. Amenities in the room includes a steamer and a mini fridge. Storage space under the bed included a safe. Be aware, not a lot of space for privacy so I hope you’re close to whoever you’re staying with. The urban fee includes WiFi, bike rental, and the waters in the room. There is a guest happy hour which includes free beer,wine, and light hors d’oeuvres. Plenty of seating area in the lobby to enjoy a coffee from the Dylan’s mini store. The courtyard mentioned has these cool igloos you can hang out in as well. I could go on about the little things but overall- great atmosphere, clean and friendly staff. Would 100% recommend staying here.

If you want a very small, cleverly designed room with a comfortable bed in a hotel that has cozy common spaces to hang out in, the Arlo Soho is great. This was my first stay and I loved it. The staff was friendly and helpful throughout the three days. (An especial shout out to Lindsey Gershberg at the front desk!) The room, with a view out onto Hudson Street, was clean and quiet. I especially liked the shower, which had excellent pressure and lots of hot water. On the first evening, I went to the Digital Detox Happy Hour at the restaurant off the lobby. (Most people were on their phones, but that was hardly a surprise.) Decent snacks and really good beer--included as part of the fee you pay to stay there. You can catch the 1 train at Canal Street a block or so away, so getting around the West Side is particularly easy. The only complaint I have is that the fitted sheet on the bed had a big old tear in it. I'm happy to give Arlo SoHo five stars, and I plan to stay there again soon.

My wife and I secured an incredible rate from Travel-zoo for a Friday in December. Even though we live an hour from the city, sleeping over is a treat. ARLO staff and property meet and then exceeded our expectations. Excellent but unusual location near the Holland Tunnel yet really was perfect and avoided the mid-town craziness this time of year. The entire front desk team, Harold's restaurant staff amazing and helpful. Wine, beer and small snacks was a nice surprise. Rooms are tiny and suggest you keep your shaded closed for privacy. Would stay again

I want to love this hotel. The location is ideal if you want to be on the west sideas it’s centrally located in Soho. While the rooms are small, they have everything one could need. The 24h bodega is great for late arrivals and early mornings. And the on-site restaurant has good food. The staff was friendly at both the hotel and restaurant. Unfortunately, despite all this we had to leave the hotel after one night because we couldn’t sleep. I’d called ahead to ask for a quiet room and the staff assured me I would be fine in a courtyard room. At 2am, my two-year-old and I were still awake due to the horns, sirens, and police announcements. I felt like I was in the Holland Tunnel. In all my travels around the world, I’m not sure I’ve ever stayed in a hotel that was louder. I appreciate the hotel letting me cancel the rest of my stay (which is why I’m giving three stars instead of one).

I am planning an upcoming staycation at this property where I luckily had the chance to see the property in person when it first opened and stopped by a few weeks ago to ask some questions. It's a beautiful property in an amazing location, but what really stands out the most is the staff, especially Lindsey at the front desk. She was so helpful in answering all my questions about my upcoming surprise stay in spring 2019 and I cannot thank her enough for all the recommendations and ease in planning a surprise for my girlfriend and I for our anniversary. I'm looking forward to my stay thanks to Lindsey's help, thanks Arlo!

I travel back-and-forth to NYC a lot for work and Lindsey at the front desk always takes care of me and makes sure that I can easily book a hotel for my work travel and is incredibly helpful onsite whenever I see her. She's one of the main reasons I keep coming back!

If your business takes you to anywhere in Lower Manhattan, this place is great. Hotel has many amenities on site. But there are also great places to eat and visit in the neighborhood. Will go back as often as I can and can't wait to get back here.

Great location - walking distance to the many good restaurants of Soho / Greenwich. 20 mins to Central Park and 15 to WTC. We found the hotel a great location to explore - as we like to walk a lot. Hotel very clean and super friemndly. The inclusive Happy Hour was a bonus too and we really appreciated this. Loved this hotel and would return.

The only reason I don’t give it a five star review is we never once had a cleaner in the room for 4 days. So stuff like the bin never got emptied etc. The staff were great and friendly and I would recommend this place to anyone.

My boyfriend and I have stayed at both NoMad and Soho Arlo hotel. Both AMAZING but we both said if you want a calmer experience away from the busier part of NYC... stay at Soho! So beautiful and definitely less hectic. As always, you will never have an issue with staff, cleanliness, and comfort as all are beyond 5 stars. Arlo is always a home away from home and always welcoming. We will never stay at another hotel in NYC because Arlo Hotels just beats them all!

The Arlo was the perfect base for our weekend in New York, very comfortable and stylish with a relaxed vibe. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and the room although small had everything we needed and the beds were very comfortable. We will definitely stay again.

This hotel has some of the most friendly staff in NYC, which is hard to find. Lindsey at the front desk is a do it all/ go getter! She always remembers us and she takes care of us as if we are family. Thank you for all that you do:) see you soon!

Arlo is one of THE best boutique hotels in NYC. The staff has become family to me. Lindsey at the front desk understands service and hospitality more than any one I have encountered. The over night crew are so welcoming, no matter what time of late night or early morning it is. I cant thank everyone there enough for all that they do. also, it smells so good!

For empty-nesters, minimizing is desirable. The Arlo was our first micro-room hotel. It was incredibly comfortable and efficient. We slept so well, later than normal. The room was quiet and very comfortable, although small. The amenities made up for the size of the room. We took advantage of the happy hour, the comfortable lobby for morning coffee and reading the paper, the courtyard "tents" for relaxing with a glass of wine. It was a unique experience. The location was so convenient, lots of good restaurants and sighs within walking distance. We would definitely go back to the Arlo.

So, the rooms are small, but very functional. I was there on business, it worked for me. I was happy I did the room with the double beds, co-worker had a king/suite which had the balcony but the bed took up too much space. Greeted with a nice glass of prosecco. Had the coupon for the ice cream but we missed it (timing). We did go up to the roof top, nice space (stick to wine or something). I'm adapable, and I loved the vibe of the hotel. Wasn't a vacation, so the room was functional for me. The restaurant was great!
user_name:
MyOyster5
New York City, New York

review_body: We had a great time there before Thanksgiving. The main areas are interesting and filled with people working, socializing and just hanging out. The crowd was a good mix of locals and guests. We ate at the bar and it was really good - best hummus I have ever had! The rooftop deck was spectacular -- and the bar portion was fun with a dj and very attentive bartender. Our rooms were small, but very easy to operate in. We had 2 connecting rooms (through our own small hallway!) one bunk room and one King bed room. Loved them both -- really well designed and outfitted. I thought the small rooms would be a problem, but they were not, they were perfect! Happy to go again and have recommended it to friends. LOVE!!!

I’ve stayed at the Arlo Soho numerous times over the past year and can just say that it keeps getting better and better, starting from an already high position. The environment and shared areas are very social, perfect for the business or leisure traveller who wants some movement in the lobby and different bars/restaurants to visit. The rooms are small, but perfectly planned and the bed by the window with flatscreen in front creates a cozy atmosphere. Always clean and modern design. Last but not least - the team is exceptional! All staff are extremely helpful, service minded and really go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. Be sure to ask Lindsey Gershberg in the front desk about the latest restaurants and bars in the area; she’ll hook you up with reservations, or at least recommendations, that will make your trip even more memorable and unique. Arlo Soho gets a solid 10/10.

The rooms are the perfect size for businessmen/women or tourists who will spend a majority of their time on the go. Always a clean room and comfortable bed to come "home" to, and great shared spaces (highly recommend the rooftop bar when weather allows for it). The lobby staff is exceptional, always greeting you with a smile and making your stay as comfortable as possible. A special shout out to Lindsey who has recommended some of the best food I have enjoyed in NYC!

Brought my 16 year old daughter for birthday trip - so perfect! Great amenities and room. Loved shopping and restaurants close to hotel. Thank you to Arlo staff for your professionalism and friendliness. We will be back!

The Arlo provides a refreshing hotel experience with a smart and very efficient room footprint. The compact accommodations provided a luxe experience without wasted space. The King bed was tucked into a wood surronded nook with a TV at the foot of the bed and two lights at the head for reading. Motorized shades cover the expansive window and the whole experience was that of a fine cruise ship cabin! The clever combo layout of shower stall and toilet area provided enough space, although it's not sound proof. The slim vanity had a large sink, ample counter space for toiletries, adequate hanging space is provided, and you can tuck your luggage and shoes in ample storage provided beneath the bed. Such a smart design! We had quick, professional service at check in/out and enjoyed the hip bar/restaurant ambiance. Highly recommend!

I used to love in NYC for 14 years and moved back to Chicago - spent a weekend in NYC recently and always trying to find a great hotel - FOUND IT in Arlo Soho - great quality, service, amenities! Hotel staff are wonderful and helpful and welcoming! I can’t wait to stay here again on my next trip!

I loved Arlo and will most certainly be back. It's got that hip, downtown vibe, but it's not over the top on the attitude. It's a friendly, easy place to hang out that just happens to have clean lines. Everything you need--outlets, 24 hour bodega downstairs, super comfortable beds and amazing showers--are there. But there's no waste and silly lux elements that nobody needs.

Visited Arlo over the Thanksgiving weekend and it really felt like home! We were checked in by beautiful and gracious Zina who accommodated our every need and was beaming with happiness about her upcoming wedding! She really made us feel like the Arlo was her home and we were her guests. Sharing all about her life and exciting adventures in the city we immediately felt welcomed and connected - by other staff members throughout the weekend. We were very surprised by the complimentary happy hour at the bar every night and again the bartenders made us truly feel like family. In such a short stay we felt so comfortable, away from the touristy (worst) parts of Manhattan, Arlo is located walking distance from all brilliant restaurants and bars, and Bubby’s - the best brunch in the city. Overall Arlo was great- made better by Zina and other happy to be there staff !

Well, we have unusual needs. I travel with my daughter while she works so that she can keep her infant/toddler close.This is our second trip to Arlo Soho and I am quite impressed and pleased with the amazing customer service and vibrant scene. They have worked with us to find the perfect solution for rooming and have helped us out when our needs have changed, Arlo is many things: comfortable and impeccable rooms, home away from home for a diverse international clientele, youthful travelers, office for distance workers and unique gathering place for the evenings. I’ve suggested the Arlo to family because it is quite a gem in NYC.Tonight, they are hosting a free party for Guests complete with complimentary drink and band. The music is uniquely vibrant and soulful. Alternating undulating types like “Smoothe Operator” with great beats for singing and dancing.The options for food are great. There is a coffee bar with pastries, small plates, sandwiches and various bagged snacks.Then, there is Harold’s. This morning Baby D and I had a great breakfast from the buffet. Scrumptious! On our prior trip, I enjoyed the Cobb salad (like no other) and an excellent caprese type plate. The food at Harold’s is delicious, very creative and alive. Staff are very accommodating and pleasantly attentive.

Arlo is a gorgeous hotel in a very convenient and easy to get to location. We stayed in a courtyard view room with a queen bed.The Good:-Staff at the front desk was very welcoming and pleasant to dealt with.-The hotel lobby, bar, "library"/lounge, and outdoor area are modern, beautiful, and relaxing spaces to spend some time in - to the point where you'd almost just want to hang out there and not leave the hotel. The bar had fantastic drinks and delicious small plates. My wife and I didn't eat at the restaurant or go to the roof bar as we had other plans, but I have no doubt they would have been excellent spots to visit.-The room - while small - was a nice, cozy space fit with everything required for a short stay in NYC. The bed was comfortable, lighting was just right, the TV was new. We visit the city to go out, not to spend all of our time in our room, so the size wasn't bothersome. I mean, how much square footage do you really need?-Fast elevators. Seems silly, but I've stayed places where it would take what felt like an eternity to get up to your room.The Cons:-I know I just said I didn't mind the size of the room - and I still don't - but there were a couple small details that annoyed me. First of all, the fact that the bathroom door is just a sliding glass door that suppresses literally ZERO sound is irritating. Not to mention, even when it's all the way closed, you can still see in to the bathroom through a crack. There's almost no privacy when using it. The other thing that was a little just a minor inconvenience was the fact that the space between the front of the bed and the TV was just a little too small to make walking to the other side of the bed more difficult.-I'm not sure if it was a surprise or if I just didn't read the fine print well enough when I booked, but we had to pay an "urban fee" for each night. I'm still not entirely sure what this was for, but was kind of annoyed that this extra fee was tacked on.-It may be kind of unfair to include this as a con as it's to be expected in NYC, but you have to pay $55 per 24 hour period to have your car parked in a garage (with no in-and-out privileges). Fortunately there is a valet service that will park it for you. We had to wait about 20-30 minutes for them to get the car on the day of check out, but we called ahead prior to leaving our room and it wasn't really a big deal. I just wanted to mention this because parking is usually one of the first things I look at when searching for a place to stay in the city.Overall I really enjoyed this hotel. I know I gave it 4 stars, but really it's closer to 5. Would certainly stay here again.

The room is tiny, this the extremely cozy. There’a a king size bed, a very small bathroom, and that’s it. The flat screen tv hangs by the end of the bed. Is small, but has everything you need for a good night rest. Not the place if you plan to spend a lot of time in the room.But there’s so much to do in NYC, should get out and explore!

I loved my stay at the Arlo. It's in a near perfect New York location. The hotel is immaculately clean, and hip without being pretentious. The front desk staff was warm, friendly and went out of the way to be kind. It sets the stage for every interaction at the hotel. I love the common areas, especially the Soho Bodega/Dylan's Candy Bar in the front, and the Lobby Bar, with its free happy hour for guests, that was packed. It was the perfect way to mingle with other guests. The hotel describes the rooms as "micro guest rooms that combine flexible, modern furniture with efficient storage spaces and a range of playful touches." It's true. The rooms are great. Very thoughtfully designed but micro means tiny. It was great for me as I was alone but I do wonder how a couple would have fit into the space. The only problem I had with the hotel is there wasn't an on-site gym. However, they do offer off-site access to gyms and classes for which they charge an Urban Fee, an additional $29.00 fee per night, plus tax. That fee covers things like wi-fi, the happy hour, and local and domestic phone calls. I hate this new phenomenon of Urban Fees many hotels are doing. Mostly they charge for things other hotels provide for free like wi-fi, and gym access, or things you don't need like the happy hour which was cool but voluntary, and who uses phones at hotels when everyone has a cell? All in all, I loved the Arlo. I'd definitely stay there again. Even with its shortcomings, room size and the Urban Fee, the style of the hotel and the service makes up for it.

Absolutely amazing service, fast, professional & trendy. Perfect for my boyfriend and I for the night. Small but the use of the room is very intelligent & the bed it extremely comfortable. They provided a steamer as well which was amazing to freshen up our clothes before we went out. Highly recommend avoiding taking a taxi/uber/lyft as SoHo is very busy.

The vibe, the service, the location, the common spaces, all made our stay at the Arlo really great! Rooms are quite small, but everything else totally makes up for it. Would recommend and will definitely come back!

I loved so much about the hotel. The front-desk service was just great. Couldn’t have been more friendly and helpful. Great location. Reasonable price. Cool feel, rooms nice. But the heating system adjusts in such a loud fashion that it woke me throughout the night, every 20 minutes or so a series of clangs as the temperature dipped and the heat adjusted. In the morning, to their credit, the front desk said ‘yeah, it’s an issue with our hotel.’ I said I’d love to come again if they could solve the problem but it didn’t sound like it was something that could be fixed. It’s a shame.

Loved my quick one-night stay at the Arlo (I flew in late at night and was moving in with friends the next day). I'd recommended it to anyone looking for a reasonably priced, well located hotel downtown. Loved the modern feel and New York street view. Compact rooms expertly designed to make the most of the space. Could be tight with several suitcases but perfect for a solo traveller like me, or couples who pack light. A 10-15 minute walk to Spring Street and the buzz of Soho. Loved the body wash so much I bought it downstairs in their store when I checked out. I'd definitely stay here again!

The hotel is nice and the restaurant serves great food, brunch, lunch and dinner. I think the hotel has the best prices compared to other hotels in NY. Rooms are small but cute and with a look out to the court yard. The hotel is located in a nice neighborhood in NYC. I will come back again..
user_name:
Dreamer50840196260
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The decor of the rooms we liked very much - we were fortunate to get a room with one of the "bed boxes" right at the window.The rest of the hotel is also great designed.The rooms and the whole hotel are very clean, the service was excellent and the food for breakfast and dinner also delicious.We had a wonderful time and will definitely come back.

We stayed at Arlo for three days. Overall great service, I was very pleased with the rooms which were compact those current. Arlo is a short walk to Soho, for me perfect.We ate at the restaurant on Friday 23rd Nov 18 in afternoon, the food, service and drinks were all to perfection, we were wowed. We returned Saturday evening for more drinks and were equally impressed. The attention to detail remained impressive, drinks made with such experience and attention to detail. Unfortunately we did dine there again on the Sunday and our drinks were not measured properly, they were far to sweet, uneven and the service was just ok. this was unfortunate.

I loved this hotel- super homey! If there'd been an in-room coffeemaker, life would've been complete. :) The bed was super comfy, Harold's food was amazing, and having Dylan's Candy Bar (dark chocolate almonds are a travel must for me!) in the lobby was fantastic. Blind Barber products smelled incredible and were really rejuvenating, too.

This is my second stay at the hotel - I love the location near to great bars and restaurants. It’s also one block from the Hudson River for morning walks. The lobby / bar / work areas are always busy, a great space for working and socialising day and night. Rooms are small but all you need for a few days stay. Staff are brilliant and so welcoming. I’ll definitely choose to stay here again on my next visit

I’ve been traveling to NYC for many years and most recently spent four nights at the Arlo Soho in November 2018. This is now one of my favourite hotels in the city. It is very comfortable and friendly. Has a wonderful bar and restaurant (Harold’s) and a very social happy hour. Had a great time chatting with other travelers. Great location, a short walk from excellent Soho restaurants. Very close to several subway stops for an easy and quick trip uptown to the theatre district. Especially loved the Ear Inn around the corner on Spring Street.

Rooms are small but no different than other comparable properties! Really cute aesthetic. Nice staff, great location. Truly would recommend to anyone visiting city! I didn’t get a chance to visit the bar but it was packed when I walked by! Close spots to check out Maman NYC and Greca for coffee!

Loved everything about our stay at the Arlo. Staff were so incredibly warm and friendly, the room we stayed in was cozy and cute, and my boyfriend was very surprised and grateful for the complimentary beers at happy hour. We don’t have a single complaint and would definitely recommend this cute and cozy hotel. <3
user_name:
Tsivia F
New York City, New York

review_body: Amazing hotel , wonderful staff and consumer experience , great strategic location , perfect functional room layout , cool lounge . We’ll be back for sure . Love the design of the interiors , the colors , textures and cozy relaxing vibe .

All in all, this is a great hotel - great location, super friendly staff, comfy rooms - the only problem was, there was no real space to leave your stuff. A small cupboard would be enough for that. Other than that, def. recommend staying here.

arlo soho is a really good value for nyc. it’s closer to hudson than the soho shops and food. likes:-great value for the price -super efficiently arranged room-strong water pressure shower-very comfy bed with stylish wood alcove and big tv overlooking bed-love the usb outlets in bed and desk-nightly happy hour w free beer wine and snacks-nice toiletries dislikes:-the in room heater hvac is super noisy; it comes on frequently in winter if you thermostat to 70 or higher-rooms are tiny; ok for 1 person (guy) with minimal toiletries but might be challenging for 2 people or anyone that travels with a lot of stuff-minimal storage for hanging or storing clothes-don’t buy anything from the hotel store ($8 for a can of beer!)

Got the terrace rooms. The terrace was nice, ALMOST made up for the room. I have never seen such a tiny hotel roomNice bar and atmosphere. Didn’t go to the restaurant tho. But...The price was right for NYC.

We stayed here for four nights, which then we had to stretch to five due to a flight change, and from minute one all the staff, from the front desk to the bar and restaurant, were superb, friendly and would do anything to help enhance our stay. (Shout out to Nate behind the bar!)Free happy hour for guests in Harold’s from 5:30-7:00 is a great touch, and the food there is top drawer too (the smoky aubergine tabbouleh is other-worldly). The location is perfect for wandering around the neighbourhoods of Soho and the Village, and it’s easy to get anywhere with subway stops within easy reach.The rooms are small, but functional and comfy (although I wasn’t a massive fan of the pillows, but apparently I have cheap taste in pillows!!) and the decor of the whole place is awesome. All in all, it’s a great place to stay, and I would definitely return again!

Cool, trendy young persons hotel that's a short walk from the heart of Soho. 3 bars to choose from including the ace rooftop bar which was great. Rooms are small but this is widely advertised so shouldn't be a surprise. Very comfy bed although there is some noise bleed from other rooms and if you are low to the ground, you can hear the traffic. Staff were generally excellent although I think they could be a tad warmer - it sometimes felt a bit fake and things on occasion seemed a bit too much effort. Atmosphere was good in the bars and the decor was spot on too. I'd say there were a few too many people just sitting around on laptops though, taking up a lot of the space. Would stay here again, overall my experience was a very good one.

Great space. Comfortable rooms. Spacious common areas. Pleasant music playing while working downstairs. Not much todo in the neighborhood except work. Cute greenhouses for sitting in the cold outside. Heading to the rooftop now

No doubt about it, the rooms are tiny, but very well appointed. Stayed two nights for a business trip at the end of October and this was near perfect. Great shared spaces downstairs for working with co-workers, couches, an outside patio area -- too cold for sitting, but nice space. The hotel reminds me more of a high-end dorm than hotel. The ONLY thing that was sneaky was throwing in a $32/per night "Urban Fee" after staying. They snuck this in AFTER checkout. When I called to inquire I was told this was for some shared services likes WiFi, TV, "water", and bikes? Seriously?? Why not include this fee into the price of the room? These discovered fees after staying are questionable. Wondering how these are even legal. I don't like fees showing up on my credit card - after the fact.

We stayed here for one night for a SoHo wedding. The location was excellent. Staff were extremely friendly and professional. Rooms were cozy and clean, but NYC small. Our "city view" room looked out at another building and down at a dumpster, so not much of a view. Great vibe overall. Price was reasonable for New York. We'd stay here again.
user_name:
walkerbh
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: What the rooms lack in size, the hotel more than makes up for in every other department. From the swanky lobby and lounge areas to the super comfy beds and amazing toiletries. This will be our go-to hotel in New York for future visits. The location on Hudson is perfect - super close to lots of great eateries on both Hudson and Greenwich St. The complimentary happy hour on several days of the week is a nice touch and a social way to get to know fellow travellers.

Stayed because it was near my company’s new NY office. This area is much more interesting than the numbered, gridded streets of mid-town Manhattan. The hotel is friendly, there’s a good atmosphere in the bar, the restaurant is fine (if a bit slow). Rooms are “cosy” — read incredibly small. In the one I’m in, the bed is literally fitted across the end of the room, touching the walls at head and foot. For all that it’s a well-designed space with good amenities. Minus one star because the rooms are so small it’s the first American hotel I’ve ever been in where there is no iron and ironing board. They give you a steamer, which sort of works but is much slower and generally lame.

In November 2018, a travel group of 18 of us visited NYC and stayed at the Arlo SoHo for 4 nights. Kate was a joy to work with in securing the rooms for our group! The location was perfect for the things we wanted to see and do in Downtown and Mid-town Manhattan. We loved the common areas where we could get together as a group in the mornings and evenings. The rooms are small (Arlo SoHo is advertised as a micro-hotel after all!) but extremely efficiently put together. The staff were all amazing, including Eddie - who provided recommendations for nearby restaurants, Chris - who bar tended during several of the happy hours we attended at Harold's (Arlo SoHo's restaurant), and Felix at the rooftop bar who crafted a cocktail specifically for me after I told him some things I did and didn't like in a drink! And we were so glad we discovered Amelia's Diner one block over on Varick St for breakfast near the beginning of our stay!!!
