We also took advantage of the car service to JFK offered by the hotel at the end of our stay. We would definitely recommend Arlo SoHo to anyone wanting to stay in the SoHo area of NY.

Pleasant staff and a trendy vibe make this place a good choice if you’re looking to spend time in Soho, Tribeca and West Village, which I was. Easily walkable everywhere. Only downside was the room takes the prize for the smallest hotel room I’ve ever stayed in in my life! That said, I was travelingnaolo and had everything I needed in a room well planned out for functionality and efficiency.

My week at the Arlo Soho was very comfortable. Small, but nicely appointed rooms, mine had a great terrace, comfy common rooms, a nice rooftop bar, and a good location. The 24/7 coffee and snack bar was a plus.The best thing absolutely was the friendly and accommodating staff, I will stay here again just because the service was so good.

I was excited to try out the Arlo Soho after staying at the Arlo Nomad last time. The hotel is in a great location with friendly staff. The happy hour was great but disappointed to find out the rooftop was closed. The rooms are small which is fine but my only complaint was we paid more for a City View and there were two bright spot lights beaming into our room every night... our room was so bright we didn't get a great sleep. If you are looking for a hotel that is in a good area with a great vibe I recommend it but prefer Arlo Nomad.

This hotel has the NYC vibe totally. Amazing service throughout in the restaurant, sitting areas, rooftop, and marketplace stores. Rooms are small (Typical NYC) but so comfortable, automated, and cool. Location is close to everything that is popular in NYC.

I loved my stay at Arlo. From the moment you walk in you are greeted with a relaxed, differentiated and modern atmosphere. This is not your typical hotel. From the amazing views at the rooftop bar, to the inviting and cosy lobby, modern rooms and ‘digital detox’ happy hour, it was a great experience. If you are looking for a unique downtown stay that has personality, comfort and great customer service, then this is the place for you.

First stay at the Arlo following recommendation. It’s got a great vibe with some great bars. Big plus for this place is happy hour between 1700-1900 which offers a selection of FREE wine and beer, not surprising it can get a little busy. Nice communal areas that you can chill, watch telly, eat or socialise with fellow travelers. The hotel is conveniently located close to West Broadway and Soho.On leaving the hotel immediate left two blocks you’ll find Westville which does great cocktails and has a reasonably priced menu (again happy hour 6-8) great margaritas! They do an amazing market vegetable plate (fellow vegetarians this was a nice find!)Rooms are New York compact but faultlessly clean and stylishly finished. Hotel doesn’t have a gym on site, however you can access for free local gym a short distance from hotel. Leftnof hotel you’ll find a pharmacist (24hr) ATM and a Pret for that all important breakfast beverage. Staff are extremely helpful.

Amazing Staff, nice amenities, the only thing I'd say they are missing is an in-house workout facility. (they do provide a gym pass of a nearby gym) Thank you to the Arlo Team and the Harolds Resturant!

I have stayed at the Arlo Soho Hotel three times in the last year and I have loved it every time. The staff is kind, helpful and supportive. Everyone is there to take care of anything you need. The coffee in the lobby is the pick-me-up that everyone needs :) The last time I was there Lindsey went out of her way to make sure that myself and my colleagues had everything we needed. My colleagues and I travel to NYC for work a few times a year and Arlo Soho is always at the top of my list! Thank you!

You walk through the doors and are immediately welcomed by the Arlo’s signature scent of Lemongrass, making you feel all warm and fuzzy immediately.And you’re then suddenly in the middle of a sweet shop! Right inside the door. I mean, helllloooo sugar needs! The rooms here aren’t huge but hey, it’s NYC, get out of your room and see the city. The rooms are clean, modern and temp controlled so we were very comfortable for 6 nights. And good beds!But it’s everything else about this hotel that makes the stay so unique. They have movie nights a few times a week. We curled up on the big sofas, were given some free popcorn and enjoyed Almost Famous.The 1.5 hour happy hour of free wine, beer and Prosecco of course was popular with the Brits and Irish that we are. And all the other guests of said nationality. I loved coming here in October, the orchard is full of pumpkins and other burnt orange decor, which I love. They even have their own bikes you can borrow, for goodness sake!And when we got engaged the staff were so nice to gift us some goodies in congratulations. Oh, and if you gym regularly they have a deal with a nearby NYC gym and you can get a pass to use it. I love the location too. You’re away from the hubbub of midtown and strolling around SoHo of an evening is calming and enjoyable with a number of unique places to eat. I’d go back in a heartbeat. Thanks for an amazing stay. ❤️

My best friend flew in from VA; we were going to see Elton John at MSG and I wanted a great hotel on the west side downtown and we were not disappointed. Reasonably priced, extremely comfortable bed and super quiet! The roof top bar is stunning. My only complaint was too much salt on my Cobb salad in the lobby restaurant.

My whole experience from booking through to my 8 days stay was amazing. This is my second time staying. The location is perfect - close to subway stations, financial district, water front, Soho, Greenwich Villiage etc. Coffee at their mini café downstairs is great (and I am from Melb so very fussy on when it comes to a hot flat white!). The healthy snacks and drinks area also very convenient.Their restaurant downstairs is fabulous and if you are looking for healthy, quick salad with fillet of salmon is delicious. Their staff are very focused on service and a huge call out to the both the night manager and Linsey. They are happy to help with any sort of recommendation you need from theatre, to local funky restaurants, bars, shopping and anything else you may need. The common area atmosphere is terrific and very chilled. The rooftop has great views and their free happy hour has delicious snacks and a selection of prosecco, wine etc.. I would also recommend their service to the airport - they will book it, the car arrives early and drops you right where you need to go.

This hotel is marketed for people in there 20’s and 30’s. Before staying here go and spend 30 minutes in a Holister Store. If you can cope with the noise and low lighting them maybe this hotel is for you. It’s loud and trendy. Staff are really friendly and the hotel is very clean.However, the bedrooms are small, the Queen room led us to believe the bed was large. This is not the case. The bed is a standard double size. The staff did offer to move use to a room with a “king size” bed. The down siide of this is the foot of the bed is against the wall and one side of the bed is against the well. This is a big issue if you are over 6 ft tall. Therefore, you are stuffed if you need the toilet in the middle of the night. There are no tea and coffee facilities in the room. You have to go down to the reception coffee shop to buy a coffee in the morning.Disappointed overall. Expect a trendy travel lodge and not 4 star and you won’t be disappointed. Staff were really nice though!

My new husband and I spent two nights here as a mini getaway after our wedding. The service at the hotel was wonderful and the location was perfect for everything we wanted to do in SoHo and lower Manhattan. Great bar too! Yes, the rooms are on the small side, but we spent most of our time out and about anyways. There's always room to hang out downstairs. And the beds are super comfy!

Nicely located on lower Manhattan, close to where I work. It has almost a backpacker feel to it despite the address and price, but I like the relaxed and modern atmosphere. The only negative aspect is that the rooms are really tiny.

This hotel is trendy, comfortable, and has a staff that goes the extra mile to make you feel comfortable. The lobby area is elegant and a good place to relax. Is spite of being rather small, the room offered everything that you may need when traveling, with an extraordinary attention to details. We felt welcome at check-in and during our stay of 4 nights. The personnel is young and attentive. The hotel features a terrace bar that offers a good view of the city.

I have stayed at the Arlo Soho 4 times and continue to choose this boutique hotel whenever I visit NYC. As soon as you walk in to the lobby, a friendly hospitable staff greets you (The mini Dylan's Candy Bar is an added and sweet welcome)! The buffet breakfast is unparalleled to any other upscale restaurant in the city! The rooms are quaint and comfortable but be aware that they are small. There is a roof top bar with beautiful views of the city and the drinks are exceptional. It is truly my home away from home!

We stayed in a double room with a terrace. It's the fourth time I've been to NYC and I would definitely consider staying here again. Great location and friendly staff. My only criticism is the bodega was style over substance.

I normally stay in LES but tried out Soho for a change. The hotel is situated in a quiet street but just 10 minutes' walk away from the East Village (if you don't want to go far, the Ear Inn is one block away and worth a visit). When I arrived at the hotel, the reception staff were incredibly helpful and responsive. As you would expect, the room was modern, clean with a small terrace overlooking Soho. What really makes Arlo different is their flexibility around check-out times when it's often important to get changed or take a shower before heading off to the airport. That flexibility is, quite simply, invaluable and for that reason alone is worth considering a stay here.
user_name:
Steve D
New York City, New York

review_body: Could not ask for a better service. And when all the other relevant dimensions are considered perfect (location, facilities, comfort, etc), which was actually the case, it’s the service that makes the difference. Hats off!

During our two night stay all the stay all of the staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The hotel was a lovely with a relaxed atmosphere and great vibe. Superbly placed for walking to Greenwich village, NoHo, Chinatown and of course Soho.

Music different from lift to corridor to restaurant , poor window insulation noise from street constant roof top bar music heard in our room so noise noise noise solution use Arlo umbrella provided to press between window and bed to create a better seal use earplugs to sleep .The safe position could have been put between bed and window this would make it easier to slide 2 suitcases under bed on other side , all staff where professional courteous and smiling from room maids to lobby staff.

This was at least our 20th visit to NYC and we were very disappointed with the accommodations. The staff were friendly but the rooms were way too small for two people with luggage. The hotel was okay until we checked out and learned there was an additional $32 “urban fee” per day. When checking in they tell you there is free wifi and a drink @ happy hour. When checking out they add there is also access to bikes, water in the room and a gym close by. It’s not free, you have to pay. We did not use any of these amenities other than the bikes for 2 hours on our last day. We tried many times to get the bikes but they were always out so we had to go elsewhere to hire bikes. They charge $3.75 for a tiny coffee......they could at lest have included that! Rooms are clean and kept every day. We would not recommend this hotel unless you are travelling alone and willing to pay an extra $32 per day for the amenities mentioned above but not mentioned at check in.

Staff really makes this place a better place! welcoming and helpfull!Location is simply perfect, and common area so comfortable (Great roof top bar and coffee shop on the ground floor)the SMALL room was cozy and intelligently designed!I think is a perfect place for a business trip!Highly recommend.

Hi There, The hotel is very well located and proposes a very intimate boutik hotek environment ! Afterwards, different elements clearly differentiating from a 4 stars hotel :Poor restaurant quality, Watching a movie on the big in the comon facility area, then 3 guys from maintenance team show up and turn off the movie you were looking at, throw away you popcorn without notice although you’ve been telling you were watching....Their night manager comes in and while you remind him that you can do everything to help but they should not forget about the customer. His only will beside gestures is to move you out to some other place so you won’t get preventing them from cleaning on time ...Could just have asked and everything would have turned out in a normal...This is not acceptable.
user_name:
NY-Mandolino
New York City, New York

review_body: More than pleasantly surprised. The whole vibe of the hotel is welcoming and one of community. Food in the restaurant was wonderful and the small room was cozy and intelligently designed so that despite a lack of a lot of space it was easy to move around and use. Every detail in the design and execution of this hotel is wonderful. Will def. stay again.

My husband and I came in last evening for a quick overnight before a business meeting he had nearby this morning. We are so glad we chose to stay here and hope to return soon. The space is lovely, airy and open while at the same time providing many different seating and working areas. There’s even a really cute courtyard area. We very much appreciated the kindness and gracious customer service we received from the lovely Mandy and trainee John last evening and the pleasant and efficient Lindsay today. As I write this, I am sitting comfortably in a chair in one of their upstairs studios, surrounded by young professionals and their laptops. The complimentary happy hour last night was also a treat, as i enjoyed my wine and my husband his beer while we snacked on deviled eggs and 2 other canapés offered. This hotel,is located 15minutes walk from the heart of Greenwich Village where we had lunch and dinner yesterday. If the room was not so small (even for city standards) I’d give this review a 5 instead of a 4. But the shower was awesome.

This hotel is the best hotel I've stayed in by far. Super cute and very chic. The lobby has a candy bar and 24 hour coffee shop. The hotel hotel, Harolds, is fabulous. Highly recommend the Ricotta Gnocci, best I've ever had. Happy hour is between 5-7pm and they serve some small apps too which is perfect right before going out with the girls. Although we found it hard to leave because it was really fun and social. We went Oct 26th weekend and the rooftop had a great Halloween party. Amazing view of the Hudson. The hotel has some gorgeous patios that are heated where you can have a smoke and a drink and relax. It was really hard for us to leave and go anywhere else really but we weren't complaining. The staff are fabulous too. Will definitely be staying there again. Thanks Arlo!

Nice and hip hotel from where we could visit the different parts of the big apple. Nearby there are lots of shops and nice restaurants. In a few minutes we were at the hudsonriver. In 15 minutes at ground zero and the financial district. Metro and bikes are available nearby.

I've stayed in small hotels in New York before, but this one felt really welcoming and efficient. The room had everything you needed without feeling like it was all on top of you. The bath products were really nice, and the room was very clean. The co-working space was perfect to get out of the tiny room and find some space. The front desk staff was incredibly friendly and helpful.
user_name:
j262008
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I have been staying at the ARLO Soho several times now. Their contemporary but warm style combined with their friendly staff is making me feel a like coming home every time I stay there. They have a great "community" area on their first floor which is inviting to just relax and hang out. Despite the fact that the room are fairly small they are well designed and actually have their beds have the best mattresses I slept on in a hotel:-)

My sister and I stayed at the Arlo SOHO while visiting New York for a couple days and we had a great time! The hotel is hip with tons of space to hangout, eat, drink or work in their many open spaces for guests. The rooms are on the smaller side and a bit expensive for the size but well set up so they feel spacious (you really don't need a lot of room because you're out and about all day). At checkin we received vouchers for breakfast buffet which was really good especially all the fresh fruit. We also rented bikes from the hotel which was a lot of fun riding down the west side boardwalk to battery park. I would also like to mention Alyssa who was at the front desk, she was very welcoming, bubbly and helpful! Thanks for an awesome trip, we will be back :-)

The staff is really friendly and also very helpful. The room was beautiful. There is a fantastic rooftop lounge and the lobby and courtyard is very nice as well. I did not want for anything, really fantastic!

Love Arlo - the hotel vibe, location, kind staff and the lovely smell in the corridors. I stay here whenever I am in NYC - although the rooms are small, I do not need much more than this - happy! Recommened

They just understand the modern business traveler. Plenty of open spaces with different moods for co-working, meeting, thinking etc always an outlet for charging nearby. The bars are all fun and engaging with a one of a kind rooftop space and another on the main floor. Food is good. Locationif u are coming in from Newark Airport and have place to go downtown is unmatched.

I have had the pleasure of doing business and visiting NYC and its hotels over two dozen times and I have to hand it down to Arlo hotel it has peaked- the worst ever.I arrived late to my room around 20:00 after a long day and journey, and the front desk girl afforded me keys explaining with a pompous talk about the hotel, that the price does not include an additional 32$ tax. For this, guests were allowed to use the restaurant (which was closed for an event), have two water bottles in the room and free Wi-Fi. Talk about pricy water….  A ridiculously small room awaited me. One in which, you have to climb over your suitcase in order to get into bed-kind. The shower had a curtain shower- not door (of course from recycled materials) yet all water was flowing into toilet area and sink was outside of the room. There was no room for storage, no closet or drawers – just a rack with 4 hangers, and overall the feeling was of being in shoebox. However, I was willing o over look all this if only my door would close. Yet it would not…I went down again to find a pleasant guy and explained to him that I have to go out to a business meeting and that I cannot stay in a room that its door will not fully close. I asked that they either fix the door (which I had a feeling was not doable) or find me another room when I am back. When back at 23:00 I found that my door had not been fixed and asking to receive another room I was asked to wait for over an hour to fix the door. By that time I was tired, irritated, and demanded to talk to a manager. The manager although in a room nearby would not come out and only 15 minutes later provided me another room. I moved to another room. Hurray! It was larger. Well it still did not have a closet or sink at the bathroom but I could get into bed without climbing over my suitcase. So I happily I took a shower and then going to the sink to brush teeth I opened taps. To my astonishment, the sink had no drainpipes!!! All the water came gushing on the floor on my suitcase and feet! Now I needed to dry my suitcase and hair as I had an early flight. When I tried to use the hairdryer, it did not work. But by that time, I already understood the concept. I knew it, The problem is not with hairdryer – the problem was with the electricity. I was so tried I figured I probably should solve this on my own. I went one out-put after the other until I found one that had electricity working and YES – hairdryer working. I guess if it was not so sad, it was very funny. By 2 AM, I was dead tired just wanted to go to sleep. Fell immediately asleep only to be awakened by someone trying to enter my room as they forgot to change the room with the other person who had the key!However, the best part – when I complained in the morning- I got my 32$ back- Hurray!STAY AWAY!!!

Fantastic hotel with a great vibe! Me and Mum loved it! Would absolutely stay again! Staff were great and couldn't be more helpful. Happy Hour at Harold's was an added bonus with free wine and nibbles.....we loved it!

For the last 18 months, the Arlo SoHo has been my home away from home! The entire staff from booking, front desk and coffee bar are an absolute joy. Like home, I can work from the living room-like lobby at 6am or until the wee hours and the daily events include movie nights, amazing live music, rooftop workouts and happy hours where I can host friends. And it’s in the best location — at the intersection of SoHo, the West Villlage and TriBeCa -accessible to all my favorite downtown spots. I love the Arlo even more with every stay!

I stayed at the Arlo for two nights for a work conference. The room was shockingly small at first but decorated to maximize space. The bed was super comfy, the rain head shower head was fantastic and the hotel has lots of nooks to spend time or have a drink outside of your room. I probably wouldn’t stay here for a sightseeing trip but it was great for a work trip.

This has not been my third time visiting this hotel, and every time it gets better and better. The reason being is because Caroline and Rey always go above and beyond to see that I’m having a great stay. I was truly craving a NY slice, and almost everywhere was closed. Instead of sulking a turning back to my room without , Caroline called me from the desk to inform that there was in deed a place open, ready to deliver, and took the initiative to place the order. As I sit here enjoying the slice that made my night, I send so much thanks to Rey for the recommendation, Caroline for the execution, and the Arlo for making my stay always so memorable. Can’t wait to come back and visit my Arlo family.
user_name:
curlfactor
New York City, New York

review_body: Probably the most comfortable bed I ever slept in. The rooms are small but stylish, very cool. Great bathroom. Nice restaurant, great rooftop bar. The location is near everything you need. I was so impressed my first visit I am telling all my friends. Just a fabulous stay!

I was taking my 16th year old daughter on her first trip to NYC and the Arlo SoHo was the perfect venue - on walking distance from Canal Street Station and even Highline Park. The staff is both very kind and very helpful. The overall atmosphere is the hotel is very relaxed. Our room was located on the 9th floor with a terrace. The latter being very convenient for privacy reasons.

Spent 5 nights at the Arlo. Reminded me a lot of my Citizen M experience in the UK. Very small but comfortable room. I opted for the Courtyard room as I wanted peace and quiet. 24/7 shop downstairs. Free drinks at happy hour every night at the time of my stay. Conveniently located as walking distance from Canal street station and Cristopher Street station if you are taking the Path to NJ.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Arlo SoHo. Contemporary style with a young vibe. Not stuffy at all. The attached restaurant is very good at least for breakfast. Very nice rooftop deck and bar with city views.

It’s in the perfect place to explore SoHo, and about 20 minutes away from the Brooklyn area. My room was clean, had a super comfortable bed and a large TV screen. The lobby staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

Location, Location, Location. Need I say more? You want to get the best of NYC and you get that with a stay at the Arlo SoHo. Great staff, comfy bed, warm and modern vibe. This place has everything, even bikes that you can use to get around Chinatown and Little Italy nearby. Can't wait to get back and take another bite of the Big Apple!

Lounge spaces are very inviting and comfortable. Service at bar and restaurant was great! Staff was very friendly and helpful. Location was very conveinent. We will definitely stay here on next trip to NYC

The staff performs very well, the rooms are small but comfortable, the restaurant is good, the community spaces are funA személyzet nagyon jól végzi a dolgát, a szobák kicsik, de kényelmesek, az étterem jó, a közösségi terek hivogatóak.

Cool lounge spaces, especially rooftop terrace, nice decor, friendly staff, comfortable beds, nice shower head, clean, nice downtown location...only downside was very small guest rooms for the price, definitely pack light.

Great hotel with awesome amenities (24 hour store, bar, rooftop bar, cozy lounges) in a great location. The service was excellent and everything you need in the rooms. Beds were comfy too. Right in SoHo and next to Tribeca. Not far Brooklyn and Wall Street area too. Easy to get a cab/uber and also close to subway lines.

I stayed at the Arlo Soho for 3 weeks and enjoyed every minute of it. Staying in a hotel for that long can get old, but the Arlo Soho was an exception. I felt very taken care of and loved how lively and entertaining the hotel activities were. The amenities were great, specifically the restaurant and 24 hour bodega.The staff was kind, helpful, and professional. Lindsey in particular always brightened my morning! I will definitely be coming back!

Stayed @ Arlo Soho for a wedding- great venue! Has a high class hostel feel with a 5 star hospitality team! Special shout out to Lindsey G for adding her personal touch to both me and my family. Will come back!
user_name:
danf337
New York City, New York

review_body: Typically like to take my wife on short weekend trips to the city and stay in the midtown area for dinner and a broadway show. I recently had to stay in the Soho area of the city for a business trip and heard a lot about Arlo Soho. This hotel was a phenomenal find as i cannot stop talking about it to friends and family. Location cannot be beat, service on all levels was excellent and so natural, the overall vibe from lobby to roof top was so chic! I cannot wait to go back with my wife for a weekend get away. Kudos and thank you to the Arlo staff for a memorable visit...Cheers!

Stayed at the Arlo Soho for an entire week on a business trip. The hotel enjoys a very good location just between Soho and Tribeca with the redline subway stop nearby in Canal St intersection.As for the hotel itself I have mixed feelings. This hotel should appeal a younger crowd who values more the hipster vibe, the hotel’s common areas and the amazing rooftop. Love the vibe, the candy store as you enter the property, the lighting and especially the rooftop which was alive during my stay.However, the rooms are tiny. The toilet is literally next to the door. I found it small and cramped and I was solo.If you don’t mind the tiny rooms, select service (no in-room dining, etc) then its a great property to enjoy and move around downtown NY, as well as enjoy its vibrant rooftop.

The Arlo is a hip spot. The staff is awesome, the rooms are interesting and comfortable. The bed was super comfortable. I was traveling with European colleagues, and some of them got bunk beds and were surprised. We enjoyed the rooftop bar very much. It's a great spot.

Positives - Friendly staff at check-in. Interesting decor. Lovely fragrance which you can buy. Nice rooms albeit slightly small. Nice rooftop bar.Negatives - We attended happy hour in the bar where the guests are given free drinks and canapés. The barman however was very surly and quite rude. He wasn't friendly or welcoming at all and he kept making comments about how it wasn't as busy as he wanted it to be. Not professional at all which put a dampener on what would have been a nice experience. Our room was also quite small and nobody offered to carry our luggage for us.

Love this place, great location, great room (small of course - it's Manhattan), great service. Enjoyed using the free bikes, and the bodega was very convenient. Roof top bar rocks! Highly recommend this hotel if you want to be in SoHo area.

Excellent value. Rooms small but compact and connected. Great shared spaces. Though everyone glued to their macs. Tempting sweet shop. Nice staff. Restaurant had great food but not very attentive staff
user_name:
Jezm0nd
Santa Maria di Leuca, Italy

review_body: The Arlington hotel is fantastic. From the rooftop bar and restaurant to the lobby / coffee shop/ candy shop/ bar/ reading area/ charging stations / lounge/ terrace/ and bistro, it is flawless. Also, lindsey at the front desk is especially nice and accommodating. I would recommend the Arlington Soho to anyone.

Small rooms never mind but this hotel is always a great stay. I have stayed several times and will still go back. Convenient location, nice rooftop (bar, yoga, etc), hip hotel with all your basic needs. Hip cool places to work or socialize. Convenient walking distance to greater Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich village and the downtown/financial district. Highly recommend. Rooms and bathroom are tiny fyi. Great service and always a smile downstairs at the front desk. Bicycle hire and movie nights are just some of the options here.

Second time at the Arlo Soho. The property is excellent, modern, but full of character. Different spaces are available within the public spaces to satisfy your every need.It has a great roof deck with fantastic service. Only blocks away from shopping, dining and bars.
user_name:
mlauzurique2018
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The Arlo SoHo is now my go-to spot in NYC. Great location on Hudson, furnishings on trend, rooftop bar is popping, and rooms are really well-appointed. Rooms are euro-style, so they're tight for two adults on a long trip, but perfect for solo business travel. Beds and baths are wonderful!

I had a room a the 8th floor with a great city view! The room was comfortable and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good, close to Soho nice restaurants and shops. Good wifi.

Was planning on meeting some friends in NYC for the weekend and one of them mentioned Arlo Hotel. She had passed by it on several occasions while working in the area and had always wanted to stay there. I booked a room for one night and was not disappointed. Upon check in, I realized that I had made a major mistake on my reservation. The staff at Arlo was quick to respond and resolved my situation immediately. The manager could not have been kinder being that the mistake was completely my fault. My friends and I then went to the roof top bar for a few drinks and snacks. The views, atmosphere, food & drinks are not to be missed. It was one of the highlights of our day! Rooms were cozy and clean. A DEAL in NYC!! I highly recommend Arlo SoHo.

Once again an amazing stay at the Arlo Soho. Love the ambiance and culture! Beds are the most comfortable!! Harold's food is wonderful and staff is great throughout the hotel. Definitely the place to stay in NYC!!

First time to NY and our stay at Arlo Soho was fantastic. The staff were friendly and helpful and location central for exploring NY City. The hotel has a sense of fun and quirkiness which suits Lower Manhattan. The rooftop bar did not disappoint and daily happy hour at Harold's was great to reflect on our day's activities. My Husband and I have already recommended and will continue to.Thanx Lindsey for making a stay a memorable one!

Girls weekend in New York and the Arlo helped to make the stay memorable. Yes the rooms are on the small side but the service and staff easily make up for it. Happy hour with free wine, Prosecco and canapés every night from 5.30pm. Free bikes available for guests to use. The staff were all really helpful and knowledgable. Great roof top bar and coffee shop on the ground floor. The hotel location was ideal for us. 2 blocks from the Hudson river park so with the bikes easy to reach the world trade centre and battery park to the south and uptown and Central Park to the north along car free bike paths. All the restaurants and shops of Soho and Greenwich village are a few minutes walk from the hotel. Room 1026 had views of the Hudson which was an unexpected bonus. Highly recommend.

The Arlo SoHo was a nice surprise. My wife and I were combining some business in NYC with a charity event near the hotel, so we chose to try something other than our usual locations in mid-town Manhattan. The staff was friendly, the hotel and restaurants quite comfortable, and the room reminded us of being in Europe. Compact, no-nonsense, and utilitarian but with some style. The room was a little pricier than I would have expected but it's NYC.

When my client booked me into this hotel, I was wary due to the low rate. However, I found this to be a delightful property. The Arlo has a great vibe. Not too hipster, and lots more personality than your standard business hotel. While my room was small, it was cozy and had an incredibly comfortable bed in a "pod". A great selection of artisan snacks in the lobby (open 24 hours) as well as a great little gift shop. The Arlo will be seeing more of me.

I love the Arlo! From the candy and coffee bar in the lobby to the friendly and informed staff (Abby and Lindsay at the front desk are standouts) to the great lobby that is somehow both airy and intimate. The restaurant is really good, particularly for the buffet breakfast - which in general I am against on principal but in this case is fresh, tasty and very diverse. The location is perfect and the rooms are immaculate and very efficiently laid out. Can’t wait to go back.

Hotel has great modern industrial chic vibe. Rooms were clean and functional. Rooftop bar has great views and served awesome cocktails. Staff was friendly and ready to answer any questions. Would def recommend.

A great luxury hotel with a good priceLocated at Hudson st.There were the cleanest rooms and bathrooms that I ever saw in my life.The bad is so comfy you won’t be able to get up :)They have a great rooftop with a nice bar and magnificent view of Manhattan.

Our children’s wedding weekend hotel. Party the night before and brunch the day after. Location is just perfect. Food was great. Service was beyond our expectations. Facilities great. Would do it again!!!

this is a boutique hotel in every sense - cute, a little quirky, well executed and fun. rooms are pretty small, but very well designed, and i like them a lot. my only criticism is that on both my last 2 stays, the AC has been v noisy switching on and off.staff are welcoming and lovely, great places to hang out, food and service in the restaurant were great. and nicely positioned away from all the noise of uptown, with good, affordable places to eat nearby

-Stayed at end of August to the beginning of September. A week. -The hotel room was pretty small, but I wasn't expecting much from it, since I wasn't going to stay most of my time in my hotel room. I like the layout of the room, minus the bathroom. -Would I come back and stay here? Maybe. The miss communication or whatsoever from the beginning of my stay. Set off the vibe of the place for me. All I can say is I was very patient from the beginning, of my trip to very end of my trip. Can't say it was all bad, but it wasn't a good experience for me too. Second chance will be given, sometimes in the future.

First off, the staff was excellent. Went well above and beyond in every interaction I had in my stay there. To the extent that even in the elevator, the manager (Chad) was STILL working and accommodating to two guests who he lent his umbrella to and clearly had great rapport with. They were quick, friendly, and well trained, even when it seemed very busy.The rooms are small (typical for a hotel in NYC), but you don't feel it at all. The room is set up perfectly for the amount of space provided. Cool stone floored shower to the left, modern sink setup to the right, and the best part is the King sized bed in a wooden cubby set up right next to the window overlooking the city, WITH automatic blinds. Really cool feature. Rooftop bar (I didn't take pictures, sorry), Harold's restaurant w/ bar downstairs, modern conference rooms and different set-up rooms make you want to hang out or do work outside of the hotel room. There's also an outside area with really cool tents with comfortable couches and stairs. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Highly recommend.
user_name:
christ8962018
New York City, New York

review_body: The place is fabulous as many have noted — the common areas are all very nice : the lobby, the outdoor tented area and the rooftop. We especially love the location where street parking is relatively easy to find and free on the weekend! All the staffs are incredibly friendly and helpful.Took off one star for the room being tiny and the restroom layout is a bit uncomfortable. Took off another star for charging resort fee (many hotels in NYC are charging these nowadays — we booked via hotels tonight and didn’t realize that there is such fee until checking out — we realized later that it was noted but not explicitly mentioned on hotels tonight app)

When I am in NYC for work, I stay here because it has all that I need as a solo woman business traveler. The rooms are quiet, clean and stylish. The staff are top-notch professional, check-in is super fast, public areas to sit and do work or have a drink are very well designed and comfortable. The roofdeck is stunning, the restaurants and bars are hip and the food and drinks are tasty. The neighborhood is safe and a 5 minute walk to several subway stops. The prices are great for NYC.
user_name:
Hikergirrl
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: I was on a short business trip to NY. Travelling solo. I am a young 30yr old, love a bit of a buzz scene and also my quiet alone time. ARLO was perfect! Location, spot on you wouldnt want to be anywhere else. Located in walking distance to the beautiful Hudson River (I didn't even know when booking that I would be able to walk to this scenic and iconic spot!) and walking distance to popular shopping destinations (think Zimmermann, Isabel Marant, Theory, Sandro, Maje, Rag & Bone, and the regular Zara's and MORE etc) along with amazing cafe's and eateries.The hotel offers free bicycle hire, which I highly recommend, I rode to Central Park (to save on lengthy cab fare and time in traffic- rode about 30 mins) and used it almost everyday to nip around quickly in the perfect weather. The room was albeit small, but perfectly curated to ensure comfort and cleverly designed storage spots for luggage and bits and bobs.Great shower, and showering products included. I had the park facing room, it was gorgeous. Super comfortable bed and optional room service to clean everyday. My first night i was so excited to be in New York that I though it was best to check out the roof top bar (overlooking the Hudson to my surprise). It was an amazing atmosphere, really inviting, great drinks, really cool and vibrant design. The restaurant was a little overpriced but reasonable. however, I wouldn't waste money on the breakfast buffet, quite dear and a little bit average on the food side to be honest, but good coffee and nice staff. Overall, I effing loved staying here (and I have stayed in my fair share of hotels all over the world) the staff are awesome, the guests are equally awesome and a super modern, cool, cleverly designed hotel. Great location, and ultra comfortable. DO NOT HESITATE, just book it, you wont regret it. xx

Even $500 a night hotel rooms in NYC are generally pretty tiny. What's great about Arlo is that you get the perks of a pricier hotel--great ambience, service, high-end sheets and toiletries, a good lobby bar and rooftop--with a much more reasonable price tag. King rooms are definitely on the small side but like all true New Yorkers they make super efficient use of the space and end up feeling charming and cozy rather than cramped. Besides you don't come to New York to hang out in your room. And the location of the Arlo puts you walking distance to Tribeca, Soho, and the West Village. Prime location. Love this hotel.

This was my fourth or fifth time staying at Arlo Soho and it was great again. Rooms are tiny, but have all of the amenities you need. Room was super clean upon check in and housekeeping service throughout my 6 nights there was perfect. I love that the Lobby has a daily happy hour and lots of communal places to hang. Had dinner at Harold's one night and the bar the next (wedge salad was GREAT). Rooftop was hopping both nights I went up (Sunday and Tuesday no less). Staff is personable and helpful. This is my go-to hotel in Soho.

Stayed at Arlo Soho for business 9/17/18 thru 09/19/18. I was in a King with a City View. The staff at Arlo are top notch. I can't recall everyone's name but Abby and Amaris in particular went above and beyond when it came to being friendly and helpful. They arranged for transportation to LaGuardia upon check out (a very reasonable $55).Very comfortable bed, great shower. They could use a place to hang your bath towel when you shower but that's a small detail missed compared to all of the great aspects of the hotel (the roof top bar, the outstanding lobby area and the 24/7 snack bar.)Coffee in the morning is not complimentary but you do get free refills. There is amazing pizza nearby (Ben's Famous Sicilian). Make a left out of Arlo, make a right on Spring St and follow it about 2-3 blocks and it's on the left (I think at Thompson Street). For great breakfast, make a right out of Arlo and walk south on Hudson St to Tribeca for breakfast at Bubby's. I asked for ice at 11 PM and it was delivered to my room in less than 5 minutes.I wish I knew this before I stayed at Arlo; if you contact them prior to arrival they will have you picked up at the airport (LaGuardia or JFK) by a driver for a very reasonable rate.My room was very small but I was expecting that. Arlo provides bikes if you have the time to check one out (I wouldn't ride a bike in the city without a good fitting bike helmet, though). When I return to Arlo (which I absolutely will do), I will get a room with a terrace.

I'm a frequent visitor to NYC and stayed at 20+ hotels or so, I hold several premium cards with big hotel chains and I've never been treated better at any hotel than the Arlo Soho. Friendly, warm and nice is the best words used to describe how they treated me the second time I stayed here. Location is great if you as me like morning runs along Hudson. The rooms are tidy and nice and staff is friendly and helpful. Rooftop is great and the overall vibe at the hotel as well. The only downside I can now is how on earth are they going to keep this service level up as I will be coming back here for sure.
user_name:
Johannes S
Göteborg, Västra Götaland, Sweden

review_body: Really enjoyed my stay. Tiniest rooms outside of Japan but great common areas and service. No work out facility Great areas to chill and work. Rooftop is really nice. Definitely worth checking out. 3 locations

Enjoyed all of it -- rooftop bar, ground floor bar, ground floor restaurant, ground floor seating areas. Have been in several rooms and have enjoyed all the views as well as contemporary design of room equipment. Totally worth the money if you can afford it!

Great ambiance, decor and overall vibe. It felt great being there immediately upon entering. It didn't feel like a typical hotel. I absolutely loved it. The staff were super nice and attentive. The room was beautiful.

This hotel is fab, we have stayed here year in year out, there is always a cool vibe in the lobby the staff are good fun and its not your typical stuffy hotel reception area. There is always a pop up shop or some sort of function on here-its especially cool to stay here during the Christmas period as they have a cute roof garden decorated with a christmas theme cocktail. Oh and the location is perfect if you want to be near the neighborhoods of Soho without being on top of tourists and shoppers

I stayed in the Arlo Soho and loved it. The room was very small but comfortable. The breakfast was great with enough choice. The bar and rooftop were very cosy and the staff was friendly. The also have bikes and we used them all the time. Great hotel. The location is not super but good.

We’ve stayed at Arlo both times visiting NYC and loved it. The hotel has an upscale feel, and the lobby scent is amazing! Location is great if you plan to explore areas such as West Village, East Village, and the Financial District. Also very close to subway entrances, making it a breeze to get uptown or further downtown.

It was a comfortable, clean room for a couple’s overnight stay, and thankfully a short walk to the City Winery, too! We were able to find free street parking and didn’t even need to utilize the valet for our stay. Check-in was a little hard to find, and we ended up waiting about an hour for our room. For the location, pricing, and room, we would definitely return

Absolutely lovely folks, atmosphere and accommodations!!! We loved my breakfast (OMG - fabulous food - ie. the baked eggs), Bloody Mary bar, the bicycles (to Harlem and back via the Hudson River Greenway), and the location (relatively quiet). Thankful, also, for them taking such good care of us when we needed the extra help too! Will not stay anywhere else if I have a choice. Luv, Luv, Luv!!

I had the absolute pleasure of staying in the Arlo hotel in soho New York, what a treasure to find. The rooms were small but absolutely stunning and incredibly comfortable. The use of space in the rooms was very imaginative and it most definitely worked. The staff were fantastic and happy to meet your every need. The restaurant had amazing food, you actually had everything you needed for a very relaxed, comfortable stay. I would highly recommend the Arlo hotel. It’s location was very good too. I loved it there and would 100% stay there again and I know my family ( husband and two small boys ) would have loved it too!

Very hip hotel with “micro rooms” - in other words super tiny. While small, the room was efficient and had everything we needed for our short stay. The bed was really comfortable and the window had a great view. We were bushed so the city noise(horns, sirens) weren’t a bother but for light sleepers it may be an issue. The bathroom offers little privacy with a frosted glass wall separating it from the bed area. If you aren’t totally comfortable with the person you are with witnessing all your bathroom activities-then get 2 rooms. The common areas of the hotel were very cool including outdoor space and several seating areas as well as a nice rooftop bar. These areas were very busy with non guests - in fact the whole downstairs area didn’t feel like a hotel at all but more like a bustling bar area. There is a small store to buy candy, food and $7 bottles of water. I suggest going to the 24 hour bodega on the corner instead ! The service is friendly and the A and 1 train stops are nearby. It’s about a 5-10 min walk from the shops and restaurants of SoHo . I do think for the space that the price tag was hefty but all of NY is quite pricey. If you are a single traveller, I think it’s a good, clean, cozy and modern option. If you are a family - this is not the hotel for you.

Booked this through work as its close to our office on Hudson.Actually really liked it, downstairs is more WeWork than hotel lobby with everyone hip and trendy working on a mac. Quite a good open space. A few bars here too. Shop downstairs was cool, but pricey. $18 for a tube of hair gel I forgot. There’s a shop up the road too for a few items if you want to save a few bucks vs the hotel shop.Reminded me very much like Citizen M in Amsterdam I’d def go back.Pros- while the rooms were tiny, they were very clever with their use of space - liked the hangers/pegs etc and a huge TV- lots of USB/Power outlets - staff were friendly and helpful- room was clean- roof top bar was great- like the events taking place every day - from yoga to movie night. Cons- 24 hour coffee was out and not working when I went at 5 am for a coffee. Would have been good to get a small coffee machine in the room- shower took about 10 mins to get hot- if I’m being really picky - the towels felt old, could have been more luxurious .- The burger in Harolds was good - but at $25, it tasted the same as a $2 McD’s

I have to visit New York every couple of months for work, I always try to stay at the Arlo, yes the rooms are smaller than some but they are comfortable and efficient. The staff are extremely friendly. I have closer hotels to my office but would rather spend the extra 10 minutes walking in and have the opportunity to actually relax and decompress at the end of the day. The courtyard rooms offer almost no city sounds compared to every other hotel I have stayed at in the city. The check-in and check-out process is incredibly smooth. If I feel like being social I have to bars to choose from and a weekly array of activities, or if I just want silence and calm I close the blackout blinds and turn off the lights and sink into the comfortable bed.

This awesome hotel it’s not only hip, cool, comfortable and with an excellent taste in design but they also have an amazing hospitality team staff that’s super production friendly and ready 24/7 to accommodate any of your needs. The food at Harold’s it’s superb! You can’t miss their happy hours wine tasting! I will definitely come back :)

This was my first hotel in Manhattan on the solo part of my trip. The hotel was easy to find, but the subway stations did not have elevators so it was difficult dragging my luggage up and down subway stairs. Would recommend going a different way if you have luggage.The hotel lobby was clean, fresh, and spacious. Hotel staff greeted me with smiles and stored my luggage as I arrived early. Later, I checked in and they upgraded my room from a bunk bed room to a king. The room was cozy but with a brilliant use of space. Bed was comfy; shower was like rain; and the room was very quiet. Would definitely stay here again.

I'm a New York resident, and I've stayed at the Arlo several times over the last few months due to construction going on in my apartment. Since I'm used to small spaces, the size of the rooms really isn't a concern for me personally, but it's worth noting that this hotel has compact Scandinavian-style rooms. This is very common in the area, and the Arlo makes good use of the space. Something I particularly enjoyed in the rooms was the Google Chromecasts for the TV which allows me to stream whatever I want in my room. The true shining star of this hotel and the reason I've chosen to stay here multiple times is the service. From the reservation phone line individuals to the lobby hosts, everyone has gone above and beyond to make sure I enjoy my stay and have everything I need each time. Lindsey at the front desk has been particularly helpful to me each time I've stayed :)

I have spent 5 nights there in August and had a great time. The employees were all very nice and helpful to make my stay as pleasant as possible. The hotel is very well situated in order to wander in Soho, Greenwhich .... all downtown. Subway stations and bus are close. Many restaurants in this area however there is a good one at the hotel + rooftop and bar + a small shop open 7/7 and 24/24 in case of emergency in having coffee, candies...the bedroom was small but very design and the bed very comfortable. I would have liked a wardrobe and coffee and tea complimentary but easy to find in this area anyway.

The location is very convenient for us. Everything is like brand new and super clean. The help is very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small but the layout is so well done that it works well. I actually like it as it is cozy. You would pay much more for a big room somewhere else.

Arlo Soho is a fabulous boutique hotel in the heart of the city. From the stellar rooftop views and ambiance at the bar my husband and I had a magnificent time. On top of the fact we had a sexy room right next to the large window. I'm looking forward to our next visit.

DO NOT and I mean DO NOT Stay in this hotel! This was the worst experience I've ever had from a hotel. We arrive at 3:00am due to a delayed flight, they give us our room and as soon as I walk in, it feels like the heater is ON. Mind you this is one of the hottest day in NY (August 8, 2018).So I go to the thermostat to turn it to cool and notice that it's already at Cool and set to 65 degrees even though the room temperature was closer to 80 degrees inside. I go down to the reception area and let them know the situation, explain I know how a thermostat works but maybe it's locked or they may know something I don't know? They quickly send a technician and after a few minutes they tell me the A/C unit has to be drained and it's broken.At this point I think to myself, no worries they'll just give me another room, I didn't unpack so it wasn't that big of a deal. Then just as I thought that to myself I get a notification on my phone. We had other people we had traveled with and they texted me this:"Did you know you guys got the last rooms? Lol I am waiting for them to find me accommodations elsewhere, my room was guaranteed and they overbooked. Dummies"So I knew this wasn't going to end well. So we go back to the front desk and the technician tells the supervisor that the A/C is broken and there's nothing they can do right now. The supervisor tells me that he's very sorry for the inconvenience but sadly there's no more rooms (I already knew that) and that he just sent our friends to another hotel and everyone is fully booked. He told me to just deal with it and he'll promise me, actually these were his exact words "I'll promise you the world" the following day to change me to a better room and also take care of me.I didn't want to make a big deal out of it, I know things happen and in reality I can't blame them for something that they have no control over. Also it was already 4:00am and I needed to be awake by 7:00 so that meant by the time I get to bed I would get less than 3 hours of sleep.I go back to my room which feels like a Sauna and take a quick shower just to get my body temperature cooler and go to sleep with as little clothes as possible. The whole night I kept scratching and feeling very uncomfortable, I was so tired that I tried to dismiss it but before even 7:00am hit I couldn't take it anymore and woke up to a bunch of bugs biting me! (SEE PICTURES)It was the most disgusting thing I have ever experienced, I took another shower literally 2 hours later and went downstairs and showed them the pictures I had taken. By then I had to speak to a different supervisor because the night supervisor had already left, she again apologized and said they would get me into a NEW room right away and if there's anything I needed from them to let them know, they comped us our breakfast that morning which wasn't really good.She then told me her Manager would be in soon and she would talk to him to see what they can do. Since I had to leave I told her that he can call me or we can chat later, I was there for business. I get back to the Hotel in the afternoon and by then I was doing some investigating to see what it was that bit me and I come to find out that it was BED BUGS! I read other reviews online that also said it was bed bugs, when I met with the manager I explained my situation and he didn't really seem to care never once said "we're sorry" or took blame.I told him I thought it was bed bugs, especially based on previous reviews and he clearly said they had the room expected and brought a K9 and it turned out negative. Sounded like a bunch of BS to me and the way he talked to me sounded like this happens often.I told him that I have to now throw away my clothes and luggage because from what I've read online this stuff can come back home with you and create a much bigger problem. He then offered me a free complimentary 3 day stay with them at a future date. I immediately laughed and told him, "If a restaurant serves you a cold steak and you complain about it and you get a new plate and the steak is cold again. They apologize and say, they would comp you the next time you come back to the restaurant do you think you'd want to go again even if it's free?" He really didn't seem to care what I had to say and basically said, "that's all I can do for you, we don't offer any type of monterey compensation, the best I can do is maybe bump it to a 5 night stay, but that's about it" I quickly laughed and went to my room grabbed some stuff and checked out as fast as I could! I had to throw away over $1000 worth of clothes because the last thing I want is bugs at my house, worst customer service and experience ever!!!

The Arlo Soho rides on the coat-tails of the green movement, specifically tiny houses--small spaces designed with brilliant inventiveness and efficient use of electricity . The Arlo is a sad knock-off: There's no closet or dresser. The sink is in the room. The lighting is harsh. The bathroom is a tiny square. The numerous switches are complicated. (An engineer came up when I couldn't figure out how to turn on the bedside and couldn't figure them out--it took an MIT graduate later.) By the time you've hung your clothes on hangers by the bed and put a few sundries on the small counter around the sink, you're surrounded by a mess that will only get messier unless you're severely OCD. The downstairs lobby has expensive items for sale, ranging from scented candles to wellness-granola to in-your-face-so-cool-bad-for-you-candies in dime-store glass jars. Stay here if you don't plan to spend any time in your room and aren't offended by the commercialization of the green movement, designed to make people think they're saving the planet by spending money on rip-offs. The downstairs--a compensation for the tiny rooms--is invitingly large and open to the public as a work area. Be glad the wastebasket in your room is disproportionately large, with a separate divider for compost. Be glad you have a Mac like everyone else.

I stayed in the bunk room, which was small, but super clean, modern and comfy. Location is good, easy walking distance to Soho's stores and restaurants and to Little Italy. The hotel has a nice restaurant, a small cafe that comes in handy in cold winter nights and a roof top bar. Definitely will return!

I had another amazing stay at the Arlo. I recommended it to a friend who is extremely picky and never finds any hotel that she likes in New York and she loved it. This hotel is clean, trendy, and has incredible service.

Small but immaculate and functional rooms with "smart", hidden storage space. There was a sense of "homecoming" feelings mixed with artistic inspiration everywhere. Facing the elevators were colorful personal notes left by guests about their amazing experience at the hotel.However, I could only give 4 stars due to the not so friendly staff at Harold's Southern restaurant and Bodega. Indeed, no one acknowledged when you came, eye contacts not made and the transactions was just reduced to the minimal exchange between a seller and a buyer. Abby at the reception desk was outstanding. Our needs were always met with a smile and kind words. Thank you, Abby, for a wonderful stay at Arlo Soho!

We really enjoyed our time at Harolds and at the Rooftop bar. The courtyard was unique and awesome. Staff was friendly and especially helpful and welcoming.Rooms were NY small, but efficient, good light and tidy!

We live in NYC and we stopped into the ARLO/soho this summer for a DYLAN's treat and a cool refreshment. There we met Nathaniel who was tending the lounge bar. He was amazing and soooo kind; my nephew had a tummy ache so he made him a special " tonic" of bitters and a fresh lemonade. He also told my 9 year old nephew all about the hotel AND that there were rooms that have bunk beds with their own TV's! We had so much fun with Nathaniel that we let the front desk know what a gem he is. I then sent an email to the hotel to let them know too; when u meet kind people you have to let the world know! On line we met Lindsey. She was so nice too... so we decided to have a stay-cation night in the bunk bed room! Lindsey hooked that up and we stayed at the hotel recently. The ARLO/SOHO is a perfect place to stay; the rooms are super fun and the staff are all amazing! Lucky for us we actually met Lindsay when we checked in and Nathaniel was in the lounge that night! we had an amazing dinner in the lounge from HAROLD's and the next day we had brunch at HAROLD's. the food is fantastic! the staff in the restaurant are so kind and super nice; in fact Lilli made us the best hot chocolates we have ever had! Everything we ate on both occasions was excellent; we will definitely be back for the fried chicken!this hotel is a GEM! very affordable, great location and a great staff. The roof top is beautiful and we had fun playing jinga in the outdoor tents! we met the nicest people working at the arlo/soho everywhere we went! Thank you for making our stay-cation super fun!

This is a GEM. Great vibe, everything you need, a little off the beaten track but close enough to what I needed. Loved it! Rooftop was a lot of fun. Restaurant was excellent (had breakfast & dinner there).

I thought the room was charming, cozy, and very efficiently laid out. (The fact that this is a “micro-room” is explained on the website, so its small size was not a surprise.) I also loved the outside seating areas, the free wi-fi, and the hotel’s location close to many fun areas to explore. I’ll be back!

Very busy, but quiet, hotel. Great check-in experience. Clean. Compact room. Nice view! Harold's has in interesting take on food and it's a good one. Arlo's Roof Top is a must in good weather. Very comfortable furniture, adequate menu, friendly staff, and again, the view!

This hotel is really strategic in Nyc. SoHo is close by, like Tribeca and Wall Street!I love the movie, the music, the breakfast! I also enjoyed the restaurant and the rooftop! But... I stayed here for 20 days the first time, the first night I went to the restaurant and after one hour they told me they forgot my ordination, I was mad, then the AC was not working, I asked to change the room, after that I had a room with a continuous noise all night long, the maintenance guy asked me to change the room again because they where not able to fix the problem,I changed again... and then The television was not working and the safety box was broken. Nothing changed. The manager was really nice and before living she offered me one night as complementary with breakfast included. They were really sorry. So I come back every time that I have the chance to stay in NYC.

Stayed at Arlo Soho with my wife for our 1 year anniversary, rooms were small but very functional and well designed. Good food, great bars ! We will be back for sure. Location is perfect, near the subway and the free bikes for use are also awesome

Super friendly hotel in a fantastic location. Rooms are compact but clean, very comfortable bed and the shower was to die for. The hotel offers the use of bikes which is an added bonus along with fitness classes, movie nights and more.

I've been to the Arlo NoMad and that's a cool hotel, but this one is way cooler. The atmosphere is very modern and unique. There is a hotel store with an assortment of food and beverages, a rooftop lounge, and plenty of areas to have a small meeting, work on your laptop, or relax with a book. I love the rooms, they are a little small, but very stylized which makes up for it. The front desk staff is also great. Rashmi went above and beyond to help us out and was super friendly even though it was 4am when we came down looking for contact solution. I recommend this spot for a romantic weekend getaway, or if you're having a small company retreat.

Absolutely amazing! The hotel is charming, elegant,the staff are so friendly and the atmosphere always cool.The room is comfortable, clean and my view very nice.The location is fantastic. Beautiful and top neighborhood, subway on my way,close restaurants , shops , parks and the best of downtown. One fo the reasons for my choice , the Arlo Bikes are the best. I’m a cyclist and I love biking in NYC! @quemanehdicaEverything was perfect. Thank you!Arlo #worththeride Manoel Oliveira

Small BUT very stylish and comfortable King room with a massive bed and good view. Staff in the hotel and bars were great and the hotel made a perfect base for a very brief visit to NYC and Brooklyn. We had a great time here.

Well what a gem! I don’t have anything bad to say about this wonderful boutique hotel situated on Hudson Street on the lower Manhattan. Nice neighborhood with lots of great places to eat, the subway is close by with several lines taking you either uptown or downtown. The rooms might be advertised small but I found them perfect. I had the king size room with my bed placed in the window. I would love to come back to this wonderful hotel again. As for New York? Still my favorite city in the world, and staying at Arlo Soho just made the experience that much better.

The main reason I made a reservation at the Arlo Soho is that it has rooms with large terraces....at reasonable rates. Our plan was to visit New York for 4 days in mid August....and we wanted to relax as well as shop, eat and go to galleries.... we didn't want to sit around in a hotel room. Our terrace at the hotel was great....there's even an outdoor shower along with two chaise longues and chairs. It was fun to be able to read and relax on the terrace. The room was small but very well designed and comfortable.We loved breakfast and lunch (we always went out for dinner) at Harold's in the hotel...the food was simple, healthy and delicious. There are lots of gathering spaces on the main floor of the hotel both indoors and out plus there's a roof deck....it was all very well done. They sold La Colombe coffee, snacks and Dylan's Candy Bar treats in the lobby. The staff all seemed to be happy and helpful.It was a comfortable and fun place to stay.

I visit New York every month for both business and pleasure. The Arlo SoHo is my home away from home. They seriously welcome me like family, with a glass of champagne and a smile. The entire hotel has such a cool, SoHo, modern vibe. The Lobby is amazing with great work and lounging space. Somewhere I really want to hang out and feel comfortable working on my laptop in the morning with a latte in hand or just relaxing in the evening with an adult beverage. There is a full bar adjacent to the Lobby and close to reception, is a well-stocked snack bar for a light take away bite or latte. An oversized blackboard lists the Arlo events which include live music on the weekends and special events during the weeknights (count me in for movie night). The Lobby opens to a huge terrace with glamping tents for the perfect tete a tete. And what could be better than a rooftop bar with a view of The Hudson and a glass of rose? Yup, the Arlo has that too! Come morning, it’s the place for yoga classes. The restaurant is an added plus and a great place for a casual meet-up and meal. Special mention to Lindsay at the front desk who makes sure my stay is absolutely perfect, every single time. She has even texted me when she wasn't on duty to ensure all was well during my stay...talk about 5-star treatment! Lindsay does her best to make sure I have an upgraded room. And speaking of the rooms, the beds are super comfy, and the rooms are cozy chic. The hotel is perfectly situated, close to the amazing SoHo shops and the charming West Village. So many great restaurants are just steps away, or pedal over on one of the Arlo’s complimentary bikes. The Arlo SoHo has it all…fun, fun, fun.

The location is perfect - located on a quiet block of Hudson, yet only 3 blocks from busy Soho and Tribeca with lots of shops and dining options nearby.We had a twin bedded room #924 - with just enough floor space but thanks to the corner location it also offered an area for your bags to be stored out of the way. The beds were very comfortable and the shower was perfect in the morning. Even if we were only two floors below the very busy roof top bar, the room was nice and quiet (for New York). One of the main attractions with this hotel were the lounge areas on the ground floor as well as the courtyard for relaxing with a morning coffee. afternoon glass of wine before dinner or doing a bit of work on my laptop. I appreciated the newly installed computer and printer in the lobby for printing of boarding passes for our international flight.

Arlo Soho is a very cool boutique hotel with micro rooms. The staff were helpful, it had good amenities and great location. The room was tiny but really well designed, so was perfect for two people. The BED THOUGH.... possibly the comfiest bed either of us have ever slept in. We found it hard getting up in the morning.... heaven!!Places we loved during our stay...Emily’s Pizza, Greenwich Baker & Co., Bleecker StAmpersand barEatalyEleven Madison Park ($$$$)Locanda Verde

A large contingent of ‘country mice’ family members were attending a wedding in New York this past weekend. How lucky are we that our smart wedding couple chose The Arlo as a preferred hotel for us to stay. Not having much previous experience with NYC accommodations we couldn’t have been happier with this choice. Welcoming staff, cool little outdoor atrium spots, convenient restaurant and amenities offerings, and the Rooftop Bar is just great. Rooms are compact-essentials plus WiFi plus tv, clean environment, 24 snack shop and Dylan’s Candy Store-close, convenient, pretty hip, much more so than us! We didn’t have the time this trip, but for anyone wishing to make the trip to the WTC site and surrounding exhibits, this is the place to stay.
user_name:
Kate B
West Long Branch, United States

review_body: We stayed at the Arlo, SoHo in Julythis is an awesome hotel and I would highly recommend it; the staff are young, friendly, and hardworking. I was so impressed with the service; the rooms are tiny but they are so wonderfully designed it was no issue at all; close to all transportation; highly recommend.

Fabulous location, very cool rooftop all in a super edgy hotel. This is my second visit to the arlo, but this time i chose to try the soho location. Its a 10 minutes walk to the west village. The rooftop overlooks lower manhattan, and is perfect for sunset drinks. Live jazz music in the lounge area, tents in the courtyard. What’s not to like? We are definitely staying here next time we visit new york.

have stayed here a few times and it is a great location with cool public spaces. in the winter they have yurts outside and you can eat in them! the rooftop is cool and the lobby areas and fun to chill inthe lobby has some cool features such as a coffee bar and mini dylan's candy barif you are coming from NJ it is easy in and easy out and there are several nearby parking garagesrooms are pretty small but clean and staff was helpful and friendly

Stayed at Arlo on a business trip. It was a lovely place to stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable and made great use of the space. The rooftop bar was really nice, although pricey. I made use of the cafe in the am, and would have loved to have tried the restaurant, but was strapped for time and didn’t have the opportunity. There were so many places to hang out and relax. They had some great outdoor spaces in the courtyard as well. Overall, I would love to stay here again and hope to have the opportunity soon.

What a great experience. The location is near everything and walking distance. The room is nicely done and clean. The restaurant including breakfast was quality and most importantly reasonably priced. Staff excellent, really friendly and genuine people, overall, I am impressed.

I love staying at the Arlo in Soho for so many reasons: great staff, breakfasts, wifi, common space for working, outdoor space for working, exercise classes on the roof, and much more. The rooms are small, but very well designed and totally comfortable for 1 person. Great location, too, for those who like to walk along the waterfront. This is my go-to hotel for my work travel to NYC!
user_name:
Stefanie W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Used to live in New York and have always thought it was the friendliest city I know, even if it doesn't always seem that way. The Arlo confirms it. The staff was terrific -- warm, welcoming, helpful and just generally "on it". The rooms were small but exceptionally well-designed and it's easy to feel cooler than you really are (even if you're pretty cool) in all of the public spaces -- bar, lounge, restaurant, tents, etc.

Lindsey, Abby and the rest of the team at Arlo Soho provided us THE BEST service over our week-long stay at the hotel. From local eats and show recommendations, to collecting our laundry from the wash & fold so we could continue drinking at the rooftop bar, and helping me sort out a solution for my excess baggage situation (too many cool things to gather in New York) that cost $20 instead of $600. We travel a lot and really pay attention to the service we get. The consistency and high quality of the Arlo team’s service is some of the best we’ve received anywhere in the world. Besides that, the hotel itself is excellent - decent room size (for Manhattan) that are cleverly designed to maximize function whilst retaining a sense of space, and public spaces (foyer, cafe, restaurant, lolly shop, rooftop bar) that are cool, fun and engaging. Thank you.

Love this place - staff are super friendly, rooms are lovely, the bar and social areas are great and its in a good location. Its also reasonably priced. I will be coming back here for definite. Highly recommend.

The hotel is excelent! Good location, spectacular bar and restaurant and very kind and helpful employeesRoom very clean and the bakery at the front an excelent opción for breakfastIf I return to New York I will certainly stay at this hotel again

Great location, reasonably priced. The staff is friendly, the hotel is hip, the rooms are clean and comfortable. What more could you ask for? If you are looking for extras, there is a really nice bar in the lobby and the rooftop, pedal bikes, and really nice working spaces around the street and first floors.

Really enjoyed our stay at this wonderful boutique hotel. The location was perfect. An easy trip into and out of the city through the Holland Tunnel. Parking was a breeze between on street parking and the convenient Valet service. The design was wonderfully efficient and the lobby was a fun place to just hang out. The staff we interacted with were all friendly, courteous and most of all helpful. This would definitely be our first choice for a return visit into SoHo.

Usually hop around different hotels in New York when I’m up for work. Arlo is hands down my favorite thus far. Small room but was expected. Beds are comfortable, rooms are clean, staff is friendly, and ambiance of the hotel is just phenomenal. Only stayed two nights can’t wait to go back and stay again!

excellent staff and accommodations. Beautiful views and spectacular roof top bar, especially enjoyable with Keesey and Bianca roof top bar maids. .found the location was ideal and close to fantastic restaurants in little italy and china town. We felt very safe walking around and taking in all the sites

Don't miss out the Arlo Soho hotel in NYC. By far, one of the best hotels I've ever visited. The hotel is energetic, clean and designed with a perfect touch. The service and the staff are fantastic!Especially recommended for people on a short business trip who needs a place to work during their stay.Can't wait to be back. ThanksEitan

We were very well received, with nice smiles, good service and a glass of prosceco. The rooms are a bit small, but it's New York! The common areas are very busy with the young professional clientele. The hotel is well located. Several good restaurants and bars are nearby and are just blocks from the Hudson River.

Really impressed with the Arlo Soho. The welcome champagne and kids candy in the bunk room was a hit! We enjoyed the view and cocktails from the rooftop. Harold’s Restaurant was so good and we ate outside in the tents ! It was really unique and kids loved it ! We ended our night watching movies and eating popcorn in the lounge. The Arlo staff goes out of their way to make you feel comfortable and happy! Honestly the best service. Thank you ! We will be back and recommend this hotel to all our visiting friends.
user_name:
mmgkcw
New York City, New York

review_body: Loved the Arlo SoHo - from the lobby to the rooftop lounge to our minimalist room. Happening bar and lounge on the rooftop w/ some nice views. Also had a nice lounge and bodega/coffee spot on the first floor. Will definitely come back.

Thoroughly enjoy my stay at Arlo Soho. The property is great, extremely comfortable. Lindsay and the rest of the staff were exceptional. They went out of there way to make sure I had everything I needed. I’ll definitely be back.

This is a great hotel with a new hip, community-oriented vibe! Loved the community spaces, great bar, great restaurant, great rooftop bar and fun rooms. The big plus were the free rental bikes! What I did not like was the lack of responsibility taken or even acknowledgment when the hotel valet damaged my car pretty badly.

The Arlo Soho is located outside the "regular" business areas of NYC (midtown or financial district). But, it is a welcoming hotel, affordable, located in a nice and quiet environment. Close to the 1 and A, C, E lines (on Canal st.), and the west side highway, and therefore easy to get from it either up or downtown.Getting to it from Newark is very easy.The hotel is renovated, room is fairly small but very clean. The lobby, rooftop, and business meeting rooms on the second floor make it ideal to conduct business meetings.Very good breakfast. A nice 24h convenience corner.Great staff. Welcoming, informative.My favorite hotel in NYC as of now !

On the edge of soho, tons of restaurants nearby, and close to tribeca dining too. Funky and fun hotel lobby, lots of different seating, places to plug in and work on laptop, funky tents and picnic tables outside, very cool. We came for a family trip but I would have liked this place as a business hotel too. Rooms are super small. Kept bumping our knees into the wooden platform beds, the space was so tight. We got a room with a terrace and it made it a little less claustrophobic. Nevertheless it is efficient and clean. They make great use of the space, the safe was rolled under the bed. We didn’t come to nyc to hang out in a hotel room anyway so all good. They have a mini Dylan’s candy bar and the teens with us liked that.
