They also have a 24/7 market that sells a variety of fresh food, salads, snacks and drinks - Very comvenient. Lastly The rooftop bar has amazing views and it’s worth having a drink up there. Overall highly recommend.

We were a group of three photographers/videographers in town for one night for some video work, and we could not have been happier. Though the room wasn't big enough for the three of us, we knew that going in, but we were blown away by beautiful patio space we had. You can't beat an outdoor shower and a view of the Manhattan skyline. The lobby was constantly filled with other creatives doing work or socializing, and it was overall a great vibe. I will be coming back again soon. Awesome place to stay in New York, as it adds another dimension to your stay. Felt like home.

As an aside this hotel is probably not the best for first timers to NYC. However for anyone else I could not recommend this hotel highly enough. The decor was beautiful, the lobby smelled incredible which is not a comment I usually make regarding hotels. The staff were friendly and the amenities provided were excellent. The rooms are cosy and modern (however a coffee machine would not have gone a miss). I found the staff to be extremely helpful (I ordered towels to be delivered to the room from the front desk and they somehow arrived before me). Location is very good with so many doing options in Soho (however traffic is very loud being opposite to the Holland Tunnel), and Canal Street subway is very good. I would certainly stay here again when in NYC.

I love Arlo Soho, the location can not be beat!! The lobby is cool, it has a little coffee shop and mini Dylans candy bar and plenty of places to chill/ work if you need to. The staff is friendly and accommodating ! Shout out to Lindsey who always goes above and beyond (I had a huge balloon order delivered and also left something in my room when I checked out) she makes it all happen!The room is smaller but for the price it is perfect. It has everything you need. The bed is comfy and water pressure is amazing in the shower.PS they have a cool roof top!100% recommend this hotel!

Pros: Bed was comfortable, with a nice view of the courtyard and Hudson/Canal St. Right next to the Holland Tunnel, but I didn't find it loud. Also right next to the 123 Canal St. Station and near the ACE Spring St. Station. All the toiletries smelled excellent. The hotel in general smelled nice. Rain shower head was great. Lots of lobby space for hanging out or doing work on a laptop. Lots of little nooks and crannies for photo opportunities. Free water for your reusable bottle. House bikes and umbrellas for use during your stay. Rooftop, but I didn't have a chance to check it out.Cons: Room is small - feels like a single dorm room - but it's cute and was great for me as a solo traveler. Apparently chic hotels are against traditional doors and shower curtains, as I've noticed during recent stays around nyc (see photo). Pillows were the usual hotel-lumpy. Some outlets didn't work and mini fridge wasn't as cold as I would've liked (but I only used it for water).Not a con, not a pro: found the doormen to be nice, but the front desk receptionists to be not very welcoming.Booked on their website and got a pretty good price for nyc - $303/2 nights.
user_name:
Lien L
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Nice and cosy room, small but the view from the 8th floor was really cool. Very helpful and nice service on the front desk! Young spirit. :)Good breakfast, variaty of healthy food. (22$/ per person).

I came for a quick weekend visit to see my son and stayed on this great hotel in Soho - Arlo on Hudson.Normally we would get a Vrbo but decided a huge tel would be better and surprised we were. Great place with a real vibe with rooftop and outdoor areas that really make the place casual upscale relaxed and energized.Arrived early and room was not ready so sat outside for an hour making calls and ended up enjoying it so much I came back early for a cocktail and more ‘work’ on the patio.Then another trip back to the bar before dinner - live music on Friday night. A great place to come and will definitely make you want to cone back again.Candy in the lobby, great bar and outside sitting with Wifi - hard to beat that!

I stayed at the Arlo two weekends in a row and both of my stays exceeded my expectations. The hotel followed up with me after my first stay to make sure that I enjoyed myself and I explained that the following weekend was my sister's bachelorette party and I would be returning and had three rooms reserved. Friday night my flight was canceled and when I finally made it Saturday morning they remembered who I was and cheered upon my arrival. The night of the bachelorette party they put champagne in my sister's room and left me a note with some snacks. It completely made the weekend. I cannot recommend the hotel staff, the stylish rooms, and the fun bars (rooftop and first floor) enough. Will be returning shortly!

This boutique hotel is a perfect home away from home for business and leisure travelers alike. It is VERY quiet and clean and has a lovely staff. The next time I’m in SoHo, I know where I’ll be staying!

Could not have picked a better hotel. It came highly recommended and still exceeded my expectations. The rooms were perfect. I got the best night sleep in a month, and the rain showers were exceptional. They have different events every night it seems. The only downside was my stay wasn't long enough.The staff gets special recognition, especially Abby at the front desk.Thanks for a great stay!

This is now our go to hotel when we are in the city. A quiet place within walking distance of great shops and restaurants in Nolita and the Financial District. One of the friendliest and most helpful staffs around.

Perfectly located great boutique hotel ideal for a short break. We had 12 nights and found the rooms a little small for this length of stay. Also found the communial areas always full of clients working, what seemed like, for all day on their laptops.
user_name:
barryandphil
Brighton and Hove, United Kingdom

review_body: Great hotel, with a few caveats - not suitable for all travellers.Pros:- Very stylish and mid century style. Hard product is really good.- Recently built/refurbished so rooms are in great condition.- Aircon works well- Soundproofing is great, so is the bed, so you get a good nights sleep- Shower is powerful and hot- Fast Wifi- Awesome bar on the rooftop- Great lobby for chilling out- Fridge in the roomCons:- Awesome bar is expensive ($18 cocktails)- Rooms are tiny. I would not stay here if you are a couple. Only suitable for singles.- Location is not great if you're here in NYC for sightseeing.- Not many restaurants and good food options in the area.- Toiletries are big bottles on the wall instead of individual bottles.

I stayed with my family for 3 weeks at the Arlo Soho. As a frequent visitor to NYC I was blown away by the fantastic location in Soho, the quality of the small yet mighty rooms, the very friendly and helpful staff, and the overall ease and comfort of my stay. The on-site appointments such as the shared workspace, outdoor meeting areas or the on-site coffee + Dylan’s candy bar....helped me to feel right at home. I will definitely return!!! Thanks Arlo Soho!!!! ♥️

Small but super light bedrooms with large windows. the large bed was on a platform. It seems to be popular with 30ish good looking professionals on the way up. There is a good restaurant on the premises and a small shop to buy snacks and drinks. Convenient to subway.

A room for one person is quite nice, but if you had to cram two people in there, it would be pretty rough!! There was barely enough room to squeeze between the wall-mounted tv and the end of the bed to get to the window or the other side of the bed. The toilet and shower are enclosed in frosted glass, but there's virtually no thing as privacy as the room is just so small. It was, however, cleverly set up to maximize what little space there was. Again, fine for one person, but too small, in my opinion, to share a room. There is a coffee bar, restaurant, and charming courtyard and library-like space to hang out, and it's a short walk to the subway (maybe 4 blocks).

I have been staying here almost every week for over a year. Everyone here has become family. They are always SO accommodating with all my requests and try to make every stay better than the last. Kate and Katie in sales are so great about my last min. reservations all the time! Lindsey at the front desk is nothing short of one of the most amazing people in hospitality! I would be lost without her there! The overnight front desk agents are also gems! thanks to everyone for making this hotel home. Also, added bonus is the location.

I have not stayed at many hotels in NYC, but the Arlo SoHo is a wonderful mix of comfortable common spaces, lively outdoor rooftop, relaxed courtyard oasis, and urban design cozy private rooms. It was a great stay and highly recommend for anyone needing accommodations in the city.

Rooms are microstudios however it is the location, ambiance, and experience for which you stay at the Arlo Soho. The rooftop is great. The cool lobby makes interacting with others so much fun! The restaurant is quite good but slightly expensive. Lindsey is one of the best, and most friendly, people at the Arlo and works incredibly hard to give me a great experience each and every stay.I stay at the Arlo every chance I can when I visit NYC.

I arrived to Arlo Soho after a long day of travel. The front desk staff, Lindsey & Katya were very welcoming and hospitable. They offered me a drink ticket and suggested I check out the rooftop bar. The rooftop was packed with people but I still had space to hang out and enjoy the sunset. The outdoor areas that Arlo has on the property are really spacious and welcoming. The room was nice, cold and clean. Amazing shower and very comfortable bed. I highly suggest staying at this property!

After a 4 hour journey from JFK to Manhattan, through apocalyptic conditions, we were greeted like long lost friends. The guys and girls greeted us with hot drinks and whisked our luggage up to our rooms. Unfortunately we had our flights cancelled due to the winter bomb cyclone and was advised to stay in the hotel over the next few days. and what a amazing hotel to get stuck in!!The rooms ticked all the boxes...dream bed and shower and even in the bad conditions the view into the courtyard below was so so beautiful. The coffee shop provided great snacks and juices for breakfast and Harold's meat + three was perfect for dinner every night. (separate review) The best part was the nightly film nights in the lounge accompanied by enthralling cocktails from the bar. Will we return? Oh of course and hopefully we will get out to see the sights. Thank you to all the team for truly looking after us.

Coming off of my recent visit to Tokyo I've become more and more enamored with highly curated hotel experiences. Arlo exceeded expectation in not only thoughtful design but also in-house amenities. From a bohemian-camp style courtyard you can post up in or the cozy roof deck, there's plenty of reasons to have people come and kick it with you during your stay. The room had everything I needed confined into a smaller space that never once felt tight. Definitely staying at the Arlo Soho again.

I did not expect the Arlo to be so modern and classy. A beautiful new building with several areas for lounging or meeting. Great indoor and rooftop bars! Rooftop bar overlooks the Hudson River~ such an awesome view! Love the lobby candy store! The staff was delightful. Everyone that passed me by smiled and said hello. Very warm and welcoming.

I travel to NYC for work with some frequency and have been hotel-hopping every single time for the past couple of years trying to find that one hotel that has (mostly) everything I look for. After having tried 5 of them I feel that I have finally found it!N.B. I'm not naming hotels since that's not the purpose of this review and I was not unhappy with them, just not fully satisfied given the high-price you pay.Price-Quality is impeccable! The location is perfect, whether you want to walk/run in the Hudson river, go to Soho (just around the corner) or take the metro somewhere else. The rooms are small but very comfy (the bed is really good in the King Size room) and it has everything you need. While the rooms might be a bit too small for a couple to spend the day, in the end you are likely not going to do that.The open spaces on the ground-floor are really nice and you can easily unwind from a long day or keep working in the library with a glass of wine. The coffee and small market place open 24/7 with tones of sweets available - very nice for a late snack.The service was amazing all-in-all, both at the reception, at the bar (thank you for all the wine recommendations!), restaurant and cleaning service. I used the laundry service and was very happy with the speed and quality overall.I also appreciated the attention to details (not seen everywhere):- the small chocolate they leave in the pillow in the afternoon/evening service or how the room is tided up without actually having anything drastically moved.- Chromecast in every room to make it easy for you to watch whatever you want (Thank you!).- The various events proposed. Unfortunately I couldn't really try them but I did watch Pulp Fiction in the movie night while answering some emails :)I highly recommend and I am looking forward to my next visits in August and October.

We travel to NY frequently for work and we always stay at the Arlo. The staff are super accommodating and friendly, making us feel at home as soon as we walk in. The rooms are clean, simple, and cozy. The hotel has a beautiful terrace and lively rooftop with great views of the city.During our last stay Isabella & Lindsey went out of their way to make sure we were comfortable had everything we needed. Their professionalism and excellent customer service always leave us with a memorable experience. On our last day we missed our checkout time due to a work delay, but Lindsey made us feel at ease and was very kind and understanding about the situation.Will be back!!

The Arlo Hotel in Soho was by far the most amazing choice we could have made! The hosts and staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly. As we saw most of them every day, it no longer felt like talking to a stranger when we asked for advice or had any problems. They were always happy to help us and found the best solutions for everything.The cleaning service was reliable, friendly and efficient. The arrival and departure processes were smooth and enjoyable. The bodega in the hotel lobby as well as the rooftop bar provided us with a wide range of freshly prepared, healthy food and some delicious cool drinks on those hot summer days in July. We especially enjoyed going to the Arlo rooftop during nighttime as there was always great music and a big crowd of people coming from within the hotel or outside to watch the sundown or have a drink. We even met some native New Yorkers who were very polite and interested in getting to know us. The interior of the hotel was perfectly designed and the limited space very cleverly used. Our hotel room was tiny yet offered everything we needed, plus a kingsized bed with a view directly to Downtown Manhattan’s beautiful buildings. Due to the very particular choice of furniture, lighting and style, the overall atmosphere in the hotel was unbelievably cosy and chic and almost felt home-like.The lobby was like a big living room where all hotel guests would come together and either work, talk, relax, have a something to eat or make plans for the next day. Sometimes even musicians performed and movie nights took place. Thank you, Arlo for this outstanding experience. It was the hardest thing to leave and we are already planning our next stay!

This hotel was hip and fun! It was definitely aimed toward younger people but my husband and I are in our late 60s and not only did we enjoy the vibe but we felt welcomed and well cared for! The room was tiny but modern and it couldnt have been cleaner or more comfortable!

It is located at the edge of the Soho, outside the rush of the city but minutes from there.Great rooms for couples. Exploiting every inch of the rooms that are not large but very comfortable.The room was quiet the beds comfortable and I slept great. The rooms and the hotel is also very clean.The hotel is in Hitech style, great for young couples even We are not so young.

A young cool place downtown, away from all the busy Streets, but close to World Trade centeret. Very Nice and helpfull staff. Easy to come to and subway near by. Roofbar most for the young guests, but great downstairs bar.

I cannot say enough nice things about the Arlo Soho. I had a lovely time. The service and rooms were impeccable. Everything is interesting; the food, the design, the patrons. It’s comfy enough that you feel at home but cool enough that people come to hang out. I was there for World Cup weekend and watched the game at the impromptu viewing party in one of their many living rooms. Strangers from all different countries were hanging out cheering together. Super fun. Highly recommend.

Stayed here a few times. Rooms are small but all the amenities are there and nice. Well maintained, fairly quiet as NYC hotels go. Nice to have a couple restaurant/bar options at the hotel too. Staff is pleasant and efficient.

Cool hotel. Good location. Friendly staff at the front desk. Housekeeping was very quick and responsive. The room was a bit cramped but clean. The bed was very comfortable.The hotel has a small bodega which is well stocked with healthy snacks and where they serve La Colombe coffee.

Great location, nicely furnished, all the essentials. Great common space. Rooms a bit small—but it is nyc. Short walk to the piers for activities. Wonderful restaurants nearby. Would recommend anyone to stay there.

I stayed at Arlo Soho last weekend and have stayed there several times in the past. It's always been a fun, relaxing treat for a nice getaway. One of the features of Arlo that stands out is the friendly service! An employee named Abby checked me in and out of the hotel for my stay, and she helped me feel welcome and taken care of. I had a stressful trip leading up to my stay at Arlo, and I arrived too early for check in. I was nervous and frustrated to think I might have to wait a few more stressful hours before I could check in -- I can't tell you how grateful I was for the welcoming smile and helpful service that greeted me at Arlo! Abby reassured me that she could get me checked into my room right away. Later, she gave me perfect recommendations based on specific requests I had. The great service made the stay at Arlo even better, and I definitely will stay there next time I'm in NYC!

The Arlo Hotel was clean and had a very modern feel. The staff were extremely helpful. The location is great, tons of food nearby! The rooms are very small. The TV is positioned in a way that makes it hard to get to the other side of the bed. Our city view room was looking at a billboard. Upon check-in, an hour after our check-in time, we were told our room wasn't ready. It took some prodding to get them to find a room for us, as we had to get ready for an event. Overall our stay was quite nice and the staff are extremely helpful, as well as welcoming.

So the good: broad shared space in the lobby that's flexible use; good location for the Soho area; friendly service; reasonably priced for NYC standards. The bad: ridiculously small rooms, even by NYC standards. All said I would stay there again.

WE STAYED here a night for my 40th birthday - saw a show - super accessible, subway nearby. Awesome location, loved the room, the view, the tv, the shower, the wonderful smells inside the the hotel. The rooftop bar is def. for 20 somethings, not for 40 somethings. Tip : Do not park your car in the front, make sure to wait for someone to take it.. our car was ticketed and Arlo did end up covering the charge. I was a little bummed there wasn't anything in the room for my birthday - we had stayed at the Arlo NOMAD the year before and there was a note, with chocolates and champagne.. Anyway Very professional, no problems we would def. return!! loved it so much!

I stayed at the Arlo-Soho this weekend and it was one the best experiences I’ve had in a NY hotel. I knew going in that it was a micro hotel so I expected the size of the room. What I didn’t expect was the level of attention and care the staff would have towards the guests! The Lobby Hosts are AMAZING!!! Especially Abigail!!!!I LOVED the roof-top garden, the studio rooms, the many spaces for community and the overall atmosphere!I had a King Bed room with a view of the garden. Loved it! Every detail was well thought out and the Body Wash is to die for!!! Luckily they sell it in the lobbyI will definitely be staying here the next time I’m in town, and can’t wait to bring our 5 year-old, he’ll get a kick out of the 24hr CANDY STORE!

Myself and my daughter stayed at the Arlo in June. We were very impressed. Yes, the room is small, but you're aware of that before you go. The bed is comfortable, the shower is good, the location is great and the service is fantastic.

I stayed there for 6 nights and whilst well run, the rooms are small (more like a pod) and blinds let in a lot of light in the morning. Suggest you get high room if on Hudson St side as traffic noise from Holland Tunnel is constant and loud. If looking for more upbeat with more choice to shop and eat then head up the road to West or Greenwich Village.

AMAZING customer service and SUPER NICE hotel. After my flight cancellation, they managed to give me an extra night inmediatly, and welcomed me with complementary toothpaste, and other necessities since they knew my bags would have been locked at the airport. Making me feel at home after a long business trip. (Thanks Joe, Mandy and Chad!)

Location + Front Staff/Service + Ambiance = amazeballs I really appreciate the finer things in life and I feel the Arlo offers it all.If I need a tasty snack or a bourbon with an amazing view of South Manhattan, I can have it all at the Arlo!

Top hotel. Arlo Soho's team rocks. Many thanks for your time, helps during our staying. I always enjoy be at your hotel. We feel as in a cocoon.Thanks Kate, Lindsey, Isabella, Frank and everybody. See You in September. MERCI

Been staying at this hotel a couple of times now, and its my absolut favorit in NYC, its trendy and cosy, and the staff are super friendly, I got a excellent service from everyone in the lobby, but Lindsey Gershberg stands out. :-)Thanks again guys, see you next time

Heard wonderful things about this hotel and had to book a room the next time I came to New York for a business meeting. From the moment I walked in I got greeted with a smile and loved the roof top bar very relaxing to have a drink or 2 after a long meeting. The suite I had booked had a view to the city it was very fascinating especially in the night time having a view of the city. I’ll be coming back to this hotel in the future.

Hotel is trendy, excellent use of space in rooms, awesome dining and leisure areas both in and outdoors! Only a block to subway so easy access to the city! We really enjoyed our stay there and will return.

My wife and I wanted to spend some time together alone from the kids. We booked the Arlo SoHo for the weekend. The best thing we did, from the moment we walked in to check-in everything was first class. we were treated like royalty. The service in this hotel is first class all the way from the rooms to the food. We loved the rooftop seating, it was an awesome view at night time & we enjoyed the outside courtyard also. For sure we will comeback another time!

This is my favorite hotel in NYC. It's always clean, always happenin'. I love how the king rooms feel like a ship's hull, and I love how spacious the common areas are on the 2nd floor balcony for working.

Hi, I already went twice to Arlo Soho in NY, in Dec17 and May18. It was a real pleasure to stay in the Hotel. I appreciated the lounges at ground floor as well as the roof terrace. But also the restaurant is very nice, and you will love the corner shop in the lobby to get even late a coffee, sweets and biscuits ... The atmosphere in this hotel is nice, and you feel like being home. Staff is amazing, very gentle. I have planned to go again in a week time, and made sure my agency is booking my nigths while Iam in NY at Arlo Soho. Regards, Antoine

Great food and a really lovely space to stay, I loved the rood top lounge and bar, perfect for sunset. The room was small but we had everything we needed for our stay in NYC. We loved the food and the cute little tents in courtyard.

I love this hotel!! From the moment my son and I arrived, we felt at home and welcome. The hotel has so many great indoor and outdoor spaces to enjoy, the rooms are very nice and the staff was accommodating and friendly! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and would love to come again! Thanks Arlo SoHo!!

Following an eight hour journey from the UK, we were welcomed at Arlo Soho by Lindsey with a glass of champagne. The customer service is first class because the staff always go the extra mile to ensure you are looked after. Lindsey was particularly quick to answer our daily queries, and Moses was always around to greet us and assist with directions. We stayed for six nights and were impressed that we never heard too much outside traffic. The hotel has a nice vibe, there is space to sit and relax and the roof top bar is great. Though slightly smaller than expected, the room was cosy and the mattress was comfortable. The hotel is walking distance to China Town/Tribecca and Greenwich Village. I would recommend staying in this location if you like Lower Manhattan. We hope to return soon :)

Arlo definitely met all our expectations. We stay for a weekend getaway anniversary celebration, and were graciously welcomed at the concierge and were pleasantly provided outstanding room service which made the stay significantly more enjoyable. The professionalism and politeness we were treated with by their employees was impeccable and something to admire nonetheless very detailed oriented. The amenity which stood out for us was being able to explore throughout the city with complimentary bicycles the hotel provided for us which was very different yet, convenient. The hotel itself is very well kept and clean which is very impressive. Last but not least the rooftop bar which was pleasant and very comfortable to enjoy delicious cocktail after a long day of exploring the city without having to step out of the hotel. My weekend experience will definitely be one to remember thanks to their amazing hospitality thank you once again!!!

A nice, clean and dynamic hotel. Great location and close to some of the best areas in Manhattan, Greenwich Village, Tribeca, Soho and Meatpacking. Great shopping and restaurants nearby. The room is very small, but sufficient for me and my boyfriend, as we spend most of our time in the city.The backyard is very cosy with lights at night. The rooftop was under construction, but seemed to be a nice place to hangout as well.

Overall, I had a great experience at this hotel. Yes, the rooms are small and take some getting used to, but you know what you’re getting yourself into, and they are fully equipped and well thought out. I really liked the location, it was nice to be away from the crowds and so close to Soho. The cafe/ shop downstairs was great too.

This hotel is in a great location - you're near Soho, but not in the thick of it. It's fairly quiet, but a 5 min walk to everything. I really liked the hotel's design and layout. The rooms are small, but very well laid out and have thoughtful design details (e.g., reading lights on the bed, automated, blinds, etc.) You can tell they really invested in the common places like the courtyards, rooftop, and other areas. Also, the hotel breakfast is great. It's probably one of the best continental breakfasts I've had at a hotel because there are a lot of options beyond bacon and eggs.What's really great about this hotel - besides the location, amenities, and soundtrack (I was a big fan), were the people working there. Lindsey at the front desk was great, as were the servers and bartenders. If you want a place that's trendy, but doesn't make you feel like you walked into a party you weren't invited to (like the W), this is the place. It's the perfect home away from home.

Very nice hotel with a great staff that matches the vibe. The restaurant downstairs Harold's Meat + Three, has super great food. Staff there is awesome as well! The rooms are a bit smaller, but are laid out very well. Not much to be expected coming to New York. Great use of space though!

This was our first time at this hotel, celebrating our anniversary. Upon entry, you notice the hotel is very trendy. There is a Dillons Candy store to the left and the Front desk to the right. The front desk staff was courteous and quick to check us in. Intrigued that the restaurant also has a open courtyard with several small tents similar to a cabana layout. Ordered food and drinks that were stellar! Noticed several cool meeting rooms on our way up to our rooms. Rooms we were fortunate to receive had a water view, with full floor to ceiling glass windows. Housekeeping staff was so polite and accommodated my few pestering requests efficiently with a smile. Then we went to the rooftop...OMG... the drinks were amazing and we had a wonderful time. The front desk was helpful in making a reservation at an outside restaurant for us . Overall great experience for a weekend getaway, I will definitely return.

Our first time in NYC and we were in this weekend for 2 nights to see Wicked and Frozen on Broadway. This was a perfect location close by to the theaters and the hustle and bustle of NYC. Helpful and friendly staff at the hotel. Rooms are very small but extremely clean and hip with the current styles. Our only critique on the rooms themselves is the design of the shower. There is nothing to catch the water near the bottom, therefore the water leaks out of the shower into the toilet area so majority of bathroom area is always a wet mess. Depending on what experience you need for your hotel but this hotel does not provide a pool area. Food is very good at Harold's the on site restaurant. If you like a great night life, the bar and rooftop area is definitely for you. If you are in for a longer stay I was impressed with the nightly calendar of events they provide at the location itself. Thank you for a memorable 1st time visit.

We thoroughly enjoyed the Arlo Soho as a base to explore NYC.Everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful.Rooms are small but well planned out. Very clean all areas of hotel.Main floor common areas were great to hangout and included an outdoor tent area. We enjoyed that.Will be back for sure!Pete and Nicole

Arlo is our favorite hotel we've ever stayed at because of their amazing service and value they provide. This is a really trendy hotel whether you're on holiday or in NYC for business. I highly recommend Arlo.

It is my third time staying at the Arlo Hotel and it is always a great surprise - amazing service, lots of interesting things happening, clean and cozy with a great style. The location is also great as you are walking distance from great neighborhoods.

Ideal for 4 day business trip, travelling alone. Friendly and helpful staff, good breakfast option in the restaurant, gifts and postcards in foyer . In particular, the compact rooms are very well thought out and comfortable, quiet. Plenty of community spaces to work or relax on ground floor. Rooftop bar with view.

We stayed 6 nights at this awesome place. The staff were so friendly and helpful. They went out of there way to make our stay perfect. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a comfortable stay and yet in a very funky and modern place. Thanks you guys.

New, trendy hotel in a perfect location close to all the great restaurants. Very friendly staff and accommodating! Intimate rooms! Everything within walking distance. Great place for a weekend getaway!

I was visiting Arlo Soho for the weekend with my mom. I have stayed at Arlo NoMad before and adored my experience there so I thought why not try out the SoHo location. The location was fabulous but the staff was rude. One night in particular my mom and I got in late from shopping and decided to purchase some snacks from the food and beverage area located in the front of the hotel. The woman at the front desk took our order but made up the prices for the items, different from what they were listed. When I asked why there was a difference in price she lied again and said, "Ma'am, this is New York, don't you know there is extra tax". I grew up near New York so I am very familiar as a matter of fact that, that is a lie. I then explained the price she charged me was much over what the tax would have been so perhaps she scanned something incorrectly. She rolled her eyes and shooed me away saying she had other things to attend to. Never have I had service like this. Totally rude and uncalled for when all I had was a valid question. I am not sure if Arlo makes it a point to over charge for those customers who do not know better and may be unaware but just be careful!

My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in April and absolutely loved it!The hotel vibe was exactly for us and loved all the attention to detail that the place had. One of the highlights of the hotel was the teepee tents that were on the courtyard. I assume this is just for the cooler months as it was really cosy inside and we had s'mores and played games. I also really liked that each night the hotel had something different. If you're on Instagram, the hotel puts up updates for the weekly activities.Yes the rooms were small, but wow they were designed really well. I knew from reading reviews prior to booking that people were complaining about the small rooms...but its New York people! I do have to mention though that there not much privacy in regards to the bathroom - so hopefully you're staying with someone you know.. really well!Also loved the location of the hotel. We ended up getting Ubers most of the time because it happened to be too cold for our liking (we're from Sydney so it was colder than our winter), though we did walk to Greenwich village one day and to the heart of Soho as well. You really just had to walk across that one main road near the hotel and you were in the heart of SoHo with all the shops, though note that theres not much else on that same vicinity as the hotel you need to walk a couple of blocks. The hotel did have a little coffee shop (and lollies) in the lobby so that gets you going till breakfast.Next time I travel to New York I will definitely be staying here again (next time hopefully in summer).:)

My favorite part of the hotel was the roof garden where I would go every night after a long day of walking in museums and shopping. Relaxing under the stars and watching the freedom tower was a pleasure. The bar staff all very friendly.The rooms are small, no closet but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom spacious.Isabella Bue, lobby host, was extremely nice and friendly and helped us to move to a larger room.Joey upon our arrival was also very nice and the bell boy on check out.We will certainly return.

The best service I've had in a hotel in New York. It felt like coming home. The staff are the best, as are the well appointed rooms, expansive shared spaces and fantastic food and beverage. I didn't want to leave.

We opted to stay further south on Manhattan this time we visited NYC and this hotel was a recommendation when we booked. It's impeccably clean and compared to many hotels in NYC, despite being pretty fully occupied and used, it didn't look tired. In fact it was a really chilled environment meaning it was comfortable enough to sit and enjoy a glass of wine downstairs when returning from a busy day.The hotel was exactly fit for purpose for us whilst staying in New York. The rooms were compact but functional. They had everything you need and there was a little shop downstairs where you could buy room essentials like water etc. The only thing I'd say is that if this is your first time visiting NYC, although the hotel is lovely, you may want to consider the location as the subway is a few blocks away, there isn't a great deal on the block or two around the hotel therefore I'd maybes check what your purpose of trip is. It depends what you're after; if you want everything on your doorstep this may not be for you but if you'd prefer to be out of the main hustle and bustle and your confident getting around the city, I'd say it's fine.

Great boutique hotel,great staff, area perfect! close to Grenwich . rooms are a bit small but still nice , you really only sleep there , out most of the time. I do say they work hard to make you happy even prececo , on arrival. James and Marta

Stayed for five days at Arlo Soho and loved the reception area and nice roof top bar, the rooms however...awful. We could barely fit our bags and ourselves into the room, and the bathroom (including toilet) was within the room itself - really expected more for the price tag...

Our stay at Arlo Soho was fantastic. The room was small but what better incentive to take advantage of what the hotel and city has to offer. Staff were super friendly, helpful and knowledgeable committed to making our stay as enjoyable as possible. The location in our view was outstanding, away from hustle and bussle with several subway stations virtually at your doorstep to connect you wherever you want to go. We will definitely be recommending this hotel to others and with any luck returning to stay there ouselves

A great warm welcome in such a vibrant hotel setting, the Arlo makes you feel right at home in the beating heart of New York. The King room gave us all the space we needed for our Manhattan stay, the rooms aren't superspacy but that's simply New York for you. The rooms are laid out very smart however, so we never felt claustrofobic. The modern design and ultrasoft beds helped out a lot on that part too. The staff of Arlo is what makes this hotel tick: enthousiastic staff, energetic folks with great tricks for conquering this mad city and a very positive attitude towards helping us feel at home in the big city. The location is perfect, with so many shops, sights and restaurants located in quite possibly one of the most "quiet" areas in Manhattan. There's a lot of hotels out there offering much less value for much more money, so there's no doubt we will be back! Ps: insider tip: take a good look at the wall opposite the elevators on the ground floor, many people who have been here before you (including us) have left behind a ton of great tips & tricks about New York on little notes, a very nice extra touch if you're looking for insider information.

We recently stayed here for two wonderful nights. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to NYC. We arrived with the intent to drop off our bags since we were early, and surprisingly our room was ready. We very much appreciated this as we had arrived from Australia the previous day and we were still dealing with jet lag. We asked where to get good bagels and were immediately directed down the street to a deli and we were very happy with the recommendation. The service at check in and throughout the stay was great, very friendly. The room was small, as expected, but comfortable with everything you need. I probably wouldn't go here as a new couple due to the bathroom situation, but we were fine. I loved Arlo Camping, boozy scoops, the rooftop bar, the lounge area, the whole vibe. If I'm ever back in NYC, this will be where I stay!

I enjoyed my stay here. The staff was extremely friendly, check in/out was streamlined and modern (on an ipad-like thing, making for a fast and unconventional desk experience), and the room was clean and functional. As other reviews mention the room was indeed small, but it is New York City. Hotel rooms are small in New York.The WiFi was fast, AC was good, bed was very comfortable, good location near a well-connected subway station. Plus an easy 20 minute walk to many places in the city.I would stay here again.

My stay at Arlo Hotel was magical!! Isabella at the front desk went above and beyond trying to accommodate our needs and made our stay as comfortable as possible! She is one of the main reasons why our stay at Arlo was so memorable. The hotel has an amazing hip and trendy environment that makes you smile everytime you walk through the door, it is incredibly clean which is something I value above all things. The beds are also very comfy and cozy :) If you go to NYC and are looking for a hotel don’t think about it twice and stay at this one!-Margarita and Giovanna
user_name:
WilliamD3537
New York City, New York

review_body: This is a great location in SOHO. It is near subway stops, restaurants and bars. Also, it is sort of close to the Hudson River walk/pier. However, unless you are a solo traveler, you are probably not going to want to stay there because the rooms are tiny (very). The shower and the toilet have one sliding glass door and you can hear everything. Everything is micro, there is no closet and not much room to do anything except sleep (and even then, I had to roll across my husband to get out of bed) and shower (and even that is a little difficult, especially to shave one’s legs). Our HVAC never worked, even though every day we called the engineers. They came up right away but they never fixed anything. Then again, we were never sure if the front desk staff ever told them when we were out of the room. Being that we stayed during a very hot time, not having proper A/C was the worst part. The price was right, though, but then again—you get what you pay for.

Wanted to say thank you to the whole staff at the Arlo Hotel in SOHO. They were very welcoming from the moment we all walked in and on our way out. All questions were answered with smiling faces and with helpful insight. Food was great and location provided easy access to all parts of the City. The room was very adorable and reminded me of high-end cruise line cabin. Rooftop has a great views of the city. Wanted to say thank you to Lindsey G. as she was very pleasant to deal with and extremely knowledgeable. Look forward to coming back.

Arlo SoHo is such a great experience! Besides being in a great part of the city, the hotel itself is such a fun place to explore and hang out in. The rooftop bar has great views and even better food and drinks. It seems as if the whole place is ready to be played with! TV's and board games in the lobby and the candy shop too!The rooms are small, but perfect for when you're actually going around exploring New York, they are simple, modern and have everything that you need. The steamer instead of an ironing board is such a great idea as well.The staff is super attentive as well. Everyone is asking if there's anything they could do, how my stay is going so far etc. Chad Nathan, for sure makes sure that everyones experience is flawless, he was always checking in on us.My favorite part has to be the outside area! In the middle of the lobby, you can go into this little garden area that has these rustic tents up year round! There's outlets to do your work, staff that can come by and wait on you, and a lot comfy seating options. So cool!We would definitely come back again!

The hotel is clean, modern, charming and wonderfully situated. We appreciated the welcome, the comfort and the wonderful isolation as we were right next to the elevator and haven't heard a thing. We are very satisfied with out stay

This hotel is very trendy, and the rooms are small but structured perfectly. However I have to say the staff is also extremely friendly and made everything even more pleasurable. I had a problem after losing the hotel key and even at very late hours of the day a staff member was able to help me with a smile on his face and did no seem annoyed at all by the inconvenience. I would come here again!

Overall a very Good hotel, could recommend this for a NY stay.Workspaces in the lobby area are superb. Rest. And bar ok.The Only thing that was irritating was the air conditioner in the room, it had a very high sound.

Rooms are smaller than expected but the room was nicely decorared. I enjoyed my stay with my friends here. Service was okay. The check-in staff was very welcoming. The location is a bit off from the central Soho. Overrall, it's a great stay!

Small but modern, trendy, hipster, chic ad clean hotel. Large bar and great saloon/ resting/working area in the lobby. Breakfast could be improved a bit (limited items) but overall a great place at a great location. Definitely my new hotel whilst in NYC!

We enjoyed our stay at this chic and modern hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The location was in walking distance to the heart of SoHo and subways are also easily accessible. The rooms are small but they pride themselves on that. The size of the room is perfect if your using your room as a place to crash during your visit. The rooms and the hotel are new, modern and very clean. Our room had a city view but by no means was a view of the entire city. It was a view none the less. The bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was very clean.Unfortunately the roof top bar was closed to us the night we stayed because a wedding party had it reserved. If the roof top bar is a must for you then I would ask ahead to make sure it will be open during your stay.

We’re coming back! The rooms are very small, but efficient. The staff was excellent. Towels and bedding top-notch. We also like the location of the Arlo in proximity of things to do in New York. I recommend it!

Fun, vibey hotel in soho NYC! Had such an enjoyable stay from check in to check out. Roof top bar is so beautiful!! Loved our stay thank you! Next time we are in NYC we will stay here again for sure!!

I've seen few places that have such a fun vibe -- every single employee we dealt with radiated a friendliness and informality. Room was extremely efficient in its use of space and feng shui. Very usable lobby and gathering areas, and a terrific place for a happy hour or late drink. And SoHo is such a terrific location.

Great front desk, bar tenders and event staff were very nice, restaurant on property- tiny rooms but you have everything you need! The coffee and candy bar in the lobby were a nice touch. Roof top bar was fun too!

Absolutely lovely hotel!! The room was excellent, super comfy bed and really nice layout. The staff were so friendly said good morning and enjoy your day, everyday without fail. Helped us on our last day book a taxi and were overall just really lovely. The hotel has a very modern feel and was exactly what I expected and more. Would definitely stay again, the location was perfect in a lovely area surrounded by lots of nice restaurants and cafes.

Great location and the property has a super cool vibe and layout for lots to do. Rooms are super clean. The hotel is managed with top tier service and the entire staff goes above and beyond to make your (my) stay enjoyable. From the team in housekeeping, the restaurant, coffee bar, room service, valet et et et., there are too many members to mention that helped give a great experience. Special thanks to Isabelle & Katya for their warm welcome into the property and their daily follow up while i was there. Theirs (and all staff) high energy and extra smiles are contagious and one of the reasons i will be back to Arlo!!!!. Arlo SoHo is by far the most fun and coolest hotel I've stayed in NYC and across the globe! Thank you team Arlo!!!

The service was fantastic from the start. Lindsey in particular was very attentive.The room, bars, rooftop and vibe were all fantastic. The employees uniforms were very cool.I will, most definitely, be back!

I checked in with Isabella,a little early to my surprise ty because I was just going to check my bag and grabbed an available bike to begin my big NY adventure on two wheels! Plugs for chargers and USB in the room are nice for device and yes it's compact, I love that, easy breezy. The staff could not have been nicer and I felt the access to 7th and nearness of Holland Tunnel(heard nothing,quiet..no really never been and wondered) gave great references to find my way back to the Mothership after Pride, coupled with easy access to Canal St Station gave me the key to the city, that's what I'm talking about. I got all stressed when I was running late for checkout when Dan T saved the day and I made it to my One. Least liked was kinda my fault but hey, have you ever checked into 231 then gone back with a dead phone from pictures looking for 321(clue Arlo is 231)?I have. NY saved me, it was Crocodile Dundee I think googled Arlo for me and I made it the final yards lol.

I stayed here one weekend in June when my mom was in town and was pleasantly surprised. Not only is it impeccably clean, but the rooms are incredibly sleek. We felt right at home in the modern, Scandinavian style room. Hotel room aside, the Arlo offers guests a cozy lobby and outdoor area. I loved coming downstairs to the lobby to grab a coffee and read in the morning, The rooftop is also another amazing feature of this hotel. Excellent stay all the way around!

I have family in NYC who recommended the Arlo SoHo. I stayed there on a business trip with the idea that it would also be a convenient location to see my family. Now that I have stayed there, the Arlo will be my first choice for all future trips ... business or pleasure. The rooms are small but efficient and beautifully appointed. The shower is fantastic! The staff is friendly and extremely knowledgeable and highly motivated to make guests comfortable and happy. HIghly recommended!
user_name:
Elizabeth A N
Washington, DC, United States

review_body: We booked this hotel because it was the only place we could find with a twin room across the entire city (huge family rooms with 2x king size beds in them were not in our budget and doubles were not suitable as my friend is pregnant and so needed her own bed). Despite being the only option, we really enjoyed our stay in one of the bunk rooms. The beds were so comfy and both beds had a huge TV at the end of them - not that we ever switched them on! Also the fact that we had bunk beds meant that there was a bit more floor space than the average NYC hotel. The only reason for 4 stars and not 5 is the fact that the bathroom is basically in the bedroom, it is just partitioned off with frosted glass. We are best friends so not really shy in front of each other but you probably wouldn’t want to share this room with someone you weren’t super comfortable with. Other than that, a trendy hotel in a great location with friendly staff. Would definitely recommend and stay there again.

I stay at Arlo Soho when I am in the area for work because it is modern, clean, stylish and comfortable. But even on top of that, the hospitality of the front desk staff is above and beyond in making everything as easy as possible. From advice on great spots to to eat and drink, to making sure you have a car at your disposal, to supplying you with forgotten personal items, to help with luggage, or even just super-friendly convos, they are such nice people!So, get this: The last day I was there I had shopped for pet toys and treats at a local pet store so that I had goodies to bring home to my fur babies. But I ended up leaving my bag at a restaurant before heading to the airport. I called the restaurant to see if they would allow me to send a shipping label for them to drop in the mail to me. They said they “couldn’t” do that. (The word is “wouldn’t”, can’t be bothered) Because the Arlo hotel staff was so great with advice while I was there, I reached out to see if they knew of any service that would go pick it up and send it. Lindsey G responded by saying that SHE would go grab it for me and send it! What??!So sweet and would not accept a tip. Got my bag in the mail a few days ago and I got some furry happy campers now. The rooftop is also a cool spot and the bartenders are also super sweet, great at convo/ connecting Also a wealth of practical info about the area

Staying at the Arlo was a wonderful experience- the staff were attentive and welcoming and the rooms are very well thought out - Scandinavian style - minimalistic yet beautifully designed.The bed was so comfortable, complete with luxurious sheets and puffy pillows. The full sized bottles of shampoo and conditioner were a pleasant surprise as I always need a lot of conditioner when washing my hair! The hand held steamer was also an excellent addition - much easier and quicker than an iron/ironing board. The food in the restaurant was fresh and healthy (there were also some not so healthy options - if that’s your preference!) - a little $$$ but still very good. Communal areas are in abundance- great for team meetings or finding a corner to do some work in a quiet space. Watching the sunsets from the rooftop bar was a glorious finish to the days, complete with a delicious raspberry and ginger cocktail!I can’t wait to come back to NYC just so I can stay at this hotel again!

I come to NY regularly for work and now I almost always stay here. The staff are friendly, the rooms are modern, quiet and always clean. There is a little shop on the 1st floor and a rooftop bar. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Very cool hotel, which was clear from the people who came just to hang out in the open public spaces. Room was small but efficient and clean, as I would expect in NYC. Bar staff was meh, but the rooftop patio was very cool with a great view. Decent location just off the super busy areas of Soho. Would highly recommend.

The only word I can use describe this hotel is contradiction. On checking I was greeted with very helpful staff, the process was fast and my room was ready. The room was small, in fact very small with a sink in the room and a shower and toilet separated only by a frosted glass divider. If you like your privacy you won't find much here. I was staying by myself so that was fine.We then headed off down to the bar (the rooftop one didn't open until 4pm) and thats where the contradiction begins. The staff were consistently (different staff on different days) incapable of providing anything remotely describable as service. From bar staff being unaware of what they stocked to actually shouting at us they were too busy to serve. The rooftop staff obviously are trained together with the other staff and they were equally as incompetent.Breakfast was a buffet with a limited choice but was enough and they have a decent enough selection for gluten free requirements. Again the staff let the place down.The rooftop bar was also closed one evening for a function which we thought was inappropriate considering its advertised as a feature of the hotel.

Can 100% recommend the Arlo as it is in a great location to great things. The only downside is the size of the room, although they have done a really intelligent design - staying with a friend meant we were quite 'enclosed' - that said - you can go downstairs or upstairs and enjoy some fun things. The best thing was the gal behind the bar - best barwoman we have ever expereinced - so awesome at her job. Check-in people are very nice - but a bit high school musical / varsity club at times. Good that the window opened as the aircon was way too noisy too.

From the second we entered the lobby to the moment of checkout the ARLO impressed, non-stop. The staff is one of the things that made the stay so comfortable. NYC can be intimidating but the staff reached out to us to check us in smoothly. I loved the lobby and the cozy sitting places, it felt like home and it was nice to see people sitting in the chairs and reading books. The rooms are small but comfortable especially the mattresses. I slept well and loved waking up to a wonderful view of the city when I rolled over. The bar staff at Harold's was also super welcoming and we had a great chat with Jose (I think was his name) about the tequila we were drinking. We asked a lot of questions and he was happy to answer them. The rooftop bar was fun with a vibrant crowd and an amazing view. The little shop in the lobby was perfect for my sweet tooth in the evening and my healthy eating habits in the morning. I am sorry I missed yoga on the rooftop. All I can say is this hotel was just so cute - from the cozy lobby, the tents in the courtyard, to the activities- yoga and mediation. It was a pleasant surprise to feel so comfortable in the city. The most pleasant surprise - the signature ARLO scent! I could smell it a block away and still have the scent on my mind.

Excellent in every way. Cool public space with bars, restaurants, outdoor areas and a great vibe. Great rooftop bar and lounge. Staff are superior. Rooms were small but perfect for a weekend getaway. We were given a handicapped accessible room which was quite a bit larger and had a nice city view.

...if I’d had known we had a rooftop ‘club’ not a ‘bar’ directly above our heads, I would have not of booked for my partners 30th. It’s 1am and we have the thudding, pounding nightclub above us on the 10th floor. We have asked to be moved 2 nights running to no avail. The windows also don’t align in the rooms so acoustically very poor and scraping and banging above from the club! This has reined my Partners Birthday trip, they have refused to turn down the music and drum kit (drumming), and the vibrations move through the room like a drum set. Apparently...’Comfortable guestrooms ensure a good night's sleep’ on the website - Not True.Another morning wasted being overtired - even with our 26db ear plugs we bought on the first night - Hopefully are package holiday company will move us tomorrow!

Ok picture this , planning a trip to New York from down under and my sister says "I know a great place in soho called Arlo hotel .So we booked a week and thought let's find our feet in the big apple ( still not sure where that term comes from ha ha) and then go somewhere else , sounds like a good plan .It was my birthday and my wedding anniversary and this trip was going to be a special one in the big apple , so what's with this apple thing as everyone I asked had a different answer anyway I must let it go .Back to this Arlo boutique hotel, I was impressed so much so that I rebooked another week there . I know right ....2 weeks in the same place when I had the rest of New York to choose from .Well I won't lie I did check out a few other places and talk about unfriendly cold and can I say uncomfortable looking hotels !!!So what makes Arlo the hidden gem in NYC , the people Lindsey our front desk manager legend and Sarina my go to barrister in the coffee shop ( Aussies love a good cappuccino in the morning )How on Gods earth do you Americans drink that brewed cawwfee ????So Arlo ,is hip it's unique it's on point and oh yeh did I mention the rooftop bar it was going off !!!But the true success of any hotel is the people so thank you girls , show this to the boss as I think you both need a wage increase . So it's a yes from me and my wife 10 out of 10

The room is quite small but if that's the killer for you then NYC isn't the place for you. The room is very clean and modern. Perfect location right near a subway station to take you anywhere, 20 minute walk from Little Italy and the World Trade Center. Service was excellent. Rooftop bar was very cool and has a great view of the city. Overall this is one of the best places I've stayed in NYC and would highly recommend it to anyone coming to the city.

Smallest hotel room I have ever seen, but the biggest problem was The fact that we couldn’t even walk around the bed and had to climb over it in order to get to the other side. The bathroom area was so small that the entire place gets soaked when someone takes a shower. After my wife and I took showers almost the whole hotel room was wet. Very stylish and hip common areas but it simply doesn’t make up for the fundamentally flawed design of the guest room

Staff were very helpful and courteous. I loved the steamer in the room (instead of iron). The shower head was big & lovely. Toiletries were great.But the room was tiny, even claustrophobic. I have stayed in a room like that, but in Denmark, and for 1/3 of the price (and Denmark is not an inexpensive place), and better designed.Desk chair had no back, so there was no place to sit other than the bed. I was so glad I had not much to do for work / did not need the desk as I usually do when I travel for business. No room to do yoga or simple exercises & no gym in the hotel. Toilet was practically in the shower, which was strange & not comfortable. Window looked out into other rooms so even with a mesh screen pulled down, you could see what other people were doing so they could see you as well. You had to go full blackout screen to get privacy but that turned your room into a cave...I was on the fifth floor but still heard a lot of noise at night, either rising up from the restaurant that was right below in am open roof courtyard or from the rooftop deck. Luckily I was able to fall asleep but it was not a peaceful space.I think I could have tolerated it had it been less expensive, but for $300+, it was overall a disappointing experience and felt overpriced.

We loved this spot — we will definitely stay again! I booked a last minute stay on a Sunday night, and it was such a treat. We had a complimentary upgrade to a King which made us so happy. Looking forward to trying the other location as well.

However you say it, this place is cool. The mid-century inspired decor is super fun, with quirks like the candy bar and outdoor tents. It’s new, clean, smells great (not to be taken for granted) and is in a great location that can be used as a home base for a trip to NYC. Very close to the subway, you can walk right to the shops in SoHo and even the Brooklyn Bridge. The rooms are small, but the space is so well used you have everything you need. The rooms are clean, modern, and loaded with amenities and extras. We appreciated the fridge and the Chrome cast for entertainment. We didn’t mind our downtime in the room at all. I loved the vibe of this place, the rooftop was quaint and fun to hangout on in the evenings after running around the city. Would highly recommend and would stay here again and again. Oh, and shoutout to all of the super-attentive staff members.

Where do I start? I stayed here overnight on a business trip. I checked in at around 11:30pm. Around 12am, I started to notice that the room was very room. I checked the thermostat and it showed 72 though it was set to 64. I felt the air from the vents and it was lukewarm. So I called front desk and they said they'd send me an engineer. Waited for 20 minutes and finally someone showed up. He restarted the unit and said it was fixed even though the temperature did not go down quickly (both of us stared at the thermostat for 15 minutes). He reassured me that it was fixed and went away. Half an hour later, it was still at 70 and it was still quite warm. Again, I called the front desk and again they said they'd send an engineer. I asked for a fan and they said they'd see if it got fixed. I insisted on a fan and they sent the same engineer with a fan. He once again restarted the system and said it was fixed. The fan he gave me was quite useless but at this point it was around 1:45am and I had taken a long flight from the west coast and was ready to hit the sack. The A/C stopped again and for the rest of my trip was stuck at 72. I managed to get 4 hours of sleep in that sauna. Their blinds don't cover the windows fully and sunlight crept in and woke me up. Overall, it was a horrible night. I paid the price for choosing a decrepit hotel.

Great place !!! I will use them again for any travels to New York ! It was very clean . It is accessible to everything ! The staff are very pleasant ! Very nice outside patio . They met all my expectations !!!!

Had a really nice stay. Room has everything a solo traveler needs, everything was very nice, beautiful and clean. The hotel stuff is extremely nice and welcoming, truly a level above ordinary hotels, I admit I really didn't need anything out of the ordinary, but I'm sure they would go out of their way to make it happen is I did. Highly recommended option in nyc

After reading all of the reviews, I thought this would be a wonderful hotel. It is a "hip" hotel with extremely nice staff. Beyond that, I was thoroughly disappointed. The rooms lack even the most basic accouterments that would be expected for a business traveler. To be fair, I didn't ask if those things would be there. I learned that lesson.The rooms have no ironing board. They have a steamer in a cool bag. Lesson learned: Ask if the hotel has an ironing board.They do not provide a bag for your dirty laundry. Lesson learned: Ask if the hotel provides a bag for dirty laundry.The desk chair they provide has no back to it. It's like a small stool. My back was aching after just one night. Lesson learned: Ask if the hotel provides true chairs - with a back. Yes, you read that right.There was no guide in the room for any of the hotel services (room service, etc.). Lesson learned: Ask if the hotel has a printed room service menu.There is virtually no storage for clothing. No drawers. Just a tiny 12" rack and some hangars. Lesson learned: Ask if there is a place to unpack your clothes.I learned the hard way. You have to ask about everything before you book.This hotel may be "hip." The staff are very friendly. But this hotel is completely dysfunctional for the business traveler. All this for over $300/night (including taxes). I will most definitely not stay here again.

Absolutely amazing Hotel, will definitely be returning! So quirky & the staff were amazing. I visited with my brother & we had bunk beds which were so cute. Ideally located literally 2 mins from the subway.

My wife and I just finished our wedding weekend in NYC, where we spent 6 nights at the Arlo Soho. We had a wedding party of about 30 friends who stayed at the Arlo as well. All of us agree that the Arlo hotel, Soho has the best customer service in the city. Special thanks to Lindsey at the front desk who made our stay an absolute pleasure and helped our entire group with the bookings. Special thanks to Kate, in sales, who helped us with our group bookings and ensured all of our guests had the best time possible. Kate truly went out of her way to make this weekend magical. Thanks to Mozes who was super helpful with our bags and making us feel at home. Lastly, thanks to all of the Arlo staff - all of you helped make this wedding weekend the best weekend of our lives. The rooms are beautiful, clean, and have great views. The rooftop bar is super trendy with great views, music and drinks. The lobby is nice and relaxing with some cool extras like dillons candy bar, tents with picnic tables to chill on, and a great restaurant in the back with one of the best burgers in NYC. WE WILL BE BACK. ARLO SOHO SHOWED US THE BEST TIME. THANK YOU AGAIN.

We came here for a business trip and the team at the Arlo were so incredibly helpful and friendly! Big thanks Lindsey who in particular went above and beyond for us. Another thing to note Beds SUPER comfortable! We will be back!

Love the Arlo SoHo! Always my first choice of hotels when visiting NYC for business. There are so many options and places to work and read on the first floor, an adorable gift shop near the concierge and a mini-cafe. Rooms are small but efficient, great service and the shower products smell amazing.The roofdeck is a popular spot to grab a cocktail and take in the city views.

The ARLO SoHo has been my home away from home on two occasions so far. The rooms are wonderfully creative in their minimalist use of space, and the beds are among the most comfortable anywhere. As if this isn't enough, the lobbies are gorgeous and welcoming, along with a fabulous staff who seem to thoroughly enjoy their jobs! While I hope to return to the ARLO SoHo in the near future, it has competition for my traveling dollars--the ARLO NoMad, which I can't wait to experience!

This was our second stay and it was as awesome as the first!! I've been to NYC a dozen times and this is the best value for money hands down. They've done an amazing job of creating a high-end boutique vibe and aesthetic while keeping costs reasonable. The location on the outskirts of SOHO means you've got everything you want within walking distance. The rooftop was great for cocktails in the afternoon and the candy store in the lobby made for excellent late-night snacking. Be sure to try the burger from the restaurants too!Special shoutout to Lindsey at the front desk who really made an effort to connect with us and make us feel at home. She looked after anything we needed and was a wealth of information for seeing the city.

really small room . but the mattress.and the sheet re really comfortable and the  everything and all the staff was kind and effective . i recommend this hotel. and for sure , we ll coming back again . is perfect for 4or 5 nights max.

One of the best hotels I have stayed in New York. Very clean room. Friendly staffs. Amazing atmosphere. Might not be the best fit if travel with elderly though. I stayed here with my parents, and the room was a little too small for them.Overall I had an amazing stay here, and will definitely stay here again for my next visit.

My first time at an Arlo. Room were small but so well designed, everything was functional and the staff couldn't have been more helpful. I would try it again, it was worth the price and you can't beat the location, who does not want to be in Soho? Drinks at the bar were perfect.

Nice accommodations: quiet library for reading or relaxing. Nice clean rooms. Helpful, friendly staff. Room is just the right size if you're not too girthy.In-house restaurant very convenient . Located a short walk from nice restaurants.

My stay at Arlo was amazing. It was my second visit and both times the staff could not have been more warm, welcoming and accommodating. The hotel is simply beautiful! Love it here! Will be back again!
user_name:
mmbutterfly999
New York City, New York

review_body: Fabulous boutique hotel in Tribeca. Room was small but cozy. The staff could not have been more professional and friendly. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay! Location is convenient to area restaurants and the Holland Tunnel.

Superb hotel, with a wonderful lay out full of lots of funky little areas to sit and relax, from the rooftop bar area to the beautiful restaurant. Excellent rooms for staying in with a very modern and sleek look to them. Staff are very helpful and always really nice. For me, it’s a 5 star hotel designed for anyone looking to visit NYC over the weekend, we throughly enjoyed our stay.

Nice & clean and - what a roof garden! Although beverage prices are a bit over the top...Very friendly staff, always helpful and kind! Rooms are very small, but stylish and neatly decorated. Walking distance to a lot of hot spots.

Loved our stay at the Arlo Soho. Location is excellent. Not sure if it's the location or configuration of hotel but we had the most quiet nights sleeps I have ever had in Manhattan. Rooms are small but extremely efficient. Front desk staff was excellent. Lobby bustling and welcoming to even non-guests. Lobby coffee bar gets the job done!

We loved our 5 night stay in late May/early June 2018 at Arlo Soho. This was a return visit to the hotel for me having been there a few months earlier in Dec ember 2017. The hotel is stylish and modern without being pretentious or stark. The main lobby area and lounges are beautifully decorated with lots of room to stretch out for a morning coffee or a meeting.Staff is friendly, welcoming and helpful with information on the city and any transportation needs you might have.The rooms are small but efficient in their layout and are clean and modern (we had a king bed) Mattress and linens are comfortable.Hotel location is ideal for walking out to Soho or Tribeca and only a short walk to other areas downtown.

I’m so happy I found this hip hotel online. Very clean, friendly and awesome staff, and all around great place. Beautiful views from rooftop bar. Loved the social areas. I will be back. Thank you. It was a pleasure.
The room was cleanThe hotel was in a perfect location!Friendly staffVery close to metro stationWalking distance to shops, nice restaurands and cafesWalking distance to China town and Little Italy

Stayed 4 nights at Arlo SoHo- a gem of a place with great friendly, helpful and efficient staff and fantastic facilities. Particularly loved the courtyard and fresh coffee service in the Pantry and the amazing rooftop bar which has recently re-opened. The hotel is a short walk from the West Village and Hudson River park which is great for a morning walk or jog. We didn’t eat in the restaurant but enjoyed a few drinks in both the courtyard and rooftop bar with excellent service. Overall great value for money- only small complaint in our room (Queen size) was a lack of wardrobe hanging space- the “pole in the wall” style design had around 6 hangers only- another one on the opposite wall would’ve done the job!.. an easy to use hand held steamer came in handy though which is a nice touch in the rooms. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay thanks.

My first time at the Arlo but definitely not my last. I had an amazing stay at the Arlo Soho, my room was small but so well designed and functional. The staff and service is really what sets them apart, from the moment you approach the front desk to practically everyone I encountered. You can feel the training that went into everyone on the team. See you guys again soon

I stayed one night while visiting New York City with my mom. The hotel is very hip and happening. The staff were welcoming, courteous and very helpful. The rooms are small but very well thought out and everything is included in a small space. I loved the camp feel to the hotel (tents outside, notes to post on the wall) areas to sit and chill. The rooftop terrace is awesome. We didn't have a chance to eat there but the menu looked great. I highly recommend this hotel and can't wait to visit again.

I have just returned from a week in the Arlo Soho and after this, I wouldn't stay in any other hotel in NY. I have stayed in others but this is by far the best. The hotel has the clean elegant lines of Sweden and the excellent open supportiveness of American staff. Everyone from the cleaners to the managers were consistently friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautifully appointed - excellent shower - and we had a room with a terrace and a great view over the city. The hotel has a great restaurant - we had three breakfasts and two dinners and each meal was wonderful - and a lovely bar, as well as very comfortable seating areas indoors and a garden terrace. One special feature is that anywhere you sit there is a bank of plugs for your tekkie stuff. I loved that! The WiFi is also excellent in the hotel. The Arlo is situated near to the subway and is a short walk from the Village and all its night life as well as being very accessible to the rest of Manhatten. The hotel is maintained to the highest standards. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

I needed a hotel for a last-minute business trip and Arlo was right across the street from my meeting. I was really impressed with the space (so super cute), the activities (yoga, live music, a surf workout) and the staff. There are a lot of open spaces to work from, too! Everyone was very friendly and helpful and I would absolutely stay here again for work or for fun.

I was supposed to meet a friend here before heading out of town, but her flight was rescheduled. I ended up staying by myself and loving it! Late night bagel was great after traveling. The music at the rooftop bar wasn’t too loud while i was on floor 9. I slept like a baby in that super comfy bed! The atmosphere and social charm of the entire establishment made me feel at home while i was very far from home.

It’s has small rooms but with everything you need. It’s a great base to have if you are exploring the city or here for work. The staff are very friendly and will always help with anything you need. I highly recommend.

Really enjoyed staying at the Arlo Soho - love the look and the friendly staff. The location was awesome, as well as the rooftop bar. The room uses the space well and appreciate the location of all the outlets.

As a freelance worker, I am always looking for hotels with facilities that make working on the road easier. And the Arlo happens to be the best I have found so far. Located at the heart of Soho, it offers some of the most modern work areas (both inside and outside) I have seen. It is worth visiting their Website to see pictures of the working areas as they are pretty impressive. No need to to worry about finding an electrical outlet for your laptop, they are absolutely everywhere, even at the hotel bar. The Arlo is also a great place for business meeting of for travelling with work colleagues. I also noticed many couples visiting for a long romantic weekend. It is also conveniently located for some serious shopping and dining. I recommend making a budget before departure, otherwise Soho could run your credit card pretty high.The rooms are a bit small, but extremely clean and practical. You can take long showers without the risk of running out of hot water. They also make a killer latte at the reception. The hotel restaurant is also great. I tried half of the menu and was really impressed (you have to try the pizza). The strongest point however, is the staff. They are super friendly, especially Caroline and Lindsey at the lobby who will go out of their way to make your stay the best possible experience. The bartenders are also terrific and I was particularly surprised at the cleaning staff’s friendliness (in other hotels I have been to, they tend to be discreet and invisible). My only drawback would be the price of the food they sell at the reception, which is mighty expensive. That being said, I have been to the Arlo 3 times already and will keep going there every time I need to visit NYC for business or pleasure.

Great location in Soho and ultra chic lobby. The room was very tiny but that would have been ok if not for the BATHROOM which is not a separate room but rather just some glass space right next to bed with a rolling glass barn door that didn't even close all the way...No privacy at all...I actually used the bathroom in the lobby ...

This was the third time I’ve stayed at the Arlo and I’m happy to see it continues to evolve and just gets better each time. I was greeted warmly by the front desk staff and made to feel like family. There was even a hand written card in my room welcoming me back. A lovely touch. And they were kind enough to let me check in early after a long overnight flight. The room is so cleverly designed that it feels spacious, and the beds are heavenly. I’ve never slept so well in a hotel. Thanks especially to Joe, Lindsey and Abby for going the extra mile for me.
