We booked this on Hotel Tonight to attend a concert at the City Winery. It was a perfect location for the show because it's only a few blocks away. The hotel is not in the most commercial area of town, but I guess that is good because it is very quiet. Very little traffic in the area on the holiday weekend that we stayed there. Very convenient to the 1 train stop on Canal Street. The hotel is very clean and chic but our 4th floor room was very small. The sink is right in the main part of the room and the desk is a small fold-down desk. The bed was very comfortable but up against a window and the inside person has to climb over the bed. It's nice to look out the window, but not good if you have to get up in the middle of the night. There is a roof top bar but the drink prices are exorbitant. Overall I would say it is nice for a night or two, but not a long stay. No room to spread out. I'd ask for a larger room.

lucky find, drinks fairly priced, nice view of jersey (is there such a thing), great mixed crowd, young, mid and old. Had the IPA and some cocktails, people were quite friend, so was the staff, great evening in Soho

A colleague and myself had a 5 night trip to New York. The hotel was ideal. Perfectly closely located to the restaurants we were there to visit but also in a "quiet" area for Manhattan. The staff are incredibly friendly and helpfully. Cannot wait until my next trip to New York and will definitely stay there again.

Had a great stay at Arlo Soho for 7 nights. Location is fantastic, easy walk to Broadway for shopping and exploring all the neighbourhoods in the area was amazing. Dan and his team at the hotel were extremely friendly and helpful, the room was always beautifully cleaned and one of the best rooms I’ve stayed in.

We stayed 2 nights at Arlo Soho with my family. A wonderful experience! The staff was concerned about our well being. The hotel is stylisch and is being frequented bij a young audience. Small but modern and well equiped rooms. I can recommend the hotel to anyone who wants perfect and personal service, a beautiful and lively interior. The location in Soho, near The Village is also perfect! The rooftop bar is the icing on the cake. A beautiful place with a human touch.

Tendy hotel, really cool lobby and bar area. Roof terrace is a great spot for some drinks before an evening out. Location is perfect for exploring lower Manhattan and all it has to offer. All the staff were incredible throughout my stay but a massive thank you to Daniel for sorting the return of my lost property! Going above and beyond. If you want some balance to the review the lifts were a little slow and bag storage is on one of the higher floors so when collecting make sure you leave 5 minutes extra. Otherwise outstanding hotel and will definitely be back.

Loved it - particularly for the price+quality+location. Don’t think it could be beat. Will definitely return. The rooms are tiny but have everything you need. Clean. Beds / pillows felt luxurious. Met some great people here chatting in the bar after being out. What I loved - proximity to the West Village. The energy / vibe. Lots of business people, international travelers. What I didn’t love - no coffee in the room. (But you can get it in the Bodega downstairs at any time.)

Great location within walking distance to the awesome neighborhoods of Soho and Greenwich Village and access to subway. The hotel itself is very cool with a laidback, casual chic vibe. Rooms are small but beds are super comfortable. One request would be bottle water in the rooms.

The Arlo Soho is situated in a good location to explore NY. Access to downtown and uptown easily via the Red 1 Metro line. And Brooklyn is easily accessed as well.It is a four star and trendy place. More young than senior audience. Music loud in the lobby, trendy stuff for sale plus lots of sweets, lounging corner and expensive drinks on the roof top terrace. "Concept" is the central word. On the functional side however we missed: enough place/space to hang/keep out clothes and towels in the room; info on home television or on paper on WIFI; info on what public transport lines/connections take us to JFK. Explanation on the counter downstairs was not sufficient/scratchy and led us out the wrong way. You'd say a professional 4 star hotel offers a ready route instruction.

This hotel is top notch.It got everything: amazing breakfast, rooftop bar, activities such as movie nights and yoga, there are bikes to borrow and really nice spaces just to hang out.The Wi-Fi works very well and there is coverage all over the hotel. The location is great, just a short walk to the various subway stations on canal street allowing you to travel all over, and also close to Hudson river park which is nice for a morning run.The rooms are cosy but there is nowhere really to unpack a part from a couple of hangers.Bathroom is good but don't allow for a lot of privacy (if you share the room with someone).You can easily charge your phone or other devices directly through usb cable on both sides of the bed (in our room, we could charge up to 5 devices at the same time).I would highly recommend this hotel!

A great location for a weekend trip to Manhattan. Easy access to the subway and to the shops and restaurants in SoHo and the village. A great rooftop patio to have a drink and enjoy the views over the city.

Arlo Soho is my absolute favorite hotel to stay in when I’m in NYC. The staff is amazing and the rooms are very comfortable. I am in NYC 2 or 3 times a month and they have made their hotel my home away from home.

Fantastic stay at Arlo Soho for two weeks with the family.Great hotel with excellent front line service.Lobby host Lindsey was terrific in her support,booking tickets to Broadway,recommending restaurants and directions for travel around the big apple.Hotel lobby ,bar and lounge with tents great for relaxing after walking all day in NYC

Room was perfect. A bit small but well laid out, had all the extras I needed (like a steamer and an umbrella), and an amazing shower. The staff was incredible and the service was great. The restaurant in the hotel was delicious too!

Don’t miss this gem boutique hotel with smartly designed modern rooms. Awesome king size bed and wonderful rain shower! Rooms are small but practical. I was impressed by the really friendly and helpful staff. Situated in the heart of Soho. Close to multiple great restaurants, bars and activities. Twenty minute walk to the Freedom Tower and 9/11 Memorial. 12 min walk to Chinatown and Little Italy. Fun lobby lounge, bar and a coffee/candy shop attached to the lobby. There is an outdoor patio area to enjoy a peaceful break from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. Definitely book this hotel and enjoy the experience! I will be back and tell all of my friends. Tom

I don't understand this hotel. It is styled in a very hip way, but the rooms are absurd. The bathroom is basically in the room and there's no ventilation at all so you are basically sleeping in a bathroom. They don't change the towels unless you ask. Forget about trying to get a cab to drop you off or pick you up because of Holland Tunnel traffic. I checked out mid trip because I was so unhappy. Also I had to sleep with AC turned off because it was so insanely loud and cycled on and off every minute.

Value (what you get for what you pay):Low value. We paid $350 ish a night for a room as small as 140sqf!!! Location could be better, breakfast not included. Location:Decent location in Soho, but will prefer The James or some of the other hotels a bit closer to the actionThe room:Smallest room I ever stayed in. No where to hang clothes. Sink is outside the bathroom (not even a bathroom - it is just some glass separating the toilet from rest of the room) and you can almost touch it from the bed. No where to leave clothes/suitcases.Breakfast:Not included so didn’t try it. Tried the cafe in the lobby - paid 6 bucks for a ginger shot Staff:Very helpful and kind staff. Always well staffed so rare to have to wait in line in the lobby. Handed out umbrellas when it rained. Knew the local market well and had several good recommendations. Will recommend to others?:No - not at that price

We arrived from Ireland and stayed in the Arlo SoHO in April 2018. It was so good we decided to return in May 2018 and stay a second time. The team led by Lyndsey, was so helpful, efficient and made our trip seamless in every way. On our return, the Super Rooftop bar was open...downtown city vibe, encompassing all the energy New York has to offer. It is a Boutique hotel, and it's cool and spacious interiors make it a definite stay in this very pleasing New York Location.

I stayed there for a couple of days and absolutely loved this hotel! My trip was a mixture of business and pleasure, but this hotel made it seem like a complete vacation. The 24hr shop has a Dylan's Candy Bar AND lots of other good, healthy options. There are lots of little fun souvenirs for sale, too. All of it cool - nothing cheesy or touristy. The location is incredible, too! Also, the rooms have black out curtains and the windows keep out all the noise. Rooms are really small, but so functional. I didn't miss having more space. There was a steamer in my room, decent hair dryer, and the products were great. Loved it. I'll be back, for sure!

Dylan's Candy Bar in the reception area - how great is that? Love the Scandinavian chicness of the rooms - ingenious use of space. Friendly & accomodating staff. Great location with quick access to nearby neighborhoods - easy 15 minute walk to Greenwich Village. Two suitcases were a bit tight but we managed to make it work. Will plan on staying here again.

The hotel room is small by NYC standards, but the design is smart, blending useful layout and aesthetics. There isn't much room for big luggage, but two carry-ons can be stored easily.We took advantage of the common space, ie the rooftop and the downstairs lounge, which was perfect for drinks with friends. Loved the design and the very friendly staff!

I’ve been in NYC for a few years now and I always want to “escape” from the normal routine of the city to a place where I can completely relax but also stimulates my creativity. When I found the Arlo in SoHo I immediately feel in love with the modern, yet comfortable design and the extremely accommodating staff. My factories thing about the property is that the community spaces are expertly put together to where you can visually see / engage with your surroundings yet also have some divide due to the design of the space. Hidden Gem: the second floor has a beautiful area you can host meetings, or get some work done yourself and still have a peek over the balcony at the scene going on down stairs. The rooftop is beautif. Many hotels try to overdue the asthetics but this location plays perfectly off the areas natural beauty and gives amazing views. Food, drinks, Dylan’s Candy Bar ( if you haven’t had you are missing out ) and also themed nights make this and ideal space for business and pleasure.

The location of this hotel is second to none. The staff could not be faulted. Great rooms, compact with everything you could possibly need. Great movies if you need a rest in the afternoon, we certainly did. New York is full on and you really do need a place to escape to and the Arlo is perfect for that.The only down side is the hectic atmosphere of the reception area. It is a very youthful hotel and so there seems an urgency to have fun and this can come with a lot of noise. Once past all of that and safely in your room you are able to feel calm again. We cannot praise the excellence of the staff enough. Thank you all at the Arlo.

Overall impression of this hotel is very good: Hudson square, shops in the hall, public spaces, restaurant . Rooms are compact but very effectively designed and clean. The staff at the front desk were very kind and supportive. I had a room on the 10th floor and complained about noise coming from the rooftop lounge. The room was immediately replaced to another one on the 3d floor without additional charges.

I've stayed in both Arlo's (SOHO and NOMAD) and I enjoy the boutique experience. The staff are the most welcoming I've encountered for business travel. Everything I need is on-site and it seems the people who stay there are also warm and friendly. I appreciate the common spaces for plugging in the laptop and getting a little work done - always other friendly people at the table.

I loved the king bed room. Love the electric window shades, the modern design, the cleanliness, and the amenities in the lounge, cafe, and bar. It had everything I needed! Only thing I didn't like was the desk was a little too small, and the desk light was poorly placed in such a way that it couldn't function well and just got in the way.

This hotel is awesome, with a great vibe and a variety of public spaces, lounges, tents (!) and events to bring people together. The Arlo Roof Top is NOT to be missed on any beautiful afternoon or evening. My friend and I splurged on a terrace room for our first grownup trip to NYC, and we are so glad we did. The entire Arlo staff made us feel welcome and special, including champagne for us and a handwritten note welcoming us - by name - to the Arlo Soho. Of special mention are the awesome Arlo Staff: Dan T and Abby Powell in the lobby to the incredible barista at the lobby bodega (forgot her name, but never her cappuccinos!)

This was my dad's and mine first time in New York City. My dad chose this hotel based off of a recommendation from a friend. The rooms are small, but you don't really need a lot of space to sleep. We had the two twin bed + Terrance room. The balcony was a very good side with two lounge chairs and two other chairs. It gave a beautiful view of part of the city. There is a rooftop bar that is both inside and outside that are both gorgeous. They have plenty of seating areas with outlets for charging electronics downstairs. They have a small conscience store that offers different types of breakfast items, coffee, snacks and a small Dylan's Candy Bar. In the back they have a restaraunt called Harolds that have an awesome staff. The bartender gave us some good food recommendations! The only downfall was that our room was late to be ready by two hours. I was tired and my phone had died, otherwise I wouldn't have minded too much. But the lady who checked us in was amazing! She apologized profusely and gave us a free drink card. She also hailed us a cab later on in the evening! Her name was Abby and I would stay at this hotel just because of her! Lindsey helped us with printing out maps and directions to get our Big Bus Tour tickets and the Magnolia Bakery. Katya checked us out and was very welcoming. She wished us a safe flight back home and hoped we come back soon! My dad also wanted me to mention Maria who helped book our reservations with the hotel beforehand!! Thank you for a wonderful stay! We can't wait to come back to NYC very soon!

I stayed at Arlo SOHO over the weekend to celebrate my wife's birthday. We came up from Orlando Florida and I have to say that I have never had such a great experience. Everyone was so helpful (when I say everyone I mean Everyone) Dan k, Lindsey, Abby, Isabella, Amaris, Tamar, (sorry if i missed anyone). From the Door Greeter, Front Desk and The Managers. We truly felt like Royalty. The attention to detail on my request for the little extras in the room was outstanding. Everything was perfect. Oh and the Free Upgrade was the icing on the cake. We are still speechless. Thank you Arlo Hotels and its Staff for making this trip one of the best experiences we have ever had.A Very Grateful Guest,Luis R.

Great experience staying at Arlo Soho! It was just an amazing 3 days weekend and al the staff was so gentle and friendly with us.The rooms are so nice and everything was perfect.The rooftop worth a visit as well.

We had booked Arlo Soho for the first leg of our honeymoon, following lots of research as we particularly wanted to be in the Chelsea/ Soho area. Landed at JFK at 8pm from the UK to find an email from Arlo saying they had cancelled our booking due to issues with payment. During our flight, they had tried to take payment from an expired credit card (my fault I know), however they had immediately cancelled the reservation and then sold all rooms, leaving us no chance to try and rectify the situation. After time spent on the phone they confirmed they no longer had any rooms and we were left to try and find a new hotel for our stay in New York at the last minute. Prices had sky rocketed, loads had sold out and nothing in our chosen location. Our first couple of hours in New York were spent stressed out in The airport frantically trying to find somewhere to stay after a long and tiring flight, we then also missed our dinner reservation in a restaurant hard to get into, which I had booked months before. Great policy Arlo and great start to our honeymoon.

We stayed in the Arlo for 5 nights in April.It’s a modern hotel with a great restaurant, lovely bar and chill out areas which include outdoor tents which are beautiful set with fairy lights and heaters if it gets chilly.We stayed in a room with a gorgeous terrace which was probably as big as the room! The room was very compact and the shower and toilet were behind a frosted screen which is not ideal if you are a bit shy!There was no real hanging space for a 5 night trip (only a few hanging pegs) and nowhere to put the suitcases so we found ourselves struggling for space hence the 4 star and not 5 star review.Otherwise I couldn’t fault The Arlo, it was clean, comfortable and the staff ( specially on reception) could not have been more attentive. It was a great location for us to visit all the New York hotspots and we loved to be able to collapse in the lovely lively bar for a night cap in the evening after our travels.It was also excellent to be able to amble downstairs in the morning and grab coffees from the lovely coffee bar to take back to the room without judgment (blurry eyed in my tracksuit) and be welcomed without fail wit a smile.I would definitely recommend this hotel, it’s young, vibrant, well run, comfortable, clean and in a great location.Thanks for a great stay!

We loved our stay here. Very clean and comfortable. The hotel offered a great restaurant and bar, as well as a super neat courtyard. We also enjoyed how close we were other cool spots around. The staff here is completely marvelous!!

Room was clean, hotel lobby had an awesome vibe. Great place to stay. Highly recommend.Check in was clean. Was offered a free cocktail on arrival and a free coffee on check-out. Service was pretty spot on.

Arlo Soho is so clean, I love when everything in the room is bright white! The bathroom situation is a little different, but we made rules and didn’t let it bother us. The hotel is in a busy area but public transportation is a breeze. The common areas downstairs are set up lovely. I would love to return to Arlo!

So, we had been warned about small rooms in NYC - Arlo makes no promises for size, but upon arrival the check-in host was very accommodating, due to our long stay (6 nights) we were 'upgraded' to the 9th floor and told it would be better for the length of time. She was spot on. I'm not sure what people expect, but considering we spent time sleeping and showering in the place, we had ample room - but then again, we aren't American, so expectations are different. Clean, tidy, fresh and well appointed - we loved the steamer instead of an iron, and having the hairdryer meant more room for my partners clothes in her suitcase! Only minor detail was not having any tea and coffee facilities - instead you're forced to pay for overpriced coffee down in the lobby... my advice: have one of their 'draft latte's' and then go explore other watering holes (not Starbucks, for your own sanity!)- its NY, you trip over great coffee shops!The bathroom has a great rain-head shower, fantastic body wash/shampoo products that are yours to use (and incidentally, almost everything can be purchased to take home if you're so inclined). The bed was very comfy, although pounding round NYC meant we barely remember falling asleep, we woke refreshed and raring to go the following day.Staff were always friendly, the pick 'n' mix candy store was a definite win and the communal areas were warm and inviting.I'd recommend staying here for those who want a great location (#1 Subway @ Canal St) thats close to everything you need in Manhattan. You get free WiFi and if you do want to watch some TV, they are huge... just remember that 'on-demand' content is extra. Final point - there are two sets of blinds, one to diffuse the light, other to create a blackout - the picture windows are amazing and are a great size, but NYC at the 9th floor isn't renowned for its views! Just remember, it's pretty trendy and not a 'full service' hotel by any stretch, but it well worth the money and we are going back for sure for NYC Part 2!

If you are not a fan of European sized rooms or hotels where the design emphasis is on encouraging you to use socials spaces in the lobby this is not the hotel for you. If these things do not bother you then this is a great spot in the heart of SoHo and Tribeca. The hotel has a fun and funky vibe. Check in was easy. Hotel has a bar, restaurant the Dylan’s Candy on the main level. The hotel is designed to encourage work and socialization in the common areas. Bar is good. Typical New York prices. There is an outside area with two cool tents with seating, games, etc. Made for a great space to relax with friends. Jax in the bar on Friday evenings. There is a rooftop bar but it was closed for renovations. The rooms are small so be prepared. Limited storage space and small desk with a stool. Wi-fi was fast. Bed was surprisingly comfy. Heat and air controls worked well. Hotel was close to SoHo dining and shoppings. Close to MTA. Right at entrance to Holland Tunnel.

Just the place to be : nice rooms, comfortable, beautiful view. Close to Soho and Chelsea shopping area. Lots of activities : yoga, crafts, etc. Perfect rooftop with a view on Hudson and New Jersey.. A way of life.

I stayed here a few nights with my wife earlier this month, and we enjoyed our stay. The staff was always welcoming and smiling, the room was comfortable (although "euro-sized") and the location was very convenient for us to walk just about everywhere. There are lots of amenities on the lobby level - a "bodega" for snacks, drinks, coffee, etc., an afternoon/evening lounge, a restaurant and plenty of lobby seating for relaxing or working. The rooftop lounge was closed for a makeover, so can't report on that...Our room was small, with our king bed taking up a vast majority of the space while the bathroom was divided into the sink area out in the main entryway and the toilet & shower enclosed in frosted glass. The bed was only accessible from one side, since the far side was against the window...fun for me since I had to climb over my wife to get in/out of bed! I have to say we really liked the shower quality though, and the bed was quite comfortable for sleeping.

We chose to stay here as we wanted to explore soho more as we hadn't done this on previous visits. The location was very good close to subway but also lots of places to walk to around. The shop inside was useful to get water and snack shots after a day of exploring. The room was clean and as stated it was very small. We had read reviews so knew what to expect. The room was well designed and we stayed 4 nights. I think that was long enough because the lack of storage became a bit tedious. This hotel would be great for business travellers and couples on short breaks.
user_name:
Livi2014
Chalfont St Peter, United Kingdom

review_body: This was a nice surprise and the TA reviews are accurate - the location is very close to Soho proper, with only a couple of odd crosswalks (entrance to Holland Tunnel,..literally!) to navigate. Lots of public lounge space - and a bit of a club vibe at night, but not nearly as disco or loud as the Ace Hotel lobby. The room itself is extremely cozy but efficient. I actually enjoyed the queen bed built into the end of the room against the window, and the bed linens were very nice. The room's width was the length of the bed frame, which made it kind of a fun space, but perhaps less comfortable if traveling as a pair - crawling over your partner to get out of bed. It was also nice that the windows could open, as an option to noisy A/C. Plenty of electrical outlets, and a nice bonus of electric window shades.The less pragmatic parts of the room: the shower was (literally) open to the toilet area. No curtain or barrier. The water pressure is good, but that meant that there was a lot of water outside of the shower ledge on the floor when I got out. Weird. Storage is definitely limited, but it worked fine for me. In terms of the rest of the hotel, the public spaces are great - pockets of quiet lounge areas if you need to work or make a call, outdoor courtyard which is rare, and the attached restaurant Harold's is decent with nice service. The little Dylan's candy bar and coffee service in the lobby is a nice touch - but that line is not surprisingly long in the morning with one person both ringing up and serving as barista.Some less good things: Elevators are slow - not sure why, but that was a consistent problem waiting for the elevators. Also, the rooftop wasn't open despite the beautiful weather. Maybe construction??I would stay here again.

So fun to walk into a hotel with energy and excitement. Even the locals come here to hang out with laptops. Rooms are small but clean and offer basic needs. Overall, had a great stay and I look forward to coming back!

Great Location Super friendly staffBeautiful roomsAce design Chilled vibe AMAZING WIFIYoga Classes Brilliant use of space You’re in the centre of the city but really peaceful Soooooo many amazing restaurants and Bars working distanceJust really really good trust me .Also Lindsey from the Lobby team is a GODDESS !

From the moment you enter Arlo Soho, a funky atmosphere surrounds you. Good music, a swinging lobby and lots of international travelers doing there business. Reception was very friendly and we were immediately offered two free cocktails since our room wasn't ready upon arrival. An excellent opportunity to explore the main lobby, the inner square, the reading rooms and off course the bar itself! Cocktails were great btw.We originally stayed in a bunk room, because they had city view. Tough the rooms are nice and the view is nice, this leads me to the main disadvantage of the hotel. The hotel is located in Soho, near two metro lines, but also directly next to the Holland tunnel. This tunnel is a real nuthouse and until very late in the evening (night) drivers there are sounding there horns to get into the tunnel. Unfortunately the rooms aren't isolated enough to keep the noise out.I must say however that upon our request, we got an upgrade to a room wich was located on the backside. This was much appreciated and an improvement for sure.All in all this has not influenced our positive feeling about this hotel, because the vibe is so loveable. Interior design, the atmosphere created ( like a cool visitor's wall), the food served, the rooms, etc... it all matches!Next time we visit NYC, we want to try Arlo Soho's sister hotel, Arlo Nomad

I have stayed here frequently when I come in to shoot photos/video for the MAN/WOMAN tradeshow at nearby Spring Studios in SoHo about 4 times a year, so I have to say that it served all my needs and was just super convenient to all my local NYC needs during my work trips. First off, it was walking distance to all things SoHo and train stops to get to anywhere in NYC. If you don't use the train, then you can grab a cab almost anywhere. But, the location was super convenient, and I'm a bit biased b/c it was walking distance to my work at Spring Studios ;)The rooms were always clean. They're not big by any means, but the compact Scandinavian charm is enough for me. I just came back from Tokyo and it's comparable to a Japanese sized single room. But everything was clean and tidy and I liked it alot. There is a deli/liquor store on the corner run by a Mr. Sonny from Korea and I totally got along with him, so I definitely became friends with the 24hr deli around the corner for those late NYC munchie nights. Anyhow I'm probably going back there in July, so I will be looking forward to it ;)

The Arlo SoHo “lobby specialists” just may shape the future of the hotel front desk experience. They are quick, efficient, helpful and most notably consistently PLEASANT when they speak to you! As a result, the whole place has a warm, friendly vibe!This place is a gem. Great location, quick and easy access to coffee, snacks, drinks, hip indoor/outdoor lounge with plentiful seating. They stored our luggage twice and were happy to do so.Rooms are small, but are equipped well. The glass bathroom door enclosure doesn’t allow for complete privacy if sharing a room, but I’d recommend this hotel without hesitation.Well done, Arlo SoHo!

I spent 3 nights at the Arlo SoHo with my 10 YO for a quick weekend getaway. Great quirky place walking distance from SoHo, the Village, TriBeCa and downtown. The rooms are on the small side but the common areas are extraordinarily fun. Our room had an alcove bed to die for. We got an upgrade bu I think a regular room with a view of the courtyard would have also worked. The courtyard cabanas are really fun to relax and have a nightcap.

Having set our heart on the Arlo Nomad Hotel in Midtown Manhattan for a weekend in New York, and having flown from France with my teenage daughter we were utterly disappointed when we realized that the external booking platform had not passed on our reservation onto the hotel. Our very tight schedule meant that our itinerary was organized around this prime location. Yet Reception Manager Kimberly was very professional and accommodating to sort out a happy alternative with their sister hotel, Arlo Soho, in circumstances that were none of their doing. Despite not being our first choice, Arlo SoHo soon became our home from home. Set in the heart of the gilded and trendy youth of New York’s playground the hotel transpired of eclectic and suave authenticity that may have come amidst should we have settled for a more touristic conventional venue. The resident Harold’s restaurant soon became a favorite with its array of relaxed and no-fuss yet delicate dining with a great flair for flavor and a friendly service. Dining prices are moderate to high but definitely worth the detour (chicken soup and sautéed squids in particular). The rooms are small yet cosy and comfortable with prime bedding. All the confort you need and a premium base camp. I do strongly recommend this hotel and wish to reiterate our thanks to Kimberly and the staff at Arlo for making us feel so welcomed. Merci et à bientôt!

Simply great! Stylish, contemporary, elegant and cool. Great location in SOHO, super food, nice lounge bar, great conferencing space, superfriendly staff. We were 20 ppl for a creative workshop and the location really helped to frame the discussions.Thanks Arlo!

We had a perfect NYC weekend. Stayed in the King Alcove room. The pictures do a good job showing the space. We love staying in a super cool hotel even if the room is on the smaller side. Shower was great & water pressure was 5 star. We were there to celebrate our daughter’s 24th birthday so we reserved one of the courtyard tents and surprised her! It was so much fun - several cousins and friends were with us. Had great cocktails and flatbreads. We visit NYC fairly frequently and will most definitely stay here again. Thanks Lindsey!

Arlo is a great hotel, and the highlights are many, such as, the great staff, the comfortable bed, the view, the lounge areas, and the location of course. I highly recommend it. It has a nice decor, with a candy shop, a cafe kiosk, a bar, a restaurant, and the common area is designed as as open space so it is fluid - walking around from the bar to the lounge to the outdoors. Dan at the front desk is very gracious and helpful.

I stayed here for 6 days at the beginnning of April with my 21 yr old daughter to celebrate our birthdays. Despite being a micro hotel our room exceeded our expectations, clean, light, airy and smelt lovely! Lindsay, front of house, was more than happy to help with any questions we had and went over and above to make sure our stay was memorable. The Arlo Soho is in the perfect location - close to amazing shops, 9/11 memorial/the Metro. I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough and am looking forward to coming back.

Small but well appointed, clean rooms - perfect for those stays when you need a great place to rest and clean-up. Very pleasant, professional, and accommodating staff - no stuffiness here! Fun, upbeat, and very cool spot.

It was my second stay and I can’t recommend this hotel enough!In a beautiful location in excellent proximity to everything needed. The hotel is lovely and although small the rooms are well designed and suit the needs for someone looking to drop their bags and explore the city. Special mention must go to the team at the front desk. They were extremely helpful with all my questions and had some amazing recommendations for restaurants and bars all over the city. Will definitely be visiting the Arlo soho again!
user_name:
Jake W
Sydney, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Wonderful open spaces. Efficient well kept rooms. This hotel is great and definitely worth a visit. Yhe balcony rooms are beautiful. Staff is friendly and complimentary activities are a great touch that you don’t find in most hotels.

Gorgeous design. laid back yet super efficient staff. Location was great, close to subway. The smell in the lobby is AMAZING!My new favourite hotel in NYC.Would definitely recommend itOne little thing that might bother you if you are travelling with someone is that the bathroom has a glass door that doesn't close completely. (not sure if all room are the same though)

Love the Arlo! The design was gorgeous and super trendy. The rooms are a bit small compared to some other places (it's a microhotel), but it was a totally reasonable size for our weekend stay. Who needs a giant hotel room? The bed was comfy and the design was fantastic. It's close enough to LES (but a little cheaper than hotels there) and easy to get to most places via the nearby subway stop. I'd recommend it to younger friends visiting NY, but maybe not ideal for an older couple. We visited back when they very first opened and had some issues with the hot water, but on our second visit, the hot water issue was totally fixed so I don't think that's anything to worry about now. It's my favorite hotel to stay at in NY!

I love this hotel. The room was very well designed, though the glass bathroom doors were a bit strange! Thank you so much to Amaris, the manager working when I checked in. She made sure that my stay was extra special and truly went above and beyond. I would go back because the hotel was great, but the service was exceptional!

The Arlo SoHo is near perfect. Loved the friendly, laid back but efficient people working there. Anthony in the bar is a star. The room was great and the location is second to none. My new favourite NYC hotel.

Arlo will meet all the expectations you might have from a boutique hotel in SoHo.The rooms are small but clean and have been well designed to have everything you need. We loved the fact that the TV was equipped with a Google Chromecast so we able to cast our favorite shows.The staff is nice and courteous. We arrived early at the hotel ~ 10 AM (Check-in is usually at 3 PM). We were able to store our bags until ~ 12 PM when we received a call from the staff when the room was ready.Although pricey, having a shop open 24/7 in the lobby is cool for late-night cravings.Only two things we wish were better: AC was noisy in the room and there was some kind of construction/maintenance on the floor above our room during the morning.

We would like to thank you for our wonderful stay at Arlo Soho. First, we were greeted by Abby, her first impression was expressive and continued throughout the entire visit. Her smile is inviting and her willness to cater to our needs made us feel at home in the big city. The atmosphere and decor of the entire hotel is captivating. The artistry throughout was a treat in itself. When traveling back to New York, the Arlo will always be our hotel of choice.

I've stayed at the Arlo during a work trip to NYC and the whole experience was really elegant. The lobby experience is all about helpful staff, considerate work spaces, chilled atmosphere and great coffee and snacks...While the rooms are small they are beautiful and comfortable. And feel a little like home.

I LOVE this hotel, from everything to the aesthetic, the 24 hour bodega, mini version of Dylan's candy bar down next to the lobby, the coworking space by day and hang area by night, the heated tents on the ground floor as well as the roof, the bar, the free activities like yoga or taco nights that are hosted, but most of all I love the staff here! They truly made my entire experience so easy breezy and they are incredibly friendly and knowledgable. No point looking at anywhere else to stay in Soho! Can't wait to stay with them again!

Stayed for one night with husband and two teenage sons. The rooms are small, but comfortable. My husband and I had a king bed room and the boys had a bunk bed room next door to us. I wish we had time to spend a couple more nights there. They had activities going on most nights. A courtyard with heated tents set up like living rooms where you could order drinks. The lobby had areas to set up your computer and also offered games and puzzles. There was a rooftop lounge I heard was great, but was not open the night we were there. I would be happy to go back!

This was my 3rd stay as a single traveller at the Arlo Soho. I have been visiting NYC regularly for 17 years and this is an outstanding hotel for single/couple guests.Located on Hudson Street, if you enjoy the fabulous Chelsea Market, High Line, Meatpacking fashion boutiques and bustling Soho area - this is the hotel for you. There are fantastic places to eat nearby, including some very impressive vegetarian cafes/restaurants.My Queen Rooms (city view) have always been spotless with a lovely, comfortable bed and efficient use of space. Even though there is so much to see and do in NYC, the Arlo lobby/bar area is a great place for a drink/snack/coffee so it's worth resting your city worn feet there or catching up with emails while soaking up the hip yet laid back vibe.I didn't have the chance to try out the Pilates or Yoga classes on offer there - next time!The Bodega coffee is great and the overnight oats are quite possibly the best in the world.All the staff are accommodating - without exception. Customer service is clearly a priority and everyone I have encountered during my trips has been genuinely friendly and knowledgeable. From Abbie/Abby at the front desk to the staff at the Bodega to the charming lobby host who went to hail me an airport cab in the pouring rain then carried my cases out for me, while I waited inside - everybody was warm, upbeat and very well-presented.I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. I am looking forward to my next stay and the only thing I can suggest as a next step for the Arlo Soho is a loyalty type scheme... maybe..?Thank you to everyone at the Arlo Soho.

Has some cool lobby features and the rooms are pretty neat, fairly small but if you're looking for a nice place in SoHo, this worked out well! The rooftop view is nice and the lobby was a fun place to hang out, it's near all the shopping and some restaurants in SoHo, just about a 10-15 minute walk.

Loved our 5 nights at Arlo Soho. Small rooms - but you know that when you book. Most of the staff were great (especially the two Daniels and Caroline). Lovely vibe in the many communal areas especially in the middle of a snow storm! Great location so close to many fantastic neighbourhoods, restaurants and sights. If going to NY for a while we stayed 5 nights here and 5 nights midtown which was a great combo.

Been going to NYC for many years and have stayed at both luxury-chains and newer boutique hotels. Luxury chains are generally way overpriced with too many things I don't need; boutique hotels are always noisy and cheaply/poorly built. Arlo Soho was amazing. Quiet, immaculate, great lighting, everything you need (including umbrella in every room) and nothing you don't need. Location was perfect because you are literally at the edge of SOHO, just outside the pedestrian noise. Walkability to all the subway stations is excellent and if you need something like a fresh banana in the morning, there's a bodega at the corner of Spring & Hudson. I went by myself so there was enough space in this 150 sq.ft. Queen Room w/city view for my things for a 2-night stay. If I were going with my husband for more than that I might book 2 adjoining rooms (they have those--bunk & king) because the prices are SO good it would still cost less than a luxury hotel. Staff was wonderful and accomodated me with late checkout. Also you can go down in your slippers in the morning to the lobby bodega and get your favorite cup of great coffee (regular, latte, espresso, or cappuccino) freshly made. Will definitely stay there again.

We stayed at the Arlo SoHo for 5 nights. The location is great - Canal Street is so well connected for the subway and within easy walking distance of SoHo and Greenwich Village and the restaurants there. The thing that makes this hotel really stand out is the cosy, stylish communal areas, which are brilliant. It was a shame that the rooftop bar was being refurbished, however if the prices at the downstairs bar are anything to go by, I'm not sure we would have spent much time in there. A daily happy hour wouldn't go amiss! In terms of rooms, my parents' room was quite small, but charming, and the room that my sister and I had was bigger (a disabled room we think), but less charming as a result. That said, the beds were comfy, the bed linen soft, and the showers powerful. My only minor gripes were the sink being in the bedroom rather than the bathroom, the lack of wardrobe, and the translucent bathroom door which did not block the powerful light! I would 100% recommend people to stay here.

We stayed at Arlo Soho five days. The Hotel is great and the service wonderful so nothing to complain there. The lobby and the bar area is really cozy to hang around in for both work and socalizing. There are tents in the back where you can sit and have a coffee or drink. The rooms are very clean and tidy but extremely small. The challenge is that there is no wardrobe in the room. The only place for storing stuff is a small drawer under the bed that hardly fit my sweaters. This is probably not a problem if you are one person and only there for a short stay. We were two persons with clothing for six days which were a real challenge.

We stayed at the Arlo Hotel for 6 nights with our three teenagers (we took three rooms). Great location for downtown sightseeing - very walkable. For uptown attractions, the Canal Street subway is just round the corner. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay – the staff were kind, courteous and helpful. We loved our small but perfectly formed rooms with all the considered details and enjoyed the relaxed yet buzzing vibe at the hotel.

Verry smart rooms with a comfortable bed and a Nice showerRooms are verry small and you miss room for your clothes, but otherwies you have what you need. Plenty of room downstairs to relax and be together. Nice area. Breakfast Is NOT cheap.Will recommend it to Young people.

I travel to NY frequently for business and I always stay at the Arlo. Yes, it is very conveniently located across the street from the office. But it also a great hotel. I love everything about it, especially the people. Lindsey Gershberg is THE BOMB, she is the ultimate welcome upon arrival. And Jesse and the gang at Harold's.are super rad as well.

I stay at the Arlo regularly. While the rooms are small, the beds are super comfortable. But, mainly it's the staff and the fact that there's so much going on throughout the property that it's not necessary to sequester yourself in your room. I like working in the library area, the food from Harold's Meat and Three is absolutely exceptional and they have game and movie night for the more social among us.The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay a good one. One time I accidentally left two pair of expensive shoes in my room and the head of housekeeping kept them safe and sound for me and they were placed, like welcoming friends, in my room the next time I visited. I'm sure they would have mailed them to me, but I was returning the next week.They'll arrange car service to pick you up and take you to the airport, just ask.

New type of hotel, young and friendly, rooms are newly renovated, great design, comfortable. As in NYC, very small Barely can open my luggage but overall great hotel and friendly staff. Location is close to financial and TriBeCa so quite far from theatre district if you need. Just be aware. I would definitively recommend.

Wonderful service from the front door to the rooftop bar. Check in and out were a breeze and the bellman snagged a cab for me at taxi shift changeover. Watching the traffic merge into the Holland tunnel was endlessly fascinating. The size was fine but needed a few more hooks, drawers at the nightstands would help, and another under the bed would make clothing management easier. Looking forward to the return.

Great three night stay here. It's a very clever room that you are getting, not a big room but one that is thoughtful in its design and layout. The guest areas on the ground floor are relaxed, informal and inviting. Lots of good areas to sit and relax, enjoy a drink etc. The rooftop bar is also a great spot to have a drink. Staff are friendly and helpful. The location is great although it can be tricky navigating the accesses to the Holland Tunnel. There are so many good places to eat or shop nearby, it was for us a great pick.

Maybe it's me but I expected a decent size room for the price we paid. Service was great from the reception staff ( altho getting extra towels was a chore at times)The bathroom, if I can call it that was a shower cubicle and a toilet cubicle. Fine if you are not sharing but not for couples!!!! Plus point - great location but would think twice about staying there again.

Strategically located as regards visiting NYC by foot or hopping on and off subways, Arlo Soho is a rewarding place for finding comfortable rooms, dynamic and efficient management and clean spaces. Bravo!

Every detail of the room was very carefully considered. Everything I needed was exactly where it should be. The space was small, ideal for 1, but a couple could fit however it was so tastefully done I will come back again. Also, there is a candy cafe in the lobby :)

The Arlo Soho is my absolute favorite hotel in NYC! I used to live in NYC for years, then when I moved to LA and had to go back to NYC frequently for work, I was an Arlo loyalist. The staff takes SUCH good care of me, and knew me by name every time I returned. The bar downstairs has a great selection of wine by the glass and also the restaurant serves great breakfast in the mornings. I love the compact-ness of the rooms - it's really all one person needs when traveling. If you are a couple - depending on the room size or style it could be a little tight. Overall - the staff, decor, and overall vibes are amazing and I highly recommend the Arlo Soho!

Arlo SoHo is a beautiful modern hotel with amenities you never even dreamed you were missing. Every detail was considered in creating an experience that you'll remember as a highlight of your stay in New York. From rooms so comfortable and lovely you won't want to go out, to spaces spread around the public areas to suite your ever need, Arlo delivers on everything a hotel stay ought to be.

The front desk people were terrific and efficient and courteous. The rooms were really really tiny tiny but quite nice and european-like. They had a little area to buy fresh fruits and salads, sandwiches and coffee. The prices were high but the quality was good. Also, there was a restaurant attached so everything was right there.

Stayed at Arlo Soho for 6 nights as part of a birthday treat. I can find very little not to recommend. The lobby team are friendly, efficient and professional and happy to deal with any question. The shared spaces on the ground floor are exceptional with space for guests to work, chat or relax.We stayed in room 730 which is a bunk room. We had a view down to Canal Street and could see the One World Trade Centre. As expected the room was not huge but did the job as we only used it for sleeping and showering. With the window closed the traffic noise did not bother us.We had breakfast twice at the hotel. Again service was excellent and a good varied selection available along with filter coffee refills.We visited the roof top bar a couple of times. There is not a huge selection but enough to keep us satisfied. The bar tender was helpful and pleasant. The views from the rooftop are great during the day or evening.Subway connections available a short walk away on Canal Street.Overall a fantastic place to stay in a pleasant area of NYC with easy connections for public transport. Thank you Arlo Soho team.

Arlo Soho is a friendly hotel for a tourist or business traveler. The rooms are small, clean and mine was quiet. The common area is a pleasant work environment with a steady activity level that's never loud or disruptive. Lots of places to plug in with nightly hotel arranged events planned.

Cool and modern location, very friendly and helpful staff. We spend six nights in this wonderful location. Hotel is located in Soho, a few minutes walk to Chinatown. Rooftop bar must be brilliant in the summer. Rooms are small but very very smart and well designed. So the size was absolut enough.I was at the Arlo Nomad too. Both Hotels are worth to visit.

This was our second trip staying at this super fun hotel. It’s hip without being too trendy the staff is warm and welcoming and the rooms, although small, very comfortable. Already planning our next stay!

I am completely in love with Arlo SoHo! I’m not going to lie, at first I was a bit nervous with the thought of a “micro room” as this is a new concept to me. BUT, I absolutely loved the space. It was perfectly cozy for my husband and I, and we had enough space to do everything we would do in any other hotel room. The service is great, everyone in the hotel is super sweet and helpful. Not to mention their toiletries smell amazing, I love their lemon grass products. The staff at the bar is also super sweet and fun. I also love the mini candy bar they have in the lobby! What a great bang for your buck! Also they have parking for much cheaper than most of the other hotels around, and if you go on the weekend you can find free street parking on canal st. Very convenient. Thank you Arlo staff, you guys are awesome! We’ll definitely be staying here again next time we go to SoHo!

Staying in Arlo Soho was a great experience for me. The atmosphere of the Arlo is the thing from the minute one when you enter the hotel. The staff is really helpful and very practical. I think I had fastest check-in / check-out experience of my life. By the way, the design of the lobby, bar and seating areas are beautiful. Rooms are tiny but good for few nights stay in NYC especially if you are alone. I would definitely stay here again for my next visit.

The Arlo is right around the corner from our NYC office so from a convenience perspective, you can't get any better. The hotel itself is lovely and always smells so good! Meat + 3 is a delicious restaurant, the coffee in the bodega is tasty and the rooms, while compact, contain everything one needs. The Arlo is my first choice when visiting New York.

We stayed at the hotel for one night. It’s very modern and they have a lot of nice amenities (lobby bar, rooftop bar, movie night, Dylan’s Candy Bar, etc). The room was small as expected but they were very smart in how they designed it so you didn’t feel like you needed more space. The bathroom could have been a little more private but other than that I thought it was a great hotel! The staff was really friendly!! We would definitely stay here again. In fact we’re already planning our next stay!

Nice room, cool staff, great location. See you in my next trip to NY! They couldn't find a package I received before I checked-in, but they finally did (and they were willing to reimburse it, if not). Thank you guys!

The Arlo SOHO is great. The environment is super cool and the staff friendly and very helpful. Lindsey was great host and took very good care of us both with reservations and transportation during our whole stay. I Will definitely return. Loved it.

Friendly and welcoming staff, specially Isabella, Mandy, Shag ,Muisa and Dan.Nice and clean room with a very good shower. Cool place to stay. Good location near everything that you need.Definitely I would stay again.

Stayed at hotel with my son for quick visit to NYC. Great customer service, Isabella at front desk was helpful and friendly. Rooms are small but we were upgraded to a room with a balcony with amazing views. Would definitely stay here again!

Perfect location. Beautiful and perfect place to work. Personal is 5 stars, rooms are a little small but very clean and comfortable with beds are A+.Have a wonderful restaurant inside.I truly recommend Arlo Soho for business

LOVED this hotel! The minute we walked in, we were greeted with very friendly faces. To say the staff was helpful doesn't give it justice. Not only were they there to guide us through the check-in process but they gave us great restaurant recommendations in the area! They also have car service which made getting to the airpot easy and fast!The hotel itself is stunning and very millennial friendly! There are plenty of co-working spaces if you need to do some work. They also have plenty of plugs to charge your laptops/phones/devices. We also ate at the hotel and the restaurant option was great! Drinks are also a good option for the evening. Did I mention they have a Dylan's Candy Bar wall in the lobby?I would stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Nice room, nice ambient, great pillows and very nice staff. The only think i am not a fan is the shower curtain. I was very well treated by two of the girls in the front desk, i would recommend it if you like Soho.

A wonderful little gem: cool and fun. Rooms small but efficient and great bedding and towels. Delicious restaurant and friendly bar. Lobby upbeat and lots of activities. Staff helpful and cheerful. Highly recommend.

This is the 4th time I’ve stayed at the Arlo and will continue to be my go to whenever I come to NY. It’s a very new affordable hip hotel with the most fantastic customer service. I’d like to give the utmost recognition to both Amber at the bar and Lindsey at the front desk. They always make me feel so welcomed and are extremely accommodating to ensure I have the best experience possible. From remembering my drink and food orders at the bar, to managing of reservations, early/late checkouts, city recommendations, anything you name it! They are amazing so thank you both for being the main reason I will continue to come here. Besides the customer service, the hotel has great amenities such as the roof top bar with views to die for, a very relaxed lobby bar and lounge, tents in the courtyard you can dine in (which I believe is seasonal), a restaurant and 24/7 snack bar. The hotel is exceptionally clean and caters to every age group. The rooms are small but this is typical to NY and they have managed to design it in a way where it utilizes the space efficiently. There are also rooms with terraces that have showers outside which is awesome during the summer season! You won’t be disappointed if you stay here. Arlo is the only way to go! -Jenn

Having visited New York for our honeymoon 3 years ago we were desperate to return but stay out of the way of Times Square and the busyness that comes with that. My husband found Arlo Soho and we could not have been happier with our stay.Yes the rooms are small, but not unbearable, suitcases easily fit under the beds so everything was put away. The bed was super comfortable and the Blind Barber shampoo, conditioner and shower gel were amazing!The location of the hotel is excellent - we were within walking distance of all the places we wanted to go to - Greenwich and Soho being particularly close!We would not hesitate to stay here again, not just for the first smell when you walk through the door!

Beautiful details fill these surprising minimalist micro rooms for a very relaxing experince after a hectic day in the cityAnd a welcoming lobby complete with library, cozy movie projection area at night, barista attended cafe, and lounge areas where you actually would want to hang out

Rooms are tiny but very well organized, so you have everything.Some sides to keep in mind (can be problematic for some):- a room has almost no storage / shelves- waterbassin is more-or-less in the middle of the room- toilet is in the room behind a glass door :) , so it is a bit limiting that you can do there, if you are a romantic couple. :)Location is great. Subway is close. Holland tunnel is in front of the building (helpful if you are going to Newark). Hip shopping areas are near by.I was alone and very satisfied with the hotel. I would think twice if we will be a couple.

Lovely boutique hotel with minimalist feel. Very comfortable and wonderful staff! Room service is not available, however there is a bodega, rooftop bar, lobby bar with lounge setting, outdoor space and adjacent restaurant. I stayed for business and it was within walking distance to my corporate HQ. Will stay again!

We spent a night at Arlo Soho with my friend. Location was super convenient to hang out in Soho or west village, or hop in to one of the Comedy Cellar shows, as we did.The room was really small, so it would be awkward to share such a room with someone you're not really close to. The hotel has a great work area indoors and outdoor in the back patio. Very comfy seats, wifi, large and stylish spaces. That was my favorite in the hotel. The rooftop bar looked good too, the barmen was very friendly. Overall, recommended.

We stayed in this hotel for one week in March and although on arrival we thought "ooh how cool!" and enjoyed the daily coffee run down to the lobby, we would not stay again. The room size didn't bother us too much.. but I didn't really expect the bathroom to be literally in the room.. we actually visited bathrooms elsewhere in the hotel when we needed to go.. No matter how close you are to someone you want privacy in that aspect. The worst thing was that every day we wanted to give the bar a try and sit downstairs to enjoy a nightcap. By no means would I have ever enjoyed sitting with a bunch of people on WebEx calls with Apple MacBooks in front of them.. and I am talking like 40 people all with a laptop taking up all the room and I am pretty sure with no drinks or food from the bar. Also the bar shut at 11pm.. maybe I am just too British but I'm not gonna want a Bailey's at 10pm.and why would I go up to the rooftop bar when it would literally just be my boyfriend, me and a bartender.The first time I saw an AW18 preview at the top of the stairs I thought it was cool but by the third day of pretentious marketing and PR bods loitering at the top of the stairs I quite frankly never wanted to see a shift dress or fur collared coat again.I can't deny the room had everything we needed, just on a tiny scale. Check in was fast and check out even faster. Rooms should have been cleaned before 5pm...but again maybe I expect too much?The hotel was clean and staff were pleasant for the most part. The design is cool and hip but not attractive for someone after a nice holiday. When you're paying what we paid you should be relaxed and feel able to enjoy aspects of the hotel and not feel out of place when anywhere but your room. We won't stay again and we won't recommend! But your coffee is great.

Fastest check in of my life! Super friendly, helpful, and welcoming front desk. Made me feel welcome and free to explore the hotel. I stayed here for the better part of a week. Room was maintained well, great bathroom, comfy bed. Housekeeping staff friendly and not intrusive. Great coffee shop right in the lobby with artisan coffee. I never tried the bar but I peeped in and it had a great vibe. Luxury hotel at a moderate price. I will be stay here again guaranteed.

Without any doubt the Arlo Soho hotel is the best option if you are going to Soho, with the best quality/price ratio. The team is simply excellent. Highly qualified and very professional. They are very charm, and effective. The rooms are very small, but very clean, very quiet and the beds are so comfortable. The breakfast is exquisite, with many options, and the waiters are so nice and attentive. From the first step in Arlo Soho all the staff make you feel like at home. I recommend it to you whether if you are going for work or pleasure. I am already looking forward to returning. For more recommendations, you can follow me on Instagram: fadfix

Several things you should know:1. The rooms are VERY small, yet entirely functional. Fine if you’ll only be sleeping in it. That said, prices are GOOD.2. It’s designed, run by and populated with a young, hip crowd. A bit too millennial for me, may be perfect for you.3. It’s not really in SOHO, but say 1/4 mile away, off of Canal St.4. Very hard to get a taxi and even Uber drove right by. I ended up using the nearby subways (1 and ABC).

I stayed for two nights in this hotel in early March 2018. I had already stayed in the Arlo NoMad last year and I found it to be an awesome hotel for solo travelers.I think of this hotel kind of like a cruise ship. The rooms are suficiently comfortable to stay in, sleep in and certainly watch good TV, but the fun is outside of the room with a very cozy environment, two bars, a large restaurant, an awesome rooftop bar, lounge areas, TV watching areas, working areas, lots of places to plug in, wifi all around and a large modern 24/7 mini mart a la bodega style.The design is modern but not intrusive. Lots of wood, lots of art, good taste, no tackiness. The beds are delicious in comfort, large modern flatscreen TVs with a lot of programming. Great showers, and all the necessary amenities. Maybe no coffee maker in room, but you can just take an elevator down for awesome fresh coffee and snacks. I really enjoyed staying here and its norther in NoMad. When the rates allow I will certainly come back.There are rooms of different sizes, but certainly rooms are cozy and the glass in the bathrooms make it not as private as other places, maybe I wouldn't share a room with a daughter or so, but surely with a girlfriend or a wife.The location may seem that you are far from SoHo, maybe you are in North Tribeca, but it takes 5 minutes to get to Canal St Subway Station for line 1, and maybe three more minutes for the R station. I walked to World Trade Center and it was maybe 20 minutes.You are very close to the entrance to the Holland tunnel, but in no way does it intrude to your rooms or experience as the street is out of the way of the through streets to Holland Tunnel.

It was our first time to stay at the Arlo Soho. I booked our accommodations using a third party website and prior to checking in, I heard good stories about the place. It wasn't until the start of our one (1) night stay on 9 March when we were in for a treat.We were immediately welcomed with open arms by the young and vibrant staff of the hotel. My family was immediately checked in and everything we needed to make our stay more comfortable was attended to with exceptional care. Having said I would like to especially commend Abby, Alyssa, and Isabella for a job well done.Keep up the good work!

Although rooms are on the smaller side, rooms were thoughtfully laid out with great facilities. Arlo has a young, trendy vibe which is m situated in the heart of soho. Its also is walking distance to other popular attractions. Will certainly come back!

I stayed with my husband in a queen courtyard room for three nights and we loved it. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the room was very comfortable. It was nice to have a little mini fridge and a view of the cool courtyard. Harrold's Meat and Three was a good little restaurant and the coffee available in the lobby was convenient and high quality. Our suitcases fit right under the night stands, totally out of the way. The shower had great water pressure. Excellent value and great location.
user_name:
Allison S
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: My wife and I stayed for one night and we had a great time. Very clean, friendly staff. My only caution is that the bathroom doesn't offer much privacy, so if you're traveling with someone on business, be comfortable with your travel partner. Otherwise, this is a perfect hotel.

I stayed at Arlo Soho for one night, and while I appreciated the modern style, the size of the room was a bit small for my liking. It works well enough for one person, but I can't imagine 2+ people being comfortable in such a small space. The lobby, bar, and common areas were all great. The staff was friendly and helpful. I'd recommend this hotel to people who are traveling solo and/or visiting for a short time.

I booked this hotel based on location.Finding a modern hotel in Soho with a decent price and walking distance to the West Village isn't easy. I knew the rooms were small based on the reviews. It is a good thing I was alone because I don't see how 2 people would be comfortable. They would need to climb over each other to get into the bed since it is against the window. With that being said, the bed was extremely comfortable and cozy. One night I was hanging out in the cool tents outside with my 25 year old nieces. It was a weeknight and only one other tent was occupied. After 20 minutes a waiter finally came over and told us if we didn't order a drink we would have to leave the tent. I was actually thinking about ordering a drink then decided not to based on his attitude. After my flight home was canceled for an impending snowstorm, I asked the front desk if I could extend my stay. I was brushed off by the employee who told me they were sold out. She asked for my phone number after a second employee overheard and suggested they could call me if they had any cancellations. They never called and I ended up checking out and finding a hotel in Chelsea. At the new hotel I was greeted immediately. Everyone was friendly. My new room was 3 times the size of Arlo and had a proper desk, Nespresso maker and a real bathroom. The hotel also had a complimentary happy hour with wine and a gym. Although not in Soho, I really liked the new property so much better than Arlo.

So the Arlo SoHO is (seems) the coolest place in town if you are the Millennial type and...erm...travel with a computer and a toothbrush!However if you don’t maybe you will struggle a bit. To be frank is great fun: the lobby is full of young people with computer that drink coffee every-time of the day and night, the bedroom is...erm...cosy to say the least (tiny is probably the right description) and really can accomodate only people with a toothbrush and you need to be in a rather decent physical form to go to bed (going trough the one the sleep on the outside), the bathroom is in...the bedroom!!!!As I said great fun if you are a Millennial otherwise people a bit older will describe it as...erm...uncomfortable!

I have stayed at the Arlo Nomad before and so my I knew I was in for a treat when I booked Arlo Soho. Great hotel with extraordinarily cozy rooms. The people who work at the hotel are extremely kind and nice to talk to.

We LOVED our stay at Arlo SoHo. After a full 24 hours of flight diversions and 12 hour traffic jams, we arrived at Arlo SoHo at 4am and were greeted by friendly. helpful desk attendants that made check in a breeze, took care of our (unplanned) rental car, and had us up in our room and asleep in minutes. It is such a cool hotel, and the bodega is a lifesaver when trying to get something quick and healthy. There are several fantastic restaurants in the area and on site. The train is just a short block away, or you can walk to the village, Tribeca, downtown, etc. in minutes. We don't normally stay at the same place when we return to a city, but I think we will definitely stay here again!

Fab location; Great rooms; Great restaurant. Rooms are NY standard small but they pack a lot in. Great shower, lovely amenities, very comfortable bed - what more could you want :) Great communal areas downstairs perfect for meetings, great restaurant – the chicken club is amazing. Will def return

I planned a fun weekend for my wife in New York City. I booked dinner at a nice restaurant, broadway show tickets and a stay overnight. If your thinking about not staying overnight, it can be done but one thing to keep in mind. Getting into NYC might be an issue. Why take a chance, I'd rather stay in a nice hotel and relax so we don't have any bumps in our plans. My hotel searching lead me to the Arlo hotel chain. Now SOHO is out of the way to see a Broadway show but guess what? The E train is close by, all of NYC is all just a train stop away. I saw the Arlo website, the hotel chain looks fun! The fun starts with a Dylan's Candy Bar on premise as well as a rooftop bar, a fun bar downstairs, a cool area for sitting called "The Library" and totally fab restaurant. If I'm planning a weekend of fun, I want my hotel to keep up with me.Checking in was a breeze. Walk up to the large monitors, type you name and out pop out your room keys. (My keys didn't work the first time I went to my room) Quick and easy.Once upstairs, we walk to our room. Here's where you really need to check their website and see exactly what your choosing for your room. They offer a room with bunk beds? Yeah.. Not fun. We chose a nice Queen size bed with a courtyard view. Some of the higher priced rooms have terraces. I'm thinking back to when I had a young family with kids or even teenagers. Unless your getting multiple rooms, this is not your typical family hotel.Our room? Had uber chic conveniences, Blind Barber Shower products?? I've been going to Blind Barber for years, love them! My issue with the room, its fashioned after a cruise ship cabin. If I had to stay here a few days, I might be cranky. There are no drawers to put socks and underwear. The bed is pushed very close to the window (Which is my side of the bed) If I have to go to the bathroom? I'm rolling over my wife which is kinda funky. Overall, it wasn't too bad. The hotel chain is trying to keep the fun and chic theme throughout your stay. They want you in the room less and around the hotel mingling. And man do I love to mingle! The roof deck bar, we went but it was too cold. If you want to explore NYC, SOHO is a great area with lots to do. This is my first Arlo hotel and from what I've experienced, I can't wait to try their other hotels.
user_name:
BillySalts
New York City, New York

review_body: I had no idea what to expect before arriving, booked off a great rate, some decent photos, and proximity to meetings. What I got was my new favorite place to stay in the city. I love the concept, amazing common areas with a small, design forward room. Who needs room for a party anyway, I was there for work, even took a couple meetings downstairs at the hotel. The entire experience was a pleasant surprise and I haven't been able to stop pitching it people back in LA.

I loved so many things about Arlo SoHo. I was not expecting the warm welcome that we received, it threw me off-guard. In a city where being "polite" isn't always in people's wheelhouses, this was a breath of fresh air. Each time we came in and out of the lobby, we were welcomed and asked if there was anything they could do to help us, which goes a long way. The design of the hotel is off the charts - each space is curated and thoughtfully arranged. I was also pleasantly surprised that we were upgraded to a corner room with a large accessible bathroom - very nice touch. There was some misunderstanding with my reservation (I thought I had booked a package that included welcome cocktails but never received them) however the front desk staff was quick to provide them for me anyways, which shows they have been well trained in customer service. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be in the middle of the action, and who desires to be treated like a true guest.

I received a warm welcome when I checked in. Three days later when I checked out, one of the super-helpful staff even hailed a cab for me as I was a bit loaded down with birthday gifts I'd received the evening before. My exquisitely designed 'micro-room' was a pleasing, comfortable place to relax, sleep and shower while the bar and lounge areas offer more spacious, just as beautifully designed spaces in which to work, socialize, etc. Looking forward to staying at Arlo Soho soon again!

Excellent location, a block away from the Canal St 1/2 subway lines, and a few blocks further to the A/C/E, N/Q/R, and 4/6 lines. Walking distance to the West Village and Hudson River. Friendly and helpful concierge, speedy check-in process. Clean, quiet rooms, small/compact by North American standards with a large bed, but limited sitting space. Sort of like a studio design, with a fold-out desk, and the bathroom/shower/sink all in the main room, contained within a separate frosted glass enclosure. Powerful central air-conditioning / heater. Beautiful lobby with a convenience store, bar, and attached restaurant, as well as a separate rooftop bar with views of the Hudson River. Overall, it had everything that you could possibly need in a hotel for a very reasonable price by New York standards. I would definitely stay here again, and would highly recommend to any friends/family.

I was with my family there in February 2017 for a couple of days. The hotel rooms are very small, but well organized and very modern. Outstanding was the location as 2 metro stations are just nearby and you can walk in a couple of minutes to Little Italy as well as Chinatown. The breakfast and coffee shop at the hotel offered very good services, too. What I have to mention is the friendlyness and helpfulness of all of the hotel staff. Especially Lindsey helped us a lot finding interesting places and organizing transportation. We are looking forward coming back soon.

I stayed in Arlo SoHo for 4 nights and my stay was really pleasant. The hotel is very clean with good cosmetics, very comfy beds, small space (but manageable) and very good service.You can enjoy your evenings in common area, good music, good coffee.

We were in town for a wedding and sight seeing, and the staff was always very friendly and knowledgeable of the neighborhood and city in general. An efficient, comfortable room with a boutique feel was exactly what we were looking for while the hotel has great lounge areas and a rooftop bar. The entire staff was helpful and welcoming - and a HUGE thanks to Moisés and Isabella for making our stay an awesome trip!

We came for a short visit. The design and atmosphere are amazing, cool spaces like the bar, the tents and the restaurant. Cozy and Comfortable bedroom. Great drinks at the bar and delicious breakfast at the restaurant. Special thanks to Moises and Isabella for your excellent service during our stay ! Definitely a place to come back

I have found it by chance in Expedia and I am so glad I did. The hotel feels more like a small scandinavian type boutique hotel. Its 3 mins walk to the subway station(s) - and a short walk from Soho. The room - though on a smaller side - is amazingly well designed and organized so it feels much more spatious than it is. It is squeeky clean and has the best mattress I have ever slept on - did not want to grt outta bed in the morning! Rain showerhead in the shower didnt hurt either :)Front desk is very helpful, friendly and professional. They have a wonderful bar and lounge downstairs and in the roof terrace and host of events there. And last but not least - the price was almost half of the rest of the hotels in the area!I will definitely stay again and highly recommend to anyone visiting New York city.

This is a very hard hotel to review because in essence it is a hotel that I would very much want to like more than I do. To start off with the good: service at reception is great, all staff is very kind, hotel is modern, clean, and up-to-date, and the interior is a nice mix of sort of minimalist Scandinavian design but also welcoming and not too cold or sterile. On the negative side unfortunately the atmosphere and social environment is a disaster for a hotel. I do not know if it was just while we were there, but for the duration of our stay (6 nights) all of the common areas of the hotel were filled with young and exceedingly "trendy" young professionals, all sitting with their Apple computers during all hours of the day and evening. It was quite inhospitable and made using any of the common areas impossible, even something so simple as sitting and waiting for an Uber to arrive. The loud music and "cool" factor going on every day in a rented space in the middle of the lounge are behind the reception was incredibly obnoxious and the atmosphere made anyone who wasn't working in marketing or a PR firm want to run away as quickly as possible. At one point some of the people sitting with their computers even started doing yoga, and while I have absolutely nothing against yoga, a hotel lobby is not the location for such an activity. On top of that the people on their computers were so spread out that they even took up the bar area and while they sat at the bar without any drinks they took up so much space it made it uncomfortable to have a drink there. Another negative was the servicing of the rooms which was atrociously slow. As tourists in the city we were gone from our rooms from around 10am until usually 5pm and only on one occasion was our room cleaned before we came back. That is simply not acceptable. Yes, the rooms are small, but that is exactly what is advertised, and while we were there for too long (a long weekend or other short trip with not much luggage is better) it was still comfortable enough and it was what we were prepared for.
user_name:
faintasticduo
Brazzaville, Republic of the Congo

review_body: Arlo Soho is mostly an upscale hostel in NY. It most suitable for young adults for a short stay, long weekends for example. Rooms are extremely small. No space for luggage and clothes. To go to the other side of the bed is a problem unless you decide to go over it! WC separated by a ¾ glass wall. Sometimes it looks that you are sleeping on the bathroom! Plenty of nice young people on the bar and public area. Bar and restaurant nicely decorated. Location not perfect. Long walk to the heart of Soho.
