My brother in law had stayed here a number of times and I can see why, staff are very professional and helpful so excellent service. Place was very clean and comfortable and also reasonable priced so I would highly recommend a stay here

Everything was great - Tribeca/Soho Neighborhood. I used to live in the neighborhood so obviously I am biased. The hotel is super clean, nice people, great place to throw up a laptop and work. Very cool spot that isn't too crowded.

My fiancé surprised me and booked this hotel. He got the one with the balcony and outdoor shower. Cute. Only sad part was that it was winter and we couldn't even go outside on the balcony. The wind was brutal. We didn't have much of a view either. All we could see was the huge Dog Pound billboard in front of our room. The room is small, duh, Manhattan. But it was clean and we made it work. The staff was very friendly! I was going to purchase gummy bears near the lobby but they were way passed their expiration date. Keep an eye out for that. The hotel also offers daily activities. I went to sign up but they told me that they weren't currently doing any. Bummer. We did enjoy the view from the rooftop though!

Cool, eclectic hotel. Good location. The staff was friendly. My room was on the front of the building and the street traffic was INCREDIBLY noisy PLUS the pipes knocked all night long. Every time someone flushed a toilet or ran water in a sink there was a loud knocking sound in my room. ALL. NIGHT. LONG. I reported it the next day and was assured by the staff they would look in to it, but for my return trip a few weeks later I opted to stay somewhere else...

I travel to NYC for work on a regular basis and always try to stay at the Arlo. The location is great and if you need to travel on the Metro, the 1-line is only 1-2 blocks away. They recently installed some self service monitors so you can easily check-in and check-out. The rooms are super functional, which maximize the space for each room. The beds are very cozy, and whether you have a city view or a courtyard view, you'll enjoy a good night's rest. They have a really cool rooftop bar/patio, and the restaurant downstairs (Harold's Meat + Three) serves up some good comfort food.

We stayed in the hotel for 5nights in early feb, the hotel is modern and cool. The staff are very friendly, it seems it is a place to be in soho.The concept of the hotel is great but the size of the rooms are slightly too small. For us staying with suitcases there wasn’t anywhere for storage. The aircon in the room was incredibly loud which made it difficult to get a full night sleep. Also the hotel didn’t provide any tea and coffee facilities but did have a coffee bar downstairs. However, this just meant I spent about $50 on coffee for the two of us in the mornings.

Arlo Soho has great vibes. The staff are super nice. Be aware, while the rooms are very trendy and well designed, they are very small, like you are in Tokyo. The bathroom amenities in the room are great, supplied by Blind Barber, a hip barber/lifestyle brand from NYC. If you are coming from Newark, you can get to the hotel in 25 minutes if no traffic. The hotel is also in walking distance to the western blocks of Soho.

Spent 3 nights at the Arlo Soho. Was warmly greeted when I arrived. Friendly young staff. I had a king size room with a city view. Well my view was nothing like the pictures on the hotel website. I was across the way from a very close office building. Had to leave the shades drawn otherwise I’d be viewing people at work. The room is TINY. It was clean and tv was huge. The sink is out in the open and the toilet and shower were in a glass enclosure so there was little privacy. You can hear EVERYTHING. The heating system is very noisy and cold air kept blowing out of one vent instead of heat, along with a loud clicking sound. The towels were thin and small. I was fooled into believing this was a high end boutique hotel. It was underwhelming.

I spent a night with my sister.The hotel is charming and super cool, we really love the atmosphere.The rooms are very small but well equipped. I can not give The fifth star just for the breakfast bill. It was not included but in The policy the rate was 22$ per person per night . When we asked The bill it was 70$ because the restaurant manager sayd the drink were not included ( we only ordered 1 coffee, 1 cappuccino, 1 orange juice) . The restaurant manager was not flexible at all saying that there was an error on our booking app and it was not the hotel fault. We had to pay the bill!!!! We were really upset about it. After that we went to the reception asking to talk with the hotel manager who was super kind and professional, he understood the problem and Made a discount on that bill. I just want to add that the rest of the team ( both hotel and restaurant) are super nice and professional, especially the waitress, we really loved him.

Great Hotel with nice shared spaces and comfortable rooms. The king size beds up against the windows with the big screen infront create a really cozy atmosphere. Clean, friend staff and fun vibe in the bar.

I travel quite frequently, and you get used to one hotel after another....But Arlo was honestly impressive. From the decor to the staffing, simply perfect. It will be my first option when I'm back in NYC. Nicely Done and Thanks!!.

The room was nice and clean! so quite small but well drawn. The Hotel place is near to Soho, in a good area for shopping, for showroom, not so distant from meatpacking where found many restaurant, bars and clubs..

They really do an amazing job which is why I reserved 2 nights this past weekend. I found it to be not the best match for me, I really like a high end feel. No complaints, but set your expectation. Due to the lower cost, it mainly attracts young people. Tons of free common space but crowded with everyone on technology pretty much isolating from any real social interacting. Good for them, not so much for me!

Visited New York recently and Arlo Soho was a lovely stay for the weekend. It's well-suited for travelers on work trips or used to city travel. The check in system is mostly automated, although staffers will be happy to help you in case of questions. The relaxing lounge area has wifi and serves drinks, which I took advantage of for a couple hours after check-out to get some work done. Overall the room was comfortable and well-equipped. Would stay here again for the location and convenience.

Very happy staying at this hotel. Room look small but has everything you need in it. Bed are very comfortable. we were bit disappointed that they didn't have twin bed but we had queen size bed which i had to share with my 14th year old son. But apart of that it was a very nice hotel. Not far from the 9/11 memorial, Greenwich village and much more.

This was a great hotel. Great value and overall great experience from the minute we checked in until we left. Front desk check-in was very efficient and friendly. The bartender at the rooftop bar was great and very personable. I believe his name was Joseph. Rooms were exactly as advertised, clean and reminded me of a European type room. Small but very efficient. Soaps in the shower were great and the bed was very comfortable. I will be using this hotel for all my excursions to NYC

It has EVERYTHING you need. There’s a rooftop bar, an outdoor sitting area downstairs and a delicious restaurant. Breakfast, lunch and dinner were great — no complaints. I look forward to staying here again as it’s super local to everything in Manhattan!!

Walked through the doors and staff was quick to greet and make you feel welcomed as a Jazz band played in the background. Check in was easy. The city king bed was huge and sleeping in was too easy for my wife and I in that small room. It's like we were one w the room. Quite, comfy, shades to block out light. It was close walking distance to everything in Soho. Loved our stay!

We loved staying at this "small" hotel in Soho! Everyone who works there are sweet, gentle and serviceminded people :-)The rooms are small but if you don't mind spending time in the nice looking lobby it is not a problem!

I had an amazing stay here. Excellent service, very clean, modern, and trendy. The small rooms are impeccably designed and the location is fantastic. Haven’t seen anything else like this in the city at these prices!

Good location for access to subway for uptown and downtown however a little bit out of the way, lovely staff, rooms are very little and not much bathroom privacy (half height glass wall). Reasonably priced.

We were fortunate to stay at this beautiful property just off Canal Street in February, 2018. We can't say enough good things about the staff, specifically Kate, the rest of the management staff and front desk team. The rooms are very smart and well designed, and the common areas lively and sweet smelling. This is an excellent option for anyone visiting downtown (easily walkable) or anywhere close to a subway stop. We've stayed in many Manhattan hotels and the Arlo comes highly recommended.

This is my second visit to the ARLO Soho; I visited in Sept 2017 as well. I love the vibe, the space and the feeling of the hotel. When I came in September; I was working and I loved the library, common spaces, and patios to work. The rooftop bar and patio in the summer is amazing. I came back with friends for the long wkd in February because I love the location and this hotel’s feel. The rooms are small and compact but clean and comfy. If you want privacy in the bathroom however (i.e. with a new relationship) this is not the hotel for you. The glass enclosed bathroom is not for privacy. The bed is super comfy though. This hotel I come for the amenities. The bar, restaurant, rooftop, working spaces and great daily activities. Plus it’s in Soho and easy to get to from Newark. The staff are friendly and I love the smell of the hotel. They sell their signature scent. If you want a hip, modern, cool hotel in NYC this is it!

Staff was friendly had helpful. The bed was comfortable. The whole hotel was very clean. I had a great view and a big terrace. The location is great. It’s not far from all the good shopping and public transportation. The tv was mounted on the wall and was adjustable, which is perfect when laying down. The only two bad points for me was there’s no room service and my shower was a walk-in, so the water would get on the floor outside the shower.

The Arlo Hotel has become my home in NYC. I have been staying here for one night almost every week for the last 6 months. The location is perfect, a quick 20 min ride through the Holland Tunnel from the Newark Airport, and just steps from Soho & Tribeca. The cozy well-appointed rooms are perfect for my dash in and out of town, and the constant buzz in the lobby is always interesting. I have held several meetings in the lobby and studios on the second floor. The outdoor courtyard is charming both in both warm weather and cold due to the adorable and creative warming tents set up in winter months. Rooftop yoga on Thursday morning is a fabulous culture collide, I have been able to meet and practice with people from all over the world. The food is great at both the lobby bar and Harold's restaurant, make sure you accept the free strawberry pie with your meal - Delish. They serve my favorite La Colombe Coffee alongside a pop-up Dillon's Candy Store. And if I have not said enough, the staff is amazing. Lindsay and her team truly take care of me on every visit. Welcome hugs are earned with multiple visits but well worth the miles.

What a find!! This hotel has a mid century modern meets hipster vibe; it’s the perfect combination. The main level has many unique and social areas to gather or work. The rooftop bar offers the same understated cool vibe with stunning views of both the pier and the water. Visually pleasing all around. The room accommodations were very comfortable with high end finishes. Now, the staff! They are the finishing touch. Everyone was incredibly friendly, professional, and helpful. Excellent experience.

Beyond accommodating and welcoming were the staff at Arlo, from the receptionists to the security, and my friend and I could not have expected not asked for a better stay. Isabella, Dan, and everyone else working, vielen vielen Dank. Thank you!!

I first stayed at Arlo SoHo in January 2017, and had a wonderful experience overall despite the hotel still being in its infancy. I have since returned in July 2017, and most recently last month - as the Arlo SoHo has become one of my go-to hotels whenever visiting NYC for work. It's beautifully designed (and is instagram worthy, and therefore is quietly becoming a landmark on its own), but it is the above-and-beyond mentality of the team that really sets the Arlo SoHo apart. I can't express how generous the team is with regard to their high level of genuine enthusiasm, and speed at accommodating requests, and offering guests perks and benefits to maximise their stay.The service before check-in is impeccable - everything was pre-arranged down to the last, precise detail. I arrived from a red-eye flight, and my check-in process (from lobby to room) was completed in under 5 minutes! The hotel is centrally located - a 2-minute walk to the subway station, and a leisurely walk to SoHo, Tribeca, and even Downtown. Amazing views throughout. Awesome toiletries, and plush bedding.I've already reviewed the room and the high level of service (which keeps getting better), but I really appreciate that everyone on the team remembered me by name and took note of my preferences and made arrangements accordingly - I felt like a VIP at a 6-star hotel - ultimately, staying at the Arlo SoHo rounds off any New York trip.

Aside from not having a separate room for the bathroom, the room was very quaint and comfortable. I got a great night's sleep. When I asked for a late check out, the front desk staff was happy to accomodate. Overall, a very pleasant stay at a very nice hotel.

This hotel is well located and trendy. Smells good and has a pretty cool terrace. The design is overall good. the staff is really friendly and nice. Wifi works well.However, it does miss the spot a bit considering the price. The room is small and, unlike other similar concepts (such as Citizen M), it is not super practically designed. The chair and table are not comfortable to work on. The "sidetable" is just the windowpane and in the winter, that is very cold.The finishes of the bathroom are also not top quality. Breakfast was included for me but they forgot to give me vouchers, so I almost ended up paying (quite a bit) for it. And it is a nice breakfast and all, but it is every day the same and though you are asked to order a juice, they forgot the juice for me 2 out of 3 days (like, I had no juice at all). The first time I asked, they told me it was coming, and it never came. The second I did not even ask. The common areas are very pretty and nice, but the music is too loud.So, it is nice, but it is expensive and the reviews make you expect something more.

We love NYC and try to visit 2 or 3 times a year ! Our main objective is to take some time off from normal life, work work work for my wife and chemotherapy for myself. Our plan in NY is then to walk the streets and eat in typical great restaurants. This time we also had a great hotel ambiance, very comforting, just like home ! The lobby and first floor is terrific, very zen ! Staff were also very nice going our of their way to make you feel comfy ! Architecture of the hotel is beautiful, alot of wood and earth colours ! The rooms are small but very practical and clean. Loved every minute of our weekend, we will be back at the Arlo Soho !

Just got back from a weekend trip to NYC with my sister. Someone recommended we stay at the Arlo Soho and we’re so happy we did. The hotel is in a great location and it wasn’t nearly as expensive as you would expect it to be for Soho. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel itself was adorable. Very trendy but with a super fun vibe. The room was VERY small but we didn’t mind. The bed was super comfortable and the space was well utilized. We will absolutely stay there again.

My husband and I always stay at The Arlo Soho whenever we are in NYC.Clean, great location and super friendly staff. Always such a pleasant stay and is our home away from home Ask for Lindsey at front desk she's the best!

A very clean, friendly and efficient hotel that is designed creatively with functionally at every turn and a great deal of warm toward its customers. The rooms further that approach with brilliant success. Overall, this feels like a European hostel, but with much more care, attention, warm and thoughtfulness.
user_name:
skyoung2018
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed for 6 nights, 1 adult and 2 teenagers. It was perfect! yes, the rooms are small but very well designed. comfort of bed, linnens, shower, amenities, all SUPERB! Breakfast was a good surprise. Their iogurt is just delicious. Staff super friendly, they really did their best to acommodate us.

The hotel and staff were excellent. Would recommend staying here. We requested a room with a terrace, hotel was unable to accomdate the reservations however gave us a dinner pass up to $75 plus two drinks on the house for our inconvenience. The room was pleasantly laid out. Small space but use of space-phenomenal!Will return...

Couldn't fault a thing with our holiday from the moment walked through the doors! Staff friendly and helpful, Hotel spotlessly clean and in a cracking location for both downtown and uptown Manhattan! Highly recommended!!!!

My daughter and I needed a place to stay over in NYC for a night. We had a wonderful stay. I grew up in downtown Manhattan so I was looking for a place downtown. This is a great location downtown. Very close to the 1 train. The hotel was clean and relaxing and also fun and hip. Our room had a terrace which was unexpected. We were able to get the room at a very affordable rate.

Rooms maybe compact but are very well designed and all you need for a short break in NYC. The rest of the hotel has that Danish flair to its design with very comfortable areas for both relaxing and working. Designed with IT in mind as you are never too far away from a plug or charging point with free wifi. There are alfresco areas including tents with heating to take away that winter chill and a roof terrance with great views of the city. The Arlo is well situated for exploring the city with the Financial area within walking distance, and the subway closeby for traveling further a field. The breakfast could be perceived as a bit expensive but has a comprehensive range of quality products and you are very well feed to easily skip lunch!. What really make you stay special are the staff from the team on the front desk, Matthew in the sweet (candy) coffee shop area and the team in the restaurant. If in New York I would strongly recommend this hotel if solo or a couple as you won't be disappointed.

I have stayed at the Arlo Soho on a number of occasions while on business. The hotel staff are great and always remember me on my return, nothing is ever to much to trouble. Great location and perfect base to get around Manhattan and Brooklyn.

Another fantastic stay at the Arlo. This place is really hip and full of energy. The staff are amazing. There is a great rooftop bar. Slightly chilly at this time of year but worth it for the great view.

Had a great trip to NY just this week. After getting swindled by some Uber driver we eventually reached Arlo. They offer a Suburban service for guests which we used on the way back and was much better and cheaper... obviously.The staff were really helpful and there didn't seem to be this culture of tipping at this part of town, having stayed in a couple of midtown hotels in the past where it was the done thing. The room was great for the most part but ours had a glass partition wall between the bed and the toilet, which isn't for everyone, we weren't a big fan, but hey you might not be that bothered. Fashion Week - if you like hearing peoples high opinion of themselves then fashion week is the best time to visit this hotel. They put a cool little 'thing' on for the models all in a room off from the lobby. Again, I get it but it just a bit much when you've walked like 20 miles around the city, you just want to relax at the bar.In principle this hotel ticks all the boxes for business guests, solo travellers and maybe even friends having their own room. If i'd had known about the room I would have seen if there was an upgrade or something like that, just to get that extra bit of privacy in the bathroom, you know.If I was to stay again I would probably see if there was a bigger room and pay the extra, but I don't think thats what this place is about.
user_name:
tomavery
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

review_body: The Arlo is a great new brand that offers a really chic and modern experience in central SOHO for affordable rates. They have a variety of room choices at different price points, several bars, great good/drinks and excellent service. Will definitely be back.
user_name:
tristans34
New York City, New York

review_body: Room compact but comfortable. Hotel staff very helpful and friendly. Good amenities, breakfast and rooftop lounge. Close to subway but easily walkable to local Soho and the rest of Manhattan. Breakfast well stocked buffet

Very good location! Amazing staff!Subway station close to hotel and lots of good restaurants around! The only negative point is small size of rooms but its enough for a couple.I definitely recommend it!

I repeatedly stay at The Arlo Soho for business. Each stay is quite enjoyable and the front desk staff is beyond helpful and courteous. Great location and a fun bar scene. I highly recommend The Arlo!
user_name:
s0l212
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed as a family group of four consisting of myself and dad in one room and my two brothers in another room... it was my dads 60th...On arrival the hotel staff were brilliant! Credit to Abi and Dan!! Thanks!! We had a great stay.. staff all great and fantastic 24hr barista coffee bar with pros on the machines The hotel is kept super clean and nothing was too much trouble.. well located to view the whole city.. would Defo recommend Thanks again to abi and dan for being so pleasurable top marks

Love the Arlo! I'm a frequent business guest. The vibe is hip and warm. Check in is easy and its in the best location.The rooms are small but this is for the type of guest that is out and about. However, I use it for writing retreats and don't mind the compactness of the rooms. I find them less distracting for work and the layout is very thoughtful.Highly recommend!

Arlo is super cool, convenient, comfortable and clean. It’s a great welcoming atmosphere with plenty of nooks and crannies to socialize with friends or just hang out. Rooms are spotless and the staff is super friendly and efficient. A terrific, affordable place to stay in Manhattan !

This was my first time staying in NYC and I was a little apprehensive about the size, location and quality of the hotels on offer. I have to say that Arlo Soho was a great find and I am very pleased that we chose to stay in the hotel. The hotel is very well laid out with great public spaces for relaxing after a day on the go. The rooms are quite compact for a couple sharing, but all the facilities inside are great. The bed was really comfy and has loads of room for two people. You can hear traffic faintly at night, but it’s New York for heaven’s sake. We are both light sleepers and always felt well rested. Great shower in the room, rainfall shower head and pressure/temperature were consistently high. Charging points, space for cases, safe, hairdryer, iron – all the things you need are there. Perhaps with the exception of a bottle opener!The service provided by all of the staff was excellent, everyone was very friendly and courteous. We received a complementary upgrade from a queen to a king room with a city view on our arrival, which was a welcome bonus. Typical example of quality of service was that when we asked for our room to be cleaned one afternoon, due to us feeling a little unwell. Cleaning staff were down promptly and left the place looking spotless.Location wise, we found it easy to get to Arlo Soho from JFK. There are plenty of subway lines within walking distance. You can be the West Village within 30 minutes by foot and we found quite a few good places to have breakfast in the mornings.Planning to visit NYC again in the near future and would definitely stay at Arlo Soho while in the city.

Great hotel. The ground floor, lobby and working areas feels very modern, much like the open areas at hotels like the Ace. Room was small, but that's to be expected in NYC. Bed was super comfy and the hotel was quiet at night.Location was great. To the south of Soho and just north of Tribeca. Perfect for quick exploring if you're tight for time. Still, not too far from Meatpacking or down to WTC or the river.The check-in process was swift, but a little too swift. No information on room or facilities or the fact I had been upgraded!Room was well done, lots squeezed in and good for a one-night stay. Would be a bit tight if there had been two of us or the stay was longer. Toiletries on the shower wall wasn't in keeping with the hi-end style of the place.People who are a bit prudish or staying with a friend may not like the glass shower walls. There is privacy but some people may want more.Breakfast is amazing.

Went to this hotel for my 60th birthday for 6 nights the rooms were not big but great area for a base.The staff Abbie and Dan were very pleasant from the day we arrived until the day we left.They were also very friendly and nothing was to much trouble for them.Would definitely stay again if I went back to New York.

From the moment you arrive at this place you realise it is different. From the pick n mix and great coffee in reception (big pluses) to the live jazz playing that night in the bar and the seemless and easy to use self-serve check in. Staff were friendly and youthful and unstuffy. The building was awesome and quirky and loved the different levels, roof bar, outside tents and the welcoming and relaxed feeling. The other guests were unpretentious and hip. The room was super. Looked better than the photos and was compact but so well thought out, with heaps of USB and power sockets in convenient places, top quality toiletries and the most comfy bed I’ve ever slept in. I legitimately said to my friend staying at Soho House I prefer the Arlo - it is like a younger and better version of a “house hotel”! They get the simple and important things right at a great price. Want to stay somewhere different to a traditional, uninspiring hotel? - Highly recommend the Arlo.

I'm a return customer of the Arlo. It's difficult to find a hotel in New York that checks all the boxes that this one does. It's comfortable, well designed, friendly, affordable, in a pretty good location and has 24 hour hipster "bodega" in the lobby. Its probably the easiest check in and check out I've ever had. The rooms are not huge - par for the course in New York - but you didn't come to New York to hang out in a hotel room. The interiors are nice and clean and don't have that tacky corporate feel that some hotels do. If you are there for an intimate getaway the lack of separate and private bathroom may be a challenge - the bathroom is essentially a sectioned of portion of the main room - but for business trips - this place is perfect. It's in a good location near the Spring St and Canal St Subway, a 10 minute walk to the center of soho - 25 minute walk to the West Village. I'll be back.

My girlfriend and I stayed for two nights for a mixture of work and pleasure. And our stay was pretty perfect. Staff was very friendly and accommodating throughout our stay. On site "bodega" and candy station came in very handy. I was not looking forward to yet another hotel breakfast buffet...but when I saw bagels, and lox and whitefish salad and delicious eggs and fresh fruit and juices and LaColombe coffee (which is my favorite!) I was thrilled! View from the rooftop bar amazing. But just to keep this review honest is to say make sure you remember it's New York, yes rooms are tiny, but if you are spending that much time in your room in New York you are doing it all wrong. Oh and I was upset there was no iron in the room...until I found the hand steamer!! Even better. Can't wait to go back!

I highly recommend staying at this hotel! The rooms are clean and modern. The bed was very comfortable and the view was nice. On top of everything, the staff are wonderfully gracious, which really made our stay even better. Would definitely stay here again!

I loved staying at the Arlo Soho. It was my first time staying there and I already can’t wait to get back! The staff is so sweet, friendly and helpful. They made sure I felt like I was at home and it was beyond that. The rooms are gorgeous and the balcony view is breathtaking. I wish I can stay there forever but for sure I’ll definitely be going back soon! -Maytee

Great experience with super nice rooms, common spaces and restaurant. Great accommodations and amenities. super trendy concept hotel to stay both for business & pleasure. Centric, communicated and very easy to reach.

Super value and spotless, reception personnel very very helpful especially Mandy who couldn't do enough as this was our first visit to New York, she gave us excellent tips on sightseeing and eateries.Fantastic location for visiting NewYork,food exceptional and Resturant staff went out there way to please.Iwould recommend this hotel for pleasure or business

This hotel is filled with beautiful, trendy people! Everything you need is right there (cocktails, food, coffee shop) making it very convenient. I stay here every time I am in town for Business. Rooms are small but the space is extremely efficient, clean, modern and very comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel!

Lots of pluses - all of the staff are super friendly and helpful - including standing outside in the pouring rain to get us a cab to the airport and then load in our bags. Rooms are clean and modern - we didn't have the smallest size as we were staying 12 nights and are older than the hotel's target demographic, but this wasn't an issue as we can cope with mainly living out of the suitcase and generally don't spend much time in the room. Having said that, it was warm and comfortable for sitting and reading when we did this (January was cold and sometimes wet!) and there are plenty of indoor and outdoor common areas if you wanted to be social, meet with friends also staying there, have more space to do work etc. Great location - short walk to Subway, a couple of blocks from the Hudson, walkable (if you like walking!) to south of Manhattan, World Trade Centre. Decent restaurant on site and lots of good places to eat within the locality. Good concept and would use this or their other hotel again - we had a great stay and would recommend.

Super tiny rooms... exactly the width of the length of a bed. Perfectly cozy for one person traveling on business, but I wouldn't want to try fitting two people in there. Clean rooms and friendly staff.

Very hip. Plenty of common space on several floors to sit back and handle work , or kick back and have a drink at the lobby bar or rooftop. Lobby has a nice 24hr convenience shop, and the staff is very pleasant and attentive to your needs . Rooms are small but def satisfied our needs. Comfortable bed, relatively large TV , and a nice shower worked just fine . Haven’t ate at the restaurant yet , but only heard good things about it.

Fabulous staff - very helpful. Very clean and modern rooms. Rooms are a tad small, but you should know that if you are booking this hotel- it is to be expected and you do not go to NYC to spend all of your time in your hotel room. This was the perfect stay.  Where can we buy the scent of the lobby? Or at least what is the name of the scent? It was very beautiful.

I had an absolutely wonderful experience at Arlo Soho. It's easy to get to and from LaGuardia, and it's in a nice spot that's not too busy/crazy/touristy. It's very close to Spring Street which is a bustling area of Soho that's fun to explore. The hotel itself is so charming and quaint, with nice touches that you won't see at a Hilton or other large chain hotel. It has a beautiful patio area and lots of seating in the lounge area. Check in and check out was a breeze with an automated computer. The room was small but actually larger than most NYC hotels I've stayed at before, and MUCH nicer/cleaner. I had a very small issue that I alerted customer service to after my stay, and they dealt with it immediately with great consideration and understanding. I would absolutely stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

We've stayed at the Arlo Soho a few times now and it's been great. Mandi was so friendly at check in. It was quick and easy. She was even able to upgrade us! We loved chatting with Abby and Dan at the desk while avoiding the cold when waiting for our Uber. We had breakfast at Harold's and the buffet is perfect. All of the staff were so attentive and happy! Thanks Arlo, we'll be back soon!

I stayed at both the ARLO and the James during my leisurely weekend in NYC. 1st time visiting this city from Southern California. By far, the staff and experience at the ARLO far surpassed what I experienced elsewhere. I was greeted and felt a very warm welcome by the staff. (Abby and Isabella are amazing!) They were able to help guide me on the most efficient transportation throughout the city and were overall very pleasant to deal with. The room was so nice and comfortable. Awesome set-up and great views. Lobby is pretty sweet too! and they have lemon/fruit infused water, which is always nice. Coffee was solid. The ARLO in SOHO is my go-to for all future visits to NYC.

From the moment I walked in I realised it was going to be a special experience. The staff (exceedingly well trained) were friendly and helpful without being cheesy or over-familiar. The hotel itself has an informal feeling with some fantastic design touches. The rooms are smaller than most but beautifully designed with fabulous well-thought-out features. Lights, hooks, storage space just where you need them and a fabulous shower. There were events going on each day/evening, including live jazz in Friday night. The restaurant, downstairs bar and roof-top bar were all nice spaces with helpful staff. I could go on, but the main point is that Arlo Soho was one of the best aspects of my stay in NewYork and I will certainly stay there again next time.

Wow , just had amazing 5 nights in arlo soho From the staff being really friendly and happy to the comfiest bed I’ve ever slept on made this trip a memorable one Would Defo come back again Thanks again for lovely holiday

Everything the others have said is true. The room was tiny, but better than rooms twice the size because of how well it is designed. The bed loft has a 40 inch tv at your feet that swivels so you can see it anywhere in the room. The loft is cozy and overlooks a courtyard. The bed and pillows were super comfy. They have two automated curtains - blackout and sheer. They pack a lot of technology in the small space. Bathroom and shower are behind frosted glass in a corner of the room. The shower was excellent. Might be a bit cramped for a long stay, but it was great for a weekend. Quiet location within walking distance to Soho restaurants and shopping and a $7 cab to the west village. Rooftop bar would be great in nice weather. Staff was great. Dylan's candy shop in the lobby is nice touch.

The room may have been small but the service, smiles, and atmosphere Mae up for it in SPADES. I would stay here over and over again! The front desk was immensely helpful with recommendations of where to eat and ordering us a car to the airport. The outdoor heated tents for after dinner drinks were super cool and comfy and the restaurant was delicious! Every single person was friendly and happy. A delight!

Lovely modern hotel. Snack shop is handy, staff are great and hotel is conveniently located just outside Holland Tunnel.Hudson River is 3 mins on foot and Soho/Tribeca is on the doorstep.Rooms are compact however very functional and minimalist (has all mod cons)

I recently traveled to New York on business and decided to try the Arlo, on the recommendation of co-workers. I had stayed at other hotels in the area and have been turned off by high prices and loud construction. Because it was January, this was an amazing deal. It was also a quiet stay.I like how cozy and convenient the room is, especially for just one person. It is very clean and comfortable, and no space is wasted. The lobby is hipster cool, and a place I would like to hang out. There's live music and turntables and yurts and lots of cool Bowie stuff in the gift shop. The only strange thing is a pervasive perfumey smell in the common areas. I tend to be allergic but I got used to it and it didn't overcome me, although one night the smell did wake me up.Service is a little detached and non-traditional, but I'm old so I guess I have to just get used to checking in on a screen.The restaurant, Harold's Meat and Three, is very good, albeit kind of pricey. I'm looking forward to going there again on a future trip.Loved the coffee bar at the front of the lobby, until I got "New Yorked" by it: $15 for a small hot chocolate and a cup of fresh fruit. You can get the same delicious La Columbe coffee just a couple blocks away at the actual La Columbe store on Spring Street, and cheaper fruit at Pret a Manger. This all sounds grouchy, but I liked the Arlo and would definitely stay there again.

Totally out there because the rooms are so small but I LOVED it! The room was designed with every detail in mind and had everything I needed and more, way better than a normal hotel room where you can't find the light switch and the outlet is behind the bed. I was staying alone - I wouldn't' stay with someone else in the room because the bathroom isn't separated too much. The hotel itself was gorgeous and perfect for the modern business traveler. Will stay there again!

Although this might be the smallest room I have ever stayed in, it was really perfect. Clean, modern,cool and a great view of the city. Comfortable bed...great shower. Basically, all would need or want in a NYC hotel. Besides that, the restaurant downstairs was great and the hotel has so many awesome spots to just hang out...work...or relax. I will definitely go back to Arlo Soho!

We stayed here on a recent trip to NYC.Our room was very small however I feel this was adequately disclosed on booking so can't mark them down for that.The room was well organised so the small space still worked for us.The bars and restaurant were beautiful and the staff were really helpful.

I was here for 12 days and loved every minute. The staff were incredibly accomodating and I was extremely well taken care of. It was a short walk to the Red 1/2 line, taking me all the way north and south of Manhattan and had many connections (it is a local train (all stops), but that made it even better, I knew no matter which stop I needed, it had it. The staff were great and the rooftop bar was brilliant (cold in winter, but that's what I went for). The addition of a 24hr barista was incredible and I found it to be a lifesaver on some of the colder days. If I could have stayed longer, I would have. I didn't stop in for some of the food, but the smell made me hungry every time i walked past. All in all, great location, great staff, FANTASTIC hotel. Highly recommend a stay here.

From the start to the end, everybody was very helpful and welcoming. Charming hotel, great service. Small rooms, but you get all the necessary amenities and even more. Very clean.The lobby and bar have a great vibe. Everything you need is right there in the lobby, food, snack, coffee...

Excellent stay here in early January on business. Made very welcome from the moment I arrived and great service was maintained for the three days I was there. Delightful staff at both reception and the bodega. Alas I didn't have the chance to try the bar or the interesting tents in the inner courtyard but will hopefully have another chance to try those as hotel is close to my company's office in NYC,Great location. Handy for subway and a short walk to plenty of eating and drinking locations. I would highly recommend the handy bodega a minute or twos walk when you turn left outside the hotel on Hudson Street for cheap eats, beer etc.Rooms are small but totally fine for a single traveller. Bed most comfortable and I slept brilliantly. Nice complimentary toiletries too. Highly recommended.

Loved staying here. Great staff, Really beautiful modern design. Lively bar scene. They had heated tents in their courtyard that you could hang out in, really fun. The rooms are the size of ships cabins, very cozy, but small. Nice products. Great location, Subway is a short walk away. Great for couples or a solo business traveler. The attached restaurants does not get great reviews on Google, but we had the breakfast buffet there both days ($22/each) and it was great. I am a picky breakfast person.

Great hotel for singles, couples, or a friends getaway. You will find small (it's NYC after all) yet smartly designed rooms that foster comfort and efficiency. There are great common area spaces to chill, work on the laptop, and more. A place for kids? Meh. Not so much. If you have them, leave them at home and enjoy.

Hard to know where to begin. Initially I was nervous about the location because of the holland tunnel and the fact that I am a walker, have no sense of direction and get easily lost. But after getting my bearings I realized that it was only a short walk into soho which I know well. Also a quick ride on the subway from penn station. The room was GORGEOUS!. Like having a little cave to snuggle into after walking your feet off all day. Beautifully designed and clean. Just goes to show, you don't have to sacrifice style for comfort and one definitely doesn't need a huge room to be comfortable either. I was on the eighth floor and went to bed and woke up to an ever changing view of the city and the river. There's something magical about having the bed tucked in next to the full wall picture window. Feels a little like being in a hammock high up in the trees, suspended over the city. I am old and cranky and HATE noise. The people at the desk that I dealt with both on the phone and in person were lovely and got me a very quiet room.What a gem this place is. If you've never tried a hotel like this (pod? Is that the term?) with small rooms, this is the one to try. I would definitely come back.

This hôtel offers all you need, very well located, a Huge welcoming from all the dream team ! You Will discover small room, ok but very optimized and I did not need a suite but be out in the streets, and not far from Met, central Park, hudson river, empire state building, moma, prince street, east side, little italy, chinetown, rockfeller center, some Nice croisière to see the old french lady.
user_name:
Ricardo L
Province of Siena, Italy

review_body: The room has everything you need. Its efficient and well appointed. The common areas feel more homey that hotel. They are spacious with comfortable seating and plenty of outlets. There is a great outdoor courtyard away from the loudness of the city. Harold's has delicious food and a great staff. Its very clean and spacious!! You can actually relax. You'll enjoy your meal and conversation without having to share it with people at the next table :).
user_name:
Sarah H
las vegas, United States

review_body: Very swanky and hip hotel. The jazz band that played on my second night really set the scene for a hotel that is both suave and exciting. I got bunk beds but was not at all disappointed. Also, the candy shop is definitely a must!

First of all, the staff are absolutely lovely. And Lindsey at reception is a fantastic hostess! - Location is great - not too far from subway stations. There are also a bunch of nice restaurants nearby. The rooms are small, but not cramped. The beds are super cozy. Rooms have everything you need - there’s even a small fridge you can use. Overall, it’s wonderful.

When you walk in you are transported into a hip European melting pot of coolness. Love the vibe, amenities, heated tents outside, amazing movie's playing on the wall with bowls of fresh popcorn. Absolutely loved my stay there. Would highly recommend.

This hotel has an amazing service and staff. As travel/lifestyle instagrammers, we really enjoyed staying there. The staff is helping and kind. The rooms are so cute and clean. The rooftop bar has an amazing view and great bartender that will suggest you the specialty. Overall, we loved our stay in this hotel for a few days in NYC. We can definitely recommend it for a little romantic getaway.

Not much to complain about here! I stayed at the Arlo Soho from January 18-21 with my boyfriend and we loved it. The hotel is very trendy, definitely a lot of young, stylish people staying here. The lobby is very cute with a little general store and candy bar, and there is a hotel bar and well appointed communal areas. The bodega, as others have mentioned, is very expensive. I get that this is NYC and of course hotels charge a premium, but I paid $5.45 for a tea. A tea should not cost $5.45, it's basically just hot water. That's my own fault though (laziness), as there are enough of places nearby to grab a coffee or tea. Also, the drinks at the bar are crazy expensive but beer is a reasonable price. The bar is cool and the outdoor tents they have set up for the winter are not to be missed, so I'd opt for a beer or two to check it out. The room was awesome! Yes, teeny tiny, but for two people for a couple days it's no problem. I could see if you were staying a week or so, wanting more space to unpack, but we had no issues. The bathroom could be problematic if you're not comfortable with your travel partner. The sliding glass door didn't stay shut, it would slide open while in there! Shower pressure was awesome, and bathroom products were nice. We both really loved the shower!The bed was comfortable, the room came with a steamer, blow dryer, mini-fridge. Biggest complaint is that there is no coffee or tea provided in the room (see above comment about bodega). I really feel that a hotel room should have coffee/tea! I know that there isn't a lot of space in the rooms and they are obviously trying to maximize the space but if you aren't going to have tea and coffee in the rooms, it should be a little cheaper in the lobby. One morning we asked for a breakfast recommendation and were directed to Bubby's. Personally, it wasn't for us. Breakfast food was way overpriced (I know this is NYC and I am happy to pay the price for NYC restaurants, but this place was a bit too much for food quality that was just OK). We would recommend The Grey Dog on Mulberry Street, decent prices, big plates, good food! Overall, we had a wonderful stay and aside from the minor things mentioned here no complaints!

This is a lovely boutique hotel with great atmosphere, excellent amenities and superb customer service. The rooms aren't huge but are faultlessly appointed; the reception, bodega, lounge, restaurant and bar are all great in service and selection.It would be ideal to have - or have access to - a small gym area but would definitely stay again.

When you read about the rooms being small in Arlo don't be fooled - they really are compact. They are, however, beautifully designed and very comfortable to stay in. The beds are less like boxes and more like cosy cabins with plenty of mod cons.The restaurant is fun, large salty portions typical of New York. Plenty of room in the communal spaces downstairs, a lovely selection of wines and board games to keep you entertained. As for the staff they are fairly helpful, but for any European travellers expect them to feel slightly cold with their service. This is quite typical for New York style service.

My sister and I stayed in the hotel as part of a travel deal bought in Denmark, Europe. Despite the rather small room, we felt very much at home in it, due to the excellent quality of the furnishing and the kind and professional service of the staff. The restaurant provides an excellent breakfast buffet that we also enjoyed several times. We will definitely recommend the hotel to our friends and family.

Very clean with small but very comfortable rooms. Great location and excellent service from all staff members. Hotel is located within walking distance from most of the great spots in Soho and downtown Manhattan and is very convenient for both tourists and business travelers.

This was our second stay at Arlo. Love the concept, common spaces and rooms. Staff is extremely friendly. Very clean and close to subways to get everywhere. The rooms are small but the community spaces at meant to make up for that and offer many spaces to hang out from indoor to outdoor, quiet to social. This is our go to spot to stay in NYC!

Staff is very friendly, helpful! Location is close to lots of shopping and great restaurants. Rooms are tight, which is to be expected from any NYC micro-hotel, but overall aesthetic is clean, contemporary, and stylish but very welcoming, inviting, and not pretentious. Great value for location and style.Note: one drawback is there is no fitness center

We visited this nice hotel located at Soho and we were pleasantly surprised by it. Ok the rooms may not be as big as one is used to when in the States but it has everything designed to fit in a small place. The bed was right in front of the window and might create a problem for those who can’t stand cold when the temperature outside is below zero but the down duvet will definitely keep one warm. The staff was friendly and helpful and the big plus is that you can find everything around very easily. The Subway, the shops, restaurants, bistros are all within walking distance. I’d definitely visit it again.

Lindsey in the front desk is an all Star! Whole staff treated us amazingly. Rooms were small but well thought out and comfortable. Public areas were AMAZING, with great energy and fun. Very welcoming place. Will be back

Just returned from New York staying at the Arlo Soho. Have to say that this hotel is fantastic. The staff are all very friendly, knowledgeable and very helpful. They're great for recommending places to visit and eat and great for directions and how to travel. We had a queen room overlooking the entrance to Holland Tunnel, the room was perfect, everything you need is provided (hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner, shower gel) so you can travel light. We read a lot of reviews before we left saying that the rooms were small, the bathroom facilities were too impersonal. Well the rooms are advertised as 'micro' rooms so what do people expect? We didn't find the rooms too small at all, they're really well designed, and the for the time you spend in the room they're ideal. The cases stow away under the bed and the free safe is an added bonus too. Free Wi-Fi, facilities to print boarding passes for the return journey. All round excellent stay. We were a little confused about the coffee in the lobby, sometimes it was complementary and sometimes we had to pay for it. It was my 50th Birthday while we were there and on our return to our room there was a gift from the staff, that was so thoughtful. Thank you to Lindsey, our Lobby Host, and all the staff we met and helped us while we were there. We would definitely stay at the Arlo Soho again.

Great location. Fantastic, helpful staff. Rooms are very small but the space is used extremely thoughtfully. Wonderful modern design. Great bath products too! Bed, pillows, sheets were super comfy. Loved that there were plenty of outlets for all the things we need to plug in these days. I always appreciate a full length mirror and the umbrella in the room is a great touch. We didn’t need the handheld steamer but nice to know it’s there. Loved the hotel bar and the bodega in the lobby is super convenient. And the price is SO REASONABLE. I’ve stayed at more expensive hotels and not gotten nearly the cleanliness, comfort or convenience that I got here. This is now my go-to NYC Hotel and I’m recommending it to everyone I know!

Great location, very modern and clean room. Rooms are a a little on the small side but get over it already. Restaurant and bar were excellent. Front desk staff helpful and outstanding. You will be very happy.

This hotel had the greatest staff ever. A beautiful modern concept with a very cool space. The rooms are tiny but the bed sits against the window with reading lights at one end and a flat screen on the other. It was great to just lay in the comfortable bed and gaze out the window after a tour around the city. This was a great place but don’t expect spacious accommodations. You should be taking in the sights anyways which are close by. We really liked the cozy feel and did I mention the candy shop in the lobby? Would stay again!

I stayed at the Arlo on a weekend trip to New York. It was a very stylish hotel. I felt like a part of the city staying here. The lobby was great and the room was small but nice. The bathroom was great and I loved the shower. There is not much room to store things so don't pack too much. My biggest complaint was the lack of an ice machine. You could get some in the bodega, but it was inconvenient to go downstairs every time I wanted some ice. Overall I had a great time.

Great place with good vibe and fabulous location! The room had everything we needed and was clean and comfortable. The rooftop bar had awesome views and a professional bartender. Look forward to coming back.

A friend and I stayed in the Arlo for 6 nights and we had the best time. Probably the coolest hotel I have stayed in - cocktail bar, rooftop bar, candy bar, live jazz, comfy ‘living’ areas, cool artwork and tents for chilling outside - we instantly knew we would love this hotel. The lobby and lifts also smell amazing! The trendy SoHo location is perfect, a 3 min walk to the subway which takes no time at all to NYC hot spots and tourist attractions. Nearby there are so many local amazing restaurants to try, not a tourist trap in sight and we didn’t have a bad meal (go to Bubby’s for breakfast and China blue for dinner). We had breakfast at the hotel on the first morning which was really nice too- excellent scrambled eggs and bacon! There is a 24hr shop in the lobby with drinks and snacks but it is expensive. The room is small but it was actually perfect. Room under the bed to store your luggage everything had its right place and home so nothing got lost. HUGE window to let loads of night in, with black out blinds for bed time. It was immaculately cleaned every day and considering the shower is basically in the room, not a hint or smell of damp in sight. Only down side is that the shower and toilet is basically a frosted glass box - so if you are not comfortable with the person you are staying with or a bit of a prude it may not be for you. There also isn’t a kettle but they serve hot drinks 24/7 in the lobby. The bed was comfy and all the soap and products in the room smelt insanely good! Thank you for having us, we love the Arlo and will 100% when we next visit New York. Would love to see more Arlo’s to stay in over the world!!!

Really enjoyed my stay at Arlo - location was perfect for me and the style of the hotel is really modern/trendy. The room size was also great for a short trip. I think the hotel could be excellent if they improved a few things; lack of tea/coffee facilities in the room was a downside. Whilst they do have a café downstairs, you don't always want to have to get up and go there first thing in the morning. Similarly the bathroom felt a little worn and there was some mould which was a shame! Overall great hotel and would certainly stay here again for the price (although be warned the bar is extortionate).

Great hotel!! Such an neat feel in the lobby. Rooms are clean, great bed, shower. Great use of space in the room. Walking distance to soho/shopping, subway line is 4 minute walk. We walked to Soho everyday, and took lyft and subway to everything else. Stylish, upbeat, etc. You will love your stay!

Trendy,immaculate,European feel. Very small, compact room but comfortable. Excellent staff, unique menu, quality food. Lots of leisure or work spaces.Bee hive of energy.Bodega in lobby. Wonderful experience!

My wife and I had a great time at the Arlo Soho!Lindsey, our lobby host, was a great help and very accommodating throughout our stay - she helped us find a room that was best suited to our long stay and made the necessary arrangements to ensure our stay was comfortable.The rooms are well designed and utilize the smaller spaces very well. The hotel is also very conveniently located - a short walk from Soho and from most of the main subway lines.We would highly recommend the hotel and will probably stay there during our next trip to New York!

Originally I laughed at the size of my King Alcove Room at the Arlo, but I was way wrong. This room was perfect. Nothing beat rolling out of bed right into the shower and everything was perfectly laid out. I had more then enough space and the amenities were top notch.Additionally, the General Store was perfect for stopping late for candy, or a coffee in the morning. Each of the hotel's bars had great drinks and the outdoor space was fun even on a cold evening. I will be staying here going forward with my time in NYC.

Friendly helpful staff, great vibe and energy, efficient room small but had everything needed, including fresh smell, clean surfaces, great linens, peace and quiet and a great view of downtown, excellent free Wi-Fi in room and lounges. The location was very convenient for theater, restaurants, walking and subway, SoHo, Village and more. I look forward to my next trip to NYC so that I can stay here again!

I think this hotel has been described as a micro-hotel but I found the rooms perfectly sized. They’re not big, but they certainly pack everything in to them that you need. Stylish, clean and bright, the rooms are very welcoming and I loved the contemporary feel to them. The staff were all very helpful too & I loved the roof top bar. Great place.

Cute, well designed compact rooms with generous and different public areas to hangout within the hotel. Really good balance of diverse spaces with a nice shop. Location is perfect, on the western edge of soho, walking distance to many great spots.

I stayed there with my mom in one room. The room's space was so well organized that the relatively small size was comfortable for us. It's also attractive in a minimalist way. We heard absolutely no noise from the other rooms. The staff was all extremely friendly and helpful (especially to my mom) and seemed to enjoy working there. One of my favorite things about the hotel were the large downstairs common rooms where you can sit and read or play games. I saw that they have activities like yoga classes, but I didn't get a chance to go - hopefully next time I will.

The room is small, as are most in NYC, but the space was intelligently configured. The bed was comfortable, there was abundant hot water and the hotel was able to stay warm despite record low temperatures. The staff are always amazing. I have been twice now, once alone and once with my husband and both trips were outstanding.

The hotel had the perfect location for us! We wanted to be a bit out of the hustle! From Soho everything is easily to reach, with the Subway you´re quickly in Manhattan and / or in Brooklyn. The staff was very friendly and the room clean! Two times we had breakfast, this was delicious!Creativity needed, because the unusually small room has no storage space. Life from the suitcase shouldnt be a problem. The prices in the 24-hour shop, and in the restaurant are absurd! $ 6 for a bottle of water (in the shop)! You do not even pay that much in a Four Seasons Hotel! If you don´t want to just Fiji water, you should go to the kiosk at the end of the street. Juices at breakfast come to $ 12-15, cocktails to $ 16.

Since I stayed at the NoMad location before, I actually fell in love with their set up. Therefore I have been looking forward to returning to new york for the experience at their sister location in Soho.I do have to say, the property is located exactly next to the Holland tunnel so it appeals to the certain people traveling nearby. Street parking is not too difficult but strict no parking between 8am to 6pm if I rmb correctly so you are likely to use the 55 per day Valet serviceThey set up like a kiosk for self check in and out, on one side I enjoy the convienace, but on the other hand I find the lack of human interactions a minus to the overall experience. I was supposedly to get a breakfast with my booking which the machine didn't recognize or follow up, neither to any events or programs being offered by the hotel (like yoga... music). After all, I feel like I am no more than a pedestrian in front of the subway ticketing machine... is that really the modern day hospitality?Living wise it's ok. I have a good view facing the street and looking straight to the car lines entering the tunnel. The location is also just ok. You are likely have to Uber a lot of places and not at all close to subway. I can see myself returning for the business event happening nearby but if I have to choose, Nomad is way leading in every single aspect
user_name:
HotHotelReview
New York City, New York

review_body: I had started looking at this hotel after my boyfriend had booked it due to finding an amazing rate, and I began to panic when I realized just how tiny the room was, and how the toilet and shower were only separated from the room by a frosted glass. Being a very tall couple, we were a little worried but remained positive. We originally booked for a Queen Room with a City View, but upon early check in were able to switch to a King Room with a Courtyard view which was amazing! Though the room was quite small, we both fit just fine, and were only really there for sleeping. I wish we got to stay longer because the lobby was STUNNING. The coziest looking huts outside, and there was tonnes of space to lounge around with friends, including a room that was playing a movie on our last night. The staff was extremely sweet and helpful and always had a smile. Such a long review but was genuinely very pleased with out stay! I should also mention that it was very close to the Canal St. 1 2 and 3 lines right up to Times Square and beyond, which was very convenient!

This hotel is fantastic, the lobby is amazing, the room decor is great and the toilet area is so cool and something that makes this hotel stand out for me.Yes, the rooms are a little small but this was clearly stated when we booked the room and its NY after all. Yes, it may be a little weird going to the toilet in a frosted glass box but just go with it and enjoy it! I don't have anything like this at home so I love to experience this type of stuff when I go away. The staff are fantastic I couldn't say a bad word about them, every time we came back to the hotel they greeted us & were so friendly every step of the way.The smell throughout the hotel is amazing, we even asked what it is and they told us that it's being made into candles or rooms sprays (or something like that) so once these are ready I will 100% be purchasing!The location is great - if you're considering it just book it, especially if you're a young couple!!!Can't wait to return back to this hotel, I'm pricing it for a few months time already! Love this place - you will not be disappointed!!

The 'bomb cyclone' storm unexpectedly marooned me at work in NYC. Arlo Soho's tremendous staff—Alyssa, Dan I, Dan T, and manager Gerry G—took extraordinary care to me feel right at home. Hospitality Pros! Highest recommendation.
user_name:
irisiris2018
New York City, New York

review_body: Arlo is funky, with great chill out and drinking spaces. It is staffed by friendly, always helpful people with great customer service ethics. It is around the corner from the subway and is within walking distance to Soho and Little Italy. Our room had a small lounge area which made it very comfortable. The fridge was a welcome sight but there was no kettle to boil hot water for an in-room cuppa. There is a stocked up café in reception that happily supplied hot water anytime. The restaurant food is extremely good and in the mid price range. We loved our stay.

We stayed here over NYE and really enjoyed it. The staff are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. Our room was perfectly fine for a few nights, although it was small, so any longer may have been an issue. However we liked the micro-hotel concept, which allows real value for money. Plus the rooms are modern and clean, which is great. Also check out the rooftop bar for yummy cocktails!

The Arlo is a great get-away hotel which has a "boutique feel" while offering the amenities of a standard hotel. The rooms are well designed to offer everything you need in a small space... making up for that is a huge lobby area with lots of places to work on your computer/phone (including plugs!), have a glass of wine, chat with friends, plan your day, etc. The staff is friendly and helpful. As great as the hotel itself is the location!--It's unbeatable for the great "play" areas of lower Manhattan! Also, it's near the subway that will take you to midtown and uptown for shopping, a play, etc. There's great food, wine bars, and cafe's within walking distance... be sure to check Yelp or Google for ratings before you go! The food in the hotel restaurant is okay, but there is better food (and at better prices) if you don't mind an Uber or a walk. I will definitely be back to the Arlo!

It’s a lovely little hotel. The design of the lobby and the rooms is extremely stylish. The staff are all really friendly and easygoing. Check-in took me less than two minutes and check-out was even faster.The room is NY-size so plan your luggage accordingly. The TV juts out over the bed a bit so it isn’t easy to walk to the other side of the bed but for a solo traveler it wasn’t a big deal. The bath products were also great.The location is simply fantastic. Canal St. Station is two minutes away and all the superb shops and restaurants are within 25-30 minutes of walking. Truly ideal.

Great location for a quieter stay than midtown. Fantastic staff, very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but comfortable and have a good hair dryer and steamer. Didn't use the restaurant or bar but they looked very nice. Positives- great shower and comfy bed, very cleanNegatives (struggling to find)- sometimes cleaner hadn't been by the time we had been out exploring all day and no water or tea or coffee facilities in room. Overall would highly recommend!

I can't get enough of this property. LOCATION LOCATION LOCATION! This is ideal for me as I am constantly between Financial District, Tribeca and Meat Packing districts so this is the perfect happy medium. I literally can get everywhere I need to be within 15 mins or under. The hotel is always super clean and the staff couldn't make me feel any more like family...customer service is always a top notch consistent for this property. The rooms are cozy and the common spaces are a wonderful place to get some work done..there are quite a lot of common spaces! I am esp. delighted to see the new Dylans Candy Bar addition in the lobby...perfect for my sweet tooth! Already looking forward to my next stay!

My husband and I visited New York for the first time arriving on Christmas Eve. Arlo SoHo came highly recommended from a cousin of ours and our stay only exceeded the positive info we already had about the hotel. The hotel facilities were clean, fresh and well-kept and the staff always went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The rooms are quite small but honestly, for a couple with no kids it was perfect for us. The rooms are designed for purpose and the bed was large and enabled us to sleep and rest comfortably. We were also able to spend quality time in the stylish lounge downstairs where the hotel would have movie nights, live music etc. Also, the coffee and overnight oats - AMAZING. I will definitely be staying at Arlo SoHo on my next visit to NYC!

the only reason i dont give an excellent is because every property has room for improvement. with that being said, this is the second time i have stayed here and both times have been top notch. room are a bit small but that is to be expected being in new york. service is exceptional and if you visit the roof top bar make sure you find out when Jasmine is there, possibly the best bartender around.. we will definitely stay here again in the coming year.

Really enjoyed our stay at Arlo Soho. Liked the common spaces for relaxing and meeting fellow travellers. Room was small but adequate. It is in a great location and very modern. Special thanks to Kate for looking after us for Christmas dinner. Would definitely stay here again.

The second time we have stayed at this hotel over the Christmas period and new years. We like this hotel as it is away from all the hustle and bustle of Times Square, although it is easily connected to this part of New York. There are lots of nice restaurants around the area of SOHO and Canal Street subway station is a 2 minute walk down the road which is great for connecting to other parts of New York. The hotel is situated a couple of blocks away from One World Trade Centre so makes for a nice location to go for a run along the Hudson River if thats what you're in to. The rooms are small but the bed is big and very comfortable and lots of hidden storage to put cases, bags and clothes, there is also a fridge. The shower is amazing and they clean the rooms daily and provide you with toiletries each day. The cleaners do a great job. The hotel is relatively quite but does have a nice roof top terrace/bar with views of the World Trade Centre which can be a little more lively but not imposing at all. Downstairs there is a small cafe/deli/sweet shop which is nice and there is also a grocery store 200 yards down the road which we used a lot. The staff are very friendly and helpful and helped us arrange an Uber from the hotel which was cheaper than a taxi (The hotel offers a transport service but its $95). We would definitely stay here again.

Booked solely for the location - initially very apprehensive when transfer bus couldn't find it, on check in it was obvious that this place rates service high on the list. We were greeted like old friends and shown to our city facing king room immediately. We had been warned of small room size and this is true (think cruise ship stateroom) they are small but all fitted out to maximise space with top quality furniture and fittings. Open plan shower and Loo may prove troublesome for first time bed sharers but we've no secrets left in that deptThe bar and foyer split between Mac using hipsters and couples -very good ambience. Tents with heaters in the courtyard great for a nightcap. Attached restaurant first class with English continental breakfast/brunch available. Rooftop bar and terrace not really useable midwinter but would be great in the summer. Elevators roomy and quick. Maids courteous and flexible. Consierge was a joy and got us a cab everytime we needed but refused tip? Hosts/ desk clerks superbOverall very pleasantly surprised as we are probably not the target market. (50's married Brits) Would definitely choose again over big name chains for short stayWell done Arlo

This was our first trip to New York during Christmas and it was amazing! We had a great stay at Arlo Soho. Arlo SoHo is superbly located within walking distance to Canal St. subway, restaurants, delis, bars and shops. The room was great and the bed super comfortable: the design/minimalist approach works well! We loved the common areas, the variety of activities (jazz band/pop-up shop/christmas movies), the attention to detail (winter/holiday theme): the downstairs lounge felt like home while the rooftop bar provided some delicious cocktails. The staff were friendly and helpful.Thanks Arlo SoHo for making our first trip to NYC memorable!

We returned yesterday from this incredible little boutique hotel having spent 7 nights over Christmas here. It surpassed our expectations! The good: the room isn’t too small in our opinion, we were in a city queen and found it fine for 2 people. Everything is very cleverly and compactly organised with power ports aplenty to keep all our electricals charged. The fridge , hairdryer and hand held steamer were all great and useful additions. The bed was so comfortable ! We loved the big waterfall shower and the complimentary toiletries which smelt divine. I was sad to realise that they were developed specially for arlo hotels so couldn’t be purchased. The things in need of improvement: the room needs very basic hot drink making facilities ! You get this in even bog standard 3 star hotels in the uk ! Going downstairs to get expensive hot drinks when all you want to do is have a few more minutes in bed was a tad annoying when you are on holiday ! But hardly an issue, just worth mentioning. But what was a bit of pain was, the drinks in all the bars are extortionately expensive! You have such a lovely funky and modern hotel with beautiful shared facilities, this is the only thing that lets it down. We would have loved to sample even one drink here , particularly on the roof top bar but ended up giving it miss all week as we found two drinks here were ( no joke ) pricier than anywhere in Times Square, soho or the financial district ! Having said that, we want to thank every member of staff we encountered for an incredible stay. Everyone was so helpful and welcoming. We would not hesitate staying here again for its great location with accessibility to whole of Manhattan.

Our first trip to New York during Christmas was amazing! Thanks again for your hospitality! We had an amazing time in New York and the Arlo Soho staff provided great service. Arlo SoHo is a great hotel located within walking distance to restaurants, bars and a variety of shops ranging from trendy upscale boutiques to national and international chain store outlets. Our stay was extremely comfortable, I love the minimalist approach to hotel living, it's comfortable, clean and functional!

Nice facade. Beautiful interior. Sleek stylish and tastefully furnished.However room was ill equipped. Not even the most basic toothbrush set, no electric kettle, no cups for drinks. Didnt like the AC. It comes on and off once it reaches a certain temp. Pretty annoying cos it gets pretty stuffy when off. We like the decor no doubt. Great place. Location is alright. Walking distance to metro. Hotel staff could have given more recommendation for local joints. Cos there are the Blind tiger, Five Guys burger, Joe's Pizza and more stuff nearby. When asked the direction from subway to hotel prior to arriving, wasnt exactly given the accurate direction. So we ended up taking a cab from the metro nearby. Cos we didnt have internet upon arrival.Overall its all ok.

Have been staying here at the Arlo Soho for 6 nights and 2 to go I wanted to review here on TripAdvisor! This is a fantastic location, handy to the subway! The food here at Harold Meat + Three is amazing, we have eaten here everyday! The manager Allen is so friendly and all the waitstaff are helpful, it's a bonus each evening we've received complimentary desert - the peanut butter cake and Mulled wine sangria are my favourite's!!!

Great little Boutique Hotel in a great location close to all downtown eateries and bars - the hotel room facilities were brilliantly executed with a steamer for ironing out creases..we had everything we needed in a great location.

Really loved the whole experience! From the very fashionable, modern, but warm lobby area, and passionate staff, to the very fashionable, functional, and modern room. The room was small, but so functional, and elegant, and modern. I will definitely return in the near future!

A massive thanks to the team at the Arlo especially Lindsay (Lobby Hero!) and Gino (Friendly Face Extraordinaire) - I had a lovely stay, rooms cleaned perfectly and the team in the Bodego always friendly. Their rooftop bar was lovely and the restaurants / Bars have a comfortable feel and excellent ambiance. The team there works really hard to recommend good bars and good restaurants and get you out and about enjoying yourself. Will definitely return with friends and family and it will be a given that the Arlo Soho will be where we stay :) Thanks again! :)

I stayed at this wonderful hotel one Christmas Night, and the only thing I can say it's that everything was perfect. The room was small, but it was well organized and super clean. The rooftop bar is wonderful and the hall is so comfortable and beautiful. Staff always gentle, kind and helpful. Great quality-price ratio for Soho.Highly recomended.

You must stay there if you are planning on going to NYC.very nice rooms, a great restaurant and wonderful staff. Very close to the Metro stations and easy to walk to the Soho. i am sure going to stay there in my next visit

YES... A thousand times yes, you should stay here if you are planning on going to NYC. It was really nice to not stay directly in the city& get away a little from all the chaos. The rooms are so cozy (in a good way) it makes you feel like you're staying with family, minus all the drama lol! The hotel employees are extremely personable and it's great to have a restaurant in the hotel. Just ask for the food to go& enjoy eating in bed! I would 100% stay here again.

My son loved the bunkbeds! The rooms were a great size with an incredible view of the city. The best part was the staff - they went out of their way to make us comfortable. The whole vibe of the hotel is great. It is relaxed and elegant but not precious (I didn't feel uncomfortable with my 8 year old son).

I had a standard room with a view of the street and a small view of the city. I had an early flight into new York and Arlo contacted me to offer an early check in. That was amazing since it was really cold that morning and were passing time by visiting stores and restaurants but were not properly dressed for the cold. The entire stay at Arlo was seamless and relaxing. The lobby is very warm and welcoming. They have designed it to be a very cozy place to get some space outside of your room with a nice little bar and restaurant as well. The staff is truly welcoming, happy, and so nice. They are ready to help in any way. The cleaning staff was thorough making my room a fresh relaxing space to return to after a long day of exploring. I had no complaints during our week stay here. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a refreshing fun place to stay, who likes it very clean, and likes good customer service. Shopping and good food are just a few blocks away, or the metro station is very convenient since it's just right around. I look forward to staying here again, or trying its sister property Nomad.
