I typically head up to NYC for 1 week a month. Several co-workers appeared to like the Arlo so I figured why not give it a try.I was incredibly impressed. This is more than a hotel, it is a community! The first floor has a plethora of sofas, work table, chairs, a bar, outdoor area, restaurant, power outlets everywhere. It is basically setup for work & play simultaneously. The decor is all very modern and elegant, everything is very clean... music is typically "chill out/electronica" type stuff and good.The rooms are not huge, but this is NYC. They're designed in such a way as to maximize the space perfectly. Like the downstairs, they're very clean and modern. Excellent waterfall shower, comfortable bed (the pillows rock)... beautiful full glass windows view of the city (yes you can close the blinds). Nice and quiet, easy to use temperature control.The staff was incredibly friendly. The guests were too, I think the environment just makes it easier to be. I'll be booking here for now on during my monthly business trips! However, this is perfect for vacationers too. Within short walking distance of subway stations... and walking distance to all of SOHO as well.

My husband and I stayed here for three nights in mid-December (a beautiful time in NYC!) and had an incredible time.The staff at the hotel were a joy to be around, from check in to check out we never had anything but a great interaction. A special shout out to Lindsey - the lobby manager that checked us in - she was awesome to deal with and treated us like old friends. The lobby and amenity spaces have an amazing ambience and there is always some form of programming going on (live music, movie nights etc.). The lobby ‘bodega’ is a great idea and a good spot to grab something on the go 24/7. Morning fitness classes are a great offering – we did the Pilates and it was quality.Yes, the rooms are small – I believe the hotel calls them “micro rooms” – but that’s kind of the point. The vibe of the hotel is about getting you out of your room to enjoy the amenities in the hotel and the surrounding city. If that vibe appeals to you then you will love this hotel. They’ve also done a good job of making the beds cozy to help make the small room almost feel like a plus.We ate breakfast in the hotel restaurant most mornings and that was great. Good selection of ‘trendier’ breakfast items and good coffee.The location is great – walking distance to multiple subway lines and great bars, restaurants, shopping – you name it. We typically stay closer to midtown, and it was great to stay in Soho and experience a totally different vibe and part of the city.So a definite 5 out of 5. We will definitely stay here again on future trips!

This is a new micro-boutique. You save on costs while still getting high quality bed and shower. The bars in the hotel and restaurant are very good. Harold's meat + Three restaurant is excellent. Try Harold's breakfast packs at the front coffee shop too.
user_name:
BatteryParkTV
New York City, New York

review_body: We loved our stay at the Arlo Hotel Soho. The location was great, the staff were lovely (and gave us some great restaurant recommendations). The rooms were clean and had all the amenities you would require (including a steamer which came in handy) and the bed was very comfortable. All round a great stay. I would highly recommend the hotel and wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again when I’m next in New York.

Though some may say the space is too small or blah, blah, blah, we loved our stay at the Arlo! The space was functional, even if considered "small," and the service was wonderful. The atmosphere of the hotel was super fun and we loved all the space around the hotel where we could hang out beyond our room.

Really cool spot to be based for a long weekend in New York! Design of the hotel interior is cool and modern, rooms are small but comfortable. The breakfast was really delicious and the staff were attentive and very friendly.

This hotel was REALLY not for me. It was loud, had a super-awkward entry way, an overpriced 'bodega' ($7 water anyone), and a crowd of people who were clearly there to party. This would be a great hotel for a younger crowd who want to stay up late, listen to loud music, and not sleep at all. The rooms are TINY with super thing walls. I barely slept in my three nights there. It is also right over the Holland Tunnel so it has a lot of traffic noise. I highly encourage anyone considering staying here to decide what is most important : sleep or party. If party - go for it.

Staying in this hotel at the moment.Good reasonal priced, clean rooms, nice helpfull service.Good quiet place, nice view, good beds and very good shower. Dont be scared of the rooms being small, its all you need, you leave early in the moring and you come back late at night, who needs space when a sleep?The restaurant in the hotel is ok. Not spectacular. Simple menu, very small burger for that amount of money. Dont take the gnocci, to simple, no bite at all. Hotel is in a nice area with everything around the corner, restaurants bars and andshoppings and good wifi!

Conveniently located to public [and private] transportation the Arlo SoHo is situated in a very interesting and accessible neighborhood. Entering the Arlo you are greeted by modernity...clean lines, energy, mystery -- what is down that hallway?...and delightful staff. Checking in and getting to my room was easy and quick. My room was a Queen and opening the door my first impression was light with compact, efficient, clean lines. And, that's what it was. My room overlooked the "City" side and, having lived in NYC for some time, was pleased to hear no traffic at all.The bed was quite comfortable; there was a steamer [instead of iron] that worked beautifully and hairdryer in the well equipped bathroom; there were sockets and USB ports aplenty.Other amenities were offered that I did/could not partake of on this visit. I will make sure to do so the next time.Net/net: Would recommend the Arlo SoHo to anyone.

The Arlo SoHo is all about maximizing space in what could be thought of as tiny rooms. Comfortable and cozy. From the first call asking for an early check in (which was rerun within an hour by Kate who is a GEM, we were treated like old friends. Everything about our short stay was nothing short of awesome. We are already planning our March and May 2018 excursions to NYC and will be booking at the Arlo!

This hotel is awesome! The best yet! Customer service is outstanding, the hotel is close to everything, the place is fresh , hip , modern and awesome! So clean, and comfy the rooms are way more spacious then I thought, great window views! The hotel has the the best staff super clean and great food! Walking distance from the gym and Barry’s bootcamp ,great dining near by, the staff will tell u the good spots , set up reservation if need, and print out directions!!! The hotel is my new found favorite The lounge area is so relaxing and they have something going on each day, Yoga, food tasting, movie night! We will def go back and we give it a 10 star rating ! Love love Arlo SoHo

I originally booked through another online loyalty site and realized mistakenly that I'd booked for the Arlo NoMad (when I intended to book at Arlo Soho). The online booking company was not at all helpful with helping me with this mistake when I called them. I arrived at the Arlo Soho and explained the situation to Lindsey G., a lobby host at Arlo Soho, who could see that I was stressed and flustered about it. She called the sister property and confirmed my reservation there was cancelled for me, then booked me at Arlo Soho, and gave me a better rate for the second night than I found online or that was offered me on the other hotel loyalty site, along with a couple free breakfast buffet coupons. This kind of service and good business practice is what will make me a loyal, regular guest at Arlo Soho for my once per month NYC weekend visits. The hotel was clean, well appointed, and efficient. The purpose of my visits to NYC is to go out and be in the city and socialize with friends, so the smaller room size is not a problem for me. I see some reviews complaining about the size of the hotel rooms at Arlo -- It's important to note that when a hotel says it has a a Scandinavian design aesthetic, that means small, clever, efficient spaces. I have stayed in hotels in Scandinavia and they are some of the tiniest spaces I've ever been in -- my room at Arlo was HUGE compared to those. I loved the fresh smell as I walked into the lobby each time, the fun rooftop bar, the lobby, the onsite restaurant (the bartenders make EXCELLENT cocktails) and the all night lobby bodega for snacks. I'll be back next month!

The room was indeed small, but you couldn't ask for anything more thought out with regards to space and amenities...it was all we needed! I felt like I was in a luxury boat cabin! Bed was very comfy, shower head was perfect, with water just the way we liked it. Compact and perfect in every way! The lobby, bar, sitting area, computer area, restaurant...all were very unique and cozy, we just loved it all!

Friendly Staff & modern rooms/ convenient lobby amenities made for an enjoyable stay at the Arlo. Rooms were a bit small, but was to be expected in NYC. The value, accessibility to the city and service more than made up for the room size.

The rooms are small, which is typical of manhattan hotels, and very cozy. The lobby, and bars are awesome and the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is about 2 blocks from a subway stop so you can get anywhere in NYC easily, and there are plenty of upscale shopping and restaurants within walking distance. There is a grocer on the corner for any supplies you'll need for your stay. Our room had a great city view, but if you are a light sleeper you may want to pick something other than city view because late night traffic can be loud sometimes.

The staff were helpful and very welcoming from the moment we walked in. Yes, the room was small but that's what we expected and it wasn't as if we spent much time in the room. It's away from busy Times Square, but it is close to the subway so the rest of Manhattan is easily accessible. China Town and Tribeca are within 5 minutes walking distance. We got a great deal and I would consider the Arlo again when I return. And I would recommend this hotel to my friends.

The ambience of the hotel is amazing, truly. The smell, the art, and the little gift shop downstairs is so well thought out. The roof top car has the best mojitos too. The room is tiny. I think that’s just a part of nyc style and lack of space, but the room is surprisingly small. I wouldn’t mind it so much if I was on my own, but coming here as a couple is a little awkward. The bathroom doesn’t really have a door and is about 8 feet from the bed. If you’re comfortable with that kind of “sharing”, then by all means - enjoy!

We spent 4 nights along with 6 other couples for a couples trip and the hotel itself was great. The lobby and hang out spots were fantastic! The furniture and decor was super cool and very trendy. It was located perfectly in Soho around plenty of things to do and see. One day the guys took advantage of the free bikes and ventured over the Brooklyn Bridge. Did I mention the smell? Holy cow...the signature scent in the hotel definitely could be sold in a bottle!The service was great, the common areas were great, but the rooms were slightly less than great. I understand that when you go to a Boutique hotel you will have a small room, so the smallness wasn’t an issue. While the bed was awesome, the bathroom was basically a shower with a toilet in it. There just wasn’t much privacy. Coffee drinkers be ware, you’ll have to go down stairs and pay for your cup of joe each morning since there’s no coffee maker in the room.

I stayed at Arlo SoHo for a week in early December and could not have had a better experience. The hotel is in a great location, has an amazing ambiance with very inviting/comfortable common areas, and offers great fitness class options. The staff at Arlo Soho are extremely friendly and helpful. Will definitely stay at Arlo again!

Visited New York with my mum for the first time. Would definitely recommend this hotel. It’s quirky and modern. The staff are very friendly. Rooms are comfortable and although small, it really works. The shower was so nice. Very relaxing and the frosted glass ensures privacy. The location is well set. It’s location in Soho allows you to experience the local shops and eateries as well as giving you the option to go uptown to more iconic areas.

We stayed in the Arlo hotel for a week in October and really enjoyed staying there.It's a stylish hotel with good facilities in a terrific location. All the staff we met were very friendly, helpful and efficient.It's located in between Soho and Tribeca (just north of Canal St) and is within walking distance of the shops of Soho, plus the restaurants of Chinatown and Tribeca. Canal St. subway is close by, giving easy access to Midtown and further afield (Brooklyn, etc.).The hotel is very stylish - not only the lobby, but the rooms. It has good facilities: a restaurant, a small kiosk in the lobby, a ground floor bar and a rooftop bar!We are a family of three, with myself and my wife in one room and my teenage daughter in another. The only downside to the Arlo is that the rooms are small - two people sharing a room that size for a week did become a challenge, although my daughter on her own, had no problems!Would I stay there again? If it was for 3,4,5 days, then definitely. If it was for a little longer, I may look for somewhere else, or negotiate a larger room at the Arlo.
user_name:
Nigel W
Steyning, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I stayed in the Arlo Soho for a week for both business and holiday purposes. Everything about this hotel is a dream, from the staff to the rooms and overall location/price and atmosphere. It is now the only hotel I will stay in in NYC. If you are lucky to get a room here, take it!! You will only be thrilled. Thanks Arlo and see you soon!

Really pretty communal areas, super friendly staff (especially the concierge and cocktail waiters), clean and well-designed bedrooms, great location and incredible roof terrace with views of the Hudson.

Well I genuinely thought we might struggle with the concept, room size etc. but we actually LOVED it.Once you get how to work the bedroom layout, and organise yourself the room becomes a secondary issue actually. VERY comfortable beds and great shower. So if working, head off down to the community work area (why sit in a room alone) or if touristing enjoy the brilliant location.Canal st station round the corner, and Spring Street 200 yds away. You can walk to the village, the Hudson river front and even to downtown if you fancy a 30 min walk.Also great restaurants and Pubs/bars all pretty close really.If not Ubers are always withing 2 mins away.The staff here are great, and special thanks to Kimberley in the bars.Everything has been said really, but don't be shy staying here if you are the wrong side of 40...just be cool!!Will be back for sure.

Smart, trendy, nice, cozy, clean small hotel room. The room had everything we needed in the right place. Very good shampoo and shower gel. Friendly staff, good coffee shop in the lobby. Good location, close to the shopping streets and the subway. The hotel aroma was a little bit to much in the lobby :)

Within the context of what it is, a micro property, it great. The room is quite nice if you are an organized traveler, if not think bigger hotel. Plenty of chill space on site with live music, poetry and the buzz of commerce throughout the day. The location is convenient to a subway, it’s a quieter part of town with enough amenities locally to be perfect for the wind down after a busy day. It’s the crew that puts it over the top, bright, young energetic ambassadors of the brand. If there is a glitch (there is always a glitch traveling, right?) they are on it. It’s not about being perfect it’s about getting it to perfect. Specially kudos to Isabella, Kimberly, Dan, Dan, Dan and Dan! Yes there are that many Dans . My tip; the downstairs bar is the better environment unless the weather is your priority and you need to be outside.

We visited New York at the end of November and stayed at the Arlo Soho hotel for 5 nights. Overall we had a fantastic stay, and would stay again, however, there were a few niggles. We stayed in a Queen Room which was very small. Having travelled from the UK for 5 nights, we had quite a bit of luggage, but there was only one very small clothes rod in the room which held at most 5 coat hangers, so we had to 'live out of suitcases' for the duration of our stay which was not ideal (we just managed to wedge them in the very tight space between the window and the bed) . Also, we visited the rooftop bar and ordered drinks, then within 15 minutes of ordering were told that the bar was closing and we had to leave them (this was at 11pm). However, having said all that, the reception staff were lovely, and couldn't be more helpful, and we loved the location, so would still recommend.

First and foremost, if you're not familiar with what a "micro hotel" is, you should look it up- Arlo SoHo is a micro hotel, and if you were to book it without knowing that, you would probably be disappointed with your room. If you're okay with the micro hotel format, the spaces that the Arlo provides as well as the amenities in the room are pretty nice. Nothing amazing, but it is a comfortable place to stay in the city.

We stayed the first weekend of November while in town to see a show and enjoy good restaurants. We come a few times a year, but this was our first time staying at this hotel. I always get a bit nervous staying at a new hotel because we have our NYC favorites...well now we have a NEW favorite! Arlo Soho was Amazing. What a cool lobby space, we had an amazing room with a terrace, and the customer service was the best. Lindsey at the front desk is a keeper. She remembers names, always greets guests with a smile and hello, and goes out of her way to make sure you feel like you are wanted as a customer. She clearly takes pride in her job and goes above and beyond! I can't wait for our next trip to NYC so we can stay at this awesome hotel again. It is a gem.

Loved my room! It was small, but totally cute and livable. If you're not spending you're entire trip in the hotel, this is the perfect place to stay. Fairly centrally-located, rad work space if you need to get some work done on your trip, coziest and comfiest bed, and super cute interiors. And (weird plus, I know) but the scent flowing throughout the lobby is delicious. The manager, Lindsey, was also crazy helpful during my stay, very attentive to my needs and great at recommending places to check out in the city.

I had at Arlo twice this year and loved it every time. From the moment you enter the hotel the staff is very friendly and accommodating. The room is small but very functional with all the necessary amenities. Even though you're in NYC the room is very quiet and you don't hear rooms next door which is very nice. The hotel lobby and sitting area are just amazing -- very well decorated throughout, very stylish and we also loved the rooftop terrace. The hotel is walking distance to everything SOHO and the village which we absolutely love. This hotel has become our home away from home and we look forward to going back.

The Arlo Soho is a cool hotel, well decorated and has some nice concepts. The best part about it is hands down their A1 service. The staff is courteous, smiling and helpful. The only reason I’m giving a 4 star is because of the bathroom layout. Taking a shower would always result in a water mess because there’s no separation between the shower and the toilet. I wish it was in a closed door room to have more privacy too.

The service was amazing - the staff went out of their was to make you feel welcome and important and gave a real personal service especially Lindsey on reception who was exceptional and made our stay even more special! It was my partners birthday while were were there and she delivered a gift of goodies from the Bodega with a card! She chatted to us every time we saw her making sure were were having an amazing time in the city recommending us restaurants and Broadway shows to see! Also the young guy at the Bodega was brilliant - he remembered our drinks order every time and always chatted about our day. The overall atmosphere in the hotel was cool and buzzing (but not too much) and there was always something interesting happening on the calendar but you could stay very separate from this is you wanted to. The rooms and beds were extremely comfortable and well planned out for such small spaces and so quiet which is the most important thing for me to sleep well!! We were in a city view room but could hear ZERO traffic noise - brilliant windows and views. The location is brilliant as its a 5 min walk straight into Soho or Greenwich village and the subway is just around the corner so very easy to go uptown and do the sites! The only negative was that we found the towels in the rooms very small and didn't feel very luxurious which was a shame especially as you don't get a robe or slippers which you often do in a 4 star hotel. Also the shower head is ceiling mounted so not easy to have a shower without getting your hair wet. Other than that an all round fantastic stay!!

Izabella and Amaris were great they made my son Aramis feel so special all the employees from Harold’s to the engineer who helped us Anthony were Awesome I would recommend everybody try out the Arlo SoHo✅

My wife and I stayed at the Arlo Soho for 5 nights in November. Everyone on the staff of the hotel was great, especially Lindsey G. She was the friendly face that greeted us when we walked in the door. She told us "I'll be here every day you're here, so just let me know if you need anything." She followed through on that by always giving us great advice on things to see and do. One example is steering us towards Rockefeller Center when we were looking for a skyscraper view of the Manhattan skyline. The location of the hotel is excellent. There are great restaurants (try The Greek), bars (try the Pegu Club!), and shops within walking distance. There are two subway stations within a 5 minute walk which give you many options for train lines to get where you need to go.The micro-suite layout of the room worked fine for us. It requires you to stay organized because you don't have room spread junk all over the place. The bed and comforter were excellent. Also, with the bed next to the window, you can lay in bed and get a great view of the surrounding buildings. The window opens so you can get fresh air. The common areas on the ground floor are very welcoming.Enjoy your stay and say hi to Lindsey for us!

Stayed in this hotel for our city trip with my spouse. Staff is super super friendly and always happy to help when asking something from them. Hotel is quiet offering activities like rooftop yoga. Rooms are small but there are things that you need, they’re modern and clean. The only surprise for us was that toilet (and shower) was in the room just divided with glass door so there was nothing to block the noise and odor. But well, I guess it depends how you’re used to ;-) Still might not be the best for romantic first trip. :DLittle shop downstairs was lovely, you can find things like match chia pudding and overnight oats. Location of the hotel is great, close to Soho activities and lively restaurants and bars. I would totally recommend this place to my friends and go there again!

We stayed at The Arlo for one night. Pleasant staff with easy check in. We arrived early and checked our luggage and left for a brunch and a show. Upon our return much later we checked into our room. Our room although small, was well planned out for the space and very clean. I could smell the bleach used to clean the bathroom. No issue for me, the bathroom was spotless. The bed was comfy and there was a place for everything. If you plan on staying longer than a few days I would definitely get a larger room. One night in the queen room was fine, any longer I would need more space. The room came with large bottles of shampoo, conditioner and body wash. Bar soap for the sink and one tube of body lotion. A shower cap would have been helpful, but there was none. There is a fridge if you want to store you own bottles of water or snacks. Harold restaurant and bar are in the same space as The Arlo. We had breakfast there. Service and food were good. We stopped by the roof top bar for a cocktail. Drinks were good. Weird thing about the hotel and restaurant is no cash. Credit card and charge to your room only. I was not thrilled about this since I had cash to spend and did not want to charge everything. Is this a new thing? Never encountered this before, and would like to choose my payment method. This won't stop me from coming back. I liked this hotel.

Nice hotel. Simple room which is good for being clean. Lovely staff. Bar quite lively.Room big enough for 1 person, 2 would be tight. Bed very comfortable.As with many modern hotels no where to put things that don’t hang. No drawers, that’s ok, but nowhere to unpack underwear etcIrritatingly cheap toilet paper and hot water takes ages to come through.Road noise, but that’s probably same all over NYAir conditioning very loudLocation not great, I wouldn’t stay again. Nothing in the neighbourhood

Love this hotel - especially when the rate is good and I am solo. As everyone else says, rooms are VERY compact, but well designed. The bathroom is essentially "in the room" so if you need privacy it would be problematic. Love the location, the service is absolutely top rate, and the open public spaces are terrific. Very young cool vibe.

Loved staying here. Although micro-sized rooms, it felt perfect for my solo stay. The location is very central. I walked just about everywhere from the hotel. Although I think there could be more amenities in the room, I don't have any other complaints. The hotel is very cozy and welcoming. I highly recommend this place!

Wanted an affordable but nice option in a great location downtown and the Arlo Soho was definitely a unique experience. Go into it realizing that the rooms are probably smaller than anywhere you’ve ever stayed but it’s new, has a really cool lobby / common area space, and the beds are super comfortable! The shower is awesome with good products and the staff is amazing and they really try to help. With the brilliant design of the small space and comfortable amenities (nice rooftop area for yoga and drinks), it’s a great affordable alternative when traveling to the city. A definite experience.

This is a fun and well decorated hotel. Very enjoyable staff with easy check-in/check-out. The room is very small but the space is utilized well. I would recommend to anyone looking for a place in this area. Rooftop bar is neat as well.

We stayed at Arlo Soho on a recent visit to New York. The hotel was smart, clean and vibrant with lots of public spaces including a fabulous roof top bar and a lovely courtyard garden. The rooms were small but well designed and very comfortable with a superb drench shower. What makes this place extra, extra special, however is the super friendly and helpful staff, from maintainence, cleaning and counter staff, without exception all seemed happy to have us stay! Two staff in particular deserve a special mention - Kate on reception and Matthew in the shop. On my very first day in New York I had my purse stolen in the subway and arrived back at the hotel very upset. Kate soon took control, phoning my bank and credit card provider and being shoulder to cry on! She acted with professionalism and compassion and above all was concerned for my well being and comfort. What an extremely kind and caring young lady. Matthew provided tea and another shoulder! The Arlo should be very proud of these two. They were absolutely fabulous and the main reason why I shall be back! Thank you.

Arlo Soho is a Gem. Impeccable staff, convenient location, and a wonderful vibe. The small room was offset by welcoming common spaces to chat, work, and relax. I've already booked my next visit! Great stay!

Its a small, trendy, charming and lovely location in Soho. The rooms are cosy and fresh but foremost the staff is really nice and helpful. If not just ask for Lindsay and she will make sure your stay will be excellent.

Read the comment down bout staff appearance, i think it is the concept of the hotel the staff are more out goin with the guest, which is very cool the location is close to subways. there is small cafe open 24 hours. i left to canada for 5 days did not want to take my luggage along, however the front supervisor was kind enough to stored my luggage i am appreciated.

Stayed here for 2 nights for work, primarily due to location, but also because it made a change to the usual chain hotel. Staff were welcoming and the place felt new and clean. Room was small - even for NY - but well-appointed and perfectly functional. Good bed, good shower, no bath.Breakfast was a buffet affair, and not the breadth of options you’d get in bigger hotels, but very tasty nonetheless.The bar is good, and turns into a trendy affair by about 7, with musicians, DJs and the like.And ‘trendy’ pretty much sums the place up as a whole. If you don’t have a beard, tatts or some kind of wonky haircut, or are not one of the well-heeled and beautiful, you may stick out a bit, as I did. Still, I rather enjoyed bringing the tone down a little and would go back, either for business or pleasure.

This hotel is great. Little rooms but they are super cool and layed out great. Comfy beds, great service, great lobby, lounging areas are awesome!! Privacy areas and group areas.Really perfect location and safe.Only thing to watch out for is the bar gets pretty loud with music and people on Thursday night. Stay on higher level. Not the 2nd floor!

Everyone at the hotel was very nice and incredibly helpful. Lindsey Gershberg was especially wonderful to work with and made sure that everything we needed was well taken care of. The room was small, but very clean. It had a European feel and was perfect for our visit to New York City.

I now know that this hotel is known for its tiny rooms but when I arrived and first opened the door, I was surprised at the tiny size of the room. It is comically small and would simply not work effectively for two people of my size let alone even 1 of my kids plus my wife and me. That being said, it was cleverly laid out and sort of fun to try as a unique experience. The property had lots of nice shared public spaces filled with mod/hipster types who go for hanging out in hotels reading books (I guess).One word of warning - the lower floor "City View" room I was in had a terrible view and significant road noise. I would very much have preferred a higher floor room. The hotel also has a 24x7 market which was very helpful for a quick breakfast (and dinner) option. Worth trying once but I'll look for a bigger room next time I think.

We've stayed here twice while on business as the value for money is great. The rooms are small but enough for a few nights stay. I recommend asking for a room on one of the higher floors with clear views towards Hudson St (some of the other rooms closely face a building across the street). The location is good with walking distance to sights, shopping and good restaurants and the rooms are quiet with little or no noise from the street. There is no room service but a small cafe in the lobby as well as restaurants, bar and roof top on site.

Such a great place. Amazing staff, amazing service. The lobby and lounge area are stylish and clean. Feels like to be home. Can also highly recommend the dog pound a super cool gym just a cross the street to develop you Abs. Will be back again and again and again! ❤️

This hotel is amazing! I love Love LOVE it! Yes, my room is tiny-house small, but it is also wonderful and well-designed. Very comfortable bed and I find the fishbowl view into the courtyard both humorous and communal. The common areas of the hotel somehow manage to be both lofty and cozy. Love the jazz musicians in the lobby, the interesting food, drink and candy selections in the bodega and the wonderful rooftop bar. I'm looking forward to the morning singing bowl meditation on the roof! Otherwise, the vibe is amazing as is the staff! And then there is the scent in the lobby and the elevators...is that vetiver? I dunno, but the Arlo Soho isn't just a hotel. It's an experience! You just gotta try it.

This was my first visit to Arlo Soho. Was there for business and pleasure. I booked easily online and also was able to extend my stay a week before my trip. They are very friendly. I requested early check in (cause I flew in off the red eye). They were able to accommodate me a little after 11. I loved my cozy room. Also loved the design of the hotel lobby. The bed and the view were the best. They even left me a little birthday treat. After I checked out I realized on the flight that I left my IPad behind. I called the hotel and they had it for me and helped me arrange shipping. I so appreciate their service. Staying only with Arlo going forward!

The staff were always pleasant and helpful, Excellent service!!! Thank you specially Lindsey. The room was not too big but well equipped, once decoration of the common areas. Great location, close to Canal Square, red line, very useful in your visit to New York City. They just need improve breakfast, they do not change anything in the 5 days.

The Arlo Soho was the most welcoming, comfortable haven after long days out walking and long nights out dancing. Best location, superb staff, sweet vibes. Rooms are exactly as described onsite - compact, clean and comfortable. Loved it here!

I have stayed at Arlo Soho just about every week since May and they are THE best! I work in the customer service industry so I know how hard it can be and all i have too say is that most everyone i encounter (bartender, front desk staff- one of my favorite front desk staff says hi and bye and notices me every time and goes out of her way to be sure I am happy- she literally makes my day!, to Katie and Arantxa).Thank you for making Arlo Soho my home away from home :)

I have stayed here 6-7 times and each time I am more blown away than the last. I have previously reviewed the micro concept rooms that feel way bigger than they are. This time I want to talk service and staff. I call the front desk and it feels so personal, I am greeted by name when they answer they are extremely polite and helpful. I walk out of my room in the morning and see a cleaner or a technician and I am always greeted with a smile and a friendly good morning. When I checkout I get engaged in a friendly and relevant conversation. So the rooms are amazingly comfortable, the staff go way above and beyond on service, there is honestly nothing I can ever fault with this place. To put this in context the Trump Soho is right next door to my office, the Hampton inn is one block away, I chose the Arlo every trip I may have to walk an extra 10 minutes but when I get back after a hard day of work I feel welcome and like I am at home. I only wish I could rate this place beyond the scale because it deserves it.

Very mixed feelings about my stay at the Arlo Soho. I stayed here for 3 nights from October 20th- October 23rd. I live in the West Village, so this hotel is located very conveniently to my apartment and could be the perfect hotel to stay at any time my parents visit. Unfortunately, I’d have to think twice before staying here again.Front Desk: Whoever the male working the front desk Thursday night on October 19th was extremely accommodating and helped me make a last minute reservation for my Mom and I. Whoever the male working Friday morning October 20th around 8:30am (I believe his name is Dan) doesn’t belong in the service industry. I travel frequently and understand how early check-ins work. Nobody can guarantee early check-ins because it is reliant on who checks out at what time and if housekeeping can get there. Anyway, I called the front desk early Friday morning to explain to them that my Mom is an anxious traveler and would be arriving at the hotel by herself to check-in around 10:30am. I understood there would be no way to guarantee an early check-in, but if the possibility presented itself to prioritize my Mom’s check-in. In an obnoxious tone (Dan) replied, “To be blunt, no.” A more appropriate response would have been, “We cannot guarantee early check-ins, but we will make a note and do the best we can.” It’s not what you say, it’s how you say it. If management is reading this, he is definitely not somebody you want being the “face” or first impression of the hotel. Lastly, the woman who checked us out on Monday morning October 23rd at 8:30am was lovely, sweet, and quick to process our check-out.Amenities: Wonderful! Loved the rooftop and lobby. Had drinks at the downstairs bar Saturday night. Lobby smells amazing and a very fun place to hang out (outside of your room).Rooms: BORDERLINE UNLIVABLE!!! No closet or drawer space to unpack. I understand the unique characteristics of a boutique hotel, but to offer no closet space or drawer is completely unsatisfactory. The A/C is also whack and SO LOUD! If you set it to 70 degrees you would be freezing and at 71 degrees dripping sweat. It would also keep both my Mom and I up all night because when the A/C clicks on it sounds like someone is trying to open the door to your room. Lastly the shower area was poorly designed in that the partial fixed glass door was not wide enough, which allowed water to flood the toilet area every time.I would love if a manager could be in touch with me regarding my feedback.
user_name:
Stephanie F
New York City, New York

review_body: Our first time in New York for my birthday couldn’t of been more special enough! The hotel staff were amazing especially Lyndsay she was so helpful and made our stay as amazing as it could be! We can’t thank her enough! The location was perfect a 2 min walk away from the subway station and only a couple stops from Times Square. Soho is a lovely area with lots to see and do. The hotel itself was so modern and cool! Ignore comments about the rooms being small they are very cosy and our room had an amazing view! Will definitely be booking this hotel again when we return. Holly and Alex x

The Arlo is a “micro” hotel and that is something everyone should know before booking. If you are looking for a trip where you lounge around an expansive space, I would say go elsewhere. BUT if you are coming to New York for a fun weekend and you need a very comfortable, well-designed place to crash at the end of the night this place is PERFECT. It’s New York – if you are spending all your time in your hotel room, you are doing it wrong.Also, size just doesn’t matter when the amenities are as great as Arlo’s. VERY comfy bed. GREAT shower. BIG window. I was on the 7th floor and had awesome views. I love the wood details, the lighting is great. It really has everything you need and I recalled feeling surprised by how much functionality could be crammed into such a small space. It was quite inspiring really.The hotel lobby, staff and roof deck were the icing on the cake (cupcake?)! Disclaimer -- for people who don’t know Manhattan, this really isn’t in Soho. It is in Hudson Square, a nice residential neighborhood near Soho/Soho Adjacent. You can walk to so much great stuff – Soho, West Village, Tribeca very easily. A great run/walk can be had at the Hudson River just a few blocks away. Overall, this is a great place with such a great feeling to it. You won’t regret your stay!

Location was excellent close to Newark airport close to great shopping a short ride away to Manhattan. The rooms are an excellent use of space without compromising comfort! Creative yet comfortable. Great value. Harolds the restaurant on premise is also very very good! Grilled octopus is a must try! Lobby and outdoor seating for dinner is very romantic and relaxing. This hotel is also a great girls getaway place! Well done Arlo

This is a nice hotel in SoHo. It is situated at a 5 to 10 min walk from three mayor subway lines that will bring you uptown as well as downtown. Getting you to Ground Zero and the Ferries to Liberty- and Ellis Island by foot will take you about 30 minutes. The only logistical problem is that the hotel is situated at the entrance of the Holland Tunnel into New Jersey. A very busy point especially during the rush hours. Taking a cab from JFK to the hotel at Friday afternoon ( set price of USD 52,80) took us 2 hrs. Not only because the expressway was very full but also because downtown Manhatten was very full. The hotel is not situated right in the center of SoHo, so you need to to make short walk to the restaurants. We had a nice, clean twin-bedded room with enough space to move around. The beds were good and the room was very quiet. It is very nice to sit on the rooftop bar (if the weather permits), although it is rather expensive . We only found the reception a bit messy. Check-in was at a small table in a limited space just behind the front entrance. As the elevators ware situated on the right hand side, all guest also had to pass through this small sort of a corridor. This caused the messy impression.People at the reception were very friendly and helpful. They arranged for transport back to JFK by an Uber car. More expensive then a yellow cab (USD 79) but also more comfortable.

Me and my wife wanted this time to stay in Soho when in New York. Fund this hotel and took a chance. A chance we did not regrett however it might be a bit to modern for my perfect satisfaction. For instance our room did not have any wardrobe for hanging cloth in so the floor gor overloaded with our stuff. It is ok if you stay one night but not more. Personell very helpful and profesional the only setback here was that we did not get our room when check in at 3 pm but have to wait.

This is not your normal hotel. Its clean nice, but very small with limited services. The staff are very friendly & helpful.There is no room service. But there is a restaurant in the hotel. The rooms are very small in size. but clean.

A fab 4 night stay @ Arlo SoHo - great location, close to metro, walkable distance to the Village and Lower Manhattan. Rooms are great, functional, contemporary design with everything you need at hand. The staff was super friendly and helpful with anything ad hoc - recommend to try the coffee downstairs with the overnight oats :)

Three of us Brits stayed here at the end of September. The customer service we received from the moment we arrived was exceptional. Upon arrival we found ourselves in a situation when the cab driver demanded we handed over $200 for a ride from JFK! The duty manager, (I have forgotten her name now!) C

My daughter and I stayed for 5 nights, loved everything about it. The front desk staff were cheerful and welcoming, the rooms are a bit small but really well laid out with smart use of space and very clean. Every interaction with staff felt friendly with genuine concern that our stay was pleasant. It's like everybody is really happy to work there, but not in an "on something" kind of way! More like a very attentive and this is a great place to work way.I will definitely return to the Arlo, and have recommended it to my friends.

Me and my daughter booked this hotel for 4 nights 12oct till 16th. The room wasn't ready when we got there, the room was too small had to climb over our suitcases, the hot tap wasn't working had to get an engineer up to fix it. No privacy the toilet and shower is in a glass enclosure nearly touching the bed. For the money we paid we could of stopped in a luxury hotel with plenty of room to hang clothes and get ready to go out. it ruined our stay.

Spent 3 days there. Quite a funky feel, staff really helpful. Rooms are small, very clean but really well designed, so do not feel so small. Beds amazing. Located in Soho so some way from Times Square etc, but convenient for Greenwich Village. Great Metro connections to uptown. The staff could not be more helpful. We had a minor problem with the AC. It was fixed in under 30 minutes and we were given breakfast on the house as compensation. Tea in the lobby not so great and pricey, but a deli down the block does great carry out breakfast and drinks. Without any doubt, we would happily stay again. The personal touch from the staff, and their attention to detail makes this s go-back-to hotel.

The Arlo hotel is a unique experience that encourages a communal environment. The rooms have a clean, minimal, sleek, Scandinavian look & feel. While you may lack some features, such as an in-suite coffee maker, you'll find that the building has everything that you need outside of your room - coffee shop, bar, communal workspace, bike rental, and gym.

Very nice hotel , well fursnished, beautiful view of the city , amazing rooftop, very well located in Manhattan to visit all the city.We had a wonderfull stay here!Hope to come back again here one day .I will highly recommend it !

First let me say that we (my "tween" son and I on a fun NYC weekend) somehow ended up with the biggest room in the hotel - a corner room (with a corner terrace) on the 9th floor. SO, nothing about this room was small, the bathroom was completely private and separate from the rest of the room and the terrace wrapped around the room. Not sure how this happened - but we were thrilled. When we arrived at midnight, staff were super friendly, we grabbed a bite from the 24 hour bodega and went to sleep (after oohing and aahing at the view of World Trade and the Hudson). We found the room to be large, clean and comfortable. Bath products are luxurious. Friday night we stopped in for the complementary wine tasting (my son had water) and the staff person was super sweet and kindly explained everything about the wines.On our last day, we were held up at an event and I called front desk staff. She graciously allowed us a later check out, no questions asked. Loved her! Wish I could remember her name. Pluses - best location EVER. We could walk to great restaurants (Black Tap for my son, Bubby's for brunch, La Colombe for morning coffee), museums, shopping (even gourmet groceries) and subway. Staff was always helpful and though some other hotel guests looked a bit hipstery, everyone was super nice to this 40-something and a kid from the midwest.The rooms are super soundproofed - we heard a voice in the hallway but once they went into their room, we heard nothing. The cocktails are AMAZING. My friend and I grabbed a cocktail from the 1st floor bar and enjoyed them on my terrace - perfection.Elevators/lifts were always available. I mention this because it's a hotel pet-peeve for me - when there are no elevators or you're packed into the one working elevator.Drawback - we didn't mind this but there was a TON of noise coming from the Holland Tunnel traffic. Apparently honking gets you through the tunnel faster. But like I said, in a Soho hotel we weren't surprised by this and even left our terrace door open whenever we were in the room.Price wasn't cheap but only a bit more than a standard midtown hotel. TOTALLY worth it.Bottom line - we'd stay here again!!

Just returned from New York stayed at the arlo soho 3 night then a week cruise I have to say I don't know what people see in New york apart from the obvious trade centre ,top of the rock .cruise up the river, big bus tour . Can't do with the really fast noisy way of life you take your life in your hand just crossing the road way to fast for me but the hotel was really good very small rooms but really nice but also very expensive good atmosphere nice bar area and sweet shop inside reception had a sandwich from the all night cafe inside reception $18 wasn't nice also no tea making facility in room which we could have done with you would think they would have with the price of the hotel we went to Pret A Manger just up the road there is also a Starbucks and an alight supermarket near by so all is not lost linda

I'm listing the good points first1. Clean2. Reasonable location to Subway3. Staff professional 4. Excellent communal spaces and recharge stations.If you are a millennial travelling alone with a change of underwear and a laptop this might be an ok place to stay.If you are travelling with someone you require NO privacy from including your ablutions it may also be fine. There is a glass wall between the beds and the toilet.The twin rooms are tiny without even space for 2 suitcases and after booking online in $AUD we were slugged with a $US bill. Really? We could have stayed in a luxury hotel for less than it cost us here!Booked a 'car' to take us to Newark airport @ 6 in the morning - told it would take an hour ( took 25mins) and would cost &90 and cheaper than yellow cab ( cost $118)Would not recommend this place to anyone. Feel entirely ripped off and disappointed.Best thing about this place is whoever does their advertising!

Beware not all the rooms in this hotel are free cancellation. As I learned to my cost.I had to cancell my booking, I thought it was free cancellation having booked on Booking.com BUT it was not. I did get some money back but not all.Be aware.

We loved our stay at the Arlo Soho, The reception is great, super friendly and helpful. The design and concept of the hotel is amazing! At the entry you have a delicious coffee to grab and Go, and also LOTS of places to stay at the entry. Almost like a Co-working space, meets coffee place in San Francisco. Loved the environment, and at the rooftop I did classes of Yoga which was amazing to begin the day, also a happy hour with my husband at Thursday night. The room is really, really small, however it is super cozy, clean and for resting it was perfect. We had a problem with our TV and the hotel was super supportive trying to fix it, when it didn't fix they gave us 50% discount on the stay! Will always recommend. Ah, by the way, YOU HAVE TO TRY the hot dogs at the restaurant below, Harolds! Amazing! Walking distant from Tribeca, Soho, Noho and Hudson River Park!

This is a fantastic hotel away from the hustle and bustle of main tourist spots. We stayed for 4 nights. It’s very well decorated through out and very modern. There’s an on-site bodega where you can pick up drinks and snacks, the courtyard area is great to sit in or have food from Harold’s. There is also a rooftop bar which is fab. The hotel also has bikes that guests can use for free. When we checked in the receptionist was really friendly, our room wasn’t ready so we went and sat in the courtyard until it was. Room was great, we had a corner room on the 2nd floor so it was bigger than we were initially expecting. Everything is in one room. The shower and toilet are enclosed by frosted glass and the shower is amazing! I could have stayed in it for ages! The bed was really comfy too. There’s complimentary shower gel, shampoo and conditioner in the shower cubicle, a hair dryer, steamer, an umbrella and a safe in the room. Luggage can easily be stored under the bed out of the way. The room was immaculate and housekeeping did a great job each day. If you want to stock up on some things for the room there’s a deli very close to the hotel, just got out the main door and turn left and it’s on the corner. Hotel is situated within walking distance to Greenwich villas and the east village and about a 30 minute walk from battery park. There’s subway stations close by as well. Really enjoyed our stay here, the hotel was fantastic, staff were friendly and chatty and I just loved the vibe of the place. I’d definitely stay here again if I were to visit the city in the future.

We stayed here for three nights in September/ October. The room was TINY but trendy. You would want to be on very intimate terms with your roommate as the bathroom is basically in the hotel room- 2 glass walls with a sliding door that has gaps large enough to pass a book through. Having said that, the bed was very comfortable, the decor was lovely and the toiletries provided were great. We had the breakfast buffet included in our rate at Harold's Meat & Three and it was delicious- really set us up for the day's exploring. The rooftop bar was pretty as was the courtyard bar. The common areas are beautiful, full of mid century style furniture. With this hotel, you are basically buying into a full on "hipster" experience. I'd sign up for that again in a heartbeat!

This trendy and relatively new hotel is located in one of the nicest area's of Manhattan. There are many cafe's and restaurants within walking distance, as are the shops and boutiques around the (West) Broadway area (5-15 mins walk). If you do not prefer walking, the hotel offers free bicycle rental as well. Also, the subway (Canal st) to take you uptown or downtown is around the corner. The rooms are tidy and clean, perhaps not huge, but that is not something to expect in NYC. The rooftop bar is really nice and with the nice weather we had during our stay, it really added value to this hotel.We found the music blasting out of the nearby Dog Pound gym quite loud, so if you are sensitive to noise I would recommend to book one of the courtyard rooms. We had a couple of issues with a cold shower and not working air conditioning. It was a little bit annoying at first, but I must say the staff did solve it immediately. In general, the staff is very friendly and really swift in answering questions or helping out with any issue whatsoever. We would stay here again.

Just returned to London after 3 day weekend in New York. The Arlo meet all my expectations - great style modern and fantastic staff. Soho is a great neighbourhood for great restaurants and shopping.Oh and the smell all around hotel please what is the scent - beautifulWill definitely be returning when next NYThanks for a great stay

I stayed at the Arlo in Soho last week and received a very good service. I ran into a small problem after my departure and Amil was extremely nice and efficient; he took care of the problem and it was resolved very quickly! Thank you Amil for the wonderful service. I will return.....

TL;DR: if expensively quirky isn't your thing, stay in a normal hotel.The staff were friendly. The beds are comfy and there's something reminiscent of building pillow forts as a kid about climbing into a king-size cubby to sleep. The motorized blinds were a neat touch and kept out the light until the sun came up. The rain shower was a good shower. Those are the positives.The design of the bathrooms is one of my biggest gripes. I don't really have a problem with the concept of the frosted glass, it's cool. What's not cool is the 2-inch gap around the glass-panel barn door and no exhaust fan when you need to...take your time but you're not the only one in the room. Makes for unpleasantness. The other gripe with the bathroom is the toilet paper. At $200+ per night, they should be providing something closer to AngelSoft or Charmin. This is some 1-ply nonsense. Maybe they can claim it's 2-ply but those 2 sheets are tissue paper thin and soft is not a word I'd use to describe it. The mini-fridge is the tiniest I've seen. Makes a college dorm fridge look absolutely spacious and it only kept things cool, not cold. They say, "Our ... boutique hotels provide 4-star accommodations without the fuss." The problem with that is 'the fuss' is what makes the accommodations 4-star.The whole room (including the bathroom) is 150 square feet. They call it a "micro guest room" which is accurate. Cleverly cramped.I've updated their description (in parentheses) of the City King Room for them: An alcove (wall-to-wall, because the room is as wide as the bed is long) king bed, pegboard closet (wall to hang things on) and convertible flip-down desk (that converts to not-a-desk, that's all, it's a desk or it's not) populate the space while the sizable windows (are normal size but in a tiny room feel bigger) overlook the breathtaking city landscape (traffic on Canal Street honking/waiting to get into the Holland Tunnel). Touches of considered design can be found throughout (the 150 sq ft expanse) including solid walnut furniture, glass-enclosed rain showers (there's only one) and handmade porcelain tiles (your feet won't know the difference). Easy-access technology like electronically-controlled lighting (it's 2017, all lighting is electronically-controlled, they're called light switches), bluetooth radio and bedside USB charging stations (like any other 3-star or better hotel in 2017) are also features.For my money, I'd just as soon stay in a more traditional hotel. This felt more like a very expensive hostel without the dorm-style rooms. It was a unique experience for sure but I wouldn't do it again.

This was my first visit, and my high expectations were exceeded! From checkin to check out, everything was great. The rooms are compact but have everything you would need. The public rooms are amazing--great for working, meet-ups, or drinks. The restaurant, Harold's is too pricey for its value--a mini-cheeseburger is $25, but otherwise, a great hotel

Tiny, tiny rooms and wildly expensive. Hated the ultra modern styling of the bathroom and shower with just a frosted panel to retain your modesty. No complaints about the cleanliness of the room or about the helpfulness of the staff but I wouldn't dream of staying here again.

Stayed for 3 nights from 29 Aug - 01 Sept. First impressions were great. The location in Soho on Hudson St is a perfect jumping off point to explore all areas of Manhattan even by foot. Also lots of excellent F&B options in the area. Warm welcome at reception with clear explanation of the facilities and activities. Every day there is a range of things to do in the hotel from rooftop yoga and surf fit to wine tasting. The rooftop itself is fantastic with views across the water and a nice bar for sundowners. On the ground level there is a grab and go snack bar plus restaurant which we didn't try. Plenty of communal space too. As for the rooms well you expect small in New York and they are but the good news in the case of the Arlo is how well they are designed to maximize the space. Hidden storage USB sockets and even a huge bed make it in. Overall we were very impressed with the value. You can easily spend as much for a much less impressive stay. Will be back

I was greeted at my cab by who I later found out was the Assistant Front Office Manager. He greeted me with a smile on his face, helped me inside to check-in. Did I mention it was 9am and they had a room ready for me? I was only expecting to store my bag until check-in, but was super impressed that my room was ready. The good news: the room was clean. But, super small. I did not mind - I was traveling alone. The view was amazing (even better from the roof top bar!) the hotel space overall was impressive, lots of seating areas, desks and very chic places to hang out. The Wi-Fi was great and everyone that worked at the hotel was helpful and friendly. I will be back again!

The interior, the staff, the rooftop bar, activities - everything was excellent. Our queen room with city views was nicely decorated, and waking up to views of the city every morning was really a great touch to our whole New York experience. There are great restaurants and bars in the area, we walked and biked almost everywhere. We would stay here again on our next visit, and highly recommend this hotel to other travelers.

Really stunning, chic and relaxed hotel in Soho, NYC for business & leisure. Friendly staff, good food and modern atmosphere. Lots of meeting and reading spaces with wonderful courtyard to enjoy your glass of Chenin Blanc.

We had an amazing experience at Arlo Soho. From check-in to checkout, service was fast, no lineups, the staff was attentive. I remember requesting additional towels and toiletries and the items were in room before I even got back, I was completely impressed. The hotel is modern and hip. The message board is a really nice touch, it allows tourists to share their experiences about restaurants or sites visited etc. A great place to look for NYC recommendations. The hotel is so comfortable with many spacious lounging areas. Although, they do not have a gym, they offered pilates, yoga etc on the roof. In the evening, the rooftop bar is a great place to hang out and meet people. Overall, our experience at Arlo was wonderful. The room itself was bright, modern, clean and had everything we needed even a steamer. I loved this hotel and would stay here again.

Everything was perfect, from the staff to the room. Will be back anytime I am in NY! Just a great experience and also great price rather than the other expensive NYC hotels. Our favorite parts were the rooftop bar and the awesome shower!

I booked the Arlo Soho for my recent business trip to NYC. I had read the reviews and had checked the rates, and decided that even though Hudson Street was a little out of the way for my meetings, I would book. I am SO GLAD I did! The staff at this hotel are absolutely amazing. So friendly, so helpful, and seriously welcoming. The lobby and spaces for working, sitting and reading or doing email -- all are so unusual in NYC. This is made for the modern traveler. Loved my room, as well. Okay, not large. Who cares? The bed was beyond fab, the flat screen TV was positioned perfectly, and, absolutely vital, there was a seriously high number of outlets so I could charge all of my devices without having to be strategic :) Really nice bar, excellent breakfast and -- key here -- some healthy and yummy snacks for sale, plus access to a gym, bikes, etc. Love the Arlo Soho and recommend it VERY HIGHLY!

Arlo Soho and Arlo Nomad have become my hotel of choice on my visits to NYC, whether business or pleasure. I've stayed in each at least twice. The rooms are small but cleverly designed, they have everything you need and a great view. The public areas are spacious with desks and quiet places to work, there are great bars and restaurants for hanging out and socialising.

The staff and amenities exceed expectation. In a busy city, it is hard to find a great space with the perfect environment for work and leisure. Dan greeted me with a smile and continued to offer solutions - bag storage (I arrived prior to check-in) and taxis for my return trip to the airport.

I have stayed here twice this year, both times for work travel, and I have been delighted both times. From the minute I arrive I feel taken care of. The reception desk is upbeat and very professional. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the "extras," like the rooftop bar, attached restaurant and gift shop all serve to engage and excite visitors. I look forward to my next visit, expecting it to be lovely.I am a transplanted New Yorker and Arlo Soho feels like my (2nd) home away from home - after mom's place. Thanks for your warm and chic hospitality!

I stayed at the Arlo for the first time last week and I'll definitely be going back! I loved the quirky personality and vibe of the hotel. The staff was super friendly and helpful too. The rooms are tiny, but smarty designed. I really enjoyed my stay.

I have stayed at this hotel a number of times in last 6 months. I keep going back as the service is great, the atmosphere in the hotel is relaxed and friendly, there are great working areas where I can meet with colleagues and the compact rooms are cleverly designed, comfortable and functional. Having stayed a few times in the hotel, I have got to know some of the staff; Lindsey has been particularly helpful with bookings for myself and some of my colleagues.The hotel location is good. It is within walking distance of some of the more fashionable areas of NYC and the subway station is a short walk away so getting around is easy. If you want to get out of the hotel in the evenings, a short walk into Soho or Tribeca means you are near good restaurants and bars. If you enjoy exercise, the Hudson River park is just moments away and the hotel has an arrangement with a gym.I will keep going back when on business in NY which says a lot!

Last week we had to escape hurricane Irma and travel to New York. We got a couple rooms at the Arlo Soho and it was fantastic. With 3 young kids it's usually tough but there are so many activities in the hotel that they were always kept busy. The front desk people were incredibly accommodating. All around an amazing experience which allowed us to relax from all the stress of the situation back home in Florida.
user_name:
arturfruman
New York City, New York

review_body: Perfectly situated between TriBeCa, Greenwich Village and SoHo, Arlo is a stylish boutique hotel with wonderfully designed albeit small rooms. I loved the vibe of hotel's public spaces: mainly the chilled lobby (they even offer jigsaw puzzles) and the hip roof (where you can sign up for morning yoga).The staff is super friendly and approachable. All in all, one of the best hotel experiences I had!

I had an amazing experience staying in this hotel for a week during vacation with my girlfriend. Front desk is very hospitable and friendly, I was greeted with joyful energy. Style and decoration are on point, I enjoyed a lot. Location is a plus, a few minutes’ walk you are near cool SoHo stores or pleasant Greenwich Village, it is also near train stations.Staff is helpful, I had an issue with my AC and they were fast at fixing it. Rooms were clean and agreeable, yes they are small however it is advertised like that, there should be no surprises. So if you have a lot of luggage (3-4 big bags) it could be an issue, it sure wasn’t for me.There is exciting rooftop where you can go for drinks. I had breakfast at the restaurant and it was very good. I loved the hotel vibe, cleanliness, decoration and comfort. The only Cons I would add is I thought food was a bit pricey but that’s all.

Came here for a 3-day weekend trip, unfortunately the rooms were so small you could not store your clothes or luggage anywhere. I was not able to hang up dresses due to the closet (equipped with only 4 hangers) being too small in length. There is one small drawer for storage, which is filled with a safe that is about half its size. DO NOT believe that the pictures posted on the website accurately portray the rooms. They are extremely claustrophobic and, having a Queen Terrace City View room, the terrace is tiny as well. As for the service, the staff working seem way too casual and unhelpful to work in a hotel. After complaining about the room size and asking for another room, we were rudely informed that there are no bigger rooms and that's how the hotel is. The shower curtain was an absolute mess, just a piece of plastic that you have to hang up yourself. We asked for the hotel to come up with a solution for the curtain and they gave us the answer that they'll just give us more towels to clean up the water after we showered. Just now, we came back to our room just to see that the cleaning service has not been there yet, but the extra towels were carelessly put on our bed. When calling to ask why the room wasn't cleaned, a staff member rudely asked if we had the "Privacy Please" sign on the door. This was our first day at this hotel, we will see how much more troubled this hotel will prove to be.

Stayed here for two nights September 27-29. I could see my neighbor when he was sleeping so I closed the window. Chose this hotel due to the location. Boutique hotel but the front desk manager was very hospitable and friendly. The water was not working so I hoped that there was a notice. I had three big luggages and it was very difficult to fit in the room. Rooms were very clean, small and bed was spacious. Breakfast was very good and the interior design was very beautiful. The hotel lobby was more of a meeting place, it also has a convenient store that serves great coffee.

I believe that you can book much better hotel in the same price. The location is excellent though and the overall outlook is modern. The roof top is beautiful and attract many youngsters. They also do some weekly shows in which many people from outside come as spectators/ listeners. This actually mean the discomfort for the people staying in the hotel. I also have been told that many time people become badly drunk which turns the atmosphere into a night club rather then a hotel. The room was small, the bathroom was tiny with no wash basin inside. You actually need to come out from the bathroom to wash your hands. I am disappointed. Surely not for the people on business stay. Also no swimming pool, gym, spa or suana.

The hotel was by no means bad, but just a little too "boutique" for me, esp. since I was there on business.I knew I was getting a small room, it being in NYC, but I even had a hard time spreading open my bag on the floor. The study table was right beside the sink and I was always afraid of soiling my documents and computer. Not having some amenities like a water heater or microwave was also unfortunate.Not much was around the area, but a subway station (Canal) on a convenient line is only around 5 minutes away.The PROs include awesome lounge areas just behind reception, good restaurant, and great rooftop bar. The staff were very accommodating and friendly as they quickly changed my room when I said that I couldn't sleep from the noise coming from the rooftop bar when they were cleaning up.

Great Hotel, compact rooms, lovely ground floor set up that is so relaxing. We had brunch in restaurant on arrival day which we thoroughly enjoyed. Location is perfect. We liked the hotel design but what makes a great hotel is great staff and they have it in abundance. We were at the Plaza Hotel, Westin Manhattan and Marriott Marquis TimesSquare for meal and drinks but they were not a patch on the Arlo Team ! Also we likedthe other guests we met at Arlo who were most pleasant and friendly. Look forward to our return trip to the Arlo and NY.

While a hotel, felt like a local part of the community. Really liked the hotel and the surrounding area. The lobby and outdoor area are awesome and the value is really good. The Greek restaurant on Greenwich right nearby is great.

The most amazing hotel hands down in NYC is the ARLO soho , in my opinion nothing compares , from the design , the amenities , the staff and all the beautiful people I've meet in and at the property this is my one and only destination for a truly luxe experience in NY , I've booked there for 12 weeks in a row and each time I stay I fall in love that much more ,All the staff are always above and beyond in everything they do , talk about device with a smile sometimes u have to wonder what's gotten into these guys there so friendly Lol. Abby and Lindsay are the best,along with Michael Webster and Emil in management , you guys have made my stays there such a treat and I thank you for all the love you show , be blessed Arlo team til next time

A bit different from our usual midtown hotel, we were keen to try something a bit different. We did end up spending quite a bit on taxis to get around as it's not really near anywhere. Rooms really are a bit on the micro side. But it's comfortable and does the job. Bathrooms - well you need to be on good terms with whoever your sharing with, not much privacy with a glass sliding door. $20 for a glass of wine, from the bar which wanted to have in our room so we're given Plastic glasses..... Really! I thought that was a bit pricy and the plastic really not necessary. The restaurant recommendations were poor and by their own admission they hadn't tried them, so this advisory bit needs some urgent attention, especially as you are going to do some serious walking to get any where.

When I first walked in the room I was extremely disappointed with the space (had two single beds and a terrace) as I felt it looked misleadingly larger on the website. Also the decor of the rooms and corridors on the floors were not in keeping with the ultra chic lounge/bar area. However, once everything was tidied away (the room is suitable for very tidy/minimal travellers!!) the space was actually workable/functional, and the area downstairs and rooftop bar were very comfortable to relax in. The staff were always attentive and helpful and the area great - quieter than usual Manhattan (in a good way).

this new trend in micro hotel was an amazing experience. The staff was very dynamic, super friendly. The hotel decor is warm. the hotel offers a lot of nicely positions spaces to read and hang out. it has plenty of power outlets, the music is nice as well. For a SoHo location this is ideal. the rooms are small, nonetheless we found it adequate. The rooftop was incredible.

4 day stay with my husband. Hotel has a lovely feel from the moment you enter - hip, quirky, suits its Soho location perfectly. We stayed in a Queen with outdoor terrace which was great - having the outdoor space and shower felt really indulgent. The accommodation is small, as expected, but there was sufficient storage for the 2 of us. No views from our room but the rooftop bar compensates for that and has a great vibe. Communal spaces also great.Location is arguably the hotel's best feature: walking distance to Soho, Chinatown, Little Italy, Chelsea, Highline etc. We really felt we could experience NYC as locals, not just tourists.Definitely recommended!

Efficient service, nicely furnished. Rooms are fairly small but as expected in most NYC hotels. We had one of the rooms with a big terrace (actually bigger than the room) that was really nice.Two smaller weak points: Low preassure in the shower and the AC was a bit noisy and quite inconsistent in kepping the temperature in the room. $17 bus o/w to/from Newark Airport right across the street which was very convenient.

I have just returned from a three night stay at the Arlo SoHo with my two teenage children - we were all very happy. Having stayed around Central Park on several occasions it was time for something new and something a bit different. Arlo is a charming hotel full of trendy and cool people, but also travelers like us, plus some families and other foreigners. However, the rooms are tiny - but who wants to spend lots of time in a hotel room when you are in New York? My room had a bed right against the window, in an alcove which made it rather cozy and at the same time, rather cool to feel like you are almost falling out of bed directly into the buzz of SoHo.The staff were helpful, the location was excellent and we were extremely satisfied with our decision to stay in Soho - much closer to the quirky and more authentic side of NYC.We look forward to returning Arlo SoHo.

Our stay at Arlo SoHo couldn't have been more perfect. The hotel made our experience perfect by ticking all the boxes for what you would expect out of a hotel. From the moment we were greeted by Lindsey at front desk with "welcome to your new home!" Our appreciation for Arlo's customer service continually surpassed our expectations, with Lindsey especially going above and beyond. The location is perfect for those that want to be close enough to nightlife and all that matters but not be affected by the busyness of a 24hour city. Their rooftop bar has the perfect balance between relaxing vibe and lively unique spot, with the bar manager also going above and beyond in his role. If budget allows I definitely recommend a terrace room. Room 904 has an amazing view. All rooms are compact but perfectly styled making great use of small space. I would not be staying anywhere else when we return to New York City.

This is a very fast paced hotel: fast check-in, lots of guests come and go and from what I see they are mostly business customers as the lounge is always full of people typing on their laptops. The deco is very nice. Room is a bit small but well equipped and functional - I was actually surprised to see how well the hotel is in terms of maximizing the usage of space. Roof top bar is nice, but it can get privatized by non-guests so the hotel guests don't really get to enjoy it.Overall, a very nice and ''functional'' hotel as in, you don't get to enjoy extra facilities: there is no gym, no pool, etc. But it might be too much to ask for a hotel in Soho.

Stayed here for 5 nights in August having booked via British Airways website. Lovely modern hotel very welcoming staff. The rooms are small but designed really well to make use of all the available space. It is located in Soho near the entrance to the Holland Tunnel. I would recommend and would return to the hotel.

I stay at this hotel regularly when in NY on business and couldn't be happier. The rooms are small, as others have noted, but they are perfectly appointed for my needs and they use the space very efficiently. There are many common areas for impromptu meetings and quiet work time. The location is close to both business and nightlife options, and the rooftop bar is a great place to unwind at the end of the day. To top it off, the place is a great value in that part of the city.

We had a great time at Arlo Soho. I had emailed hotel prior to our trip and front desk manager Michael Webster was quick to respond and also advised that he would be working the morning we were arriving. Rooms are small but cool modern and functional. We had a king bed w courtyard view. Room was also quiet for sleeping at night. All hotel staff were friendly and professional. Rooftop bar was nice for aCocktail and the view at night. Location was walking distance to Little Italy etc. A great place for a few days in Soho.

Stayed here for my first night in NYC in order to rest and get over jet lag in maximum comfort. The room was very stylish and perfect for a solo traveler, but if my (very tall) husband had joined me, it would've felt cramped. I loved the scent of the bath products, the blackout curtains, and the built in USB plugs in the bed frame. Having a bodega/coffee shop in house was a big relief - sipping an iced coffee while heading up to my room after check in was a god send. And breakfast was delicious, especially the oatmeal! There was a great spread of mostly healthy options.Staff were extremely friendly, from front desk to the barista to the restaurant server. The hotel is a 5-10 min walk from the subway. Also a 10 min walk away from the Dominique Ansel Bakery, if you want to see what all the fuss over cronuts is about (too sweet for my taste).BTW: I had originally booked through Booking.com, but when I checked the rates directly through the hotel's website, they priced the rooms similarly AND included breakfast.

Really impressed with this super cool, laid back hotel. Micro rooms which were actually pretty comfortable and just the right amount of space that you need as you are not in the city to stay in your room all day. Great natural light and comfortable bed. Really laid back and inviting common areas which are great for getting some work done and socializing. Friendly and welcoming staff that were very helpful and loved the mini market in the lobby to pick up some snack essentials. Cool vibe on the rooftop that seemed to really pick up in the evenings and a great place to catch the sunset. AWESOME location in a super quit part of Soho. I strongly recommend Arlo SoHo.
