This is a great hotel. Clean, modern, and chic! Even though the room is tiny tiny tiny, it's one of the nicest I've stayed in New York! I say that because it's convenient with everything you need it. They even provide you with an umbrella for rainy days! Roof top is a lot of fun to hang out with friends. Staff throughout the hotel were extremely friendly and front desk were eager to help customers in any way. Coffee shop in lobby was excellent. I didn't want to leave the hotel and will certainly return if I'm ever back in New York.

My time spent at Arlo went really well. Friendly staff; clean & cute room; comfy bed; everything worked, from the steamer to blow dryer; very welcoming atmosphere and lovey aesthetic. Keep it up you guys at Arlo Soho!!

We stayed for a few days as part of a holiday and did not disappoint. Firstly the rooms were functional and with a very comfortable bed and a great shower. The price reflects the small space but that did not matter as we only spent time in the room for to sleep shower etc.What made the place great was the ample common areas including on the first two levels , the top floor and roof terrace. It was inviting, tons of natural light light and plenty of space to both relax and work .The hotel restaurant was good with a great wine selection The bar was lively. The deli was over priced. What made the place stand apart was how the management responded to some minor niggles . It was prompt , responsive and effective .

I was in an Uber to DC airport with my mum when we got some pretty terrible news. So terrible we almost stopped our holiday there and then to fly 6000+ miles to get home. That was not feasible or sensible. Our booking was non refundable but when i called them 4pm day we were checking in they cancelled the room that wasn't not yet charged on my credit card, saving us close to $2k - i was frantic on the phone but i didn't tell them what was going on. I did effectively arrive at the hotel grieving a loss. I was alone but felt surrounded by friends. Hats off to the majority of staff. I was surprised at the size of the room when i arrived but the terrace was LOVELY. I enjoyed the outdoor space which was larger than the room. I definitely needed it for 5 days. Which became 6 days when we had flight issues and delays. The room is well designed and utilises every inch. I had a piece of luggage delivered before i arrived so had to keep that in storage otherwise can't move in the room. The lobby is beautiful, spacious, lots of electric outlets etc. The reception staff...90% are super sweet and helpful...10% are disinterested but that was fine by me. Special shout to Lindsey who was so sweet and chatty, and even got me an invoice for our JFK taxi transfer via email mere hours after i asked. She helped us load our luggage - she's an asset to this hotel. I can see other colleagues doing the same to other clients too. That's why i'd say 90% of the staff are brill. The toilet in the terrace room is separate (not a glass box within the room as previously described). I found the location more than ideal, 50 m walk from 24 hour convenience shop. 5 min walk to all the action in SoHo, Greenwich village, 10-15 min walk to Chelsea / meat packing. I would say noise levels are not great in the hotel you can definitely hear cars. I still slept well the bed is great. We had a problem flying out so i called them from the airport after we checked out, they price matched an online deal we found and included breakfast. This really helped, having someone reliable to count on after an airline left us in JFK for 7 hours waiting....all in all i would 100% consider staying again. I would only go for terrace room as without the outdoor space, the room is too cramped for more than a couple of nights. I did bang my knee multiple times on the bed frame. I am super clumsy though :) Thanks Arlo...maybe see u again. Oh and finally, how about some free filter coffee? My gosh $4 a cup is a wee bit steep even for NY!!!

If you come to NYC, don't forget to check hotel room sizes. Don't find out AFTER the fact and then complain! This hotel is great! It's minimalist and rooms are small which I love. It's perfect area as I love to run in battery park along bike path. You can walk everywhere in Manhattan if you are fit and able. The rooftop bar is cool, there is a small cafe downstairs (expresso, granola, boiled eggs, chia seed yogurt cups, fruit), and outdoor and indoor spaces to work, relax or read. There is also a restaurant which I didn't eat at. Bed is comfortable and I recommend courtyard view room.

Great location, super friendly staff, lovely view, awesome design, and very affordable. My boyfriend and I were having a little staycation before I started my new job and we had an amazing time. The rooms are a bit small, but that's pretty common in New York. And they do a great job managing the smaller space. I loved our room. And the bed was super comfy. Great pillows. I would definitely recommend this hotel...

Entrance smells nice all day long. In lobby and second floor they have a lot of place for study/work. The room i stayed was small, with tiny glass bathroom and the sink in the bedroom.Breakfast was nice.

We spent 5 nights at Arlo Soho, in the king room, facing out onto Canal Street. First important thing to know, the room is small. Very small. Its adequately furnished and clean and they make good use of the tiny space with clever design/layout. The photos make it look not too bad but it is smaller than all the small european hotels we've stayed in, and that's saying something!Second important thing to know is that the bathroom (shower and toilet) is IN the room, behind a glass 'room' door which has a large open gap (it doesn't fully close or seal) which means it is not soundproof (or smellproof!) If one of you is in bed, the other is basically on the toilet by your head. And you can see the person through the blurred glass. It's a bit awkward to say the least. I read the reviews where people mentioned this fact, and I laughed because my partner and I have been together a long time and not much is private anymore, so I thought ah we'll be fine! But this was actually bad. Comically so. Our room was noisy, as the hotel is so close to the busy Holland Tunnel so cars honking, trucks etc.... but its NYC... so its to be expected!The good news is the Arlo lobby area is beautiful, lots of seating and chill out space so if you need to escape your cramped room, you can. The staff were great, very friendly and helpful.The rooftop bar, while expensive, is worth a visit. The 24 hour bodega in the lobby sells nice snacks water coffee etc but note; there is a convenience store 50m down the road with water a third of the price and much cheaper snacks. The location was ok, but a bit of a walk to the main hubs which wasn't ideal. We wouldn't stay here again, as the room was just not an experience we'd like to repeat. We moved over to the lower east side and we had a large room with incredible views (for any first time visitor to NYC I'd recommend staying in that area) BUT I would visit the Arlo rooftop and downstairs / outdoor bar again as it was really nice!

Firstly let me say that the location of the hotel is brilliant. The room was small but perfectly formed, and I would have been very happy had it not been for the awful air con.It was absolutely boiling hot in New York in June, and the air con in the small room was blasting out warm air. We told the front desk twice and nothing happened. The third time they sent an engineer who managed to get it to stop blasting out hot air for a while, but couldn't get it to cool, so we had one almost comfortable night. He came back and managed to get it to cool but only if you got up and pressed a button (it then stopped 5/10 mins later). So when it was unbearable in the middle of the night, this was all we could do. The engineer said that they had problems with the air con in many of the rooms. The whole experience of having to awkwardly sit in a tiny room while some guy stands there trying to fix the air con was also a bit depressing.I was 6 months pregnant, so things were pretty uncomfortable as it is, but the lack of concern from the staff was pretty shocking. They paid lip service to the issue "Oh, I'm so sorry to hear that, that must be very difficult" but didn't actually really do anything. On check out, I expressed concern that they were going to put someone else in the room, and the girl apologised - each time it was as though they had not heard of this matter despite it being ongoing all week - and offered us a free coffee (which turned out to be filter from the lobby). They also wrote off an order of chips to the room.Says it all really.We also used their airport taxi company which was a disaster. I wish we had just used Uber as originally planned. The guy not only couldn't follow sat nav (he kept turning between the bridges) but also was on the phone the whole time and I did not feel safe in the car at all.

We stayed at Arlo Soho at the end of May to celebrate my 30th birthday. My friend who lives in NYC snuck in ahead thanks to staff and left us some treats in the room which was a lovely surprise to be welcomed with. The hotel is great, very modern and spotlessly clean. The communal areas are lovely, very relaxing and plenty of space to work or read. We also had a quick lunch in the adjacent restaurant when we arrived and were waiting for our room - it was delicious!Staff are friendly but not overbearing and more than happy to help with recommendations.In terms of the rooms, they are tiny but have everything you need and are well thought out in terms of storage etc. The beds are really comfortable and its fun having the big windows with city views. Location of the Arlo is absolutely perfect - we walked everywhere! Soho shops and restaurants are a stones throw but you can also get to Greenwich, East Village and Tribeca easily. We walked all over the city from the hotel including along the high line, up to and around the park and even over to Brooklyn and Williamsburg. I honestly think its such a good central spot to be based in.My boyfriend actually popped the question in our teeny tiny room (which was hilarious - he just about managed to get down on one knee in there!) so Arlo will now always hold an extra special place in our memories. We can't wait to get back again soon.

Can't beat the location - walking through Soho, West Village / Nolita is around the corner (they're the best spots in NYC)Small room which is expected (you're never in it) but the bed is super comfy. Will be back for sure and the staff are excellent too. The Arlo also has a bunch of bikes which you can use, free for a day.

Visiting NYC in August, the streets were full of tourists and locals so it was great to have the calm of the Arlo Soho ground floor livingroom to spend time in - enjoying a morning coffee or for a drink between sightseeing and dinner.The rooms are not big but if you are two persons, make sure to request a queen bedded room to give you walk around access to the bed.Location is perfect with Soho and a subway stop 2 blocks away.The women at front desk offered a warm and efficient welcome, while some of the afternoon staff could offer a bit better service attitude.

Great hotel. Luxurious, hip feel. Lots going on. Roof-top bar with great views. Fun location. Beds are super comfortable and rooms are spotlessly clean. (Rooms are a bit small if you have lots of luggage, but other than that, you walk in and get a cool vibe. 1 block from subway.

Excellent location in Soho walking distance from shops, restaurants and 911 memorial. The staff was friendly, rooms were very clean but quite small with no closets but very modern and nicely appointed. Breakfast was excellent and hotel amenities as well. Excellent service and attention to detail.

So decided to change my hotel this visit and decided to give this a go. They don't make a secret that rooms are small - and they are. It was fine for me as a solo traveller but a couple might struggle for room. Comfy bed , nice furnishings, good power from the shower - but very limited space/hangers for clothes. Housekeeping not the greatest - missed doing room twice over 8 nights - and not thorough when they did . Food cellar and bar downstairs quite expensive though free chilled water a nice touch . Nice rooftop bar and downstairs courtyard. Overall a pretty good experience

Cute little trendy place. Great Hotel with lovely staff! Stayed here for 4 nights as a surprise trip and loved the cute room. The several floors to lounge on made a great place to wait before we departed. The staff in the cafe area in the front were nice and even remembered our name!

The hotel is on the perfect location if you want to move to Tribeca, do some fancy shopping on Soho, visit little Italy, or even take a subway to downtown!.The rooms are really small but comfy, clean, and with an amazing design. The rooftop is really pretty to take a drink or just a nice picture. I was in NY and I tried to spend a lot of time on the common areas of the hotel because the design is so pretty. And an amazing view because the bed are just beside the window! the top New York experience!.The cafeteria is a expensive, I don't know why.. but the cocktail drinks and the price of the bedroom was ok. The people in there was always kind, the check in and check out really fast.Master tip for tourist::: Be sure to book a bike, they are free! and I literally visit little Italy all the river, wall street, and the best part of my trip the Brooklyn Bridge on BIKE!, and of course Brooklyn and dumbo park. Just put a water on the basket and ride!.,
user_name:
Ana P
Saltillo, Coahuila de Zaragoza, Mexico

review_body: Excellent location. Hotel has pleasant atmosphere and comfortable, efficient rooms. Plenty of nicely-designed common spaces on the first floor to talk, work, or relax. Staff was friendly and accommodating.

This was our second stay at the Arlo...the first was within weeks of their opening and they had some kinks to work out. Well, they did. Pristine rooms, well appointed and small (what you would expect for NYC). This time we enjoyed their breakfast service, too. Excellent. Everyone was great at the hotel and very accommodating. Love the location one block from the subway. Took public transport to and from LGA. Walked to Chinatown for dinner and Little Italy for dessert!

Great hotel! Not only is the lobby space aesthetically pleasing, it also smells amazing. More importantly- the staff is incredibly friendly! Love the location. The rooms are small, but clean and cute. They were kind enough to loan us a bike for the day which made for an amazing day in the city. All around amazing stay and would definitely recommend!

Great hotel with good location in Soho, very cozy atmosphere and a lot of good spots to hang out in the lobby. Nice rooftop terrace. Rooms are small but cool. Above all, extremely friendly staff - very service minded and nice.

Loved the Arlo SoHo. The space is great and the rooms are just perfect. I loved the details and style of furniture, the great feel of the room. The location is also a great plus, it's SoHo/Tribeca so not much to add there.

We stayed a week and are very happy with the hotel. The air conditioner was a bit noisy so we had it off in the night. Breakfast a bit expensive, 21$ each. Good beds, cool interior, hip rooftop bar. It was quiet in the night.

This is the hotel you'll want to stay to get a true feel of SOHO in NYC. It has an edgy vibe with a comfortable feel. There's a roof deck bar that will blow your mind. The rooms are very cozy and I like how the beds are pressed against the window for the ultimate NYC feel. You have to say hello to Lindsey G at the front desk. She has the answer to everything and knows how to direct you for a very enjoyable stay. I'm definitely heading back soon. Sean.

We stayed for 3 nights and we loved this place! New& trendy, the staffs are friendly and helpful. Especially love the smell as soon as you walked in, also the lemon grass products they provide in the rooms.The only thing that the room is a little small but we didn't stay long in the room, only to sleep. Overall, nice place to stay for your NYC trip!

From the moment we checked in until we checked out this hotel exceeded our expectations. Very modern relaxed vibe and super helpful staff. Hotel smells amazing! Rooms are small but absolutely well laid out and honestly, we were perfectly comfortable and impressed with the excellent use of every nook and cranny! Beds were super comfortable - not too soft or hard - rooms were sooooo quiet too!! Conveniently located w/in a short walk to World Trade Center memorial, Chinatown, Little Italy, etc. subway is close by for a quick $3 fare to Central Park, etc. Excellent restaurant in hotel and one just around the corner on Spring St - Union Bar & Kitchen - w great food/ drinks too! Overall, if you have a chance to stay at this hotel, DO IT!! We will absolutely be back and recommending to everyone I know traveling to NYC.

Stayed for 3 nights at Arlo Soho with the full knowledge that the rooms were only around 150 sq feet. Having lived in many a college dorm before, the room was perfectly comfortable, even for 2 people, although, one would have to plan more carefully.The only obstacle was if you had to be productive, you would either want to put your workspace on your bed or somehow squeeze it onto the small table they give you. However, downstairs lobby is a wonderful productive space with designated tables with charging ports. Speaking of which, the ambiance is suited for doing work and personal stuff anywhere.A day into the stay, the water pipes made a loud noise as there were some mechanical issues. I was promptly and efficiently moved to a new room by Gerry, who was super helpful, friendly, and all around accommodating. For all the trouble, he even gave us some vouchers for breakfast.All in all, Arlo Soho was a fantastic experience, as well as a fantastic location near all the pulsing things in fashionable Soho.
user_name:
blokchoy
New York City, New York

review_body: Stayed for a business trip. Unfortunately was booked in the room with the bunks, but it would have been a great room for a family.Small rooms, but clean. The shower curtain should be redesigned and the shampoo/conditioner are locked to the wall. This didn't make for a pleasant bathing experience.The front desk was polite throughout the stay and the restaurant had friendly outgoing service during breakfast. The food offered for the pre fixe breakfast price was ok and needed replenishing.Overall, the hotel is clean and had several common areas that make it a great spot to hang and converse or catch up on emails.The entry has a great mini market with things for the traveler.
user_name:
ExploringtheWorldNow
New York City, New York

review_body: Best Hotel I've visited in a long time!! It smells AMAZING and the staff was super friendly and accommodating!! Our room was very comfortable with a great view. We will definitely stay there again. Shout out to Lindsey!! She was a fantastic host!

Overall, very nice hotel. Very hip place. Young staff, extremely attentive and very clean. However this hotel for two people is a challenge. The rooms are small- do not underestimate just how small 150 ft.² is! There's only 6 inches of clearance between the foot of a queen size bed and you have to dodge the TV mounted on the wall. The worst feature of this room, as many before me have mentioned, is the bathroom situation. There is zero privacy. And I do mean ZERO. You have to really love the person you're traveling with! The door is frosted glass that does not fully close, does not go to the top of the ceiling, and the frost is too light to block any view of what's happening in the bathroom. The worst thing is the lack of exhaust fan. Great location though!!

We stayed for 3 days at Arlo Soho in July and loved every moment. The hotel is in a great location, just five minutes from the heart of Soho and about a 10 minute walk into the heart of the West Village. We've visited NYC several times before so it was important for us to stay in a hotel that wasn't Midtown and away from all the first time tourist attractions and we couldn't have picked a better spot.The hotel itself is extremely modern and reminds me of the Hoxton chain in London and Amsterdam. The staff were really friendly and helpful, especially Lindsey who checked us into the hotel and always remembered us.The hotel has a great rooftop bar which we went to for drinks on Saturday evening. It has a great atmosphere although drinks are pretty pricey. The only disappointing thing was that for such a great bar there wasn't really a wine list - just a house white so not great if you enjoy a nice wine.There's nothing really to fault with the hotel. The one gripe we did have was the bathroom in the room. Reading from other reviews quite a few people feel the same - there is zero privacy. The sliding glass door doesn't really cover the bathroom properly so you'd need to feel pretty comfortable with the person you're travelling with as you can hear and see in the bathroom when someone is in there. All in all, great hotel and hopefully the bathroom privacy will be taken into account later down the line.

Convenient location to Soho/ Shopping/ Dining. New hotel, just opened 8 months ago. Staff very friendly and so accommodating. Loved everything from the clean rooms, the in-house scent, rooftop surfboard workout, and the matcha chia pudding. Also the 24/7 market downstairs is so convenient and have a variety of snacks and drinks. I've stayed at many of the hotels in the Soho area and the Arlo is by far the best. Can't wait to come back again!

Fantastic hotel, fully recommended! From the very warm welcome at the reception by Lindsey, to the super friendly staff in the restaurant, to the nice rooms (clean!), it was pretty much perfect. The hotel oozes a nice ambiance. The only drawback was the grumpy bar keeper on the roof top, with hopelessly inflated prices. If we go back to NYC, we will definitely go back to Arlo!

New hotel -- very clean; staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms are small but in great shape. Wonderful lobby - with inside and outdoor space. Also, nice rooftop bar. No gym. Very modern. Good location -- Canal Street and Hudson. Walkable to Soho and the Village.
user_name:
DMaxG
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Had a 2 night stay at the Arlo Soho in a City King. Thought that pretty much everything about the property is great, just didn't have enough time to spend in the communal areas. The rooms are small, being a micro-hotel, - but I think most people understand that is the point though. Really well appointed, thoughtful inclusions and a quality, younger, hipper vibe to the place compared to other properties in NYC that would pitch around the same price range. Sure, you might get a bigger room but a lot of the older properties even after renovation are pretty seedy feeling - whereas the Arlo had a very fresh feel. I think 2 people in a room is probably a little squeezy, especially with more than 1 suitcase, but if you are using it as a base for sightseeing or meetings while in the city and not expecting to throw a party, then it is ideal. Front desk staff were especially sweet and helpful, in particular Lindsey and Abby. Only issue, which is not really an issue, is that the location is a little outside of SoHo proper, but for me, anywhere Manhattan is fine as a train, cab/uber or walk is easily doable. Would definitely stay again.

This hotel has a hip/modern euro vibe to it. The rooms are very small but adequate. Spotlessly clean. Comfortable bed that takes up most of the space in the room. No closet space - storage under the bed and pegs for hanging clothes. I stayed one night for a business meeting and it was just fine. Would be hard for a longer stay or more than one person. Very nice and competent people at desk and little food shop in lobby as well as in phone reservations center. Also there's a rooftop lounge that seems pretty popular - I didn't use it, but lots of people were headed there yet I heard no noise in my room, right next to elevator despite that. Overall good value for the money.

The hotel is absolutely a gem in Soho with beautiful surroundings not far from the cosy restaurants in Spring Street, the buzzing nightlife of Greenwich Village or a morning run by the Hudson River. The staff here go the extra mile and makes you feel like you are amongst friends. There are cool activities such as free bikes, succulent planting, art classes, concerts, wine tasting and sunrise workouts on the rooftop. Let's talk about amazing rooftop with both a city view and overlooking the Hudson.The rooms are modern, clean and boutique-like with a great mixture of Japanese zen and Nordic simplicity. I will definitely stay here again next time I go to NYC!

My wife booked this hotel through BA, for four nights, as a surprise for my 60th birthday. She booked a Queen room and BA advised that they would make the hotel aware of the special circumstances to see if the better of the Queen rooms could be reserved.We arrived tired and shattered at 10:30 to find that the last Queen room (226) had been allocated to us with some rather noisy A/C plant outside. BA had not contacted the hotel!This was brought to the attention of the staff and they immediately responded with an upgrade to a King room, which was fantastic with all the amenities that one could want. Fantastic shower, modern compact layout, really good TV and motorised blackout/sheer blinds.The buffet breakfast was great and the rooftop bar with views of the Hudson was fantastic. However, the staff really make the difference in this hotel and go the extra mile to make you feel like a special customer. If I could single any one person out, it would be Lindsey! She took control of the original situation in a really friendly and supportive way. She was always there for us throughout our stay and was always attentive ant every time we came across her, going out of her way to find out if all was ok and if she could do anything for us. It was brilliant, after many hours of traipsing 'round Greenwich village to find a birthday card wishing me a happy 60th with several gifts of locally-crafted snacks .... we were extremely touched.To add to the foregoing, the location is great, 20 mins walk from 1 World Centre and 12 mins walk from Greenwich Village with the Metro 3 mins away.We would heartily recommend this hotel for the warmth, customer care and enthusiasm of the staff, especially Lindsey, the great rooms/facilities and the fantastic location, nit forgetting the fantastic buffet breakfasts and great free WiFi signal through all of the hotel.

I stayed in Arlo Soho with my boyfriend for 5 nights. The hotel is very chic and location is great. I had expected a small room because of the reviews but our room was not that small at all, especially for New York city. I recommend the Arlo bikes and the roof top. Didn't try the restaurant but the little shop near the reception has good coffee amongst other things and is open 24 hours. Arlo gets 5 stars from us, will definitely recommend it.

What a brilliant find. This is a super well thought out hotel, and it looks great. The roof terrace bar is always fun with great music. However it's the staff that make the hotel the gem that it is. I would go so far as to say it's the best team of people I've ever encountered in any hotel.Thank you for looking after my family so well.

Well priced, great location, amazing open spaces to work or just hang out. Super clean, modern and new. Room are compact but clean and you have everything you need. Bed was amazingly comfortable. Cheerful and eager staff. I would definitely stay here again!

At the check-in I was greeted by wonderful Lindsay who goes above and beyond to make her guests feel at home. But in general all staff were wonderful and very serviceminded in a friendly way. The hotel has a modern nordic interior with several hang-out places both inside and outside. You can watch tv, chill in the sofa groups or enjoy a cup of quality coffee from the café. The rooms are small as they all are in NYC but they are well adapted with efficient storage and one doesn't need any more space because of that. The bed is really comfortable and the double quilt is wonderful and makes you wanna stay in bed and relax yourself. Also there is a roof-top terrace which has a great view of the area and also a sneak peak to Hudson River. The hotel offers bicycles free of charge which is really great as you can bicycle along the River for many kilometers. The only 2 things that bothered me a bit was the massive traffic and honking from cars waiting to drive through the Holland Tunnel. And also quite loud music from the rooftop terrace when private parties was held there. So if you are looking for a new modern hotel with all that you need for a stay in the perfect location with 5 minutes to the Hudson River, 5 minutes to the Subway and 5 min. to SOHO shopping you should choose Arlo Soho. I really loved my stay there and will recommend it to everyone I know :-) Br. Jane

A very nice, clean and brand new hotelWonderful rooftop barPerfect location and roomsService is impeccable Lovely new spot for downtown areaWorth a lot of words. Do not forget to try the rooftop bar Incredible views. Perfect location

F&B staff where great, the wine director took time to share with me some of her tips on procuring wine and let me taste some new additions to the list. Rooms are small but clean, HVAC a little noisy. The Hudson Square location is great. Fab restaurants nearby.

First, the location is confusing to be accessed as the back entrance says "Arlo Soho" but isn't the hotel entrance. Then the front desk staff is misinformed and tries to cover their lack of knowledge with a weird version of rudeness. Certainly not a customer friendly place. I recommend to management to retrain the staff and even if there is a confusing situation to give the customer some options instead of just sending him away. 1 star and a lot of work needed to improve..

The staff are excellent and you feel they are more like friends that want to see your stay is great. Rooms are a little small but extremely well thought out and there are many events that keep you in the hotels common areas. Great vibe.

The Arlo is perfectly located to walk to just about anything. One World Trade, Soho, Tribeca, Greenwich Village, Chelsea Market, The highline and more. Amazing restaurants and bars all around it. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful and we arrived during their free weekly wine tasting which made for a wonderful welcome. The staff are exceptionally polite, friendly and helpful (shoutout to Lindsey Gershberg for making our stay extra memorable). The suite with a terrace and outdoor shower is a dream come true. THANKS ARLO

Spent there two nights this last November, on the first day there was some problem and there were no hot water until midnight. Could not take a shower and got no compensation. Then, we asked to use the phone to make reservations and were told it was free of charge but they charged us when we checked out (not that I mind a couple of bucks, but it would have been nice to get informed in advance, especially after asking...).Rooms were soooooooo tiny but well decorated. Not for travelers with big suitcases like us...

Great location, easy walk to Soho and beyond, close to Canal St #1 subway, brand new building, smart, thoughtful design for a small space, friendly staff, blackout blinds and a super comfy bed. Great value for money. We will stay again.

Nice room with a good street view along with the rooftop bar. Some handy amenities in the room. Well received at the reception for check in. A very good bartender called Ricky did a great job and he's a gentleman. Would recommend.

I can honestly say that I've never been to a hotel that was so adorable! Everything from the layout of our compact "city king room" to the rooftop bar to even the lovely smell of the lobby had that attention-to-detail that was much appreciated. I stayed at the Arlo SoHo for nearly a week on a girlfriends trip to NYC. The room was cozy, but in truth we didn't spend much time in it. We enjoyed rosé on the rooftop patio on the Fourth of July and found it to have a young, fun vibe. The lobby bodega was great for grabbing snacks or a quick meal. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Will definitely be back!

We loved our stay here for our honeymoon. The hotel is beautifully maintained and has everything you can want! It's conveniently located and the staff are super accommodating! Special shout out to Lindsay who gave us extra special attention! Thanks to the Arlo team

When I arrived at the Arlo there was a woman who was making quite a scene to the manager, who handled her in a graceful way considering! I'm not sure what she was expecting, but I had the most wonderful time staying at the Arlo! Every staff member is so friendly, genuine and helpful! Lindsey helped us find a wonderful Chinese restaurant called Wo Hop in China town! I agree with all of the positive reviewers so no need to list them all again! Thank you!!

Love the floor to ceiling wall to wall windows in the rooms & the courtyard is amazing. The room is perfect. Took me a second to find the iron...it's a steamer. The cafe downstairs is perfect & the food tasty, if a bit pricey. The location is perfect.

This looked good on websites and had lots or rave reviews - and after a five-night stay I can confirm that everything good that has been said was spot on.Bedrooms are decent size by New York standard, very clean and modern and well set out. Comfortable bed and powerful a/c.Downstairs, the reception team are incredibly helpful and there are some great chill-out spaces. It is also possibly the most aromatic hotel I've ever stayed in; a pleasant, distinctive scent wafting out on to the street.Upstairs, a rooftop bar which is a great place to relax in at the end of a hot day on the city streets.There's a subway nearby and although there is not much in the immediate vicinity, you will find a range of good diners within a few blocks, along with the busy Canal Street.The subway will take you quickly up and down the west-side - downtown, Penn, Times Square and 42nd Street are a few stops away. Walk further down Canal Street and there are more subway entrances for services up the east side (Union Square, Grand Central etc).Arlo attracts a predominantly young, slightly hipsterish crowd but the vibe is super-relaxed and I can't imagine older travellers would feel out of place. It certainly wasn't noisy.Very impressive, well-run hotel and thoroughly recommended.

I recently stayed at Arlo Soho for a short business trip with my family. Traveling with an infant is not easy, but we had a very pleasant experience. This hotel was comfortable, cozy and clean. Their staff was very helpful and friendly. I very much enjoyed my stay in NYC thanks to Arlo Soho!
user_name:
turkishcoffeelady
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Friendly,professional,efficient, and helpful staff. Clean and inviting lobby with a good mixture of seating, tables, monitors, and lots of natural lighting. Relaxing green courtyard. Delicious food in hotel restaurant. Clean and well stock lobby toilets. Hip rooftop club. Fun social activities. Strong wifi throughout the hotel. Comfortable beds. Well stocked showers. Large bedroom terrace with 9th floor rooms. Convenient location proximity to subway, bakery, stores, restaurants.

We stayed for five nights in Arlo Soho. This is a wonderful hotel experience when we stay in New York. The open public spaces are very cool and modern. The front desk staff was friendly. The Abbie and Linz did the great jobs with our questions offered a perfect cheek in experience. Bellman Edwin help us storage our luggage. The housekeeping head Iwona and room inspectors Thomas an Amalia are patient to leading us to show rooms and Introduce room quality. The food breakfast was excellent. The rooms are small but well designed. Shower and toilet are opaque glass enclosures, so privacy could be a concern if sharing room with family. Twin size Beds are comfortable, it next to large window, terrace is nice to enjoy great time and sunshine which gave a sense of more space of city view.During our stay, housekeeping staff are helpful, The Ryan sent us extra pillows and blanket, Tony did a bucket of ice and Ivan give us iron and iron board. And housekeepers are nice, they did the great room service, every night when we get back to room, we was all surprised to live in new room every night(Especially thanks Sharon and Amanda they did the great job of refresh our room). Great Wi-Fi and TV when you need to just relax. Amazing roof top party I have ever joy at night. The location was pretty convenient for us. It's not a busy part of town, but we were able to walk to Soho and China town district. Subway stations were pretty close 5-10 minutes walk. If you're traveling to NYC for fun and aren't planning to spend a ton of time lounging in your hotel room, this hotel is a great value.Looking forward to coming back!
user_name:
jianer w
New York City, New York

review_body: Great hotel in NYC. Rooms are on the small side but the layouts are extremely efficient. You'll have everything you need. Nice restaurant downstairs and a rooftop lounge with amazing views of the NYC skyline. Close to everything in SoHo and also close to any train you need to get around NYC. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They made check in and check out a breeze. Great spaces on the first floor, indoors and out, for gathering or just sitting with a cup of coffee.

I stayed there for a few days and the place was quite charming and cozy. The rooms are very little , but very clean and great decoration.Recomend to get your breakfast at the deli in the corner it has great food at great prices.

We had a room with two twins and a terrace and it was fabulous. The room was small but well appointed. The terrace was amazing. It was so nice to enjoy the summer outside with views of New York. I would stay again- booking ahead to get a terrace room!

This little gem is small but has all the bells and whistles along with a Great staff (especially Isabella, the Dans, Emile and Gerry G) The front desk stafff is warm, welcoming and extremely accommodating! Isabella bent over backwards to match a room rate I found slightly lower on the Internet. Breakfast (included in some rates) was great! There is tons of gathering space in the lobby conducive to meeting people for biz or socializing. The rooms are tiny and so are the bathrooms but all updated, clean and wet cool. My only complaint was the AC..either blowing too cold or the room got too hot. The garden rooms are quiet with no street noise. I will definitely book again!

From the staff to the rooms -- we had an incredible stay with Arlo. We arrived in NYC at 3am and needed a place to stay for a few hours until our flight out. We found Arlo on Hotel Tonight. Booked it right away as it was the only hotel under $120 a night! Incredible location, staff is on point (fastest checkin ever), rooms are tight but make such great use of the space (all hotels are this small or smaller btw), and they let us do a late checkout which was so appreciated. LOVED! Pro Tip -- if you have them hold your bags as you wonder around after you check out, make sure you ask for them back BEFORE booking your Uber lol. Takes about 5 minutes for them to retrieve your bags and bring them to you in the lobby.

I stayed on business. If you book online on the Arlo site, breakfast is included. Definitely do this - breakfast is outstanding; served in the 'Meat 3" eatery. Front desk, coffee shop and restaurant staff are all wonderfully helpful and friendly. Coffee shop is open 24x7. Rooms are small, but super well designed so very functional. I had a great nights' sleep. Very good value for money, and the location cannot be better.

I had a lovely three night stay, and really enjoyed the hotel. Yes, the room was small as expected. But it was very well organized, everything worked, and it was quite quiet, despite the futile honking of cars trying to get into the Holland Tunnel. The location is great, and the free bikes were brilliant ... it's only a couple of blocks to the waterfront bike path which you can take out to Harlem or around the southern tip and over to the UN Buildings. Lots of amenities in the area (City Winery, Acquagrill) and very close to the Canal St subway station with the blue A-C-E line. Also a nice walk to Greenwich V., Chelsea, Tribeca, or Union Sq. The staff were absolutely great and they make a terrific coffee in the lobby. Breakfast was decent ... they provided one on the house and a room upgrade to a King room as there was a workman in my room when I checked in. Nice touch. The hotel was very hip and you would definitely be out of place without an Apple product, newer the better! But as an older traveller I felt right at home and without hesitation would stay here again.

I had a quick overnight trip to New York for a business meeting in Greenwich Village and this Hotel was perfect for my stay. The location is fantastic, service is excellent, common areas are plentiful and comfortable, everything you would expect from a hotel, a warm welcome, and great service. I would definitely go back in the future.
user_name:
aidansartinconte
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: The rooms are very small but the hotel is cute and very well stuffed. Internet is FAST and customer service is top notch. Location is strategic having as an axe line 1 of the metro. The food in the restaurants is xcellent and the bar is awsome.

Had the pleasure of staying at this property for 3 nights during my recent visit to New York. Excellent location located with the village. Located near restaurants, stores, galleries & the like. The staff were welcoming & helpful. The hotel had a home away from home vibe with many open spaces to relax, read & wifi availability. The only caution I would give to advise the accommodations are SMALL with one king bed (about 150 sq. ft.) so not suitable for more than a couple. They have used the space well so it worked for me and the bed was very comfortable. So of you are a singe or couple heading to New York I would recommend this property

I cannot recommend a stay at the Arlo for the usual business traveler. The rooms and beds are extremely small, very noisy, and elementary things like the shades not being able to fully darken the room don't make for a good night sleep. Service issues like you being sent to your room on the 8th floor without a working key so you need to return to the front desk after a long day of travel, the lack of a gym, pseudo partnerships with neighboring gyms (boxing class on 1 day of a week, a free class at soul cycle that everyone is eligible to anyway) make this review a soft 2.

Wonderful place to stay!! Always people smiling. EXCELENT location in NY.Near to SOHO, Brooklyn bride, the Village and delicious restaurants. Only a block away from the subway station. Amazing roof top. I really recommend the rooms with the terrace!

Stayed at Arlo SoHo during our very first visit in NYC. Our vacation exceeded all of our expectations and Arlo SoHo had a big role in making our stay wonderful!First of all, the location of the hotel is excellent - short walk to nice areas such as Soho, Tribeca and Greenwich Village. Lots of excellent restaurants and bars nearby. The Canal street subway is located just around the corner.The front desk staff was always very friendly and helpful and had the time to say hi despite being in a rush. Special thanks to Lindsey and Jason who made us feel very welcome from the very start!And oh the rooms - the bed was super comfortable and the view was fabulous. Yes, the room was quite small but we knew it beforehand and were prepared for that. Despite its size the room was functional and clean and the housekeeping worked well.Definitely will stay at Arlo SoHo on our next trip to NYC (hopefully very soon)!

This place is in a great location, good check in and a cool layout and atmosphere - upon checking in I wanted to give it a 5, unfortunately a few things cumulative over days turned it to a generous 3. Dirty sheets in the bed upon checkin was not a great at start - there no follow up or communication from management following this issue which was disappointing. An air conditioner that has a mind of its own and will heat your room to a balmy 80 degrees in the middle of the night, 3 am wake up feeling like your are lying on a pavement in the tropics without having had water for 3 days (2nights in a row). I tried to report it to reception but it was always so hectic - so emailed instead on day 1 - no reply, 24 hours later I rang through to escalate the issue. Was put to a manager and was treated well and problem was resolved to my satisfaction - again it was regrettable that I had to escalate it - just pay attention to the details, respond to emails etc.Few other items to note - the rooms are nice but small - bring your Tetris skills to arrange bags so you can get to bed, lifts get busy as there is a rooftop bar so can be a journey to get to your room at peak times. Also it is a security issue as you don't need to scan your room key to get to your floor - this means any person entering the hotel can get to any floor which is a safety issue that should be addressed.So much potential and good elements here. Just fix the details.

Very cool hotel with a hip, boutiquey vibe. I got a king city view room for one (so excited because it was the enclosed box bed), and it was plenty of space for me. The bed is SOOOO comfortable and even on the 3rd floor, I had a nice view of a back street and even a little peak of the Hudson River. I was very surprised that even next to the Holland tunnel, the window had great sound insulation, and you couldn't get much of the traffic noise at all. The Blind Barber bathroom products are amazing and the rain shower has amazing water pressure. The bathroom was very clean and had a good design, but I think I'd have different feelings if I was traveling with someone else, as there is only a glass sliding door between the toilet and the rest of the room. There was also a small fridge, safe, fold down desk, speaker (bluetooth enabled), hairdryer and clothing steamer included in the room as well. Aside from being slightly annoying to get to via car (at certain times of the day) because of Holland Tunnel traffic, it's walking distance to so many great restaurants, bars and shops.

Recently I stayed for 8 nights at the Arlo Hotel Hudson Sq. - Soho.Excellent service/hosts, especially from Lindsey Gershberg who all the time was very attentive. The room is a bit small, but it is very cozy and was always clean.In addition to the excellent hotel, they even have an incredible rooftop.

I travel to NYC regularly on business and the Arlo SoHo is hands down the best!It has a young and hip vibe but I felt very much at home, even if I was on the older side. The rooms are compact but very nicely appointed and quiet. The common areas both inside and out are great for a morning coffee or night cap in the evening. Very easy walk to the financial district and numerous neighborhood restaurants.

Everything single aspect of the Arlo SoHo was absolutely incredible! I've never been so happy and comfortable at a hotel before I stayed at the Arlo! The rooms are just the right size for crashing at night, the lobbies are boutiquey, comfortable, and clean. In fact, the whole hotel was spotless. So clean everywhere!! Not only did we love the physical hotel but the people we AMAZING! They were so polite, accommodating, and amicable. A special shoutout goes out to Jason. He was especially friendly and made us smile! Thank you so much to everyone at the Arlo SoHo a memorable one!

We stayed at this hip new hotel for 4 nights while my daughter started her new job in the city. It was well located and the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly - especially Tayson. The rooms are small but equipped with everything we needed. The common areas are beautiful and inviting! We would definitely stay here again!

We loved everything about this hotel! The staff was friendly, helpful and accommodating. Our room, though teeny tiny, was very clean and comfortable. We were in #512, which is a king room with a courtyard view. Be sure to close the privacy blinds if you want privacy from the outside world, but be prepared to have very little privacy in the bathroom area. The sink is out in the open and the toilet and shower are only sheltered by frosted glass that doesn't hide much, especially sound. Though this was at first surprising to us, as was the size of the room (my Mom said it was smaller than a cruise ship cabin), we soon found a place for everything and really didn't get in each other's way much. The bed and linens were dreamy, the shower was fantastic and the noise level from the street wasn't bothersome. Thursday evening we enjoyed jazz in the main bar, along with a few delicious cocktails. To return to the airport, the hotel arranged a car service for us, which was much nicer than taking a cab and the price was comparable. As I said in my title, this hotel is very hip (the majority of guests looked like they were under 35), the decor is contemporary, there's a bodega in the lobby, the main bar, a restaurant, a rooftop bar and patio, lots of areas to work or lounge, and a cute courtyard. I would definitely stay here again. One thing to note: the Holland Tunnel is almost across the street from the hotel, so traffic gets really bogged down in the area. We ended up hopping out of our cab a few blocks away most of the time, and walking the duration of the trip.

Ive just enjoyed a 4 night stay at the Arlo Soho.In my opinion the location is excellent. Close to the 1, 2, 3, A, C, E lines.I enjoy walking and do a lot of it but often take the subway somewhere and walk back or vice versa. The hotel is ideal for that. If you head out of the front door and turn right you are in walking distance of the World Trade Centre site (within a mile). Turn left and you have the West Village up to the Highline area. Head (sort of) straight ahead and you will be in the Wooster Street, Greene Street area of Soho. So great on all three counts.On this trip I arrived via JFK and was able to use the A train from Howard Beach (JFK air train station stop) to within half a mile of the hotel. Very achievable even with a suitcase.I had a queen bed city view room which was on the 3rd floor – I quite liked my view over the small park across the road even though its not much! I believe my room was a disabled access room so a touch larger (!) I was a solo traveller so it was perfect for me. (I was kinda hoping for the room with the enclosed wooden cube bed area just for fun but fair enough ;o)As the hotel decor is funky and stylish I felt the room could have had a little something to give it the same feel – just a decorative touch, maybe a photograph on the wall (call me! ;o) or a touch of colour from a cushion or accessory. It was pretty featureless.The bed was very comfortable. There was a small fridge and a safe – both very useful. No wardrobe just a few hangers on a hook which was adequate. The room has a sink with mirror and plug point and there is a hairdryer for your use. There is a full length blackout blind and sheer blind which can be used together or separately.The only negative point is re the air conditioning – SO LOUD. Maybe us Scots aren’t used to air con like our US neighbours as many reviewers haven’t mentioned it but I felt it was like a loud hoover/vacuum cleaner going all night long. I used earplugs and they really made zero difference. I got used to it but it did affect my sleep. (Also watch out for the corner of the bed nearest the door which was sharp and I gave myself a few sore scratches and bruises bumping into it!)The bathroom is more of a wet room set up with a rubber buffer between the main shower area and the toilet. On my last use of it, this appeared to have loosened and caused a flood over the entire area and out into the tiled area of the room. Nothing a couple of towels couldn’t sort though.The public areas of the hotel are lovely and I enjoyed a quick look at the gadgets and accessories you could buy at reception. I also used the Bodega once and found the selection good and the food fresh and well-priced. Although I didn’t use the rooftop bar due to being out and about it was a lovely feature with cute styling.I came home one night to find ‘The Haiku guys’ in the bar area (in this case girls!) – I think they are fab and it was lovely to chat to the girls. Thanks for my Haiku Sarah ;o)Although I found the Air Con a BIG problem I loved the location and would stay again.((Side note - consider popping into sister hotel Arlo Nomad and check the view from the rooftop bar – fab!))

Arlo SoHo exceeds expectations in the following areas: Customer courtesy - the people at the front desk are courteous and respectful. They will answer all of your inquiries and print out directions for you. Cleanliness -the rooms are extremely clean and so are the public areas. The location is great and there are many fine restaurants in the area. The rooms are small but you are not there to spend the day in your room.This was a great hotel with a wonderful staff.

Place was nice, great location, minimalist space was comforting. Noise was a bit much especially on garbage day if youre lucky enough to get an alley window....the biggest issue i had which caused anxiety and sleep deprivation (i left at 5am because i couldnt stand it) was the analog ticking clock built into the headboard!!! Why! Why would someone want to hear that!!!!

Just completed my stay, and overall found this to be a very decent place to stay. The location was great, and the room was clean and modern. The staff were friendly and efficient, and the hotel has a great set of lounges and bars. Note, however, that the rooms (or at least our bunk bed room) offers little to know bathroom privacy. Rather, you get a shaded glass stall that does little to block the view and even less the audio. Given that people booking bunk bed rooms are not likely to be couples (and frankly I don't think couples particularly want this either), it seemed like a very poorly planned design. The space is small, but a few simple adjustments would have made it a more comfortable stay.

I come to NYC often , for business and also pleasure , I usually stay around Soho Area . This was my first time staying at Arlo , the staff , the room , location , the roof Terrace !! everything I loved !!! This will be my first choice to stay when coming to the city , I couldn't ask for a better location !

Trip started off rocky as there was an issue with the AC in the room. One of the managers (Michael Webster) was more accommodating than any hotel employee I have ever come across. He was courteous, proactive and always smiling. He fixed the issue for us and the rest of our weekend was great. I highly recommend.

We had a great time in Arlo. Nice rooms, very centrally located if you like Soho, nice rooftop terrace. My daughter and I went for a 2 bunker bed room, which was quite convenient.The staff is very friendly and service minded.Arlo has no own gym, but a partnership with Dogpound, a celeb fitness-club right around the corner. Be sure you are fit as the classes are quite demanding (boxing each Friday and Wednesday at 7 am).Breakfast is overpriced, though the quality of the food is good. No problem though, as there are plenty of alternatives on Prince street around the corner.We'll be back next time we are in NY.

I have never stayed at a micro hotel before. I LOVE the concept. The hotel was just great. Super comfortable "tiny house nation style" rooms, with every amenity one would need. Extremely comfortable beds, bedding. Loved the restaurants, wine bar, living spaces downstairs, great night life on the roof. We were really pleasantly surprised by this unique place. I'll go right back there when I get a chance to return to NY.

Stayed here end of May for 3 nights. The whole place is very modern, clean and seems very new. The staff at all times on reception were very efficient, friendly and welcoming. The rooms are not huge, but were immaculate, well designed for the space available. Bedding and towels looked brand new. The addition of a room safe was very welcome and unexpected. The wi-fi is complimentary and could be picked up from all areas quickly.There are plenty of places to eat within a short distance and close to China town too.We didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel too busy enjoying the city, but was overall impressed with the location, accommodation and staff, the only thing we thought was not so good was the price of the breakfast at $21.00 each, although a buffet and nice dining room, thought it was too expensive.

Love this hotel in SoHo Tribeca area. The staff was friendly and accommodating. By 2nd day they greeted me like family, asking how my "big presentation" went and went out of their way to help me extend my stay at reasonable $. Mico rooms but all of NYC is small however room are designed perfectly, comfortable and clean. Many common working areas in entry, has rooftop bar and wonderful breakfast. Would highly recommend and will be my 1st choice when I say in that area again. Probably not best for family.

We came for a soho weekend for my birthday and I fell in love with this hotel! I would book this again over any of the generic luxury big brands any day!The hotel has a really fun character, cool rooms and lots of trendy extras...For example we placed chess at 4 AM in the common lobby area.Recommend the rooms for couples, they fit two well but don't think there are rooms large enough to accommodate families.

I booked rooms for my coworker and I to stay in the city the night before a training. This place was so cute and priced competitively compared to other options in the neighborhood. Even though the space was small, it was efficiently used and perfect for a solo business traveler. The bed was so comfy. I only wish I was in town a little longer to take advantage of the workout classes, cool common areas, and rooftop bar. Staff was very helpful to ensure we had a great stay. There were lots of cool restaurants, bars and shops within close proximity.

After a 24 hour flight from Australia the crew at check in gave me a room on the 9th floor with a balcony! It was FANTASTIC!!! I highly recommend room 931. Dan I. and Lindsey were great. The room is big enough for 1!

I had never stayed in an Arlo Hotel previously, but I love the concept and can't wait to stay at another property.I traveled for work and this hotel was perfect for that purpose. It would also be good for a couple, but the rooms are a little small for a family or a couple and child. Also, the hotel has a quiet vibe so a parent might find themselves constantly trying to rein in their little ones excitement.The rooms are basic, but clean and provide a desk, small hanging area for clothes, safe and single wall mounted sink. I loved the fact they ditched the traditional ironing board/ iron and put a steamer in each room- much easier to use and who wants to wrestle with the board anyways?! If you have a lot of luggage you will be a little cramped in a regular room. I can not speak to a suite, which may have more room.The room does not have a coffee maker in the room, but does have a fridge. To make up for that, they have a coffee bar in the lobby where they can make you a drink ( it is not free). They also have a 24hour pantry stocked with healthy and savory food options from fresh fruit, pressed juices, sandwiches, nuts, jerky,etcThere are two things that stood out about this hotel: the rooftop bar and the work/conversation/relaxation spaces spread throughout the first floor. No need to confine yourself to the room, grab your computer and knock out some work on a desk surrounded by amazing decor and a homelike feel downstairs. Or, curl up with a good book on the outdoor sofas surrounded by vegetation and a living wall. The rooftop has great views and lots of comfy seating for a pre or post dinner drink.The hotel is also impeccably clean!Room tip: if you are a light sleeper ask for a room away from the elevator. Also, if you want a little bit more room ask for a handicap accessible room. My colleague had room 607 and it was much larger than my room, quiet and had a great view.

This was our first stay at the Arlo SoHo, and we were really impressed. The staff at the front desk was extremely welcoming, and remembered us throughout the stay, providing a very personable touch. The hotel has a modern and well-designed feel. The rooms are smallish, but the carefully throughout desk, clothing storage and bathroom make it very usable and comfortable. Despite being near a couple of bigger streets, the rooms were remarkably quite (a valuable and rare quality in the city). In the lobby, the little bodega offers nice snacks and food, while the SoHo neighborhood restaurants are a very convenient walk away. We would definitely stay here again.

We spent 3 nights at the Arlo Soho and it was perfect. Check in was smooth and we were met by Aranxta and given a personal tour of the property. She was so friendly and professional. We enjoyed breakfast at Harold's 2 of the mornings and the buffet was fresh and had everything you need to leave full and happy. The rooftop was perfect for a drink to enjoy the sunset. Amazing trip. Thanks!

Loved this hotel, it was close to everything and I arrived 2 hrs early and they were able to get me in my room. The guest agents we humorous and very efficient. The hotel itself was so beautiful and it made me wish i had stayed a few more days. They offered some awesome leather and matte black cruisers at no charge in addition to really sweet daily free offerings like a morning surf class on the roof, and a free wine tasting. I biked over the Brooklyn Bridge to 2 craft breweries and then back. The roof top bar is so beautiful in addition to the open courtyard where i took my laptop to get some work done. The room was perfectly small and very Soho. Everything from the bed to the bathroom was very new and modern. Hands down stay here, I usually stay at 4-5* hotels and without a doubt this place met and exceeded all of my preferences and expectations. Side note: go the The Mermaid Bar for Happy Hour 5-7pm it was fantastic!

Definitely a tiny room. This is great for the solo business traveler. I can't imagine staying here with even a small family. That said, the room was just great for the purpose. The hotel was cool. The staff helpful. The location was great. Fantastic rooftop bar.

This was a first - time stay as a business traveler. I had a terrific front of desk manager, Michael Webster, who made all the difference -- especially once my air conditioning went on the (temporary) "fritz". He was super! I loved the restaurant veggies (especially), yummy drinks in a cool bar lounge downstairs, outdoor interior garden, and -- especially the cozy bed set up. Try it! ... you're bound to like it!

Yes these rooms are not large but the hotel is VERY clean, modern, and has comfortable beds. One in our group needed a handicapped room and it was larger of course. The rooms had plenty of supplies (i.e. Blind Barber shampoo, conditioner, lotion and shower gel) and an decent sized bathroom. The front desk staff were always helpful and nice. The hotel has a great many areas to sit and desk areas for computers as well as a beautiful outdoor area with tables and chairs for lounging or eating just beyond the front check in area. It is close to several shops and restaurants but also has a bistro style quick grab and go(separate charge) by the lobby with coffee, breakfast and lunch items which is convenient.We walked over to Amelia's Restaurant for 2 meals as it was within a couple of blocks. We might stay here again but my husband thought the room was a little tight between the bed and the TV so not sure. The service and cleanliness were outstanding so the only reason would be the room size. I do recommend this hotel though as I think it is a good bargain!

I used to live in NYC and jumped at the chance to visit for work in May. I would usually stay further uptown, but I needed to be close to my office in Soho. I chose this place after looking at a lot of reviews and it did not disappoint!I checked in at 10am and the super nice guy at the check in desk already had my room ready. The room was very small -- closer to something you'd find in Europe (which I don't mind) -- but very clean and modern. If you're not crazy about the small room, there are plenty of gorgeous communal spaces for hanging out (including a roof deck).I like to see a lot of shows when I'm in NY, so I was most concerned about getting to and from midtown late at night. This was definitely the best hotel to be at. A 5 minute walk and you're at the 1, which takes you anywhere you want to go uptown! (You're also right next to the entrance to the Holland Tunnel if you're flying in or out of Newark.)Extra props to the awesome staff who let me ship stuff I needed from Amazon to the hotel!

This hotel was great. The staff was very helpful and informative. They went out of their way to make us comfortable and help us. The rooms are small but adequate and well-appointed. There is no wasted space and are well-designed.

After a super long 22hr flight - What a wonderful surprise to be greeted by a super nice even if on the smallish side room with the most comfortable bed ever!Staff are super friendly abd the place is spotless! Great coffee can be found in foyer too at Bodega... overall great value for money in a quiet part of town but only a few mins walk to soho - ( you must go to Balthazar ) and not very far from a subway

We had a great wk at arlo , really great hotel, location and really friendly staff :)Lindsey was so really helpful .....so big thanks again .Would recommend the hotel to any one ,location was brill as near to subway and lots of pubs & restaurants, we did walk to most attractions , but they r a distance but a nice walk if u like walking.We stayed here for a week,, had no problems with the room size ,we knew it was going to b compact b4 we came as read up on it ,but who stays in there room when in new York ...too much to see :)Room was very clean Would definitely stay again Thank u all again :)

Just spent 10 days in this hotel and could highlight some things: 1. Walking distance from soho and meat packing, excellent neighborhood, close to metro stations 2. Excellent lobby, environment, new furniture, cool bar, and restaurant 3. Super new and clean rooms but with problems of maintanance - our phone did not work for the 10 days despite complaint and asking for fixing and shower was some days hot others not.... I believe the management has to be a bit more careful so the hotel can be a five-star in NY.

My friend and I did a Priceline Express Deal for a boutique hotel in SoHo for a long Memorial Day weekend, so that is how we found the Arlo SoHo. We had requested a twin bedroom but upon checkin were told that those rooms were unavailable, so we got a bunk bed room. They were really cool and gave us food vouchers for the restaurant which we used for breakfast one day, and dinner the next. The good: The vouchers were each $75 so we comfortably ate under that amount, and I think the two solid meals we had at the hotel made up for having a bunk bed room. The restaurant service was excellent and the food quality was good; everything was pricey of course. The hotel is super hip and fun (we felt stodgy as 36 year old non-hipsters) and we appreciated the convenience, location - walkable under 5mins to the Canal St and Spring St subway stations, and nice folks at the front desk. We did not take advantage of the rooftop bar as it rained all weekend. :/ Our room was quiet and had a view of Hudston st (Rm 808) - never heard neighbors or hallway noise. The hotel was super clean and tidy, I think the housekeepers did a nice job. Wifi was free and fast. So the bad: It was TINY like European studio tiny. Each bunk bed bed had its' own TV, and the room was configured a bit like a cruise ship where all the storage was super functional, but not spacious. The bathroom door didn't close all the way - it was a sliding glass door - so there wasn't much privacy. The shower also only had a hook-setting to close the curtain, so no shower rod to hang clothes on. Also there was not a closet - just a peg-board like industrial chic rack. We would have appreciated a few more hangers. All in all I would stay there again if the price was right, but for what we paid it was pretty tight in there even for NYC standards.

The decor is very modern and hip. However, this room felt more like camping than a hotel room. The length of the king sized bed is literally the width of the room. The "bathroom" is a glass enclosure surrounding a wall toilet and shower stall. There is a peg board that has a short rod on which to hang your clothes. The air/air conditioning wasn't sufficient to clear the steam from the "bathroom" the entire day. If I was brushing my teeth, my husband had to be sitting on the bed. I've always felt a room is just for sleeping and didn't need more space than that, but I do require standing area for two people to get dressed at the same time which is not the case here. Maybe would be suitable for one person, but for two there's no room and zero potty privacy.

We had an incredible weekend in NYC, made better by this gem of a hotel. It is so well thought out, from the to-go coffee and juice bar in the lobby, to the stylish ground floor that feels like part living room part co-working space. The rooms are about as space-smart as you can imagine--tiny but incredibly well laid such that you don't notice or mind. The reception staff were one of the highlights: whether it was Abby, Natalie or Michael, we were always greeted with a sincere smile, a great mood and tons of helpful suggestions about nearby restaurant and bar options.

I come to NYC quite a bit and had not found a hotel I wanted to return to until now. They've made this hotel a truly living place that is warm, friendly and enjoyable to be in. The rooms are ergonomic and stylish, where there is no wasted space and lots of attention is paid to very important details. The bars on the main floor AND rooftop are delightful...and they know how to do a proper cocktail. The offereing of bicycles, yoga classes and curated evening activities go beyond expectations. I've already booked my next stay there.

The rooms were incredible. Such a modern feel while still maintaining a "cozy" feel. However, what stood out most was the knowledgeable, friendly, and professional service. Miss Lindsey Gershberg was incredibly helpful from the point of booking all the way through to checkout. Even after our stay, she helped me find out what pillows the Arlo used because i absolutely needed them! I fully recommend this to anyone venturing into NYC for a night or an extended stay!

I’m giving this place 5 stars because the devil is in the deets and they left no stone un-turned. So here's the thing about me...I'm a HOMEBODY and staying anywhere other than my home is a big deal. I felt at home the moment I stepped foot in the door. It was pretty busy but a really good busy. I was told that early check in could possibly be an option, but that it depended on availability. When I arrived they were sold out the night before and that was no longer an option. The way they handled it made all of the difference. Jason G. kept us in the loop when it came to the status of our rooms. No request was too obnoxious. After brunch, I offered to inspect my own room to help expedite the process, but he graciously declined my offer... He looked at me and I looked at him and we both burst into laughter...lbvs I was tired and needed to nap. The food in the restaurant was ripped right from the food network channel and it was delish! The servers were attentive and I just loved the host...I think his name was Rob or Ron. I might have made that up, so don't quote me on his name. He was a total Rockstar!!!Here's a list of my all-star team Jason, Kate, Don, Don, Gino and Daniel I and the guy that cleaned my room. The rooms were small but so personal...I loved the quaint space. My bed was super comfy. I adored the view of the court yard. The rooms had everything that I needed to make me comfortable. Here's my prayer for the hotel and it's amazing staff...don't get lost in the sauce. Keep your awesomeness! Stay young, fresh and excited about meeting people's needs. I truly believe this is what sets you all apart from everyone else in the industry. It's been a pleasure writing this review...you all have earned every single star. Keep up the great work.

The hotel is impeccably designed. I loved every inch of it. The staff was super friendly and the hotel was very clean. My room was the perfect size. It is small, but everything is designed so well, you don't even notice the size. It was perfect.

I enjoyed my stay in this stylish yet functional hotel. Lindsey at front desk is simply amazing, she helped me with bookings, ideas for sightseeing/days-out and also other recommendations.Arlo also has these events on certain days, like jazz music, wine tasting etc. It's conveniently located near shops, bars and restaurants. Highly recommended.

The proposal is that you will get minimalist rooms. And indeed they are. The designs are good and well thought and they certainly maximize the small space. Since I was travelling alone it did not pose a real problem. However, since the shower enclosure does not fully close, the bathroom floor was always wet after a shower!Breakfast was very good and staff is friendly and helpful.Would stay a secont time

Giving it three stars for the location, lobby/restaurant, and flare. Taking TWO stars away because you will not sleep well. The AC unit does not stay on and there is no way to make it stay on. It was originally at 74 so we tried docking it down to 66... guess what not even close. The AC turns on with a loud tick and an obnoxious fan noise then bursts cold air for a minute and a half (we timed it! We were so awake!) and shuts off. The room did not get anywhere close to cold, and definitely no where near 66. The unit doing this every five minutes was enough to call down in the middle of the night to change rooms. The manager on duty did accommodate our request to change and we moved almost immediately..... into a room that did the exact same thing?!! Except this one was better because instead of the AC doing this loud obnoxious turn on and off thing every five minutes, the length between bursts of air was every twenty. I guess this is standard and the only reason I write the review. The rooms do not cool off correctly and the sound of the AC unit struggling to cool off the room will keep you up all night. Good thing there's coffee?

Me & my friend stayed here for 11nights in May and we Loved every minute of it! The staff were super friendly & accommodating, we had a bit of a LONG travel day as our original flight from UK had been cancelled (we had be due to land in JFK at midday) so we had been re-routed via another UK airport arriving at the hotel over 7hrs after we had originally ment to be the staff we wonderful got us hot tea as it was now getting late an I personally had been up nearly 48hrs my friend nearly 24hrs! An every morning & evening we were greeted like we were friends and asked how we were doing an if they'd missed us after a day they would say hey let's catch up I've not seen you in a couple of days!! Made the stay so much more better not like the awesome hotel it self couldn't do that but they topped it off!! The roof top Bar was amazing so lovely & relaxing, price about average for cocktails, little more than normal for canned beers! But the views were amazing!Used the coffee shop a couple of times but only for coffee as the food was a little over priced for our liking but if I had been there on business I no doubt would have used it more as it was extremely convenient! P.S. The Soya Cappuccinos were AMAZING! And the door staff/porter esp one which at mo for the life of me I cannot remember his name but he was so lovely making sure we were ok An on our last day he kept checking if our transport had arrived!! We were Sad to leave! Fingers crossed I will be back soon!!

If ur after a newish style hotel with open share space facilities, casual dining bolt on (Harold's meat and three), good casual bar along with a cracking roof top bar and a great Coffee, I would recommend Arlo as a venue to drop in and or stay. If ur not fussed about spacious, the Standard rooms are small but perfect for a couple eager to see what downtown has to offer. If ur planning on sharing with a mate ( or in my case was with my son) a two bed option is a little cramped...suggest u see what studio rooms are available. The Arlo is well located to the subway on Canal st and close walk to Trendy bars, cafes and the fashion of Soho and surrounding areas.Michael (the manager) and his team are great and super helpful.Thanks again Arlo - Nick c (aka - iggynite on instagram)

It was my first time in NYC, and Arlo Soho was the second hotel I stayed at for the trip. Great location in the heart of Soho, therefore very close to many restaurants and shopping. Not hard for your Uber to find either! The staff was wonderful - very attentive, ensured they informed you about any events they had, as well as all their amenities. They have a rooftop bar - I did pay a visit to enjoy the view, but never had a drink. They also have a small cafeteria downstairs which appeared to be open 24 hours where you could grab coffee, juice, water, fruit cups, and various sandwiches.This is a micro-hotel so the rooms are fairly small, but very suitable if you're travelling solo, with a close friend, or as a couple. I had the courtyard view room. The layout of the bathroom is not your typical hotel style bathroom, but strangely enough, I actually liked it. I especially loved the fact that they included a handheld clothes steamer, as well as other amenities such as a blowdryer, small refrigerator, hangers and the Blind Barber bath products which smell amazing! Free wifi was a plus.I highly recommend.

Had wonderful experience at the Harlo Soho. Modern, clean rooms with great common space including a garden. The staff was helpful especially Sachin and Jason ; never thought NEwYork could be that friendly...Will definitely come back!

Location is fantastic, service is excellent, common areas are plentiful and comfortable, and what is that wonderful smell? Our recent long weekend in NYC was a great success and the Arlo most definitely contributed. Service is fantastic, girls at the front desk are very friendly and go above and beyond to help. Rooms are cozy, we had a twin room, plenty of space for our suitcases (under the bed)we were able to hang some of our cloths and store other items in the drawer under each bed. Very clean, modern hotel. Lovely shampoo, conditioner and body wash is provided in shower. Breakfast at the adjoining restaurant was excellent. I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, service, cleanliness and comfort.Well done to all staff at Arlo Soho!
