Great hotel! Very clean and cozy rooms, friendly, helpful staff. Would stay again at this hotel if in soho. We didnt get to check out the rooftop bar due to the rain however heard it was dope. The umbrellas☔️ in each room to use during your stay was an awesome touch!!!

I was just here on a business trip and couldn't have been more grateful for the helpful staff, particularly Kate at the front desk. She helped with recommendations and reservations. My room with the courtyard view was cozy and lovely.
user_location: New York, New York, United States
user_name:
Anne R
New York, New York, United States

review_body: Arlo Hotel is a very professionally-managed boutique hotel in the heart of Soho.The staff is top-notch. Everyone was friendly, helpful and ready to do what guests need in order to have a terrific stay.The location is right in the heart of Soho. My favorite area in Manhattan. Quiet area with great local restaurants and shops. Great location, walking distance to China Town, Meatpacking District, Brooklyn Bridge and much more! If you stay here, you can easily move around New York by metro. The hotel itself is very modern and unique. The rooms are small but are comfortable and beautiful! There are dozens of local bars and restaurants within a very short walk, however, the Hotel has a really nice restaurant and an amazing rooftop with a great view. Overall this is a pleasant place to stay especially if you want to be right in the middle of Soho surrounded by great places to visit.Can't wait to go back.

Great for business, family stay, friends, couples, etc. Great value and convenience. Staff was extremely helpful. Easy for UBER to locate, lots of surrounding black cars available at all times.Excellent experience overall!

The rooms are tiny bunk bed style. I felt like I was in a dorm room. There was no warmth with cheap plain grey tile, cheap furniture and a twin bunk bed which was suppose to be a king. The lack of amenities was odd. It was less than minimalistic. A very central location for that area though.

This hotel will be my newest go to in New York. Nice room, good restaurant and bar.Plus a really helpful and nice staff. The location is perfect. Has a great decor , but still comfortable.Very close to the Meatpacking, Soho and Skylight Clarkson Square for the menswear presentations.For me it was ideal.

Right form the start, The Arlo Soho stimulates all your senses upon arrival. As I walked through the doors I was greeted by a siganture scent. I immediately begged to buy it beacuse it was so good. The staff greeted me, checked me in and welcomed me with all of thier bubbly personalities and warm smiles. My stay lasted for a week and every single day they greeted me by name. I felt very special. The ammenities are top notch, the decor is a mid-century modern dream and the food is immpecable. If you get a chance, grab happy hour on the rooftop and take in the most spectacular view and sunset. If you are looking for your home away from home, and a cool one at that, book now- and book always. I know I will.

When I first arrived, it was a little hard to figure out where to go. The advertised address does not lead you to their front door. It was more around back. I ended up having to go through their restaurant.Front desk was very friendly and quickly got me checked in. The room was really great. It is minimalist.. but everything worked.The reason that I could not give a 5 rating was because of the bathroom. It is a little.. unconventional.It is a large frosted glass box. Very elegant looking. Very modern. The only downfall would be if I was sharing the room..The glass is frosted, but you can still see what is going on inside. And the very large gap in between the sliding door and the glass wall.. I could slide my whole hand through it.Perhaps there could be some kind of shower curtain on the inside as well?If you are traveling alone, I would definitely recommend this hotel.

I been to NYC more times than I can remember. I have not once repeated the same hotel. Not because the others have been bad, I´ve stayed at really cool places...small hotels, nicely designed, particularly that...good design. I guess I always want to pick something new.... Well, I picked ARLO SOHO HOTEL this time. Great location, amazing design, friendly people, very good service. Rooms are perfectly clean and distributed, the size of the room is adequate if you have same plans as mine which were: live NYC all day long, get to the hotel to rest in a nice place you feel comfortable and taken care of. I´ll be back, if they take me :)

We just spent 2 nights in the Arlo SohoHotel. It is a very trendy hotel in a good location outside the city centre $12 Uber ride from Times Square. The room was exceptionally small but the bed was extremely comfortable. The staff were friendly and eager to help. We had a couple of issues with the shower being cold on the second night and the safe not working but we don't sweat the small stuff. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

If you like chaos and tiny rooms this place might be for you .And believe me you should be honored to stay there according to their attitude .The waitress at the rooftop bar even asked my colleague for a bigger tip as she said my other colleague didn't leave enough.There are amazing hotels in New York- this is not one of them !

Lobby is very stylish and enjoyable. Check in experience was terrific. Sold out prior night, but worked hard to get us in earlier than standard check in time. Restaurant had a great breakfast and yummy menu options. Food was a little pricey, but it is New York. What do you expect? Room is small but still very comfortable with cool views and interesting bathroom configuration. Internet is quick as well. If I was in Soho again, I would stay here again.

My cousin and I took a trip to New York City last week.We stayed at Arlo Hudson Square Hotel Soho. We absolutely loved it and were completely impressed! The atmosphere is relaxed and stylish.The customer service was great. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Decor was modern, comfortable and functional. The area surrounding our hotel felt safe, there were several restaurants within walking distance and it was close to subway line.There is a restaurant, cafe, and rooftop bar on site. There were daily activities hosted by the hotel. Several areas to charge your devices or use your lap top. Access to bikes and a gym. The use of an umbrella if needed. The toiletries made by Blind Barber were really nice.Definitely recommend and be back again! I miss it already!

The Arlo is incredible! The vibe was very NYC, the scent throughout the hotel was beautifully relaxing and the staff were super friendly, fun & helpful! I must also mention the Blind Barber products on offer are superb! I will definitely be back.

Went to Arlo Soho with both of my parents ( so we were three in total ), and I must say the hotel has its negative and positive points, but the number of negative aspects of this hotel is very little. I see a lot of people complaining about the room size, to be frank it isn't as small as they say ( at least in my opinion. ). We took the twin room that overlooks the city view, and it wasn't crowded in the room - but it would have been better to have an extra bed for the third person. For those who aren't used to walking a lot & prefer eating outside of the hotel and in a restaurant, i wouldn't recommend this because the location isn't the greatest as restaurants are found a couple of blocs away.Nevertheless, this hotel has a ton of positive aspects.  First off, I must say the view from my room on the 10th floor took my breath away. You know those pictures you see on the internet where the bed overlooks the city? yeah, well the room we had was exactly like one of those pictures. When sitting on the bed, you can overlook the buildings that's just beside it and if you look closely, you can see the Hudson River so that's a plus. Quite frankly, this has to be the best rooms I've ever been to. The bathroom was big and it has its appropriate amenities. Secondly, the staff were very friendly and accommodating- from the front desk to housekeeping and the breakfast/dinner room. Front desk people were very accommodating when we checked in and checked out, the waiters / waitresses were very friendly that they would come to check us during our meal to see if everything was alright. I appreciated that very well !!  Thirdly, the food was average. If you're one of those people who expect a luxurious and grand buffet breakfast, sorry to disappoint but this hotel is not it. Instead, their breakfast was very casual and small but very filling to the stomach ! For dinner, it's also very filling since most dish are followed by 3 side dishes so that's very delicious !! I highly recommend the grilled salmon, that was delicious!

Amazing service, friendly and efficient. Rooms clean, and extremely comfortable.I used the bicycles and all they needed was a bell! Bars were fun and there was a great relaxed atmosphere.I would definitely return and recommend this hotel.

There's a lot to like about the Arlo. It's the most affordable NYC hotel we could find that still had a nice design aesthetic. We had a great view out of room 835. They had a 24-hour kiosk in the lobby where you could easily pick up a quick breakfast, snacks or drinks. The staff was very friendly. And we REALLY appreciated the umbrella that was free to use during our stay. But there were some negatives, too. The location was really awkward. You really had to navigate carefully around the Holland Tunnel entrance (it was a little intimidating) to walk back to the hotel. There are almost no restaurants or coffee shops right outside the hotel. You're only 5 or so blocks from them in Soho/Tribeca, but it feels far by NYC standards. The 24 hour kiosk in the hotel is great, but incredibly expensive ($7 for a bottle of water, which you need because the water from the sink is so gray I couldn't see my fingers through the glass!), although there is a deli right on the corner ($2.50 for a gallon of water there). Other negatives: the bathroom has a sliding door that leaves about a 3-inch gap, making it feel very not-private; and the noise from the rooftop bar made it sound like there was a concert going on all day (although it was turned down at a reasonable time in the night). I see a lot of other people complaining about the size of the room. Yes, it was small, but it's a micro-hotel - that's what I expected. And to be honest, it was a lot bigger than the room I stayed in at another luxury Greenwich Village hotel and a few places I stayed in Europe, so we were actually pleasantly surprised by the size. Despite the issues I listed above, I'd definitely stay here again. I appreciated being able to stay in a cool space, relatively near the Village/Soho/Tribeca, for a reasonable (by NYC standards) price.

fabulous staff. Lindsay was awesome. helpful. nice location easy access to subway via canal street. walking distance of fabulous Soho shopping and nightlife. interesting hotel rooms... nice for young people, solo travellers not for older couples tho

This hotel looks like a student´s hostel but in fact quite expensive. Rooms are too small. Do not take city view rooms because at first there is no view at all and secondly windows are so dirty that it is better not to look at it and close curtain. So city view are wasted money. Very simple things like eu/us eletric adapter are not available. I could not recharge my computer. Staff is friendly but not helpfull. This hotel is definately not the first choice..

The rooms are small, as anticipated, however they have been designed with an incredible attention to detail that maximizes space. Bed was very comfortable, excellent water pressure. Courtyard is lovely, rooftop bar is an added bonus. Staff were very courteous and helpful. Easy walk to Metro stations.

Stayed 4 nights for work and very much enjoyed it. Above all this hotel is very chic! Stylish communal space and a great roof terrace. Rooms are small as you would expect in NYC, but very well laid out and functional. The area around the hotel is great for shopping, people-watching and restaurants. Ill be returning for sure!

Great location in a old/new area Nicely designed in a new type hotels that is growing for the space of living .The bars and rooftop, very good and a must to visit .And order the drinks of the day Nice restaurante.

The hotel and the service are very good, free wifi.The location is good, near to soho.The hotel has a good cafeteria, but to expensive. The hotel Restaurant is too expensive for what they serve.The hotel rooms are way to small

Great spot for business in lower Manhattan. Easy walk to WTC. Good. dining in house and wonderful zpots nearby.Roof top bar is a hot scene. Rooms are small but have all you need plus lots of spaves to work, meet or hang out.I would go back.

My friend and I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square for a long weekend trip in late May. The staff were all very helpful and welcoming! Overall, our stay was good. The decor is very modern and it definitely has the trendy boutique hotel vibe! (Which is what we were looking for.) The rooftop bar was awesome and the bartenders were super nice and offered some great suggestions for other bars to hit up! There were a couple of small things that were slightly odd/ took away from the hotel itself. Our particular room had a very odd layout. We stayed in a twin bed room, and it would probably be fine for a couple, but for 2 friends it was odd. The bathroom and shower were open to the room (which we knew when we booked) however our particular room was arranged so that the beds looked directly into the toilet/ shower area. There was glass surrounding the area, but it was a bit awkward trying to watch TV when it was mounted to the shower if your friend was in the shower. The only other negative was honestly the location. The hotel is located right by the entrance to the Lincoln tunnel which made it difficult for cabs. And there isn't a lot in the way of food/ bars/ entertainment unless you walk a few blocks.

Great location right off Canal street in SOHO. Location is close to great shopping, food, 9/11 memorial and World Trade Center. You can walk anywhere. Hotel is beautiful, artsy and chic. Rooms can be small so prepare yourself. Beds are comfortable and it was a quiet night!! Food options at the hotel are limited to two, and at that, it is extremely expensive!!!!!! Especially for the tiny portions you get. Now, on the flip side the $29 Guacamole and chip is worth a try. Very tasty!!!! Nice hotel, very friendly staff. Would do again just for location!!!

This was a great hotel! We were first greeted by warm and friendly staff. Our room was very small by regular north american standard but actually, it felt super cozy. The bed was like a sleeping nook. The hotel is a micro-hotel so there is no room service. There is a mini fridge in the room (not stocked) but great if you purchase some drinks yourself. One thing I would recommend though, is have complimentary bottles of water for the guests in the room. The main areas are also cozy and well designed. There are couches and tables where you can hook-up your lap top and work. What makes this hotel amazing is the STAFF! They are so nice and are so willing to help. Especially Lindsey at the front desk, who worked tirelessly to organize sending at big package for me. She even continued communicating with me upon my return at home!!!! Unbelievable! I would strongly recommend the Arlo Soho

This is a really interesting hotel, with comfortable rooms and interesting decor--particularly the placement of the sink outside the bathroom proper, which was actually very much more convenient than the usual arrangement. The staff was friendly and efficient. The terraces and courtyard are great as is the location. We will definitely be returning.
user_name:
Steve C
Sayville, New York, United States

review_body: What a great hotel! Everything you would expect from a hotel, a warm welcome and great service. Our room was small but very well formed, having everything a traveler needs.One thing I must say is that the Arlo is exactly as you see online. A very funky Hotel.

Love the Arlo! The design was gorgeous and super trendy. The rooms are a bit small compared to some other places (it's a microhotel), but it was a totally reasonable size for our weekend stay. Who needs a giant hotel room? We stayed there shortly after it opened and had some issues with the hot water, but I'm sure they've fixed it by now. The only other thing that wasn't perfect was the loud a/c. Otherwise, it was phenomenal. It's close enough to LES (but a little cheaper than hotels there) and easy to get to most places via the nearby subway stop. I'd recommend it to younger friends visiting NY, but maybe not ideal for an older couple.

From the tiny lobby experience I loved it. Eclectic but fits the bill wonderfully. A fantastic grab and go which is open 24 hours. Coffee in the early hours of the morning is free but paid for later. Stayed in a Queen Courtyard room on the 7th floor. Small but perfectly functional. Everything works just right. Great co-working spaces throughout the ground floor and a library/meeting room on the 1st Floor.Food and beverage options but I didn't bother with so much on its doorstep.Highly recommended.

You walk into this place and it smells like coconuts. The staff were amazing and very helpful. Our room was a little small (it was a micro room) but very clean! The Wifi always worked, TV had a bunch of channels, easy access to food and a common area for people to sit and work or play board games.Would book again!

My boyfriend and I just got back from staying two nights at the Arlo Soho. We really loved this hotel! The customer service was great, the rooms were comfortable and modern, and the communal spaces were lovely. LOCATION: the location was perfect. It's just a block away from Canal Station (on the 1 line) so getting around from here is super simple. Soho proper is just a short walk away so there is plenty of restaurants and shops in the area. This is a very trendy neighbourhood.HOTEL COMMUNAL SPACE: the main spaces in this hotel are pretty awesome. There is a big lounge with plenty of sitting space. They even have board games! There's also a cute little garden patio. They have daily activities in the hotel as well. If you're a social person you would love it! It's like staying in a more upscale hostel. The washrooms are clean, and the stalls are fully private. FOOD: there's no room service, but there's a bodega downstairs where you can buy snacks. The restaurant attached to the hotel, Harold's was really delicious! It's a little expensive, but you get a lot of food for the price. The rooftop bar is great for drinks and checking out the skyline. It gets really busy in the evenings, and it is a very trendy crowd. ROOMS: the rooms are small but well-designed and functional. The bed was comfortable, and the storage is quite efficient. They have both block out blinds and ones that allow some light in... our room faced the courtyard, but with the blinds closed it wasn't a big deal. Loved that the room came with a fridge, as well as a very sturdy umbrella (it came in really handy when it rained all day in NY!). Our only complaint was that the washroom is just sectioned off by a frosted glass wall, so there is very little privacy. If you're sharing a room with someone, prepare to have some awkward conversations about using the bathroom! STAFF: the staff was absolutely lovely. They were very accommodating. We allowed us to check in early since we had arrived about an hour and a half early and luckily a room had opened up. They also offered to look after our bags after checkout since we still had a few hours before our flight. They also offered to arrange our transportation to the airport (we declined, but the offer was very much appreciated!) We would definitely stay here again!

Fresh, trendy, clean and functional micro rooms with great bathrooms and bed with tv in end of bed. Loud intermittent ventilation 24/7. Much appreciated, airy common lounge and work space on entrance level, close to Joes not so fresh food coffee shop. Clear navigation only from north, but bus Line some 3 blocks from entrance. If you want to go Midtown beware of time consumed by traffic jams. I'd not come back for more than 200$ room / night. Great and helpful reception staff and arranged happenings daily in hotel. Tips! Complimentary ear plugs would be a nice treat.

Love the Arlo. Love the Aces too, but more their west coast properties than the trying way too hard Ace NYC, which is now priced way too big for its britches. And is hipstered out to point of embarrassment. Arlo scores high in: Service - super friendly and helpful. Left my charger at home and they charged my iPhone at front desk and in restaurant while I ate breakfast and worked. Space. Well designed room that maximizes small footprint and manages to come off airy and warm at once. Lots of public area nooks inside and out with wifi, worked a full day there as did several other guests. Rooftop bar is a plus too! Location is great too. Very walkable right smack in SoHo plus a block away from the subway. Will def book again. Oops almost forgot bed is sooo comfy. That's important too.

Great hotel with lots of unique features and a super friendly staff. The interior courtyard is terrific as is the entire lobby space. Good for writing, thinking, working, hanging out with friends. The hotel organizing interesting events that change on a daily basis. The location is great is you like being downtown and close to great restaurants and the Hudson. Rooms are compact, but efficiently designed to maximize space.

My girlfriend and I had a great time staying at the Arlo for our Easter break. The hotel and room was spotless and welcoming. Such a good vibe with a cool lounge area and great dining areas. There is a very nice little shop in the lobby where we bought our morning coffees for our long days walking. Very cool and very trendy hotel. Very well connected by the Canal Street Subway which is 5 mins walk across the square. Apart from the traffic jam on the first day (right in the square), not too busy or noisy. My girlfriend was so happy with her complimentary birthday surprise organised by Arantxa! Thank you so much for that! It made her day! We had booked through Expedia who asked for a room upgrade for my girlfriend's birthday. I think we had the best room in the hotel! We were at the top residential floor at the corner of the building, overlooking the main square. I think the other side overlooks just tall buildings with no morning sunshine. Windows give you a great view of the morning sky in the square (where there are no tall buildings :-) ). We only visited for the Easter break so had so much to see and do. I only wish we could have spent a little more time in the hotel at the roof terrace bar which looks amazing from the pictures! Overall I highly recommend this Hotel. We booked well in advance and got good rates for the room so good value for money.

This hotel was our second in our first NYC trip and i can honestly say we were far from dissapointed. From the minute you walk in you are greeted by a quirky, friendly atmosphere and in that instant i knew we had chosen the right place. Check in was a breeze and the front desk team were exceedingly friendly. A quick scan around the lobby had me wanting to find out more about the cool canteen with its snacks and design orientated products. Our room was on the 10th floor overlooking Soho and even through Arlo brand themselves as a "micro hotel" we had more than enough room to breathe. The bedding was incredible, the view fantastic and the bathroom held the best shower i had ever had the pleasure of bathing in! During our 5 night stay we had breakfast at Harolds which was delicious and a drink up on the rooftop overlooking the sunset. I can honestly say that Arlo was an memorable experiance, one we will definitely look to recreate on our next trip to NY. Well done Arlo, you stole our hearts and captured our imaginations.

First of all a very good smell when you enter the lobby which bring you into a very nice atmosphere. Lobby decoration is really nice. Rooms are clean, modern and functional with great view on the city for those with option. Location is perfect, close to Soho, west village and south Manhattan. Service and reception is very nice

Stayed here for 6 nights when in town for business. Hotel is very trendy and there is a nice amount of space in the lobby to work if you prefer not to do this in your room. You would find bunch of young people there with you with their Macbooks. Plenty of charging points as well.Room was relatively small but clean and modern. Bathroom is a glass cubicle, which gives you privacy from sight but not from any noise as it has zero isolation.Loved the fact that there was empty mini fridge and you can just buy your own stuff from the deli downstairs.Also the restaurant was amazing with very friendly staff so didn't have to wander away for dinner after long day in the officeGood location, very modern, would stay again.

We stayed at Arlo Soho for 6 nights in April. The hotel room is small, we knew that from the description and the bathroom set up is not ideal for any couple trying to keep the romance alive, but we worked around it! Yes there isn't much hanging space but we hung what we needed and put our suitcases under the very comfortable bed and were more than happy. There was small steamer for pressing clothes that worked perfectly. However, the hotel is fantastic, the location is quiet and a short walk from some lovely restaurants and bars, situated in downtown, when we walked around uptown Manhattan we were SO glad we weren't staying in one of the shabby expensive hotels in the thick of it, it isn't our style. The Arlo hotel is amazingly clean, modern, amazingly decorated and has everything you need. The breakfast is delicious, the staff friendly and welcoming. It was so nice to stay in a hotel that had put in a bit of effort to be relaxing and comfortable. the communal areas were lovely I could have imagined sitting there with my laptop and relaxing as it was we were only in New York for 5 days so had to make the most. The tube was super easy from the Arlo and we walked home from Upper Manhatten most days stopping for a few drinks in the many bars along the way. Fabulous time and would most definitely recommend the hotel to anyone. We got Ubers from here and didn't have any issues as mentioned in other reviews.

I started smiling the moment I walked into ARLO, from the interior design, the staff's smiles and the yummy treats that await you right inside the door to the coolest "little" rooms". ARLO has thought of everything.

Stayed as a couple over Saturday night for a wedding in the area. Because I checked before booking, I knew that the rooms were beyond small - microscopic comes to mind - and that there were no closets. So we brought nothing with us but two hanging bags for our dress clothes. The rest of our clean clothes and toiletries went into a very small duffle bag. Luckily the twin beds had some space below them, or we would not have been able to store the duffle anywhere. There is literally NO walking-around space. The toilet/shower is claustrophically tiny with a sliding glass door one foot away from one of the beds. No privacy whatever. But the beds were comfortable, and there was no city noise to disturb our sleep.Had breakfast in the main restaurant on Sunday. Price ($21) not bad for a NYC hotel, except that the "full buffet" was the skimpiest I've ever seen anywhere - and that includes Best Westerns and Holiday Inns. No decaf coffee. No breakfast pastries of any kind. No smoked salmon (though listed on menu). Friendly but inexperienced staff. Can't imagine what people rave about, but as a local resident, I never stay at NYC hotels, so this may be the (unfortunate) norm.

If your plans are outlying below Canal Street find another place to stay. This location on Hudson above Canal is a problem. Canal is a horrible crossing at almost any point, but this close to the Holland Tunnel it seems like it takes decades. All of my Lyft and Uber rides were thwarted by the GPSs inability to navigate there. About the rooms, our deluxe queen was anything but. The room is so tiny that it can't really fit a queen bed: it was very short. I am. Just 6', and my feet hung over the bottom of the mattress. Not a pleasant night's sleep. They did give me a free toothbrush, though, and gathered decor is cool.
user_name:
F2450QFjohnh
New York City, New York

review_body: A five minute walk to Canal Street Metro, the Arlo on Hudson is a fantastic allrounder of a hotel. Friendly reception staff, spotlessly clean, funky elevator music and cleverly designed rooms. The rooftop bar has a great range of beer (and knowledgable local barman) and the breakfast is unforgettable (the overnight oats are just amazing).The rooms are the highlight though. Everything is fitted in just perfectly and it's the most comfortable hotel bed I've slept in for years; which was extremely welcome after an eight hour flight, one hour queue through customs and another hour in a taxi. I highly recommend this is a business hotel (the financial district is a hop on the Metro or a nice 30 minute walk through Tribeca) and there were plenty of tourists there too.I look forward to going back!

NYC is one of our favorite cities, and this time we chose to stay at Arlo. The hotel is small but the atmosphere is amazing.It is located close to everything. I personally love to work out, so even though I could try the boxing class, I was lucky to have a Soul Cycle studio nearby.

I had a lovely stay here. The staff was extremely helpful, courteous, efficient and accommodating. Particularly Amaris, who is a sunny, warm presence at the front desk. And she graciously allowed me a very late checkout when my flight was delayed. They have a number of comfortable bar, "living room" and outdoor areas to have a drink or a bite or to sit and work. Free WiFi, of course, which is great. The food at the restaurant was terrific, with a lovely manager whose name I didn't catch. My room was small but lovely. And I especially liked the cozy, enclosed bed/tv setup. Wonderful rain shower and really nice bath products. I will definitely stay here next time I'm in New York.

The Arlo is a great little hotel. Everything is sleek, modern, and hip without shoving it down your throat. The bar and lounge are doubles as a quiet work area during the day and the rooftop bar has great views and isn't overcrowded. The rooms, while small like a cruise ship, are very comfortable and well thought out. Very clean and modern. But the real standout was the staff. Incredibly warm hospitality. Every single staff member was polite, friendly, and professional. Maintenance and housekeeping as well, just so pleasant and eager to help. That's hard to find anywhere, let alone in NYC. A special shout out to Abby who really went above and beyond multiple times in helping with an especially difficult valet situation and storage of awkward items. Thanks, Abby!

I had a quick overnight trip to New York for a business meeting in Soho, and this was the closest location. As a micro-hotel, the room is basically the length of the king-size bed, which is positioned against the window. The view was actually pretty cool, and the window had both translucent and opaque screens. The bathroom was a shower/tub combo of sorts, all very modern. It was perfect for my stay. Note there is only a small table, so while the bed is big enough for a couple, there's limited space for luggage. So unless you're alone or comfortable with small spaces, I'd say this is best for single occupancy.

Very, very comfortable beds and pillows! Beautifully fitted out room (although I wouldn't like to be the cleaner as it's a very small space, fine for sleeping but not much else) and great communal areas. Very friendly staff. Lovely shower. Good value for money. Roof garden and bar available in good weather apparently with good view of Empire State building. Very central location for visiting Manhattan.

It was my first time in New York and was looking for a quintessential New York vibe. This hotel did not disappoint. The rooms were very cool. The common spaces are very trendy and comfortable. Staff is super friendly. I'll definitely be back.

So welcoming and cool atmosphere in the lobby, toproof bar and at the restaurant. Nice room even though it was small. I love the lemongrass products. I really enjoyed my four nights at Arlo. I'll definitely come back!

Very nice hotel. Very modern. Staff: EXTREMELY NICEGreat breakfast. Awesome location: walking distance to many local restaurants and attractions. Love the area. Hard to park so use the hotel valet parking!!!!Rooms are extremely small!!!

The hotel was very clean, modern, hip. Upon arrival, front desk (Emily) and bellman were very helpful. Emily let us know about surrounds restaurants, events, the in hotel restaurant and general information. We were able to check in at 12pm luckily which was convenient as we had plans for the entire day. The room's are small however -- how much time do you really spend in a room when you're in NYC? Very little. The bed was comfortable, the shower was so warm and spacious. Check out was so easy and convenient -- the only thing that was confusing was our $50 restaurant credit which was not reflected on our restaurant bill or check out information so we had to make a few callbacks regarding that. All in all, arlo Hudson sq's location, staff and hotel were all fantastic.

Standard queen size is like sleeping on a yacht, very nice but compact experience. But lack of room size means that all hotel guests hang out in in the lobby areas which are kitted out with work stations, bars, outdoor cafe and loads of sofa sets. Feels like WeWork with a hotel room attached..:). Breakfast had loads of healthy choices.

I loved Arlo in Hudson St. It's such a cool little hotel. Great little 24hr shop with awesome coffee with a barista. It has a restaurant and great chill out sections. The hotel rooms are tiny but all you need when in NY. Your hardly in the rooms. It also doesn't have room service but again who needs it when your in one of the best city's in the world. Highly recommend Arlo Soho. Walking distance to all the cool shops and meatpacking district xx

Stayed two nights for business. Nice little hotel, lobby is amazing. Front desk staff was polite, friendly and helpful. Arrived at 3pm and room was not ready, offered a free coffee in the bodega in lobby while waiting. I only waited a few minutes but noticed it got very busy with people coming and going. Space near front desk is extremely tight when two or three people are checking with luggage. You must squeeze between them with your luggage to get to the elevators. Also, it may be my age but the elevators are are a really dark red and black paint, making it hard to see the buttons. A few other people had this issue too. I had a nice room, queen bed with terrace. Thankfully I was aloneness because the room had a full glass door to the bathroom, a pet peeve of mind. What kind of privacy is that? Even if I was with my spouse there are some things I don't need to see. The bed is easily 6-8 inches shorter than a standard Queen bed. I heard the couple in line ahead of me at check out make the same complaint, and the desk clerk assured them it's a standard Queen bed, implying Mayberry beds sizes were different where they were from ( which ended up being Louisiana or something, so, WRONG). I think they hear that complaint a lot and have answer ready. Terrace view was great, lots of light. I found the room to be exceptionally quiet. I never heard a toile flush or shower run as is the case in many hotels. Outlets were in odd places, and no place to hang your clothes while using the steamer provided. There is no iron or coffee pot in the room, but there is a small fridge. Wifi worked fine on three devices. The hotel is in a nice location, room was clean, but I would stay not stay here again, especially when there would be two in the room.
user_name:
MacBratt68
Albany, New York, United States

review_body: Excellent from form to function.I'm a frequent business traveller and the Arlo is designed for my lifestyle: service, amenities, proximity, quietness and pricing are right on the mark.I will definitely return.

Outstanding front desk staff, Kate, Abbie and two men whose names I do not remember. They were always smiling, very polite, eager to help and had very positive attitudes. The rooms are small, but clean, neat and very adequate for the few hours one spends in them. The common areas are large, clean and neat (both inside and in the courtyard) and have lots of small groupings of chairs and tables so that one feels as though it is almost private. There are numerous power and internet connections. It is a wonderful place to stay in SOHO and the staff could not be better!

Fantastic hotel in a great location, easy access to the Subway and the hotel is really well put together, the rooms are as advertised, small but well formed! I would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly check it next time I visit NYC

Trendy and well priced hotel near Soho, Tribeca, Subway (1), Restaurant & Bar areas. Creatively designed small rooms, friendly staff with plenty of work area between lobby, bar and restaurant. My hip daughter loved it, we will come back for sure.

Small but perfectly formed rooms. Clever storage and spotlessly clean. Great location near Soho and Chelsea. Subway nearby.Bar areas lacked atmosphere in the evening but it's a great space and easy for a quick drink before moving on.Rooftop bar is good and probably fun in summer.Public spaces really work. Lots of areas to sit and chill.Good Wi-Fi. Good take away coffee.Totally recomend as a great reasonably priced hotel.

A great hotel to stay in! The rooms were small, but very convenient. The staff were very helpful, friendly and professional. We never ran into a problem from check in to checkout. There is also a subway just around the corner to get to downtown. Don't forget to check out the rooftop patio! Loved our stay and would definitely book with Arlo Hotels again!

I stayed in this hotel on a business trip and found the hotel to be very nice. The room was very small, however it was perfect size for one person. The staff was fantastic at helping with directions and restaurant recommendations. This is in a perfect location if you are looking to explore soho.

Very good location. Clean, cosy and nice rooms. Very helpful and smiling staff. 24/7 healthy snack bar at the entrance! And with a beautiful rooftop. Would definitely recommend for any kind of trip to NY!

This hotel is really really nice, the ambience, friendly staff, wonderful lounge make this a very cool stay, I will certainly choose this hotel next time I am back in NYC. The rooms are very efficient, small but have all you need, even a steamer and the beds are great. Most important you realize that the staff are enjoying working there which makes your stay very good and finally, the restaurant has really good food including very niece vegetarian options.

Went on the 29th march and the first impression was good, very nice lobby and bar and staff very friendly, as soon we reach our room was in shock, i can easily call a box with the bathroom on in glass, mean not privacy, no wardrobe, no facilities at all, no even a coffee or tea in the room, mean you have to pay for everything, like we had 2 glass of wine from the bar and we paid nearly $40. i can say that a part of the room the hotel is great but i wouldst stay there again or suggest to any of my friend, is really overpriced.

The hotel as soon as you enter the lobby conveys all his design full of character. Staff is friendly. The proximity to SoHo and the Village (Canal St & Spring St Subway) make it an ideal place to NYC.

My stay was amazing! The atmosphere was friendly and caring! This is the first Hotel stay where I felt that the staff really cared about my stay! Abby and Dan both provided exceptional concierge level service!

i was there over the week end. the room was great. The issue is with staff. smiles are rare, fake hipster attitude. When asked about close by restaurants, answers were vague and disinterested as if you are disturbing them. i travel a lot, and i am far from demanding but i am expecting that the front desk people know the area well. i asked the front desk clerk to make a reservation at a restaurant, came back 45 minutes later to ask from confirmation, the clerk told me that she would call within the next few minutes, results (related or not) no table available.

The funnest and coolest place, with amazing public spaces, the warmest front desk, and the most all-around hospitality I have ever experienced - and I travel for a living!Arantxa at the front desk handled my own reservation mistake ( I screwed up - not them!) with warmth and humor and found me a wonderful upgrade. Amil made sure I had everything I needed ( which was a lot!) to get myself home with gifts for the kids. My two separate clients who came in for drinks and dinners could not get over how warm and cool the place was! The rooms might be small, but the are amazingly well designed. This is a hotel to really relish and cherish. Top of the line - you will love it!

Now we all know that NYC hotel rooms are small, but this was unbelievable. If I stood in the middle of the room I could touch both side walls. Why they put a king sized bed in here for one person? Desk was a flip down board next to the sink. Location was a bit scary after dark, especially when I realized the windows were not-one way, so I had to watch my neighbors dress. Lobby was great, as was wifi. There is a great deli two doors north - ate there just about every night. Service and personnel were great. No more than one person can stay in one of these rooms - it is only for sleeping, forget getting any work done or relaxing in the room.

The rooms are small, but it is deceiving, they feel way bigger than they are, they are perfectly arranged to make you feel like you are in a much bigger space everything is at your finger tips. The beds are very comfortable. The showers have good water pressure, the staff are very friendly and helpful. This is my second stay at this hotel and I will be using it in future when I am in the city for work, it is the perfect place to decompress after a stressful day at work.

Stayed only one night. We had meetings around the neighborhood but worked there because the space has an incredibly huge lobby that is almost a co-working space prepared for plugging anything you want anywhere. The staff was very very friendly and helpful. I would definitely go back and even stay there for a family trip. It's right between SOHO & TRIBECA which means you can walk, find great places to eat and not be in the middle of a crowd. Great new find

Stayed at this hotel last week, for five nights, with a friend. We went to NYC to do some shopping, catch a hockey game and go to a Clapton concert. We arrived late because of our flight. This was no problem and we were met by friendly staff, both in the reception, the 24 hour bodega store and the roof top bar (where we had a nightcap). We got a room on the 10th floor, with separate beds and a nice view over the rooftops of SoHo. The rooms are kind of small, but smartly designed (like the little detail of two USB ports by each bed, for charging phone/tablet). Good size TV with enough channels.The bathroom solution might be awkward for some prissy non-couples. Half transparent walls that are not soundproof. No problem for a Scandinavian guy like me - you know sauna culture and all that.The room spotless when we came, and was cleaned perfectly every day. There were enough towels, toiletries and pillows. Could maybe have thrown in one of those vanity sets - shoe shine stuff (a lot of snow and salt the first days we were there).We had breakfast one day at the hotel. Nice and fresh continental buffet. I'm used to beverages like juice being included in the breakfast buffet, so I was a bit surprised by the price - butt no biggie. We didn't have time to eat dinner there, this time. The hotel is just a short walk from the Canal Street subway station, so getting uptown is no hassle. I really have to brag a bit about the service. I had ordered a package to be dropped of at the hotel. It didn't arrive on time, due to the "blizzard" according to the USPS. The staff in the reception called the USPS for me. The USPS were of no help, and said that the package would be returned to sender unless it could be dropped off while I was there. It arrived at the hotel the day after we left the country...I reached out to the hotel on email. The manager answered promptly and said they would send it to my house. It was a gift for my wife. It came today. She's all smiles.

This is genuinely the first hotel I have checked in to in a long time that I felt a very warm, personalised welcome. Both Dan and Natalie on reception are stellar examples of how to run a front desk - thanks! The communal spaces really make this hotel. Such a nice place to chill... I sat and worked on my laptop having a glass of wine and you just get such a nice New York vibe.Room was super clean. Small but then that's New York. Bed was super comfortable. Two negatives: 1) No complimentary water yet also no minibar to purchase any which was annoying. 2) No in-room safety deposit box which I just always find a bit disconcerting. But overall I had a really excellent stay and will definitely be back.

I stayed two nights in March 2017. The location is great, and the staff is very attentive and friendly. The rooms are small (I guess normal, by NYC standards) but clean and modern. I especially enjoyed the common spaces - lots of rooms to spread out, enjoy a cup of coffee, surf the web, and/or chat with your friends. The 24 hour "bodega" (market) was very nice, too. You'll love the modern vibe.A special shout-out to Kate for above-and-beyond service with a smile.

I loved everything about this hotel from the moment I walked in the front door. The people were friendly and entire hotel had a great vibe. There was literally nothing I would change about this hotel. It's a wonderful little gem in a great location.

Good hotel with clean and conviniece rooms. I don't like that there is no coffee maker in the room and mini bar was empty. Location is close to SOHO, Little Italy, China town and subway station. There are many tasty restaurants and bars around.

As soon as you walk in to Arlo Hudson Square, you'll feel the great vibe - There's Joe's coffee bar upon your entrance on the left, and there's a cozy cocktail bar with cozy ambience as you walk further. There's also several seating area with board games, long communal table for the travellers to discuss our future travel plans together at the back. Hotel also offers many other daily activities, such as live jazz, yoga, etc. Unfortunately we were not able to attend any. There's Harolds the hotel restaurant which we didn't get to try since there are so many other options in the area. Rooftop lounge opens until 12am and it offers a very chilled environment for you to grab some beers/drink if you don't want to be down on the first floor. Rooms are quite small - we were staying on the 3rd floor with a courtyard view (basically some walls) with king bed, an glass sliding door shower and sink is basically outside of the bath/washroom area. Compared to the other hotels that I've stayed in, it's smaller and it doesn't provides any complimentary coffee/tea/water bottles/kettle/coffee maker. Which was not a big deal for us. The area is close to Holland Tunnel and it's walking distance to SoHo. Thanks for providing us a comfortable 3 night stay Arlo Hudson Square :) Next time we might wanna try staying at Arlo Nomad because that area seems to have more activities going on.

Nothing but good things to say about this place!! Highly recommend! Service was excellent, the restaurant was great, the room was perfect. Great location. Would recommend to anyone. Had a great weekend!!!

Great hotel. Rooms are smaller, as expected for NY, but very well furnished and comfortable. Everything works and is well maintained. Hotel is beautiful, has a great feel and staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Would definitely go back.

Had a great stay here. I love the design and these, love the big windows in the room. They have great green tea body wash, shampoo and conditioner. We stayed in the Queen city view, the view wasn't all that great (this hotel is located kind of on the outskirts of nyc, very close to the Holland tunnel actually) But the view was still nice, bathroom was small but very clean. Staff was extremely nice and helpful they suggested a great brunch spot that we enjoyed. You should stay here loved it.

This place is very modern, smells delightful when you walk in, has a 24 hour bodega, rooftop with great views, and is surround by art and culture. The rooms are perfectly laid out to optimize the space (yes it is more European so smaller rooms) but we loved our King City View room; with the bed in front of the window it looked like the whole wall was a big window. Bed was comfy, room spotless, and it had blackout shades which came in handy when needing to sleep in. Would definitely stay here again - great remodel job Arlo. Cheers!

Rooms are small but extremely well appointed. Every detail is well thought out. No waste of available space. Extremely clean and modern especially the bathroom. Comfy bed. Top quality linens.One negative: sliding etched glass door for toilet/ shower area has a 1 inch gap between glass panels whereby a person on the toilet can be seen from another person standing at that exact part of the door. ..odd design.Great shower, nice soaps.Lobby area is very comfortable and has many tables, chairs, couches etc to relax or work. There are lots of outlets to charge your devices. Great atmosphere and vibe. Bike loan is free but we were not allowed to use them due to some lingering snow on the roads. Barring another snow storm, they should be available now.Friendly, professional and knowledgeable staff.

While this place has some positive qualities I was very disappointed overall. NO workout facility, no in room coffee, uncomfortable beds (mattress on wood slats!), loud and competing multiple music in lobby, and icing on cake is no hot water for shower on third morning here.

We stayed at The Arlo from the 17th March and just checked out this morning. The hotel is extremely clean and comfortable, the staff are warm and welcoming and the rooms (although compact....but that's pretty much all hotels in NYC) were well designed and very comfortable. Loved the twin room with the terrace, and although it had been snowing I still managed to catch a few rays. The hotel is in a very convenient location and walkable to many of the major attractions....we didn't use the subway or a taxi once. As a travel agent for a major global travel company, I will be recommending this hotel to all my clients and colleagues :)Thanks Arlo Hudson Square

I stayed at the Arlo over the weekend and found it a great little hotel to stay. Everything in Soho is a short walk away. The staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms even though compact was perfect for what we needed. I would highly recommend it if you want to stay near the Soho area.

We found the Arlo the perfect balance of comfort, design, friendliness, and accessibility to the rest of the city. We stayed four nights, and made use of both bars and the restaurant. The library / living room lounge areas are super cozy and nice to hang out in and work or socialize. The rooms are efficiently designed too—furnishings and layout are thoughtfully situated. I travel to the city often and never remember the hotels I have stayed at, but I'll remember the Arlo and would definitely consider another stay.

I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square in Soho for a week in February 2017. I was there on my own so the room was perfect for me. It was smallish but no smaller than the New York standard. I loved the design of the room. The king bed was set in up to the window so it was lovely sitting up in bed in the morning with a city view. The blind system was awesome! 2 blinds was were button operated - sheer and blackout. The widescreen tv was at the end of the bed. I stayed in the sixth floor and it was really rare to hear any traffic noise. The only problem I foresee with the bathroom is that you would want to know the person you are sharing the room with rather well. The glass is frosted however it is not sound proof. I don't know if the set up is different in the rooms where there are 2 beds. Harolds Meat and three is downstairs behind the lobby. I really enjoyed my meal there and would recommend getting the salad bar option with your meal, it was so good. I would have returned for just the salad bar if time permitted. I had a very packed schedule whilst I was there so wasn't able to take part in the hotels activities. I think they are a great idea and range from a boxing class at the gym next door, to a wine tasting session with their sommelier. All staff members I deal with here really nice and helpful. Particular thanks to those who helped me at check out as I was running late for my shuttle and they got me through quickly.

Hip and young crowd with modern minimalistic rooms (e.g. Glass door on the bathroom, no drawers, a view hangers on the wall, sink outside the bathroom). Great staff and easy access to the subway (Local 1 a block away and the E is a few blocks).

This is a tough one. On one hand I loved it, on the other I was pretty disappointed.My teenage son and I spent 4 nights at the Arlo in a bunk bed room. The room was very small, but adequate and the beds were very comfy. The location was absolutely perfect for what we wanted to do. (shop in SoHo and do a bit of sightseeing)However, the bathroom situation was bordering on inhumane. I knew that there would be a frosted class door on the bathroom. What I didn't know was that door would leave 3 - 4 inch gaps on either side, so that you effectively have NO privacy in the bathroom. I just don't get it! How can you have a room marketed to 2 people and then not give them a properly closing bathroom door?Also, the ladder on our bunk bed had obviously been broken in the past and then repaired by screwing it directly to the bed frame. (hard to explain if you can't see it) Anyway, that created a situation where it was ever so slightly tilted backwards - making it really hard to climb up and down - borderline dangerous.One of the TV's in our room didn't work. The issue was dealt with over several days, and in the end it could not be fixed, so we were offered to change rooms. By that point, we only had a day and half left in NYC, so moving was pretty pointless.Overall, the Arlo is a very funky boutique hotel that goes out of its way to make your NYC a great one, but there are some pretty big flaws/inconveniences that shouldn't be there in a hotel of this caliber and price. If I found out that they changed the bathroom doors (or if I was alone), I'd definitely stay again.

First time trip and hotel well located for sight seeing and near to canal street for the subway. Public areas very comfortable however room was too small for us, bed against window and no room to move around. There is no space to unpack just a few hangers. The toilet and shower are behind a glass sliding door but zero privacy be aware. Expensive for food and drinks but plenty cafes etc a shirt walk away.

Myself and my brother stayed for five nights. The hotel is the definition of hipster and there were plenty of hipsters around (my brother included!), but the overall clientele was mixed between middle aged and young people. A lot of people we passed in the elevators appeared to be there for work. The staff were very courteous and friendly.The twin room was clean and very compact. They packed a lot of things into quite a tight space, but it worked! We had fresh towels every day. There was a hair dryer and clothes steamer in bags by the sink (which was in the room). Bathroom (toilet & shower) was a good size despite being only a frosted glass partition. In the shower there was always hot water and consistent water pressure. The complimentary umbrella in the room was a welcome addition!The rooftop bar had a limited selection of cocktails, some of which were lovely, some of which were stomach turning. There was a respectable selection of gins and whiskeys. They were also a tad expensive. We didn't eat in the hotel.Location-wise, bars and restaurants are within walking distance. Everything else was within subway distance, with Canal St and Spring St stations being only a five minute walk away. The room could get quite noisy from traffic outside at times due to the proximity of the entrance to the Holland Tunnel - but maybe it's the same everywhere in NYC.Overall it suited us well. A place to rest our heads, freshen up, and good location for accessing places to eat and drink and major tourist attractions. The price of rooms reflected this.

Very nice location in Soho/Tribeca-area. Short distance to very nice parts of Manhattan as Soho, Greenwich Village, MEatpacking, Chelsea... Subway very close as well.Modern hotel with young and "chic" guests. Small rooms with a "glass" bathroom minimizing any hope of privacy from your partner... Rooms are very nice though. One disturbance was a noisy aircon. Turned it if and opened the window at night.Staff is super friendy and helps you in any way to inform and help you around.Hotels in NYC are generally expensive. Taking this into consideration this is a good value hotel.

Walking into this room was like walking into a sleeper car in a train. The first thing you see is the bathroom sink in the hotel room because there's no room in the bathroom. There was no closet or drawers so I had to live out of my suitcase, but the room was so tiny that I couldn't open my suitcase all the way. The bed is bordered by the window and two walls so you had to climb onto it from one side. There are no bedside tables. I have terminal cancer and have to take meds in the middle of the night. I had to climb over my daughter and walk to the sink to take my medicine. The bathroom is made of frosted glass within the room and the door is on a rail. There's three inches between the "wall" and the door so there's no privacy while you're in the bathroom. There was a problem with my room door-it was really difficult to open. I asked for it to be fixed and it wasn't. This definitely draws a young crowd so be prepared for drunk people making a lot of noise. I had my suitcase and my daughter's suitcase when I arrived and I had money ready to tip the doorman/bellhop. There wasn't one. I wasn't asked if I wanted help with my luggage. I struggled to my room with the two bags. The mattress was so hard that I couldn't sleep. I'm so disappointed in Priceline for billing this as a four star hotel. I called them and was offered 5% off of my next Express Stay.

Well designed, well located and very professionally run. Rooms are smaller but still very comfortable. Common amenities are excellent and are designed to complement the rooms. An excellent choice for a base in NY city.

This past weekend my hubby and I decided to do a spontaneous night stay in NYC. My brother in law suggested the SoHo area for us and the hunt for hotel room was on. We found the Arlo Hudson Square by the HotelsTonight app. For $150! What got a steal! We even searched a promo code and the HotelsTonight website gives you a $25 off promo code (code - TONIGHT). The area itself is cute and young. The hotel is hipster with hip hop blasting as we walked in. To valet your car a day is $65 which is basically what you would pay for any other garage. We received the BESSSSSTTTTTT service from Emily! Emily blew my mind with her customer service and her knowledge of the city. I asked for a room on a higher floor and got moved from the 3rd floor to the 9th floor. Emily even gave us 2 free drink tickets to enjoy the roof top bar on the 11th floor! The roof top bar was adorable! It was hip with amazing views of NYC! We had a full view of the Freedom Tower!Our room was small with a King size bed. We were not bothered by the size of the room because it's what you expect for New York right? The toilet and shower is small but, the hotel is perfect is you are looking for just some where to crash for a weekend get away.

We spent 4 comfortable days at the Arlo Hudson Square and with a few reservations give it a thumbs up! I chose it for the chic and modern décor and we were not disappointed. The spacious lounges, working area, patio,and bar are the perfect places to relax, people watch and meet up with like minded travellers. The small but well designed rooms are equally attractive, but perhaps minimalism has been taken a bit too far! No ledge or bench for your suitcase, no drawer to store things and only a few hooks for hanging up clothes. (suitcases on the floor both awkward and untidy!) No shower door or curtain led to water, water everywhere in the large bathroom. We liked the basin separate, ie, in the room, but could have used a hook or rod for a towel.For peace and quiet our room on the courtyard was ideal and staff were unvariably pleasant and helpful. I would recommend this hotel for young and convivial travellers who will enjoy the happy hour events and lively company. Close to several metro lines for exploring the city.

I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square soon after it opened last year. It was just delightful, with all of the amenities you could ask for, as well as very hospitable service. The rooms overlook Hudson Square, featuring full-height windows and a very comfortable double bed. Each detail of the room is carefully thought out, maximising comfort and design despite the compact size. The bar and roof terrace have a lively atmosphere, while Harolds does one of the best burgers I've had in NYC. While we were in town, we had the pleasure of looking around Arlo NoMad. If you have a chance, make sure you try the fried chicken and maple syrup pancakes (this was an enlightening moment - realising fried chicken and maple syrup are a match made in heaven. My jeans haven't fitted the same since); then take a trip up to the roof terrace and look down through the glass floor. I will be returning to New York in a few weeks and look forward to making my stays regular at Arlo.

This hotel is more of a boutique hotel, but it's very quaint and centrally located! There's a rooftop bar and a restaurant on the main level. The service is also awesome! Emily was super helpful!! Definitely stay here

I loved all the shared spaces, the restaurant (although we didn't get a chance to eat there) was nicely designed and the open areas were fun. The rooftop bar was cool, I can't wait to go back when it's warm enough to go outside - Bar top inside (rooftop) was really sticky which was kind of off-putting. The bartender let us know he knew about the issue and did wipe it down to show it was clean but it seemed like the finish was coming off and that was causing the stickiness. The room was small but clean and functional. The bed was uber comfortable and the shower was outstanding. The constant switching on and off of the HVAC all night was annoying but pretty standard in NYC. Lighting in the room was tricky to figure out. A Bedside table for phones etc. would be great, although I used the little stool and that worked okay. Emily at the front desk was great - she gave us a wonderful recommendation for dinner at a nearby Italian restaurant that did not disappoint. Overall a great stay and I'll definitely be back when travel requires Soho stay.

Abby at the front desk greeted me warmly and assigned me a nice quiet room and was able to get me checked in immediately when I arrived at 10am.This time I got a room with a kings size bed which went from wall to wall but fortunately there was no need to be able to walk around the bed to the other side since I was by myself. The space is not large, but they have a nice lounge area next to the lobby with comfortable chairs and sofas to enjoy your morning coffee from the lobby café. I do wish they had a but more assortment like the Arlo NoMad but their space is very limited so this is understandable.The morning and days were very enjoyable for relaxing in the lounge but in the evening the music volume here and at the entrance to the hotel restaurant was turned which made it not so inviting as the different music selections competed against each other. The location is great, just two short blocks from Soho and Canal Street where there were several good restaurants and cafes. Several subway lines also stop nearby which makes it very convenient though the A line from the airport is rerouted to the F line away from the hotel due to maintenance work, but the E line still works for the airport run. I was impressed by the high quality over all from staff to room to amenities like the morning coffee, good dinner place next door, free hotelwide wifi and best of all at a very good cost for the area.

I've stayed for a week at the Arlo Hotel Hudson Square and it was a very nice stay. The hotel it's new and clean. It's perfect if you want to stay near the "cool" area like SoHo and West Village.I really recommend and appreciate the hotel Staff that gave all the support we need.

I visited the Arlo hotel this weekend and everything about my stay was amazing. The location allowed us to walk to shopping in Soho and Canal St. We were less than a 20 min drive from the Barclays Center. Hotel staff was friendly and welcoming. During my stay I was able to eat at the hotel restaurant and the food and drinks were amazing! The bar and lounge space through the main floor were also extremely comfortable and aesthetically pleasing. Without a doubt I will be staying at the Arlo again!

Call me old fashioned but I like a real door on the bathroom especially when I'm in a micro sized hotel room. Only stayed one night and felt very claustrophobic. As others mentioned no closet, no shelf space, sink in the room. The rooms are very small even for NYC. The common areas have a very hipster vibe, and front desk staff were lovely. Great neighborhood, nice to be away from the mobs of tourists. I would stay at a hotel with larger rooms, but spend time in this neighborhood and maybe even relax in the common areas.

Nice newly built hotel at walking distance from Greenwich Village, WTC, and Hudson River Park. Clean and nicely decorated compact rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff. Only negative were the lack of proper door to the bathroom (the sliding "door" provided little privacy, but that may be customary in New York?), lack of restaurants and delis in the absolute vicinity of the hotel, and the strong odd smell in the reception.

New, hip but cosy hotel close to Soho/Tribeca.. nice and friendly staff, hotel lobby designed for gathering, perfectly equipped for electronic addicts. Rooms are really tiny but if you book a room with terrace this compensates.. well furnished, pragmatically thought. Don't bring a big suitcase though and do not expect to unpack it - no closet - good for short stays, we stayed there 5 nights and no problem for us.. did not try the restaurant, just once for breakfast but would recommend to find something in Soho neighborhood or walk 5 blocks up and go to 'le pain quotidien' - would come back to this hotel if I wanted to stay close to Soho!!

The accommodations were amazing! Clean, comfortable, well appointed rooms. Eclectic and fun places for drinks and food. EMILY was an invaluable concierge and day planner for these first timers to NYC!!

This is a wonderful, well appointed hotel in a good location. The rooms are compact but well designed and, for my partner and I, had everything we needed. Very much appreciated a steamer instead of an iron and the queen bed was very comfortable. I usually take a night to adjust on vacation (the first night sleep tends to be restless) but not at the Arlo. Slept like a baby.We booked a city view room and it faced the back (Renwick St) and found it to be a bit quieter than those that face Hudson St. Nothing that earplugs won't fix though.The lobby and main floor common spaces are gorgeous and a great spot to have a coffee and danish in the morning. Stylish and comfortable seating is everywhere with an energetic but not intrusive soundtrack pumping through. They also offer events in the space that guests can take advantage of like wine tasting in the evening. We'd intended to try one out but the city outside our door kept us pretty busy.Will definitely recommend and would book again.

We stayed here for one night with our kids. Arlo put us in a combo room that had a bunkbeds connected to a second room with a king bed. Everything was impeccably designed and executed-from great showers and comfortable beds, to great views and friendly service. We loved the cozy design of the bedroom alcove, complete with handy reading lights. Lastly, the chocolate cake and order of fries we got from harald's were remarkable. Easy access to 9-11 memorial and battery park rounded out the experience.

Stayed here 3 nights. Loved the hotel and everyone was friendly and helpful. Loved the morning coffee at joes. They even upgraded our room when we checked in. Great location. Will definitely stay here again.

Great priced hotel in central location - perfect for just meandering around the local areas.Room was compact (queen) and you really could move from shower through toilet and to the other side of bedroom in 5 steps (tried it!) but really isn't a problem. Room was nicely appointed both from style as well as gadgets (fold out desk etc).Reception and bar staff were all very friendly and seemed to be through genuinely being happy to be there rather than faked on! Downstairs hotel areas all well appointed and welcoming Would definitely come back

My partner and I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square for 5 nights this past week and would recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to NYC!In terms of location, this hotel is near the Holland Tunnel (on a side street) and is a walk away from several subway lines. It is an easy walk to Soho, Nolita, Chinatown, Tribeca, Chelsea Market, and Little Italy all within 10-15 min. A great location which allows you to explore lower Manhattan at your own leisure without having to compromise on price. The location alone is what attracted us to the hotel at first since we wanted to stay in a less busy part of the city.The hotel is itself gives off a very trendy vibe; upon entering you are greeted by friendly and warm staff who will try to cater to your needs. Check in and check was incredibly efficient and fast. Staff were friendly and we were given a free room upgrade due to our early arrival to the hotel. We were promptly given our keys and were on our way. Check out was great too, the staff asked us if we wanted to store our luggage or even call a taxi. Service of the hotel staff were great too, we had bought a bottle of wine and asked for a wine opener which was promptly given to us. The housecleaning staff also did a great job with keeping our room clean. The interior of the hotel is very modern and minimal. The rooms themselves are not big but serve the purpose of sleeping. Even though there is not much space in the room themselves, the design of the space is well thought out. The lobby of the hotel is decorated beautifully and a great place to lounge around. There is a coffee shop and store in the lobby with a unique selection of snacks but we didn't purchase anything from there.The rooftop bar and patio was also great to have a few drinks at. Overall, great location, staff, and vibe at Arlo Hudson Square. Would not hesitate to stay again and would recommend this hotel to others.

Spent three nights, enjoyed the stylish, no-frill room, the comfortable bed, the spacious and elegant lounges, the excellent restaurant - pretty much everything. The desk personnel was super helpful. I'll definitely be back!

This hotel is ideally located and has a fantastic rooftop bar! Staff is friendly, it smells amazing (signature scent throughout), free wifi...activities and cool common areas...it really is great! As far as the rooms, they are small, but make great use of the space. There isn't a closet,but we had plenty of room with hanging racks & drawers. The bed is very comfortable, and though right next to the window, it was quiet. Steamer in the room and excellent toiletries. The only quirk is the bathroom...spacious enough, but just a frosted glass cube in the room with a sliding door that doesn't fully close...so no privacy! As long as you're staying with someone you're comfortable with, it is ok..but potentially very awkward! We had a great visit and would stay here again.

Room linens pristine, beautifully designed, large floor to ceiling windows, small square footage, clothing steamer, hair dryer, fridge, in room. Lots of shared spaces in the lobby second floor lounge and library, cool funky vibe, felt very safe, close to transit. , and I liked the shower products, a very nice, clean lemongrass scent. The room lacked a kettle. Dan and Abby were very curteous front desk staff, and very helpful.

The location was perfect! A few steps away from SoHo and a couple of blocks from the best restaurants in the West Village. The room was super cute, clean and stylish - we felt so posh staying there haha!I would highly recommend the Harolds restaurant too for food and great cocktails.

The hotel was really great. The open community spaces, bar, restaurant are really great. Excellent for couples, singles or business travel. The rooms are very small but really have everything you need. Once you get used them they are really good actually just not alot of room to move around.Service was excellent everywhere.Close to SOHO and subway.Location is great.

We walked in early morning expecting to drop our bags and check-in later when we were greated by a very courteous and friendly gentleman teliing us they had a room ready. So lucky!The team was so incredibly bubbly and hospitable, and that just after sunrise, it was such a treat to get this kind of a welcome (obviously the early check-in was a plus!). Loved the hotel the moment we walked in - very well designed, modern but a great combination of colors and textures, right out of a home/architecture magazine!It's the small touches which made it more quirky, like a guest board right outside the elevator where guests could leave recommendations for places they discovered or really liked or even leave their metro card behind for the next guest to use. They had board games in the lounge and plugs (by Conway Electric!) everywhere.The coffee shop in the lobby was very efficient and served great coffee to go (or enjoy in the lounge) if you would not have a meal in the hotel restaurant.The rooms were fairly compact, but had everything you need, especially as we would be out all day anyway. The bed was super comfortable with two clocks which you could set to your home time zone and the local time.The rooftop bar was simple but had a decent view and basic bar service. Walk around the hotel and you can find the conference room, another terrace and a well designed restaurant with an all-day menu.The bar in the lobby was the only let down. One bartender who may have just been covering for someone, and though he was extremely chatty and confident, drinks were just terrible. Hurt watching him trying to make cocktails. Nevertheless for a straight drink it was good enough.We would definitely come back, maybe try the other location. Here a summary:+ Great staff, helpful, friendly, great hospitality!+ convenient location to discover some not so overcrowded areas and find some hidden gems+ Coffee bar in the lobby (with other takeway items), great cup of coffee!+ Overall design + Guest recommendation board+ Room design with fun elements which did not just look good but with function+ Mattress and bedding quality+ free wifi+ cleanliness- Bar / Drink quality(room size is considered neutral, for us it was perfectly fine, but depending on the purpose of trip maybe slightly small)

From the moment I walked into the lobby, I was pleasantly surprised. Great care has been taken to make the environs chic and comfortable (there's even a signature scent in the hotel that just subtle and wonderful). The woodwork and decor are tasteful and the staff were charming! Highly recommended .

Very much enjoyed our visit , what a cool little hotel with a warm and laid back atmosphere and all staff were very welcoming and friendly . Room was perfect for our needs and my concerns it would be to small we're laid to rest as it was a great size for our needs and for a 4 night stay . Loved the gorgeous aroma around the hotel when entering ! Only very slight minor disappointment was that we were hoping to borrow and use the hotel bikes one day but we were told they were out of action due to outwith season yet the bikes were in the courtyard . Not a major big deal but had looked forward to a cycle while in the area . But overall we loved the hotel and the area and would recommend 100% . Absolutely delighted about our choice to stay at Arlo and we will be back again in the future ! Many thanks !
user_name:
Paul C
Glasgow, Scotland, United Kingdom

review_body: It's located extremely well to walk everywhere in Soho, close to the Spring metro station, amazing hotel with really friendly staff. Totally recommended! I would repeat my experience here. The rooftop bar is also really nice and with good drinks! In the area you will find at 10-20 mins walking amazing restaurants and cool stores

The minute you walk through the doors you know your home. The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful. Yes the room was a tad small but the large personality of the hotel more than makes up for it. The toiletries in the shower are the best in any hotel Ive been to. The beds are extremely comfortable and the traffic noise was minimal. The restaurant food is second to none with extremely friendly staff. The location of the hotel was really easy to get to any of the places you wanted to visit. They will sort out transport to the airport for you. The snack place in the lobby has some delicious snacks. Tips for a better stay : none its all good

Lovely, modern place in a great location near Greenwich Village. Room had double bed and bathroom with frosted glass door; enough room for just one person. Room faced courtyard, so street noise was minimal. Lobby has upscale "bodega" with snacks and breakfast items. Staff courteous and helpful.

Everything was dead on! Right when you walk in it smelled incredible with the friendliest staff! Room was clean, ready and so cool! The rooftop bar was a lot of fun and the bartender helped us find amazing local spots!

Mini rooms, noisy, area OK (entrance to Holland tunnel, much of traffic) and extre.mely expensive (5,50$ for a small bottle of water). This was really no good experience, event though staff was friendly

Brilliant location, new hotel so very clean, everyone looks after you very well. Kate in the concierge especially, she booked us tables at restaurants that were booked up and nothing was an issue to sort out. Haven't got a bad word to say.
user_name:
