Rick_Gayton
New York City, New York

review_body: Absolute pleasure staying at the Arlo Hudson, its a great stylish hotel but what made it were the staff. Especially Kate on the front desk, she sorted us out so many times, booking us restaurants, advising us what to see whilst here, and generally being as lovely and helpful as possible at all times. Legend! Can't wait to come back.Darren

We enjoyed our couples stay at Arlo Hudson Square! Upon check-in, the two front desk attendants greeted us pleasantly even though it was 9pm. They were sweet enough to upgrade us when we asked for a high floor and upgraded us from a Queen to a King room! We were on the 6th floor, city facing, overlooking the entrance for the Holland Tunnel. We assumed because it was such a busy road area that we'd get a lot of road noise but there was very very little road noise.. the noise came from the hallway! The room was modern and cozy for a micro-hotel with a good amount of small amenities built into the room (usb charging ports galore). The bed was firm but comfortable and we loved the little nook it was in with the television and I could just lay in bed and look out the window over the city which was magical. There's a powered sheer curtain and black out curtain which were nice. We didn't do much discovering of the hotel because we were taking in the city but the hotel is centrally located which is nice to get to Battery Park and Times Square, etc. Only thing to beware of is that the bathroom/shower are sectioned off by a sliding glass door and you can hear your significant other doing their business.. we thought it was funny but others may not so I wanted to write it! Not a huge deal. We enjoyed our stay at Arlo and would definitely stay here again.

We had the pleasure of staying at both Arlo locations in one trip, and we can say that while both are very excellent, they are quite different. This location is located in the Hudson Square area with excellent proximity to Greenwich Village and all of the fun and nightlife it offers. It is walking distance which is very convenient. The room in this one is efficient and small, but it's creatively done. The bed is in a wooden cube, which if I had to find a complaint it would be that the person closest to the window wouldn't be able to get out of bed with our going over the person nearest the door. The front desk clerk was extremely welcoming and wanted to tell us about all of the amenities the hotel offered. There is a bodega, and a meat and three restaurant on the first floor, so you don't have to leave if you don't want to. One thing that impressed us is the only issue we had was the TV in the room would not turn on. This problem was amplified because the Super Bowl had just started. The repairman could not get it to work, but he told us to go to the lobby Super Bowl party and enjoy the game and food for free while he swapped out the TV's. The service was quick, and we watched the second half from the comfort of our cube bed. The shower is very nice, with excellent water pressure and good shampoos, conditioner, and body wash. The room came with a hair dryer, steamer, umbrella, and plenty of towels. We enjoyed our stay and will certainly stay here on another NY visit.

My trip was primarily for business, so I was looking for a cute, convenient hotel near the visiting office. The Arlo Hudson definitely exceeded my expectations. The staff was friendly, on-point - Abby at the front desk was the sweetest one of the bunch and got me from A to Z. Especially loved the lounge and roof-top bar. I'm a romantic at heart, so the rose and heart-themed decor bowled me over. A must for lovers and business trekkers alike.

Reception staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was compact but cleverly designed with nice fixtures and the shower was amazing. The hotel was exceptionally clean. The lounge areas are comfortable and stylish and the hotel is in a good location. Rooftop bar looks good for spring/summer.

My boyfriend and I were wonderfully surprised by the Arlo's chic, modern decor with efficient use of space and pleasant customer service. Our king room with courtyard access was absolutely tiny (upon entering into the room you immediately are beside the bathroom sink which is outside the toilet/shower section), but it provided everything we needed with a small fridge, desk, under-bed storage and a nice TV. The free wifi worked well and I LOVED the fact that checkout was at noon. We were also able to store our bags and the hotel allowed us to borrow their last two umbrellas during our final day in the city after we had checked out. Lots of space on the ground floor of the Arlo with a coffee shop, bar and restaurant allows for space to lounge and relax, even though there isn't a lot of space in the room to do so.

Stayed for 3 nights, stylist hotel & great value ! Compact but well designed rooms. Great living room & library for guests. Well located in Tribeca, 10 minute walk to soho, 5 min to subway. Great service, will be back. Highly recommend.

This small new hotel is beautifully designed, especially the bar and lounge areas. There's a lovely rooftop bar and deck too which will be great in the warmer months. The rooms are small but so cleverly designed you don't really notice. Perfect if you're traveling alone. And the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The staff are all so friendly and welcoming. Kate on the front desk had great suggestions for shopping and dining. She really knows her city. Gino the doorman was helpful too. Good location for lower Manhattan and a couple of blocks to the subway.

Good location and that's about it. This is a classic case of let's see how many rooms we can squeeze in one building but not consider how we can deliver a service. NO space in the room, you have to crawl around the bed. Nowhere to store clothes so you'll live out of a suitcase. No service, if you ask for something you're told to hang on or wait (and you will wait). Bar overpriced and staff cheeky enough to ask for a tip. No hot water one morning and told to wait for 30 minutes rather than offer another room so we could get on with our day. Not worth the money, plenty of other places to stay in this gorgeous area of NY. No mini bar and if you want a cup of tea you have to go to reception where you'll pay $6 for something 'organic'. Top tip if you go, don't bother buying anything there, there's a great corner store a few minutes away where you'll get a great breakfast and a smile for free.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Arlo. The hotel is clean, modern and the staff were accommodating and friendly. The Arlo is a cool boutique hotel, located in a terrific neighbourhood, close to the subway. The rooms are compact, yet highly functional. If you're comfortable hanging out in shared spaces then the size of the room is inconsequential. Designed efficiently, I appreciated every aspect of the hotel, right down to the bathroom amenities. Pop up to the rooftop bar for a great perspective on the city. I would definitely stay here again. It provides hip luxury at a reasonable price point.

I had an exellent 3 night stay at Arlo Hudson Hotel. Check in staff (I think her name was Natalie) was very friendly and professional. Even though I had to move to another room due to a noisy heating system on the first night, I enjoyed my stay very much. Rooms are small but they are well designed and I had eveything I needed. The level of service I received was absolutely 5 star. Thank you everyone.

Arlo is such a welcoming and pleasant hotel. The way they arranged the lobby really makes you want to hang out and work there. The rooms are super clean, the staff is really nice, not to mention the amazing rooftop bar and the restaurant. Haven't seen such a nice hotel in a while, especially given the fair price.

This was our second stay at this hotel. The rooms are compact but have everything you need. The best night sleep you are likely to get! Unbelievably comfortable beds, fab crisp white linen and comfy pillows. You don't hear a sound in these rooms. Great location for seeing the city but for getting your rest also. Great bars and restaurants nearby. Can't wait to go back!

Spent 6 nights at the hotel at the start of December and couldn't recommend it enough! We arrived early but were checked in and taken to our room straight away! Very Friendly staff! I had read reviews of the hotel and was slightly apprehensive about the room size but it was fine. Big comfy bed, perfect after spending the day exploring the city.Location is good, slightly out of the way, but everything you could need is within walking distance of the hotel

I had the pleasure to spend 10 nights at the Arlo - Hudson Square, and enjoyed my stay so much I book a return for another 30 night. Not only was this a hip, fun boutique hotel in Manhattan, its staff was great... ensuring I was well taken care of. Kudos out to Amaris who helped me connect with hotel management to book my return, longer stay.

Extremely well appointed boutique hotel. Very small rooms are off set by beautiful warm common spaces throughout the property. Modern minimalist decor in room with comfortable beds, an incredible shower, and convenient outlets for all of my devices.All staff members were welcoming and helpful, they made you feel at home.Really cool feature was a wall of recommendations on comment cards outside of the elevator. The best of the best from NYC as found by guests of the hotel.Would stay and will be staying again soon. Simply an excellent experience. Note: It's relatively new so taxi's may need your direction.

The Arlo Hudson Square perfectly captures the essence of SoHo - it's beautifully designed, urban, hip. What sets the property apart is the service and the staff, who take pride in their jobs. I arrived earlier than check-in time from a 19 hour red-eye flight, and the check-in process was seamless (took less than 2 minutes) with an adjacent artisanal coffee bar, and the room was immaculately prepared. The room itself was small, but the space planning was efficient with lots of light. The glass walls expands the room's sense of space (while some people find this controversial, I find this adds an adds luxury element to the design). Large floor-to-ceiling windows with an amazing skyline view and a lot of light, beautiful wood finishes, stylish mid-century inspired furniture, luxe Blind Barber toiletries, high-thread count linens, comfortable mattress and pillows, high-def wall mounted plasma TV...it was actually hard to leave the room, which felt like a luxurious cocoon.The hotel has many "public" areas, stylishly decorated with modern furniture, attenuated by mood lighting, unique architectural flourishes. There is also a rooftop with amazing skyline views. The in-house restaurant, Harold's offers very delicious food as well. The staff are impeccably dressed, polished, and warm. There was a last-minute change in my schedule, and the quick turnaround to assist me was impressive. The location is excellent, a less than five-minute walk to the subway. SoHo is a quick, scenic walk, and the trendy West Village is also accessible. The Arlo Hudson Square is a great addition to the SoHo landscape, and will likely be an iconic institution very soon.

After my last visit to NY and staying in the Soho region I thought I'd try a different hotel there. The Arlo Hudson Square is definitely not a hotel for everybody in that the rooms are exceedingly small and in my case the view out of my window was directly onto the rear of the hotel and construction work. This, however, should not put people off who really just want a comfortable bed, free wifi, clean facilities for showering, a small fridge and TV, in particular as you're there in NY to be out and about seeing the sites.In my case, level 6, the room layout is one whereby you walk in to entry where there is your wash basin on the left, toilet and shower on your right separated by an opaque glass screen and perfectly suitable for one person but I'm not sure I'd be happy using the toilet whilst my husband was showering only separated by a cloth shower curtain. There was a very small writing table with connections to charge your computer and a telephone and lamp; a small fridge; no wardrobe but a set of clothes hangers on a wooden structure for hanging about 6-10 items - and tucked at the end was(very sensibly) a free to use (not keep) umbrella. Then the bed (which was either a queen or king) filled the entire end of the room - in that there was no walking space around it at all. Built in to the end of the bed wall was a large TV, and at the top end were two small built in reading lamps, switches for lights and the day and night shades.So, as you can see, it was definitely a minimalist room, well set out for what it contained, but my only real objection had I been travelling with someone would have been the close proximity of the bathroom to everything else in the room. You'd definitely not have to be worried about any privacy issues with your traveling companion.On the plus side though, it was clean, I didn't have any problems with noise, the bed was super comfy, the staff were fantastic and extremely helpful, your room contained an umbrella and really all that you needed if your plan was to spend most of your time out and about. Downstairs and I believe on the roof, though as it was winter and wet the entire time, were Lounge areas, as there were on the ground floor where you could escape to in order to read, do a puzzle (provided by hotel)relax or eat. There was a lovely dining area, an in-hotel deli. The hotel had made use of every inch of space for those staying there to use. As I mentioned the staff were very good and nothing was too much trouble for them in helping you. As you can see it is certainly a hotel for a specific sort of traveller. I believe they also have double bunk rooms, though I didn't see inside one of them. It was well located for visiting TriBeCa, Soho, Little Italy and Chinatown, and of course train stations within walking distance if you wished to travel further up or down town. For me it was ideal and well priced. I was there for 3 days at the end of my time in the US and it provided a clean room to rest my weary head of a night with very helpful, pleasant staff.

Great little hotel in a good area for getting everywhere. Clean, tidy rooms. Very small accommodations but we don't mind.What we did mind was the intensely perfumed lobby area. The smell hits you as soon as you open the front door. It also wafts up through the elevator to the upper floors. I am sure there are people out there who like the scent and the people at the front desk said they no longer notice it but I can tell you we did indeed notice it and others in the elevators with us commented on it as well. Considering the increasing awareness of allergies and sensitivities, it is hard to believe that a public space like that would push out such a strong smell all day long.Worse still is the fact that this potent smell seeps into the restaurant and really affects the taste of the food. Nobody wants fragrances to mix with the smell of food and it really interfered with our experience.This hotel has a lovely HUGE lobby space with seating of all kinds. So you can understand our confusion about the fact that the reception desk allows for about 6 feet of standing room for people and their luggage while bodies are coming in the front door, going to the cafe in the reception area and people going to and from the elevators have to squeeze by there too -- bizzare design oversight, especially considering the vast lounge areas just behind this awkward and cramped space.Overall a great, inexpensive hotel but, please, enough with the so-strong-we-can-taste-it scent in the lobby!

Great location lower Manhatten if you are looking for a "less touristy" feel and don't mind subway/walking.Clean & tasteful décor, friendly staff, great little bodega for snacks at the front. I will be back!

I used to live in NYC, and have been there several times, but never wanted to stay in the same hotel twice. I didn't want to leave the Arlo Hudson Square! The staff at the desk, the coffee bar, rooftop, and restaurant were all so nice and helpful! They remembered me by name daily and made a single traveler feel very welcome and not alone. Amaris at the desk was super nice, and couldn't have been more helpful! I can't wait to go back when it's warmer to really enjoy the courtyard and rooftop.

Arlo's most redeeming quality is that it is just on the step of the action in the Lower East Side. This gives it great access to SoHo, the High Line, Battery Park and One WTC. It's relatively quiet except for the traffic in Holland Tunnel which was extremely busy on this particular Christmas Weekend.The rooms are nicely appointed - small - but I don't expect big rooms in NYC. The hotel has a great vibe with a great staff across from the reception and up to the roof-top bar. The bar has a beautiful terrace which you can't use in December but it didn't stop this on from venturing out into the cold nights to peer at the skyline.Just had 3 issues with room & the hotel:1. Their cards were extremely faulty. I replaced them a total of 4 times in 5 nights because they would get de-magnetized so easily.2. The washbasin which is in the room itself ran milky white water in the hot faucet. This may be due to bad plumbing as chalk deposits may not be filtered out accurately or the construction that was occuring across. It was reported on checking-in but was never attended to.3. The glass shutter that closes away the toilet may look cool but is extremely shaky so it jangles a bit.Other than that, it is a nice space and has one of my favorite lobbies with so many little nooks and crannies with beautiful upholstered furniture, lots of power ports and great wifi to catch up on work. Not to mention the stack of board games that you can borrow too :)

The rooms are small but efficient with a great bed and a marvelous shower! The staff is really kind and helpful. The design of the hotel is really nice to just relax for a evening. All the downtown city experience are nearby. If we're back in the NYC we're booking again for sure at Arlo.

Had a mini getaway on Sunday 1/22. Was greated by a warm friendly staff. Kate Scherer checked us in and gave us a tour. I love that Kate is a native New Yorker raised in Greenwich Village. She showed us the fab rooftop bar and garden, the restaurant, the ground floor bar and lounge area. I loved my room. Cheers to the design team. Anyone who loves great architecture and design will love this place. What a cool bathroom! I loved my bed with windows out to the cityscape. I think i had a view of the old AT&T buulding where my dad worked after he returned from WW11. Of course, if you want, you can draw an electric shade so you don't see the city lights, but I choose to keep my shade open all night. i will definitely be back with family and friends. Love that The Arlo is close to Chinatown, the West Village, and Tribeca.

I mean can you beat a hotel with a coffee bar in the lobby? Prob not. They were more than helpful on my trip and the room was so nice. I would stay here every time i come to NYC. Special shoutout to Natalie for helping me during my stay. Highly recommend this hotel.

A friend and I decided to stay at Arlo Hudson Sq. a few weeks ago last minute. We had a wonderful experience. The room was everything we could have asked for (clean, comfortable, etc.) and the staff was very considerate and hospitable - particularly, Joanne, who was very accommodating throughout our stay and Natalie, who helped us out at the front desk. We will certainly consider staying here again in the future.

An outsanding lobby for chilling and doing work, amazing french toast! city views, and an overall great experience and amazing value...highly highly recomendedRestaurant was great, room was great and especially loved the common area and 2nd floor for working and chilling out..Ill be back!!

Excellent hospitality - especially from Brian - when I stayed last night. My favorite hotel in NYC yet, can't beat that huge window looking out on the city! Lighting also especially well-thought out.- Joe

Amaris is very kind and helpful. Great experience in the hotel. The room is relatively small, but very normal in NYC. Very clean rooms, the restaurant in the hotel is decent. Pretty sure I will choose Arlo again when visiting New York.
user_name:
visitLOHA
New York City, New York

review_body: I was there for a whole week and let me tell you , when it comes to find a nice , small hotel , Arlo is the one. Located in SoHo , it really provides everything we needed for our business trip. What really made my staying there amazing was , no doubt , the staff. Waking up every morning and coming downstairs to the morning shift was a great boost of energy. Whenever I needed something , they provided. KUDOS to Kate Scherer, for being the best human being on earth. Not only was professional but also helped me through personal issues and gave me the warmest hug I could find far from home.

I left my ipad mini in the hotel room during my stay in Dec 2016, it was found after I left NY city, i was told for any guest items that are left in hotels, the courier service is handled by guests, for helping me to save the courier service charge, I need to give a special thanks to Michael Gerry Geronimo the Director of Front Office who is helping me to personally drop the mini ipad to my NY office which is like a 10 mins walk distance from Arlo Hudson Square. Truly appreciated for the flexibility given :)

I booked through Hotel Tonight and got a phenomenal rate for a last minute work trip. The vibe of the hotel is excellent with a modern, chic aesthetic. The rooms are small, but perfect for one person for a couple of nights and have all the amenities you need. The bathroom products are luxurious compared to what you typically get at any large hotel chain. All this combined with the friendliness of the hotel staff makes The Arlo my new go-to hotel when I'm in the city.

Let's see...where do I begin? From the moment I walked in, I was welcomed and greeted with open arms! I was not only taken back by such a cheerful welcoming but the fantastic smell that lingers throughout the hotel.Emily at the front desk is absolutely exceptional!!! She truly understands the importance of great customer service and personal touch! Statistics have shown that the most successful businesses and the businesses that will last the longest, are the ones that deliver great customer service!Customers have a plethora of options when it comes to where they can spend their money. So if you have customers walking into your establishment, you better nail it!!!And Arlo Hudson Square does! They've got it right! I had the most amazing stay at this hotel for the reasons listed above and beyond. I would highly recommend Arlo to locals as well as all travelers. This will be my new home away from home!Thank you Arlo for getting this customer service thing right! People don't mind spending their money when they are treated special and treated WELL!! Kudos :-)

Rooms are new, clean and well designed. Lobby is warm and inviting and smells amazing! I was staying at the hotel alone and the room size was perfect for me, although I could see it being a bit more of a challenge spatially for 2 people and their luggage. My room have the cozy 'bed in a box' and I loved it. Beds, linens and pillows were so comfortable. Loved the rainfall shower and toiletries. The room also came with an umbrella to use during the stay, a blowdryer, mini fridge and even a handheld steamer, which was a delightful surprise! Staff were extremely friendly and helpful and willing to help in any way they could. Rooftop bar was nice and decorated nicely, open all year round, which is nice! The location is a 10 minute walk to the lovely west village. With the great price point and amazing service, I will be returning to this hotel for sure! Thank you Arlo!

We stayed here for 3 nights. Overall a great experience and would highly recommend it, especially to those staying for a quick trip over a weekend. Extremely modern and cozy. You have very well decorated rooms and lounges. Good crowd as well in terms of neighboring guests. There is a restaurant, bar, TV, and small cafe area in the lobby which are expensive but nice to have.Rooms are very small but cozy and well designed. The walls are very thick as well so you couldn't hear the neighbors or the street (things we were nervous about due to the size of the room). Location is not anything noteworthy if you're looking for a great view of the city but it's in a safe area and very close to the Subway.Overall great experience.
user_location: Washington, District of Columbia, District of Columbia, United States
user_name:
Aakash B
Washington, District of Columbia, District of Columbia, United States

review_body: I had a wonderful stay at the Arlo Hudson. Everything about it worked for me - the vibe, the location, the staff. Kate, at the front desk, was particularly helpful - her restaurant advice turned this trip into something special. Thank you all!

We stayed at the Arlo for 5 nights.It is a wonderful hotel, modern, cozy, stylish. The common areas offer everything you need: coffee, quick bites, working stations, terrace, drinks. Every space is great.Rooms are tiny, tiny, tiny, but extremely well designed. There's no closet so storage space is a challenge. We had big luggage that we managed to put under the bed... but it takes an effort every day.Bed is comfortable, probably a little small. The "city view", worthless.Staff very friendly and super attentive. Service is impeccable.The roof top bar is nice.Will come back.

A simplistic modern feel with hip trendy vibe. The rooms were clean and very artistic with a great use of space. I stayed with my teenage son and felt that there was something for all ages at Arlo. The on-site restaurant is a treat, along with the wonderful public spaces that make you feel at home.

Loved the Arlo Hudson hotel, easy access between Soho and the West village. The rooms are very quiet facing the courtyard which it's rare for NYC and very efficient with a minimalistic style. The lounge work area is very stylish and fun to hang out or take meetings.The front boutique offers a great variety of food and souvenirs, I would recommend trying the Williams and Murray's Fragrance! And don't forget to try the restaurant and the rooftop bar.
user_name:
sylvielekarski
New York City, New York

review_body: I've stayed in a couple of different hotels in New York, and Arlo Hudson is special. It's away from the tourist traps but close to the right spots. Staff were friendly and ready to help. I'll definitely be back.Thanks Emily for making our stay much more enjoyable!

We are frequently in NYC for business/pleasure, and the Arlo has become our go-to place. It is designed in a very stylish manner, and the staff could not be more helpful. Rooms are small, as are most in the city, but that doesn't matter, as you will want to spend your hotel time in the library, lounge, or courtyard, which are all gorgeous and full of life. The themed evenings are great, such as wine tasting on Monday, and Jazz on Thursday. Very close to the Holland Tunnel and several subway stations.
user_name:
Rick1708
New York City, New York

review_body: During Christmas to New Year's week this was the perfect location. The Arlo is convenient to downtown museums, Village clubs like The Vanguard and Small's, and a range of restaurants. Harold's, located at the hotel, has an excellent breakfast buffet. The frittata, yogurt, and raspberries were especially impressive. Guest rooms are small but sufficient, though not very private as the frosted glass bathroom has a sliding, and not quite closing, door. There are few places to hang or store clothes. This coziness is mitigated by the spacious sitting rooms in the lobby. There are bars downstairs and up on the roof. The hotel staff are delightful, friendly, knowledgeable about nearby eateries and activities, and wonderfully accommodating.

I usually don't write reviews, but this was one of my favorite hotels I've ever stayed in. The rooms aren't very large (it's New York, after all) but are very comfortable. Some of my favorite things:- The rainfall shower is awesome. Great water pressure and the water actually gets hot (quickly, too).- The shampoo/conditioner/soap is much better than most hotels I've stayed in. They smell great and actually lather up without having to use a ton.- The bed is super plush and comfortable.- The room is clean and utilizes the small space well.- Decorations are modern and delightful.I would definitely stay here again if I'm in the area.

Recently spent the night here and could not say more amazing things about the hotel. From the friendly and attentive front desk people, the guest activities (wine tasting, Monday night football), to the wonderfully setup of the cozy room made for a terrific and relaxing stay! Highly recommend everyone give them a try, you will not be disappointed.

Our stay at this hotel was outstanding. The decor and vibe in the public areas is perfect. The hotel is such a good location for people wanting to explore the city and there are tons of brilliant bars and eateries within walking distance. The staff are so helpful and nice. We wil definately be back. Thank you Arlo!
user_name:
Helen S
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: My wife and I recently enjoyed a belated honeymoon, part of which included a too brief 12 nights in New York, all of which we enjoyed at the Arlo Hudson Square. The first thing that struck us about the Arlo was it is definitely boutique.Secondly, the staff are absolutely charming and good looking! From the front desk where we mainly dealt with Kate( we have claimed her as Aussie!) and Daniel to the lovely staff making coffees in the morning, they all engaged with the guests and nothing was too much trouble. They really personified the hospitable nature of the industry they represent.The rooms were compact and spotless and the turnover service faultless. It was my first time in the States and I absolutely fell in love with New York. Staying at the Arlo just fuelled the romance. Well located, away from the glitz of Park avenue,etc, we managed to walk pretty much everywhere with minor assistance from the subway, Brooklyn, Soho, Noho, Chinatown, Little Italy ...you name it.Will we go to New York again? Of course and where will we stay?...with our mates at the Arlo!Thanks guys and have a terrific 2017.

We had an awesome stay at the Arlo Hudson Square in December. Natalie at reception was very helpful, location was also great. Can't say enough about the helpful/friendly staff. I would highly recommend this hotel! Bed was also unbelievably comfortable!

The Arlo has not been in operation all that long, but I had wanted to stay in this area of Manhattan for a change, and this hotel was part of the airfare package. I had an enjoyable six nights and would use it again. Arlo is a "micro" hotel with modern décor, so be sure to look at the photos to have some idea of what you are getting. Rooms use space efficiently, but do not expect a closet or much space for putting clothes. The shower/toilet is enclosed in frosted glass, so you want to be quite comfortable with whomever shares your room. Sink is in the room. The hotel makes up for the small rooms by having exceptionally comfortable, spacious common areas with plenty of seating. One area is built around the bar (another bar on the roof), one around a TV, and others are just pleasant seating arrangements looking out on a courtyard. I highly recommend the NY continental breakfast at the in-house restaurant. It's $19, but it has a huge selection, and you won't need lunch. Hotel staff is young, energetic, and well-trained.

Just home from an amazing stay in the Arlo Hudson Square. Great location myself and my partner walked to most of the major attractions and taxi rides to others where fairly cheap. Perfect stay if flying into Newark as the Holland Tunnel is right next door. The Hudson River is just around the corner and provides beautiful scenery along the boardwalk. The hotel itself is very modern, the food in Meat and Three is to die for and playing board games while having cocktails is always fun. The staff where so friendly and helpful also. The tip board located at the elevator on the ground floor is such a clever idea also. Wish I was back there now!

The best thing for this hotel is great location- in the real heart of New York, between east and west Manhatten, upper you can find Broadway, 5 th avenue, other side Wall street, Statue of Liberty etc..But the rooms are extremely small, if you are not alone, bathroom is just inside the room and its very uncomfortable , something like shared bathroom and restroomTry the roof bar

Came across this hotel not knowing anything about it and it was SUCH a pleasant surprise! Service was wonderful and very helpful. The lobby and surrounding space was modern, trendy, and refreshing! The bar was BEAUTIFULLY decorated during Christmas! We couldn't get over it! The rooms are modern which I love in a hotel, and fairly small but cozy! We didn't spend much time in the room so the size was not a problem for us, but just be aware of that before you book. The location was perfect and everywhere we needed to go we simply walked to... After a long time of searching I have finally found my go to hotel for New York!

I absolutely loved my stay at Arlo and did not want to leave!Firstly, I made a stupid error with my reservation and Arlo (along with Hotel.com) were kind enough to not charge me for it which I am very thankful for.Secondly, Emily (who works there) is amazing! She is the best person I have met in Tourism for a long time. She's welcoming, informative and patient (I asked a lot of questions). She is definitely an asset to Arlo and it shouldn't go un-recognised.The activities timetable was a delight and a great addition to Arlo. Plenty to get involved with (movie night, free 5 minute massages etc.). The rooftop bar has a great atmosphere and view. The downstairs seating area is great too, very spacious and relaxing.The bedrooms however are not spacious (but surely you'd know that before booking so people can't really complain about that). I loved the room! They're so quirky and efficient. The lack of division between the bathroom and the rest of the room isn't great BUT it's so minor.Location wise, you can't go wrong. Soho is within walking distance (amongst other districts) and there are several subways nearby. To get to Arlo from JFK Airport I would advise getting the Subway. As the hotel is located near the New Jersey tunnel, it was a nightmare to get there with an Uber!

Stayed here for 4 nights seeing in NY. Fantastic hotel and staff. Close to all the places you want to visit. Getting a cab on the doorstep is a peice of cake and whether ur stayin downtown or goin mid or uptown ur there in a few minutes.
user_name:
Peter B
Greater Manchester, United Kingdom

review_body: Comfy bed, lovely staff, bar, library lounges and restaurant. Hipster decor is very well thought out with board games etc but rooms ridiculously small with no closet/wardrobe at all. No bathroom privacy as toilet area is enclosed by frosted glass with lots of gaps so not great for a couple sharing making the downstairs washrooms constantly busy. Good location

We had a good experience in this Hotel. It is brand new and clean with bar and restaurants onsite. It is located between Down town and Mid town and you can have access to both easily. We walked between these 2 all the times, but if you don’t like long walks, you can use the metro instead.Hotel staff are very friendly and ready to help.An improvement opportunity is the room service. It was good, but we were short of toilet paper and shampoo in some occasions and we had to call the room service. Hotel management has to increase the stock they put in rooms in our opinion.We recommend this Hotel for your next visit …

A friend and I stayed at Arlo for one week whilst in New York City. The location is perfect as it's a 5 min walk from the Metro and which gives easy access to the rest of Manhattan. Our bedroom was compact (no separate bathroom) but that but that was fine as we were only in there to sleep and shower! We didn't eat in the restaurant but we had drinks at both bars (on the ground floor and rooftop). They do happy hour and the bartenders were friendly.If you would like to get out of your room then Arlo has plenty of great lounge/work spaces on the ground floor and first floor. The decor throughout the hotel is modern and functionalIf you plan on spending all your time in the hotel then this isn't the place for you however if you want a comfortable and modern base to explore NYC then the Arlo is perfect!

I've stayed at Arlo Hudson Square several times and highly recommend it. Staff are wonder, especially Dan at the front desk. The Arlo is a two block walk from the Hudson River and close to the 1 train on Canal St..

I love ARLO! This was my third time staying here and I've always had a great experience from check-in through to check-out. The rooms are small, which is typical of a contemporary boutique hotel in NYC, but I really enjoy the layout and the amenities. Very cozy and comfortable, modern and always impeccably clean. The front desk staff is always in a great mood! Super-friendly and patient, knowledgeable and responsive. As someone who has spent some years working in the hotel industry, I understand what it takes to make a hotel successful in such a competitive market and ARLO's got it. My only issue during this stay was fighting with the thermostat, it would not cooperate and my room was nearing sauna temperatures at one point but eventually we just cracked the window open.

The location, hotel and staff were all quite nice. The rooms are small, there is no closet and the bathroom is even smaller. The front desk hosts, Kate and Natalie were over and above accomodating. Harold's restaurant hosts a better than average breakfast buffet for $ 19 which is, for a hotel, reasonable. I found the restaurant, Harold's, no great shakes for it's medium price. All in all, for the price and the neighborhood, I'd recommend this hotel.

The room is really nice, especially for the price in NY. Positives...restaurant on site, great location, rooms very nice and updated. Staff are personable. Downside...ac makes a noise each time it kicks in and a little bit of a challenge with traffic for Uber,s since it is right at the mouth of the holland tunnel. Would definitely come again!

I stayed with my husband for 3 nights in this modern hotel, it was a perfect stay for us, close to all the attractions, and very affordable.Staff is very friendly and helpful. Room was very clean.We would definitely stay again and we highly recommend it.

Great micro hotel. The open public space on the first and second floor were very cozy and comfy. Felt like a large living room area. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Although I am from NYC I chose Arlo for a staycation, could not have had a better experience here :)

This is my 2nd time staying at the Arlo Hudson Square and I'm sure to visit again. I was very impressed with the overall service. The front desk staff was very attentive and accommodating to my needs. It's a great hotel whether you're in town for business or pleasure. Thank you Kate, Natalie and Jake the bartender!

We only stayed at Arlo for one night but it was awesome!! The hotel was so nice and the lobby and restaurant were welcoming and accommodating. Every staff member was genuinely nice and helpful and the rooftop bar, decorated for Christmas and with delicious drinks, was such a bonus. We will absolutely be back next time we come into the city, and we will recommend this hotel to our out-of-town friends and family.

Hotel is new, designed modernly, staff is polite- all correct.rooms are super small - also correctbut today, 3 months after my stay - I continue getting false charges on my credit card that was given only for deposit. we checked out and payed for everything - but for some reason they continue charging me with the same date of my checkout, without notifying me about it. their slow response to my complaints made me activate my credit card anti fraud policies as I had no choice. Do yourself a favor - find another hotel.

My wife and I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square when they first opened. We had a fantastic stay! The location is perfect and the restaurant Harold's Meat and Three is superb! We really enjoyed the lobby and it was such a treat to be able to get a latte anytime of day or night. We can't wait to return in the New Year.

What can I say? It was amazing! Excellent service, especially Ismaël! Great hotel for everyone who wants to visit New York. You have everything you need within 15min, great shops, 5th avenue, Central Park, SoHo.. just awesome!

This hotel is awesome. Good location in lower manhattan and not too far from Canal St train station. When I got in Natalie showed me a couple different rooms. Ended up with a awesome view of Hudson sq. She was super helpful! Bonus. There's a coffee shop in the lobby!

Thank you so much for a great great stay! It has been a truly amazing stay at Arlo Hudson. Had a four-day stay and the service and the room was perfect! The personnel is 100 pct. Service minded. We will be back again! Christian & christina

We stayed in the Arlo Hudson sq from the 19th to the 21stWe stayed in room 721 and realIzed immediately the rooms were exceptionally small...I think 150sqft as per Expedia. Not really much privacy between the bathroom and the rest of the unit. That was basically the only "slight" negative. Everything else was fantastic. Very clean with modern amenities. Staff was extremely helpful and prompt whenever we needed assistance. Wifi worked great. The hotel is also located in a very convenient area of soho that will get you to many great stops in just a few minutes of walking. Perfect for someone traveling solo and manageable for couples (ie bathroom issue)

I really liked our room - very modern, clean, comfortable bed and pillows - a bit on the small side. I wound up checking in very late and it was quick and easy. Really close to subway and Holland Tunnel if you need to go to Newark Airport. Quiet neighborhood. There's a 24-hour deli up on the corner next that has everything.They also had notices for events up which makes it a little more fun. I would definitely stay again.

Stayed for 3 nights with my girlfriend close to Christmas. Never been to New York before so didn't know the best places to stay but this place was perfect for us. It's only 2 minutes walk from a subway station where you can be in Times Square in 10 minutes so it's a great location. All the staff were very helpful and friendly throughout our whole stay. Rooms are very modern and clean with everything we needed. There is a nice rooftop bar and lounge area downstairs which is well priced. The hotel is great value for money considering it was Christmas time and it was a very good location.

Stayed at the hotel for one night. Got upgraded to a better room and was able to extend my checkout until 3 pm! Room is a little small, but super new and modern! Shout out to Dan in the reception for providing great service!

Although this hotel is in the desert of SoHo, it is a quick walk to the metro. The staff members were marvelous! Our visit began and ended with Dan at the front desk, he was friendly, helpful, and kind. I can't begin to say how pleasant the stay was, due to the super nice staff. You guys are great!! Public spaces were cozy, and thankfully, there were many of them. It never felt crowded. But, the bedroom felt very crowded, as it is very tiny! Lacked adequate space and hooks to store clothes and coats. Because the hotel is new, it was very clean and fresh. The shower is a soothing beauty. 2 ticking clocks, which are built into the headboard of the bed, would have made it impossible for me to sleep. Michael, the assistant front office manager, was very helpful in helping to solve the problem. And I slept soundly! The bed was comfy, and linens very nice. Jake, the bartender was a darling, bar food was great. Sunday brunch yummy. Overall, a great stay, largely due to the marvelous staff!!!

The good/very good:• very enthusiastic, friendly and helpful staff • hotel is new, clean with beautiful, mid-mod inspired interior design • tho bedrooms are small, they are well laid out to maximise space • public space is stunning mid-century mod vibe with plug ins everywhere for computers etc. • lots of events there which would be great for solo travellers• lunch and breakfast at the restaurant was good (tho to me seemed like meals were either too small or too large...)• free bikes with locks and helmets - really great as the hotel is a bit out of the main fray (not including the Holland Tunnel traffic!)The not-so-good:• can't be denied - the bedrooms are small, very little storage space (tho it's possible to slip suitcases under the bed!)• not really even a separate bathroom - the toilet/shower door doesn't provide adequate privacy (they are planning to address that at some point soon) and the small sink area doubles as the front entry... • the wee mini fridge was totally empty - that space would be more useful as a drawer or shelves• tho not too far from Soho, is a bit off to the side by the Holland Tunnel entry - about a 10 min walk to the #1 line and 15-20 min walk (or transit) to shopping and restos• lobby coffee shop is convenient but NO hot food (not much else around for small hot morning bites, just a weekday deli up the street a bitConclusion? Great hotel for younger people (with money), short-ish term stays, and business travellers. Couples travelling for a week might not care for the tight quarters.

I cannot stress to you enough the level of top quality customer service at this quaint but beautiful hotel. The staff were friendly, polite, and went above and beyond at every turn. A special thanks to front desk attendant, Dan. The place was clean, perfectly located. Top quality grab n go food and coffee in the lobby, ample and lovely lounging areas and a great rooftop bar. Between the neighborhood and hotel, you could easily spend your entire trip within a few square miles and never need to see another inch of NYC. I wasn't expecting much when we booked our room but I HIGHLY recommend staying here. Our stay in Hudson Square/Soho was an experience I'll treasure for a lifetime, in no small part to this top notch boutique hotel and it's wonderful staff. <3

We stayed here for an extended weekend getaway Thursday thru Sunday. Let's start with the good! The hotel is in a great location. The rooms had very nice decor and the bed and shower were both very nice. The hotel itself had very nice decor and two great bars. The food and drinks we had at the bar were also very good and we enjoyed their daily happy hour. The roof top bar had great drinks and awesome Christmas decor. The service here was the best in the hotel. Now for the bad. The rooms for one are very tiny, I'm talking the size of a closet tiny. I would not recommend any more than 2 people per room. The very first night we slept there we were woken up by drilling in the walls at 5 AM. I called to the front desk three times and was told all three times it was being taken care of. It continued and I had to get dressed and go downstairs to speak to the manager. The manger didn't even know where the drilling was coming from. Both myself and several other guests were extremely upset with this. The manager did end up giving us the night for free, which is the only reason I am giving them 2 stars and not 1. The next night we decided to go to a nice dinner and needed an iron and ironing board in order to press our shirts, since they do not provide one to you in the rooms. We called downstairs 3 times and never received anything. Your beds are right up against the window in the rooms and the noise level is extremely high. They have very poor sound proofing. I know it's a big city and you will hear noise, but I have been to NYC over 20 times and never had the noise level this high. You are right next to the Holland Tunnel so there is constant traffic. Service at this place is slow and nonexistent. Even waiting for wine and cheese during happy hour took forever. The only place I experienced good service was the roof top bar. While the manager did give us Thursday night free, we have yet to hear from anyone about when exactly our card will be reimbursed. I would't be surprised if I had call again and again in order to make sure this happens. Overall, we did not have the best stay here. I do not think I would ever come back or recommend this place to anyone. While it's a good thing your hotel looks nice, ultimately the service is what keeps customers coming back and the service here is just horrible!!!

Third time at the hotel. It is inexpensive, modern, and close to the subway. What else can you ask for? The room are very small, but you are in New York, so who cares. The rooms in the courtyard look directly into other rooms, so it may be a little too peeping tom for some.

Great service from Dan, Michael and the other people in the staff who over and above to make it a great stay!Rooms are very small but in a good way with excellent design and atmosphere The Harolds breakfast is also very delightful with lots of fresh fruits etcAll in all very happy with the stay and would recommend it!

From the time I came in till I left 3 days later i can't believe how we were treated. From the people at the arrival desk especially Katie to the waiters in the restaurant. From Giovanni to the bartender Jake Everyone that we came in contact with was kind and very friendly. I know when I come back for a visit to NY again I will stay in the Arlo in Hudson Square. W Malone
user_name:
wallym214
New York City, New York

review_body: The location is a bit far from the subway station but is manageable as long as it is not too cold. I saw some comments on the size of the rooms, but we could not imagine how small they really are. I booked 2 rooms for 3 nights each, at first we found the staff to always smile and seems polite. however during checkout they made some mistake adding a charge of 112 for each of the room due to a restaurant charge that we never used nor eaten in. The receptionist agreed that it was a mistake and said we will be refunded (112$*2). Upon my return I noticed that it was not the case, and started talking to Arlo's staff and managers, until of today (3 months later) it is still not sorted out, this is outrages and have never happened to me nowhere else. I can show you the corresponding so far with them ever since, personally I would not recommend this due to this issue. be warn! . I cannot believe how it gets such high scores, but either it is not correct or others simply didn't noticed their bank charges, I suggest you carefully review on your return.

Enjoyed stating here for business but would certainly stay here for a pleasure trip. The food and cocktails were great. Great service and friendly people. Dan is the man - ask for him! You won't be disappointed here.

I had a great experience I was taken care of as soon as I walked in the door. Emily checked me in and was extremely helpful with giving me direction though the city throughout my stay. She is definitely the person you should get your info from. The rooms are great and the service is impeccable. Great hotel!!

What can I say? Checked in today and was amazed by the service. Emily was amazing. Just amazing. Very thorough and informative and made me want to stay there even more. Amazing hotel with even better service from Emily. Thank you, will be back!!! Love it!!!

Fantastic, minimalist modern hotel. Staff were very friendly, helping with all requirements i needed when traveling for work! The Style of the hotel is flexible and encourages a more relaxed scandinavian vibe! Far better than hotels like The Crosby or similar in Soho for far better value!

I almost dismissed this hotel due to it's proximity to the entrance of the Holland Tunnel. I'm glad I didn't. I booked a room with king bed and found that it was enclosed in this interesting wood cubby with a large window on one side. The cubby and the small desk allowed for a surprising amount of storage which offsets the small size of the room. It also has a large flat screen TV at the end of the bed. Once in the comfortable bed, it's hard to leave the warm, intimate space. Once you leave the bed, the size of the room becomes a bit claustrophobic but have no fear. The hotel includes a roof top bar and spacious common areas on the ground floor. There are couches, chairs and a large table perfect for a group gathering. I was also surprised by the surrounding neighborhood. Once you get past the traffic waiting for the tunnel, there are a number of nice stores and restaurants within walking distance. The Canal Street subway stations provide easy access to the rest of the city.The room has a bathroom but be warned that it doesn't have walls. Instead it has frosted glass partitions to separate the living space from the bathroom. I suggest you know your travelling companion pretty well. This place reminds me of a nicer version of the Pod39.

First time in the new Arlo hotel. Very comfortable and trendy. The lobby and ground floor is relaxed. You can pull out a laptop and work or meet friends or colleagues for a drink and be pleased with both. Harold's restaurant is a bonus. Great breakfast and dinner without wandering out in the neighborhood. Staff is friendly and it easy in and out too. I will definitely go back soon.
user_name:
Tom Z
London, England, United Kingdom

review_body: I stopped in at the Arlo for dinner at Herald's Meat +3 and was surprised to discover this quaint little gem in my neighborhood. The service was phenomenal, from our host to the charming waiter. The food was good and quick just wish they had more vegetarian options, but what can you expect from the name. I must comment on the service at the front desk. We were greeted by the nicest young ladies and shown some of the rooms even though we weren't guest. Aronsa and Kate were great. Although the rooms are on the smaller size you can't beat the price. Great for family visiting for the holidays. Glad to have you in the neighborhood, welcome Arlo!

Stayed for 2 weekend nights, arriving late on Friday night. All the staff were super friendly and helpful. We valet parked our car (very smooth experience although we did have to go inside since there was no attendant) and since we were trying to get to the hotel's restaurant (Harold's Meat + Three) before the kitchen closed at 11pm, the front desk offered to let them know we had arrived so we could go up to the room briefly before having dinner.The rooms while yes, they are small, are extremely well appointed and well designed. It was a pleasure to have well located sockets with usb options (both sides of the bed, plus extra around the room.) Nice big window, comfortable bed, great shower.The only 2 minor detractions were that we would have preferred thicker pillows since our necks started to hurt (they have lovely down pillows, we just prefer thicker ones with more height) and the shower is only partially enclosed (no door or curtain to separate it), so the area right outside the shower where the toilet is gets VERY wet (the bath mat was pretty well soaked after our 2 showers). But the shower itself is great, good water pressure and nice rain shower head.The common areas are fantastic (we hung out there Sunday morning since we had time before meeting friends). We were offered complimentary mimosas and sat in their beautiful lobby/common space reading the newspaper.And go to Harold's! Our waiter was fantastic and do was the food. I was so pleasantly surprised by the quality of both (because we arrived just before closing and restaurants don't often find there footing the first few months they are open). They were spot on with everything and we never felt rushed. Oh, and have the butternut squash and mac'n cheese sides, both are awesome!Just a great place, go, you'll enjoy it (unless you really do need one of those "big" hotel rooms, but then NYC is probably not the best option for that anyway).

Stayed there on my recent trip to NYC. Was impressed by the design of the hotel although the room was very small and mostly impressed with the professionalism and responsiveness of the staff. Kate was especially helpful, assisting me with my booking and making recommendations for nearby restaurants. Gino, the doorman was very friendly and made me feel very welcome. I would definitely stay there again.

compact, functional room, great restaurant, close to subway, only problem was the fact that we sat in the uncomfortable chairs on the rooftop bar and we had 2 glasses on house red wine and 2 glasses on draft beer. I did not sign the bill because bartender changed shifts and it was mislocated. . Got the bill for $111.25 US.That means as a Canadian , we paid about $150.00 for 2 red wine and 2 draft beer.

Lovely, new contemporary hotel and not too far from the subway stations (Canal St and Spring St). Rooms are small so if you want something spacious, this isn't for you! Had a japanese-feel to it, with the sliding doors, fold out desk etc to make it as space saving as possible. TV's are a great size, the amenities in the room are good. The sink isn't inside the shower/toilet area which isn't what I was expecting but didn't bother me. The sound-proofing could be better because I could hear other doors closing near by.Downstairs area is very sociable, the staff are wonderful! A special thank you to Emily who really helped us when it came to recommending places to eat and shop! Honestly the most accommodating person, we missed her on her days off.Ground floor - space where you can buy snacks/coffee and large open spaces to sit and chill if you don't want to be cooped up in your bedroom. Board games are available to play too. They were offering free 5 minute massages after Black Friday shopping - the best!Rooftop bar which was beautifully decorated for Christmas when we went there on our final night, there is also an outdoor seating area on the rooftop and downstairs. As well as this, there is a restaurant within the hotel, we never actually got a chance to eat there but it seemed quite busy when I did go have a quick look. They also have their own Arlo Hudson bikes which you can rent out for free! Again, we didn't do this but a little perk to the stay.I recommend this hotel if you're not too fussed about space and want to stay somewhere that has a different, but positive, vibe to it.

I love quirky so add incredibly nice and engaging staff, well equipped rooms and great bar. Plus they have an excellent coffee bar and they fun things to buy. Be warned the rooms are very small but who cares. This place is a treat.

The Arlo Hudson Square Hotel bills itself as a "micro-hotel." (At least they're open about it.) For travelers unfamiliar with a micro-hotel, it's the latest insult to traveling in comfort or style. A micro-hotel - for example, the Arlo - is pretty much what the term suggests. Micro. A typical hotel room - including the bed and bathroom - measures only 8 feet wide by 15 feet long. The bathroom is actually inside the bedroom, separated from the rest of space only by a thin, frosted glass partition. If you're traveling solo, this arrangement may work. For a couple, it's unacceptable. We traveled to NYC over the Labor Day week, staying just one night in Manhattan. We made our Arlo booking on Hotwire. Hotwire, in case you don't know, reveals your hotel booking only AFTER you've hit the "purchase" button. ( Don't use Hotwire if you don't appreciate unpleasant surprises!) It was after we purchased our booking we learned we'd been placed at the Arlo. That's when we started learning about micro-hotels and what hellish experience awaited us.Of course we tried to cancel. No amount of cajoling and threatening would get the Hotwire people to allow us to cancel the Arlo booking. They were simply AWFUL to deal with. Never again.So we showed up at the Arlo, thankful it was only for one night. The Arlo bills itself as a four-star property. That rating may apply to some of the common spaces, but certainly doesn't fit the rooms. Our room had malfunctioning A/C, problems with the hot water, and a TV set that would turn on but got no channels. Oh, and a very large gap under the room door ensured we heard every nuance of every conversation of people walking down the hall in front of our room. (We assumed they could hear us as well.) Ugh!In the Arlo's defense, it was their first real week in operation, and it was NY Fashion Week, so the place was mobbed. The staff was struggling to attend to the needs of all the fussy guests, not to mention deal with all the complaints and mechanical problems. The management was very kind to us: They realized the problems we encountered during our stay were significant, and they gave us a full refund. I was impressed with their professionalism. So here's my thought: If you're traveling alone and don't mind a tiny room where there's barely space to turn around, you'll probably enjoy the Arlo. It's got a hip, swank vibe. If you prefer more generous accommodations, or if you're traveling with a companion, I would pass on the Arlo. You'll be as miserable as we were.

Room was very clean and functional. Staff friendly and helpful. Location is good and well serviced by public transportation. With the very small rooms finding a place to put more than carry-on size luggage would be difficult. I appreciated having the charger and the small fridge, and the big wall TV. We would definitely go back to an Arlo hotel for short trips.

We really enjoyed our weekend stay at the Arlo Hudson Square . It's a beautiful designed hotel, and the rooms are quite cozy! We loved the large king size bed with TV enclosed in the bed frame design! We also enjoyed picking up coffee and a delicious breakfast sandwich to go on our way out each morning. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family wanting to stay downtown.

If you are planning a quick visit to NYC, this is a fantastic option! Yes, they have small rooms but the location is great, everything is brand new, staff is super polite and helpful, the restaurant food is delicious and everything looks amazing, super tasteful. If you are planning a week of shopping it might not work for you. But if you want to hang out around Soho or Meatpacking with your friends and family, for a fair price, it will work perfectly. I gave it 4 starts bc you don't have much privacy in the bathroom, but it was not a problem and everything else was top notch. Could not recommend enough.

I'm not gonna talk about the structure of the hotel, even if I found it absolutely modern and stylish (despite the lack of intimacy of the standard room's toilet, even if it was cool). The real "plus" Of this supernew hotel is the staff, one above all EMILY, the curly girl at the reception...amazing!!! She is friendly, available, warm and approachable, she' s gonna give you precious tips but also a cup of thè if she sees you are sick..and at the same time, she is very professional and she can book for you everything. Also Dan, the barman, can really make your dinner very pleasant if you are seated at the bar top: he's gonna engage you in nice conversation. In short, they CARE ABOUT THE DETAILS, and they make you feel home.Tks for the unforgettable experience. Eleonora&Samantha, The Italians

Had another great stay at the Arlo Hudson this past weekend. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The beds are amazing and had an awesome meal at Harold's, where the food and staff was outstanding.My "place" away from home to stay when I visit NYC. I will be back!!

I had a FANTASTIC experience at this hotel! I've been to quite a few NYC hotels, but none were as accommodating as this one. Kate at the front desk was especially helpful; she had a cab waiting for me when I left despite the insanely early hour. She was also able to point me in the direction of a few great places to eat in the area. I will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

Everything was perfect, starting with the friendly and helpful staff The hotel is modern, the rooms small but incredibly well-designed to contain everything you need. Clean, comfortable and well situated, in our opinion it would be hard to find much better. It certainly made our stay very enjoyable. Thank you to all the personnel, (and specially Natalie and Gino)

Arlo Hudson Square is a brand-new micro hotel in Tribeca, offering tiny but well-designed rooms, generous and handsomely-appointed public spaces, and an all-over trendy hipster vibe. Attention to brand is in every detail- the guest rooms, bars, washrooms, lighting- the music (think: "You're The One That I Want" from Grease, covered as a pensive ballad by a chanteuse with acoustic guitar) and the exotic scent wafting through the lobby, which depending on your tastes will seem either sexy or cloying. The rooms have comfy beds, a great tv, a large window with both privacy and blackout blinds, and a nicely-designed toilet/shower area, with the sink and vanity positioned by the sliding frosted doors of the washroom. This area has walls of frosted glass, and a sliding door which allows a large crack when open, something to keep in mind for those with privacy concerns, whether traveling with a partner or a friend. There's a tiny fridge in the nightstand, and a safe in a drawer under the bedframe (which I only discovered on my last day: a brochure on check-in describing amenties would be useful; is it true there's free coffee in the lobby? I never found out). There's a hair dryer and a clothes steamer hanging in cute embroidered bags near the door, but no kettle or coffeemaker. The HVAC is efficient, but loud: it turns on with a startling click and then a dull roar of air, which might disturb a very light sleeper. The public areas are well furnished, stocked with boardgames, books, and free wifi. The first floor has a bar, a restaurant, a 24-hour tuck shop in the lobby, a well-laid out seating area, and a courtyard. On the 11th floor a rooftop bar and terrace is open from 4pm to midnight.Traveling solo, I found other guests too involved with their phones to be friendly in those chic gathering spaces, but the bar staff were stars: Janelle in the main bar and Theo in the restaurant were chatty and cheerful. And a desk clerk solved my phone's inability to connect to the wifi by signing me into the staff network. The hotel is close to Canal station on the 1 line, and a short stroll from Soho and Chinatown.I enjoyed my stay at Arlo, but would have appreciated the touches that other micro-hotels in the city provide, such as a complimentary Continental breakfast, adjustable beds, and access to a hot drinks galley on the guest floors.

Arlo's staff members are some of the nicest I have ever encountered. Although the room itself is quite small, the shower is really nice and the bed is extremely comfortable. The location is very convenient and the aesthetics/design of the hotel is second to none. I especially appreciated the lobby bodega and the Blind Barber sponsored body products. A truly wonderful place.

Fun, friendly staff. Free chair massages in the lobby after check-in?!? Clean room. Small, but average for NYC. Great views and location. Quiet regardless of floor. I'm a returning customer. Look forward to my next trip.

I loved the modern clean design of the double bedroom for one - it was a fantastic bed, so comfortable, with lovely linen. Though I probably wouldn't want to share the room, as the bathroom sliding frosted glass door is a little too intimate unless you are, and the basin was outside the bathroom which was a bit odd but fine. However, it was THE best shower, featuring a big showerhead, extra showerhead and a fold down wooden seat. Wonderful. There was a hairdryer, clothes steamer, safe and a refrigerator, but no kettle which bugged me as I am a tea drinker and prefer to make my own tea when visiting the US. (You could buy tea in the lobby for over $5.00). The view of the courtyard was lovely, the massive tv rotated on its stand to afford really comfortable watching tv in bed viewing. It was great to be able to open the window for air if you wanted and I liked the automated blackout and sheer blinds. There's no room service, but you could get snacks and drinks 24hrs a day - and there's restaurants and bars there too. The guest spaces were great, you could hang out with your laptop using the free wifi in stylish lovely surroundings. There was a wall where people could leave their tips about what was good in the neighbourhood - a great touch. And there were events for guests like free wine tastings. But as others have noted, the real attraction of this hotel was the staff - all amazingly friendly, efficient, knowledgeable and, to use a well-worn cliché, they went the extra mile. I really didn't want to leave.

Back in October, my boyfriend and I stayed at Arlo Hudson Square during a weekend visit to NYC. The room we booked was, as described, small but comfortable, efficient as well as stylish. The layout struck me as well conceived and clever. During our stay, we particularly enjoyed the public spaces and took the opportunity to work at one of the tables while indulging in a glass of wine from the bar. The only problem we encountered came upon check-out. I had made our reservation on Booking.com, and there was a discrepancy in the amount I was charged, which Booking.com would not remedy. I got in touch with the manager at Arlo Hudson Square and described my situation. She promptly responded to me and graciously resolved the problem. I am grateful to her and Arlo Hudson Square for their superb customer service in this matter. I look forward to booking at Arlo Hudson Square again for my next visit to the city, and I strongly recommend this hotel to others.

Had a great stay at the Arlo Hudson Square. This is a cute little hotel in Soho. Well located with rooms that have everything you need. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The beds are super comfortable after a long day exploring the city and its nightlife. Coffee from the stand near the front desk is good, and the staff there are lovely. Highly recommended.

I knew full well coming to NYC was going to mean a few things. People, horns, traffic and cramped spaces. Despite my mental preparations I was still thrown back by just how small the room was. A mere moment after entering the room I hit the floor to ceiling window on the opposite side. Mind you, that this was only 3 large steps from the door. 2 twin beds sit atop a built in wooden wall to wall headboard and bed frame. The space was planned to use every available square inch of floor space. 2 inches of clearance from bed frame to door is a testament to that efficiency. I would have liked to see the headboard go all the way up the wall which would have allowed more vertical space for the peg board closet system to spread out a bit. If that was confusing, it was meant to be. In between the two twin beds was a nightstand and directly above that was a series of evenly spaced holes with tight fitting pegs. These pegs could be arranged in any fashion you saw fit to serve as a makeshift hanging system for 3 or 4 articles of clothing. We used it for our jackets as that was all the room it afforded us. The bathroom... sorry toilet and shower were separated by floor to ceiling glass. It was frosted from about 8 inches up to about 8 inches from the ceiling. So, when your roommate dropped his pants you saw a blur for the most part, yet clearly saw the color of his underwear! However, the glass could have been a bit more frosted as it left little to nothing to the imagination. For family or a couple this is fine but for two full grown men who are on a business trip, it’s a little too open concept. Some things should not be witnesses through frosted glass! The rain shower head was great but allowed a little too much water to flow into the shallow polished concrete shower basin. This would flood the toilet room directly adjacent. However, nothing a pile of towels and dirty laundry couldn’t solve. The lack of ventilation in the bathroom area left the room less than fragrant at times and closer to South East Asia than NYC when the shower was on. A vent would have been a nice touch but what is the saying. Hindsight is 20/20... or your roommates sight of your hind will be 20/20 in this room. The terrace was a nice touch as it made the claustrophobia a bit more palatable. An amazing view of a large black billboard with the word DogPound on it was our main focal point. To the right was a smaller building with a top floor loft which looked to serve no other purpose than to drive home the fact that we had been shoehorned into a sardine can! For all intents and purposes the room was sufficient. Heated and cooled quickly but consider the cubic airspace! It was minimalist and contemporary and served it’s main function... to shield us from the elements. It even had an outdoor shower, which we’re still trying to figure out why it was there. The only explanation is that when the weather permits, it gives you more space than the bathroom. Please don’t take this as a complete list of negatives. I am a pessimist/realist and call them as I see them. The hotel was clean, comfortable, modern, hospitable and was moderately priced for it’s location. Now, on to the hotel staff. This is where the redeeming qualities will come through. The staff is extremely friendly, caring and helpful. Our first night we met a lovely woman named Emily. She quickly welcomed us and helped us find a place to eat. We were under the impression that New York was the city that never slept. Although, true, there is activity 24 hours a day, nearly everyone of the 9 million+ residents stops eating after 10pm. Try finding decent food that isn’t deep fried or made from 20 syllable words after 10pm. No, seriously, try it... it’s like a frustrating scavenger hunt. Couple that with an impossible maze of one way streets and you’ll not be bored from 10pm till 6am! On the second day I fell ill and I mean ILL! Super flu hit me like a baseball bat being swung from a rocket ship. The 150 square foot room became my prison for 18 hours. After 9 hours I couldn’t take it anymore and called down to the front desk where a young woman by the name of Kate answered. I informed her that I was really sick, like way past “man sick”. She was full of empathy and took down a list of items I required to continue living. 15 minutes later she hand delivered each item with the addition of crackers which I had wanted but forgot to ask for. She was like an angel and I want to thank her publicly for her pay it forward act of kindness. You are amazing! All in all I think if you get this hotel at a decent rate it is by far one of the better choices. Just be prepared to get real comfortable with your roommate and if you are not ready to watch their full routine, either get your own room or figure out a schedule to allow for some privacy. Oh and don’t forgot that they loan bikes out. Borrow one before renting a Citibike!

This place is fabulous. The staff is awesome and very attentive to the needs of ALL guests. The food at Harold's is unbeatable - especially the Cheeseburger and their Mac & Cheese! Rooftop bar is fun and the subway is really close so you can get anywhere else quite easily.

The rooms are poky, but well planned and the beds ooze comfort. Probably one of the best hotel beds I've slept in. The air con sounds like it's going to fall out the ceiling it's so noisy, so on the second night we turned it off and slept like babies. The Bathroom is poorly designed as the shower screen isn't wide enough to prevent the flood of water going all over the bathroom floor, my pet hate. Amenities are lovely.The public spaces are generous and well considered and the guest relations staff are always chirpy and smiling, and happy to help with anything.

I love the staff at the Arlo hotel on Hudson The registration is done efficiently ,and quickly ,there is a small canteen where you could grab a snack or a cup of coffee anytime of the day or the night ,and u can sit on a bench waiting to register .there is also a very nice restaurant with wonderfully multinational staff who are very kind very nice and helpful and polite.the food is good breakfast is decent continental ,and everything is clean and pleasant besides the helpfulness of the staff.the room i had was not big and looked onto a courtyard it has an automatic curtain button so u do not have to tire yourself to pull the curtains on and off.as I am old the registration boy offered to help me to get my luggage to my room.the bed is a 5 star hotel bed very comfy ,i had a queen or king i can not remember as bed ,it is also panelled in wood which gives a special warmth with the shower and the bathroom are in glass so there is an airiness int he room although the space is small but not stuffy or impersonal.but compact.It is ideal for a business travel as well as leisure depending what your needs are.if you like dancing in your room than i would say it is small,I forgot my scarf at the hotel when i checked out ,i called them and they found it for me.they are very helpful.they have lounges and bars that are lnot impersonal and are comfortable there is also a terrace lounge etc.what is the main thing is a group of yong people who are determined to make their hotel work and it woks.i would definitely return to Arlo hudson or their other hotel the Nomad.it is a 4 star hotel in terms of comfort and 5 star in terms of staff performance.

Stayed for a total of 7 nights, red signals began as soon as we tried checking in after a long delayed flight. Our travel agent we booked the hotel through communicated to Arlo that we will be checking in later in the evening. Despite having already pre paid our booking Amaris (one of the hotel staff) advised us that we DID NOT have a booking in place, took her some time to find our booking then we were advised that our rooms had been cancelled however luckily we were able to check in and there were available rooms. Took our card for incidentals/bond. It wasn't until we checked out and I had contacted my banking institution to find out the hotel had debited unauthorised funds from our card meaning they doubled charged us for our stay. We paid for the hotel months in advance. I called them and advised them to see if they could rectify this but was told it was a "glitch" The managers advised they had cancelled the pending amount for the double charge on my card and the funds will be cleared into our account, 7 days later and still no sign of any of it. The hotel have basically ruined our holiday, I've now racked up a huge phone bill making international calls, calling my bank to see if they can fix it asap - several calls and emails exchanged with all 4 of their managers of Arlo and still nothing. What a way to ruin our month long trip. The arlo Hudson has deprived us of enjoying our hard earned savings for the remainder of our holiday.
