I sure hope that the hotel fixes their so called "glitch" so this nightmare does not happen again. No ownership of their mistakes, nor were they proactive in resolving it. I've not received one call or follow up since. The 1 star is purely for the design and cleanliness of the hotel, as well as their room temperature mini fridge that could barely keep one bottle of water cool.

My wife and I went to celebrate our anniversary in the city and checked in to the Arlo hotel. From the time I pulled up to the hotel to the time I left, we could't believe how nice everyone was. The staff was friendly, courteous, helpful and knowledgeable.The hotel is warm,inviting with alot of common areas and plenty of places to enjoy the scenery around you.The location made it easy to get around on foot and enjoy all the city has to give. The rooms,although small in size,are comfortable and cozy when you finally decide to go to rest. We loved this hotel and are planning our next trip in for the holidays.

Although the room is super small, I have a pleasant stay here. All furnitures are well put. Service is good especially the cleaning lady. The lobby and room have many places for you to work. Even though a bit pricy compared to the room space, it's worth.

As a new hotel it all work very well.The staff is friendly and locals who knows the area.The hotel is located in lower Manhattan but in the 'hip' areas in walking distance, and very close to the Subway, Canal st. also Starbucks, delis, restaurants is within minuts of walking. In the hotel lobby there is a direct link to Harolds Meat and three which is a separate review (it was a bit pricey but excellent!) and very convient if you don't want to go outside. The room is small, but that was expected, there is everything you need and modern/convient style. Only minus is that the slide door to the bathroom doesn't close thight, which leaves a gap open for view and sound ect. (you know what I mean ;)) There is shampoo, conditioner and bodywash in good quality, and everyday housekeeping, towel service.I booked in advance so the price was good and fair compared to what you get.There is lounge areas and a rooftop bar which is nice, there is free WiFi which works perfectly, and possibility for luggage store. But best of all they lent out good bikes for free! We used that, and it's way cheaper and quick to get around Manhattan! All on all really good hotel! Would come back again!

I stayed at Arlo in October for a quick weekend getaway. What a gem! Arlo will definitely be pushing Gansevoort, The James, and all other stylish hotels to the side! There are so many fabulous public spaces to lounge in. I loved the rooftop bar and the views cannot be beat. The restaurant, Harold's, was delicious! My girls and I are planning our next dinner party there. I would absolutely recommend this place. Make sure you meet Dan at the front desk, he was a superstar!
user_name:
SallyQt
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed here for 2 nights and was very happy with everything. Good reception, friendly staff, fresh and clean hotel and rooms.The rooms were small but it is New York standard so it is ok. If you are a bit shy when to go to the toilet and do not want anyone to see or hear, and you want to be in peace, then this hotel is not for you then there is a glass door to the toilet. But cool design, good beds, etc.Good breakfast, maybe a little pricey but most of it was good. And plus to the Host of the breakfast which was very nice, spoke Swedish with us when he learned the language through television and had a nice style!We will certainly return.

The Arlo was in a great location and is very stylish and cool. We stayed for 2 nights on the Hello deal which was a great offer. The staff were friendly, helpful and fun. The restaurant was absolutely brilliant - amazing food, not too fancy and great quality. The roof top bar was fantastic, great views and the bartender was really lovely and made a fab Manhattan. We had a great time here. The main areas of the hotel are comfortable and stylish with lots of nice places to sit and read or chill out. The room was lovely and comfortable and would be really great with some improvements. The bed was really comfortable and in a fun alcove type thing. As many other reviews have said the bathroom situation wasn't ideal. The frosted windows were fine but the fact that the door only slides rather than closing completely means there really isn't much privacy and it's a bit awkward when sharing. The space is really well laid out otherwise. I don't know if other rooms were better but the 'city view' that was promised and we paid extra for wasn't great - it was blocked by a large billboard that said 'DogPound' - not exactly the romantic view I was hoping for. The windows also didn't block sound out well at all which was distracting and the air conditioner/ heating system kept coming on and off all night and was really distracting and it was very hot then very cold. This may have been due to bad programming on our part. With some improvements this could be the perfect hotel. Very nice without being extortionate and a very fun vibe to it. I would stay again.

This is a fantastic new hotel in Tribeca/Soho. Location is excellent, close to Canal street Subway. As previous reviewers claimed, rooms are small, but ingeniously planned so that they are perfect for the solo traveler. Rooms consist of everything that a business traveler needs - an comfortable bed, a fold-up desk, a wonderful glass (half-see-through) shower and lots of connectivity points (USB, power sockets etc). Breakfast in excellent, fresh and has a good variety. most importantly, the front-desk staff - and particularly Dan and Michael - were exceptionally friendly and hopeful. I strongly recommend this wonderful hotel.

The hotel is very new and therefore everything is clean. I also liked the location, almost in the SoHo. The Lobby is the best part of the hotel. Unfortunately the rooms are minimal and the toilet is a problem. It is constructed of glass, as in all Arlo hotels (I checked this in the web). And this means no intimacy, we ended up using the lobby toilets. If i pay 246 euros/night and I finally have to use a public toilet, I am sorry but something doesn't work in the conception of this hotel. The rooms are also minimal, and are OK if you are in a short trip with little luggage, but we were two, doing a long trip and the room has no wardrobe and we didn't have were to hang our clothes. When I complained about the size of the rooms they answered me that this hotel was for "millenials" (ergo I am old to go to this hotel, next time I will go to a Holiday Inn, for old people like me but very confortable).Also I would like to suggest the hotel direction to low down or to turn of air conditioning, I think it was completely unnecessary to have all the hotel freezing during october. Don't you care about global heating?

I was pleasantly surprised by how much I loved this hotel. It's sophisticated and the staff are super friendly and helpful. It is a boutique style and everything is brand new. The rooms are ideal for single travellers or couples. I was on the 7th floor with a decent street view. The rooftop bar is a highlight as is the lobby area, complete with board games and magazines. The area is not busy or top of the destination list, but gives amazing access to the Hudson for a wonderful jog, and the rest of downtown/Soho.The bed was ginormous and comfy, and I would highly recommend this place to anyone for a few days stay.

Great location in Hudson Square- walking distance to the cute neighborhoods of Soho, Nolita, Greenwich Village. The ambiance is super stylish- clean, minimal design, and friendly. The Hotel Manager, Li, was very welcoming and warm. The front desk were professional, young and helpful. Natalie was very helpful. I would say this hotel is gearing towards the "young adult traveler". The rooftop bar was packed, fun and a great environment. The rooms are very small, but the beds are incredibly comfortable. The city view is amazing! There is no room service, but they have a 24 hour snack shop open, where I purchased bottled waters. The restaurant is very delicious! The bathrooms have sliding doors which isn't the best for privacy if you are sharing a room, but the shower head is so wonderful. Overall, I was very happy with my stay and will definitely be staying again.

Convenient and practical, with a personality. I liked the service and availability as well as the aroma of the hotel. My room was a bit small but ok as a single person on a business trip in lower Manhattan. Would go back again.

We reserved a queen room and a king room for us and our kids. Our friends reserved a King Room with adjoining bunk room. The staff was super nice and accommodating. Our kids felt comfortable calling the staff to get a new remote after we confiscated theirs so they would go to sleep. We enjoyed the games and puzzles and were very comfortable having dinner in the courtyard and hanging out in the living room style common space. I stayed an extra night and had a business meeting in the library. Great space for working while you are traveling and to meet new people in the common spaces. Don't miss out on the restaurant for breakfast and dinner.

Very nice and modern Hotel for all the people who loved design, minimalism and boutique Hotels, very contemporany instalations, for flexible and youn people, brand new. We stay for 8 nights, the subway was very close to the Hotel, 1 min walking, and midtown were just a 10 min subway trip and SoHo just 3 blocks walking, not for big families or people who are expecting a classic and big hotel, definitly not their target...free wifi

Sleek, modern, sophisticated for young and hip travelers. Room size was spacious and very comfortable and neat. Overall I recommend to stay at the hotel and you won't be disappointing. You come to NYC, you must stay at Arlo Hudson Sq.
user_name:
bestgreeneyzbaby83
New York City, New York

review_body: Everything was good , the hotel is new with a beautiful decoration and a perfect location near to Soho and good neighborhood with a lot of restaurants and stores . There is a metro station very close. The room I got was small ( I knew before booking) but it was ok for a trip that we stayed all day out and just went back to sleep. It was all cleaned every day. Beautiful rooftop, Harold's restaurant its delicious!  The receptionist and everybody that works for the hotel were very friendly and welcoming , the only disappointment is because some days the hotel had events happening in the lobby and I felt that the attention to the guests was not the same in these moments. I suggest the hotel to be prepared for non American guests , people that doesn't speak or understand English very well.  Muito acolhedor , ótima localização , perto do Soho, cheio de restaurantes e lojas perto e estação de metrô. O hotel não cobra pra receber encomendas , guardam suas malas se você fizer check out mas ainda não tiver que ir embora. Quartos são pequenos mas é tudo muito limpo e organizado, e novo.

I stayed here a few weeks ago for a weekend in NYC and was really impressed by the concept of the hotel: well appointed guests rooms made an ideal base for a weekend of exploring the city. Had a great nights sleep on the super cozy bed as well! The public spaces were so cozy and created a very laid-back vibe throughout the lobby. Staff at the front desk (Dan and Michael) were delightful at checkin and were incredibly attentive to my needs and made some great recommendations for local area attractions. The hotel is situated in Hudson square, a quick subway ride from midtown or the financial district.Great selection of treats in the lobby bodega store (especially the matcha seed pudding!)Absolutely would stay here again!!!

Sleek, modern, sophisticated for young and hip travelers. Room size was spacious and food at the restaurant downstairs was great. The ambience and vibe on the rooftop bar made me stay there till late at nite. I would only stay at Arlo whenever I'm in NYC next

Live the REAL New York. This hotel is well located, walking distance of many interesting districts, restaurants and activities.It is super clean and the staff is really amazing.The lobby is amazing with small little rooms where you can have a drink, relax, work on your laptop, read, everything. It feels like home !We had a 2 single beds room, small but very efficient and beautiful.The rooftop bar is a great extra with an amazing view !I really recommend this hotel for travelers not wanting to visit the typical "Time Square New York" and for business travelers for the amazing lobby with great work places.

Stayed there 2 nights. Brand new hotel which opened in September ... probably also the reason I got a great rate. Loved the room design (although might be a bit small for two). Extremely friendly and helpful staff (in particular Emily). Had some stuff ordered over the internet before arriving, they stored it for me for a couple of days, no issues at all. Had a drink in their rooftop bar ... fantastic. Had diner in the hotel restaurant which was excellent. Location is great, within 5 minutes walking distance to Soho and Tribeca with many great restaurants and shops. Other reviews complained about noise, I was not disturbed by noise at all, maybe because I had a Backyard View room. Would definitely go back!

The Arlo Hudson is a new hotel. It is near Tribeca but there is nothing immediately around it such as restaurants and bars along the street. The subway station is an easy 5 minute walk, maybe less. The hotel has a restaurant which we did not try. We visited the hotel bar which featured an $8 slice of Stouffers French bread pizza, mixed nuts for $5 and pimento cheese and crackers. Still hungry, we visited their 24 hr "food market" which consisted of a couple of refrigerated cases and some shelves. There, we got a $12 cold and stale ham and cheese (could not bite into the bread) sandwich and $6 yogurt. The room was tiny with a king sized bed pushed against the window. It reminded me of the cabin on a ship. There was no room to walk around the bed. There was no night stand. However, the worst part about the room was the bathroom design. It consisted of a frosted glass enclosed stall with a sliding door. There was only room for a toilet and shower. The sink was outside. The sliding door left a gap so that from the bed area you could see the person sitting on the toilet. The bathroom had no fan so you have no privacy in terms of bathroom noise.Overall it is an Ok hotel if you are traveling alone. Remember to eat before you get there.

The Arlo Hudson Hotel can be simply summed up by the phrase 'All style but no substance'. I spent 8 nights at the Arlo and while not a terrible experience it wasn't a great one either.It's a new hotel and is very well presented throughout. Simple, clean and chic with a trendy minImalist aesthetic. The rooms are small but designed well enough to maximise space where possible.Staff at the Arlo love to say "If you need anything just ask". And if you do who you are will depend greatly on what sort of response you get. The staff obviously have standards and if you don't meet their standards they will treat you differently. They will no doubt deny this and say they treat all their guests equally. However, I experienced it first hand on several occasions and noticed the same with other guests. This was not all staff but definitely the majority. The Arlo is a beautiful looking hotel but below the surface I found it to be ugly and shallow.Pros- Location - cool neighbourhood. Great shops, bars & restaurants. Easy accessible subway links New, clean, trendy lookingWell designed room but smallComfortable bedExcellent showerBig screen HD TVFridgeCons-Location - next to Holland Tunnel. Constant noise from traffic Unfriendly staff - not all but most. Discourteous, judgemental, unwilling to help. Lack of information given about hotel's amenities. Housekeeping intermittent - 2 days out of 8 day stay room was never servicedLimited storage space. Limited space around bed and windowBed bugsHot and noisy throughout - AC in room loud. Hallway got very warm making sleeping uncomfortable. Music on main floor makes hearing others difficult 24 hr Food kiosk overpriced. Poor selection and poorly staffed.Slow checkout process

Stayed at the Arlo for a business trip. Location in West Village/Tribeca area meant lots of great places for drinks and meals after work and on the weekend. Rooms are contemporary and stylish AND ALSO functional: numerous outlets and usb ports for charging, snacks/drinks for sale in the lobby late at night, great bar and restaurant (am sure it is a destination in its own right), rooftop bar, and open lobby with a living room feel - plenty of seating nooks for reading or taking a break.

Stayed here a week after it opened and there must have been a big push to the British market; it was awash with them. As is the modern style for hotels targeting millennials whose number one hobby is hanging out in wifi enabled 'spaces', the lobby and bars and restaurant punch above their weight. Staff are smart, attentive and friendly. The rooms I have to categorise as perfect for one. Even for New York they're small. As you walk in there is a shower and toilet cubicle, very small desk and a platform bed against the window. There is space to store stuff under the bed but, for long stays?Front desk staff are good at smiling and speaking but not listening. When I left, despite my making it clear what my name was, I was put with the wrong driver to the airport and he had to turn back after 30 blocks. Which landed me and the right driver in rush hour traffic.

The hotel is really well designed; everything looks and feels quality.The staff were extremely welcoming and helpful for my entire stay - friendly and knowledgeable with great recommendations.The location is perfect. It's in a more local part of the city surrounded by nice restaurants and public spaces - but close enough to feel like part of the action with Times Square a short subway ride away.The rooms are not massive; but they don't feel small; just a really good use of space with everything you need to hand.Ate a couple of times in the restaurant; the breakfast was fresh and tasty and the dinner was seasonal, well cooked and nicely presented. I hired a car for the weekend - was a bit worried about parking...but it was totally fine. Loads of free on street parking around the area all week long. On weekends a lot of restrictions are lifted so I parked literally a few feet away from the the hotel entrance for free!

Just returned from New York , where myself and four family members spent five nights at The Arlo Hudson Square, in Soho. This is a new hotel having opened on September 6th 2016.It was exactly as we expected so no surprises! We had three rooms which were more or less identical except our room was a little larger.Everything you needed for a short stay,fridge,safe ,T.V lovely shower room and toilet and small wash basin.Rooms were serviced and towels changed every day.There is a court yard which we used each morning to sit and have coffee,a bar downstairs and a lovely roof top bar with great views.All staff we came in contact with were very helpful .The area around the hotel was lovely, good places to eat and nice bars to sit outside weather permitting.GREAT shops.It is a good location for visiting Battery Park, Statue of Liberty etc. but also close to underground stations to travel up-town, which once you got the hang of it was very easy to travel on and fast.So a big thank you to Natalie and staff, you are doing a good job,well done! Would certainly recommend this as a place to stay.

Harold's, the restaurant, proposes an interessant cooking, délicieuse meat. The roof top Terrace has an impressive vies on Hudson river. Close to Soho, NYU. Good Subway connections. Juste the place to be!

We've just spent 5 nights here. Flawless hotel, service and great location. Roof top bar is a special space. Thank you to all the Arlo staff for making our stay for our wedding in NYC so good. Highly recommend!

Lovely place. Cosy! The rooms are small but manageable. Amazing staff. We had really nice breakfasts every morning. Loved the omelettes, heathy stuff. Soho, Tribeca west village are all close by! Walked everywhere. My daughter and I had a great time although she was working! Will stay there again.

Arlo's was booked for my wife and I as a treat by our daughter-in-law. We were travelling in the USA with our last night being in NYC. This is a new hotel. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and quietly efficient. The bedrooms are compact with every amenity and service you need for a short stay. The breakfast was the best "continental" we have ever had - fruit, granola, all types of breads, cheese, hams and a high standard of coffee. The staff were young and clearly well trained.

The hotel is new, we arrived in to the hotel 2 weeks after opening and stayed there for 4 nightsSince day 2 we did not have worm water for shower in the morningsIt upset us very much.Hotel manager ( Alex) offered us a free day ( one of the 4 nights) and until today hotel is ignoring our emails calls and there's offerWe of course did not see any pay back as promised If you go to New York - don't take this hotel ! They need time to Learn ho to mange an hotel and treat its customers

Dan & Lawrence offered us an immaculate service and advice, the rooms are very nice and quiet, the location is perfect. We thoroughly enjoyed our week at New York thanks to Arlo Hudson Square Hotel! And dogs are allowed! Bart & Veerle

The Arlo is a beautifully decorated hotel. It has a great restaurant with 24hr cafe stocked with great stuff. The lobby and common areas have great hang out spots and the roof has brilliant views. Rooms are small but nicely done and very comfortable.

The Arlo with its urban style opened a month ago and was buzzing with activity.The lobby is modern and sleek and offers many unique sitting areas. Plug ins are located everywhere so you can charge your device. Rooms are minimalist, modern and maximize the space. We stayed in both the queen room and the bunk room. Both did not disappoint. The roof top bar offers amazing sunset and night time views of Manhattan. The Arlo is a few blocks from the Hudson River trail, for miles of walking. Many great restaurants are a short walk away. We will definitely be back.

Stayed at the Arlo for 4 nights in mid October 2016. New, fresh and nice & friendly staff. The roof top bar i nice, but please see to that the hotel WiFi can be usel outdoor. The rooms are small, but nice and well designen. When you stay in NY you don't spend more time than neccessary in the hotel, so the comfort of the ned is the most important thing. The beds where really nice.Just 4 minutes walk to Canal Street subway, and in just 4-6 stops you are up att Penn Station.I would absolutely recommend this hotel.

Sparkling new hotel in great location. Close to subway lines and walking distance to great areas. The common areas in this hotel are funky and stylish and comfortable! Coffee and snacks available 24/7 in lobby. Staff are very pleasant and helpful. The rooms are 'micro' but well laid out, the beds are very comfie and the shower was wonderful. Rooftop bar area too. Would recommend this hotel without reservation.

Great little hotel just off Canal St. Rooms were small but well-laid-out, rooftop bar great for views of World Trade Center and the river, breakfast buffet had all the classics but some additional slightly more imaginative (and delicious!) dishes, staff were friendly and helpful. Could have done with a coffee maker in the room or free coffee in the lobby, but that's my only criticism. Great value for Manhattan, I'd happily stay there again.

Kate and the Arlo crew and the front desk, along with the rooftop and location made our NYC stay that much more enjoyable. Each day Kate met us with a smile and the rest of the well coiffed and attired staff took care of our every need. A cool, hip, but also friendly NYC hotel.

Stayed at Arlo for two nights on a trip with a friend. The hotel is located in a really good spot between SoHo and TriBeCa which means short walks everywhere around those areas.The hotel is clearly brand new and has a hipster feel to it, front desk makes any effort to be helpful and big shout out to lovely Natalie.Lobby, outdoor space, rooftop and lounges are very cool as well as their restaurant/coffee/bar place harnold's which I only went for breakfast e.g. coffee (amazing flat white!).I stayed in a standard queen room and it was perfect. I was however prepared to the fact that the room was going to be small and cosy but that was a trade in I was prepared for given the very competitive price and the great standard of the hotel and top location.As per other reviews you need to be sharing with someone you are confortable with sharing as there is not going to be much privacy there! Bathroom (shower and toilette) is a built in glass one so whilst it is practical you can hear and partially see what’s going on in there. Sink is outside the glass structure.The bed and pillows were uber comfortable and the whole room is spotless clean - minimalist design and style which I loved.I was in one of the highest floor and facing the city view which was super quiet, you have also the option of the garden view.In summary, great hotel and modern vibe, fab location, great room standard (albeit small) so it’s definitely a fab solution given the price and the NYC hotel standards. definitely recommended.

Small but functional hotel room at a reasonable price for Manhattan. Located next to the Holland Tunnel. Friendly and helpful staff. Enjoyed the bar on the top floor. Easy walking to Greenwich Village and Soho shopping. What's not to like?

The Arlo Hudson Square is a top class 'microhotel'! This has been explained already....but once again: 'microhotel' in plain English means a hotel room that is perfect for a solo/business traveller or a close couple/pair on a short stay (or, if you don't mind only hanging up your clothes on a rotation of three outfits at a time, a longer stay) The Arlo's concept is very similar to the Citizen M, but the execution is superior. The fixtures and amenities in the room are very high quality and the lounges, restaurant, bar and other common areas are beautifully designed and functional. We had a maintenance blip during our stay and the front desk handled it beautifully. I would recommend unreservedly.

I was in a twin-bed room, but I think they're all pretty small. If you have a big suitcase, forget it. No place to put it. They say "pegboard closet", that means some hooks hanging off the wall. The room was clean, the shower was great. We had to call twice for a non-feather pillow, they brought more feather pillows. Eventually, they got it right. Noisy A/C vent, but we opened the window and actually loved the sound of the cars outside.Check out the rooftop lounge, even if you're not drinking. Lovely views.

My time at the Arlo was amazing. The location is perfect, very close to Soho and Tribeca. Arenas helped me and made a great first impression. She was so helpful and insightful. Also, their uniforms are sharp and very professional. I will recommend this place whether you are staying for a night or longer!
user_name:
William J
New York City, New York

review_body: My son and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights while visiting New York for his 21st birthday. We absolutely loved this hotel from the second our taxi pulled up outside of it. Staff are friendly and helpful, decor is fresh, bright and the whole place smells lovely! The beds are SO comfy and the view from our room was fantastic. There is a nice little park opposite the hotel and deli down the road does some great sandwiches. The surrounding area felt safe and the hotel is only a few minutes walk from Canal Street subway station making it easy to get around the city. If I had to find anything negative to say about the hotel at all, It would be that there isn't much privacy in the toilet, but I wouldn't reduce my rating for this one thing as it was easy enough to work around. This hotel would definitely be our first choice if we were lucky enough to visit NYC again.

The location is on the outskirts (for now) of Soho, Tribeca but you are only two blocks away from these areas as well as two subway line stops. I was very impressed with this hotel and with a few tweaks can become an excellent choice if you want to stay in this area. The room was small (160 sq ft) but offered everything i needed included a nice shower and a very comfortable bed..The major plus was the first floor living room set-up areas for enjoying my morning espresso from their lobby cafe counter or the happy hour glass of wine before I went to their in-house restaurant with great food.I had a queen bed which would be too short for tall people but it did allow me to walk around the bed. The area around the front desk was a tad too small as this area was frequently congested with people checking in and checking out but further in, the lounge areas were a picture of calm.Like some many new hotels like these, they lacked a business center so any printing has to be done via a staff member's email address.

This hotell is brilliant. Perfect location near the shopping and restaurants in SoHo. Very nice interior and comfy beds. The staff is welcoming and helpful. Great resturant and nice rooftop bar.We will definately return!

Brand new hotel in Tribeca. Were a bit apprehensive with it being new and with specifically designed small rooms. But the place is a must stay. Excellent friendly staff. Brilliant restaurant. We will definitely be staying again when we revisit.

Brand new hip hotel at the great location of the border of Tribeca and Soho, Great friendly staff, cool vibe, fun roof-top bar, very small room where you have to bend to get between the end of the bed and the wall.

My daughter and I stayed at Arlo for a long weekend. I love the hotel. The rooms are small but very smartly designed. We stayed in a room with a king size bed. Loved the way the bed was build from wall to wall next to a big window and with a big build in TV. Very cozy. The staff is friendly. The reception and other common areas is also very nice and beautiful decorated. My daughter loved the post-it wall outside the elevators were guest puts their recommendations. The location is great. You are just minutes walk away from Tribeca, Soho and Meatpacking. I will definitely be back

The hotel was only open a few weeks before stayed there so there were a few teething issues and I am sure these will be resolved in the near future. The staff were all great and did everything they could to look after us. The rooms are small, very small. They make this clear in their photos so no-one should be surprised. The biggest issue the no effective segregation of the toilet with the main room. Solo travelers will have no issue but couples will find this a little uncomfortable. Otherwise the small room is brilliantly arranged with smart and clever idea. For example you get a clothes steamer instead of an ironing board. There is no wardrobe but there is a hanging rack and customizable peg board to hang up clothes. Apart from the bathroom situation it was all fun. Where The Arlo starts to shine is when you get out of your room and use the communal spaces. There are several relaxed and stylishly appointed areas on the ground floor, part of which cleverly turns into a bar at night, and a large outdoor courtyard. We had a great time at the bar after dinner, discussing cocktails with the barman and meeting other guests - it is that type of place.This area is so nice you could sit down there all day, do some reading, catch up on work or meet friends. Also on the ground floor is a restaurant the Meat+3. We had breakfast and really loved the refreshing approach to the menu and reasonable pricing. Alternatively you can just grab a snack and coffee to go from the front foyer. Then on the roof is a rooftop bar with ample outdoor seating when the weather is good. Once again this feels like a welcoming and communal space where all activities would be welcome. We loved our short stay at the Arlo. As long as you can deal with the bathroom and small room this is a great place to hang out for a few days in a great part of NY with lots of shopping and restaurants nearby and if travelling for work there would be no better place to stay on a budget.

I'm so disappointed to write this review. We stayed here the 3rd to the 6th October for a shopping trip. The location is fabulous, the hotel is immaculate because it's all brand new. The open spaces are great, the rooms are small but lets face it in NY who wants to be in there room. I was travelling with my boss so the whole sliding door bathroomWhich was see thru is a bit weird it's a good job we both get on and are used to travelling together. For 2 women there is hardly any hanger space but again u can get over that as it's all nice and clean. The restaurant is pants.... we was so tired after a full day shopping that we really couldn't be bothered going back out again but I wish we did the Mac n cheese side was so sickly, the salad bar looked like it was there for ages. The staff were all a bit odd like they didn't know what was going on. The other thing was rubbish was u couldn't get a decent coffee in a cup in the bar bit outside it had to be In Paper cups and that again took ages to do. Reception staff was ok, there was one girl who was brilliant but if you didn't get her then no one again really knew what was going on and the door man was lovely too. This i can get over thou as the location is so good and we wouldn't normally eat in the hotel what I can't get over is the fact that I paid the £900 on check out for our stay and they have continued to hold the £800 from when I checked in. So in total they have charged me £1700 for a 3 nights stay... I have spoke to the hotel and they have given me the accounts email address but I haven't heard anything back and it's been 6 days now. I've stayed in hotels all over the world with my job and never before has this happened. It's a disgrace! When I spoke to my bank they said the £800 will be returned on the 18th October... WHAT A JOKE! So if u do stay here for the location then please give them a credit card not your personal bank account as you won't have your money for 2 weeks! It's such a shame as I wouldn't stay here again because of the sheer lack of customer service!

For being a new hotel we were expecting things to be unorganized or mediocre, but they weren't ... at all. From start to finish our stay was nothing but a gold star! As we entered, the lobby smell reminded me of a luxury hotel in the Caribbean (fresh and clean with a hint of eucalyptus- my favourite!) The staff was amazing and helpful anytime we spoke to them. The look of the hotel was bright, clean and modern. There was not one thing I would change about this place and we will certainly be back!

Hotel was near Soho and Tribeca with subway stations on spring st and canal st nearby.Good location for lots of restaurants and boutiques although an expensive area to eat out in .Hotel bed was extremely comfortable with good quality bedding.Rooms are purposely small and well designed ...not much space for people who want to spend a lot of time in the room...definitely for people who are exploring all day.Room would benefit from little extra touches such as a nyc guide or room service menu...I would put welcome chocolates in the room and maybe some sort of drinks like coffee machine or water as travellers often remember special touches over everything else.Roof terrace has more potential. I would have a few cool sun loungers around and use outside bar for a cocktail hour ...bar lady was lovely. Reception was a mixed experience. Male reception staff were more friendly than the female members one of which was a bit pretentious and more interested in herself than the guests.The hotel smells divine in all areas and has great decorThe restaurant style of food doesn't match the cool traveller vibe the hotel promotes.I would be going for exotic salads and less heavy foods..All in all it was a fabulous experience but there are small areas for improvement

This is destined to become a really good friend. the rooms are small but extremely well thought through..and who needs a sofa and a desk when you are in New York. Just get out more. The decor is stylish, the rooftop bar is fun and great views of the river. Best of all the front of house service is excellent. We had no hot water for one day (new hotel teething troubles). We didn't make a big fuss but they took off a whole nights stay and taxes. Massively impressed overall.

We loved it, perfectly located, small rooms but so cozy and well designed. Gave us everything needed and more! Dan at the desk is truly a gem! His energy and efficiency helped us through our whole stay!! And the public space! Don't even get me started, I felt so much at home that I didn't even want to check out! Cannot wait to come back again!

My husband and I stayed for 2 nights in a King room with courtyard view. Brand new hotel with a great atmosphere. The rooms are small but everything is right where you need it. Cozy bed & nice furniture. The hotel was very clean and smelled nice. We spent a lot of time in the lounge area on the 1st floor as it was super cozy with 60s mod style comfortable sofas. They also have vintage board games! We played old school Trouble and backgammon with our friends both nights. What a great idea for a hotel. We venture to NYC often and this will be our new spot for sure! Thank you

Rather than going on about everything that went wrong during my stay, I will just note this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, and the bathroom lacked adequate privacy. The room---which was a Hotwire $300 boutique hotel "surprise"--would be ideal for a single person but was inadequate for two. The bed configuration (tucked into an alcove) requires that one person climb over the other to get in and out of bed. There was inadequate luggage storage space. My biggest objection was the toilet area, which is separated from the rest of the room by a sliding frosted glass panel that provides insufficient buffering of sound, sight, and odor.

We stayed for 7 nights. The king size suite with 'yard' view was very small. The view was bad. The toilet and bath was literally in the same room as you sleep. We had expected a bigger room fornthe price. The place seemed very clean and house-keeping was by every day - no complaints. However, we were bitten by bed-bugs - so the cleanliness was either superficial or we were just unlucky since these creeps can bite their way down to the mattress which is hard to clean properly. The receptionists were friendly and the Harold's 25/7 kind of vendor was absolutely great to have at the hotel when you needed a latte or granola yoghurt or a quick sandwich/snack. Location wise it is very close to SoHo and Spring street - great hip area. Also close to both Canal street metro and Spring street metro station which gives you only 15-20 minutes to Times Square and 5 minutes from the financial district. All in all we would probably not go back to this hotel due to the bed bugs. But location wise we would book some other hotel in the area.

Terrible night, the air conditionair was not working and our room was very, very noisy the hotel is very close to the holland chanel and very early I wake up sweating and with a lot of noise.my reservation was for 3 nights and I went to another hotel after the terribel first night. And my credit card was charged for 2 nigths.

Rooms somewhat bijou but as expected for NYC. I was travelling alone so actually ok, but if sharing would have been a bit challenging! Hotel only open 1 month so everything shiny and new. Not in amongst the 'Village' but Easy to walk Downtown, SOHO, West Village. Noisy, no very noisy air con, had to turn it off as it kept waking me up! But all in all very happy with the place.

Rooms are small but efficient - containing everything needed for business travel. Including one of the best night sleeps ever! The public spaces were funky, stylish and surprisingly comfortable. Met up with a group for drinks and even enjoyed a fabulous breakfast at Harold's Meat plus 3!

This was a great hotel for a weekend trip. Although the rooms are small (so make sure you like who you are traveling with) they are very well laid out. The hotel is spotless with fun common areas. There was ample seating with newspapers in the lobby area plus the roof top bar. The bar has good cocktails and well manicured set up. Finally, I want to say that the customer service at the hotel is exceptional. As soon as you walk in they are accommodating and friendly. They made it possible for both myself and my friends to have an early check in. Overall a great experience.
user_name:
rwiede
Washington DC, District of Columbia

review_body: Great use of space , rooms are small but really functional. The bathroom was very interesting fab toiletries and shower but certainly no privacy if you are traveling with someone . Did not hear any street noise which is incredible for NYC the only complaint I have is the ac was the loudest I've ever heard kept waking us up , otherwise I will definitely stay again . Beautiful rooftop bar

Had a decent stay here this week. Great location and nicely designed, but the hotel has only been open for 3 weeks, and a number of things were off or went wrong. Front door is terrible (the door closes in your face, which is frustrating when you're slogging bags with you, and there is no doorman to assist). The AC was broken in my room when I arrived. They fixed it that night, but it broke again and I had to change rooms. The supplies in the room were not well maintained, the staff seemed nice and friendly (especially when I checked in), but not really caring if my stay was going well (which I was surprisingly not asked at check out, especially since I was forced to switch rooms). A cute hotel and comfortable, despite a tiny room, and good for an individual stay (not for more than one person, if you need any privacy or space to stretch out). Might try it again after they work out the initial kinks for business trips. But considering the price, I expected more.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights in September. The hotel itself is beautiful and very modern. We really appreciated our early check in after travelling a long distance to get to the hotel. The rooms are very compact but have everything you need. The lobby area is very peaceful and quite funky! The breakfast was also very good, we ate here each morning. The hotel is very close to subways which can bring you to various locations quickly. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others.

Stayed at the brand new Arlo for four nights. The hotel was delicate, fresh and new. Staff was very helpful to accommodate us when asking to change rooms for a better view (booked city view). The rooms are small, but efficient and we really did not need a large room given we were out in the city all day. The bed was amazing! We had a king size and really enjoyed the fresh linens and a good night´s sleep every night. The hotel is very close to Spring street, which we walked to almost every night to get to lots of different restaurants/shops. Also easy to get to Canal street subway station. Great rooftop terrace with a nice view and perfect to spend an hour in the sun before sunset after sightseeing. We did not try the breakfast, but I believe it was $22 a person, so we found lots of other cheaper options in the area. Would def stay again next time we are in New York!

The Arlo had been open for just two weeks when we arrived for our stay, and what a warm welcome we received. The staff were all highly professional and very friendly. The room we booked was a basic double room with an incredibly comfortable mattress, and had a really effective hand held clothes steamer rather than an iron and ironing board. The hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Greenwich, SoHo, Chelsea, the Meatpacking District (and the Highline) etc. Harold's restaurant offers a superb buffet breakfast, and sundowners at sunset on the rooftop bar is a great way to recharge and relax after a day's sightseeing. We will definitely book into the Arlo Hudson Square on future visits to New York.

So apparently this place is brand new! I'm not surprised, the rooms are gorgeous. It's actually kind of amazing how planned out the rooms are because they are TINY. I could see some people not liking it but this is New York and it still had everything we needed. We booked one night here and decided to stay a second night. Great location. We walked to little Italy for pasta. The only thing that was a bummer was our first day we didn't have any hot water!! some problem with the boiler but I'm sure they're still working out the kinks and it was fixed the next day. Great ambience and staff. Awesome rooftop. I would say again!

A no frills hotel with quirky, tastefully decorated rooms in a modern, design conscious style. 'Micro style' rooms make it ideal for a weekend of sightseeing when your hotel is more used as a base rather than somewhere to spend your time in. Does what it says on the tin and is in a great location. Would definitely return to Arlo again and try their other locations too.

Arlo is in a great location that's really easy to find. There's not too much traffic other than the Holland Tunnel from what we noticed. The hotel itself looks great and is very clean. The beds were very comfy. However, the service is a bit unorganized and slow. You can tell the staff is trying hard to do a good job but they seem too stressed out or don't know what their roles are just yet. Check-in was not very smooth since I was 5th in a line of some people that seemed to have been waiting for awhile. My husband had to stand at the curb by our rental car because there was a sign for valet but no valet attendant to be seen. No one explained to us the services/amenities of the hotel at check-in like other hotels typically do. We only got the wifi password from eavesdropping on someone else's check in. They also ran out of parking passes/valet tickets for our car so we had to leave our rental car keys at the desk so they could figured things out while we went sight seeing. I was a little worried to leave our keys since everything seemed so unorganized. Four hours later we came back to the hotel and the gentleman still wasn't sure if the valet ticket he had was for our car so he went to double check if the ticket was for our car. The whole Arlo experience was odd and it seemed that everyone we encountered had never worked for a hotel before. The staff was really nice and very apologetic but when you are on vacation you just don't want to be stressed about things that shouldn't be that stressful.
user_name:
LinhD_13
Royal Oak, Michigan, United States

review_body: We booked the Courtyard View - Queen room and while I loved the design and furniture, my only gripe was that the bed literally took up the entire width of the room from wall to wall. There was maybe about a 10 inch "gap" from wall to bed to use as a 'walkway'. I can't tell you how many times I stubbed my leg on the corner of the bed frame... maybe I should just count how many bruises I've accumulated on my shin :/ Considering the size of the room, there's probably no other way they could've positioned the bed, BUT they definitely should have reconsidered the positioning of the tv mounted on the wall which is in DIRECT PATH of the gap between the wall and bed! I felt like I was playing Human Tetris just to get up in the middle of the night to use the restroom. Not fun.Aside from that though, I don't have much complaints about our stay. The staff was welcoming and able to accommodate our early 7am arrival (music to my ears after a red eye flight!). The hotel itself is beautifully designed and there are maintenance guys constantly making sure that everything is clean and spotless on the hotel grounds. Although the hotel does not offer room service, there is an adjoining restaurant and rooftop bar with a nice view of the city (both of which were a little pricey with mediocre food, but offered a nice ambiance without having to leave the hotel). There is also a 24 hour deli corner store right next door and the hotel is walking distance to all the shopping and great food west village & soho has to offer. We've visited NYC in the past and did all the touristy things already, so the main purpose of our trip was to eat and shop which is why staying here made the most sense for us. TIP: keep in mind this hotel literally just opened, so it would be wise to keep the hotel address handy if/when catching a taxi ride from the airport to the hotel... each time we've visited the city our cab driver always knew where to go if we simply told them the hotel name, but our cab driver (who explained he has been driving in the city for the past 15 years), was thoroughly confused when we told him the name of our hotel.

I stayed at the arlo with a friend. We loved the soho location and it's easy to get all over Manhattan from there. The hotel has some great bars and communal areas including the rooftop bar where you can eat takeout. My main complaint with this hotel is the in-room bathrooms. Do not book this hotel unless you are fully comfortable with your travel companion hearing and seeing you use the toilet. The bathrooms are a frosted glass box in the middle of the room, with space at the door for sounds and smells to escape. We had an issue that we booked a twin room through booking.com and were surprised to find bunkbeds in our room - this was definitely not what we had booked and was not made clear at check in. The hotel blamed the way that room info comes through to them from booking.com and they were not able to give us a twin room until our second night. The biggest issue with the bunk room was the lack of space. There was nowhere to sit or relax except the beds and who wants to scale the top bunk every time they need to sit down?I would potentially stay at the arlo again if I was travelling alone but I prefer a traditional hotel room for space and privacy.

Overall we were very happy and satisfied. I would definitely stay again.Service: Top notch front desk, friendly staff, and room was cleaned very quickly.Location: 5 minute walk from the heart of SoHo. Very trendy area. There definitely is some car traffic due to the Holland Tunnel being nearby. I would avoid taking a cab to the hotel during rush hour. Better to subway and walk.Room: It's small--not cramped. But that's New York. Unless you're paying an arm and a leg, you're not going to get a huge room. We felt very comfortable as a couple. Bathroom: This was a bit odd, there was no shower door--just an inch high divider on the ground. As a result, when we showered the entire floor of the bathroom got pretty damp. This honestly wasn't a huge annoyance but it was odd...Other: There's a 24 hour bodega (mini-mart) in the lobby. This was clutch! We got hungry at night and were able to grab some popcorn and sodas at a decent price. Didn't even have to leave the hotel. I definitely plan on going back to the Arlo.

From check-in to check-out, including breakfast, I have not stopped being amazed by the amateurism of the staff and the terrible service. I took the exact same breakfast three days in the row and every day I got a different check! Upon arrival, almost at the check-in time, there was not a single room ready... I also experienced problems at check-out with the billing (again) and the staff was totally unable to charge my chip-based credit card although all other shops in NYC had zero issue with it. The food at the breakfast was extremely disappointing. The room were teeny tiny, even for NYC standards. The only positive aspect of this hotel is the location...

Having looked for a hotel in the Tribecca / Soho area for a while, only finding hotel with shared bath or extremely expensive we found Arlo, soon to be opened,,, glad we kept looking.Spent 5 days and really enjoyed the stay. The hotel has the charm of a boutique hotel but all the benefit of a larger hotel. Great bar at the rooftop, with a fantastic view to Newark and a glimpse of World Trade, not to forget good cocktails. The lounge area is like being home, but still plenty of room, space to work or just relax in their great furnitures, retro but still very modern. The restaurant had a good buffet with value for the money, still some minor startup problems which I am sure they will soon have fixed with a little more experience.The reception and staff were very service minded and nothing like the snobs' you often meet at the larger hotel where a 20 year look at you like, can you afford staying here, here they were friendly, gave good advise, handled it smoothly and were always available if you had a question.The location is one of the best in Nyc away from the main tourist areas, but still close enough if you want to be part of the crowd, suggestion take a Citibike. Lots of restaurants in Soho and we just loved walking the area from the hotel towards Chelsea, found a lot of good restaurants, not chains but individually owned.Two small points, rooms are small, as for most Nyc hotels, but the space is used to its maximum, and then there can be some noise from the traffic, but then again you are in one of the most vibrant cities in the world,, so all in all a great stay,, see you soon again

Was in NY for work for two days. The location of this place is right at the Holland Tunnel entrance and overlooks the Hudson. We couldn't tell it was a hotel at first. There were folks standing around looking around and we couldn't see a sign or anything. There is a small sign on the wall. They need to make it larger or something so folks can see it. The cab driver wasn't sure either lol. Very modern and chic. The rooms are small. When walking in, you see a huge window in front of you with the bed up against it. Not sure how two people would be able to climb into it. One would have to climb over the other. The bathroom was a first for me. The toilet and shower in the same spot like you would see in Europe. The sink was in the same room as the bed. There is no closet. There is a wall with an apparatus with hangers to hang your clothes on. There was a hair dryer but no iron. Had to unpack my things right away and hope there wouldn't be too many wrinkles. There is a button to push to get the shade down next to the bed. Took me a couple of minutes to figure that one out. I did go out to their rooftop bar. That was very nice. Bartenders were great and we lucked out with a beautiful night. So for me, not sure I would stay here if I had to make the reservation but most hotel rooms in NY are small. So be prepared.

First of all, the check in process was one of the BEST I've ever experienced in all my years of traveling. Kudos to Aransa at the front desk. She was friendly, efficient, pretty, stylish, and genuinely passionate about her job. She even went out and waved down taxis for us. What a great way to start off a hotel experience. The last night of my stay, I went up to the roof top bar (the night they had the bombings). Listen to me Angel the bartender is one of the BEST I have ever seen. I'm in the restaurant business and I know quality when I see it. He was personable, creative, attention to detail, clean and service orientated. Kudos Angel - to the managers of Arlo. If I were you I would do everything in my power to keep both Aransa and Angel two very happy employees. Micheal was also very good at the downstairs coffee snack shop. Very helpful. I rarely write reviews, but I had to do it this time.The food at breakfast was a disaster, but I understand that the restaurant was fairly new and kinks has to be worked out. The waiter tried I guess. The air condition in the room was very annoying...kept kicking in and out every ten min or so. Noisy and made it hard to sleep at times. Overall, a great stay! Friendly staff and i will return.

We had an excellent stay at Arlo with our family! The hotel is very modern and chic but comfy at the same time! Our first experience with the hotel began with a very nice gentleman opening the doors for us and offering to hold our bags while we parked our car. The lobby itself is very inviting, and large for a NYC hotel. There are many different areas to utilize, including the bar, meeting/office areas, convenience store, restaurant and other sitting areas. The room was small, as expected for a NYC hotel, but it had everything we needed, including a comfy bed, clean bathroom, working space, and your essentials. When we needed help, the staff were very responsive to our requests. Even though the rooms are small, the lobby creates a great sense of community whether you are a solo traveler, or there with others. Grab your laptop, bring it downstairs to work at the long table with plenty of outlets. Can't forget the rooftop bar! What a great view! Another great community space. The restaurant, Harold's, was not fully open yet, but we did have an excellent continental breakfast including some delicious items such as overnight oats, matcha chia seed pudding, lox, and other healthy items. The location is also ideal for shopping, bars, restaurants and sightseeing. It was a nice walk to One World Trade, excellent restaurants, coffee shops, and more. Obviously you can Uber or take the subway to other locations as well. We cannot fail to mention, again, the service we received. Whether it was a gentleman who stopped washing the windows to open the door for us, the friendly staff who welcomed us as we arrived or came downstairs, the general manager welcoming us, or the helpful housekeeping staff, they all were there to help make our experience excellent!

place is a bit overpriced for what you get - doesn't give you any of the amentities you would expect in a 4 star hotel like toiletries, bathrobes and slippers. does have a places to hangout and a rooftop. gives you swanky hotel feel. however the service was slow - slow to check in, slow to checkout and slow to get your bags. with how many other good hotels that are better value to money, i won't be staying here again.

We arrived about 1 am and were greeted enthusiastically - since we hadn't eaten and were on west coast time we grabbed some things from the prepared foods fridge and accommodated by the front desk - even though that area was closed. Every interaction with the front desk was pleasant. Delicious morning coffee right there on site. Sat in the courtyard, the various lounge areas. Even went up to the rooftop bar and sat outside one evening with a glass of wine and relatives from Long Island. It is a micro hotel and NYC is not a place to hole up in your room - so the compact room was perfect for our needs.I don't have a single negative thing to say about the Arlo Hudson.

Arlo has an excellent location on the corner of Soho, TriBeCa, and the West Village. There are tons of cool and delicious restaurants nearby, not to mention the restaurant in the Arlo itself. It's also near lots of cool shopping in Soho and the Village and perfect places for strolling in Hudson River Park. Arlo's library on the second floor is the perfect spot to unwind after all of that shopping and eating. The entire lobby is chicly decorated and has an outdoor lounge for drinking or relaxing.

We stayed for two nights in August. The open, public spaces are very cool and modern. The staff was friendly. Food (we only had breakfast) was excellent.The rooms are small but well designed. Shower and toilet are opaque glass enclosures, so privacy could be a concern if sharing a room with a friend. Bed was pushed out toward large window, which gave a sense of more space. Great WiFi and TV when you need to just relax.The location was pretty convenient for us. It's not a busy part of town, but we were able to walk to Soho and Meatpacking District. Subway stations were pretty close (~5-10min walk). If you're traveling to NYC for fun and aren't planning to spend a ton of time lounging in your hotel room (i.e., most people), this hotel is a great value. You'll have everything you need for a great trip.

Check-in was wildly disorganized. My wife and I waited in the lobby for 3 hours to check in to our room along with dozens of others (even though we requested an early check-in). We requested wine and a cheese plate be in our room upon check-in and it was never brought. Every area from the front desk, to the bar, to the cafe, to the restaurant was run by staff who had no idea what they were doing. Staff members would leave to go ask someone for help and never return. It took over 20 minutes to get a cup of coffee on two separate mornings. Generally the staff would smile and say "Yes" to requests, and then those requests would never be fulfilled. When we checked out, the staff double billed me for our stay. The hotel itself is very lovely. It's a modern, well-designed space that has potential. Unfortunately that potential has not been met. Currently it's a long, long ways off.

We stayed here with another family during the recent "soft opening," so not everything was in full swing yet. Nonetheless we really enjoyed our use of the common spaces. The kids played games and puzzles while the grown ups had a drink. We even ordered take out food and ate it on the courtyard. The roof deck is amazing and the second floor lounge feels like a private getaway from the city streets. Looking forward to coming back.
user_name:
ASV9
New York City, New York

review_body: We stayed at the bulk bed room. It's about a size of a matchbox. It's good for people who love pooping in a glass cubicle while shaking hands with another person sitting on the bed through the gap in the glass wall. Zero intimacy. Probably OK for couples or singles. The design of the hotel is cool though. The reception, lounge area and the restaurant & bar area is very trendy and cool, but the rooms (maybe it was just OUR room) are just sad. It made me cry.

Booked the Arlo Hotel quite frankly for the great rate. Was blown away by the hotel. So much more than I expected. Room is small but clean and efficient with comfy bed. Great rooftop bar. I love the neighborhood--totally away from tourist traps. But the best was the coffee bar in the lobby and selection of snacks. I will be coming back to this hotel!

Right outside the Holland Tunnel, this hotel was perfect for doing business in Manhattan and catching a flight out of Newark. This is a micro-room concept, but the rooms are so thoughtfully and stylishly designed that I felt like I was getting a great value. This was enhanced by the helpful hands-on staff and amazing public spaces with bar, living room (spinning vinyl records), awesome restaurant, rooftop bar. There was clearly a ton of talent behind the art program - I noticed fun touches at every turn. As long as you know you're getting a small hotel room, I don't think the value can be beat.

I was in New York for one night and wanted to make it a night to remember in a lovely hotel and when I saw the images of the Arlo, I thought, new build, luxury, beautiful rooms, it was perfect! The price is not that cheap but I wasn't looking for cheap but what I was looking for was a great room, great customer service but that is not what I received. Firstly I could not find a contact us on their website and when I contacted their FB page the email I got, they took a long time to respond.When I arrived I was greeted but I had my credit card taken, no passport taken which I thought was odd, and no explanation on the hotel, no summary of what payment was taken or if I needed help in New York. The room was small but I am only little so it's fine but I requested a City view room and it was one of a side street, when I went down to request, they told me there was nothing they could do and it was full up, if you are advertising for a City view room that is what I expect otherwise advertise it for a partial city view! I also had to ask about the payment for them to explain.Upon check out I advised the same thing when they asked how my stay was but all the staff member could say was that's how the building is built...not impressed! Overall the place is lovely, but don't expect it to be an enjoyable stay....

Stayed here opening night and night after on business. Things that Did Not Go Well:-First room was incredibly loud. The hotel is right next to Holland Tunnel, so if you have a room facing the street, you will hear nonstop honking from back to back traffic throughout the night. I requested to move rooms and they didn't have one available until the next night.-The room is really only meant for one person. I'm from NYC originally, so I'm used to no space. I have a hard time seeing two people be comfortable here.-The restaurant wasn't open but the bartender lets you take drinks up to your room-24 hour cafe downstairs is convenient but it seems nobody works there. I went 4 times and each time I kind of just wait awkwardly at the counter until some hotel employee is done chitchatting 6 feet away and walks over to take my order. Except for one guy who seemed to be missing a hand. He was awesome.-All the staff seem young, eager to please, but somewhat clueless. Nobody knew where extra forks were. I would stand somewhere waiting and be ignored. -Opening night had no hot water. Lukewarm at best.Things that Did Go Well:-I like being able to take drinks from the bar up.-They comped all my food (maybe about $70 over 2 nights) bc the noisy room the 1st night. -The courtyard room really is very quietThings that are.-They gave me a little bag of snacks in recompense for no hot water. Potato chips, a bottle of water, cookies. Ok.-The bed was shorter than the space the had for it, so there's a weird wedge they place under the pillows. I thought it was really uncomfortable and moved it.

I really enjoyed my stay at the Arlo Hudson Square. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms are very cool and the lobby had a great cocktail bar. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone coming to NYC!

Just stayed with my husband in this wonderful new hotel. We are both 5'10". Rooms were cozy but really well thought out. The bed was amazing. It's totally ideal for 3 or 4 nights for 2 adults. Nice bathroom with large vanity. Great service throughout. Nice bar. Close to both Soho and Little Italy areas.

Very small, so if you're looking for a spacious room, this is not it. However, it has everything you need and it didn't feel cramped at all. There is very smart use of the space. Huge bed next to a huge window with remote blinds. The staff was so helpful and courteous. I will definitely check out this hotel if I go back to the area.

From the moment I stepped through the glass front doors under a canopy of white lights, I was mesmerized by the Arlo Hudson Square. It was bright, welcoming, and sleek. I had a rough day of travel and wanted a drink and the best part was the bar was right past the entrance, well-lit and packed with others who appeared to be just like me, ready for a cocktail. I had an incredible mixed drink that the bartender suggested after I shared that I was a fan of gin. After checking in, which was a piece of cake, I went to my room. It was perfect for me! The bed was surrounded by a wooden frame that went up the walls and across the ceiling. It added instant warmth to the room. What was even better, was that the TV was mounted directly inside the bed frame. The best part by far thoguh, was the large window right next to the bed which allowed me to see the views on NYC (quite the bonus for seeing the sunrise in the morning as well). The beds were comfortable and I heard no outside noise which was a pleasant surprise considering I have stayed in hotels in NYC many a time before and been woken up to the grinding sounds of construction and traffic horns beeping. When I felt like having some background noise though, the bluetooth speaker connected with my iPhone and I was able to plug my charger in right next to the bed as the outlet is built into the bedframe!As for the Rooftop Bar, what a view! It was a beautiful summer day/night and perfect for sitting outside with a cocktail and some friends. My friends and family also stayed at the hotel in their own rooms as we had a wedding to attend, and we all found ourselves to be well-rested and ready for a day in the city. What was truly great was the immense amount of "social space" on the first floor of the hotel. We were able to sit in these gorgeous leather club chairs and plan out our day over fairly good coffee (and trust me, I'm a tough critic) from the hotel's very own coffee bar by the entrance of the hotel.Every time we entered or left a public space, the staff would check in with us to see how our stay was or if we needed anything. It was nice to feel thought of in a city that never sleeps and houses millions of people. We knew the hotel had an abundance of rooms and guests were everywhere throughout the buidling, but we were never made to feel like just another number. There was more than one occasion that I was addressed by name by a staff member which really made my day! My family and I will definitely return in the future and will be recommending this hotel to others! It's worth it! Let us know if any future properties open up in NYC or other large cities. I travel a lot for work and would recommend Arlo in a heartbeat!

Stayed here for four nights during their first week of operation. For a new hotel they handled all the pressure, and to top it off it was NY fashion week as well. Rooms were comfortable in size and had all mod cons you'd expect.Hotel has a couple of bars with the rooftop being the pick of the bunch. Great views at sunset and fantastic cocktails. Definitely will return next year.

Brand new funky boutique hotel on Hudson Square. Rooms are tiny, but brilliantly designed with the most comfortable beds ever. If you're travelling solo this is excellent value for NYC. If you're traveling with a mate, you need to be really good friends; no room for sulking...

We just spent 2 nights at the Arli Hudson in New York City. It's a lovely little hotel with small but well set out rooms. All of the staff we dealt with were warm and friendly, and very helpful. I paid a little extra for a 'city view' room but our room looked out to the wall of another building! Natalie at reception showed us several other available rooms and we were able to move to another room with a much nicer outlook. Ask for a higher floor if you want a view. Make sure you check out the Roof Top Bar, and enjoy the common sitting areas on levels 1 and 2.

The design is very hip and contemporary and while the rooms are quite small, the details feel well considered. This is a great hotel for anyone who appreciates the excellent aesthetic and mostly needs a bed to come back to after a day out and about. If necessary, the common spaces were great spots to camp out for a little while do some work, given the hotel wide wifi and ample outlets. Would definitely like to come back to try the restaurant.

I loved the bed at the window, with expansive city & Hudson River views. My room faced West, and despite proximity to Canal Street, I heard little to no traffic. The room was super cozy, the bed was great, the shower was too. Even though the rooms are small, they work really well!
user_name:
Audra T
New York City, New York

review_body: Micro hotel rooms. Prefect for business or site-seeing trip when not spending much time in your room. Men may find it too confined, I find it cozy. Restaurant not open for dinner which is disappointing after a long day of meetings. Outdoor courtyard & 9th floor outdoor lounge...nice! Friendly, accommodating staff.

The room is as wide as the queen size bad. more than one person in the room gets very crowded. The worst service - busy front desk that house the two employees they keep, so always a line even for the smallest thing.No hot water for the 3 nights I was here. You get to hear the Holland tunnel traffic 24 hours. The pics are misleading - its only the lobby that looks good. A two star hotel charging too much (the soap is in those bottles, just like Holiday Inn :)
user_name:
roai2005
New York City, New York

review_body: We booked through booking.com and the price was reasonable, but it did not specify the room would be so small.The bed almost reached the opposite wall so I could not walk round it without hitting the Tv and the sink was in the room with us and very little hanging space. It would be perfectly formed for one traveller but not for two. No privacy from each other if you get what I mean, only a thin glass pain between the toilet and bed.Even more disappointing was the lack of hot water, my partner had a cold shower and I ran it for 20 mins with only a slight raise in temp. I rang customer service and they said run it for another 10 minutes as they were having issues. I did and the temp raised a little more so I kept waiting until finally the temp was bearable to stand under it ( about 30 mins) But it was by no means hot, really unhappy with this as the hotel had two functions a place to sleep and have a wash and one of those functions didn't work properly.The style of the building was nice and modern but I wouldn't come here again.

great, sleek, modern pod hotel...comfortable and a great base to explore from.helpful, accommodating and happy staff...great new hotel addition to downtown. We spent a night with my wife and three children and had a blast!

Beautiful new hotel, with a very tasteful design - from the lounge/lobby to the rooms and the restaurant/bar. Excellent food and ambiance. I like the location - makes you feel more like a New Yorker than a tourist. Thank you Arlo for the five star experience at an affordable price!
user_name:
Monalo
New York City, New York

review_body: Great new design with very comfortable and smart accommodations for the modern traveler. Very conveniently located to the best restaurants and shops downtown. I would recommend the Arlo to anyone looking for a smart downtown hotel.
user_name:
castronovof
New York City, New York

review_body: We recently spent two nights at the new Arlo Hudson with my wife and kids. The staff was friendly and helpful and made us feel we were in good hands from the moment we arrived. Beautifully appointed common spaces and a fantastic restaurant. The rooms were thoughtfully designed and the kids loved their bunkbeds with individual tv's. Would definitely stay there again.

I visited the New York for business. I stayed at the Arlo Hudson for 2 nights. This brand new hotel is a hidden gem in New York. From the moment I checked-in until I left the staff at the hotel made me feel like I was home. They are very friendly and knowledgeable. Perfectly located in Hudson Square walking distance to the Canal Street subway station. The common areas are very spacious and open. I really enjoyed relaxing at these areas. The hotels offer complimentary fiber wi-fi, a great benefit during my stay. The rooms are cozy, but they have all the amenities you need for a good and comfortable night sleep. I definitely recommend this hotel for your stay in New York.

My wife and I stayed at the brand new Arlo Hudson Square for a three day two night weekend. Arlo is brand new and will set a new standard at the Hudson Square – TriBeCa/SoHo location. Extreme friendly staff all around. Brand new rooms, we were in a single room, small (New York size) but everything is logically arranged. We enjoyed the 1st floor bar, the excellent breakfast / brunch, and the view on the roof top. The location is outstanding, 6 minutes walk to the Hudson River Greenway, excellent for walking, jogging or biking (rental nearby). Big selection of restaurants besides the excellent restaurant in house, South (TriBeCa) and North – we ate at two good family restaurants – and going East (SoHo)!

What an amazing new hotel! My wife and I needed a weekend away - what a find! From decor to dinning to destination, really fantastic. The staff was kind and helpful. We enjoyed so many parts of NYC by foot. TriBeCa, SOHO, China Town, West Village and Union square and with a short cab ride we were at Times Square and Broadway. For around $300 you just can't beat the luxury, location and comfort. Can't wait to go back!

Holy smokes, what a great hotel. Rooms are small but very clean and efficiently laid out. Beds are super comfortable. Cool, spacious lobby - a great space to work or relax. Kids loved the bunk beds (each with its own TV, which was pretty sweet) and the board games in the lobby. Very happy with the breakfast at the hotel restaurant--especially the buffet bar with a ton of options, from matcha chia pudding (!?!) to bagels and whitefish salad.

I stayed at the Arlo Hudson Square for three nights recently, and had an excellent experience. The staff were extremely helpful and kind, and the rooms were impeccably clean with a cool modern feel. The hotel itself is in a great location, just minutes from the highline and the river. I will definitely be going back!

We stayed here for 2 wonderful nights. The staff was warm, welcoming, and very helpful. They recommended terrific local restaurants within an easy walk. It was easy to get to Little Italy, Chinatown, the village, Wall Street and midtown. The bed was so comfortable. The room was clean and light with ultra modern furnishings and quick, reliable wifi. We will be back. Thank you Arlo Hudson Square!

Very modern and nice. Lots of places on the first floor to hang out, with a nice courtyard. They had a work area with lots of outlets for laptops and phones and even a library like study on the second floor. Great roof top bar with excellent views. We liked the location. Close to the New World Trade Center and not far from the subway making it easy to get around. Most important of all, the staff was very knowledgeable and helpful.

We stayed at this hotel for one night and I wish we had stayed longer. I loved so much about it I couldn't possibly list it all, but below I'll give a few highlights:First off, when you walk into the building there is a little store, and they have super fun stuff. All of it is sourced in NYC around the neighborhood, and I wanted to buy most of it. The staff at the front desk and really through he hotel were all super friendly and professional. I loved the uniforms!The main lobby is one of the most naturally comfortable lobbies I have been in. There are board games and puzzles all around, as well as a record player with a variety of records to choose from. The furniture also managed to be incredibly chic and comfortable, a rare combination. The same could be said of the entire back lobby area. Upstairs, the rooms feel ten times bigger than they are. My floor to ceiling windows looked out at a beautiful building across the street and gave a glimpse of the skyline- and I was only on the 7th floor! More importantly, the mattress was AMAZING. It is very rare that I go to a hotel and get a fantastic nights sleep, but here I slept like a rock. The pillows and comforter were perfection as well. The room also had a super cool pegboard on the wall that could be adjusted to hang bags or anything else you like. The bathroom, though small, was mighty.
