The pressure of the shower was perfection and the temperature changed quickly and accurately. The shampoo and conditioner also left my hair feeling smooth and silky- something often not true of hotel hair care. Another perk: they were in big bottles- environmentally sound! In the morning I went downstairs to the restaurant, Harold's, for a complementary breakfast. The menu was pretty standard, but everything was cooked to perfection. They had the nicest bagel buffet bar I have seen, with lox and chia-seed pudding and many more toppings. My time at this hotel was amazing, and I recommend it for anyone coming to NYC for a few nights.

charlotte899
New York City, New York

review_body: My wife and I had an excellent experience and would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are excellent, very friendly, very professional. The public spaces are beautiful with natural materials, cool design, very comfortable and inviting. The rooms are not large, but perfectly laid out, beautifully designed, and great value!
user_name:
KeithJS2014
New York City, New York

review_body: I recently stayed at the Arlo Hudson Square hotel and had one of the best hotel experiences of my life. I don't think I've ever stayed at hotel with a friendlier staff. The rooms are small (my room was about 150 square feet), but very clean and comfortable. The hotel has several really cool public spaces/lounging areas, including a library and a lovely outdoor courtyard. The hotel is also located within easy walking distance of several NYC attractions and only a few feet from many great restaurants, bars, and stores. The hotel also has an awesome rooftop bar with amazing views of the city and the Hudson river. I will definitely be back!!!

The Arlo is a great, new hotel on Hudson. We just spent three nights there and were very impressed. We travel a lot and have stayed in NYC at many properties as my wife is originally from Princeton and we come home a couple times a year. The concept, location, STAFF and restaurant will be a big success.We really liked the location in lower Manhattan and the three minute walk to Prince St subway station. We walked to the 911 Memorial (10 minutes) one evening with the kids and found neighborhood shops, deli's, bars and eateries close by fun and charming.Loved the concept....the first level bar, library and living room are hip, stylish and comfortable. One evening we played board games with the kids in the courtyard with a bottle of wine. The restaurant, Harold's, was only open for breakfast as they ramp up but it was excellent. The layout, decor and menu is really well conceived. The rooftop bar was not yet open but we took a tour through it and the skyline views and setting are going to be awesome.Rooms are really neat. We had a queen single room and a bunk room next door for the girls. Each bunk has its own flat screen TV which they loved and the set up, use of space and style design all fit perfectly together.Staff was really top notch. They're all extraordinarily friendly, knowledgeable and clearly passionate about this property. From A-Z I really couldn't have been more impressed. Kudos to them.This place is going to be a great addition to the area and I couldn't recommend it more. Congrats on approaching the opening of a hotel the correct way and utilizing the resources necessary for success.

We were among the first guests at the lovely Arlo. Very well-located- multiple subway stops nearby and an easy walk to SoHo, Chinatown, Little Italy, and Hudson River piers. High-style rooms are very small and beautifully appointed, with nice woodwork and fine linens. Although there's lots of tunnel traffic nearby, the guest rooms are really well soundproofed. Large indoor and outdoor public areas suitable for working, socializing, and "being alone together". The roof garden with river views promises to be a big draw, as does the celebrity chef restaurant. Guest service is outstanding, with friendly, knowledgeable people. We're looking forward to the second Arlo to open in NoMad this fall.

Checked out the just opened Arlo Hudson Square and was impressed. Small but well appointed and stylish rooms. Very comfortable and quiet, with big city views. Ideal spot for either business or leisure travelers who generally know the city and are looking for location, ease, maybe a place to work or take meetings, and a like-minded community of people.

Very cool and modernly designed hotel. Great bar area. Amazing views from rooftop lounge. Excellent customer service. Convenient location (<10 mins walk to all the areas you want to be downtown --- West Village, SoHo and Tribeca). VERY comfortable bed. Would highly recommend to others.
user_name:
Salvatore S
New York City, New York

review_body: Arlo HS more than delivered. The rooms are small but beautifully appointed--best bed ever, great tech, in the heart of Soho. Lobby spaces, bar and rooftop are stunning. I found myself sitting in the lobby just to soak up the atmosphere, something I've never done. The staff is warm, informative and professional. Lawrence always made me feel welcome. And Harold's sublime dining will make you want to return again and again!

The public spaces of this hotel are amazing, making the smaller (but well designed) rooms not be an issue. There are several lounging areas & 2 huge bar spaces, and the location is convenient to the rest of the city and to NJ.
user_name:
Ben H
Dallas, Texas, United States

review_body: Very cute new hotel close to Holland Tunnel and other West Village spots! Most comfortable bed, cute decor, and very accommodating for business travelers and/or couples. A lot of "communal space" for working/meetings. The rooftop has amazing views as well! Great space all around!

Unbelievably gorgeous hotel. Ultra luxury! Great attention to detail to make the stay absolutely fabulous. Very high quality furnishings, design, and amenities. The room was very comfortable (even though it was small - but not by NYC standards). It has everything you need. The rooms are very quiet. The public spaces are just beautiful and very comfortable. Lots of nice areas to sit and work, relax, or just hang out. Soho is a great neighborhood, and Arlo is an easy walk to everything. They have a great bar and restaurant. Super roof-top bar/lounge area with a great view.
